Modified_Commentary: FOUR, first boundary for batsman and team. Full and on the pads, needed to be put away and batsman did just that, picked it up and dispatched it over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and into the fence

FOUR, back-to-back boundaries to end the first over. Again, bowler is a tad short in his length, batsman had the width to cut and he didn't try to hit it hard, just placed it behind point and Bhuvi at third man gave up the chase pretty quickly

FOUR, hit straight back at bowler and he was late to get his hand up. Once more the off-cutter which almost fooled Jadhav, who shimmied down and checked his drive, middled it alright to beat the mid-off fielder
FOUR, another full toss, it's Jadhav this time and he picks his spot into the deep mid-wicket fence. Not great bowling from bowler. He's missing the yorker by quite a bit

FOUR, four more. Jadhav starting to really find his timing now and he's looking dangerous. This is smart batting rather than just throwing his bat at everything. He knows that fine leg is up and so he waits for the back of a length delivery to come to him before pulling it over the fielder. bowler under pressure

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. Cutting has conjured a wicket out of nowhere. That's a sensational throw from the deep. My goodness. He's absolutely nailed the stump from long leg and Jadhav is out of here. This is a huge moment in the context of the match, especially as Jadhav was looking so good. Even this shot which he played was extraordinary. It was a length ball outside off, Jadhav sat on his back knee and scooped it over short fine leg. He was a little slow to decide on the second run, maybe a little hesitant and boy did Cutting make him pay! More than a couple of feet short, even with a dive. batsman run out (Cutting) 31(16) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, goes down and smashes the full toss over the deep mid-wicket ropes. Some nerves maybe from the Afghanistan leggie and batsman pounced all over them with a mighty slog-sweep

out Caught by Yuvraj!! Rashid strikes back! That might have been the googly. Yeah, it seems so. batsman went for another slog-sweep, but due to the variation, Rashid managed to generate some extra-bounce which took more of a thick top-edge and lobbed up towards long-on. It still came really close to clearing the boundary though. Yuvraj keeps his cool and takes it smartly. batsman c Yuvraj b bowler 30(22) [4s-3]

out Caught by Henriques!! Straight up off a leading edge, taken! team taking control. There's no turn on the ball as Bipul fires it on leg-stump from round the wicket, Baby swings across the line and is undone by the sliding delivery. Good catch from Henriques too. He pedalled backwards from mid-wicket and made it much easier than it should have been. batsman c Henriques b bowler 1(3)
SIX, Rashid finishes with a long hop. To be fair, it's not abysmally short, but batsman is so good on the back foot. Rocks back quickly and hammers the pull over long-on
SIX, slower ball again but this time batsman hacks it over deep mid-wicket. It was slightly closer to off-stump and was given a fair tonk
FOUR, plants his foot down and absolutely drills the ball wide of a diving extra-cover. Overpitched from bowler, batsman blasts him away

1 run, dropped! Naman Ojha, with the gloves on, puts one down. The ball went high up and was swirling awkwardly all the way through. But at this level, it should be taken. batsman was completely duped by the slower leg-cutter. Such good bowling from Bhuvi to keep it wide of off and out of reach

out Caught by Yuvraj!! Gone this time. Yuvraj makes no mistake at backward point. What a top over this has been from bowler. It may now be a mountain too high for the team to climb. batsman backs away to slash a back of a length delivery over point. But this is a leg-cutter which bounces spongily and he slices it up to the fielder. batsman c Yuvraj b bowler 11(10) [6s-1]

out Caught by Henriques!! That's the end of batsman, and of team. The little bit of reverse-swing which bowler uses to curl the ball away from batsman does his undoing. Despite it being another full toss, batsman slices it straight up off the outside half of his bat. Simple catch at extra-cover. batsman c Henriques b bowler 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Bowled!! Terrific yorker from bowler; a perfect way to seal wicket no. 100 in the IPL for the veteran pacer. The ball tails back in, zips through batsman before his bat could come down and plants leg-stump into its grave. bowler on a hat-trick. batsman b bowler 0(2)
SIX, full and wide, Mills has a proper dash at it and he's flayed it away over the point boundary. Magnificent hit. bowler won't enjoy that

out Caught by Warner!! Good lord, that's got air miles on it. Way up into the night sky, Warner settles under it at long-on and takes it. bowler had slowed the pace down on the delivery, causing Mills to go through with the hoick too early. Right off the toe-end of the bat. batsman c Warner b bowler 6(3) [6s-1]
SIX, first ball Choudhary faces in the IPL, he smashes it over long leg. A short ball from bowler, Choudhary swings into an instinctive pull and gets enough on it

out Chahal Run Out!! Direct-hit and that's it! team with a comprehensive win in the IPL 10 opener. Another pull shot from Choudhary, this one's straight to mid-wicket. Chahal comes running down only to be sent back and he had given up. Jordan with the bull's eye. Chahal run out (Jordan) 3(7)
FOUR, bowler goes back to the shorter length, batsman seems a tad comfortable with that, hops on one leg and uses bowler's pace to guide it past the diving short fine leg fielder
FOUR, might have been the slower one and batsman picked the bones out of that one. He cleared his front leg to give him more options and then slots the loft over mid-on, one bounce and over the rope

SIX, that ball hung in the night sky for eternity. Never looked like coming down. For what it's worth batsman gets the maximum result. Length delivery right in the swinging zone and batsman did not hold back, went full-monty and heaved it over deep mid-wicket. Six number one for batsman in IPL 10

SIX, batsman is in the mood. Mind you, he's not been in the best of forms, but IPL is his cup of tea. bowler dishes a full length delivery and hopes to get away with it, batsman doesn't allow him to, carves it over long-on for his second maximum
FOUR, batsman is playing the perfect foil to Gayle. Warner already worried. Full on middle and leg, whipped through mid-wicket and mid-on. Hit uppishly but placed it expertly in the gap

FOUR, not convincing, but batsman will take that. A very good over from bowler. Just misses the length this ball, goes full and that allows batsman to get underneath and hoick it over mid-wicket. Not off the middle but enough to clear the fielder
FOUR, Rashid throws it up once more and this time batsman threads the crowded off-side field. Overpitched and batsman went full-throttle on the drive, raced to the sweeper fence

out Bowled!! He strikes! The customary celebration follows. One hand up and the finger pointing skywards. The most delighted man in the dugout was his fellow countryman - Mohammad Nabi. He too had his finger up in celebration. The quicker wrong 'un and batsman clearly did not pick it, went back for the cut and gets cramped for room, only manages a chop onto the stumps. batsman b bowler 24(16) [4s-5]
SIX, a gift from Hooda and batsman thumps it over the rope. A full toss outside off, batsman takes a step out and slots it straight back over the bowler's head. Went miles back into the crowd

out Caught by Warner!! It was an experiment from Warner and it has paid off. Completes the catch, turns towards the crowd and does a fist pump. team have lost two in quick succession. Both set batsmen gone. Slows it up as batsman gives the charge, he goes through with the loft even though he isn't to pitch of the ball, miscues it towards long-off and Warner ain't dropping those. batsman c Warner b bowler 32(21) [4s-2 6s-3]
FOUR, lots of flighted and lands as a half volley, batsman gets a good stride forward and drives it past Henriques at extra cover, the timing was superb as long-off had no chance of cutting that off

FOUR, ordinary delivery from Rashid and Jadhav is all over it. The young man is shaking his head while taking his cap from the umpire. Half tracker which sat up nicely for Jadhav, who pulls it between deep mid-wicket and long-on
SIX, that looked like a half-hearted shot from Jadhav and it has travelled the distance. Picked the back of a length delivery and pulled it to the vacant deep mid-wicket region, just cleared the rope

FOUR, batsman does the most of the full length delivery, stays deep in the crease and opens himself up to free his arms, smashes it straight down the ground and even a quick Warner could not reach that from long-on

FOUR, lovely shot, sublime timing on that one from batsman, it wasn't anything more than a back-foot punch. This was a back of a length delivery outside off, he got on top of the bounce and placed it in the gap past point
FOUR, smashed, width on offer from Choudhary, batsman gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes

SIX, .. and batsman makes the most of the free-hit. Another pretty poor ball from Choudhary, short and just outside off, batsman rocks back and pulls it high and over mid-wicket, went sailing into the stands for the first six of IPL 10

out Caught by Mandeep!! The night has changed completely for the 27-year old team debutant. batsman has been dismissed for less than fifty for the first time against team - when he's playing for team. On a good length and well outside off, it was there to be smacked, batsman didn't go through with the shot completely, he was just looking to clear the infield. Mandeep times his jump to perfection at point and completes a good two-handed catch. batsman c Mandeep b bowler 14(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, oh boy. He's toying around with the bowling out here. bowler looks to go wide outside off with the shortened length as well. But batsman in all his confidence walks across, crouches and half-pulls, half-sweeps it past the reach of the man at 45-degrees behind square

out Caught by Sachin Baby!! This was coming. It really was. Tactical aggression here from SD with his dance down the track looking to smoke some into the clouds. Does everything in getting right to the pitch of this fuller one as well, swings mighty too, just that he skews it off the toe end. All the altitude and into the safe palms of Baby at long-on. batsman c Sachin Baby b bowler 40(31) [4s-5]

FOUR, here's the pick up. Vintage batsman. Helped by an allying half volley on the pads at gentle pace and all he does with it is lovingly lofts his flick. All the timing and a bounce into the mid-wicket fence

FOUR, streaky. But the runs keeps leaking. Does it really matter how. Wide, half way down the track and batsman anticipates the ball to fizz up in flat batting it across. There's barely any climb, and all he gets is the inside edge to impart the direction in guiding it just past the sticks

SIX, whoa. This is getting back in the 2007 zone. Choudhary without a clue as to where to bowl goes full and wide. The mind-reader gets the front leg out and unleashes a full bat swing showing the maker's name in tonking it right on the extra cover ropes
FOUR, and it keeps getting better. Rocks back, stands tall, waits for the short drag down to sit up and swats in his swivel. All the crunch in the timing to reintroduce it back into the fence

1 run, oh Aravind. You really do not grant a life. Certainly not to this guy. Another compulsive pull here from batsman but with the ball gaining in height, only manages the top-edge. Right into the hands of fine leg, who slides and makes an absolute mess

FOUR, back to the usual. Is this a surprise anymore. This time the skipper decides to test him with a short one, one that neither has the pace nor the bounce. And obliged with a swat. As flat as you'd want

FOUR, on the charge. And the slap. The combo bags yet another fence hunter. Walks down, intercepts the length and gets on top of the bounce of this back of a length delivery in flaying it in front of square
SIX, into the first tier. And a standing admire from batsman. bowler serves a pie with the short sitter and heaved away. So very typical. Equally friendly bowling here as well

SIX, now batsman joins the act. Wants to ive his partner a run for his money. A run for some crowd catchers. Keeps banging it in short with the pitch sucking away all the momentum. Another mow across to give the crowd some work. Brings up his fifty. In some style

out Caught by Sachin Baby!! Some normalcy restored. And as always is the case, it is spin that gets on that duty. bowler doesn't mind giving it some air inviting the big swing. And gets just that. A full-blooded tonk down and skewed away. Almost teases Baby at the long-off fence with this one threatening to fly over, before the bucket hands facing upwards come to the rescue in plucking it out. They're checking the foot's behaviour - just inside the permissable limits. batsman c Sachin Baby b bowler 52(37) [4s-3 6s-2]

1 run, is that a bird? Is that a plane? Oh it is Mandeep Singh on his flying ways. batsman goes through with yet another ones of his delightful airy drives. Is in the process of admiration just as Mandy runs across at the long-off fence, leaps and pulls it back into the field of play. Almost plucked it out while landing down too. Oof

FOUR, head on. The battle continues. With Mills keen on cramping him up with the short pepper gets it barely up to the ribs. Just when he spots the bat going flat and the face pointing upwards in hooking it away. Behind square it flies

SIX, the march to the double ton gets another gear. And some help from Chahal in tipping it over the fence. Hooda opens up and uses his entire height to good effect in his tall pull. Mid-wicket takes another one in its kitty

FOUR, a salute in celebration. Takes the bat to his head in holding it up to his team mates inside. Covers all his sticks with a shuffle and after getting bored of the wides throws the kitchen sink at it and slaps it over point. #HisFastestIPLFifty

FOUR, full, down leg. Nothing right with that. Certainly not if fine leg is inside. Certainly not if that man is Chris Gayle. All batsman has to do is get the bat down in giving it some tickle. And places it wide and into the ropes

SIX, the murder continues. Mass murder. Another spirit buries itself inside this pitch. Overcompensates going short, going quick but the response is quicker. Is brutal too. Back to his high backlifted pulls. Gravity too cannot pull it down

out Bowled!! The zings light up. The crowd refuses to believe and keep searching for the ball. Nope, that's the end of the fun in store folks. Mills for a change aims for the stumps, going slower as well. Nicely off the back of the hand and foxes him with the seam position. A swat across the line is missed eventually and the top of leg takes the brunt. This has been some serious clock roll back here. Makes me feel 10 years younger. batsman b bowler 62(27) [4s-7 6s-3]
SIX, the yorkers too cannot stop the bleeding. batsman rocks way inside, crouches, gets underneath the supposed yorker and carries on from the finals a year ago in tonking the drive

FOUR, eventful first over from Choudhary, a wicket and 16 runs. Another freebie to end his over, short and wide outside off, batsman was all over it as he cracked it square past point, beats the inner ring and rolls away to the fence

SIX, a dramatic photo finish. bowler tries another short one but this time batsman ain't surprised. Stands up, uses his entire height to good effect and smokes it away. Admiring it as he does so. As flat as the bat motion could get

1 run, a direct hit at the bowler's end and batsman was struggling. He was coming back for the second run, Dhawan didn't respond one bit. Aravind was the man with the throw and he sent it to the keeper. Kedar Jadhav still had time to effect the run-out, but his shy is way off-target. batsman scrambles home with a dive. Coming to the ball, it was flat and wide of off, punched to the left of long-off
FOUR, too short from bowler, can't bowl those at his pace. batsman swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
FOUR, gentle loosener from bowler, short and on batsman's hips, he swivels across, uses the pace on the ball and helps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

FOUR, lovely shot, batsman is getting into his groove now. Comes down the track, doesn't get close to the ball, that allows him to free his arms and drill it back past the umpire, no need to run for those
FOUR, juicy full-toss and batsman has put it away, turning out to be an expensive start from bowler. batsman leans into the shot and finds the gap wide of mid-off, no need to run for those

FOUR, make that four fours of the over, banged in short and on the stumps, batsman swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it behind square on the on-side. bowler was expensive in the final of IPL 2016, he has started badly here once again
SIX, massive, batsman shimmies down the track, makes room as he did so and goes high and over long-on, went a long way into the stands. Watches in admiration as the ball kept going and going
FOUR, thank you bowler says batsman as he clips a leg-side dross fine to claim his first boundary
FOUR, length ball outside off and batsman is away. Swats it across the line and gets it wide of mid-on
FOUR, shuffles across and flicks a ball from middle stump, easily done. With fine leg inside the ring that was always asking for trouble, batsman obliged
FOUR, bowler not getting the googly right. Again down leg and this time Rana gets a bit of bat/glove on that. The ball races away fine beating the short fine fielder

out Caught&Bowled!! Thank You! A typical Bhatia wicket. Foxes the batsman with a 116kph delivery and batsman is found checking his drive, spoons a straightforward chance and Bhatia accepts the dolly. Once again the Delhi man showing his variety and the key to his success has been the length. It was on a good length and batsman thought it was there for the drive. Not to be. batsman c and b bowler 10(12)

SIX, bowler would be proud of that shot. Banged in halfway down and the line was around off, Rana is quick to transfer his weight onto the back foot and nails the pull over deep square leg. Third six that bowler has conceded

out Caught by Dhoni!! First Tahir and now Bhatia. The slow bowlers are doing it for team. Bhatia lets out a roar as soon as MS completes the catch. He's been exceptional with his variations. This offie was bowled at 96kph, Pandya just didn't have the pace to slog it across the line, the top-edge skies up and Dhoni calls for it. Takes it in his own unique way, one leg up in the air. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 3(5)

FOUR, batsman welcomes him with a thumping drive. Bit of air and batsman plants his front foot forward, smashed it straight back over the bowler's head. Didn't bother to run, he knew he had middled it
FOUR, batsman goes downtown once more and gets the desired result. bowler goes fuller with the tossed up delivery and batsman drills it straight back at bowler, who is slow to get down and stop it

out Caught by R Bhatia!! Bhatia has made amends. Put a sitter down early in the innings, this time keeps his eyes on the ball and ends Rana's knock. It was the googly which was drifting away from the southpaw, Rana went down and slog swept it flat, Bhatia didn't have to move at deep mid-wicket to pouch that. batsman c R Bhatia b bowler 34(28) [4s-1 6s-2]

SIX, bowler shouted "catch it" and there was no way anyone could have caught that. The South African goes a tad fuller in his length and that enables batsman to get underneath it, slams it flat and over long-off for a maximum

no run, was that a drop? Need another look. Wide yorker outside off, batsman bends down to squeeze it out, the ball takes the under-edge and goes low to Dhoni's right. The former skipper goes with one hand and spills it. Tough one for Dhoni and bowler's unlucky day continues, second drop off his bowling

FOUR, unlucky and bowler have been synonyms today. Full and outside off, batsman throws everything he's got at that and the outside edge flies away fine and bowler just stands there in his teapot position

out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! bowler gets the better of the West Indian. But credit has to go to Mayank Agarwal, he's pulled off a stunner. Length delivery and batsman miscued his loft, came more off the base of the bat. It was dropping in front of long-on before Mayank dived full length and grasped it inches from the ground. He didn't allow it to pop out even as he hit the ground. batsman c Mayank Agarwal b bowler 27(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

SIX, batsman nails this. He should have tried this shot on the previous ball. Once again gets his front leg out of the way to give him a free swing, bowler makes his job easier by bowling a length delivery, tonked straight back over bowler for a maximum

SIX, consecutive sixes for team. bowler missed his yorker by a few inches and is launched into the crowd. Low full toss outside off, Pandya keeps a firm base and carves it over point. Went a long way back into the stands

SIX, bowler attains normal services. Three sixes in a row. Pandya getting into the thick of things. Length delivery and Pandya dismisses it over long-off. Just stood there and dispatched it with disdain
SIX, make it four in a row. bowler and death overs are not the best of mates. He goes full and misses the yorker by a couple of inches, Pandya had enough to get under that and smack it over long-on
FOUR, four more. Already 22 off the over. A game-changing over this. Fifty up for bowler. Full and wide outside off, Pandya throws the kitchen sink at that and the outside edge flies wide of Dhoni

SIX, Smith has a worried look as Pandya sends another one crashing over the rope. Switched to back of a length and the result remained the same, Pandya went back and nailed it over wide long-on. Pinged the ad hoarding on the full
FOUR, sat up on a perfect length to be smashed, batsman rocks back and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Take four!
FOUR, this pitch is a belter, 180 is a must. Half-volley outside off, batsman stands tall and slams it straight of mid-off who dives in vain

wide, out Southee Run Out!! Where was Southee going? He might have thought that it was the last ball of the innings, but Pandya was sure that it was a wide and there would be an extra delivery. bowler fires it outside off, Pandya can't reach it and Southee was at the other end by the time Pandya could react. Dhoni lobbed it to bowler, who took care of the rest. The third umpire checks if the batsmen had crossed, Pandya got his back foot in before Southee could reach the crease. It's touch and go, but Pandya will cling on to the strike. Southee run out (Dhoni/bowler) 7(3) [6s-1]

1 run, dropped by Bhatia. A straightforward chance. batsman doesn't get control of the cut and he slices it straight to third man, Bhatia didn't even need to move an inch. It was going arrow straight towards his chest. Straight in and straight out. Oops!
SIX, for the first time this over, he pitches it up and batsman goes bam! Gets underneath it and launches it for a maximum over long-on

SIX, bowler turns back and smiles. That's all he could do. Ridiculous T20 batting on display. batsman shuffles and scoops a pacy length ball over the keeper's head, lands just over the advertising triangles. Back to back sixes for batsman
FOUR, floated full on leg-stump, batsman sits up and brooms it away with sheer disdain, rocketed away behind square

out Bowled!! Knocked him over. bowler is off with his marathon sprint. The crowd go bonkers. It was a slider, just skids on and slaps batsman's leg peg as he fails to connect with the slog sweep. Got too greedy and paid the price. batsman b bowler 19(14) [4s-4]
FOUR, gives himself a lot of room as he skates down the pitch, pierces the gap between extra cover and mid-off to perfection. Fast hands, full flow of the willow. Jos-outrageously-talented-batsman
SIX, that's gone flying into the stands. Greyhounds out of his crease, picks the bones out of it, a Tennis-esque flat-batted smite over wide long-off

out Bowled!! And again, Imran bowler is on fire. He's just unstoppable at the moment. A canny skidder this, just keeps going with the angle and clatters batsman's stumps. He may have got a bit of inside edge there. He wasn't fully forward, neither backward. Poor feet movement. batsman b bowler 3(7)

out Lbw!! Inside-edge onto pad, but doesn't matter, the umpire has his finger up. No turn, just goes flat and on the stumps, batsman is stuck inside the crease, tries to block off the front foot and ekes a big edge onto his pad. In real time though it appeared as if it had gone straight towards his pad. Wasn't to be. Big moment in the game? batsman lbw b bowler 38(19) [4s-3 6s-3]

1 run, direct hit and batsman was gone! Smith was the fielder, curses himself after he missed the target. A casual knock down the wicket from batsman, goes straight to mid-off, Smithy had ample time to target all three at the non-striker's end. A big miss
SIX, half-tracker and gone! Lovely swivel-pull from batsman, lands bowler over the mid-wicket fence, brute power!

FOUR, edged and four, streaky but Mayank will take those. There wasn't a first slip, Buttler dived to his left from second, but can't get to the ball. On a good length and holding its line outside off, Agarwal just hung his bat at that, the edge bisected the keeper and second slip to perfection

FOUR, he's peirced the gap to perfection, just a tiny gap between the fielder at point and cover-point and batsman found it. Played with an open face, allowed the ball to come onto him and gets it in the gap past point

FOUR, edged and four, on a good length and in that channel outside off, drew batsman into the drive, he went with hard hands and gets a thick edge past the lone slip, rolls away to the fence in a hurry
FOUR, lovely shot, on a good length and well outside off, batsman gets a big stride forward and lifts it over the head of the man at mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes

out Caught by Nitish Rana!! A slight misjudgement from Rana in the deep but he's recovered really well here. The umpires want to have a second look. But I think the catch was clean enough. Soft signal is out, and we will stay with out. A back of a length delivery, batsman slogs it across the line and hits it flat and straight towards deep square leg. Rana is slightly guilty of sleeping on it. He doesn't really move from his position, expecting it to carry comfortably, and has to dive forward in the end. Snatches it right off the turf. bowler has struck first ball of a new spell. team needed that. batsman c Nitish Rana b bowler 60(34) [4s-6 6s-3]
FOUR, heaves the pull away over mid-wicket. He was quickly in position for that. Short of length from bowler and the ball just sits up. batsman drags it from outside off with a lot of muscle
FOUR, plants his back foot at least a couple of feet outside off, rocks back, and mows the pull through square leg. The footwork had batsman written all over it
FOUR, that will run away. bowler strays in line and bowls it on leg-stump. batsman simply had to glance it away past the fielder at short fine leg. Neat wrists

1 run, dropped! It's Nitish Rana in the deep. The ball flew towards his left and he was on the move but he got there with both hands. Exquisite timing on the short-arm pull from batsman. It's precisely that which gets him in trouble. Rana provides the reprieve. The ball actually hit him flush on the shoulders. That's quite an error. Huge moment
FOUR, oh poor ball. A short of length delivery which sits up around the waist and batsman drags it away past short fine leg. Big decision to get bowler in here
SIX, it's not working. batsman is just too good for bowler. His slower balls do work sometimes but this is just different class. batsman picks it up, waits on it and swipes it over deep mid-wicket

FOUR, he's absolutely crashed this through extra-cover. A full, wide ball with mid-off up. Not sure what the thinking is. Whatever it is, the execution of it is way off target. Misses the yorker by a long way and batsman pummels the drive

2 runs, fifty for batsman. This guy, huh, unbelievable. He comes off a 499-run series in Tests and now belts a half-century in his first IPL X innings. Clips a short of length off-cutter from outside off and rushes back for two

FOUR, rare error in the field from Pollard. It would actually be harsh in calling that an error for most fielders, but this is Pollard we're talking about. A mistimed slog from batsman. However, he still places it to the left of long-on where Pollard sprints and dives across trying to flick the ball in, but fails to get a hand

out Caught by Southee!! Another miscue, this time it goes straight to hand. Was it an off-cutter from Pandya? Might have been. It was there on a length though but batsman doesn't get hold of it and holes out at deep mid-wicket. The crowd erupts with "Dhoni, Dhoni" chants. batsman c Southee b bowler 21(14) [4s-3]
FOUR, how good is he! Susses out the plan from bowler based on the line he's been bowling in this over so far, waits on the ball and just slices it past short third man
FOUR, that's been dragged all the way to the wide long-on fence. Pure despair for bowler. He's bowled this so wide of off and to see the ball being swatted into the on-side is downright demoralizing
FOUR, there we go. batsman isn't to be denied for too long. A bit shorter than the previous couple of deliveries, and batsman pulls it away to the fine leg boundary. One bounce and over

1 run, dropped! An absolute sitter put down by Southee. Oh boy. They've already dropped Smith earlier. That hasn't quite gone well. Now another one. batsman miscues the full toss to deep mid-wicket where Southee doesn't have to move. Dear me
SIX, going, going, gone... Is there anything he can't do? It's a slower ball from bowler, batsman swipes across the line and muscles it over wide long-on

SIX, he's done it. A couple of sixes to finish the game off just when it was getting away from them. What a player! A full ball on leg stump, batsman whips it away with unbelievable timing over the deep mid-wicket boundary. Pune clinch the game with a ball to spare

SIX, batsman is looking in good touch, this was banged in short and on the stumps, batsman swivels across, doesn't bother to keep it down. He didn't look in complete control - but has enough to send it sailing over the head of the man at long leg

FOUR, cracking shot, on a good length and just outside off, batsman leans forward on the drive, seemed to have checked his shot at the lst moment. It went in the air and past bowler, beat mid-off's sprawling dive to his right and rolls away to the fence

out Caught by Rohit!! Soft dimissal for Mayank. A daft little shot - to be precise. This was a back of a length delivery outside off, the width was there to cut, instead, he attempted something of a forehand jab, doesn't keep it down and hits it straight into the hands of Rohit at mid-off. Not the start Mayank wanted in his new franchise. batsman c Rohit b bowler 6(5) [4s-1]
FOUR, clubbed, made a great noise as the bat connected with the ball. Length delivery outside off, batsman shuffles across and heaves it over wide mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

SIX, that's easy pickings for batsman, width on offer from bowler. He stays in his crease, uses his hands to good effect, makes the most of bowler's pace and helps it high and over third man for a maximum

FOUR, lovely, this is exquisite cricket from batsman, back of a length and well outside off, he waits on it, opens the face of the bat and steers it to the left of wide slip, beats the man getting across from the deep
FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide from Krunal, batsman doesn't need a second invitation, hangs back and cuts it square on the off-side, beats the fielder in the deep with ease

FOUR, fifty for batsman. This was banged in short by Hardik, batsman took his eyes off the ball, still went through with the pull, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes. Hardik looks amused, that ball didn't deserve a boundary

SIX, stunning bit of timing from batsman and he gets just enough to beat Pollard's leap at long-on. At first instance, it looked like a simple dolly to long-on, the ball kept going and going. Pollard arched back one-handed, got a finger-tip, but the ball was always beating him

FOUR, cracking shot, batsman is off and running in his IPL career. On a good length and just outside off, he leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no need to run for those

FOUR, nicely played by batsman, width on offer from bowler. He leans into the shot, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and steers it behind square on the on-side, gets it past backward point and into the fence
FOUR, lovely, the reverse sweep in full flow from batsman, gets down low and gets it into the gap behind square on the off-side. It was picked up from the middle-stump line as well

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Second wicket for Kuldeep. One shot too many from batsman. It was the wrong 'un which was on a fuller length, batsman gives himself room to go inside out, the bat turns on impact and the ball skews towards long-off. Suryakumar runs around the circumference and pouches it cleanly. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 15(8) [6s-2]

FOUR, a well-controlled pull shot from batsman. bowler did not get height on the short of length delivery, just above the waist and batsman got on top of that nicely, rolled his wrists and struck it behind square, beating deep square leg with ease

FOUR, Pandey tried his best, but the ball still found a way to reach the fence. Width offered outside off, batsman maintains a low base and drills it in front of square, Pandey runs across from sweeper cover, dives and flicks it in but the ball backspins and touches the rope

2 runs, in no man's land. The googly and batsman takes it on without reading, he charges down and goes across the line, the leading edge balloons up and drops in front of the incoming long-off fielder

FOUR, for the umpteenth time today bowler has landed it on a shortish length, sat up nicely for batsman, who cut it away fiercely square of the wicket. Timed it superbly as it beat the sweeper cover comfortably

2 runs, comedy of errors. First batsman gets away with yet another leading edge, goes on the bounce to long-on. He was never wanted the second and Karthik was almost near the bowler's end before batsman decided to go, Karthik makes it in and Kuldeep for some unknown reason doesn't throw it to Uthappa and batsman also survives. He's living a charmed life

1 run, fifty for batsman. 29th in IPL. Not one of his best. Quicker delivery on the stumps, clocked at 113kph, that's the pace of Bhatia. batsman is hurried into the flick and sends it along the ground to deep mid-wicket

1 run, dropped! Would you believe it? I have lost count of the number of chances batsman has got today. Flighted delivery on the stumps, batsman kneels down and sweeps to deep backward square, went straight to Yusuf and he split it. He was on the move a bit and that put him off. He's been whisked away from that position by a stoic GG
SIX, ends the over with a maximum. A much needed one for team. Bit of air on this and a fuller length meant batsman was able to get underneath that, he heaves it high and over the cow corner fence
1 run, batsman backs away and bowler follows him with a yorker, squeezed to backward point

FOUR, it is all going batsman's way. He might walk on water today if he wants and get away with it. A well-directed yorker, batsman brings his bat down and squirts it off the inside edge to the fine leg fence. Not far away from the leg-pole

FOUR, bowler misses the yorker and batsman is in no mood to let him off, doesn't bother to get his front leg in line with the delivery, just goes through the line and smacks it straight down the ground

1 run, batsman and bowler collide. Short and slow outside off, batsman cuts it on the bounce to backward point. Both were ball watching and batsman dashed into the bowler, bowler is down on the ground and batsman makes his crease. The team skipper goes back to check on bowler and the Englishman is fine
SIX, batsman picked the bones out of that. Length delivery right in the slot and it was a clean swing of the bat from batsman, lofted it with a straight bat and cleared long-on with ease
FOUR, batsman is playing a blinder here. bowler goes short and outside off, it was the off-speed delivery and batsman spotted it early, carves it up and over backward point. No need to run for those

FOUR, 16 runs off the over and not the best of outings for bowler on IPL debut. He finishes with 3-0-35-0. Once more the slower delivery is on the shortish length, batsman waits and cuts it behind square, splitting backward point and short third man to perfection

FOUR, off-pace delivery and once more batsman read it early, he waited in his crease and stayed leg-side of the ball, lofts it handsomely over the extra cover fielder. All timing there from the Tamil Nadu man
FOUR, batsman does a ABD. The reverse sccop. Full delivery and close to the yorker length, batsman switches his stances and sends it over the short third man fielder, almost went the distance

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! A fine knock ends. He provided the much needed impetus to the innings. Deserved a fifty, but that's cricket. Short delivery that caught batsman by a bit of surprise, pulled it towards long-on and Suryakumar takes the easiest of catches. Raina pats him on the back as he trudges off. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 47(25) [4s-6 6s-2]

FOUR, that's a shocker from Kuldeep and he concedes four runs. This was dropped short and wide of off, McCullum backed away and cut it straight to backward point. Kuldeep dived over the ball and ends up conceding a boundary
FOUR, batsman finishes off in style. Very full and outside off, batsman crouches low, opens the bat face and drives it square on the off-side, the field was up and that was played beautifully

out Caught by Y Pathan!! batsman falls and team have struck early. A nothing shot from the England opener. This was another long hop from bowler, batsman rocked back on the pull, didn't go through with the shot completely - was perhaps just looking to help it on its way, gets a fat top-edge, high and over mid-wicket. Yusuf ran back and completed an easy catch. batsman looks gutted as he walks off. batsman c Y Pathan b bowler 14(12) [4s-3]
SIX, massive, tossed up nicely by bowler, fell right into McCullum's hitting zone, he gets forward and clubs it high and over mid-wicket, went a long way over the ropes
FOUR, cracking shot, poor ball from bowler, drops this one short and wide of off, McCullum makes room and cracks it over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes
FOUR, bowler has been too short today, drags his length down once again. McCullum rocks back and pulls him past the square leg umpire

FOUR, nicely played! Fraction fuller and on the stumps, batsman leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and punches it back at the bowler. bowler got a hand onto it, but it still beats mid-off to the fence

FOUR, this is excellent cricket from batsman, made room as he came down the track. bowler spotted it and followed him - batsman is good enough to tuck it past square leg, the man in the deep is very square and has no chance

2 runs, that will go down as a chance, but Kuldeep did very well to get to the ball, got both hands and lost control as he fell down. Would have been a stunner had he held on. This was short and on the stumps, batsman was making room for the pull, gets slightly cramped on the shot, hits it high and over mid-on. Kuldeep ran a long way back, stretched as he got both hands to the ball - but can't complete the finishing act
FOUR, Kuldeep can't afford to drop short on this pitch. McCullum rocks back and pulls it through mid-wicket, bisects the two men in the deep to a nicety

SIX, McCullum is in some form alright, comes down the track, doesn't get too close to the ball, allows him a free swing and he deposits it high and into the sightscreen. Another expensive over for the Knight Riders
FOUR, that ruins the over for bowler, leg-stump half-volley, all batsman had to do was get some bat on that. Once he did - fine-leg, who was inside the ring had no chance

out Lbw!! Kuldeep has his man. This was tossed up on the leg-stump line, McCullum was looking to turn it towards the on-side, the ball straightened and went past his inside edge, struck him low and in front of leg-stump, would have been crashing into the stumps. Easy call for the umpire and it's also time for the strategic break. batsman lbw b bowler 35(24) [4s-4 6s-2]
SIX, batsman gets going with a massive hit, Yusuf tosses one on the stumps, batsman gets a big stride forward, lifts it with the spin and sends it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
SIX, back-to-back sixes from batsman, flighted delivery on the stumps, batsman gets forward and thumps it high and way over the fence at deep mid-wicket
FOUR, just goes through with a wild slog across the line, no timing whatsoever. All power. To Lynn's delight, it went in the gap behind the square leg umpire. First boundary for team
SIX, that's the batsman we saw in BBL. Full-blooded swing, clears his front leg, picks the length early and goes bang over mid-wicket
FOUR, stand and deliver! Half-volley in the slot, batsman won't miss out, watches the ball closely and dismisses it out of his sight
1 run, advances and compiles a well-deserved fifty with a ease to long-on

FOUR, both of them have just played themselves in such good form here. Full ball outside off, batsman clears his front leg and crashes it inside-out to send it to the wide long-off fence. Superb hand-eye co-ordination
FOUR, really ordinary bowling. It's a gentle short of length delivery on off-stump, the ball sits up for batsman who bludgeons it through mid-wicket

FOUR, awful from bowler. He bangs it in very short but the speedometer just shows 128kph. The ball was actually on its way down when batsman slashed it over backward point. team being clobbered out there

FOUR, down the track in a flash, right to the pitch of the ball, and driven so beautifully over the covers. The trick in the shot was that he delayed the charge and came out only when the ball was released
1 run, bowls it short from round the wicket, batsman pulls it away to deep square leg. 150 of the partnership comes up
SIX, way too many half-trackers from bowler today. Just can't get away with it at this level. Lynn rocks back and blooters it over long-on
SIX, that about sums their night up. McCullum makes a blunder in the deep and palms the ball over the ropes. A miscue from Lynn off a full toss, should have been taken at long-off
FOUR, short of length, probably an off-cutter, Lynn mows the ball in front of long-leg who comes running forward for the catch. But the ball drops well short and then bounces over him
SIX, flat, strong, six! Kulkarni misses his mark, bowls it in the slot and is walloped over long-on. Lynn can do no wrong
FOUR, that's spanked! The open stance helps him figure the line and length quickly, uses all his might to smash it straight down the ground
FOUR, batsman and his golf hits I tellya. This isn't off the middle, but that bottom hand power and the baseball swing takes it the distance, just one bounce and over the long-on ropes
SIX, boy, has he nailed it! You bet. 95-metre smite. bowler serves length and gets smoked for a maximum over long-off
FOUR, rank long hop, batsman says thank you. Short, down leg, batsman swivels and nails the pull behind square
FOUR, too much width gestures Raina as soon as he saw the ball flying over backward point. Tad short and Lynn pounced on the width on offer, slices the cut and gets four
FOUR, 50-partnership. Clears his front leg and goes bam over mid-on. Right out of the screws
FOUR, bowler Koushik isn't learning. Keeps landing it short and gets smacked. batsman rocks onto his back foot and all he needed to do was get it over the fielder, did it with sheer ease
byes, FOUR, keeps low and nutmegs DK, batsman didn't pick it, neither did the keeper, runs are runs
FOUR, sits on one knee and chips the slog-sweep over mid-wicket, excellent batting this from GG
FOUR, outside edge and four! Opens the bat face to steer, the edge flies to the right of Kulkarni who dives belatdely
FOUR, make that 20 off the over. batsman has raced off to 40 in no-time. A real dart on the pads, batsman milks it off his pads. Easy peasy

SIX, if that ball had voice, it would have pleaded: "Chris please take me for a journey". Lynn heard that and obliged, rubbish length ball outside off and the next thing Smith sees is the ball flying over deep mid-wicket
FOUR, stands tall in the crease and flat-bats a shortish delivery straight down the ground
SIX, in his zone and Lynn doesn't have any second thoughts. Marmalizes it with utter disdain, Roy came in the way to interrupt, he was never going to catch that. Never
SIX, the onslaught continues... Full ball, don't even look back Mr Smith, the ball has gone to Brisbane. Period
1 run, slower length ball outside off, Lynn drills it through cover and brings up a sparkling fifty
2 runs, short ball on middle, batsman jumps on the back foot and lifts the pull over mid-wicket. 4th fastest team 100 in the history of IPL, gee!
FOUR, bowler Koushik's night keeps getting worse. Fires it short and wide, Lynn gets a feather of an edge on the attempted cut, the edge runs past DK's gloves

FOUR, edged and four! Streaky way to get off the mark, but batsman won't mind. Seam-up delivery that shapes away a tad, batsman chases it with a slash and gets a fat outside edge. The ball flies between slip and short third man. First boundary of the innings
FOUR, shot! Uses the width outside off and bounce and elevates it over backward point to collect his first boundary
SIX, goes for the big whammy and succeeds. That was short and has been flat batted over long-on for a huge maximum. Pressure on the youngster

out Caught by Stokes!! The young man gets the big fish! A luring delivery tossed up outside off and the batsman looking to thwack it down the ground, finds the able hands of Stokes at long-off. That brings the game back in the balance. batsman was struggling to get the runs and pays the penalty trying to up the ante. batsman c Stokes b bowler 28(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Caught&Bowled!! Looks to go for the slog sweep, the googly undoes him and he manages a big fat top-edge. The high ball comes down for the bowler to pouch that. The trademark celebration from bowler follows. That was a disastrous strike for team as they had lost Amla a couple of balls earlier. The promotion didn't really yield the desired results. batsman c and b bowler 24(22) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, MAAMMAAAteamAAAHH! The Big Show has arrived. The showman lays the bat on that and crunches that over the man at long-on. That scaled many a light years before coming down
FOUR, backs away and then the sledge hammer does the rest. Just like a warrior, wields his weapon to axe the ball past the man at cover

SIX, slower ball, doesn't matter. That was a dead meat of a delivery and the batsman has picked the bones out of that. It's that time of the season folks - In the arc, it's out of the park. If it's in the V, it's into the trees. Remember the carnage from 2013 against team?
FOUR, PHHUUUUFFFFF! Such power. He bulldozes that one through the off-side and the man at cover had no chance as there was a lot of room on it
SIX, backs away by clearing his legs and then sees the ball like a football to have a clear swing at it. The ball soars over the long-off region for a maximum. batsman is taking it away

SIX, 50 for the combo! That was a short ball, never got enough wood on it but enough on it to send it packing just over the man at mid-wicket. There were shouts of catch it but that region was unmanned
SIX, the most powerful delivery boy is here. He has sent it packing over the cow corner region. Brutal sinews into that pull and the ball flies away into oblivion

SIX, has that gone all the way? An overpitched delivery and the batsman checked his drive with power on his bottom hand to hit it flat and just past the diving Christian at long-on. The ball landed on the cushion and the third umpire signalled it as a half-a-dozen
FOUR, short ball and the swivelled pull. Picks up the length quickly and pivots on his back foot to send it speeding towards the backward square region for a four
FOUR, 13 off the over after bowling a brilliant first ball. Length ball down leg, batsman gets inside the line and flicks it well past the short fine leg fielder. Easy runs
SIX, that has been slapped! Short of a length delivery, batsman dances down and wallops it over the bowler's head. Muscled it. Way past the boundary rope

out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! First wicket down! bowler sees the batsman charge down and bangs it short. batsman is cramped for room, but still persists with his pull shot. Doesn't middle it and the ball balloons up on the leg-side. Tiwary, who had a good stint with the bat, runs to his left from deep mid-wicket and gobbles it up. batsman c Manoj Tiwary b bowler 14(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, nicely done! Shortish delivery outside off, batsman hops, gets on top of the bounce and forces it wide of point. The ball races away into the fence
SIX, batsman is turning it on here now! He walks down and lifts this shortish ball over mid-off. The ball has enough wings to go into the stands

1 run, a very tough chance goes down! batsman prods forward and drills the cover drive. Dan Christian, at cover leaps to his right and gets a hand to it. Those are the ones that need to stick. Wasn't the case this time
FOUR, batsman has come out with a positive intent and that is paying dividends. Finds the gap beautifully on his cover drive. No need to run for shots like that
FOUR, four more! Safest shot to play is hit it down the ground. Sees the length on a fuller side and lofts it down the ground, left of the bowler and right of mid-on. Safe shot

out Bowled!! bowler strikes! And he is off! His customary celebratory run. He bamboozles batsman with a googly. It tweaked in at pace as well. batsman doesn't pick the wrong 'un and is also late to bring his bat down. The ball cannons onto the stumps. Through the gap between the bat and the pad. batsman b bowler 14(9) [4s-3]

FOUR, sloppy from Rajat Bhatia at short fine! He was put off by the appeal for lbw from the keeper and bowler. It was the slider which was very full. batsman just about brings his bat down and gets a bit of wood on it. Bhatia over-runs to his left and allows the ball to go past him

out Bowled!! Cleaned him up!! That was the ferocious inswinger and the batsman without covering the line of the ball looks to play across the line and misses. The sticks go cartwheeling and the bowler takes off with a hand in the air. He does it so often, does bowler. Superb bit of attacking bowling as he got the ball to land on the sticks and put the batsman on a tight leash. batsman b bowler 0(4)
SIX, good end to the over. A massive end actually. In the arc of the southpaw and the batsman comes up with an explosive response to tonk the ball over the cow corner region

FOUR, imparts his powers of guiding the edge where he wants. Is happy to stay away from the line, giving his long levers some breathing space and just slashes at a slanter. An obvious outside edge and an even more obvious empty cordon for some free runs here

out Caught&Bowled!! A tame dismissal. Quite typical of batsman's defences in the early part of his innings. One of those famed stabby defences, just that he cannot keep this one down. But Swapnil decides to help him to an extent, getting his palms and almost grassing it. A three-time juggle before he earns himself a story for a lifetime. The replays show it to be much slower, yeah batsman was made to check his defence causing the ball-lob. batsman c and b bowler 5(11)

FOUR, pure timing. And grace. With a sink down on a knee, Tiwary decides to free his arms at a wide overpitched delivery outside off in the form of a slice. Such is the meat on this that he doesn't even bother keeping it down. Almost all the way

FOUR, gets a long hop. A rank one. And all he has to do is decide where to deposit this one. Decides mid-wicket it is again to take the brunt. Ensures that he doesn't get up early and once again puts his spinning back foot to use in whisking it into the fence
SIX, and now he lets the off-side take the brunt. Patel in his response fires one out flat and wide. The mind-reader that batsman is, sinks and tonks it through the line

SIX, the wide yorkers. Prove to be the undoing of Natarajan here. Makes Tiwary reach out making him stretch every cell of his body in getting there. Boy o boy he does. And how. Slices it imparting all the momentum in lofting it over backward point. These tiny boundaries I tell you
SIX, he's smoking them in. With a gallop down, gets the ball sitting up in his arc and keeps swinging his bat. We are firmly into the baseball zone. Over cow corner

FOUR, they're turning it on. Tiwary joins the act now. Is mighty helped by a horror line always drifting down leg. Has to ensure that he gets some wood on it and he does it with aplomb. Gets enough to muscle it heave behind square and beat the lone man perched out there
1 run, clears his front leg and shovels it down the ground. The yorkers keeping him quiet(er). Nevertheless, the half-ton comes up

out Caught&Bowled!! A smash back. And the perish. Patel smartly keeps denying batsman the opportunity to go through the on-side by firing it wide outside off. Gets the bat up flat on the slap down the ground. Too early once again and all he manages is the cue end that flies back to the upward palms of Patel. So the change in bats not quite what the side wanted at this point. batsman c and b bowler 50(32) [4s-2 6s-3]

SIX, in the arc, and out of the park. You cannot expect the bowler getting away bowling length at this stage. And Tiwary keeps up with the tradition of dishing out the punishments. Sits up and swings it through the line in tonking it over long-on

FOUR, a real drag down. The Mohit slower back hander but half way down the ground. All the time for the adjustment and Tiwary does it in executing his crouched pull. Axar did get a hand in his stretch at the fence, the power imparted was enough to burst through a wall though
FOUR, oh dear. Spots batsman running inside and fires one way down leg. batsman with his stalking eyes always on the ball gets his bat out on the horizontal swiping mode and scoops it away

FOUR, more of the same. The ploy here from Sandeep refuses to change and batsman too refuses to stand up on his feet against this length. Does all he can to get under the ball and keeps his bat on the scoop. This time right over the keeper
SIX, a switch to over the wicket makes no difference. Pounds it short, pounds it wide and batsman unleashes the mighty forehand smash. The concrete on the stands taking a real beating here

out Caught by Maxwell!! Shovels it to his doom. Only after having done his job to perfection. Sandeep gets the yorker right and batsman gets his bat down off a massive backlift in shovelling it out. Not quite the elevation this time with the ball flying down to long-on. batsman c Maxwell b bowler 17(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

1 run, DROPPED!! The man at cover - Vohra had enough time to settle down under it by going back but he makes a meal of it. That was a nothing shot to a length ball and the ball scooped high up in the air and never scaled any distance. Vohra was put off by Natarajan at mid-off who was just beside him. The former could see the fast bowler from the corner of his eye and that was enough
SIX, OLLLLAALLLAAAA! That was some response from batsman to a short ball. He loved the aroma on the perfume ball and accepted it with glee. That drop might well be costly
FOUR, opens the face of the blade on impact and runs it down to third man for a four. Cheeky from batsman as used the pace of the bowler and knew his angles to perfection
FOUR, gets the room to free his arms and creams the ball away into the covers. No one moved as the ball sped away into the off-side
FOUR, creates room by going leg-sidish, got the room to expand his arms and then threads the ball away between cover and extra cover for back-to-back fours. Innovation and batsman go hand in hand

out Caught by Stoinis!! There you go! The young man strikes. Whatta moment for him. A length delivery slanting away, batsman looks to drive on the up, hits it uppishly and finds the safe hands of Stoinis in the sweeper region on the off-side. The fielder was looking into the sun, so he steadied himself, got a hand up to create a better vision and then gobbled it up. batsman c Stoinis b bowler 19(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

FOUR, shot of the day? Shot of the tourney so far? Pardon the exaggeration but that was serene from the skipper. That was a slower delivery and the batsman just leant his weight forward on it with a straight face of the bat touching the ball. The man at mid-on and at long-off dived over the ball to allow a deserving four to the skipper

out Caught by Vohra!! HUGEEEEE WICKKKETTTT for team. That was a leading edge as the ball held onto the surface for the batsman to not control the whippy pull. The man in the deep - Vohra, this time settles down and takes a smart catch at the edge of the boundary. It almost carried all the way. Pune in trouble now. batsman c Vohra b bowler 26(27) [4s-3]
FOUR, loose delivery. It's drifting onto the pads and all batsman has to do is help it on its way. team can ill afford these errors, especially when they're defending a sub-par score

FOUR, that's quite the blooper from Mills at third man. He might have taken his eyes off and the ball sneaks through him and over the ropes. Nice little glide from batsman, shouldn't have been anything more than a single

out Caught by Binny!! bowler rushes batsman and gets rid of him. Really tame dismissal actually. He's pulling on the front foot, the ball is onto him quicker than expected and it hits him right on the splice. It spoons up for an easy catch to long-on. Bangalore keep hitting back, they keep fighting. batsman c Binny b bowler 13(12) [4s-1]

SIX, that's a really good short ball from bowler. batsman is unable to control the pull as he tries to fetch it over his head and nearly holes out. But these are short boundaries. The ball lobs up to the left of Binny at deep square leg, who runs backwards and leaps across but can only palm it over the ropes

FOUR, yeah, Abdulla is in a fix here. He doesn't want to be bowling in Abdulla's arc, but there is no one out in the deep to protect the cut either. He ends up straying wide of off and batsman slaps it through point
SIX, now he gets closer to off, batsman goes down on one knee and wallops it over wide long-on. This is superb batting from the 19-year old. He's putting Abdulla under tremendous pressure

out Lbw!! The ball slides on with the arm, clips both the pads and up goes the finger. Morris was caught in the crease there to a flat ball from round the wicket, and then he made the mistake of playing across the line. That would have hit leg-stump. So Bangalore have struck back as soon as Delhi threatened to surge ahead. It's been that kind of chase. batsman lbw b bowler 4(5)

out Bowled!! bowler's got him the very next ball and he is absolutely pumped. This is serious drama in Bangalore. A beautifully flighted leg-break which drifts in on leg, the ball dips on batsman, lands away from him as he slogs and sneaks under him. batsman b bowler 1(5)

FOUR, batsman keeps stroking them beautifully at the other end. He clearly holds the fate of his team now. It's a full ball on off and batsman has timed the pants of it as he flicks it through mid-wicket. The placement is brilliant too
FOUR, bowler has erred big-time with the leg-cutter and Cummins gets him away. It's well down the leg-side and Cummins whips it over short fine leg for four. It was so close to clearing the boundary

out Bowled!! It swings one way, and then the other. bowler hits back with a vengeance. A good length delivery which is in the slot for the slog, but the ball nips in just a touch to cause the error from Cummins. He chops it back on off an inside edge. The crowd is right in this. batsman b bowler 6(6) [4s-1]

1 run, beautiful slower ball, it's all the more effective with Mills bowling it. batsman is deceived by the lack of pace and he has to reach out as a result. He skews it right off the toe-end to mid-on. It's fifty for batsman. Superb knock, but he has to go all the way

SIX, Rishabh batsman, you beauty! This is some stunning cricket we're witnessing here. He takes on the short ball, and pulls it away over the fine leg boundary. It was a thick top-edge there actually but with Mills's pace, it travelled

out Bowled!! bowler has done it. That is surely the game for the team. batsman moves across towards off, bowler may or may not have seen that but he fires it on leg-stump and uproots it. A real valiant effort from batsman comes to an end. He's dragging himself off. Got to feel for him. batsman b bowler 57(36) [4s-3 6s-4]

out Caught&Bowled!! bowler tosses this up and lands it far enough from batsman to make him reach out for the slog. The ball turns, takes a thick leading edge and lobs up. bowler doesn't leave it for anyone else, he runs backwards and grabs it so well. Made it look easy there. batsman c and b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, picked away into the leg-side again. bowler searching for swing, pitching it right up, but the ball goes on with the angle and ends up on the pads. He has to adjust his line. Too many freebies
FOUR, oh well, put the mockers on him there. But again, as soon as he tries to pitch the ball up expecting it to swing, he ends up on the pads. Whipped away gloriously from batsman over square leg

FOUR, that's flown between keeper and slip. Gayle, standing at slip, didn't even have time to react. It was too close to cut. batsman made some room and slashed at it off the stumps. Lucky to get away. Not just get away, he's gotten four

out Bowled!! Mills has struck. A fierce short of length delivery which skids on, keeps a bit low and nips back in from round the wicket. batsman makes room once more and has a slash at it but he's played over the ball by six inches at least. It pummels the off-stump. batsman b bowler 18(17) [4s-3]
FOUR, climbs from a back of a length, finds the outside edge pretty high up on the bat and runs away to the third man boundary. batsman was driving on the up there. Highly ambitious

out Bowled!! It's game on here at the Chinnaswamy! batsman has played completely down the wrong line of a full ball and is castled comprehensively. The crowd erupts. Rusty footwork from batsman as he presses forward to drive, the ball didn't seem to do a great deal. Might have held its line a touch if anything. batsman played way inside the line of it, maybe anticipating it to come back. The off and middle stumps are clobbered. batsman b bowler 4(3) [4s-1]
SIX, oh my days! This is thrilling cricket. batsman goes down low and wallops the reverse-sweep for six. He's known for this. It was right in the slot too after bowler flighted it up

out Caught by Stanlake!! batsman has been completely outsmarted. What clever bowling from Abdulla. He enticingly tosses this on up and ensures to keep it very wide of off. Seeing the flight, batsman is lured into having a go at it but he's not quite to the pitch of the ball and has to reach out for it. The ball turns away further, lobs up off a thick edge and is taken by Stanlake at backward point. Bangalore are making good inroads. batsman c Stanlake b bowler 25(19) [4s-1 6s-1]

SIX, holy smokes, the nerves these guys have got! First ball, batsman sashays down the track and wallops the ball over deep mid-wicket. He was playing with the turn, so not a bad option. But to do that first ball is something else. This is a roller-coster, this match

FOUR, short of length into the body, batsman swivels across on the back foot and helps the pull behind square. He's placed it in the gap perfectly. Fine leg and deep square leg have no chance. batsman taking Mills on

FOUR, cracking shot, nice way to get going, that should give batsman plenty of confidence, length delivery on his pads, he prods across and clips it in front of square on the on-side, beats the infield and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, batsman is at his best in the opening slot and he has started well for team. On a good length and well outside off, he leans forward, plays with an open face and drives it on the up, beats cover and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, Cummins makes a mess of a simple stop and concedes a boundary. On a good length and holding its line outside off, batsman went for the big drive, gets a thick edge over backward point. Cummins did all the running, slid and stopped the ball, but it hit his legs and rolled onto the ropes
FOUR, creamed, low full-toss from Morris, batsman waits on it, leans forward and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover-point and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, much needed boundary for team, on a good length and angling back into the right-hander, he uses the pace on the bat, opens up slightly and shovels it wide of mid-wicket. Mishra put in the dive - but in vain
SIX, massive, Kedar breaks the shackles, this was well tossed up on off, right into the swinging zone of Kedar, he gets forward and sends it high and into the second tier - over long-on
FOUR, pushed through flatter and wider of off, Kedar makes room and flat-bats the slap - beats bowler and races away to the fence in a jiffy
FOUR, cracking shot, tossed up on the stumps, Kedar shimmies down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it back over the bowler's head, almost went all the way, one bounce and over the ropes

SIX, 24 from the over. team needed something and bowler has gifted them a perfect launching pad. Kedar is in some form alright. This was tossed up slower and wider outside off, Kedar bends down his knees and clubs it high and over long-on, went a long way over the ropes

FOUR, cracking shot, that's Kedar's own version of MSD's helicopter shot. This was full and on the stumps, Kedar was deep inside the crease as he whipped it wide of mid-wicket, no chance for the man running across from long-on
SIX, freaky, this is sensational from Kedar, length delivery on off, he makes room by backing away and goes inside out over cover, went all the way over the ropes

2 runs, fifty for Kedar, this has been a superb innings, short and just outside off, he backed away and cut it to the left of point. Billings put in the dive, made the stop and fired in a throw at the striker's end, concedes another run

FOUR, mistimed shots are finding the gaps now, this was short and on the stumps, Kedar was late on the pull, gets a top-edge - the fielder at square leg was inside the ring and Kedar has managed to get it over his head

out Caught by Billings!! Lovely shot - but batsman has found deep mid-wicket to perfection. This was full and on his pads, batsman gets forward and whips it beautifully - but unfortunately for him, the placement wasn't right. Straight into the hands of Billings and he doesn't drop those. A small contribution from batsman - but a big wicket under the circumstances for the Daredevils. batsman c Billings b bowler 16(18) [4s-1]
FOUR, smashed, length delivery on the stumps, Kedar backs away and thumps it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes

SIX, cracking shot, he's in some devastating form at the moment - Kedar. Length delivery from bowler, that's a cardinal sin for any bowler. Kedar gets his left leg out of the way and drills it back over the bowler's head, went high and into the top tier of the Chinnaswamy
SIX, he's done it several times for Kerala - he's showing why team picked him up as KL's replacement. Runs down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it over long-on for a maximum

out batsman Run Out!! That was completely unnecessary from batsman and it has cost him his wicket. This was a floaty delivery outside off, Vinod got underneath it and drilled it towards extra-cover. Almost a catch to Nadeem, he doesn't go for it though, instead, stops it on the half-volley, the return to the bowler is good and bowler whips the bails off - with batsman miles out of the crease. batsman run out (Nadeem/bowler) 9(5) [6s-1]

out Caught by Chris Morris!! That's another huge wicket and team are losing their way towards the end. Lovely piece of deception from bowler. He followed the slower short ball with another slower ball, rolled his fingers across the seam. Kedar was backing away on the lofted drive, gets it right off the bottom of the bat, plenty of height but not the distance. Morris settles under it and holds on at mid-off. batsman c Chris Morris b bowler 69(37) [4s-5 6s-5]
SIX, batsman connects one finally! This was the slower full-toss from Morris, batsman backed away, got underneath the delivery and sends it soaring over long-off for a maximum

out Bowled!! Morris gets his yorker right and batsman's stumps go for a walk. This was fast, this was full and this was on the middle-stump line. batsman backs away on the drive, misses and simply walks back to the pavilion. batsman b bowler 10(8) [6s-1]
out Bowled!! Morris gets another wicket with a juicy full-toss. team finish with just 157 on the board. Mills made room on the drive, missed and the off-stump goes for a walk. batsman b bowler 0(3)

FOUR, lovely, just a hint of width outside off, batsman made it look bad by arching back slightly, frees his arms and sends the cut scorching behind square on the off-side, beats third man - running to his right

out Caught by Samson!! A high full-toss has got rid of the big Jamaican. batsman looked surprised, was looking to blast it over the top, can't get on top of the ball, it hit him high on the bat and lobbed over Samson at mid-off. He ran back, kept his eyes on the ball even as it landed beyond his shoulder, dives and clutches it with both hands. Chinnaswamy has been stunned into silence as the big man departs. batsman c Samson b bowler 6(8) [4s-1]
FOUR, that ruins the over for Morris, another full-toss, but this time on batsman's pads, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way. Nice way to get going
FOUR, cracking shot, back of a length and well outside off, batsman rides with the bounce and punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and rolls away to the fence
FOUR, lovely, this is even better, on a good length and just outside off, Singh presses forward, drives it on the up and splits the gap between cover and mid-off. Good early signs for batsman

out Bowled!! batsman has chopped on for the second straight time in this tournament. On a length and just outside off, batsman saw the width, manufactured a bit more by backing away slightly, went with hard hands on the cut, gets an inside edge that bounces back onto the middle-stump. He was looking very good, but it means nothing now. Another promising start, but nothing more for batsman. batsman b bowler 12(10) [4s-3]

SIX, beautifully played, what made the shot even more special was that he didn't get to the pitch of the ball. It only allowed him to free his arms and lift it inside out over cover, went sailing all the way

out Stumped!! bowler has deceived batsman completely in the air. Anticipated that batsman was getting itchy and was looking to dominate him, shortened his length and beats batsman in the air, the extra bounce did the trick. batsman was completely flummoxed on the lofted drive and Pant is quick to whip the bails off. team are in a spot of bother now. batsman st Pant b bowler 24(24) [4s-4]

FOUR, cracking shot, that should release some pressure off batsman, comes down the track, flat-bats the short of a length delivery and lifts it back over bowler's head, a few bounces and over the ropes
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for batsman, makes room to a length delivery on the stumps and swipes it over the infield, clears cover-point and rolls away to the fence
FOUR, wow. That sped off the bat. Smith breaks the shackles, stands tall and extends his hands into fierce punch, right off the middle and pistols away to the fence beating the sweeper cover fielder

FOUR, edged and four! Would've been swallowed by the first slip fielder, if there was ever one. Lovely flight from Rashid, drew batsman forward and takes the outside edge which runs away through the invisible first slip region
FOUR, short ball and punished. Smith picks it up early and nails the pull in front of square
FOUR, two fours in a row for Smith. This was a poor ball from bowler, drifts one on the pads, all Smith had to do was to get some wood on it, which he did and it races away to the fine leg fence

no run, brilliant work from Henriques. A direct-hit would've been interesting. A fuller length delivery on the stumps, Smith pushes it meekly towards extra cover, Moises dives to his right and throws at the non-striker, all in one motion. DK was backing up for a single and had to turn back and dive full-length to make his ground

SIX, Smith is finding his bearings now. bowler errs in length and dishes out a full ball right in the hitting zone, Smith frees his arms and launches it straight down the ground, pings the sightscreen on the full
FOUR, that's an awful ball from bowler. Offers width, by bowling it well outside off, Smith goes deep in his crease and carves it over point. 50-run stand comes up between the two

out Caught by (sub)Vijay Shankar!! Kumar strikes! Half the team side are back in the hut now. Smith runs out of patience, decides to take on Bhuvi. It was a slower delivery and the West Indian didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and went through it, skews it off the toe-end and slices it towards deep mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar, the sub, runs to his left and pouched it safely. batsman c (sub)Vijay Shankar b bowler 37(27) [4s-4 6s-1]

no run, oh nearly.. A communication breakdown between both the batsmen almost resulted in a run-out. A short of length delivery outside off, batsman slashed it straight to point, Kulkarni set off for a single, DK was ball-watching and sends him back. Yuvi, the fielder, was slow to react and fires a throw at the non-strikers end, misses the target and Kulkarni survives
1 run, wristed into the on-side, takes off for a quick single before being sent back. Rashid fires at the bowler's end and misses. The duo run on the overthrow. Karthik was in trouble had that hit

out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two wickets in two overs and team are losing gas towards the end. A short ball from bowler, batsman went across his sticks and tried to lap/scoop it over short fine, doesn't succeed as he gets a faint nick and Ojha takes a simple catch. batsman c Naman Ojha b bowler 30(32) [4s-2]

out batsman Run Out!! Third umpire woken up for a run-out check. Kulkarni is struggling and has to take the long walk back to the pavilion. team are committing hara-kiri. Another one bites the dust. Kulkarni worked it towards mid-wicket and took off blindly for a single, his partner was never interested and sends him back. Rashid Khan, the fielder, swoops down on the ball, takes the aim and fires a direct-hit at the striker's end to catch Kulkarni short of his crease. Rashid Khan's dream day continues. batsman run out (Rashid Khan) 1(2)

1 run, silly running from the team batsmen. Could've lost another one. A short of length delivery outside off, Kumar toe-ends the drive to extra cover, takes off for a single. The fielder collects the ball and fires a throw but misses the target. PK had given up
SIX, this will do. Sinks low, gets under this slower ball and tonks it over the long-on fence for a maximum
FOUR, lovely shot, fraction too short from Bipul , batsman is quick to rock back and pulls it through mid-wicket, no need to run for those
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries once again from batsman, comes down the track, covered for the spin and lifts it over the head of mid-on, a couple of bounces and over the ropes
FOUR, lovely shot, banged in short and on the stumps, it sat up to be smacked, batsman makes room and pulls it over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

out Lbw!! Rashid has struck gold in his first over! This was pushed through flatter and quicker, the wrong 'un from Rashid. McCullum was down on his knees as he went for the sweep and missed, struck pretty adjacent to the stumps and it's an easy call for the umpire. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the stumps. batsman lbw b bowler 5(10)

no run, edged and dropped, that was a chance and Warner at first slip has missed it. It was a tough opportunity though, batsman went with hard hands, the edge was flying and to the right of the captain, he went with hard hands and shells it. Coming to the ball, it was tossed up invitingly outside off, another wrong 'un from Rashid, lured batsman into the mistake - but batsman survives

out Caught by Dhawan!! Dhawan has claimed a catch. batsman isn't going anywhere. The third umpire will have a look, the soft call is OUT. He has caught it cleanly, but has the ball touched the ground or did Dhawan get his fingers underneath it? The zoomer has been called for, it looks tricky, but the soft signal is OUT. If there's no conclusive evidence, it will stay with the on-field call. The third umpire is taking numerous looks at it. B2$ is the call. team have lost two of their overseas batting stars now. Coming to the ball, it was banged short and just outside off, batsman was rocking back on the pull, went low of the bat and looped towards mid-wicket. The ball was dying in front of him, but Dhawan does well to dive forward and holds onto it. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 31(21) [4s-5]

out Lbw!! Rashid is leaving the Lions flummoxed. This was the wrong 'un, pitched just outside off and spun back into the right-hander, batsman didn't read it one bit, played for the straighter one, beaten on the inside edge and struck bang in front of middle. The height wasn't an issue, the ball would have been crashing into the leg-stump. Easy call for the umpire and Gujarat Lions slip into further trouble. batsman lbw b bowler 3(5)
FOUR, cracking shot, a floaty half-volley from bowler, batsman leans forward, closes the face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no chance for the man at mid-off

out Lbw!! Rashid is running through Gujarat Lions. This was the leg-break and batsman had no idea about it. This was tossed up on the off-stump line and spun back in slightly, batsman didn't read it, was playing for the straighter one, gets beaten on the inside edge and is rapped on the pads. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the top of middle. Rashid is on a roll and so are his team. The umpire has called for a strategic break. batsman lbw b bowler 5(8)

FOUR, cracking shot, that should release some pressure off batsman, comes down the track, flat-bats the short of a length delivery and lifts it back over bowler's head, a few bounces and over the ropes
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for batsman, makes room to a length delivery on the stumps and swipes it over the infield, clears cover-point and rolls away to the fence
