out Lbw!! Rashid is running through Gujarat Lions. This was the leg-break and batsman had no idea about it. The impact was in front of middle, would have been going on and hitting the top of middle. Rashid is on a roll and so are his team. The umpire has called for a strategic break. batsman lbw b bowler 5(8)
FOUR, errs in length and pays the price. Lynn is too good to not miss out on these. Takes a giant step forward, uses all his power to muscle it down the ground
FOUR, poor ball. Short and down leg, too easy for Lynn. Swivels across and helps it on its way past the man at 45
FOUR, another edge. Pandey is living a struggle here in reading the amounts of turn. Not quite the control but ultimately manages to get some wood on it in directing the edge through the keeper

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Another dismissal all in the household. In fact it doesn't leave Baroda either. Pathan in his quest to get on with the scoring jumps down the track, barely gets close but cannot pull out of his hoick. Swings hard, miscues big time and Hardik at long-off stretches vertically in plucking it out. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 6(11)
FOUR, so deft. The cheek these days. Shapes up for the cut, or so we assumed but at the very last moment opens the bat upwards in a dab past the outstretched Parthiv leg

SIX, this was coming. With bowler keeping it short and wide and Pandey's orthodox cuts failing, he decides to arch back with a toe-rise and ramps his bat upwards in teasing the man at third man over the ropes
FOUR, just the hint of width. Enough for Yadav to sniff a boundary out of it. Throws the kitchen sink at it with a crack through the off-side
FOUR, the width is back. And so is the allied length that starts off from half way down. A wristy chop quite off the outside half of the bat. Hurries away through third man

SIX, oh boy. Smoked one down. For a change he stays put in his crease without moving around and bends low in plundering what should have been a yorker. A vicious bat swing in tonking it into the black screen
FOUR, and now he toys around further. bowler responds with a length delivery outside off and Pandey after threatening to muscle another one out, stays composed and guides it behind point

out Caught by Pollard!! The sucker ball. On the umpteenth occasion a set batsman perishes after the team passes on a strategy in the break. Can't blame Yadav for anticipating the toe-crushing yorker. He gets one just that there is no pace at all on this one. Swings through his shot, gets one hand off the handle and eventually watches the ball pick out Pollard to perfection at long-on. batsman c Pollard b bowler 17(15) [4s-2]
1 run, here's his half-ton. Playing a vital hand here. Gets there with a flat batted agricultural heave. Then watches all his effort neutralized by the ball finding deep mid-wicket on the bounce

out Caught by Pollard!! The wheels falling off here. Looks for his favoured flat batted pull through cow corner. Does get it right but neither manages the elevation nor does he keep it down. Yet another batsman picks out Pollard at the fence. The ploy of keeping it short and slow doing the trick out here. batsman c Pollard b bowler 9(8)

SIX, a sink, a swing and a crowd deposit. Picks out the predictable off-spinner and waits for the ball to get into his arc. Unleashes a full bat swing and goes through with it in holding the pose as he drills one several rows into the cow corner stands
SIX, the sitting up length. Right where he wanted to and with all the pace on it as well for it to be dealt with severity. A full-blooded pull and just the sound ensures the maximum

SIX, misses the mark yet again. A yorker attempted only to be missed by a cool few centimeters. Ample time for Pandey to settle himself under it as he hammers it over long-on. Just cannot keep it down

no ball, FOUR, he oversteps and then bowls it in the arc as well. More of the sunken bat swings in intercepting the two men at the leg-side fence. Pandey with help here from the bowler giving team the final catapult. Free hit coming up
FOUR, a full toss now. Nothing coming out right here. Tailing away and Pandey is more than glad to use the width in just tickling it past the keeper
FOUR, offers some width to batsman, who will not miss out on these. Reaches out and bullies it with serene timing through cover
FOUR, yes he can! bowler is not learning, doles out a friendly full toss on off, batsman opens the bat face and slices it behind point

out Lbw!! Dead straight. Just that it goes onto the pad after smashing the bat. A yorker on the stumps, quite where he should have been right from the start. batsman tries hard in getting his bat down in digging it out. Almost does well in the end, gets right off the toe-end to ricochet onto his boot. Too quick for the umpire to spot it as well. Never mind. team finish with 178. batsman lbw b bowler 1(2)

FOUR, two in a row for batsman. This was streaky but the team captain won't mind. Pitched up full outside off, batsman went hard on the drive, gets an outside edge that races away to the third man fence. The fielder was squarer and had no chance
SIX, there he goes! Loads up big, gets under this short ball and dismisses it into the deep mid-wicket stands. Into the top-tier

out Caught by McClenaghan!! batsman combusts. The ploy of bringing in a spinner early in the innings has paid rich dividends for Mumbai. batsman, in an attempt to go big, miscues one and hits it straight to square leg. McClenaghan times his jump to perfection, leaps and takes a smart catch. Pandya exults in delight.batsman c McClenaghan b bowler 19(13) [4s-3]

FOUR, this was quite intentional from Robbie. Plants his front foot forward, looking to defend. The ball came in with the angle, takes the outer half of his willow and runs away to the third man fence

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Two wickets in the over. batsman falls cheaply. This was floated up much fuller from KP, tempting batsman to go for the big shot. The Karnataka batsman went after it, albeit didn't find the sweet spot in his willow. Skies it as far as deep mid-wicket, where his brother Hardik swallows it up with ease. Pandya roars in joy and sprints up to his brother and leaps onto him. What a start for Mumbai. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 4(3) [4s-1]
FOUR, oh boy! bowler has been Lynn-ed here. If there is ever a term like that. Just stands still, unleashes a strong bottom-hand to slap it through extra cover. Bulleted away to the fence

out Lbw!! Boom! bowler strikes. Its the dangerous Lynn who has to walk back to the hut. The crowd find their voices back. Lynn makes a blunder by walking across his sticks, bowler kept it simple, bowled full and raps him low on the pad. Was beaten for pace and was struck right in front of middle. Lynn is disappointed. Big wicket for the home team. batsman lbw b bowler 32(24) [4s-3 6s-1]
FOUR, poor delivery from bowler to follow-up. Short, wide and Parthiv is right on top of it, cracks the cut behind square and third man was only picking it up from the rope. team are off and running
FOUR, inswinger which is slightly off target and batsman puts it away with ease. Full and swinging into the pads, flicked through mid-wicket to open his account. Not a muscle moved
FOUR, this time Krunal is in position much quicker, the line is different too - more around off and middle - and he's able to muscle the pull away through mid-wicket
FOUR, consecutive fours to finish the over. team desperately need some momentum here. I think bowler is getting a bit carried away. Bowls it full on the pads and Krunal whips him over mid-wicket
FOUR, a little bit of air from Kuldeep, Rana quickly bends his knees and swipes it to the wide long-on boundary. The length was a bit too full from Kuldeep there

SIX, oh what a shot! 23 off the last two overs now. A good little burst from these two. Kuldeep still flights the ball up, the line is outside off and Rana goes through the line to cream it beautifully over extra-cover. What timing on that. Way into the stands

out Caught by Uthappa!! bowler has strangled him down leg. What a lucky breakthrough to end a fledgling partnership. Back of a length on leg-stump, Krunal tries to help it along into the fine leg boundary but the deflection is only a small one. A faint little tickle off the inside edge straight to the keeper. batsman c Uthappa b bowler 11(6) [4s-2]
SIX, all the way. If you're going short to batsman, it better be nice and high. This one sits up around his chest and he dismisses it from his presence over the mid-wicket boundary

no run, uh oh! A bad mix-up there with batsman being sent back from the middle of the pitch. But he makes it home. The throw isn't a great one from Pathan either. Rana called him initially but then backtracked as batsman steered it to point. These are nervy times

FOUR, bowler bowls short first up to surprise him, but batsman is quickly into position. He's able to swivel outside the line of the ball which is on leg-stump and helps the pull to the fine leg boundary. It's rocketed through

out Caught by (sub)Rishi Dhawan!! What a huge wicket right after the break. The major threat of batsman is gone, and team will really back themselves now to seal this. Not sure if this was the plan, or bowler just executed it incorrectly. He bowls it short and wide, batsman throws his bat at and the top-edge flies down for a comfortable catch to third man. Massive moment. batsman c (sub)Rishi Dhawan b bowler 17(17) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, moves away from the line of the short of length off-cutter, creates some room and flays it away over extra-cover. Rana keeping Mumbai afloat

1 run, bowler botches a run-out opportunity! He just had to collect the ball cleanly. Rana was well short. Rana couldn't find any elevation as he tried to flat-bat the back of length delivery and he hit it straight to mid-off. Never a run there, but the non-striker had come a long way down so Rana obliged. Would have been gone
FOUR, that's been absolutely spanked through extra-cover. The ball has left a vapour trail. Short and wide from bowler, Pandya smokes it while backing away
FOUR, brilliant timing! Low full toss wide of off, Rana reaches out and slices it past backward point. It skimmed off the bat

SIX, 10 off 2 balls. This game isn't over yet. Not while Rana is there. bowler is struggling to execute the yorker. He delivered a low full toss last ball, now a proper full toss at the stumps. Rana picks it away effortless over long leg

SIX, length from bowler and it disappears way back over mid-wicket. The team dugout is on its feet. What a blow from Pandya. But this is ordinary death bowling. Seam-up and good length, right there in the slot
SIX, lapped over the keeper for six! Thrilling stuff. Rana has stooped across and picked this full toss from middle-stump. It came right off the middle

FOUR, full toss again and this time he lofts it over extra-cover. Although the timing isn't quite there, he just had to clear the fielder in the circle. No chance for the fielder running across from sweeper cover. It's fifty for Rana too. The crowd going bonkers

out Caught by Narine!! That roar from bowler drowned the whole of Wankhede by itself. Rana backs away to a low full toss on middle and spears it straight to point. He had timed the pants off it but couldn't have found the fielder any better. His stunning innings comes to an end. Oh what a game! batsman c Narine b bowler 50(29) [4s-5 6s-3]
SIX, low full toss again and Hardik flogs it over square leg. He is 18 off 5. What a blinder!

FOUR, that is probably the blunder which will cost team the match. It shouldn't have been any more than a single. A low full toss which Hardik can't find any elevation with. He smacks it down to long-on, where Surya attacks the ball nicely but he misfields and the ball sneaks through

2 runs, this is very, very ordinary from team in the field. The substitute Rishi Dhawan is the culprit this time. He drops a skier. Another brilliant short ball, rushes Hardik on the pull and takes a thick top-edge to deep square leg. Dhawan looks nervous under the ball, slips a bit and then has to dive to his left after the misjudgement. Makes a hash of it
FOUR, full on the pads, and Hardik has done it! He whips it away past a diving Rajpoot at the fine leg boundary before running down and cutting a pose for the camera
FOUR, a shot that should make him feel better. bowler errs in his length slight and that is enough for Parthiv to punish him, driven beautifully wide of mid-off and the ball raced away to the fence
1 run, direct hit and Parthiv was running back. Finally he connects with one of his heaves, not middled though and finds Yusuf at mid-wicket. The shy is at the bowler's end and it is way off target

SIX, batsman clearly has the wood on his England team mates. Stokes in the first game and now bowler. A little shuffle and a crouch down to scoop this length delivery over short fine. The connection was such that it travelled the distance
FOUR, rank long hop to start bowler's spell, Parthiv picked the bones out of the pull shot, rocks back and nails it wide of the mid-wicket fielder. No need to run for those
2 runs, the new opening combo for team has registered a 50-run stand in only their second game together. batsman works it away with the spin wide of long-on and the second was on

SIX, batsman surely picked that from bowler. It was the off-spinner and he played it with the turn, plants his foot across and whips it over the cow corner fence for a maximum. This was more timing than power from the Englishman
SIX, finally Parthiv connects with one and sends it into the crowd. Floated up just outside off, Parthiv sinks to one knee and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket. GG certainly didn't like it

out Lbw!! Kuldeep can't be kept quiet for too long these days. He provides the first breakthrough for team and ends Parthiv's hit-and-miss innings. It was the wrong 'un and Parthiv shuffled across to sweep, missed and is rapped on the pads. The question was whether the impact was in-line, umpire Nandan thought so and raised his finger. batsman lbw b bowler 30(27) [4s-3 6s-1]
FOUR, a freebie from Kuldeep to welcome Rana. Googly which is short and down leg, Rana went for the big pull and under edge it fine. The man in the deep was square and had no chance

out Lbw!! Two wickets in two overs. The bowling change has worked for team and GG. The UP lad gets rid of the dangerous batsman, who makes a start and gets out, again. A full toss that tailed back in, batsman was beaten for pace as he missed the flick. The ball struck him in front of leg-stump. Not sure if it would have gone on to hit the sticks. But the finger was raised and he walks back. batsman lbw b bowler 28(22) [4s-1 6s-2]

out Lbw!! batsman is not walking. He's not pleased with the decision. Has some choice words to say to umpire Nandan. "That's an absolute shocker," says KP on air and he's right. Massive inside edge onto the pad. Two poor decisions in two overs might have just cost team the game. The off-break which turns back in and cramps batsman for room, he hurriedly brings his bat down and smashes it into his pads. The umpire didn't spot it and gave it out after a thought. batsman was fuming after the decision. Even showed his bat to the umpire gesturing he hit it. But you can't overturn an onfield decision unless you have the DRS and that is not available in the IPL. This wicket has to be the game changing moment. batsman lbw b bowler 2(6)

FOUR, batsman is off and running. bowler loses his radar and sprays it on the pads, batsman will not miss out on those. Just nonchalantly whips it past square leg. The ball raced away to the fence at MACH 3

FOUR, fabulous shot from batsman. Don't offer him width, not even half a foot. If you give him half a foot, he will take it into a mile. Just extends his hands and lifts it effortlessly over extra cover
SIX, that has gone flying into the third tier. Just slid on with the arm, batsman picked the bones out of it, thumping it high and handsome into the long-on stands

1 run, dropped by backward point, a real sitter, team fans can't believe it! Full and wide, Maxi slices the drive sitting deep inside his crease, it went flat and straight to Mandeep Singh. He was a tad slow to react, straight in and straight out

FOUR, it's down the leg side and batsman tickles it away for four! The man at fine leg had no chance. A fine fifty from the South African. This knock has ensured that team are chasing this down without much of a problem
FOUR, plenty of width on offer and batsman takes full toll of it, stands tall in his crease and smacks the leather over extra cover. Take four!
FOUR, that's fodder! Maxi wants to finish it off ASAP. Uses the strong bottom hand to whip it in the air over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes

SIX, this could be over pretty soon. batsman is surely relishing captaincy, Australia are you watching? Clears his front leg and smites the heck off a short delivery, backs away and makes a clean connection, goes seething over a helpless third man

SIX, brute! That's massacred! Maxi is in some form. Watches the ball like a hoop, once he picked the length (short) it was all about connection; that was marmalized, flat and flying over backward point

SIX, #team make a mockery of team's 148, ABD's 46-ball 89, win by 8 wickets with 33 balls to spare. Maxi is blasting it all around the park, puts the finishing touches with a brutalizing maximum over long-off. Got underneath a flat delivery and killed it...Watto smiles as he shakes hands with his dear friend. Lo! That's all he can do at the moment

SIX, you will see those often especially when bowler is bowling at such pace. batsman is not afraid, goes for a pull off the front foot, gets a fat top-edge that flies over the third man fence. Blades these days! I tell you..

FOUR, in the airrr and just over a leaping Negi. batsman would've had his heart in his mouth for a moment. A short of length delivery outside off, there was width on offer so batsman went after for a rasping cut. Didn't bother to keep it down but luckily for him it flies over the point fielder
FOUR, almost.. bowler overcorrects his length, bowls fuller this time. batsman flexes his arms and lifts it over mid-off. Just clears the fielders and runs away to the fence

FOUR, third boundary of the over. bowler is not learning. This was much straighter, he is looking for some swing which is non existent at the moment. Full on the pads, batsman gets inside the line and tickles it away to the fine leg fence. The fielder was inside the ring and bowler shouldn't have bowled it there

FOUR, threads the gap this time. Pure class from batsman. Stands still and lets his hands do the talking. Punches a back of a length delivery crisply through cover-point, beats the packed off-side field
1 run, goes wide of the crease and angles one on the pads, clipped away sweetly to deep square leg. 50-up for Punjab

SIX, in the airrrr and dropped. Mills is furious. Stanlake is the culprit. Don't even look at the bowler. A short ball down leg, batsman swivels across and pulls, hits it straight to fine leg. Stanlake prances to his right, goes reverse-cupped but makes a royal mess of it. The ball bursts through his fingers and what's worse is, it carries over the fence

FOUR, wow. Elegance written all over it. Shot of the day so far. Mills bowls a half-volley on the stumps, batsman leans forward, presents a full bat face and drives it smoothly down the ground, beats mid-on

out Lbw!! Number one down. A premature end to batsman's innings. Mills is chuffed to bits, lets out a huge roar. It was full and straight, the back of the hand slower ball from Mills. batsman misjudged it completely. Shuffled across his sticks and plays down the wrong line. Misses it and is struck low on the pad. Looked pretty adjacent and umpire Anil Chaudhary raises his dreaded finger. batsman lbw b bowler 34(21) [4s-4 6s-1]
SIX, this one goes horribly wrong for Abdulla. Tries the chinaman, but drops it on a shortish length, Patel spots it. He pivots back and muscles the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands

out Bowled!! bowler strikes. The experiment of sending Patel up the order fails. It was the googly from bowler, wasn't quite short. Patel went for the encore, not the ideal length. He misses and the ball rattles the stumps. bowler exults! batsman b bowler 9(6) [6s-1]
SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Pitched up just outside off, batsman was waiting for it, plonks his front foot forward and lifts it over long-off
FOUR, you cannot keep batsman quiet for long. He gets into business, full at 146kph, batsman clears his front leg and bludgeons it back over the bowler's head. Brutal from Maxi!
SIX, wow! What a strike. Full and outside off, batsman engineers room and slices it with an open bat over extra cover. Such is the power that it carries all the way

out Bowled!! And that's a beautiful delivery to get rid of batsman. He beat him in the air. Lovely change of pace from bowler. The previous ball came at 100kph, this was nicely floated up, batsman was early into the cut, didn't turn much, anyway was too close to cut and he chops it back onto the sticks off an inside edge. So the ploy to open with bowler works wonders. Disappointment for the team skipper. batsman b bowler 1(4)

FOUR, that was a poor piece of fielding from the man at third man. So batsman is off the mark straightaway in this IPL. bowler bowled a decent length ball outside off stump, just shaped away from the right-hander, batsman guided that with an angled bat past point and eventually managed to get a boundary

out Caught by Saha!! Can a wicket keeper take a wicket? He sure can. Catches like those should be awarded to the keeper. Short delivery, got big on the batsman, he went for the pull and managed a big plump edge. The ball skied upwards and stayed there till eternity till Saha circled under it after running back and then despite misjudging it, threw himself in the air to take it out of thin air. Superb take from the mitts-man. batsman c Saha b bowler 28(34) [4s-1 6s-1]

SIX, MAAMMAAteamAAAHHH! That has sailed over the long-off region. Out of nowhere, Mr. 360 decides to pepper the area down the ground and he got the length to smack it down the ground. Length to ABD is blasphemous

SIX, good length is synonymous to death in the death overs. Length ball and the batsman hacked the pull shot away to send it packing into the cow corner region. That was out of the top draw from the comeback man!

SIX, Mr. 360 is back with a bang! Short delivery, it was a dead meat of a delivery for the batsman who was on the back foot, he picked the bones out of that. Pivots on the back foot and then hammers the pull on the on-side for a maximum and with that his fifty.
SIX, length ball and it disappears. That has been hoicked away into the on-side and that has landed many-a-miles into the deep mid region. He picked it up like he was picking roses in a garden

FOUR, goes inside-out and cannons the ball over cover for a boundary. That was a full ball outside off and the batsman thwacks the ball over the fielder to get another boundary. Even batsman joins in the act

SIX, cheers says ABD as he accepts the freebie from the bowler. That was a friendly full toss on the sticks and the batsman went across the line to smack the blow flat between long-on and mid-wicket for a maximum

FOUR, FIFTY for the combo! This man can do anything and everything with the willow. The pied piper of team treated the bowler as if he hails from Hamelin. That was full outside off and the batsman just steered the ball over the man at point

SIX, PHHUUUUUU!! 97 metres hit after he sank down on his knee to clobber the ball away towards the deep mid-wicket region. That was a low full toss and the batsman got under it to send it into oblivion

SIX, full toss, you don't want to know what happened to the bowler. That again forced the batsman to crouch low and trample the ball away into the on-side. That ball almost scaled the moon before it came down
SIX, his body lost balance. He was done in by the length, which was full, done in by the lack of pace but he reached out for it. He still managed to drag the ball away over long-off and a six it is

FOUR, in the airrrrrr and just over the leaping Maxwell at mid-on. Vinod is known for his audacious stroke-play. He won't mind playing his shots in any situation. Shortish delivery from bowler, Vinod smacks that from the crease, didn't get hold of it, more a sort of a pull shot it was, the ball just evaded the Punjab skipper

SIX, on the sticks, he goes down onto his knees and then the biggest of the night is unleashed as the ball scales some other orbit and disappears out of the stadium. Sensational hitting from ABD and team have something to fight with

SIX, oh my! That's a batsman special. How did he manage to time it so well? Looked like he was initially cramped for room, just moved his legs to the leg-side for a wee bit, somehow managed to get under that ball and loft it inside-out over wide long-off. Right then, he's moved on to 10 off 5. Good start you would say

no run, yes-no and the last thing team want is for Vinod to run AB out. Thankfully no damage done. He defends this back of a length delivery towards cover-point and blindly sets off, AB rightly sends him back and Stoinis' throw wasn't accurate at the striker's end

out Caught by Maxwell!! Good captaincy from Maxi. batsman hit a boundary that went aerial over mid-on in the previous over. Now he's placed himself in the deep and swallowed an easy catch. Disastrous start for team after opting to bat. Credit to bowler as well for dropping it short and cramping the batsman for room on seeing the batsman advance, Vinod wasn't in the best of positions to play, yet he went through with the hoick, totally mistimed it in the end. batsman c Maxwell b bowler 7(12) [4s-1]

out Lbw!! "Aaaaah, aaaaah," goes bowler and the finger goes up. "Definitely going over," says Pup on air, but quickly corrects himself to add, "maybe umpire's call." Body blow for team. Kedar was their hero in Bengaluru, he's out for a 4-ball 1 in Indore. Was that going over the top? Should the benefit of doubt been given to Kedar? This was the nip-backer from bowler, Kedar was on the hop, impact was just around the off stump and hawk-eye shows the ball missing the stumps. Another poor call from the umpire. We've had a few thus far in the series. Ask Mumbai Indians! batsman lbw b bowler 1(4)

FOUR, bowler missed the yorker by a yard or so and that was just what batsman wanted with the line being middle and leg. He waited for the ball to come and flicked it past the diving mid-wicket fielder

no run, another yes-no and batsman escapes. A direct-hit would have seen him walk back. He wanted to drive this short of length delivery through cover, got an inside edge to Amla at mid-wicket, AB shouts and sends him back, the throw was wide of the stumps

SIX, now then, now then! That's hit the roof of the stadium over the square leg stand. What a shot! How effortless was that? This short ball didn't rise much, batsman stood tall, swivelled and muscled the pull shot all the way

FOUR, and he gets lucky with an outside edge that runs away for four! No one at slip and third man can't cut that off. Natarajan bowled full and outside off stump, batsman reached out to meet the ball, the ball escaped off the edge

out Caught by Dhoni!! Look at him go. Surely he's inspired by a certain South African in his team - Imran Tahir. As soon as he sees Dhoni complete the catch, bowler is off on a celebratory run. Runs past almost all his mates. Good length ball in the channel around off, batsman has a needless poke at that, the hint of away movement takes the edge and Dhoni does the rest behind the stumps. batsman does not trouble the scorers and team have an early wicket. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 0(5)

FOUR, classy stuff from batsman. Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Good length ball around off, batsman allowed it to do its bit before opening the bat face and directing it past the backward point fielder. Used the pace on the ball and timed it beautifully

FOUR, consecutive boundaries for batsman. That should calm the nerves. Overpitched and bowler is punished, batsman strides forward and creams the square drive through the packed off-side field. No need to run for that
FOUR, tosses it up slow on middle and leg. Overpitched as well. batsman waits for the ball and drills it down the track. No chance for the long-on fielder

SIX, hits it and poses for the photographs does batsman. That's Instagrammable. Full delivery with no pace behind it. He clubbers it over the bowler's head and the ball sails over the sightscreen. First maximum of the day

SIX, second six of the over and batsman is turning the heat on here. Very similar to the first six. Full and slow from Bhatia. Once again, batsman thumps it down the ground and the ball lands wide of the sightscreen

1 run, just short of the long-on fielder and batsman reaches his fifty! Pitched up delivery, batsman lofted it over mid-on and falls in front of the diving long-on fielder. batsman collects a single to get to his milestone
SIX, that's a pressure-releaser! Brings up the 50-run stand in style! bowler overpitches and batsman takes full toll of it. Leans forward and sends it sailing over long-off for a gigantic six

out batsman Run Out!! That's brilliant stuff from Mayank Agarwal. The excellence cuts short batsman's innings. To start with, bowler bowled a wide yorker. batsman squeezes it out, finds Mayank at point and sets off. Mayank finds the target directly and batsman is well short of his ground. batsman run out (Mayank Agarwal) 31(22) [4s-1 6s-2]
FOUR, nice looking shot! Short ball, batsman has ample time to move across and pull it behind square on the leg-side. Well wide of the fine leg fielder. One bounce over the rope
SIX, that's a monster! Fired in on the legs of batsman and batsman deposits it into the mid-wicket stands with a heave. That cleared the boundary rope by a long way
SIX, welcome to your new spell says batsman! Length ball wide of off allowing batsman to free his arms. He is balanced in the crease and elevates it straight over long-off for a six

SIX, that's a stunning shot! batsman moved leg-side and bowler follows him with a bumper. batsman has no problems whatsoever as he hooks it over square leg. No fielder there and batsman collects another maximum
FOUR, highest score in this season! Cheeky from batsman! Low full toss outside off, batsman picks it and laps it well wide of short fine and the ball dribbles away into the fence
SIX, what a stunning way to get to your maiden T20 century! bowler bowls it quick, full and on the stumps, batsman moves slightly to his right and lofts it down the ground. MUSCLED

out Bowled!! bowler gets his man and batsman walks back raising his bat. Gets a standing ovation from his team mates in the dug-out. It was a flipper that did the trick. batsman looked to pull it through the on-side and failed to make connection. The ball cannons onto the stumps. batsman b bowler 102(63) [4s-8 6s-5]
FOUR, that's one helluva way to open your account! Leg-break outside off, Morris lofts it inside-out and gets off the mark with a boundary

SIX, that's a gigantic hit. For a moment, I thought it might go on and land onto the Pune-Mumbai Expressway. Fullish length, Morris moves to his right and wallops it over long-on. That went miles in the air and cleared the fence by a long way as well. High and handsome
FOUR, the gamble hasn't paid off. A wicket was scalped, but the overall result - 22 runs off the 19th over. Flipper outside off, Morris crouches and lifts it inside out. No chance for long-off
FOUR, that's a gross delivery! Short of a good length delivery with no pace behind it. Morris moves across and helps it away well wide of short fine. Runs away into the fence

FOUR, that's a brilliant stroke! bowler can't believe that. He didn't do much wrong there. It was bowled in the blockhole wide of off and Morris opens his bat face and drills the squeeze wide of point
SIX, wow! Bowls length and gets punished. On the pads and just a flick of the wrists. The ball has more than enough wings to clear the square leg fence
FOUR, batsman has come out firing. Picked the length early on the short of length delivery, got his front leg up and nailed the pull in front of square. That came smack bang off the middle

FOUR, fourth boundary in five balls for batsman. The start is getting better for DD. bowler overcompensates and goes full outside off, batsman is up for it and cracks the drive past the diving cover-point fielder. Sped away to the fence

FOUR, third boundary of the over and bowler leaking runs here. Short and wide outside off, batsman throws the kitchen sink at that and the ball flies off the outside edge, over Faf at slip and into the third man fence

SIX, fittingly Morris finishes the innings with a six. What a cameo this was from him. bowler bowls it short and Morris easily muscles the pull over deep mid-wicket. The man in the deep is just a spectator. Well that has been the story for the last few overs
FOUR, excellent batting. On a length and just outside off, batsman goes up and over cover, once he got it through the infield the result was going to be in his favour

FOUR, bowler too meted out with the same treatment. Good length ball outside off, batsman leans into the drive and places it square. It is a crowded off-side field and he's threaded that to perfection
FOUR, not a boundary ball but that's T20. Back of length around off, batsman crouches a bit and swats it away wide of mid-on, not off the middle but he had enough wood on that

FOUR, last over of the powerplay and batsman has decided to cash in. Advances and gets cramped for room, swings with all his might and drags it off the inner part of the bat to the left of short fine, Dinda can only escort the ball to the fence
FOUR, poor delivery this and bowler is made to pay. Sprays it down leg and that is easy pickings for any batsman, batsman stays inside the line and whips it fine. No chance for Dinda this time around

out Bowled!! And off he goes. Gets the crowd going as well. batsman is cursing himself off the field. It is yet another start for the Englishman that is not converted. It's always dangerous to shimmy down the wicket for a bowler like bowler, who generally skids the ball through, and that is what happened. batsman came down the wicket and bowler pushed it through, by the time the Kent batsman could get his bat down, the ball was past him and crashed into off-stump. The partnership has been broken and just the opening team needed. batsman b bowler 24(17) [4s-4]

FOUR, first boundary of the innings. Sweetly timed by Agarwal. Saw the ball dropped on a shortish length, pivoted back and flayed it through cover. This is a mickey-mouse outfield and it zooms away to the fence
SIX, take that! Says Bhatia. Gets under this short ball and smokes it over deep mid-wicket. Crunching sound of the willow

SIX, lovely shot, Pune need more of those, batsman skips down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum. Chants of MS, MS from the crowd.. Can he make a big score here?

out Caught by Nair!! When things go wrong, they go hopelessly wrong. Even his favourite helicopter shot has gone wrong tonight, that should snuff out whatever little hopes Pune might have had. This was tossed up invitingly by bowler, batsman cleared his left leg and whipped it off his toes - flat and hard, but straight to Karun Nair at deep mid-wicket. He didn't have to move an inch, accepts the catch gleefully. MS walks off, so do half the Pune crowd. batsman c Nair b bowler 11(14) [6s-1]
SIX, mistimed but six, batsman just got enough to clear the leaping Billings at wide mid-wicket, got underneath the length delivery, gets plenty of height and just about enough distance

SIX, back-to-back sixes for batsman, Cummins shortened his length outside off, batsman backs away, makes room and slaps it over cover. The timing is good and the ball sails over the ropes for another maximum

out Caught by Chris Morris!! Another wicket for bowler, he's having a better night. This was a floaty leg-break, went wider of off. Bhatia had to fetch that as he played the slog-sweep, went off the toe of the bat and it's a simple catch to Morris at long-on. Bhatia has a look at his bat and walks away. bowler is on a hat-trick now. batsman c Chris Morris b bowler 16(17) [6s-1]
FOUR, lovely shot, bowler tosses one wider of off, batsman gets a big stride forward and drills it through extra-cover, beats the man getting across to his left from long-off

out Caught by Pant!! Third wicket for Khan, he's having a ball tonight. Saw batsman giving him the charge, banged it short and on the stumps, batsman swung across in hope, gets a thick top-edge - simple catch to Pant. bowler has a few words to say as batsman walks away. The end is nigh for Pune. batsman c Pant b bowler 14(6) [6s-2]

no run, has Karun plucked a one-handed stunner? The third umpire is called for, the soft call is OUT. Looked like a good catch on first view. Has the ball touched the ground, has he got his fingers underneath? The third umpire is having a look at different angles, this will be a tricky call. NOT OUT it is. Fair call, looked like the ball might just have touched the ground as Karun plucked it. Coming to the ball, it was full and shaping away, squared up batsman as he was looking to work it towards the on-side, the edge flew to the left of first slip. Karun stuck his left hand out and claimed the catch
FOUR, batsman wants to have some fun, length delivery outside off, he gets forward and thumps it over extra-cover for a boundary

out Caught by Samson!! Another catch for Samson and another wicket for bowler. This was another leg-break, bowled slower and on the middle-stump line. batsman swung across in hope, he had to manufacture all the power himself, doesn't get the elevation either. Samson moves across to his right at deep mid-wicket and takes the offering. The umpire has called for a strategic break with just one wicket remaining. Not sure what the two teams will talk about over the next 150 seconds. batsman c Samson b bowler 5(7) [4s-1]

out Caught by Mishra!! The Daredevils have opened their tally and it's Cummins who has the final wicket. On a good length and on the stumps, batsman was backing away on the drive, doesn't get hold of the shot and chips it tamely towards cover. Mishra runs forward, dives and completes the catch. A 97-run mauling at home for Pune, they would love to forget today's display as soon as possible. batsman c Mishra b bowler 7(7) [4s-1]

out Caught by Samson!! Zak attack strikes! Glum faces in the crowd. batsman falls early in the innings, big wicket for DD. It was on a fuller length around off, it was the off-cutter from Zak. batsman perhaps went hard at it, the ball seemed to have stopped on the pitch and that must've foiled batsman's attempt there. Skewed off the toe-end and lobs a sitter to Samson at mid-off, who backtracks and pouches it safely. So, Zak gets the better of his counterpart. batsman c Samson b bowler 10(9)

FOUR, wow. Delicate stuff from Agarwal. Opens the bat face to this length ball and runs it towards third man, Sanju had to cover some ground, sprinted to his left but couldn't stop the ball from reaching the ropes

out Caught by Chris Morris!! The old warhorse gets his second wicket. Agarwal's poor form continues. He was scarced for runs, wanted to throw caution to the winds but doesn't succeed. Went for a on-the-up drive to a good length delivery that probably kicked up a touch. It was the slower ball from bowler that did the trick. He slices it straight to extra-cover, who took a couple of steps back and held onto it. batsman c Chris Morris b bowler 20(18) [4s-2]
FOUR, fabulous shot from batsman. Sets up a solid base and caresses it past long-off
FOUR, what a way to get off the mark in IPL for batsman. Leans across to a full ball and blasts it through extra cover
FOUR, edged and four. Morris is not happy. Throws a wild stare at the batsman. On a length and just outside off, batsman went hard at it, gets an outside edge that races away to the third man fence

out Caught by Nadeem!! Short ball consumes batsman. Morris picks up his first wicket. A lifter angled at the batsman, batsman went for the pull. The ball got big on him and he manages a fat top-edge that went up in the air. Nadeem from fine leg darted in and snaffled it with ease. batsman c Nadeem b bowler 10(5) [4s-2]

out Caught by Pant!! "Ahhhh, ahhhhh" goes Pant and S Ravi raises his finger. A big blow for Pune. Stunned silence in the crowd. batsman tried to be too cheeky, went low to play the scoop over the keeper's head. Gets a faint tickle and Pant nestles it into the gloves. batsman c Pant b bowler 8(7) [4s-1]

out Caught by Pant!! Gone! Three wickets in three overs and Pune are in trouble now. batsman bites the dirt. Cummins reaps reward for his tidy bowling. Again slants it wide of off, batsman went for a pull. Wasn't too short and all he could manage was an under-edge that was gobbled up by Pant. Smart catch, must say as it was dying. He bent forward and took it cleanly. batsman c Pant b bowler 2(5)
FOUR, slightly straighter from bowler and the batsman clips the ball away between mid-wicket and mid-on for a four. Hardly touched it and the ball sped away after he shuffled a tad across his sticks

FOUR, looks to defend and the ball trims the inside edge to run past the sticks. Cruel it is for the bowlers. The ball lifted up after landing on a length forcing the batsman to jab at it but the ball clipped the inner edge to run past the timbers and the keeper for a four

FOUR, serene! The format might demand slam bang wham. But a back foot cover drive with a lean into the shot and hitting it on top of the bounce is welcomed all day long. He trampled back to stroke it off the back foot

SIX, BOY O BOY! Clatters the ball out of the park after dropping down on one knee. The moment it hit the bat, it was heading one way - into the oblivion! That was again flattish and the batsman wasted no time in sending it away aerially
FOUR, he's sprayed it around a bit today, has bowler. Short and wide and gives away the boundary to finish the over. Slashed over backward point by Rana
SIX, wow! Just a flick of the wrists from batsman and away she goes. That's scintillating timing. It was a fullish off-cutter on middle stump and batsman whipped it comfortably over deep mid-wicket

out Caught by Dhawan!! He's whipped a pull straight to square leg. It was an innocuous short of length delivery into the body, not very high, and batsman usually is pretty adept at dealing with those. But this time it seemed as if he didn't go through with the shot. It's straight down the throat of Dhawan. Can team still turn things around? batsman c Dhawan b bowler 11(11) [6s-1]
SIX, oh that's a full bunger on leg stump, the dew causing the ball to slip out of Rashid's hand. So difficult. batsman swings it away over square leg
SIX, just clears long-on! He didn't get all of it, having to fetch it from outside off, but there was enough power in those shoulders
FOUR, 10 off 2 balls. bowler continues to be expensive. Strays just a touch in line, bowls it on middle and leg, and batsman glances it away past short fine leg
SIX, he's mowed that over deep mid-wicket. Back of a length, maybe a cutter, and it sits up to be whacked. Flat six
FOUR, very wide outside off and batsman somehow reaches out and then generates enough power to carve it over extra-cover. He's in a hurry now

FOUR, off the top-edge or the glove, the ball lobs over Naman Ojha and runs away to the boundary. batsman was rushed on the pull on this occasion. The line from bowler cramped him up too. But he still gets the boundary

out Caught by Cutting!! He's holed out off a full toss. He swings hard but gets it right off the toe-end. It still goes pretty far and is caught just 5 yards inside the deep mid-wicket boundary. Cutting takes a smart catch running backwards and to his right. batsman c Cutting b bowler 37(20) [4s-3 6s-3]
FOUR, lofted over mid-off! He picks the slower ball, the length was pretty full outside off and Rana's focus is purely on timing. Doesn't go very hard at it. Brilliant batting

out Bowled!! bowler knocks over Rana's off-bail. It hit nothing else but the bail. Third wicket for bowler. He's been fantastic again today. A little bit of nip from a good length, Rana was backing away looking to create a shot out of nothing and missed it by a long way in the end. He's played a fine knock though. batsman b bowler 45(36) [4s-3 6s-2]
FOUR, repeats the gait of the previous ball and gets an outside edge to run it down towards third man. He got wood on it and got it fine after just using the pace of the bowler. 15 off the over!

FOUR, errs in length, which is short, errs in line, which is wide. Enough said. The batsman cashes into the blank cheque of a delivery with the flay of the arms and stroked it beautifully through the heavily manned off-side

out Bowled!! The batsman preempts by dancing down the track but he lost his dancing shoes in the process as the slower ball doled out deceives him. The wily old bowler rolled his fingers over the ball and the batsman trying for a cross batted swipe completely missed the ball due to the lack of pace on it. team get the first blood. batsman b bowler 14(11) [4s-3]
FOUR, nicely done as he wristily whips the ball in the air over the man at mid-on. A few bounces and into the fence. A length ball it was and the batsman did it with nonchalance

FOUR, targets the mid-riff with another short delivery but the pint-sized dynamite is onto it in a flash! The short arm jab on the pull and the ball screeches away into the backward square region on the on-side for a four

out Lbw!! The wrong 'un and the team skipper seems to be at the wrong end of it again. First game: Tahir, Now: Rashid. The ball decked in after landing and the meek prodded attempt from batsman plots his own misery. The impact might have been around off even as batsman lunged forward on the defensive push. The teen sensation continues to bamboozle the men. batsman lbw b bowler 4(4)

SIX, banged in short, the batsman plays an awkward shot to pull the ball away fine on the on-side for a maximum. He had eyes away from the ball and then the evasive action with the bat coming down on it made good enough contact

FOUR, that was a chocolate brownie of a delivery and the batsman puts the icing on it with the help of an eyes-scream of a shot. Cut away easily past the man at point making the man at third man look like a statue
FOUR, the ramp now! He is pulling out all the tricks from his hat. Short ball bumped in well outside off and the batsman helped it on his way towards third man
FOUR, poor delivery on the pads and third in a row as the batsman clips the ball away over the man at short fine leg
FOUR, attempted slog sweep, is not really well timed but is well placed to send it away into the vacant backward square region for a much needed four

out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Length ball tossed up and he has chipped it straight to the man at long-on who dives forward and takes a good catch. He gave the impression to us that it might have stuck onto the wicket a bit. But it was a bizzare shot as he just lofted it without any particular intent on the shot. End of a good knock from batsman. batsman c Bhuvneshwar b bowler 39(24) [4s-7]
SIX, bring it on! Make a GIF of that shot. batsman swapped his hands and belted it with switch hit over third man, that's some hitting I tellya. Got behind it and gave it a full whack, bam!

out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Not again! batsman tries for another switch hit and this time it doesn't come off, ends up playing it off the back of the bat as the ball slid onto him and then the heroics of PP. He anticipated the shot, moved quickly to his left and dived full length before nestling it inches above the turf. Stunning catch that. batsman c Parthiv Patel b bowler 49(34) [4s-7 6s-2]
FOUR, don't worry about that! Healthy width on offer, Hooda throws the kitchen sink and gets his christmas gift
FOUR, right in the sweeping zone for SD. He gets inside the line and thrashes it away behind square

out Caught by Pollard!! bowler's doosra does the trick, and boy is he happy! Does a cradle like celebration for his daughter, who is in attendance today. That was fired around off and middle, Hooda knelt down on knee and miscued the slog, was trying to clear long-on, but didn't get the distance. Pollard sets himself at long-on and consumes with ease. batsman c Pollard b bowler 9(9) [4s-1]
FOUR, batsman's getting better with each passing delivery, he steps out, takes bowler on and lofts him inside-out over extra cover

out Bowled!! No fifties for the openers. Warner misses it by a run and SD by two. It was a loopy full toss which dips under batsman's cross-bat hoick to crash into his stumps. Easily done. bowler has a wicket, been expensive thus far but this wicket should sooth his nerves. batsman b bowler 48(43) [4s-5 6s-1]

FOUR, no fuss from batsman! Arrives and gets a boundary, with utmost ease. A friendly full toss outside off, batsman shows the full face of the bat, bowler's pace takes care of the rest. Raced past mid-off

FOUR, a fielding blip from Buttler and that's a boundary. Yuvi knew what was coming with the field set, stayed on the back foot and unveiled the cut with a glitter of left-hander's elegance. Jos runs to his right from cover and dives, the ball slids through his fingers to add agony to a grumpy-looking Rohit Sharma

out Bowled!! Dragged on! Lands on the seam and gets the ball to angle away from Yuvi; making him fetch that far from his reach. Yuvi with his laden-feet went through with the pull and chopped it back onto his stumps, off the thick inside edge firing off the PUMA sticker. batsman b bowler 5(7) [4s-1]
FOUR, the gangly batsman makes his intentions clear. He wants to have a piece of slinga bowler. Waits deep inside the crease and bludgeons a full ball back over the bowler's head
FOUR, that's a wood chopper! Takes on a full half-volley and slices the whacky-drive over a leaping exra cover. Bhajji was the fielder and he may have got a fingertip on that
FOUR, slower ball alright, but serves too much of width. Ends up as a full toss, batsman chips it over extra cover, easy peasy

out Bowled!! The bowler special, batsman can't do much, just drops his head and walks off. Goes a touch wide of the crease and lands a perfect yorker, right at the base of middle stump. By the time batsman got his bat down, his stumps were already shattered. Phewf! batsman b bowler 20(10) [4s-4]

out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Way too early through his shot, played the shot on Monday, and the ball...Um! It arrives on Wednesday. Looking to flick, a healthy leading edge pops up to Rana at backward point. Simple catch. batsman c Nitish Rana b bowler 1(2)

out Caught by Pollard!! The wickets keep tumbling. Slower ball, in right-hander's swinging arc, Ojha got under it but he didn't give it a full whack. Relies on timing and chips it high into the night sky, Pollard is safe as a house at long-on. batsman c Pollard b bowler 9(9)

out Caught&Bowled!! bowler says "It's mine" and he makes no mistake. Charges out of his crease and clatters it, nowhere off the middle, it hung in the air for long and bowler had it covered. Caught it around the cover region. batsman c and b bowler 2(4)
FOUR, lovely shot, poor ball from bowler, dropped it short and wide of off, batsman backed away, plays with the turn and cuts it over cover, one bounce and over the ropes
FOUR, this is even better. This was not all that short but batsman made room for himself, stayed back and went inside out over cover, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

FOUR, nicely played by batsman, it was the slower ball from bowler, rolled his fingers across the seam. batsman watched it all along, played with an open face and guides it in the gap behind square on the off-side, beats backward point and rolls away to the fence
FOUR, poor ball from bowler, too straight and on batsman's pads, he allows it to come onto it, closes the face of the bat and glances it fine, beats the keeper and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from bowler, batsman waits on it, gets on top of the bounce, uses bowler's pace and steers it to the right of backward point. No chance for the fielder running across to his left from third man

FOUR, streaky and four, on a good length and on the stumps, batsman heaves across the line, gets a thick inside edge past square leg. The pace of this outfield is so good that it rolls away to the fence
SIX, cracking shot, length delivery on the stumps, right in the hitting arc for batsman, he gets forward and thumps it high and over mid-wicket, went sailing into the stands for a maximum
FOUR, cracking shot, on a good length and just outside off, batsman does a little shimmy, gets close to the ball and drills it wide of mid-off. No need to run for those. 15 from the over
leg byes, 1 run, short of a good length and on batsman's hips, he was looking to nudge and missed, rolled away off his pads towards square leg

FOUR, that's a bad fumble from Rana and he has cost his team two runs. Full and on his pads, flicked away behind square on the on-side. Rana did the hard yards, got to the ball and slips it through his hands

FOUR, back-to-back boundaries and it has turned out to be another expensive over from bowler. He got too predictable with the slower ones, batsman was waiting for it, cuts it hard and beats the fielder at point to his left

FOUR, inside edge and four, on a good length and holding its line outside off, batsman walked across on the swipe, gets a thick inside edge - past the off-stump and past the diving Parthiv. A hat-trick of boundaries for team
SIX, beautifully played, banged in short and angling across the left-hander, batsman backs away,uses the pace of Hardik and helps it on its way, no one in the deep and the ball sails over the ropes
FOUR, slapped, short of a length and shaping away from outside off, batsman plays with the angle and carves it behind square on the off-side, one bounce and over the ropes
FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from bowler, batsman gets on top of the bounce and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, beats the man in the ring and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, edged and four, a third slip would have gobbled it up. Short of a good length and angling across batsman, opened him up as he looked to defend, the edge flew past the diving Maxwell at second slip, third man can't get across - despite the dive

out Bowled!! batsman attempts a cheeky lap sweep and ends up self-destructing himself. His captain doesn't look too pleased with it. This was tossed up on the leg-stump line, batsman went a long way across his stumps, bent down and was looking to lap it past the keeper, misses and the ball hits the top of leg-stump. Hushed silence at the Eden Gardens as batsman walks away. batsman b bowler 26(16) [4s-3 6s-1]

1 run, 33rd IPL fifty for GG. Equals Warner's record for the most number of fifties. Waves his bat around to acknowledge the Eden Garden crowd. Reaches the milestone with a wristy flick through mid-wicket

FOUR, off-pace delivery and batsman spotted it early. The length was short and with his open stance, it was always going to be trouble for Mohit, punched off the back foot in front of square and Axar at sweeper gave up the chase very soon

FOUR, what was Ishant doing? batsman backed away to the leg-side, bowler followed him with a short and quick delivery, batsman adjusted and ramped it fine. Ishant at short third man stood like a statue

FOUR, top shot! Just a caress and off she went racing to the boundary cushion. bowler tosses it up outside off and draws Pandey into the drive, the Karnataka batsman drives it handsomely through extra cover and beat a quick David Miller at sweeper cover
FOUR, slower short ball and Pandey had all the time in the world to dismiss it from his presence, delays the pull and sends it along the turf behind square, well wide of the deep square leg fielder
FOUR, that's bread and butter for batsman. Short, wide and he cracks it away. Went back in his crease and unleashed the cut shot behind square, beating backward point and third man quite comfortably

SIX, team complete a stunning 8-wicket win. Their eighth win on the trot against team. Pandey brings up the winning runs in style, picks the slower delivery and swipes it flat over long-on. The fielder there was a mere spectator

SIX, lovely, batsman was sent in to do some pinch-hitting and he's doing exactly that. Length delivery outside off, batsman gets forward, drives it through the line and sends it high and over the fence at long-off

FOUR, cracking shot, hint of width outside off, the length was on the shorter side as well, batsman gets on top of the bounce and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, beats the fielder at point and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, this is turning out to be an excellent start from team. Sandeep overcompensates and bowls one full and wide of off, batsman shimmies down the track, gets down on one knee and drills it past extra-cover

FOUR, poor ball from bowler, short and wide of off, batsman gets on top of the bounce and cracks it behind square on the off-side. Beats backward point to his right and the man getting across in the deep
FOUR, this is a super quick outfield, flatter and on batsman's pads, nudged away behind square on the on-side. Two men gave chase, but the ball kept going away from their reach
FOUR, lovely shot, pushed through flatter and quicker, batsman shuffles down the track, makes room as he did so and drives it wide of mid-off, no need to run for those
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for batsman, bowler drags his length back, drops it short and on batsman's pads, pulled away over square leg for another boundary

FOUR, 18 runs from the over, poor ball from bowler, fired it flatter and on batsman's pads, he goes back and clips it past square leg. The man in the ring was pretty square, gives the chase, but it's in vain
SIX, lovely shot, batsman is hurting team here, length delivery on the stumps, he presses forward and thumps it over mid-on, has enough power to pop over the fence on the full

SIX, back-to-back sixes, this is batsman's highest ever T20 score. bowler isn't learning here, another length delivery on the stumps, batsman backs away and lifts it high and over long-on, went a long way over the ropes at long-on

FOUR, cracking shot, awful start from bowler, fine leg was inside the ring and he looks to bounce out batsman. There's not much bounce on this one, batsman swivels across and helps it over short fine-leg, one bounce and over the ropes

out Caught by Axar!! batsman's fun is over, but has he taken this match away from team's grasp? This was banged in short and on the stumps, batsman swivels across and pulls it hard and flat - was struck pretty well but went straight into the hands of Axar at deep mid-wicket. He doesn't drop those and batsman walks off to a nice round of applause. Even his captain enjoyed it, gives a good send-off to his partner. batsman c Axar b bowler 37(18) [4s-4 6s-3]

FOUR, the short-ball attack isn't working and team aren't learning either. Banged in short and down the leg-side, batsman gets inside the line, swivels across and pulls it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
SIX, stylishly done, just a pick-up swivel from batsman and he sends it into the stands at wide long-on. Was quick to read the length, stayed on the front-foot and launched it into the stands

FOUR, deft touch from batsman, bowler dropped one short and wide of off, batsman makes room, waits on it, uses the pace on the ball and dabs it late, beats Sandeep at short third man and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, that's easy pickings for batsman, he's looking in good form tonight. Short and on the stumps, he gets inside the line and helps it on its way, one bounce and over the fence at backward square leg
FOUR, poor ball from bowler, dropped it short and wide of off, batsman makes room and cuts it behind square on the off-side. Miller was caught wrong-footed and has no chance to recover

FOUR, shoddy from Piyush Chawla, running around from fine leg. He's too stiff while bending and the ball slips underneath him. Swinging in on middle and leg, batsman clips it behind square leg and it shouldn't have been more than a couple
FOUR, the swing from bowler takes him on the pads once more, batsman stays in the crease and whips a glance down to the fine leg boundary. Brisk start from the Kings XI

SIX, that's been dispatched with disdain. Blistering pull shot. Short of length, around chest high, batsman is still on the front foot but he transfers his weight quickly and smashes it in front of square. Hits the boundary cushions on the full

out Caught by Gambhir!! Maiden IPL wicket for bowler. batsman's painful innings is over. The frustration was creeping in, he walked across and tried to nudge it into the on-side, it was an off-pace delivery and batsman was fooled there. Gets a fat leading edge that goes up in the air. The skipper takes a simple catch at cover and the crowd roars in delight. batsman c Gambhir b bowler 25(27) [4s-4]

out Caught by Uthappa!! Mad max Maxi is gone. This is a body blow for Punjab. Two wickets in two overs and the pendulum swings back in favour of team now. It was a pacy back of a length delivery, batsman backed away towards the leg-side, perhaps was undone by the bounce there. He is tucked up for room, ends up having a slash at it. Gets a feather and Uthappa makes no mistake behind the stumps. First time Maxi has been dismissed in this IPL. batsman c Uthappa b bowler 25(14) [4s-3 6s-1]
FOUR, flashed and flashed hard. Umesh provides width for batsman, he throws his bat and ekes out a thick outside edge that flies past first slip
FOUR, this is a bit streaky but batsman won't mind. Bangs it short, batsman went for the pull, gets a top-edge that flies over the keeper

no ball, SIX, thumpy thump! What a sin. bowler has overstepped again and one more free-hit for batsman. Hurls one full outside off, batsman plants his front foot across and smashes it flat and hard over extra cover. Such is the power that it carries all the way
SIX, batsman gets into the act. He's had enough. Uses his feet, reaches near the pitch and tonks it over long-off. An 84-meter strike
SIX, fabulous shot. He has picked this googly alright, shimmies out, meets the pitch and lofts it inside-out over extra cover. Sweet timing and it sails over the rope

FOUR, that is an awful effort from Narine. Makes a royal mess of this one. bowler wears a cheeky smile on his face. It was a short ball outside off, batsman gets a top-edge as he tried to elevate it over third man. The ball lobs in the air and drops in front of Narine at third man, he fails to get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it go through making him look absolute silly
SIX, that's gone a long way into the stands! batsman sets up a solid base on the leg-stump, lets his hands take over and smokes it miles into the deep square leg stands
FOUR, attempted yorker gone wrong for Umesh. Ends up offering a high full toss on off, batsman gets hit high on the willow but he manages it skew it past mid-off

out Caught by M Pandey!! There is a notion that full tosses are a bad ball but not on this occasion. Some respite for Umesh and team. Slips in a friendly full toss on the stumps, batsman went for a whack across the line, again squirts it high on the bat. Pops it high towards deep mid-wicket. Pandey ran forward, covered good ground and snaffled a good running catch. The umpires checked for a possible no-ball (both crease and height), but it was fine. team anthem blares in the background. batsman c M Pandey b bowler 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]

out Caught by Woakes!! Two in two for Umesh. What an over this is turning out to be for team. Umesh is on hat-trick now. A fuller ball on off, batsman sort of checked his shot, ended up hitting it uppishly to mid-off, Woakes dived forward and held onto a smart catch. He ensured that it didn't pop out of his hands when his elbows hit the ground. batsman c Woakes b bowler 25(17) [4s-2 6s-2]

out Caught by Narine!! Three wickets in the over and Punjab are falling apart here. Umesh is on a roll. Spears it on a fuller length on off, straightened a wee bit. Patel was early into his shot, skims a leading edge that balloons straight into the hands of Narine at extra cover, who finally holds onto one today. batsman c Narine b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, he's timed that well. Gets on top of the bounce, opens the bat face nicely and steers it past point. No chance for the third man fielder

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Another one bites the dust. Against the run of play, Punjab lose another one. It was a short ball slanted at the body, Mohit went after it, gets it high on the bat and skews it to long-on where Suryakumar Yadav pouches it safely. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 10(8) [4s-1]

FOUR, ravishing cover drive from batsman. This looks a belter of a pitch. This is no half-volley, but the ball is coming on so beautifully that batsman just leans across and caresses it on the up. Awesome timing
FOUR, third boundary today that bowler has conceded off the pads. Just straying a touch with the swing. Curling in on leg, batsman shuffles across and just tickles it through

1 run, Narine has shelled a sitter at third man. Oh dear. bowler just turns around in despair. A short of length delivery, batsman tries to pull off the front foot and sends a top-edge flying down to third man. They don't come easier than that

out Caught by Gambhir!! Oh goodness! Gambhir nearly made a meal of this catch. He somehow clasps onto it. A full ball outside off, batsman threw his bat, gets a top-edge that goes high in the air towards extra cover. Gambhir set himself under it, the ball was swirling in the air. The ball popped out of his hand, after juggling with it, he manages to gobble it up. batsman c Gambhir b bowler 4(5)
FOUR, deliberately goes up and over point. Ordinary delivery. Short of length with width on offer, batsman opens his wrists up as he slashes it away to lift it over the infield

FOUR, the boundaries keep coming as the bowlers keep erring in line. Full ball on the pads, fine leg is inside the ring, so batsman effortlessly whips it over him and into the fence. team off to a flying start
FOUR, that's a risky shot but batsman backs himself to ramp a short of length delivery into the third man boundary. He got it fine enough of the fielder. One bounce and over the ropes
5 wides, an inswinger from bowler. But this one goes a long way in the air, falls away down the leg-side and beats Uthappa completely. There's no stopping those runs

out Bowled!! Much needed breakthrough for the hosts. bowler comes on and strikes first ball. Not a big turner of the ball, this bloke, and that skiddiness through the surface accounts for batsman. May have been the googly. Pushed through the air, lands it on a length, and the ball zips through the gate as batsman tries to loft it on the up. He was aiming for the inside-out shot with the turn. But the ball goes straight on and knocks over middle and off. batsman b bowler 28(19) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, only slightly short, the ball slides in on leg, and batsman is quick to go back in the crease. He effortlessly whips a pull over square leg and beats long leg to his left
1 run, fires them in, 103kph, batsman punches it to the right of point and quickly goes through to the other end

out Bowled!! Chopped on! batsman doesn't pick this one. He expects the ball to go away to aid his cut shot, but it turns in slightly to cramp him up. A thick under-edge into the pitch before bouncing up to knock over the top of leg stump. batsman b bowler 9(12) [4s-1]

FOUR, picked off his hips for six, is it? No, one bounce. So stylishly done. Loose from bowler again, he bowls back of a length and bowls leg-stump. batsman languidly swivels outside the line and helps it on its way. Lovely wrists

1 run, dropped by Uthappa! Definitely two noises there. Back of length, cutting in and takes the inside edge. The ball deflects off batsman's thigh as well. Uthappa dives to his left with one hand but the ball hits him hard on the glove
FOUR, short of length into the body, batsman wallops a pull through backward square leg. That's rocketed to the fence. Really poor from bowler. He's been consistently short so far

SIX, he's in some form in this tournament. A flighted leg-break from bowler, it's right in the slot. batsman is close enough to the pitch, knows that bowler doesn't turn it a great deal and just swings through the line over long-on
FOUR, four more. Flatter outside off but it's full again, and batsman smokes a flat-batted drive wide of long-off
FOUR, bowler under serious pressure. This is scintillating batting. He goes wide of off again, and is carted over extra-cover again. An unabridged swing of the bat

out Caught by Gayle!! bowler tears off the wrapping paper and presents team with a gift in his first over. Early strike from the home team. bowler was being under used in the last three matches. Makes amends immediately today with a prized scalp of batsman. It was a fuller length delivery jagging in on leg-stump line, seemed to have stopped on batsman. He flicks it meekly straight to mid-wicket. Gayle won't drop those. batsman c Gayle b bowler 2(5)
SIX, in the slot and Pandya connects one. Scooches low and smacks one over long-off

FOUR, in the blockhole, the ball chirps the toe-end of the bat and bisects the gap between the keeper and the slip fielder to race away to the fence. That was really full and was just outside off to force the batsman to jam his bat down on that
FOUR, length ball outside off and the batsman flogs the ball away with the meaty bottom-hand coming into play. The gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket was easily pierced

SIX, backs away and clears the man at deep extra cover. He went inside out and got enough meat on it to send it packing over the cover fielder's head. Any doubts on batsman's powerful delivering skills were quelled down. He didn't time it at all. The batter got it off the outer part of the bat and still enough sinew in it to send it over the ropes

FOUR, fifty for the combo! He waited on that slower delivery and then dismissed it out of his sight with disdain. Got the room as well to free his arms and then got the ball speeding between cover and mid-off for a four

FOUR, full ball targetting the sticks and the batsman got enough wood on it to clip it away. The man from deep square who was Binny came running in to make the save but despite getting a hand on it, couldn't bend down enough to stop that. Second four of the over
SIX, flat hit! That was a flatter delivery and the batsman spanks it down the ground and over the bowler's head to give himself a wonderful fifty! This has been a top-class knock from the Trinidadian
SIX, go fetch that! That has gone out of this orbit. That was flat again from bowler and the batsman shot a firecracker into the night sky to the delight of the team fans

FOUR, poor from Mills! That was dabbed away with soft hands and the fielder at short third man does the London Bridge and dives over it to open the floodgates for team. The momentum has again changed hands
SIX, succeeds this time! He reaches out for the dragged slog and then biffs the ball down the ground to send it rocketing 20 rows into the stands

out Caught by de Villiers!! The gamble has worked for Kohli. Gives the ball to bowler, who tosses it up, the batsman takes the aerial route but gets more elevation than distance and ends up being caught at long-off. That again went very high but ABD was all calm under the ball and cupped it without any fuss. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 70(47) [4s-3 6s-5]

FOUR, short ball, pulled away and no man in the deep mid-wicket region allows the ball to race away into the fence. Chahal from deep square ran across and the ball sandwiches between him and the ground to ensure that he is in some pain. Hope he is OK as he has a grimacing expression on his face

SIX, slower delivery, batsman picks that up and dismantles the ball over the cow corner region for a maximum. That is it. team have got themselves out of jail here after self-imprisoning themselves with a dreadful start. They were 7 for 4 but Pollard-Pandya have done it for them. 3rd win for team!

out Caught by Gayle!! Two in two for team. Chinnaswamy breaks the sound barrier. team are right back in this contest. Both openers back in the hut now. bowler looped it full outside off, it was the sucker ball and Patel fell into the trap. Drove it on the rise straight to Gayle at short extra cover. The West Indian shows quick reflexes as he pouches an excellent catch. He was alert enough and his natural instincts took over there. batsman c Gayle b bowler 3(8)

out Caught by Mandeep!! "Mumbai Indians are committing hara-kiri" screams Ravi Shaz on air. Can't disagree. batsman has been promoted up the order and what does he do first ball? Gets underneath a full toss and smacks it straight into the bucket hands of Mandeep at long-on. batsman c Mandeep b bowler 0(1)

out Bowled!! The scoreline reads 7/4. This is surreal from team. What an over from bowler. bowler takes a hat-trick. batsman's woeful form continues. He fails to pick this googly from bowler. The crowd go bonkers. It came back in as batsman prodded forward to defend, leaves a gap between his bat-pad. Enough for the ball to sneak through to rattle the stumps. batsman b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, Rana is the man in form. Poor ball from Mills, slides one down leg, Rana gets across and whips it crisply behind square. No chance for the fine leg fielder

SIX, greets him to the crease with a maximum. Tosses it up, a floppy-hat batsman plants his front foot forward and launches it over long-off. A blow so meaty that it deserved some extra cheese and french fries to add to it

out Caught by Aravind!! What a dream spell from bowler. Finishes it with a wicket. His fourth of the evening. Rana bites the dirt. Was itching to smack this quicker delivery, it was wider of off. The width was there and Rana went after it with a flashy cut. He forgets to keep it down and hits it straight to point. Aravind dives forward and takes a fine low catch. team sink further into the mire. batsman c Aravind b bowler 11(16) [4s-1]

1 run, dropped! Buttler went backwards at deep-midwicket, then circled under it and drops it in the end. That was a mistimed slog-sweep and the ball stayed in the sky for a long long time. Buttler messed it up by never really judging it

byes, FOUR, byes signalled! The ball kept terribly low as batsman backed away to thwack it. The ball rolled down to beat the keeper through his legs and run away into the fence. Bumrah giving it a chase comes up with a comical effort - tried to flick it back and ended up lobbing the ball outside the boundary edge

SIX, that's a six and a half! That ball is gone into the sea of reds in the cow corner region. That was a slower delivery and batsman spotted it like dead meat after giving the charge and picked the bones out of that
SIX, full toss and the ball has been banged down the ground! Over the man at long-off and fifty for the skipper in his comeback game! He can do no wrong in this league. That was effortlessly done
FOUR, cheeky from the skipper as he opens the face of the blade and runs it past the diving keeper for a four
FOUR, looks to slog sweep, the ball chalks the outer thin edge and runs past the keeper for a four. Lucky and streaky

out Caught by Buttler!! The Buttler serves this one up for his team by pouching the big man on the juggle. That was wide and on a length, the batsman threw his hands at that and managed to trample it straight down the throat of the man at deep cover. Buttler came in a few paces, juggled it once as the ball came at chest height to him and then on the juggle managed to grab hold of it. batsman c Buttler b bowler 62(47) [4s-5 6s-2]

out Caught by Rohit!! The Hit Man does it for the team side. He flies to his left and flings his left hand to pick that out of thin air. That was chipped away uppishly sans any control from ABD and the ball was picked up inches from the ground as Rohit decided to showcase his wings at extra cover. Third time Krunal has accounted for ABD in the IPL. batsman c Rohit b bowler 19(21) [6s-1]

out Kedar Jadhav Run Out!! The yorker blocked back, the bowler picks it up with one hand to his left and then has the mind to strike the sticks down at the bowler's end. That was harakiri from Kedar Jadhav as he was backing up so far on a free-hit delivery. That will hurt team but credit to bowler as he had the brain to take the opportunity. Kedar Jadhav run out (bowler) 9(8)

out Bowled!! Gone first ball. The length ball, batsman looks to go for the big monty and ends up dragging the ball onto his sticks. He had to throw caution to the winds but manages only a thick inside edge. bowler is finally getting amongst the wickets in this season after a disastrous start to his campaign. batsman b bowler 0(1)

SIX, first maximum for batsman. Finds his bearing right this time. Sees a full ball on off, just stands motionless, in fact took a step forward and thumps it over long-on. Doesn't bother to look at the ball at all. He knows it went a long way
FOUR, awful start this has been for bowler. Overbakes and bangs it short, sits up nicely for batsman, who skips back and muscles the pull in front of square on the on-side

FOUR, two fours in a row. "He is looking ominous here," says Ravi Shaz on air. This was a half-volley on fifth stump line, batsman brings those quicksilver wrists of his into play. Just gets inside the line and whips it past mid-on. Goes to the fence like a 'famous bullet phrase' to the fence

FOUR, the chat has worked. Virat offered some advice to batsman and next ball the big man slaps one to the fence. A quicker delivery outside off, batsman goes back and flays the cut, through point. Zooms away to the fence.
FOUR, stand and deliver stuff from batsman. Just flexes his arms and times the pants off this length ball. Races away through cover and no need to run for those

SIX, batsman flies out of the blocks! He runs out of patience and shows Michael Jackson footwork. Reaches the pitch this time and lifts it high up in the air. Didn't get it off the middle but enough to clear the man at long-on
FOUR, buffet ball, as Geoff Boycott would say. Short and offers enough width, batsman skips back and knives with a solid punch, the timing was brutal and it beats extra cover

out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Gone! Pandya has struck in his first over. As often is the case, lapse in concentration for batsman. Hits the deck on a shortish length outside off, batsman wanted to pull it, he had to fetch it from outside off. He came down a step and wanted to smack the leather off it. All he could do was manifest a faint nick to the keeper. PP went up straightaway and Hardik joined him late. Hushed silence in the crowd. The umpires checked for a possible no-ball but his foot was way behind the crease. batsman c Parthiv Patel b bowler 22(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, that's a thick inside edge is what it is. Smith just plants his foot down looking to loft it down the ground without being anywhere close to the pitch. It slides in, spoons up off the edge and beats square leg before running away
