SIX, he's got proper hold of that. Good lord. That's gone way back. Not much different than the first delivery as Smith lunges at a length ball but this time he muscles it right off the middle. Welcome back as an opener
FOUR, now Ankit fires it short and Smith goes back to punch it through the covers. What a blistering start for team! 16 off the over
SIX, bangs it in short but it's a leg-cutter and it just sits up. McCullum makes room and spanks a flat-batted shot over extra-cover. Woof!

out Stumped!! The junior Chahar continues to impress. Some of the fantasy fanatics are cursing_____ you know who! Baz follows his instincts, shimmies down and looks to bash the young man over long-on. Was nowhere near the pitch of the delivery, beaten by length and done in the drift and dip. MS slaps the bails in flash. batsman st Dhoni b bowler 49(32) [4s-5 6s-3]

out Bowled!! bowler strikes and the customary celebrations follow! DK had a great domestic season, looked decent thus far in this IPL, but not today. He was shaping up to cut, perhaps didn't expect Imran bowler to fire in a googly. Result? He ends up chopping it back onto his stumps, off the inside edge obviously. batsman b bowler 3(5)
FOUR, paddle-scoops a leg-drifter to the fine leg fence, good placement
SIX, this is batsman at his best. He does this so often against spinners. Dances down, gets to the pitch of the delivery and takes bowler for a journey over cow corner
FOUR, first poor delivery from bowler. Half-volley outside off, batsman lofts him inside-out over extra cover. Smith running in from long-off gave up a little too early
FOUR, that's timed to perfection! Save your legs. It rose just enough from a fullish length, batsman shows the full face of the bat as he spanks it through cover. No chance for the man in the deep
FOUR, plenty of flight on that one and batsman takes full toll of it. Watches it closely and nails the drive wide of extra cover
FOUR, batsman is having a ball out there. Middling almost everything. On one knee, gets underneath a flighted delivery and loft-drives bowler over extra cover
FOUR, on the pads, batsman says thank you and brooms him away into the deep backward square fence. 13 off the over

FOUR, a night to forget for Imran Tahir as he puts one down. Pick-up flick shot from batsman, Tahir at fine leg was late to anticipate as he tries to reach the ball with a lackadaisical dive, through his fingers
SIX, that's a batsman special. He loves pace, doesn't he? Stamps a 145ks delivery with a 80-metre maximum over square leg. Pure power!
SIX, that's it. Gujarat Lions win their first game of the season. batsman goes deep inside the crease, expects pace and envelops it over long-on

FOUR, bludgeoned! A short of length delivery outside off which Smith smokes through mid-wicket. To hit that well in front of square against someone like Ferguson, especially after having to fetch it from wide of off, it's a special shot
FOUR, you don't bowl short to this guy, not unless you're express. Such fast hands as he dispatches a pull through mid-wicket. The man in the deep is too square

no run, hit straight back at Thakur who puts it down. Half a chance here. McCullum had timed that beautifully and the ball was travelling. But it came at a nice height in the followthrough. Thakur parries it towards mid-off

FOUR, 147kph on that length ball and Smith uses all of it to slice the ball over backward point. Or maybe I'm giving him too much credit and it's just a thick outside edge. In either case, he went hard and the ball flew
FOUR, a proper half-volley at the stumps, beautifully whipped away wide of mid-on. Excellent wrists from Smith. team off to a flier
FOUR, lunges out at the ball and lofts it over mid-off. Interesting that he's gone after bowler first ball. The ball was full enough to execute the shot and he took his opportunity
FOUR, now McCullum skips out of the crease, takes it on the full and drills it through extra-cover. Back to back boundaries
SIX, a little shimmy down the track, reaches out to the pitch of the ball and wallops it over long-on. bowler under pressure, probably for the first time in this IPL
FOUR, too close to cut, but Smith has played it well! Picked the length early, rocked back and slapped it from around off-stump backwards of point
FOUR, that's pleading to be pummeled. Short and slides down, Smith with a brazen-looking pull shot puts it away into the vacant mid-wicket area
FOUR, kneels down and sweeps bowler between long-on and deep mid-wicket. Gee! This is some exhibition
FOUR, a repeat of the previous delivery. This time though he had to fetch it from well outside off and beats Stokes's dive to his right at long-on
SIX, skips out of his crease and smokes a dart high into the night sky, straight back over the bowler's head
FOUR, full floater on middle and leg, Smith drills it to the right of a diving Imran bowler. Long-on can't get there

out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Flays one straight down the throat of third man. batsman is disappointed, but he has done his job. Was lured by the width on offer and went chasing, makes a mess of the connection though, it slices the thick outside edge and drops as a dolly into the hands of junior Chahar. batsman c Rahul Chahar b bowler 47(30) [4s-8 6s-1]

out Caught by Raina!! What a way to start your 150th IPL game. First, won the toss and now pulls off a blinder. Even he can't believe that he has plucked that out. A blob for batsman and early trouble for Pune. This one jagged back in from a shortish length, batsman thought it would be shaping away and went for a flashy cut, the outside edge flies towards the cordon. Raina, standing at wide slip, reacts quickly and grabs it with his left hand. He caught it when the ball had almost passed him. batsman c Raina b bowler 0(3)

FOUR, class written all over it. Tells us what kind of form batsman is in. Ball is darting around and he just presents the full face of the bat and drives it straight past the bowler, the timing and placement was exquisite from the skipper
FOUR, batsman is off the mark with a fine shot. Thampi wanted to start with a yorker, misses it by a good distance, the full toss is thumped down the ground, past the diving mid-on fielder
FOUR, edged and four. batsman won't mind that. Quicker and the ball straightens a touch, batsman goes hard on the drive and the outside edge runs away fine. A welcome boundary for team
FOUR, hit-me delivery from Smith. Short and down leg, batsman swivels and helps it over the short fine leg fielder. He's keeping the scoreboard moving swiftly

out Bowled!! The aeroplane takes off. Second wicket for Tye and what a selection he's been for team. Another biggie for the home side. A set Ben batsman departs. It was the knuckle ball from Tye, batsman did not pick it and was early into his drive, the ball catches the inside edge and deflects off the pads onto the stumps. team in a spot of bother now. batsman b bowler 25(18) [4s-2 6s-1]
FOUR, that's a half-tracker wide of off. Tiwary fetches it and shovels it wide of long-on. Jakati under pressure straightaway after an ordinary first over

out Lbw!! batsman's poor run of form continues. He's hit on the back leg as bowler slides one on with the arm and the ball would have clipped leg-stump at least. batsman wanted to cut loose here and unwinds a hefty swing looking to go downtown but was beaten on the inside edge by the slider. A good phase for Gujarat this. batsman lbw b bowler 5(8)

FOUR, nicely done. He's played this so late and so delicately, using all the pace that bowler has to offer. Darted in on a back of a length just outside off, Ankit leans back and dabs it fine of short third man
FOUR, brilliant timing. The ball races away past point. Back of a length outside off, Tiwary eases onto the back foot and punches it firmly. Good start to the over

2 runs, back of a length slower ball on middle and leg, Ankit makes room and chops it into the pitch. He's ambling across for a single as Thampi appeared to be lazy in getting to the ball, but that's only a smokescreen. Thampi quickly pounces, turns and throws and would have caught Ankit short had he hit the stumps direct. Instead, concedes an extra run

1 run, hammered back at the bowler and that's not really a chance. Props to bowler for getting his hands in position quick enough and attempt a catch but he can't hold on. It was hit powerfully. Saved a boundary really
FOUR, this time bowler can do nothing about it. Full in the slot, Ankit drills it straight down the ground and beats long-on to the right

SIX, goes down on one knee and tonks the ball straight back down the ground. Finishes a good over for team. 14 off it. bowler fires it full again, maybe aiming for the blockhole, but misses it by a fair distance and Tiwary is all over him
SIX, length and into the batsman, right in Ankit's arc to heave it over cow corner. It might have been a slower ball but Ankit picked it all right

out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! That's been skied up .. and McCullum takes a really good catch around 5 yards inside the ropes. It was there to be slogged from a length, but Ankit went through it too early and lobbed a leading edge up which surprisingly travelled quite a fair bit. McCullum skirts to his right from long-on, runs backwards and grabs it with both hands while tumbling over. batsman c Brendon McCullum b bowler 25(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Two in two. Tye has four. Slower ball at the stumps, Tiwary swings it in the air and is caught at the backward square leg boundary. Lovely deception from Tye. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 31(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Bowled!! Two hat-tricks in a day. The IPL has gone mental. Thakur has absolutely no clue as Tye dips a knuckle ball into the blockhole and he ends up playing all around it. The ball sneaks through to knock leg-stump. Tye is absolutely pumped. It's a five-for as well! batsman b bowler 0(1)

FOUR, wow! Does this man have wrists? Even the sub-continent players will be proud of this shot. Full delivery around off, batsman with his slight shuffle brings those wrists into play as he flicks it over mid-wicket. Couple of bounces and into the fence

FOUR, lovely shot! Nothing too fancy from batsman. Waited for the ball to do its bit - move away and used the width on offer to his advantage, carved it past the diving cover-point fielder and it raced across the turf

2 runs, that could have, and should have, been four in the over for Tye. Another knuckle ball, Chahar is early into the slog and miscues it to Jadeja of all people at deep mid-wicket. He puts down a simple enough chance
FOUR, greets Jakati with a whippy flick. Flatter and just outside off, batsman brings his bat down at an angle and whips it past mid-on. No chance for the deep mid-wicket fielder
SIX, glorious. Uses his feet and gets right to the pitch of the flighted delivery, once he did that the rest was easy, lofts it handsomely over the long-on fence for the first six of the game
SIX, well, batsman showing why he's been sent out to open. One, two and bang. Advances to the length delivery and swings through the line. Hit flat and over deep mid-wicket

SIX, the result though does not change. Good length ball around off, batsman lofts through the line, nice free flowing of the bat and off it went over the long-off fence. Back-to-back sixes for batsman

FOUR, the 50-run partnership is up. Rahane's wicket seems a long time ago. Pitched up and right in the slot, batsman has no half measures in his armoury, lofts it over the infield on the off-side and collects four more

FOUR.. and it is usual business from batsman at the other end. Sees the delivery in his arc and lofts it straight back over the bowler's head. Once again the full face of the bat was the key to the shot

FOUR, poor bowling this from PK. Searches for the yorker, low full toss down leg, batsman just helps it along the way, flicked behind square and there's no one in the deep to stop that. Expensive over from PK, 25 off it and team are off to a flier

out Caught by Finch!! A breezy innings comes to an end. One shot too many from batsman. Should have tried to bat a bit longer, especially with Smith at the other end. Full delivery on off, batsman makes a bit of room and lofts it to mid-off. The idea was to go over the fielder, but with the ball being too close to his bat, he did not get the elevation. Finch reverse cups it right on the edge of the circle. batsman c Finch b bowler 33(17) [4s-3 6s-2]

FOUR, errs in line and batsman is too good a player to miss out. Drifts onto the pads, batsman stays on leg-stump and glances it fine. PK at short fine dives just to please the captain, the ball had gone past him

SIX, just a pick up shot and cleared the rope by quite some distance. Bit of air on this delivery, batsman uses his long reach to get under that and sends it sailing over deep mid-wicket. Jaddu under the pump

out Caught by Finch!! Break followed by a wicket. The bowling change has worked for team. This is a huge wicket. batsman was looking in ominous touch. Short of length delivery just outside off, batsman went for the pull and top edged it towards long-off. Finch had plenty of time to settle under that and he pouches it safely. Just what team needed after the time-out and not what team required. Steven batsman was gutted with himself, smacks the bat onto his glove as he walks back. batsman c Finch b bowler 43(28) [4s-6 6s-1]
FOUR, stands tall in his crease and rockets the flat-bat smack back over the bowler, wasn't in complete control, but it had enough power to go all the way

SIX, a nice way to nail your form back. And he exhibits it with some toying around. Just crouches, takes on the line off a length sliding in and swats it flat batted. Such is the timing that it flies all the way too

FOUR, too much of a risk. But when the luck flows for you, you'd better be milking it. And batsman does it with aplomb. Sinks and without quite picking the wrong 'un slogs it hard and high. Through the hands of a diving Dhawan at the mid-wicket fence
FOUR, leans forward, takes on the short pepper head-on and mows it across the line. Not the timing but once again the placement in finding the gap to bounce it into the cow corner fence

FOUR, now he's back to his caresses. More like the batsman we know. Moves away, exposes his stumps and bowler tries his best to evade the reach with a wide yorker. Gets under it and shows the full bat face in lofting it over extra cover
FOUR, make it 14 off the over. A length angler with the width pounced on by a backing away Pandey as he imparts all the timing in spanking his punch through the covers.

FOUR, irritating runs these. batsman's edges are back to deal. Rashid gets some extra bounce on his top-spinner but all that comes in handy with batsman looking to sit and slog. The top-edge runs past the keeper

out Caught by Rashid Khan!! The luck runs out. But it's done the damage. On the shorter side, with the pace taken off the ball as well. batsman looks to go ahead with his front-footed pulls but wears it high on the bat with the face swaying upwards as well. For a change, the airy ride finds its destination in the hands of Rashid at mid-wicket. batsman c Rashid Khan b bowler 68(39) [4s-5 6s-4]

FOUR, goes full pace. Only to watch the edge bag a boundary against his name. On the back of a length and outside off as well tempting Pandey to go after it. He flashes hard and the outside tickle takes it through the cordon where no one is
SIX, the feet are on the skipping mode. Sharma does the cardinal sin of darting it in Pandey's arc and the shimmy down with the full bat swing unleashed tonks it high and mighty
FOUR, a tossed up invite. And Pathan cannot refuse. With a massive stride in getting right up to the pitch of the delivery, he nails the broom. Whistles away in front of square
SIX, a yorker missed by the slightest of margins. And Pandey punishes it to the fullest. Gets moving inwards, gets right under what ended up as a half volley and smashes it down the ground

FOUR, cheeky now. bowler persists with his yorkers. gets it right too this time. And wide as well to prevent the earlier misery. Pandey however has his bat ramped up with a crouch and guides it using all the pace on offer. Wide of backward point

out Caught by Warner!! A strike. In the form of bowler. A slower float here outside off and Pandey pretty compulsively reaches out in looking to deposit it out of the park. Is quite early on his slice and the balloon off the cue end goes high but just not long enough. A running in Warner from long-off will not put these down. Not even if he is distracted by Bipul Sharma running back from cover to take it. batsman c Warner b bowler 46(35) [4s-3 6s-2]

FOUR, misses the blockhole. Just the shot Yadav needed to help himself to his first runs. A low full toss on the pads and whipped away with those enviable wrists. The deep square boundary takes the impact

out Caught by Naman Ojha!! The umpire spots an edge. And is happy to raise the finger. Sorry, not quite the time to be mean. bowler bends his back in banging it short, and cramps Yadav all ends up for any room. Despite the shuffle coming in, the swivelling pull only gets the ping on the glove to a diving Ojha to his left. batsman c Naman Ojha b bowler 4(3) [4s-1]

SIX, spoiling his figures. A perfect sitting up length delivery right in the slot and Pathan is in his beast mode unleashing the entire bat curve bringing it down off a massive backlift and spanks it high and mighty

out Bowled!! A mess of the stumps. The pin-point yorker comes out at full pace and Grandhomme without bothering to move his feet just jams his bat down. No connection at all. The off-pole is uprooted. Kolkata just not getting the move-on they'd aspired. batsman b bowler 0(2)

out Bowled!! The off-stump goes flying. Bhuvi has had a fantastic bowling record over team and it only gets better. It swings in the air, lands on the seam and shapes just enough to uproot batsman's off-pole. The slash-flash batsman had no clue about that one. By the time the ball dipped in, batsman opened himself up completely and embarassed himself. batsman b bowler 6(9) [4s-1]
FOUR, plenty of room on offer and batsman has nailed the cover-drive to perfection, pierced the gap between cover and extra-cover
FOUR, drifting into the pads, batsman shuffles a fraction before helping it to the fine leg fence. Easy!
FOUR, stands deep inside his crease and exerts all his power on the punchy-drive, gets it past a diving mid-off to his right
SIX, gets underneath this one and lauches it over long-on, picked the length early and was helped with some width on offer
1 run, flicks to square leg and rushes for a non-existent single. Dhawan aims at the bowler's end and misses, had that hit batsman was a goner. He is living dangerously here

out Bowled!! Got him! bowler does it again, he has taken wicket off the first over in every game he played. That's some record. batsman exposes all his stumps looking to cut it square, the quicker one skids on and pings the bails in a flash. batsman slaps his bat onto his pad as he walks back in disgust. batsman b bowler 15(16) [4s-2]
SIX, stand and deliver! Uses those Popeye-esque arms to smash a pull off the front foot, sheer power! It has gone flying into the mid-wicket stands
SIX, sits back and smites a half-tracker over wide long-on, he is making the most of his luck today

FOUR, width on offer outside off. batsman chases it with a slash and gets a fat outside edge. The ball flies past the slip fielder and races away past the ropes. Hits the laptop in the team dugout. Probably, the one that of the statsman
FOUR, delicacy from batsman! It was a off-cutter which sat up on the pitch, he uses the width and sends it open-bat faced into the vacant third man region

out Caught&Bowled!! Things looking bleak for team. 3 of their main batsmen are back in the hut now. No change of pace this time around, he spears it in at 136ks on a good length, batsman checks his drive and chips it back to the bowler. Easily done. He was perhaps expecting the slower one. It came right off the cue end of the bat. batsman c and b bowler 13(10) [4s-2]
FOUR, stands tall on his back foot and delivers a perfect pull does Yuvi, picked the right spot to place it too. No-one at deep mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes
SIX, advances, gets right to the pitch of the delivery and hacks him over wide long-on. Nailed!

SIX, I hate to do commentary on balls like these. Coz, all you want to do is stand, admire and applaud the class of Yuvi. Wowza! Holds the pose for the cameras as he powers a mere extension of the arms on this 141ks pace cranker
FOUR, effortlessly done. Short and down leg, he half-swivels and puts it over short fine with a twirl of his wrists
FOUR, backs away to manufacture the desired room, cuts the length ball in the gap behind point. Smart cricket

out Stumped!! Nah, not again! Looks to fancy his chances against the wily bowler. Not to the pitch and was caught miles short. 83ks, lands on the seam and moves the other way round and beats batsman neck and crop. Uthappa does the rest. He was looking to go over long-on/mid-wicket. Booming bat swing, but no dice. batsman st Uthappa b bowler 13(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

SIX. That's dismissive. Precise, mathematic middle of the bat. No feet, allows his wrists to take over. The gift of timing. Flat-footed, takes on the short and wide ball, thumps it flat over extra cover. Fetch that!
FOUR, batsman likes the short stuff, he likes pace too. No wonder he's from Brisbane. Rocks a touch back and then smashes the pull through mid-wicket, raced away...

out Caught by (sub)Rishi Dhawan!! And look what that extra delivery has done, it has fetched team the much-needed wicket. Yuvi walks back disappointed and has been asked to wait by the umpires. Oh hang on! What's the wait for? Just a little confusion out there and Yuvi continues his march. It was a slower short ball, Yuvi was through the shot way too early, didn't get hold of the pull and holes out to long-on. Good running catch from the sub fielder. batsman c (sub)Rishi Dhawan b bowler 26(16) [4s-2 6s-2]
SIX, that's in his half and batsman has clubbed that straight back over the bowler. Clears his front leg, gets underneath and goes bam!

out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The Kiwi combination does the trick. The ever-smiling bowler can smile a little more now. batsman shuffles a long way across his stumps, premeditates the slog straight down the ground and makes a mess of the connection. Outcome? He tumbles after the half-hearted execution and it goes flat and straight to the man at long-off. batsman c de Grandhomme b bowler 15(10) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, quick-feeted this time, does just enough to pick the length and marmalize it over team's dugout at the long-off area
FOUR, takes his eyes off and pulls a short ball. Top-edge flies over the keeper's head, all these runs count
FOUR, full and angled in, Bipul stays leg-side of the delivery and biffs it straight, long-on and long-off can't cut it off. Too good

1 run, catch it is the cry, but Woakes can't hold onto it. That came in at a rapid pace. Once again, batsman gives the charge and this time he slashes it off the middle of the bat. The Englishman at cover-point dived to his right and half-stopped it. Saved three runs there
FOUR, stand and deliver. batsman stays in his crease, sees the shortish ball come to him and lifts it over mid-on. He stood there and admired his shot

FOUR, not off the middle , but batsman won't mind. A length ball on middle and leg, batsman moves across and swishes it away. Finds the gap on the on-side and the ball races away into the mid-wicket fence
FOUR, that's not the greatest of deliveries from bowler! Short ball that sits up nicely for batsman to pull it firmly behind square on the on-side

FOUR, first boundary for batsman! That was a good ball from bowler. He bowled a sharp bouncer attacking the head of the batsman. batsman, who almost took his eye off it, wasn't afraid to go with his hook shot. Came right off the middle of the middle in the end. One bounce into the fence
FOUR, four more! bowler pitches it up this time. batsman presses forward and checks his drive. The ball falls wide and short of GG at covers and the ball rolls into the extra cover fence
FOUR, easy to put away. Drifting down leg, all batsman had to do was get a tickle, which he did. No chance for the man at 45 to stop that
FOUR, shot! Typical batsman! Reverses his stance and wallops the sweep over backward point. With both the deep fielders on the on-side, that's an excellent shot

out Caught by de Grandhomme!! That's a soft dismissal. The ploy of giving Pathan the ball has worked. That ball didn't deserve a wicket to be honest. It was floated outside off, batsman waltzes down, moving slightly leg-side and chips it towards de Grandhomme at long-off, who runs forward and pouches it. There was no intent there from the southpaw there. batsman c de Grandhomme b bowler 23(22) [4s-4]
FOUR, tossed up delivery outside off, not much of spin there and batsman latches onto it. He smacks the cut behind square on the off-side. The sweeper can't get there

out Caught by Woakes!! This was coming. batsman was struggling against the spinners and perishes trying to play the big shot. A tossed up delivery that pitched outside off and turned further away. batsman got low and wanted to clear long-off. Doesn't get enough power behind it and a straightforward catch from Woakes at long-off. Lots of revs on that delivery. batsman c Woakes b bowler 26(30) [4s-4]

FOUR, no, no. Wrong line Sandeep, searches for that banana swing. In the process, sprays it on the pads, the fine leg was inside the ring and easy put away for batsman. Just nurdles it past the man at 45
FOUR, candyfloss. Cracking shot from batsman. Leans forward and caresses it through the packed off-side field. Eventful start for DD

FOUR, not where he exactly intended but he will earn a boundary. batsman gets off the mark with a boundary. Mohit bangs it short, batsman was committed to the pull, was hustled by pace, manages to get it off the higher part of his bat and skews it over mid-on
FOUR, make that two in a row. Mohit goes shorter again, batsman is bred on English soil. Too easy for him, pulls it wide of mid-on. No need to run for those

FOUR, with mid-wicket inside the ring, the pull is a safe shot. That is if you get it right. batsman was almost cramped for room, but got the pull high on the bat and placed it to the left of mid-wicket. No chance for long-on to cut it off

out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! Catching practice for Morgan. Another partnership that had started to flourish is nipped in the bud. Not the greatest of shots from Iyer. It was a length delivery alright and he wanted to loft it over the long-on fence, the bat turned on impact and the ball went up towards long-on. Second catch for the England ODI skipper. batsman c Eoin Morgan b bowler 22(17) [4s-3]

1 run, fifty for batsman. Raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from the home crowd. Still a long way to go for him. The pitch has started to get slower and run making is not going to be easy. With him being set, DD would want him to carry on. Coming to the ball: Plays the slower delivery with soft hands into the off-side ring and jogs across to the other end
FOUR, bowler almost deceived his man. Saw the batsman advance and pushed it wider, batsman reached out and lofted it inside out, not off the meat of the bat but had enough to collect a boundary

out Caught by Miller!! The small little things that you do produce the bigger things. That Vohra stop kept batsman on strike and what happens next? The Kent man miscues a loft to long-on. Takes a couple of steps down, not close to the ball but still goes through with the loft. Right off the toe-end and almost had enough to clear Miller, who set himself up right on the edge of the circle and clasped it. batsman c Miller b bowler 55(40) [4s-9]

FOUR, long-off had around 10 yards to cover and he couldn't get there. That is the power of batsman. Races down the wicket and gets to the pitch of the ball, lofts it hard and over extra cover, one bounce and into the fence

no run, almost thumped it back to bowler. Flatter offie around, Anderson hangs back and punches it straight down the wicket, did not keep it down the ground, bowler is late to react, the ball hits his upper part of his hand and goes to ground. Tough chance but should have been taken
FOUR, wow! Width offered and batsman is all over it. There was a deep cover fielder and he beat him to his right. Short as well and batsman slaps it in front of square, raced away to the fence

FOUR, even the mishits are going to the fence, thanks to some sloppy work by Morgan. Short and turning away, batsman pulls and the bottom hand comes off the handle, the ball goes to wide long-on, where Morgan allows it to escape

out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! Done in for pace. An important wicket for team. batsman was looking to get on with proceedings. Short and angled across off, pulling against the angle is always dangerous, batsman takes it on and splices it towards mid-off. Morgan might be having a rough day with his ground fielding, but not with his catching. Accepts the dolly with ease. batsman c Eoin Morgan b bowler 15(9) [4s-3]

FOUR, lovely! No fancy shots from Morris. He uses bowler's extra pace to his advantage, stays leg-side of the short of length delivery, opens the bat face and directs it behind square on the off-side, split backward point and short third man expertly

FOUR, Anderson reminding everyone that he has the second fastest ODI hundred. The extra delivery costing bowler four runs. Length delivery right in the slot, Anderson slams it straight down the ground. Almost knocked the umpire off

SIX, that's how you cash in. Something for Billings to learn. 95kph slower delivery and Morris picked the bones out of that one, delayed his shot and that allowed it him to send it sailing over long-on. That gets the crowd going as well

FOUR, round the wicket and dishes in a full toss, the idea was to nail the yorker, missed and Anderson slices it over the infield on the off-side. The fielder was at deep cover and even though the ball plugged in the outfield, he couldn't get there

out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Huge wicket this, especially at this stage of the innings. Morris blasted a 9-ball 38 in the previous game against team, coming in at this stage. Short of a length delivery and Morris pulls, he does not bother to keep it down, was planning to clear the fielder. But since it was off the bottom of the bat, it has no wings to fly over Mohit at deep square. batsman c Mohit Sharma b bowler 16(8) [4s-1 6s-1]

SIX, bowler became predictable there. He was targeting Anderson's pads, missed his length and the Kiwi got underneath that, swung it over the long leg fence and the short Kotla boundaries took care of the rest

SIX, it was a gamble and it didn't pay off. Darted in on a shortish length, Anderson sets himself up with the front leg cleared, muscles it towards long-on. Maxwell leaps as high as possible, but couldn't even get a finger on it
FOUR, handy runs these for DD. Not a bad delivery by any means. The wide yorker outside off, Cummins crouches low, opens the bat face and steers it past the diving backward point fielder
FOUR, yorker followed by a slow short of length delivery, Cummins was waiting for that, he stayed on the back foot and pulled it in front of square, bisected deep mid-wicket and long-on to perfection
FOUR, switches to round the wicket for Anderson, misses the yorker by a few inches, Anderson smashes the low full toss straight down the ground. No chance for long-on or long-off
FOUR, you don't often see a batsman play sweep shot to a fast bowler. Let's call this batsman special. Buries on one knee and sweeps it fiercely behind square. Races away to the fence in a jiffy

SIX, Anderson ends the innings in style. Slower short of length delivery, sat up nicely for Anderson, who waits for it and pulls it to deep square leg. The ball teased the fielder, but he could only palm it over the rope
FOUR, wow. That was hammered ferociously. batsman charges down the track and smacks it down the ground
FOUR, batsman is teeing off like a golfer. Uses his feet again, stays a bit leg sidish this time. Fetches the heave from off and directs it through mid-wicket

FOUR, three in a row. Problems aplenty for bowler. Just not getting his line right. Slants it on the pads, fine leg was inside the ring and batsman will put it away seven days a week and twenty four hours a day. Flicks it past short fine
SIX, caps off the over with a stinker. Short ball sat up nicely for batsman, he gets on top of it and nails the pull over wide long-on. Just about clears the fence
1 run, rushes it through outside off, batsman goes deep in his crease and pats it softly to cover

out Caught by Eoin Morgan!! First wicket for bowler in IPL 2017. Has struck in his first over. Tosses it up this time, the ball dips in a touch. batsman plays down the wrong line, gets a leading edge that ballons up straight to long-off. Morgan ain't dropping those.batsman c Eoin Morgan b bowler 19(18) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Caught by Saha!! That's an excellent catch from Saha. Credit to Varun, kept persisting it with short pitch stuff and it pays off. After conceding 13 runs in his first over, he shows great courage and picks up a wicket. It was short and drifting down leg, batsman, in a bid to tickle it fine, gloves it to the left of Saha. He flings and settles under it. batsman c Saha b bowler 0(3)
FOUR, streaky but he won't mind. bowler sees the batsman back away and hurls it full outside off, batsman throws his bat and gets a thickish outside edge that flies through the vacant slip region
FOUR, top shot from Iyer. Sees the leg-break early, lunges across, opens the bat face and steers it past point. The fielder in the deep gets across and puts in a dive but in vain
FOUR, easy-peasy for Iyer. Vrooming down leg, Iyer gets inside the line and tickles it fine

FOUR, brilliant placement from Iyer. Bisects two men in the deep to perfection. Showing a piece of geometry that would put Euclid to shame. bowler strays it on the pads again, Iyer gets right behind it and clips it behind square

out Lbw!! Shahbaz bowler strikes in his very first over. He's having a wonderful season. The umpire took his time before raising the dreaded finger. Did that pitch in line? Yes, it did and spun away. batsman gets down on one knee and in his attempt to lap it fine, misses it completely. He is pinged on the thigh pad in front of middle and leg. HawkEye confirms that would have hit the leg-pole. Good decision from the umpire. batsman lbw b bowler 3(6)

out Caught by Nair!! He's cut that straight to backward point this time. That's a big blow. Morgan was starting to find some fluency but he now finds the fielder. Short and wide from Cummins, Morgan goes hard but fails to keep it down and it's straight to Karun Nair. batsman c Nair b bowler 22(20) [4s-3]

out Caught by Billings!! Is that the game for DD? The in-form batsman is gone for a duck. Too much pressure really. He had to tee off from the word go with the required rate touching 13, and bowler isn't the most straightforward bloke to take on first up. He cleverly bowls it a little wide of off forcing batsman to reach out for his slog-sweep and it comes right off the bottom. It's a top-edge too. Simple catch for Billings at deep mid-wicket. batsman c Billings b bowler 0(2)
SIX, gosh, that's big from Patel. Way back into the stands. bowler turns one into him this time, Patel goes down quickly and picks the bones out of the slog-sweep. Elevation as well as the distance
FOUR, his first boundary today and it's come off a thick inside edge past short fine. Anderson bowls this in the blockhole just outside off, batsman jams down on it and squirts it away past leg-stump
1 run, is that a dropped catch? It looks like it. Another very full ball, batsman crashes it to the right of cover where Zaheer goes across low with both hands but fails to hold on

out Lbw!! batsman's painful stay at the crease has ended through a full toss. Anderson gets some tail on the delivery and swirls it in on middle, and batsman plays all around it. His head fell over too. The ball crashes into the back leg on the full. Just one of those days for batsman. Never found any timing whatsoever. batsman lbw b bowler 24(28) [4s-1]

2 runs, bowler only had to gather that and Mohit was gone. But the throw landed very close to him making it difficult. Knuckle ball outside off, Patel punches it through backward point and calls his partner back for two despite the fielder swooping in quickly
FOUR, short and wide, Patel slashes and slashes hard. The edge flies away through to the third man boundary

FOUR, he's unwittingly sliced that over short third man. A knuckle ball outside off, Mohit throws his hands at it, the bat-face opens on impact and the ball beautifully lobs over the infield. A bit of a helicopter from Mohit too

SIX, drills this straight back down the ground. Anderson misses out on the blockhole by a few inches and is hammered by Patel. He's playing a good little knock here. But this chase is beyond his powers
SIX, another slower ball perhaps? Patel picks it up and nails it over long-on. He's been hitting them really well today
1 run, dabs a short of length off-cutter straight to short third man. They impetuously run across for a non-existent single. Mohit had given up. No direct hit though

out Bowled!! Off the pads and into leg-stump. Cummins followed Mohit with a full ball as he backed away a touch. The delivery is too quick for Mohit. He misses his swipe through mid-wicket and the ball deflects off the pad to knock over the timber. batsman b bowler 13(14) [4s-1]

out Bowled!! Similar technique from batsman - backing away to swish through off. But Morris does him with a yorker. It's too quick for batsman. The ball bursts through to crash into the base of middle. batsman b bowler 1(2)

FOUR, in the air and that's the first boundary of the innings! The knuckle ball on a shortish length, batsman walks down the track and pulls it over mid-wicket. There is no one in the deep and the ball races away

out Bowled!! The leg-bail flies off its groove and that's the game for Delhi. Massive win. Morris causes Patel to go through with the slog too early as he holds it back in pace and the deception is good enough to fetch him his third for the night. batsman b bowler 44(29) [4s-1 6s-3]
FOUR, shot! Perhaps, a safe shot. Stands tall, waits for the ball to come to him and launches this short of a good length delivery over mid-off. One bounce and into the fence
FOUR, flat and slightly short, batsman backs away and carves it over point. Two fielders chase, but can't chase it down

out Caught by Zaheer!! Zaheer takes a catch and claims it. The umpires decide to go up and the soft signal is out. It was darted in on off, batsman danced down, moved leg-side and went for the inside-out shot. Couldn't get enough elevation on that and finds Zak at extra cover. The ball was dipping when it approached him, but Zaheer had both his hands underneath the ball. Second wicket for Shahbaz bowler. Now, it's all down to the four foreign recruits for team to make a match out of this. batsman c Zaheer b bowler 7(5) [4s-1]

FOUR, beautiful shot! See the ball, hit the ball, is the mantra. A round-armish delivery from bowler, batsman who has taken leg-stump guard, has enough room to free his arms. Strokes it over and wide of mid-off to collect his third boundary
FOUR, wow! Elegant. batsman shuffles across a long way and flicks this full ball around off very fine. No chance for the man at short fine leg. The ball reached the fence in a hurry

out Caught by Billings!! Would you believe that? batsman perishes to a full toss. There was one fielder in the deep on the leg-side and batsman finds him perfectly. A low full toss on the pads, batsman with a slight shuffle, flicks it in the air and hits it straight down the throat of Billings at long leg. Punjab in a spot of bother. batsman c Billings b bowler 19(12) [4s-4]

1 run, ah! A direct hit there at the striker's end would have been curtains to Eoin Morgan! batsman taps this length ball to covers with soft hands and sets off. Billings chases it down and fires in a throw quickly. Misses the target just by a few inches
FOUR, shot! Shortish ball that sits up nicely for Morgan to thwack the pull from outside off. Found the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket and the result was a boundary
FOUR, a boundary for team after 24 balls. Morgan clears the front leg and spears a full ball through extra-cover. Mid-off was up in the ring and he just had to find the gap
FOUR, Morgan again. This time it's short and wide and Morgan slaps it hard through point. It beats the diving fielder inside the ring as well as the one at the boundary

out Caught by Nitish Rana!! The dangerous one is gone and the crowd go wild. bowler is delighted. Smith sees the width outside off on this short of length delivery and slashes hard. Doesn't get enough elevation and finds Nitish Rana at backward point, who jumps and takes a good catch. Smith departs without troubling the scorers. batsman c Nitish Rana b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, and batsman takes full toll of the free-hit. Bends his back knee and crunches the cover drive wide of the diving extra cover fielder. Once it cleared him, there was none stopping that
no ball, FOUR, bowler oversteps and bowls a length ball on middle and leg. batsman shuffles across and tucks it very fine. The short fine leg fielder is pretty fine as well. Free-hit coming up

1 run, fifty for McCullum. A very unlike McCullum innings this. Waves his bat around and is congratulated by his skipper. Looked scratchy to start off and has slowly found his bearings. team would want him to continue. Flatter and on off, worked to deep square leg

1 run, direct hit and McCullum would have been on his bike. batsman punched this towards extra cover, where Suchith got a good bounce and it was to his strong hand as well. Fires a throw at the striker's end and fails to hit the stumps. McCullum was stretching and would have been touch and go

out Caught by Rohit!! This was on the cards. batsman kept charging down to the spinners without much success, but he didn't stop trying. Shimmies down and bowler being a clever bowler, tosses it up well outside off, batsman has to reach out for the inside out loft, all he could manage was a slice towards cover-point. Rohit tracks back and takes it over his head while tumbling. Good take that by the team skipper. batsman c Rohit b bowler 28(29) [4s-2]
SIX, a gift which McCullum accepts with pleasure. Full toss just below the waist, McCullum maintains a low base and helps it along the way, over long leg for a maximum
FOUR, McCullum has had the wood over bowler in this innings. Continues to collect runs off the Sri Lankan. Full and down leg, McCullum tickles it very fine. No chance for Bumrah in the deep

out Bowled!! That roar and fist pump says it all. Just takes one delivery for bowler to change the tide. A fine knock from McCullum comes to an end. Battled hard and has built a platform for his lower-order. Straight delivery, McCullum plays all round it, the ball sneaks through bat and pad to hit middle stump. Two set batsmen gone and team keeping the lid over team. batsman b bowler 64(44) [4s-6 6s-3]

SIX, 200th six this edition. And we are just into the 11th day. Improvisation at its best. batsman moves across his stumps and gets underneath the back of a length delivery, uses the pace of Hardik and scoops it over the fine leg fence
no ball, FOUR, poor from bowler. First, he oversteps and the yorker is way outside off, batsman stays low and drives it square on the off-side. No chance for the sweeper this time around
FOUR, bowler has not get his radar right on his yorkers. A low full toss down leg, Kishan is almost down on his knee and swipes it behind square. McClenaghan at fine leg had no chance to cut that off

FOUR, this is an ordinary over from bowler. 19 runs off it and he like Malinga has been expensive today. Full toss on the pads, batsman says thank you very much and flicks it behind square leg. The man was up inside the ring and the ball was well away from him

SIX, he is a small man but when he hits them, he certainly packs a punch. Short of length delivery angled across off, batsman goes deep inside the crease and pulls it over deep mid-wicket. Flat and all the way. 50-run stand and 150 up for team

out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Something for the 18000 kids to cheer about. bowler has provided the breakthrough. Kishan has been asked to wait by Ravi. The front leg is fine. Legal delivery that and Ravi raises his finger. The back of the hand slower ball dug in short, Kishan takes it on and top edges it to deep square leg. Krunal misjudged it for a second, but recovered well to pouch it. batsman c Krunal Pandya b bowler 11(14) [4s-1]

SIX, why was batsman held back? Can someone tell me? Such power and timing he possesses. This was more power and the ball cleared Pollard with ease. bowler misses the yorker length and batsman gets under that, though a miscue the ball still goes over long-on with ease. A rare off-day for bowler, finishes with: 4-0-51-1
FOUR, low full toss and batsman thumps it down the ground. Goes deep and leg-side to free his arms, with mid-off in the ring, he just had to place it wide of him, which he does and collects four
FOUR, short ball and McCullum latches onto it! No pace behind that delivery to trouble. He waits this slower delivery to come to him and pulls it away wide of the man at 45
FOUR, trademark McCullum shot! Dances down to a fast bowler and thwacks this length ball down the ground. No chance for the bowler and the ball reaches the fence in a hurry

SIX, wow! He made that look easy. McCullum waltzes down and bowler shortens his length. But there was enough width outside off for McCullum his free his arms. He expertly elevates over the point region and it has enough wings to go all the way
SIX, shot! It's the slower ball from bowler and McCullum picks the bones out of it. Waits for it to come to him and muscles it over mid-wicket. Second maximum of the over
FOUR, another flighted delivery, not much of turn and McCullum brooms it away through mid-wicket. The man in the deep couldn't get there
FOUR, ends the over with a poor ball. Darts it short, McCullum rockets back and pulls it fiercely through the mid-wicket region
FOUR, one bounce into the fence! Gets down on one leg and middles the slog sweep. Found the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket to perfection

out Caught by Roy!! Parthiv goes for a blob. Praveen Kumar is effective with the new ball and once again he gets the breakthrough. Good seam presentation on this good length delivery. It pitches on middle and jags away off the track. Parthiv gets a leading edge looking to work it through the on-side and finds point. Jason Roy collects it in his third attempt. batsman c Roy b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, top shot to get off the mark! Of course, he was helped by Praveen. Drifting down leg, Rana dances down and flicks it over short fine and the ball bullets away into the fence
FOUR, stand and deliver! No need to run for shots like that. Length ball that sits up nicely for Rana stand tall and drill it wide of the bowler. No chance for mid-on

1 run, dropped! Jason Roy has put down a dolly. The pacy short ball catches Rana by surprise. He still persists with his pull shot and gets it off the top part of the willow. The ball balloons up on the leg-side. Roy, at mid-wicket, runs back, settles under it and makes a mess of it. Thampi can't believe it. He has to wait for his first IPL wicket

out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! First IPL game after three years and Munaf has his first wicket. And it is a vital breakthrough. Another start and another stutter for batsman. His rope is coming to an end, especially with Simmons waiting in the wings. Short of a length delivery, batsman pulls and gets it high on the bat, straight down McCullum's throat at long-on. Replays show that it was a slower ball - the leg-cutter and batsman had to manufacture all the pace, which he couldn't. batsman c Brendon McCullum b bowler 26(24) [4s-1 6s-2]

FOUR, that should get him going. First boundary for batsman this edition. Short and wide delivery, batsman hangs back and relies on placing the ball, cuts it between backward point and short third man

FOUR, Munaf is not a happy man. Short and wide outside off, batsman cuts it over backward point, where the fielder did not make any effort to catch the ball. He might have lost it in the background. Jadeja was the fielder and he simply stood his ground
SIX, 120kph slower short of length delivery, sat up nicely for batsman, who pulls it off the front foot, struck it flat and over the wide long-on fence

SIX, just a lift and off it goes over the long-on fence. For the first time in the over Smith pitches it up, batsman nonchalantly puts it over long-on. Just an extension of the arm and the ball flew away

FOUR, goes back to the shortish length and takes the pace off as well, batsman pulls and is a touch early into the shot, the bottom hand comes off but the ball is in the gap, wide of deep mid-wicket and four more
SIX, lovely shot! This is batsman Sharma we all know. Flighted on off, he makes a bit of room to go inside out and connects handsomely, the ball crosses the boundary cushion by a metre or so
1 run, as expected starts with a slower delivery outside off, batsman drives to sweeper cover

SIX, just over a leaping McCullum at long-off. Short of length delivery outside off, batsman flat-bats it straight back over Tye, McCullum standing at straightish long-off, jumps up and couldn't even get a finger

FOUR, a pick up shot and that has almost gone the distance. Angled in on off and middle, batsman flicks it away powerfully. Roy like McCullum was straight at long-on, he can only pick the ball up from the boundary rope

1 run, run-out chance and Kishan hits the stump mic instead of the stumps. batsman was a goner. Thampi nails the wide yorker, batsman digs it to point and sets off for the single, no response from Rohit and he had to turn back, well short with a direct hit. No one backing up and the duo eventually get the single

out Caught by Jadeja!! Not over, yet. Still need 17 runs off 11 balls. Credit must go to Thampi for bowling a tight 18th over. batsman had to take the risk and he perishes while doing so. Full and slow, on middle and leg, since there was no pace, batsman could not gather momentum on the flick, skies it towards deep mid-wicket, Jadeja won't drop those. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 39(23) [4s-2 6s-3]

FOUR, streaky, but team won't mind. The knuckle ball on a fuller length, Hardik had the width to free his arms, throws everything he's got and squirts it off the outside edge behind point, right between backward point and short third man

FOUR, that must surely do it. Praveen looks befuddled. He comes round the wicket and bowls a low full toss on the stumps, batsman moves across, crouches low, almost on one knee and paddles it fine. With the fielder inside the ring, that was a smart shot
FOUR, much needed boundary for team! Length ball on middle and leg, batsman moves across and flicks it effortlessly backward of square on the on-side and collects his first boundary

SIX, wow! That's a batsman special. Easily done. Short of a good length delivery on off, batsman moves across, still has the eyes on the ball and scoops it over the keeper's head. Improvisation at its best

SIX, shot! That's Raina-esque. Slower ball outside off. Overpitched as well, Rana crouches low and creams the lofted cover drive over extra cover. It came right off the sweet portion of the bat and the ball goes the distance
SIX, one of the best shots of the day! Short ball at a decent pace, Rana has no trouble in pulling it over square leg for a maximum. He absolutely middled it
FOUR, wow! That went like a bullet into the fence. Short and wide outside off, Rana jumps and flashes it hard. The ball flies through the point region and races away
FOUR, what a way to get to yout fifty! Second half-century this season. He cuts the shortish ball outside off and pierces the gap between backward point and short third man
SIX, wow! 15 runs off the over and team are surely ahead at this stage. Right in the slot for batsman to swing his bat. He prods forward and thumps it over long-on for a huge six

out Caught by Karthik!! batsman has done his job here. End of a fine knock. The knuckle ball from Tye does the trick. Rana wanted to cut hard and all he managed was a faint tickle. The man with the mitts gobbles it up and the umpire spotted the feather. batsman c Karthik b bowler 53(36) [4s-4 6s-2]

SIX, my word, how well has he timed that! bowler appeared to have deceived batsman with a cutter and batsman had to really reach out for it. But his wristwork is a work of genius. He somehow manages to whip the ball away over the deep square leg boundary. Fantastic shot

FOUR, he's checked this shot down the ground but it still races away off the middle. Back of a length and wide of off, batsman thinks about a cut but changes his mind midway and just jabs it back. The ball was in the air but Thakur can't get down quick enough because it absolutely raced away

no run, Tiwary drops batsman. Oh you can't do that. Thakur hits the pitch hard on a back of a length outside off, batsman dangles a horizontal bat and edges it for a simple catch to first slip where Tiwary makes a meal of it

out Caught by Dhoni!! Another chance, and this time there's no mistake. But it's batsman, and not Kohli. Not too dissimilar from that Kohli chance actually. It's a bit short, a bit wide, batsman has a swish at it but he's done in by extra bounce. Simple catch. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 0(3)

out Stumped!! Oh what a ball. What a ball. He tosses this on off, gets it to dip on AB to draw him out of the crease and then turns it right across him for the stumping. This is a brilliant piece of leg-spin bowling. AB was ambitiously trying to flick this through mid-wicket but he's beaten in flight and length. Dhoni, quick as ever, hardly takes any time to whip those bails off. That's lightning glovework. This is on. batsman st Dhoni b bowler 29(30) [4s-1 6s-2]

out Bowled!! Jadhav's dragged on. Time was running away and he had to do something, so he gallops down the pitch with an almighty swing but the ball takes a long time to arrive. He's forced to reach out for it outside off, gets a thick inside edge and plays it onto leg-stump. batsman b bowler 18(22)

FOUR, pace on the ball from bowler and he's been put away. That's not how Thakur and Unadkat were bowling. It skids on nicely from a back of a length for batsman and he flays it through backward point

FOUR, it took 39 balls for team to get a boundary. And now they've got two in three. Slower ball banged into the pitch outside off, this time batsman gets stuck into it and slashes it into the extra-cover boundary

out Bowled!! Got him. And that's the big one. It's the slower ball again which does the trick. team have read this pitch like a book. bowler takes the pace off, bangs it on a back of a length and the ball dips underneath batsman as he tries to heave it away. The middle stump is floored. batsman b bowler 14(18) [4s-1]

SIX, batsman nails this one into the crowd. The slower ball from bowler drifted into his hips, sat up to be put away, and batsman flogged it a long way over long leg. Don't think we're getting the ball back. Someone's taking it home. Ball change required
FOUR, normal pace short ball, batsman swings into a pull and it takes a thick top-edge to fly over the wicketkeeper. team just about stay in it

SIX, well, well .. don't go anywhere. This partnership has raced away to 22 off 9. Thakur deviates from the slower ball strategy, bowls it full and wide of off and batsman spanks him over mid-off. That's gone all the way. Flat six

out Caught by Tripathi!! That's gone straight up. Who wants it? Tripathi is the one settling under it at deep mid-wicket, and he takes it neatly. A real skier. Slower ball which extracts spongy bounce and takes a thick top-edge as batsman slogs. Second for Thakur. batsman c Tripathi b bowler 10(7) [6s-1]

1 run, what an effort from Stokes. This is stunning fielding. He's actually caught the ball and has control over it, but he doesn't have control over his weight which is causing him to fall over the ropes. So he has to flick it back in - does so incredibly, through his legs. Lots of height from batsman on the slog, fair amount of distance too. Stokes's foot is stationed just a foot inside the ropes at wide long-on, he takes it overhead, and flicks it in. They just take a single

out Bowled!! The middle stump has been planted into its grave. That might be it as far as team's hopes go. batsman moves a mile to the off-side and Thakur keeps it full and straight and fast. batsman b bowler 18(8) [4s-2 6s-1]
1 run, slower back of a length delivery on middle, batsman glances it to short fine leg. Badree was struggling had Thakur hit direct

out Bowled!! Floors middle stump yet again. Has he stepped up today or what?! Exceptional from bowler, and even Shardul. He's slowed this up beautifully and batsman is through his slog too early. batsman b bowler 0(1)

out Bowled!! Bang on top of off-stump. These bowlers are helping themselves to some good wickets here. Three for bowler now. Cuts his fingers across the ball while bowling it into the pitch, it doesn't bounce as much as batsman wants. Right under his swipe. batsman b bowler 2(3)
FOUR, what a start from AB! He smokes this off the back foot past backward point. Short and wide from Thakur, and a player of AB's class won't miss out
SIX, he's hit that straight into the stage where a display car is kept. He sat on that slower ball. It was a touch on the shorter side, AB is quick to rock back before mowing it over wide long-on

FOUR, the edge just eludes a flying Stokes at backward point. Nice and full from Thakur, drawing batsman across into a drive. The ball holds its line slightly to take a thick outside edge. Such a good effort from Stokes. Can't get a hand though
FOUR, batsman walks at Thakur who bowls a slower ball on middle and leg. That's batsman's bread and butter shot. A beautiful wristy flick through mid-wicket fetches him another boundary

out Caught by Rahane!! bowler has batsman. That's a really sharp short ball. batsman was on the move down the pitch, bowler bangs it in and gets it around head high. batsman still doesn't back down. He has a big swish at it and probably caught it right off the bottom of the bat. It slices up in the air for a simple catch to Rahane at sweeper cover. Another wicket, especially of AB, and things will get really interesting. batsman c Rahane b bowler 28(19) [4s-3 6s-1]
SIX, bowler flights it up and AB immediately clatters him over long-off. Just got the length wrong there. It was a bit too full outside off. Still, it's a superb shot as AB had to reach out
FOUR, a full toss. First up. Dictates terms right away does batsman with a lean forward in whipping it through the on-side. Quite a warm up this
FOUR, decides to take matters into the leg-side. Reaches out to the pitch of the delivery and forces it with a dragging slog bisecting the men guarding cow corner

SIX, whoa. The beast mode is out. And the ball has been tonked into one of the metros going around. batsman is back to his earlier avatar of galloping down to spinners and just swings the bat keeping it as straight as possible. Laced over long-on. Has to be the biggest of this season
FOUR, a wasted delivery. Well down leg and all batsman has to do with these is get some wood. And he gets a whole chunk on it. Flicks it away off his pads

FOUR, a real sitter. Quite a nothing delivery this from bowler. Neither full nor short enough. Gives batsman all the time to open himself up and spot the area to place this angry pull of his. Decides it would be cow corner to take the brunt

FOUR, the edges spoil the over. The scrambled leg-cutter this from Watto with a hint of width as well. batsman gets his drive around 90-degrees finer than he had planned. Off the outside edge and through the vacant cordon

out Bowled!! Plays it on. And it is the age-old trick of firing in the yorkers that does the trick. batsman loads himself up for a version of his helicopter. But the ball is just wide enough to kiss the inside edge and ricochet to make a real mess of the timber. A much needed pull back into the contest for team - a contest that could well have gone outside the park. batsman b bowler 28(25) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Bowled!! Two in a row. And is both the batsmen who'd done all the hard work in setting themselves up for the final slog. bowler comes back with an off-cutter and keeps the aim up and right on the money. Stays much lower as well. Through the defences and under the early pull to light up the zing bails once again. batsman b bowler 27(24) [4s-3]

out Caught by Mandeep!! They are falling apart. Three wickets in the span of six balls. All the momentum that seemed to have drifted Pune's way has surely been redirected via the national highway to Bangalore. A fullish delivery this and full-paced as well for a change. batsman executes the clip but fails to keep it down. Doesn't get it high enough either. The middle path treaded takes the lob into the safe palms of deep square leg. batsman c Mandeep b bowler 1(3)

out Bowled!! The stumps just keep flying. The heart of Pune being ripped apart here. And so is this innings. A length delivery assumed to be in the slot for the slog here from batsman. He lines up neatly and does everything right in swinging his ba putting all forearms to good use. Just that there is hardly any bounce here to sit up for the timing to come out right. Scoots under the flat bat and sends the off-pole on a cartwheel. batsman b bowler 2(3)

out Caught by de Villiers!! Oh dear. This is a collapse of enormous magnitudes. Faster than some of the vehicles that line up in the evenings on the Bangalore roads. Goes for the slower one on a length outside off. Thakur looks to check his drive but the sticker on the pitch makes him check his shot. He does so and chips it to a flying AB at cover. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, a juicy full toss, with generous width dished out as well. Smoked off the middle of the bat sinking onto the front knee as well making it one for the cameras. Pune need a lot more of these
FOUR, pitched up. Right in the slot to be spanked. And Tiwary doesn't disappoint. Once again leans onto his front knee and just swings his bat through the line. A lot straighter this time

FOUR, some runs scrapped here. In style rather. Those wrists employed in executing the lofted drive over extra cover. Finding the gap to perfection. bowler for some reason doesn't believe in not dishing out half volleys at this stage of the game

SIX, even better. The gorgeousness of the shots increases in an arithmatic progression. Much straighter this from bowler but once again off a generous half volley length. A seam up and dispatched into the sight screen with a full flowing drive

SIX, up and dispatched. Gives his side something to bowl at on this graveyard. bowler after bowling an eviable yorker misses the next. A cool few inches short and enough time for Tiwary to get under it in whipping it over the top. Behind square and into the stands
FOUR, right off the screws. A charge down the track in perpendiculars moving down and away in the same motion. All the breathing space for his arms in slicing it with all the power through the covers
leg byes, FOUR, down leg. And dealt with a nurdle off the thighs. Going past the glance and runs away into the long leg ropes

FOUR, whoa. Take that for timing. All of it employed here on duty tonight. Leans onto the front leg and shows the full bat face in spanking a lofted drive over the bowler's head. Holds the pose to make it all the more elegant

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. Surrenders in the quest fo an extra run. But he's done his job. Squeezes out a fullish one, almost whipping it in the process to long-on. A charge in and a good throw at the keeper's end ensures that Tiwary's desperate diving attempt to get back in for the second is futile. So, 161 is what Pune manage. batsman run out (Kohli/Kedar Jadhav) 27(11) [4s-3 6s-2]
FOUR, make that 17 off the over. After the polite timing, batsman gets out his violent streak now. Crashes the cut ferociously. Square like a tracer

SIX, nothing streaky this time. bowler looks for another one to fox the batsman getting too predictable in the process. A mighty swing taking the ball into the clouds before getting it to settle over long-on. Jee, this target setting is getting scary
FOUR, width now. Nothing going Bangalore's way. The length isn't either. A friendly sit up and smashed away with a flaying cut. Reintroduced into the fence
FOUR, deft. Delicate. Cheeky. The wide slip tactic not quite making much sense now. With batsman using his surgical precision in bisecting the man out there and the keeper with his delayed steer

FOUR, they're racing through. Brings up the half-ton stand as well. Watto decides to get defensive with a wide dart. Not quite the case with batsman already stooping low and reaching out in drilling it behind point

out Bowled!! The break does the trick. In the form of the strategy to introduce spin back. As has been a trend all through the tourney, the leg-spinners's wrong 'uns keep getting the rewards. Floats it up inviting batsman to get forward on the drive. And then gets the ball to dip in sharply going through the tiny gap between the bat and pad to light up the timber. Much needed slow down this for Bangalore. batsman b bowler 30(25) [4s-5]
FOUR, bursts through the hands. bowler's. Was a polite drill down this squeezing out the fuller one from batsman as he smashes it back. The bowler, slow to get low has a boundary against his name

out Caught by Kohli!! All the timing. All the power. All the elegance. Just that there is a certain Kohli in the way. Clears his front leg, gets his eyeline right on the ball and looks to go for the inside-out slap through the covers. Intercepted and a dive to his left plucks this one out of thin air. Diving low as well in the process. A real stunner. batsman c Kohli b bowler 31(23) [4s-3 6s-1]

FOUR, threatens to come down. Charge down in fact. All he does in the process is fool bowler into thinking the same and fire one wide. Adjusts and reaches out in slapping it behind point. A confidence boosting boundary
FOUR, the punches are out. A wide, short combo this and dealt with a certain degree of aplomb. Shows the leather the full face of the blade and crashes it through backward point
FOUR, wow! What a shot to get off the mark. Length ball right in the slot for batsman to swing his bat. Stands tall and lofts the on-drive
FOUR, four more! batsman isn't afraid to play his strokes. Sees the width outside off and throws the kitchen sink. Gets it well wide of backward point. No chance for third man

FOUR, that's timing and placement! "That's class," calls Sunny G on air. Just a hint of width outside off on this back of a length dlivery and batsman just taps it on the off-side. Pierces the gap between backward point and cover-point. The quick outfield does the rest
FOUR, beautiful shot. With mid-off up inside the circle, bowler pitches it up outside off. Iyer spots it and caresses the drive. It was uppish, but in the gap. 12 runs off the tenth over

FOUR, placed to perfection. Flighted on middle, batsman sinks down to one knee and sweeps, not quite off the middle, but got it in the gap at deep square leg. The fielder tries to flick the ball in play, but in vain
FOUR, that ruins the over. Like Nair, Iyer also moved to leg, but he kept his options open and didn't committ to one shot, waited for the short ball and cut it behind point

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. It was a risky second and Iyer pays the price. It was his call and he was running to the danger end, took on de Grandhomme and came second. The knuckle ball on middle, nudged softly into the mid-wicket region. The Kiwi charged in from the rope and fired a flat throw right next to the stumps to Uthappa, who did the rest. Even a dive from Iyer was not enough to save him. Another start for Iyer that he doesn't convert. batsman run out (de Grandhomme/Uthappa) 26(17) [4s-4]

no run, dropped! The penalty you pay for fielding a part-time wicket-keeper. The flatter knuckle ball around off, batsman moved away to the leg-side and tried to force it off the back foot, the outside edge goes straight in and straight out of Uthappa's gloves. That would have been two set batsmen removed in one over

out Bowled!! This was coming. batsman was struggling against bowler and he perishes looking to play a wild stroke. NCN darted it full and on the stumps. batsman clears his front leg and wants to heave it over the on-side. Doesn't bring the bat anywhere close to the ball and the it strikes the base of middle. batsman b bowler 21(27) [4s-1]
SIX, wow! Floated up outside off, batsman had the width to free his arms and he made no mistake, lofts it high and over the long-off fence. Almost nailed the electronic scoreboard
SIX, the yorker gone wrong. Low full toss just outside off, batsman brings that strong bottom hand into play, gets underneath it and sends it sailing over the long-on fence. What a hit!
FOUR, short and outside off, batsman cuts up and over backward point. Used the pace of Umesh and never thought about keeping it down the ground, one bounce and into the fence
SIX, 16 off three balls. That is what he can do. Length delivery on the pads, batsman crouches low and plays the pick-up shot to perfection, sent it packing over backward square leg

SIX, wasn't Umesh the best pacer for India in the Test season? He's been taken to the cleaners by the youngster. Third six in the over and already 22 off the over. team will be hurting by this onslaught. Fuller and around off, batsman clears his front leg and dispatched it over wide long-on

FOUR, geez! He hits them hard. 26 runs off the over and Umesh has taken a pasting. From 1/27 he ends with 1/53. Very full and outside off, batsman drills the drive past the diving extra cover fielder. The ball rocketed to the fence

out Bowled!! This is not what you expect from an experienced campaigner. With Pant going brilliantly, batsman just needed to give the strike to the youngster. Instead he advances and fails to pick the offie, the ball breaks back in and hits the top of leg-stump. batsman b bowler 1(4)

FOUR, you need confidence to play that shot, especially against bowler. The off-break turning in, Morris reverse sweeps it over backward point. Not off the middle, but once it cleared the infield it was going to be four

out Caught by Gambhir!! GG exults. But the damage might have been done. Third wicket for NCN and he's been an inspired selection today. Low full toss outside off, batsman had to reach out for that, slices it low to backward point, where GG clings on. A fine knock from the youngster that. Gave DD the momentum going into the final overs. batsman c Gambhir b bowler 38(16) [4s-2 6s-4]

1 run, dropped! Tough chance, but when you get two hands, you have to catch it. Short delivery and Morris is hurried into the pull, spliced towards long-on. Umesh runs forward and across, overruns and the ball comes near his waist while he was diving forward, hits his hands and pops out. GG is not happy with the effort

1 run, Morris living a charmed life. Now, GG puts one down. What do you say now skipper? Umesh might be asking. It was a straightforward chance unlike his. Slower delivery and Morris is early into the drive, toe-ends it towards extra cover. It was going in slow motion and GG lost it in the background. The ball hit his fingers and went to ground
FOUR, short delivery on middle and leg, that is easy pickings for a South African, Morris swivels and pulls it towards long leg. Bounced just before the ad cushions
FOUR, streaky but DD won't mind. The slower delivery but had the space for Morris to throw the kitchen sink, the outside edge flies fine and down to the third man fence

out Caught by U Yadav!! Clever bowling from bowler. Dug in the slower short ball, Morris delayed his shot after reading it off the surface, the idea was to ramp it over short third man, since there was no pace the ball balloons to Umesh, who makes no mistake this time. batsman c U Yadav b bowler 16(9) [4s-3]
FOUR, starts with a leg-stump half-volley and gets the treatment it deserves. batsman leans forward and whips it through mid-wicket and the ball bullets away. No need to run for shots like that
FOUR, wow! He strokes and stands still on the crease, posing for the photographs. Length ball just outside off, batsman presses forward and caresses the cover drive. Finds the gap superbly

FOUR, four more! This time he uses the pace and bounce to good effect. 141kph short ball outside off, batsman opens his bat face at the last instant and runs it wide of the keeper. Third man gave it a chase, but in vain

FOUR, exquisite. He's seeing the cricket ball like a football. All timing. He is not trying to hit the leather hard. Pitched up delivery, batsman leans onto it and drives it between mid-off and extra cover. Umesh Yadav leaks 17 runs off his opening over
FOUR, starts with a full toss on leg. Easy-peasy for batsman. He clips it in front of square on the on-side
2 runs, to long on, 50-run stand in the fifth over. A gentle nudge into the leg-side, followed by a quick double

out Caught by Uthappa!! The umpire took ages to raise his finger. Perhaps, it looked like he had a look at his partner before making the decision. The partnership is broken, courtesy short ball down leg. batsman would have smacked that past the ropes nine times out of ten. But, not today. He attempted the pull and all he managed was a glove onto it. Uthappa moves to his left and pouches it. batsman c Uthappa b bowler 21(17) [4s-2]

FOUR, cheeky, delicate and effective. Uses the slightest of width on this short ball outside off and sends it wide of the keeper by opening his bat face. It was an off-pace delivery as well. He waited for the ball till the last moment before making contact

out Caught by Uthappa!! Umesh Yadav strikes and removes the big fish. He bowled much better compared to his first spell and earns himself a wicket. It was a pacy Test match line and length. Short of a good length delivery on fourth-fifth stump line. batsman gets a faint outside tickle looking to run it down towards third man. Settles into the safe mitts of Uthappa. batsman c Uthappa b bowler 39(25) [4s-7]

FOUR, that's harsh on the bowler. That didn't deserve to go to the boundary. It was banged in short and bowler bent his back there. Iyer is surprised by the pace and bounce on that delivery. He jumps and just sticks his bat out hoping that it doesn't hit him. The ball flies past the keeper off his shoulder and dribbles away into the third man fence. The umpire thinks it came off the bat and gives four runs
FOUR, welcome to Delhi says Iyer. Shortish and wide outside off, Iyer treks back and fiercely cuts it behind square on the off-side. Gets it well out of the reach of backward point

out Caught by Billings!! Zak attack strikes. Trap set and trap sprung. So, batsman's promotion fails. Lasted for just two balls. It was a fuller length delivery on off-stump line, batsman went for a half-hearted flick. It appeared that the ball might have stopped on the wicket. Nonetheless, he was early into the shot and it was the slower ball from bowler that fooled the batsman there. Skies it towards deep square leg. Billings sprawls in forward and pouches it with ease. bowler roars in delight. batsman c Billings b bowler 1(2)
FOUR, that's a gift and batsman accepts it gleefully. Half-volley on off-stump, batsman takes it from there and flicks it fiercely past mid-on. Rockets away to the fence
FOUR, too full and too easy. Wafted full outside off, batsman leans forward, presents a nice high elbow and creams it past mid-off
FOUR, batsman gets off the mark with a boundary. Pivots back to this short ball and nails the pull in front of square on the on-side
FOUR, this is intentional stuff from Pandey. Waits in his crease till the last instant, opens the bat face and runs it through the vacant slip region

SIX, that's a pressure-releaser. Jogs down the track and uses his wrists to good effect. Flicks it handsomely over square leg. there were two men in the deep. All they could do was watch it sail over the rope

SIX, can't get away with this full toss! Pathan brings up his fifty in style. He clears his front leg and swings his bat hard. Finds the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket and has enough power to go all the way as well

3 runs, 100-run stand between the duo. Another low full toss, Pathan gets underneath the delivery and drills it down the ground. Morris from long-off dives full length to his right and flicks the ball back in play. The other fielder (Nair) from long-on fires in a throw, but he can't stop the duo from taking the third. Excellent running

FOUR, 15 off the over and bowler isn't happy. Probably with himself. After serving all those full tosses, he drifts one down leg. Pandey moves across and gets a faint tickle. No chance for Pant who put in a desperate dive. The ball dribbles away into the fence
FOUR, this is a gift and Pathan collects it with both hands. Full toss down leg, Pathan gets enough wood on his wild bat-swing and gets it very fine

out Caught&Bowled!! Much needed breakthrough for the home team. The short ploy does the trick. Morris bangs it in short at a good pace. Pathan is hurried on his pull and the ball lobs up off the top-edge. Morris calls for it moving to his left and takes a safe catch. batsman c and b bowler 59(39) [4s-6 6s-2]
FOUR, cheeky shot! Full and on off, Pandey opens his bat face at the last instant and steers it between the keeper and short third man. 10 runs off the wicket, in spite of Pathan's wicket
1 run, a fore-handed stroke to send this short ball to long-on. Manish Pandey notches up his fifty with that single

out Caught by Zaheer!! Is there a twist here? With mid-off inside the circle, it was worth taking the gamble. But, Yadav didn't get the desired result. The pace off the ball did the trick here. Yadav moved leg-side and mishit the lofted-off drive straight to mid-off. The bat turned at the point of impact. batsman c Zaheer b bowler 7(9)

out Stumped!! Delhi is going Mishy, Mishy, Mishy. A dot followed by a wicket. He completely foxes batsman with this tossed up leg-break. batsman's weight takes him forward, who wanted to deposit it away with a slog sweep. The back leg is well in front of the crease. Pant whips off the bails in a flash. The only doubt in the third umpire's mind was if Pant gathered it behind the stumps. It's touch and go. The benefit of doubt goes to the keeper. OUT flashed on the giant screen. batsman st Pant b bowler 3(5)

SIX, wow! Six and team need just 2 now. It was darted outside off. Pandey does a Dhoni! He moves slightly across and thumps it over long-on. Cummins was coming forward and I reckon he misjudged it there. Had he held his ground, he might have had a better chance

out Caught by Pant!! batsman combusts. No tryst with destiny for batsman today. Top nut from Cummins, overcorrects his length and hurls in the sucker ball outside off. batsman goes for a booming drive sans any feet movement.
