out Caught by Axar!! Axar takes a beauty diving to his right at deep mid-wicket. Googly and batsman goes with the turn. But this is the first ball he is facing. Not sure what was he thinking. Does not quite time it and hits in the air towards the right of the man in the deep. Axar attacks the ball and dives in time to get his fingers underneath the ball. batsman c Axar b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, first boundary of the evening. A loose ball down leg, batsman moves across slightly and nudges it very fine into the fine leg fence
SIX, right in the slot. And batsman goes into the beast mode. Swings, hard and mighty. Muscles it over long-on
SIX, more of the freebies. A sitter up on the hips and batsman couldn't be happier in swishing it around the corner. With all the meat in the timing
FOUR, the edges too come in. Ah, unfair. bowler bumps it in, gets it at the perfect nagging height and batsman's compulsive pull gets the top edge flying over the keeper. You cannot stop these

FOUR, piles it on. With the width not enough to force matters in the off-side, batsman takes it into the other side of the pitch. Another back of a length this from bowler looking to cramp him up for room and responded with a flat bat this time. Barely bothers to keep it down either, gets it in front of the man looking to cut it off at mid-wicket
1 run, the off-break. A room creating punch down to long-off. Brings up the 50-run between the duo
FOUR, too short. Too wide. Further amplified by batsman backing away violently. Waits on the ball to get close and slaps it through the covers

SIX, into the clouds. Too good for the multi-pixel cameras to pick this one from the clouds as well. Too short this from Yadav, all the time for batsman to rock back, inherit the line and plunder it away. Hacked away to clear the deep mid-wicket fence
SIX, even longer. batsman turning it on here. A scarred ball this - flat, dragged down and real quick. Just the pace required to go for another muscling swat into the favoured cow corner region

out Caught by Woakes!! The greed. Oh it really is. Brings about his downfall. Tossed up wide, floating googly and inviting batsman to take matters into the off-side. And he cannot resist it. Throws his hands out, with a lean and a reach out as he lofts it. Off the toe end and some clean diving at the fence seem to be enough to send him back. batsman c Woakes b bowler 44(25) [4s-1 6s-4]

SIX, gets the slog right. Invites him with an airy googly does Kuldeep and batsman throws everything he has into it. Slices it up, slices it high and slices the projectile long enough to take it over long-on

wide, out Stumped!! The teaser. And teases batsman back into the pavilion. Keeps up with his wrong 'uns, drifting them wide and slow. batsman obviously with his show of aggression was down and away once again, just that this time even the stretch out to reach the line of the ball turns futile. Robin takes over. The best extra leaked - ever. batsman st Uthappa b bowler 38(33) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Bowled!! Drags it on. Bends his back does bowler in bumping it in. And it skids on to stay a touch low for the anticipated lined up pull from Swapnil to come out right. Too high in the end and takes the inside edge to light up the night sky with some red again. Punjab falling apart in search of their catapult at the end. batsman b bowler 2(2)
FOUR, for some reason switches to a half volley. Tewatia, waits, buries and meets it with a full-blooded lofted drive through extra cover
FOUR, spots the slower off-cutter. And ensures to dispatch it away. Tries to fox him with the loopy bouncer here does bowler but a walk across to pull it past the man at short fine does the job
FOUR, hunts the fence. Much needed this for the Punjabis. Takes it off the pads and brings out the broom as he sweeps it this away
FOUR, doesn't get away this time. Seam up delivery from a shortish length, batsman punches it handsomely through the covers. Finds the gap and the ball races away
FOUR, cheeky and effective. Uses the slightest of widths outside off and opens his bat face to guide it wide of the keeper into the third man fence
FOUR, slower delivery and batsman takes full toll of it. The attemped leg-break ends up right in the slot for batsman. The batsman jogs down and heaves it over mid-wicket for a boundary
FOUR, wow! Superb shot. batsman spots the slower delivery well outside off and carves it over point. There is none stopping that

out Caught by Uthappa!! Umesh Yadav persists with the short ball stuff and that pays dividends for him. Removes the dangerous batsman with a 139kph bouncer on leg. batsman didn't go whole-heartedly against it on his hook shot. He shuffled across a bit and ended up giving a simple catch to Uthappa. It came off the glove. batsman c Uthappa b bowler 25(16) [4s-4]

out Lbw!! A vociferous appeal for lbw and up goes the finger. batsman isn't happy with the decision. The impact outside off maybe? No. batsman got low on one knee to play the sweep shot and missed a straight ball. He is struck adjacent to the off-stump. That's crashing onto the stumps. Good call from the umpire. batsman lbw b bowler 12(16) [4s-1]

FOUR, ah! Streaky, Marsh won't mind though. Seam-up delivery on a short of length, probably kept a tad low. Marsh wanted to work it through the on-side and gets an inside edge that eludes the leg pole and dribbles away into the fine leg fence
FOUR, that's textbook stuff from batsman. Half-volley just outside off, Marsh leans forward and middles the straight-drive. That's Instagrammable

out Bowled!! batsman is clean bowled. Seam-up delivery from bowler from a goodish length that snakes in a tad. Marsh doesn't account for it and attempts the drive. The ball sneaks in beating his inside edge and cannons onto the stumps. batsman b bowler 11(10) [4s-2]

FOUR, that's as minimal footwork as you'd get, and the ball has sped to the boundary at the rate of knots. What timing. What a start. Shows you how good a pitch this is as well. Back of a length from Kulkarni, curling away a touch outside off, and batsman just caresses it from the crease through the covers
FOUR, full again, but too much width on this occasion and batsman roundhouses it to the cover boundary. Just lashed at the ball and got it away through the ring

out Bowled!! He's played on. Big blow for Delhi up front. Short of length from bowler, hits the pitch hard and rushes batsman on the pull. It was there to be put away, the height didn't seem an inconvenience, but I think what unraveled batsman was the skid on the ball. He's late on the shot and under-edges it into the furniture. Middle stump floored. batsman b bowler 10(7) [4s-2]

FOUR, first ball and he's away. We've seen that before from batsman this season. Isn't shy to take the bowler on, even as early as his first ball. Picks length quickly, and swats it through mid-wicket off the front foot. Dismissive

out batsman Run Out!! Waste, a complete waste. batsman has had a brainfade. He's completely caught up in the LBW call, so much so that he forgets to plonk his bat inside the crease. Excellent comeback from bowler, spearing it full on leg, batsman plays across the line and it appears to hit him on the back leg. Maybe an inside edge, maybe going down leg, whatever it is, it isn't out. Meanwhile, batsman is anxious about the decision, wanders out of the crease and Raina capitalizes from slip. batsman run out (Raina) 4(2) [4s-1]

out Samuels Run Out!! Slower ball from bowler, Iyer taps it towards backward point again, a little bit in front of the fielder this time and they decide to go through for the single. Turns out, it's not a good decision after all. The man they are taking on is Ravindra Jadeja, one of the best fielders in this tournament, and if he hits, more often than not his arm will catch you short. Samuels is a yard out. Samuels run out (Jadeja) 1(4)
FOUR, flat and wide outside off, Iyer waits for it on the back foot and cuts it behind square on the off-side. Runs away to the fence and that brings up his fifty

1 run, another risky run. The running between the wickets hasn't been good all through this innings. Iyer taps a length ball straight to cover and calls his partner through for a quick single. Kishan fires in an underarm throw and misses the target at the striker's end. A direct hit would have been curtains for Corey Anderson
FOUR, that should ease his nerves. Slightest of widths outside off and Anderson opens his bat face at the point of impact and punches it through square on the off-side

out batsman Run Out!! Third run out of the innings. Once again it's the rocket from Rajkot. Why do you take a chance against him? He is so good there. Coming to the ball, it was a short of length delivery just outside off, Anderson chops the cut to backward point and wanders out of his crease for a non-existent single. He is sent back by his partner. By the time he turns back and tries to return, Jaddu does the thing he often does. Finding the target direct at the striker's end. batsman run out (Jadeja) 6(6) [4s-1]
FOUR, Thampi throws it wide outside off, Iyer forces it behind square on the off-side and the ball races away towards the fence. The man in the deep isn't sharp to stop that
FOUR, wow! Easily done! batsman gets low on one knee and laps it away into the fine leg fence

FOUR, was there bat involved? The ump thinks so. The premeditated shot fetches batsman a boundary. It was fired outside off, batsman reverses his stance and tries to play the reverse sweep. Probably, there was a bit of wood on it. DK can't stop it and there no one else to stop that from reaching the fence

out Caught&Bowled!! Carlos batsman has been bounced out by the Mumbai seamer. batsman underestimates the pace of Kulkarni and is late to play the pull shot against this back of a length delivery that kept following him. The ball lobs off the outside part of the bat. The bowler calls for it, moves to his left and takes it with ease. batsman c and b bowler 11(10) [4s-2]
FOUR, four to start the over. Iyer backs away, creates room and hammers this length ball from round the wicket through the covers. Thampi, in the deep, dives and makes a mess of it
FOUR, four more! Once again, Iyer moves leg-side, opens up the off-side and cuts it fiercely behind square on the off-side
FOUR, good shot to open your account. He relied more on power than timing. Clears the front leg and hammers a length ball through extra cover
FOUR, wow! DD are still in this game. bowler angles it on a length, Cummins moves slightly leg-side and flat-bats it down the ground
FOUR, third boundary in a row. Full ball around off, Iyer waits for the ball and carves it between mid-off and extra cover
FOUR, make that four! This is excellent batting. A mini shuffle across from Iyer and is helped by a low full toss on middle and leg. Helped away through backward square leg
FOUR, and another one! Kulkarni is feeling the heat. Drifts one on the pads of Iyer. Tickled away fine into the fine leg fence
SIX, in the air and out she goes! It was an off-pace delivery wide of off at 129kph, Cummins clears his front leg and launches it into the cow corner fence. It came off the sweet spot

SIX, highest IPL score for batsman! For a moment, it looked like he would hole out to long-off. Length ball, Iyer walks down the track and lifts it over long-off. It came off the bottom part of the bat, but had enough wings to clear the rope by a long way

FOUR, with mid-off up, you don't bowl full. That's exactly what bowler did and got punished. Iyer drills the drive wide of a diving mid-off fielder. 21 off the over and DD need just 23 with three overs to go

out Caught by Dwayne Smith!! Cummins departs looking to play the full shot. It was in the slot for Cummins to slog it over long-on. He cleared his front leg, but unfortunately mistimed the tonk. Straight into the bucket hands of Smith at long-on. batsman c Dwayne Smith b bowler 24(13) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, oh Soni! What have you done? Slower ball, was a full toss as well. batsman backs away and throws the kitchen sink. Manages an outside edge, that goes to the left of short third man. Soni, there, initially went to his right and hence couldn't stop that as it spun away from his dive. That could well be the turning point

leg byes, 2 runs, a direct hit and Iyer would have been a goner. Very full pacy delivery down leg, Iyer misses the flick, strikes his pad and runs towards fine leg. The throw is decent at the striker's end, but there is no one near the stumps. Iyer gets a couple. Raina is animated as he wanted the bowler to be at the stumps. Had Thampi been there, would've had the chance to run Iyer out. Thampi was just standing and watching - poor!

out Bowled!! Gone! This man from Ernakulam is too good at this stage of the innings. Full and tailing in, hint of reverse swing. Iyer walks across in his crease and looks to clip it through the on-side. Gets an inside edge that cannons onto the stumps. batsman b bowler 96(57) [4s-15 6s-2]

FOUR, 3 off 3 now! What a shot! Dhoni-esque. Dances down the track and elegantly flicks it through mid-wicket after converting it into a full toss. Wristily played and it raced away off the bat. Jaddu gives up in the deep

FOUR, batsman has done it! He was the villain against team early in the tournament, not giving strike to Pant. Not today. With seven needed off four balls, he comes in and hits two boundaries. Cheeky shot. Back of the hand slower ball, was a full toss as well. batsman moved across, waited for a long time and helped it away wide of the keeper. Akshdeep Nath at fine leg, tried his best, but couldn't stop the ball from going past the rope. DD win by 2 wickets

2 runs, back of a length just outside off, Iyer pats it to the left of Jadeja at backward point. They go through for a single. Jadeja shies at the stumps and concedes an overthrow. Replays show that Iyer had given up and had Jadeja hit, Iyer would've been gone
FOUR, beautifully done. The ball is coming on so well that you need not go hard at it. All timing. Back of a length outside off, Iyer punches it through point with a firm bottom hand
FOUR, the bat-face opens as batsman tries to loft a drive over mid-off but he's got enough behind it to skew it over the infield. Gets it away into the extra-cover boundary

1 run, poor running once again. There's never a run there but both batsmen just decide to go through on instinct and never take a chance to process their decision. batsman steers this back of length ball with impeccable timing but Raina's dive at backward point parries it to the fielder beside him. A direct-hit would have consumed batsman
FOUR, pounces on the width and flashes it up and over backward point. Poor delivery. Iyer up and running with a nice couple of boundaries

FOUR, overpitches and Iyer puts him away. It's a juicy delivery on middle, with Thampi perhaps missing a yorker. Nice roll of the wrists from Iyer to flick it through mid-wicket. The man in the deep is too square
FOUR, Thampi gets too straight and too full again and he's been whipped away. Iyer not missing out on any freebies he gets. Beats short fine leg to his right
SIX, all the way. That's a consequence of going through with his shot. Didn't hold back at all. Fullish around off, batsman has the swinging room he desires and launches into it
FOUR, now here's a surprise. bowler bowling in the powerplay. He drops it short and wide first ball and is crashed to the boundary. DD building some good momentum
FOUR, treating Smith with utter disdain. That's dismissive. Good length ball, batsman muscles it with a lot of bottom hand over mid-on. Nearly carried all the way

FOUR, he's decided that Smith has to go. Really good tactics from batsman. These are gentle medium pace deliveries and he's backing himself to clear the infield. Goes over mid-on again. One bounce and over
FOUR, oh shocker. Very short and very wide. With third man up, all batsman has to do is make some connection, especially with him going so hard. Upper-cuts it over short third man
1 run, fired in fuller, Iyer prods it away into the point region
FOUR, goes down low, reverses his stance and scoops the reverse-sweep over short third man. batsman rattling along. 30 off 13 balls now

out Caught by Dwayne Smith!! bowler's done him with lack of pace. Really canny bowling. Cuts his fingers across, the ball holds up on batsman as he tries to loft inside out and ends up slicing it in the air. Smith backpedals at least 10-15 yards from extra-cover, eyes on the ball all the time, and grabs it. batsman c Dwayne Smith b bowler 30(15) [4s-5 6s-1]

SIX, that's miscued .. and six. He didn't get that like he wanted at all. A big mow from Iyer, the ball grips and catches him on the outside half of the bat and it goes all the way. Ridiculous. Finch, at long on, is left bemused

FOUR, this is what he was trying to do the previous ball. Gets it spot on this time. Waits on the back of length delivery, allows it to pass him and then taps it just beside the keeper to have it racing into the third man boundary
FOUR, and again. Such a deft touch. Normal pace from bowler and Iyer utilizes all of it and steers it cheekily. Karthik dives, third man dives, but to no avail

FOUR, the outfield here is so quick. Cutter on the pads of batsman and he tucks it past the square leg umpire. The man behind square on the on-side did not have much to cover, yet the ball beat him to the fence
FOUR, precision at its best. A normal seam-up delivery around off and batsman drives on the up, opens the face of the bat a bit to place it between cover and point
FOUR, top shot! Short of length, batsman rides the bounce and punches it beautifully through extra cover, the fielder at mid-off was a touch too straight and had no chance of stopping that

FOUR, not where he intended, but that should relieve some pressure. The cross-seam back of a length delivery delivery, batsman heaves and the inside edge goes behind square on the leg-side, Shami had no chance in the deep
FOUR, poor delivery and Anderson pays for it. 9 runs off the first three balls. The off-pace delivery is on the pads, batsman glances it fine and picks up the second boundary of the over
SIX, fabulous shot! Just the extension of the arms and off she went. Good length ball just outside off, batsman maintains a good base and lofts it straight back over the bowler's head. All the way
FOUR, team picking up the run rate. Six followed by a four. Rubbish from bowler, sprays it down leg, batsman helps it along the way and beats a squarish fine leg

leg byes, FOUR, appeal for LBW and umpire Anil Chaudhary has got it spot on. Right off the back boot. Low full toss and batsman wanted to sweep it, missed and the ball runs away off the right boot. The ball had pitched outside leg and hence a good decision from the umpire

SIX, just over a leaping Samson. The famous bowler knuckle ball on a shortish length, not sure if batsman spotted it early, went for the pull and the short boundaries helped his cause, over deep square leg for a maximum

out Caught by Corey Anderson!! Wicket right after the break and it is Anderson, who has pulled another terrific catch. Full and on the stumps, bit too full for batsman to get underneath that, but he still goes through with it and spoons it towards long-on. The ball was dying in front of an onrushing Anderson, but he gets there with a dive. Takes it inches from the ground. The umpires send it upstairs and it is an easy one for the TV ump. batsman c Corey Anderson b bowler 40(28) [4s-4 6s-1]

SIX, fifty for batsman. He's blown hot and cold this season. Still getting used to the new batting position. Almost a similar delivery that got DK out, but batsman was able to get under that and tonk it over the long-on fence
FOUR, some charity from bowler. A nice juicy full toss outside off for the new batsman, batsman had ample time to pick his spot and he slices it behind point, away from the deep point fielder

FOUR, now the finesse from the Australian. Had the width to play whatever shot he needed, he chooses to back cut it behind square on the off-side, splitting backward point and short third man to perfection

FOUR, that is straight in batsman's alley. Full and outside off, and he is too good with the inside out shots, stays leg-side of the ball and goes over the fielder, couple of bounces and into the fence

FOUR, wow! What wristwork. He backed away and Cummins follows him, almost cramped for room is batsman, but still manages to whip it wide of long-on. The strong wrists come into play to execute that shot

FOUR, bowler's turn for some charity work. Second full toss batsman has got this innings and he has put that away, heaved wide of mid-wicket, got it high on the bat but more importantly had found the gap

out Bowled!! bowler makes a mess of the stumps. The off and middle are uprooted completely. But batsman has done his job. A quickfire 69 has set team up for a strong finish. This was a full delivery and had batsman not given himself room, he would have been in a position to put it away, not to be and the ball crashed into the stumps after beating the swinging willow. batsman b bowler 69(39) [4s-6 6s-4]
FOUR, shaping in this time. But bowler has gone too full, making things easier for batsman. Whips it past mid-wicket. Timed it beautifully
FOUR, streaky, but team will take it. It was a good over from Cummins. Full, fast and slanting into the batsman, batsman heaves across the line and the inside edge eludes a diving Sanju Samson

out batsman Run Out!! Is batsman short there at the bowler's end? Yes he is. He was a sloth there, has to pay in the end. Got hurried on the short ball and mistimed the pull to short fine leg. Ishan Kishan wanted the single and set off. batsman reacted late and despite bowler not being in a good position to collect the throw, he could not make it in the end. Did not even attempt the dive there. Might have lost his bat as well. Will confirm soon. batsman run out (Mishra/bowler) 8(8) [4s-1]
SIX, finally he gets one where he wanted. Down the leg-side and full, batsman whips over the fine leg fence. Only just clears the fence

FOUR, that's his area - behind square on the on-side and bowler is playing into his court by bowling it short. Now that batsman has got the idea of the pace off the pitch, he is picking them well. Pulled this one over the man at fine leg, who is inside the ring
FOUR, so lucky batsman is there. Tries to drive a full ball from off and almost chops it on. The ball misses the stumps and rolls to the fine leg boundary
FOUR, batsman makes room and gets a short ball to his liking. Cuts over cover, a couple of bounces and into the fence

out Bowled!! batsman has been cleaned up. Makes room again but the length is much fuller and laced with pace (146kph). batsman's bat is late to come down on the inside-out drive, loses his stumps. Big wicket in the context of the game. batsman b bowler 6(5) [4s-1]
FOUR, races off the bat of batsman. Did not try to hit that hard. Just timing and made sure that he placed it well. Driven on the up past cover, what a way to get off the mark
FOUR, bad ball. Down the leg-side, batsman does not have to do much, sweeps it well to the fine leg fence. Was trying a googly there

out Caught by Zaheer!! One shot too many for batsman. Another googly but it has a lot of flight. batsman goes for the sweep again and top edges to Zaheer at short fine leg. bowler has struck soon and once he gets a wicket early in the spell he can be lethal, especially on these kind of tracks. batsman c Zaheer b bowler 34(25) [4s-5 6s-1]
FOUR, slides down the leg-side. batsman helps it fine off the inside part of the willow. Races to the fence
FOUR, what timing from batsman there. Gets on his toes and accomodates the bounce and angle from bowler, tucks through backward square leg
SIX, touch short and batsman sees it early. Camps back and dispatches it to the deep mid-wicket fence. 89 metre hit this

SIX, and now bowler flights. Overdoes it and gives some room as well. batsman cracks it over the long-off fence. bowler's wrist looked as if he attempted the googly but it went away from batsman there
FOUR, swing for Hardik, but it's full and way outside off. batsman leans into the drive and hits it over the man at cover-point, a few bounces and over the ropes

FOUR, edged and four, Harbhajan leaped at first slip, might have got a finger-tip on that, but there was no way he was catching it. batsman came down the track to a floaty outswinger, gets a thick edge as he slapped, the edge just about cleared the leaping first slip fielder
FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Hardik, it was short as well. batsman leans into the free-flowing drive and finds the gap past cover-point, no need to run for those
FOUR, nicely played by batsman, hint of width outside off. batsman waits on it, opens the face of the bat and guides it past the slip cordon, no one in the deep and the ball rolls away to the fence
FOUR, beautifully played, length delivery on the stumps, batsman gets forward, uses his wrists to good effect and flicks it over mid-on, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes
FOUR, intentional! batsman waits for this seam-up delivery and opens the face of the bat at the last moment to get this one past the keeper to his right, races away

out Bowled!! Look at bowler. He is hardly this pumped. Knows he's got the big man. batsman makes room, tries to cut, but the ball is not that short. On top of that it's a seam up ball that skids through and uproots the off-stump. Crowd goes mental. Little window that Mumbai needed, have they got that? We shall see. batsman b bowler 47(21) [4s-2 6s-5]
SIX, 'what a way to bring up the fifty,' shouts D Morrison on air. batsman skips down and lofts bowler with the turn over long-on for a maximum
FOUR, batsman is deceived for a while, in the flight. But does well to go with the shot and hits it well enough to beat the dive from long-off to his right. Eventually timed it really well
SIX, batsman skips a bit, dos not need to dance down. Gets a fullish ball and goes with the swing to dispatch it over the long-on fence. Big hit this one
SIX, batsman is justifying the move to send him up the order. How quickly did he read the slower ball from bowler and lofted it over long-off. Goes the distance
2 runs, full toss but batsman, in his bid to go too hard on the shot, mistimes it towards long-on. Is still wide of the fielder and fetches him a couple
no ball, SIX, these cute Aussie-Kiwi battles. bowler oversteps and then bowls a slower ball, which gets read by batsman. Clears the front leg and sends it soaring over the deep mid-wicket fence

out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! A bowler always has the last laugh. One of those things. batsman is gone. bowler gets him, not sure how big that one will be. But at least it's a dot ball and a wicket. Another off-pace ball that is going across batsman. He tries the cross-batted swing, slices it in the air. Parthiv Patel runs forward towards his left. Has to stretch a bit to snaffle this one. batsman c Parthiv Patel b bowler 25(16) [6s-2]
FOUR, slower balls lose their venom when banged in short. Like this time. batsman has all the time in the world, waits and pulls to the left of the man at deep square leg
FOUR, such awareness from batsman, sees the mid-off is inside the ring, makes room and lofts over him so nonchalantly. A couple of bounces and into the fence
SIX, full toss. batsman loves that. Clears the front leg and muscles it over the deep square leg fence

no ball, FOUR, lovely shot from batsman, he's looking in good touch already. A no-ball as well as bowler flicked the bails during his delivery stride. Turns out to be a low full-toss, batsman presents a straight bat and punches it back past the non-striker
SIX, full toss in batsman's arc and out of the park. Takes his right leg out of the line and sends it over the long-on fence

no ball, SIX, that's a big bonus for team, it's a maximum and it's a big no-ball as well. On a good length and just outside off, batsman takes a step forward and carves it high and over cover, went a long way into the stand
FOUR, expensive start from bowler, it was the slower ball, but it gave batsman plenty of time to spot it. He makes room and carves it inside out over cover, a couple of bounces and over the ropes
FOUR, this is turning out to be a very expensive over from bowler, short and on the stumps, batsman swivels across and pulls it behind square on the on-side, back-to-back boundaries for batsman
FOUR, drilled, bowler kept it full and on the stumps, batsman backs away, makes room and drives it through the gap at extra-cover, no need to run for those
FOUR, tossed up on the stumps, batsman was setting himself up for the big slog sweep, gets a thick inside edge and beats the fielder at square leg, rolls away to the fence
FOUR, lovely, tossed up nicely by Karn, right in the zone for batsman, he clears his left leg and drills it back over the bowler's head, one bounce and over the ropes

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! batsman gets greedy and throws his wicket away! Lovely ball from Karn, slowed down the pace on this leg-break, batsman was setting himself up for the slog sweep, gets a fat top-edge, high and towards long-on. Hardik kept back-pedalling, didn't lose sight over the ball and completes a fine two-handed overhead catch. Much needed wicket for team, the two openers were threatening to take this game away. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 36(18) [4s-5 6s-1]
FOUR, cheeky and four, leg-stump half-volley from bowler, batsman bends down low, uses bowler's pace and laps it past the keeper, no need to run for those with fine-leg inside the ring
FOUR, nicely played by batsman, back of a length and on the stumps, he waits on it, opens the face of the bat and runs it past the keeper. The pace of bowler does the rest

FOUR, this is excellent batting from batsman, bowler went short and wide of off as batsman backed away, he waits on it, uses the pace of the bowler and taps it on its head, splits the gap between backward point and short third man to perfection
SIX, lovely shot, tossed up invitingly by Karn, batsman gets a big stride forward and lifts it through the line, long-on is just a spectator

SIX, batsman is in a beastly mood tonight, lovely leg-break from Karn, slower and wider outside off, nearly did batsman in with the length. He had to lean forward, goes inside out and carves it over extra-cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
SIX, bowler is greeted with a maximum, dropped it short and on the stumps, batsman rocks back and pulls it over square leg, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
SIX, back-to-back sixes for batsman, pushed through flatter and just outside off, batsman gets forward and thumps it flat and hard over mid-wicket, went sailing over the ropes for another maximum
SIX, third six of the over, this was tossed up wider of off, batsman gets forward and thumps it high and way over long-on for a maximum
FOUR, and Mumbai take off with Punjab's momentum. Gets a delivery nipping onto the pads and tickles it away fine enough to go all the way

FOUR, pouncing on the pace. Pouncing on the bounce. 142kays of it and Parthiv throws everything at it as he hacks it. And even a mistime is enough on this carpet to race it away into the fence - the mid-wicket one
FOUR, more of the pace offered. This time Parthiv forces it through the line. 142kays again and a front footed smear through the covers. Ah, elegance all over it
FOUR, make that three. Parthiv on a carnage. Pitched up further, more of the width and an invite to get back to the business of dispatching these away. Done with another full flowing cover drive

FOUR, time for cliches, "Fortune favours the brave" chirps Laxman Sivaramakrishnan on air. Also, french cricket from Rana, goes for the almighty pull, the ball shapes in a touch, takes the inside edge and beats a diving Saha, who sprawled to his right. Runs away to the fence in a jiffy

3 runs, Comedy. Chaos. Everything happening out there. batsman tucks it away towards mid-wicket and sets off for a second run. The fielder quickly gets to the ball, collects it and fires a throw at the non striker's end. There was an opportunity for a run-out had bowler taken it cleanly. He fumbles and Rana gets back in. They also sneak in an extra run as there was no proper backing up

out Caught by Guptill!! Punjab are fighting back into this contest. A big, big wicket in the context of the game. Hold on! They are checking for a possible no-ball but he's fine and batsman has to continue the long walk back to the pavilion. The Mumbai skipper's destiny doesn't last long. Totally fails to connect this flatter delivery and ended up hitting it straight to Guptill at long-on. Too easy for him and he ain't dropping those. Stunned silence in the crowd. batsman c Guptill b bowler 5(7)

out Caught by Guptill!! Gone! Another one bites the dust. Rana hasn't been in the best of touch lately and he departs cheaply today. bowler pushed it through quicker, perhaps Rana was hustled for pace. Went back and looked to clear deep mid-wicket but messes up with his timing. Skies it straight to Guptill near the rope and he gobbles it up nicely. batsman c Guptill b bowler 12(12) [4s-2]
SIX, Pandya doesn't bother wasting any time. Sees a tossed up delivery in his arc, flexes his muscle and tonks it straight over the bowler's head
SIX, batsman joins into the act. Tewatia drifted it wide of off but batsman managed to reach with his long levers and launches it straight down the ground

SIX, spoils the over by conceding a six off the last ball. Lands it full in the arc for Pandya, he clears his front leg and smacks it over long-on. The fielder seemed in business for a while but it sailed over his head for a maximum
SIX, this has gone some 10 rows back. Such is his power. Full and just outside off, batsman stands motionless and wallops it over long-on. Not off the middle but still soars over the ropes
SIX, two in a row. Henry goes short, batsman is upto it in a flash. Spindles back and pulls it behind square. Goes all the way for a maximum

SIX, a behemoth, gosh. Third six off the over. Henry bowls it full and outside off, Pandya bends his knee and lofts it handsomely over extra cover. All grace, elegance and class. Go watch a smooth wave caress the shore, this is that
SIX, shambles, follows up with a full toss, Pandya ain't sparing those. Gets under it and murders it over long-on

out Caught by Saha!! Has that been taken? It has. Up goes the umpire's finger. End of Pandya's cameo. Again bowled it full and outside off, Pandya threw his bat at it, gets an outside edge and flew to Saha. He flung to his right and pulled off a blinder. Is this the spark that can lighten Punjab back into this game? batsman c Saha b bowler 30(13) [6s-4]

FOUR, it's a summer sale. batsman is making a joke of these boundaries. Sandeep misses his yorker, serves it up on a fuller length, batsman brings his bottom hand into effect, dumps it straight down the ground
SIX, what a shot. If you miss your length, batsman will make you pay. Full and zooming on the stumps, batsman gets underneath it and blasts it over long-on

FOUR, another massive over for Mumbai. Again, Sandeep offers a full toss, Karn frees his shoulders and clouts it wide of long-on, Maxi runs to his left and tries to keep the ball back in play but in vain

SIX, what a clanger. Maxwell, what have you done? Knuckle ball from Mohit, on a fuller length outside off, Karn tonks it straight down the ground, Maxwell prances to his left from long-off, gets both hands but palms it over the ropes. Clumsy!
FOUR, this match ain't over folks. To rub salt into the wounds and other jazz. Mohit goes wider of off, Karn protracts his hands and lifts it over cover-point
FOUR, this is getting better and better for Mumbai. Full toss and outside off, Karn throws the kitchen sink and gets an outside edge that runs past short third man

out Bowled!! Bowled him. Just when Mumbai keep belting boundaries, Punjab manage to strike back with plucking wickets. Let's call it a nomenclature, Mohit's back-of-the-hand slower ball, aiming at the stumps. Karn swung at it wildy, misses and is castled. Mohit roars in joy. batsman b bowler 19(6) [4s-3 6s-1]
SIX, wow. batsman is still keeping Mumbai in the hunt. Pivots back and swats this short ball over deep mid-wicket
FOUR, oh my. That's a punch, a ramp and an upper cut all in one. bowler looks to climb onto his neck. A typical Caribbean back footed stride and an open batted punch to race it through the cordon
1 run, Mohit seals the deal for his team. Punjab win by 7 runs. Again, fires it in the blockhole, batsman just about gets his bat down and digs it out

1 run, has switched to the yorkers. Bang on the sticks. A dance away and down in the same motion to half-drill, half-squeeze it down to mid-off. A direct hit and you never know. Because there isn't one
FOUR, a wasted line. Ruins what was well on the course of turning out to be a top over. Down leg and helped along getting it past the man at short fine
FOUR, all timing. And glory. Nicely pitched up, very friendly. The reply isn't am afraid. A perfect approach to the pitch of the delivery and a smear to time the pants off it. Through the covers
FOUR, okay now a few runs for the luck brigade. Nicely snaking up and a desperate/compulsive pull takes the top edge and flies in no man's land. Over the keeper's head
FOUR, pile on the misery. bowler slips, tumbles, falls down and then gets up to see the ball hitting the fence. A slip onto the hips and nurdled away fine enough. Mumbai well on course
SIX, another Sharma. Another dispatch. Right in the slot. A shimmy across from batsman to top it up with a full-blooded tonk. Several rows into the long-on stands
SIX, he's toying around here. The mind-reader reads the slower one and the fullish length on the stumps. Deals with a backing away and a sinking lofted power over the covers
1 run, the time-out almost brings a wicket with it. Smashed down, doesn't bother keeping it down and pops in and out the man at long-off lined up. Ah the dew. And the drop. Mohit Sharma the man

SIX, there are some ways to bring up a half-century and there is this way. A gallop down the track, right forward and swings his bat massively to deposit this well into the stands down the ground. His #11 I'm told
SIX, and he celebrates with some more. More of the charges down, more of the swings through the line. The zone of having fun here
FOUR, oh the cheek. The deft. Attempts the scoop and nails it. Off the middle of the blade, nothing streaky about this one as he guides it past the keeper

FOUR, now conventional. But keeps thudding the fence. Forces it full, forces it wide and amplified further with Parthiv backing away and smacking the drice off a knee. Sliced over a leaping Ishant at short third
FOUR, short. Down leg. But Parthiv refuses to relent. Keeps the dancing shoes on. Gets inside the line and pulls it away past the lurking short fine. This is murder. Call 100

out Caught by Vohra!! That's the end of the fun. Continues moving away, but for a change Mohit learns his bit following him with a pacy length stuff. Gets too big on him as he tries powering it away once again with a loft. Miscues it all ends up and the balloon in the air is taken. Finally. At cover. Something's arrested. batsman c Vohra b bowler 38(23) [4s-7]

FOUR, a new man, the same old line down leg and the same old response. Doesn't matter that it is only the first ball he's facing. Whips it away with enough chunk of wood on it to take it behind square

out Caught by Guptill!! A bird, a plane. Oh no. That's Martin Guptill. What in every world could only have been a smoke down the ground with batsman in his mood dancing and tonking sucked out by the only man who could have taken this. And he does it with a jump, a one-handed raise and taking it as cleanly as it could. Forget the boundary run-ins and throw outs. This is sheer timing. batsman c Guptill b bowler 59(32) [4s-5 6s-4]

out Samson Run Out!! Poor running. Absolutely poor. batsman steers it to the left of backward point. The ball goes at a good bounce for Stokes to pick it up and hit the stumps direct. Sanju Samson was nowhere in the frame and Ananthapadmanabhan has his finger up. Sanju Samson walks back disappointed and an end of a good first over. Samson run out (Stokes) 2(4)

SIX, top-edge and six, too predictable from Shardul, banged in short and well outside off, batsman was swiveling across on the pull - was in no control, the top-edge went high and behind square on the on-side, just has enough to clear Unadkat at deep backward square leg
SIX, cracking shot, much better from batsman, length delivery from Shardul, batsman backs away, opens up his arms and lofts it high and into the sight-screen. DD are off and running once again

FOUR, lovely shot, width on offer from bowler, batsman backs away and slaps it square on the off-side. Tripathi got across to his left from deep point, puts in the slide and drags the ball back in - but the ball slowly rolls back onto the ropes

out Caught by Dhoni!! 101st dismissal for MS and he took it as cool as a cucumber. He's still one of the best keepers in the game - and this catch shows why. This was another slower short ball from bowler, batsman made room outside leg and was looking to flay it through mid-wicket, played the shot a tad too early, got a fat top-edge. For a moment he seemed to be safe, but there was that man. MS ran backwards, kept his eyes on the ball, timed his leap well and completed a one-handed catch - with his right glove. bowler clenches his fists in delight - as much as a keeper's wicket as it was for the bowler there. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 27(21) [4s-1 6s-2]

out Stumped!! Dhoni is confident about a stumping. When he's confident, it means he's got his man. Looks like Anderson's foot is in the air, he did well to drag back in, but couldn't get his feet down. OUT is the call. Excellent work from MS, quick hands did the trick, but that was very well bowled by Sundar as well. He slowed down the pace, dragged Anderson forward on the drive and did him in with the turn. Anderson was a long way out of the crease, he did try to drag his foot back in - but comes second best to the Indian keeper. batsman st Dhoni b bowler 3(5)
1 run, tossed up on the stumps, nudged away behind square on the on-side, raises his 8th IPL fifty, his first this season

2 runs, a direct hit and even Cummins' dive wouldn't have saved him. MS let the ball go and Cummins was sprawling all over the place. Coming to the ball, on a good length and just outside off, eased away backward of square on the off-side
SIX, much needed for the Daredevils, length ball on offer from bowler, Cummins backs away and clubs it over mid-wicket, went sailing over the ropes at mid-wicket for a maximum

out Bowled!! That's a terrific comeback from the England star all-rounder, he slips in the leg-stump yorker - bowled at pace as well. Cummins was making room for the shot, has to jam his bat down - too late and the leg-pole goes for a walk, first wicket of the night for bowler and Pune continue to chip away. batsman b bowler 11(6) [6s-1]

FOUR, lovely shot, width on offer from bowler, Karun arches back, waits on the ball and cuts it late - gets it into the gap behind point and beats the fielder getting across to his left from deep point
SIX, cracking shot, back of a length and just outside off, batsman was prodding forward, uses the bottom hand and smashes it high and over long-off, has enough to clear the ropes on the full

FOUR, expensive over from bowler, topo short and at his pace it's easy pickings for the batsman. Karun waits on it and pulls it in front of square on the on-side. Long-on has no chance of cutting it off

out Caught by Unadkat!! Excellent catch from Unadkat - he seemed to have lost it under the lights, puts in the full-stretch dive and just about holds on. Second wicket for bowler and Pune are finishing strong. It was a length ball from bowler, batsman backed away on the heave, ended up getting a fat top-edge that spiralled in the air and behind Dhoni. Unadkat ran across to his left from short third man, called for the catch, seemed to have misjudged it - but held on with a dive. batsman c Unadkat b bowler 64(45) [4s-9]

2 runs, that's a chance and Sundar has dropped it, very similar to that of bowler's catch, this was another top-edge that went high and behind the keeper. Sundar ran across, got to the ball, seemed to have slipped at the last moment and drops it

out Caught by Stokes!! That's a superb catch from Stokes - he hasn't just saved a six, but he has got bowler a wicket as well. Watches the ball all the way at the deep mid-wicket boundary, lunges behind, holds onto the overhead catch - realises that he was going over the ropes, chucks the ball back into play, crosses the ropes, comes back in and takes the catch. Coming to the ball, it was a length delivery on the stumps, batsman backed away and swung hard - looked like he had got plenty behind it - only for Stokes to spoil his party. batsman c Stokes b bowler 2(4)

out Caught by Dhoni!! Second wicket goes down and Delhi are in trouble early on. Poor shot selection from batsman. Flashes away from the body with no feet movement to a back of a length delivery outside off and gets a thick outside edge through to Dhoni, who won't drop those. bowler has his hands up in joy. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 3(4)
FOUR, this is excellent improvisation from batsman. Gets well outside the line and sweeps it over short fine leg for a boundary
FOUR, good batting that from batsman. His eyes lit up for the tossed up delivery outside off and a perfect execution of the slog sweep. Finds the cow corner fence on the bounce

SIX, phew! That's been nailed for six. Short delivery from round the wicket. batsman rocks on the back foot quicker and dispatches it with a pull over deep square leg fence. Pure power that from batsman
FOUR, batsman showing his class now. Sees the width outside off and helps it wide of short third man. With the field inside the circle on the off-side, this shot was always on the cards

FOUR, batsman is in the zone today. He is seeing the ball well and has the awareness of the field. Makes room to this short delivery and pulls it well over the infield. The ball bounces just once before crashing into the ad boards
FOUR, bowler tries to attack the pads of batsman. He backs away and chips it over mid-wicket. Fielder from deep square leg tries to get across, but fails to stop the ball from rolling over
FOUR, batsman gets into the act now. Full and straight, batsman goes through the line and drills it straight down the ground. Smith had no chance of stopping that at mid-on
FOUR, nicely done. Thakur slips one down the leg. batsman goes low and helps it down to fine leg. Fine leg was inside the circle and the ball raced away to the fence in no time

FOUR, Thakur is struggling with his line. Left-right combination is making it much difficult for him to stick to one line. Now he slips onw down the legs of batsman, who helps it down to fine leg with a flick

FOUR, 50-run stand comes up for the duo with a top shot from batsman. Wasn't all that short, batsman quickly jumps on the back foot and cuts it square of the wicket. The fielder in the deep was too square and had no chance of stopping that
FOUR, exactly what he could have done with the third ball this over. Short and wide again, batsman gets his back foot across and slaps it past backward point. The ball rockets to the fence
FOUR, rank long hop from bowler. Gets what it deserves. batsman rocks on the back foot and pulls it hard along the ground. Splits deep backward square leg and deep mid-wicket to perfection
SIX, wrong 'un from bowler and how well did batsman read that. Goes on his knee and slog sweeps it to send it deep into the mid-wicket stands. That's a huge hit

out Caught by Christian!! batsman tries it again and loses his wicket. He will be disappointed with that after being batting so well for his 36. Tries to get under the ball and slog sweep. Wasn't to be. The ball came right of the toe end for Christian to settle under it wide of long-on. batsman c Christian b bowler 36(22) [4s-4 6s-2]

out Bowled!! What a ball. Cleans up batsman. Has this man retired, bowler? Wowed I am. Pitches up and swings it in to find the gap between batsman's pad and bat. For all that peach from bowler, batsman too is slightly responsible there. Went for the drive and pushed the defence a bit, leaving the space for the ball to sneak in. What a start for DD! batsman b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, this one does not swing. And hence there is no exaggerated shuffle from batsman. Stands his ground and flays the drive through cover. Races away
FOUR, batsman shows how to tackle the inswinger from bowler. Steps down and clips with the swing to bisect the field between mid-on and mid-wicket
FOUR, slower ball. batsman does not bother getting closer to the ball. All hands from him as he drives through extra cover. Zaheer has his hands on bowler's shoulder. Must be some words of wisdom

FOUR, another iffy slog which results in a miscue, but Tiwary gets enough on it this time to drag the ball over wide mid-on and into the boundary. That's precisely why he was targeting this shot. Mid-on is inside the ring, and with a little bit of fortune, he's able to muscle it over him

FOUR, that's brilliantly bowled, and bowler is so unlucky here. Having not given anything by way of flight all through the over, he tosses up a googly and dangles it wide of off to reap the pay-off for his pressure. batsman bites, has an almighty swish at it but he is trying to drag the ball into the on-side against the turn, a ball which is very wide in the first place. The edge is found but it zooms over the man at slip

FOUR, hoho, fierce! Absolutely fierce from batsman. He's just showed Cummins who's the boss. He gives charge, and accordingly Cummins bangs it in short. But batsman isn't backing down. He thumps the ball wide of long-on into the boundary

1 run, that could have been a sensational catch, but Samson cannot cling on! bowler begins with a half-tracker which should have been deposited in the stands, but Tiwary doesn't go through with the pull. He checks his shot, might have stopped on him. It travels low and quick in front of Samson at deep mid-wicket. He runs in full throttle, dives forward nearly plucks it off

SIX, he's starting to turn it on now. That's not in the slot, let me tell you. And he hasn't used his feet either. Just plants the front foot down with authority and swings through the line over long-on. Brutal batting

FOUR, smart from Tiwary. bowler generally bowls it quicker through the air, so Tiwary smartly stoops across on the back knee, uses the pace and paddles it round the corner. His placement is spot on, splitting the dives from short fine and long leg

1 run, dropped by Nair! Oh dear. This, right here, could be game defining, considering how this partnership is starting to flourish. Tiwary wants to take on a cutter from bowler, but the wily old veteran has angled it so wide that Tiwary has to really reach out. The cut on the ball catches a thick top-edge and lobs up to the right of point. Nair never really looked settled under the ball, was still on the move as it came down and makes a mess of it
SIX, he has flogged it off his pads for a six over mid-wicket. All muscle from batsman. I don't think he's got that in the middle at all, but it still clears the boundary comfortably

out Caught by Corey Anderson!! bowler misses the blockhole and delivers a full toss, batsman advances and converts it into a slightly higher full toss than he would have liked. It takes him by surprise a bit. He swings hard, it hits him high on the bat and he ends up slicing it straight down to long-off. Had he stayed his ground, would have been a much simpler ball to hit. batsman c Corey Anderson b bowler 33(25) [4s-3 6s-2]

out batsman Run Out!! That's a very, very rare occurence. MS batsman caught napping is not something which happens very often. It doesn't happen at all. The slower ball deflects off batsman's thigh towards short fine leg, and batsman is just ambling across not expecting Shami to go at his end. Once batsman realizes the danger, he motors through and even puts in a dive, but he's caught short by a few inches or so as Shami rockets the stumps down. Big wicket. batsman run out (Shami) 5(5)

out Lbw!! batsman looks surprised by the decision, but that's absolutely dead in front. That's crashing into the middle of middle. Full and straight from bowler, batsman tries to lap it fine but misses and the ball crashes into his pad. Gone! batsman lbw b bowler 3(3)

SIX, they needed that. They definitely needed that. A nothing ball from Cummins, gaining no height on the short of length delivery. It sits up for Tiwary and he pulls it away into the stands backward of square

SIX, oh boy, do we have something special on tonight?! Back to back sixes. This one is a sizzler over extra-cover. Another poor delivery from Cummins, bowling it full in the slot around off. Tiwary clears his front leg and smokes a stunning drive inside out

leg byes, FOUR, away to the boundary, but that's not enough. What irony. The one ball which Cummins has nailed into the blockhole has gone to the ropes. Tiwary is beaten by it, the ball hits his boot, misses leg-stump by a whisker and leaves the keeper wrong-footed. But it's game over with eight needed off one

out Bowled!! That's it. Bang into middle stump. Cummins seals it and can afford a smile. Those two sixes cranked up the pressure but the young Aussie recovered well. batsman b bowler 60(45) [4s-5 6s-3]

1 run, we will have to wait to ascertain what happened there? Shreyas Iyer has done a commendable job to save a six. Could not control the momentum and threw the ball away, else he could have come back to catch that one - like Stokes did earlier in the day. Short ball and batsman pulls off the back foot. Looks good to clear the fence but Iyer runs to his right from deep square leg, leaps and parries it back into play
FOUR, steps down and almost loses the balance but does well to slap it past point. How often does he do he something like that? Pretty often
SIX, tossed up ball and batsman makes full use of that. Skips down and goes with the loft. Never intended to hit that hard, clears the long-off fence with ease
FOUR, and now bowler drops it short. batsman uses the depth of the crease and cuts past point

out Caught by Pant!! Loud appeal for caught behind from the keeper, given. bowler did not look interested at first but joined later seeing the men from behind yell their throats out. Was a back of a length delivery that went across batsman, who wanted to cut closer to his body. Top edges to the keeper. batsman c Pant b bowler 7(6) [4s-1]
FOUR, what a shot. Lets the ball shape away and then goes back to punch through cover. Found the gap with ease
FOUR, just a little push but the sound it made was a proof of superb timing. batsman got on the front foot and then beat the man at cover

FOUR, too much risk involved for a single. Oh, wait. Shami at fine leg has made sure that batsman is rewarded well for the risk, Tiwary had taken his front foot long way across to fetch the sweep from off and middle. Was lucky to have connected
SIX, against the turn and run of play. Leg-spinner and batsman steps down, keeps himself away from the pitch of the ball, swings hard and sends it over cow corner

out Lbw!! batsman is dejected. Cannot believe his luck. Was there some edge? It definitely hit him high on leg there. But he was on the back foot having missed this skidder from bowler, who pumps his fist as soon as the umpire acknowledges the lbw appeal. What a wicket. Was there a time-out before this ball? Never mind. batsman lbw b bowler 38(32) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, fuller ball on the legs of batsman, who gets the toe-edge while trying to flick. The ball races to the third man fence
FOUR, first four of the innings. Beats the five men on the off-side with a cracking cut. The width was there and he pounced on that beating a diving cover-point

FOUR, the slip was there for batsman's first ball. But he was taken off for this one and guess what the ball goes right through that gaping hole. Good delivery from bowler, hitting a length and getting bounce, the edge was found but there was no-one to catch and it runs away to the third man fence
SIX, picks the slower delivery and deposits the pull over the deep backward square leg fielder. Not that short, but with a half-swivel batsman pulled that meatily and got himself a biggie
1 run, 50 for batsman now. Cracked through cover
FOUR, mowed from outside off and beats long-on to his right. Knelt down and hit it, not with great timing but good enough to get it in the gap and four more

out Lbw!! Gone. The Nelson has struck. A fast skidding delivery that rushes past batsman's pull and strikes him bang in front of middle. Too quick for Smith's shot. Easy decision for the umpire. batsman lbw b bowler 54(33) [4s-7 6s-2]

FOUR, very sloppy from Dhawan. Attacked the ball in trying to prevent the second and gives away two more. Thrashed to him and in running to his left from sweeper, he lets it go through his hands. A slight bobble before the ball came to him, but still should've been stopped

out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two down. The slower delivery and batsman can only slog it high up in the air, a fat top edge, Naman Ojha calls for it and takes it with ease. batsman c Naman Ojha b bowler 61(40) [4s-5 6s-4]

out Caught by Dhawan!! What a wicket that is. Two in the over for bowler. A game-changing over? Will only know once the match is done. But certainly team now get a chance to come back into the game. Wasn't a great delivery, off-pace and down leg, but batsman found Dhawan at deep backward square. After taking the catch, he puts a finger to his lip and points to the crowd suggesting to keep quiet. Typical Dhawan. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 2(5)

out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Wow. Wow. Three wickets in quick time and suddenly the score isn't looking that great. High full toss, was meant to be hit for six but batsman mistimed that and looked like it was falling in front of the fielder, but Hooda came in and snaffled that low and diving forward. bowler can't contain his smile. Can't believe his luck either. DK just puts his head down in disappointment, unable to believe the shot he played. batsman c Deepak Hooda b bowler 0(1)

out Bowled!! Atrocious batting from batsman. Utterly and truly hopeless. His side have lost three wickets inside two overs and him being so experienced, is expected to bat till the 20th over. But what does he do? Swings across the line, without picking the googly. Past his shot and into the stumps. bowler goes off on his trademark celebration. Some collapse this is. batsman b bowler 2(3)
FOUR, smashed. Too full and batsman used his levers to bullet it past the umpire. Who did well to get out of the way
FOUR, low full toss and sliding down, helped past backward square leg. Easy delivery to get and batsman doesn't miss out

out Bowled!! Cleaned up. Full and straight, with a late tail back in. batsman swings to leg and can't connect. The ball clips the leg stump and bowler punches the air in delight. batsman b bowler 8(10) [4s-1]

out Bowled!! Two in two. Before this ball, bowler was talking to Bhuvi as he set the field. Whatever he spoke, he executed to perfection. Inswinger, lands on a length and goes through the bat and pad gap of batsman. Too big a gap and the ball finds its way through to the stumps. bowler ends with a four-fer. What a story he has been this IPL. The whole of Old City in Hyderabad will be tucking into their biriyanis watching this. Certainly made his folks proud. batsman b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, awkwardly for Warner and he can't stop it. A high full toss, swung away by batsman, bounces just in front of his body and he can't even get a hand on that. Slips away from his grasp

out Bowled!! Brilliant yorker from Kaul. Late swing back in, batsman tried to squeeze it out, but the ball escaped past the bat, may have even kissed it, not too sure about that and then hit the off stump. Too good for a tailender. batsman b bowler 0(6)

out Bowled!! Exceptional from bowler. Jadeja is on his haunches at the other end. Looking disappointed. Full and swinging back in, through the attempted whip of Praveen Kumar. Rushed past the bat. I predict a first baller for Munaf too. LBW or bowled. batsman b bowler 1(2)

out Bowled!! You don't need to be a genius at this. Anyone can see that batsman has no chance against the swinging and pacy bowler. Especially at the death. batsman doesn't get in line, just stands outside leg and wafts his bat through the line. The late reverse swing takes the leg stump out and sends it out of its groove. That's clinical execution at the death. Perhaps the best exponent with the ball when bowling at the end in the world. batsman b bowler 0(1)

SIX, "he is a puller" says the great Sanjay M on air. I have to agree with that. Anything near his range and he instinctively goes for the pull, a top edge on this but it went all the way and even if there was a fielder, it was going over his head. On the swivel and then got it away

FOUR, four more. Again the pull. Can't bowl into his strengths. Into his range. This short ball sits up for him and he unleashes the Brian Lara-esque one-legged short arm-jabbed pull. Beats short fine to his right and races away
FOUR, short and wide outside off, batsman rolled his wrists on the cut and got it down, beats extra cover and gets another boundary
FOUR, too full this time from bowler and batsman lofts over mid-off. bowler is bleeding here and Ishan has raced to 31 off 13
FOUR, smashed past the stumps at the other end. Too full and batsman has drilled that in a flash. Rocketed away
1 run, fired in on the stumps, batsman drives and gets a single to long-on
SIX, slightly slower and on the stumps, batsman plays his favorite slog to leg, connects cleanly and it goes all the way over mid-wicket. Can't give him the room to swing his arms

FOUR, and now four more. bowler fired that fuller and faster on the stumps, a powerful drive and Warner at mid-off is slightly wide, so can't get there and once he did, didn't dive. Smith is hurting team

SIX, given as six. Just landed on the ad-cushions. A top edge on the short-arm jab and Dhawan was running towards it with his left-hand stretched, attempting to catch it. But it went away from him and landed flush on the cushion

SIX, maiden fifty for batsman. Raina stands and applauds. Picks the wrong-un and pulls, it was catchable for Nabi at the deep mid-wicket fence, but he was mindful of the ropes behind him, goes reverse-cup and can't catch it. Can't push it back either. bowler doesn't like that effort from his countryman
SIX, that is the flattest hit for six. Rocks back and muscles the pull, over mid-wicket, picked the shortish delivery and was onto it in a flash. Sailed into the crowd
FOUR, cute little paddle now. The line is down leg and with short fine inside that's not the way to go, batsman gets sufficient bat on that and beats the man inside the ring
FOUR, batsman is a monster when he gets going that is. Stands on the crease and butchers this slowish off-cutter that sits up, beats extra cover with ease
2 runs, punched to sweeper's left and batsman takes on Vijay to come back for the second. Good running
FOUR, everything going team's way. A genuine outside edge and it has flown to the third man fence. Flashed at a length delivery outside off and got a thick edge
FOUR, first four of the innings. Beats the five men on the off-side with a cracking cut. The width was there and he pounced on that beating a diving cover-point

FOUR, the slip was there for batsman's first ball. But he was taken off for this one and guess what the ball goes right through that gaping hole. Good delivery from bowler, hitting a length and getting bounce, the edge was found but there was no-one to catch and it runs away to the third man fence
SIX, picks the slower delivery and deposits the pull over the deep backward square leg fielder. Not that short, but with a half-swivel batsman pulled that meatily and got himself a biggie
1 run, 50 for batsman now. Cracked through cover
FOUR, mowed from outside off and beats long-on to his right. Knelt down and hit it, not with great timing but good enough to get it in the gap and four more

out Lbw!! Gone. The Nelson has struck. A fast skidding delivery that rushes past batsman's pull and strikes him bang in front of middle. Too quick for Smith's shot. Easy decision for the umpire. batsman lbw b bowler 54(33) [4s-7 6s-2]

out Caught by Naman Ojha!! Two down. The slower delivery and batsman can only slog it high up in the air, a fat top edge, Naman Ojha calls for it and takes it with ease. batsman c Naman Ojha b bowler 61(40) [4s-5 6s-4]

Typical Dhawan. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 2(5)

out Bowled!! Cleaned up. Full and straight, with a late tail back in. batsman swings to leg and can't connect. The ball clips the leg stump and bowler punches the air in delight. batsman b bowler 8(10) [4s-1]

out Bowled!! Two in two. Before this ball, bowler was talking to Bhuvi as he set the field. Whatever he spoke, he executed to perfection. Can't push it back either. bowler doesn't like that effort from his countryman
