SIX, cracking shot! batsman isn't wasting any time to get going and is happy to target the red-hot bowler who is breathing fire. Short ball that's not high enough, sits up nicely for batsman who dismisses it over mid-wicket with a forehand smash sort of pull. Beautifully done

FOUR, just short of backward square leg! For a moment, the fielder in the ring thought he had a chance but it bounced in front of him and sneaked through. Once it got past him, the outfield did the rest. Short of a length ball that batsman pulled without bothering to keep it down. Fortunate that it didn't go to hand

FOUR, freebie to start from bowler and batsman puts it away in style. Half-tracker and it's asking for trouble on this easy-paced surface. batsman swivels on the back foot and controls the pull with elan through backward square leg
SIX, half-tracker and goodbye! Cannot bowl such stuff on this pitch, easy for batsman who rocks back in a flash and deposits it into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Huge hit!

FOUR, deft touch! If the previous shot showcased his power, this is all about finesse. Slower and around off, not all that short but batsman waits for it on the back foot before essaying the late cut. Gets it very fine and just past the keeper as it races to the fence. He is in the zone, is batsman
1 run, tight single but they get it in the end with ease. Slower and outside off, batsman stays back and pats it into the gap at cover. 50-run stand is up!
FOUR, rubbish ball and batsman will feast on these all day. Gets a drag on around middle and leg, sits on the back foot and nails the pull through square leg. Found the gap

1 run, chance and Hooda has dropped it. That's a massive let-off for batsman, no calling at all, Hooda ran back from mid-wicket, it was perhaps Rashid's catch as he came in from deep mid-wicket. Short of a length and on the stumps, batsman was in no control over the pull, got a fat top-edge that went high and over mid-wicket. Hooda back-pedalled, wasn't in control as he went for the catch, the ball hit his palms and burst out.
SIX, lovely shot, batsman was in complete control over this pull, banged in short and well outside off, batsman swivelled across and pulled it high and over square leg, went a long way over the ropes
FOUR, lovely from batsman, tad fuller and wider of off, batsman leans forward, drives it on the up and finds the gap past cover-point, the timing is sweet and the ball rolls away to the fence

FOUR, that is batsman's riposte. The wrong 'un on a fullish and batsman used his reach to good effect, pressed forward and struck it straight back over the bowler, couple of bounces and into the fence

FOUR, needless. Kaul brought third man up and batsman sends the ball there. Should have followed the mantra off the first five deliveries. On a length outside off, batsman dabbed it late and beat short third man with ease

SIX, into the second tier. Mumbai need to step on the pedal. Bit of air as bowler tossed it wide of off, batsman charged down and had the room to free his arms, smashed it over extra cover for a biggie

SIX, wow! That was just an extension of the arms and the ball flies over the fence. For a change bowler goes full, right in batsman's arc, he stays rooted to the crease and presents the full bat face to loft it straight back over the bowler. Held his pose for the shutterbugs

FOUR, for the second time batsman uses the pace of bowler to pocket a boundary. Fraction short and outside off, batsman waits in the crease and steers it behind point, Kaul at third man should have done a better job of stopping that. He got there and allowed it to escape past him

out Caught by Dhawan!! What was that? batsman puts his hand up in an apologetic manner towards Yadav, I guess. Back of a length delivery, clocked at 143kph, batsman stays back in the crease and is through the shot even before the ball arrived, the ball takes the cue-end and skies to sweeper cover. Dhawan completes the catch and does his thigh slap. batsman was so much early that his bottom hand came off the bat handle as he made contact with the ball. Timely wicket for Hyderabad and not for Mumbai as batsman was looking in ominous form. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 28(23) [4s-3 6s-2]

SIX, he remains the key for Mumbai. Flighted on off, Yadav backs away by moving to leg, give himself the opportunity to free his arms and lofted it inside out handsomely over extra cover. Cleared the rope comfortably

FOUR, lovely shot! Kaul might have been a bit too predictable with his length, Yadav moved to the leg-side and waited for the short delivery, swatted the pull backward of square leg and ended the over with a much needed boundary
FOUR, that is cheeky. Pushed it through did Rashid and batsman used the pace on that, shuffled across with bent knee and scooped it fine, giving short fine leg no chance

out Bowled!! Just too good. It is hard enough for a proper batsman to pick Rashid, imagine how hard it would be for an Australian all-rounder. batsman shimmies down the wicket without knowing what delivery it is, the wrong 'un spins in and sneaks past the swinging blade before crashing into the stumps. A well-deserved wicket for Rashid, who has bowled brilliantly without any luck. batsman b bowler 9(9) [4s-1]

out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! And another one gone. This knuckle ball epidemic is getting to every Indian pacer. Sharma the latest to show it off. Lands it on a length and Yadav thinking it was a normal length delivery, goes through the line with the loft, miscues it completely and Hooda runs forward from long-on to pouch that. Yadav was the key and even he is sent back. batsman c Deepak Hooda b bowler 28(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Lbw!! You can't get more plumb LBW decisions than that. Umpire Nandan messed it up. The knuckle ball once again from Sharma, batsman is through his slog early and is struck on the back leg, yes back leg. The ball was crashing into middle stump as per ball-tracking and for some reason Nandan didn't give that out. Sharma was quick to ask KW to take the review and the skipper obliged. batsman lbw b bowler 0(4)

out Caught by Shakib!! Smart catch from Shakib and Hooda can breathe easy. On a good length and angling into batsman's pads, he was looking to tuck it towards the on-side, perhaps played a tad too early, the ball looped in the air and was dropping in front of short square leg. Shakib was alert though, dives forward, got both hands underneath and scooped the catch. batsman falls cheaply once again and team have lost an early wicket. batsman c Shakib b bowler 11(10) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, batsman gets going in some style, his first runs of IPL and it's a huge six, length ball on his pads, he swivelled across and helped it on its way, deep into the second tier at long leg

FOUR, streaky and four, Kishan gets lucky and gets a boundary as well, comes down the track, doesn't get anywhere close to the ball, swings through the line, the big inside edge races away past the leg-stump and into the fence
FOUR, cheeky! batsman decides to do something about the length Kaul was bowling, moving across the stumps and laps the length delivery over short fine leg, enough legs on that to reach the fence

FOUR, edged and four, more runs for Kishan, more frustration for Sandeep. This the slower ball on off, Kishan was perhaps looking to play with an open face, he didn't look to get it that fine though, past the keeper and third man was inside the ring
FOUR, short of a good length and well outside off, batsman stands tall and punches with a straight bat, finds the gap past cover-point and the ball rolls away to the fence
FOUR, that's his answer to bowler, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, batsman was backing away, has to reach out and carves it over cover, a few bounces and into the fence

SIX, magnificent shot, pacy length ball on the stumps, batsman makes room by backing away, swings hard and sends it sailing over extra-cover for a maximum, flat and hard - that's what made team shell big bucks to buy him in the auctions

leg byes, FOUR, appeal for LBW, but I reckon it might have pitched outside leg. Kishan was setting himself up for a reverse sweep, lost his poise in doing so, ended up with a reverse hack, the ball clipped the pads and beat the slip fielder to the fence

1 run, chance and dropped, Kishan was looking clueless against Rashid, but the bowler has been let-down by his fielder. He didn't spot the wrong 'un as he gave the charge, doesn't get anywhere close to the ball, gets a thick top-edge over cover, Sandeep back pedalled, looked certain to take the catch and then makes a mess of it

out Caught by Y Pathan!! Oh dear! This is terrible cricket from Kishan, another blind swing and this time, he isn't reprieved. Yusuf was the fielder in the deep and he takes a good low catch. Coming to the ball, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Kishan was eyeing the mid-wicket boundary as he hacked across the line, gets a thick edge that flew towards third man. Yusuf was perhaps unsighted by the floodlights, but does well to bend forward and takes it inches off the turf. batsman c Y Pathan b bowler 9(9) [4s-2]
FOUR, smashed, half-volley outside off, batsman gets forward and drills it past the non-striker, the fielder at mid-off was a mere spectator

out Bowled!! Kaul has two in the over and he's chuffed to bits. He's running all around the ground in jubilation, three wickets in the powerplay for team and all those dropped chances will be forgotten. This was the slower knuckle ball, pitched on middle and shaped across the left-hander, batsman didn't spot it, went for the big heave over mid-wicket, he missed and heard the sound of clatter. batsman b bowler 29(17) [4s-3 6s-2]
FOUR, beautifully played, too full and too wide of off, Krunal gets close to the ball, that allows him to play against the turn, beats extra-cover with the drive and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, cheeky and four, tossed up well outside off, Krunal bends down low, reverses his stance, uses the pace on the ball and laps it very fine, beats short third man and it's back-to-back boundaries for Krunal

out Caught by Williamson!! bowler has his man and team find themselves in further trouble. This was tossed up and held its line just outside off, Krunal was looking to play with the turn, closed the bat-face early and pops a leading edge, straight to KW at cover. It's a dolly and the team captain doesn't need a second invitation. batsman c Williamson b bowler 15(10) [4s-2]
FOUR, cracking shot, too short and well outside off, Suryakumar swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square, beats mid-wicket and rolls away to the fence

FOUR, batsman is underway! That's bread and butter for Gabbar. Too wide and he'll punish you all day. The length was on the shorter side as well - the recipe to get hit. batsman flashes his bat at it and slaps it through extra cover. Off the mark with a boundary

FOUR, second boundary for batsman. didn't try to over-hit, timed it well and the placement was good. The line is too straight from bowler - strayed on the pads and batsman used his wrists to glance it away in front of square on the leg-side. The man inside the 30-yard circle gives a chase, but can only escort the ball to the fence

out Caught by Rohit!! Almost a horrible bit of miscommunication between bowler and Rohit, but the Mumbai skipper just about takes it in the end. He can see the funny side now, won't have been so funny had it gone down. But what a horrible shot from Pandey. All team need to do here is knock bowler around, the rate is under control. But Pandey charges out for a big hit. He's done in by the flight, and skies it up off a leading edge. It was bowler's catch, but the youngster leaves it to the skipper without any indication. At the very last moment, Rohit sinks low and snaffles it off the turf. Phew. The 20-year old is inspiring the visitors and keeping them in it. batsman c Rohit b bowler 11(8) [4s-1]
FOUR, charges out to the pitch of the ball and smokes it down the ground. What a way to start from Hooda. Wow
FOUR, poor delivery from bowler, can't afford to release the pressure this way. team don't have much to play with. Short and wide, batsman sizes it up early and slaps it through point

out Bowled!! What a soft, soft dismissal. He had so much time on the back foot, how did he even edge it! Shortish googly from bowler, sits up outside off. batsman is back in the crease to tamely pat it away through point, but all he does is chop it back onto the stumps. What a spell from bowler to give Mumbai hope from a pretty hopeless situation. He's done though, will the others rise? batsman b bowler 12(12) [4s-1]
FOUR, pivots on the back leg and whip-pulls this delivery to the left of fine leg. Ordinary short of length delivery from bowler, sitting up comfortably around Pathan's chest to be dispatched

FOUR, this has been a really sensible partnership for the most part, and here comes the reward. bowler sprays on the pads, allowing Pathan an easy release of pressure as he glances it away past short fine leg

out Caught by Pollard!! team are close, but this is still not over. bowler rushes Pathan with this short of length delivery which hurries onto his attempted pull shot. He was caught on the swivel as it spooned up off the splice, before nestling into the bucket hands of Pollard at mid-wicket. batsman c Pollard b bowler 14(14) [4s-2]

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Oh my, what do we have here! bowler has ripped the game open once more with two in two. Pacy full ball outside off, the punchy fellow that Rashid is, he goes for an ambitious cover drive but can only nick it to the keeper. Hat-trick ball coming up. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 0(1)

out Caught&Bowled!! Taken one-handed. The Mumbai supporters in the crowd erupt. Kaul was probably surprised by the line from bowler here - it was full at the stumps after the previous two which were wide of him. He chips the off-cutter straight back, where bowler sticks a hand out and the ball sticks. This will be some comeback from team if they pull it off. batsman c and b bowler 0(4)

out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Sandeep does in fact look for the boundary. He walks across, bends his back knee and tries for the same scoop that Kedar Jadhav hit for six a few nights back against bowler. But what Sandeep achieves is very different. He doesn't get it anywhere near the middle, and spoons it up to short fine leg. bowler raises his arms as the team fans go wild. batsman c Krunal Pandya b bowler 0(2)

SIX, he has clubbed this for six! What a start to the over. Low full toss wide of off from round the wicket, Hooda shuffles across a bit, bends his back knee and frees his arms. Muscles it over long-off

FOUR, how good are those wrists? Must have learnt a bit from VVS. Wasn't a bad ball at all from bowler. On a good length and on middle and leg, batsman stayed in his crease and flicked it nonchalantly over and wide of mid-on

FOUR, dropped! Cutting is the culprit. An ugly hoick attempted from batsman and he mistimed it horribly. Cutting, at mid-on, went back and got to the ball, but couldn't hold onto it. What's worse? He allows it go for a boundary. It was a good length ball and batsman was slightly late into his shot

FOUR, the top-edge goes over the keeper's head and runs away for another boundary. No luck lor bowler, who banged one short and the bal got big on the batsman. batsman, despite not being in a good position, went with the pull shot. He will be happy with the result though
FOUR, bowler hurls one fuller and batsman decides to go after it. It was bowled wide of off, batsman comes down for a walk and muscles it over the bowler's head to collect his third boundary
no run, was that a chance? batsman backed away and Pandya followed him. Got a bit of turn and batsman missed the cut. The keeper failed to catch it cleanly. Not sure if there was any bat involved
FOUR, bowler overpitches and batsman takes heavy toll of it. The back leg is bent, to the pitch and then creamed the cover drive. The placement was spot on too
FOUR, 50 up for team! In a quick time. This was a pacy good length ball on middle and leg, batsman helps it along its way to fine leg. Runs coming thick and fast for the hosts

FOUR, edged, missed the stumps and races away to the fence. 14 runs off the over. It was a skiddy length ball from round the wicket and batsman checked his cross-batted stroke. The ball trimmed the inside edge, missed the sticks and evaded the keeper to the fine leg fence
FOUR, crashed away! The googly from bowler, but it's short and wide outside off. batsman trks back and muscles the cut through extra cover. Lewis sprints across and dives to his left, in vain

out Lbw!! An appeal for lbw against batsman and umpire Nigel Llong shakes his head in denial. Well, team have decided to review. Fair delivery. It was the quicker googly and batsman was way out of his crease and the impact is above the knee-roll. What does the ball-tracker say? Three reds and batsman has to go. Llong can't belive it and so can't I. Brilliant review from Mumbai. batsman misses the clip as he didn't the pick the wrong 'un and was also late to bring his bat down. HawkEye showed it be hitting the leg stump. There's the breakthrough and it's the 20-year-old who does the job for the visitors. batsman lbw b bowler 22(20) [4s-3]
FOUR, bangs one short does bowler and there's no venom. batsman fetches it from well outside off and swivel-pulls it in front of square on the leg-side. He was in total control of the shot
FOUR, fullish ball outside off, batsman opens the bat-face at the very last moment and runs it down to third man. Got it very fine

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Another review from team. This time against KW for caught behind. Fair delivery. There's a sound. We'll have Ultraedge in a short while to confirm. There's a little spike. Is that enough for the on-field call to be reversed? I wouldn't want to be the third umpire. Well, the call has been made. Overturned! Two overs, two reviews and two wickets. Mumbai are coming back. It was the cutter from bowler and batsman tried to run it down to third man. Gets a faint outside edge and Ishan Kishan pouched it with ease. The keeper and the bowler heard it. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 6(4) [4s-1]

out Caught by Bumrah!! In 35 balls that he has bowled in IPL, Mayank bowler has dismissed Dhoni and batsman. His CV will look good, for sure. So, batsman plays a high-risk shot and perishes. Was a quick and flattish leg-break, batsman goes down for the big slog sweep and top-edges straight to the man at long leg. Bumrah, the man in the deep, held his ground and took a calm catch. He was inches in front of the boundary rope. Went a couple of steps back, but looked back to find himself just in. batsman c Bumrah b bowler 45(28) [4s-8]
FOUR, shot! Too short, Pandey stays back and cuts it square of the wicket. Powerfully hit

SIX, excellent shot to get off the mark. He's in sublime touch, has carried his form into this match too. On a length outside off, stands tall and pumps that over covers for half a dozen. Flat and over the fence

SIX, beautiful flick that. Very less margin for error on this wicket. Full on middle and leg, batsman keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket with nonchalance. Made that shot look effortless

FOUR, 16 runs off the opening over. Couldn't have asked for a better start. On the pads again and all batsman does is clips it past the fielder at short fine leg, he dives there but the ball is too quick for him

FOUR, off the mark in style, Agarwal too. Picks the length early, it's short on middle and Agarwal gets in position early to flick it over square leg, fine leg is too square and the ball wins the race
FOUR, textbook straight drive! Presenting full face of the bat and high elbows. Fullish in length around off, Agarwal backs away, drives it straight past the bowler and gathers a boundary more
2 runs, the leg-break from bowler, batsman reaches out and sweeps it in front of square on the on-side, comes back for the second run

FOUR, bowler's over is ruined once again off the last ball, this was tossed up nicely outside off, batsman bent half-forward, reverses his stance and helps it on its way to the long leg fence, make it off the fifth ball

out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! Oh dear! That's a horror shot from KL, he was looking so good and now plays an atrocious heave, pushed through quicker and wider of off, KL was looking to mow it over the mid-wicket fence, doesn't get anywhere near the pitch of the ball, the fat top-edge loops towards short third man where Sarfaraz takes it with glee. End of a handy knock from the team opener. batsman c Sarfaraz Khan b bowler 47(30) [4s-2 6s-4]

out Bowled!! Khejroliya has his first IPL wicket and that's a big one as well. batsman was looking in good touch, decides to up the ante and instead has to walk back to the hut. Short of a length and on the stumps, wasn't short enough for the pull, batsman went through with the shot, connected with thin air and the ball clattered into the top of middle. team are beginning to boss this match now, can team find an answer? batsman b bowler 29(26) [4s-3]

leg byes, 1 run, loud shout for LBW and team want a review. Kohli looked very keen to challenge the call. It's a fair delivery from Sundar, it has pitched in line, but is it spinning down leg? There's no bat and Ultraedge confirms it. I don't think it straightened enough, Hawk-Eye in and it's missing the leg-stump. team have lost their review. This was tossed up on middle and was spinning into the right-hander, batsman swept and missed, was struck on the pads, in front of leg and the angle was traking it down the leg-stump. The ball rolls away towards the off-side, the fielder has a shy at the bowler's end and concedes an overthrow
SIX, pushed through just outside off, batsman comes down the track, doesn't get close to the ball, went through with the swing and sends it sailing over long-off for a maximum

out Stumped!! This is poor cricket from team, they are losing wickets in clusters. Another unnecessary shot from batsman and he's stranded way outside the crease, gave away his intentions way too early, stepped down the track, allows Sundar to shorten his length. He still didn't accept defeat, swung recklessly across the line and missed, an easy stumping for de Kock. batsman st de Kock b bowler 11(9) [6s-1]
FOUR, cracking shot, short and on the stumps, batsman swivels across, rolls his wrists and helps it on its way, the man in the deep is square and the ball beats him to the fence
FOUR, beautifully played, length delivery outside off, batsman leans forward, drives it on the up and beats the diving fielder at cover, no need to run for those

out Lbw!! batsman has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. This looked adjacent to the naked eye. It's a fair delivery and there's no bat as well. The impact seems to be in front of middle, the height isn't an issue. No edge, says Ultraedge. Hawk-Eye in, three reds and batsman is OUT. Simple call for umpire Ravi and Khejroliya has struck with his last ball. This was full and came back with the angle, batsman shuffled a long way across on the flick, once he missed, it was curtains, decided to take a chance as he reviewed, but to no avail. batsman lbw b bowler 2(3)

FOUR, lovely shot, this is turning out to be a fine cameo from batsman, comes down the track, uses his reach to good effect and clears cover with the lofted off-drive, couple of bounces and over the ropes

out Caught by Kohli!! This was always coming! Tye was looking to slog everything out of the park, on a good length and just outside off, might have been the slower ball, Tye swung through the line, went off the toe-end of the bat, got plenty of height but not the distance. Kohli ran across to his left from long-on and held on to a simple catch. batsman c Kohli b bowler 7(7)

SIX, cracking shot - made it even more special as he was done in completely by the flight. bowler saw his coming, slowed down the pace, dragged it wide of off, batsman reached out and slaps it back over the bowler's head, all the way for a maximum

out Stumped!! Has batsman been stumped? de Kock certainly seems confident. It's a fair delivery, the bat is in the air, batsman is way short as well and he's OUT. That's the end of a mighty fine cameo from the team captain, will it be the clinching factor in this match? Smart bowling from bowler, sensed that batsman was coming down the track, threw in a loopy leg-break, batsman came down the track, doesn't get anywhere near the ball, swung across the line in hope and missed, de Kock did the rest. batsman st de Kock b bowler 33(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! team have been bowled out for 155. team will feel they have done a good job with the ball. This was short and at the stumps, Rahman was backing away on the pull, the ball was just too quick for him, gets a top-edge that lobs behind square on the off-side. de Kock went for the catch, but Sarfaraz called for it and holds on safely. batsman c Sarfaraz Khan b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, errs in line after a good start. This is a shortish one on leg and Agarwal doesn't miss out on the chance. Swivels and drags it down to the fine leg fence, can't keep a fielder there

out Caught by de Kock!! Stunning catch by de Kock behind the wicket. Full length delivery in the zone around off, Agarwal goes for it, swings hard at it and ends up getting a healthy edge. de Kock flies to his right and pulls off a beauty. So just like always, Agarwal departs after getting off to a flier. Good entertaining cameo! batsman c de Kock b bowler 15(11) [4s-3]

out Lbw!! Golden duck for batsman! Umesh is on a hat-trick as the umpire's call stays. It was a length delivery around middle and batsman who tried to flick it off his toes missed it and got struck on the pads. Pitching in line, impact in line and clipping - umpire's call. Can he bag the hat-trick now? batsman lbw b bowler 0(1)

FOUR, what was the fielder doing there? He should have been back near the fence. Could have been a straight forward catch there. Short of a length delivery around off, batsman swivels and pulls it over the leaping fielder at deep square leg, guess it was Sarfaraz Khan

out Bowled!! Third wicket of the over. Umesh Yadav is on fire! Cleans up batsman with a beautiful delivery. Comes from round the wicket and fires in a length delivery from wide off the crease. batsman who looks to fend it, misses it altogether and the middle-stump is out of here. Look at Umesh's celebration, he's absolutely delighted. Just look at him. Fist pump and all! batsman b bowler 4(4) [4s-1]

SIX, batsman continues to march on. Wickets falling at one end won't make him a difference. This one is a short delivery on leg, batsman keeps his calm and pulls it over fine leg, off his hips and over the fence

FOUR, Rahul, Agarwal and now batsman. All Karnataka boys have got off the mark with a boundary or six tonight. Full length delivery around off, batsman keeps his head still and drills it past the fielder at mid-off, no chance to stop that

SIX, flat and over the fielder at deep square leg. Short and quick on leg, batsman waits for it and drags it powerfully over the man in the deep, that went like a rocket, lot of bottom hand on that blow by batsman
FOUR, class apart. It's a short delivery around off, batsman arches back and guides it to perfection over the empty cordon, third man sprints to his left but it's one bounce and over the fence

FOUR, no... he doesn't! How often have we seen the last delivery of the over to be the spoiler! Darts it on leg and batsman gets down on his knee to paddle it away and a chase by the fielder is not enough to stop this as the ball races away

SIX, excellent shot to get off the mark. He's in sublime touch, has carried his form into this match too. On a length outside off, stands tall and pumps that over covers for half a dozen. Flat and over the fence

SIX, beautiful flick that. Very less margin for error on this wicket. Full on middle and leg, batsman keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket with nonchalance. Made that shot look effortless

FOUR, 16 runs off the opening over. Couldn't have asked for a better start. On the pads again and all batsman does is clips it past the fielder at short fine leg, he dives there but the ball is too quick for him

FOUR, off the mark in style, Agarwal too. Picks the length early, it's short on middle and Agarwal gets in position early to flick it over square leg, fine leg is too square and the ball wins the race
FOUR, textbook straight drive! Presenting full face of the bat and high elbows. Fullish in length around off, Agarwal backs away, drives it straight past the bowler and gathers a boundary more
2 runs, the leg-break from bowler, batsman reaches out and sweeps it in front of square on the on-side, comes back for the second run

FOUR, bowler's over is ruined once again off the last ball, this was tossed up nicely outside off, batsman bent half-forward, reverses his stance and helps it on its way to the long leg fence, make it off the fifth ball

out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! Oh dear! That's a horror shot from KL, he was looking so good and now plays an atrocious heave, pushed through quicker and wider of off, KL was looking to mow it over the mid-wicket fence, doesn't get anywhere near the pitch of the ball, the fat top-edge loops towards short third man where Sarfaraz takes it with glee. End of a handy knock from the team opener. batsman c Sarfaraz Khan b bowler 47(30) [4s-2 6s-4]

out Bowled!! Khejroliya has his first IPL wicket and that's a big one as well. batsman was looking in good touch, decides to up the ante and instead has to walk back to the hut. Short of a length and on the stumps, wasn't short enough for the pull, batsman went through with the shot, connected with thin air and the ball clattered into the top of middle. team are beginning to boss this match now, can team find an answer? batsman b bowler 29(26) [4s-3]

SIX, flat and over the fielder at deep square leg. Short and quick on leg, batsman waits for it and drags it powerfully over the man in the deep, that went like a rocket, lot of bottom hand on that blow by batsman

FOUR, no... he doesn't! How often have we seen the last delivery of the over to be the spoiler! Darts it on leg and batsman gets down on his knee to paddle it away and a chase by the fielder is not enough to stop this as the ball races away
FOUR, that came right off the meat. On a length outside off, batsman stays put and punches this sweetly through the gap at covers, sweeper kept it place right after that shot

FOUR, Pandya doesn't like it. He's not happy with himself. Bowls a shortish delivery on leg and batsman simply puts it away to the square leg fence with a nonchalant clip off his hips, 11 runs off the opening over

SIX, that's huge! Akila concedes his first six of IPL and that's only his second delivery. Nothing much he could have done about it. Flighted one around middle and leg, batsman shimmies down the wicket and smokes it for a 95 metre six over mid-wicket. Welcome to the IPL, chirps Nasser Hussain on air
FOUR, the spinner put under pressure right away by Jason. Picks the length early on this short delivery, camps back and hammers it past the fielder at wide long-on, no chance of the stopping that

2 runs, oh no! Poor fielding, but it's fifty for Jason batsman, great effort. True pitch, lovely stroke-maker, you got to expect him to come good and boy, he's done well in a stiff chase. Very full and outside off stump, batsman squeezes it out, straight to backward point and it goes right through him

FOUR, in the airrr and if Pollard can't get there with that trampoline jump of his, nobody can. Gee these batsmen have no mercy, not even for Jas bowler! Well, this was a freebie ball though, full and in the slot, batsman muscles it hard over mid-off and looks like Pollard has hurt himself coming down hard on the ground

FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. Krunal! batsman will love this - left-armer turning it back into him. Leg-side is going to be busy. This was actually bowled pretty well, very slow although full, batsman delays the lofted drive and manages to hit it straight over the bowler to split long-off and long-on

out Caught by Pollard!! That's Pollard for you. Freak on the field. And Krunal roars in delight. Dangerous 69-run stand broken. This was a flighted delivery wide outside off stump, something that left-arm spinners do against left-handed batsmen to take the leg-side out of play, batsman tries to muscle the ball hard through the off-side, wanted to hit towards cover, but he hit straight and Pollard ran quickly to his left, dived and took it air-borne. batsman misses a deserved fifty by three runs. batsman c Pollard b bowler 47(25) [4s-6 6s-2]

FOUR, the invitation there from the bowler with the flighted delivery, you can't blame him because he's going for wickets. But just that he's bowled this too full for the batsman to be troubled and batsman smashes it straight over the non-striker's head to take long-on out of the equation

SIX, another tossed up one and Maxi slog-sweeps it all the way over backward square leg. It's on the stumps and Maxi won't miss those. bowler's having an of day. Tip for you bowler: If you are bowling to batsman, bowl the away-spinning ones wide outside off stump, hope for batsman to slog and slice one up in the air

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Oh that's a stunning grab from brother Hardik. Unbelievable. The catch of the tournament so far. This is exactly what Markande should have done in the previous over. Turn it away outside off stump like Krunal did this time. batsman tries to go for a big hit, but the bat turns in his hands on impact with the ball and it's a slice that flies more towards deep extra-cover. But Hardik put his skating boots on, got there and flew full length to his left and took it with both hands horizontal to the ground. Just amazing! Krunal has given a lot of hope for team with 2 wickets in 8 balls. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 13(6) [4s-1 6s-1]

2 runs, that's almost another catch. Delhi are going really hard and the opportunity for a wicket is always there. Need a bit of calmness out there. 50 odd 35 balls isn't that tough, especially at the Wankhede. Very full delivery, batsman slogs, connects well, luckily it dipped on SKY who was diving forward
SIX, oh what a shot! The quicker delivery from bowler, Iyer slogs really well and the timing is exceptional, sails into the second tier over the mid-wicket boundary

SIX, this game is so unkind to the bowlers. bowler has actually deceived the batsman in flight and with length, batsman, who was jumping out of the crease was nowhere close to the pitch of the ball, but he's gifted with timing and has a great willow in his hands and that combo is good enough for him to back himself and go through with the lofted hit over the bowler's head
FOUR, that should have been stopped by Rahul Chahar at deep point. Short and wide outside off stump, Iyer cuts, Chahar got there running to his left from sweeper, but he fumbled

1 run, dropped, tough chance though! Fizz the man there at short third man. Slower delivery wide outside off stump, Iyer checks the dab, gets a leading edge that flies to the left of short third, Fizz moved to his left and dived, but couldn't hold on. Massive moment in the game

FOUR, a dropped catch and then the team's best bowler has been carted away for four next ball. Five runs off 2 balls and the asking rate is only around 9. Short of a length delivery on the stumps, batsman pulls powerfully and there's no one at deep square leg to stop the boundary
FOUR, slower ball alright, but this is way outside off stump, Iyer delays the cut shot, puts it past backward point and the man sweeping the off-side boundary could not cut it off as well

1 run, another catch put down and it's Fizz again. You don't deserve to win if you are going to field like that. That stare from Rohit Sharma tells it all. Silence all around the Wankhede. Good length delivery outside off stump, Iyer backs away and slices it, went to the right of short third man, easy catch and he spills it

FOUR, there is deep square leg, there is deep mid-wicket but batsman has expertly split them both with a well timed pull shot. bowler went normal pace on this short ball and it didn't rise high enough for Iyer to be troubled

FOUR, that's a quality hit from batsman but hang on, why on earth did you bowl normal pace bowler? Full and wide outside off stump, batsman drills the drive over cover and there's no one in the deep. Great start to the over for DD

SIX, uppish and all the way. Scores level! What a hit under pressure. With a boundary through the off-side previous ball and a field set for the leg-side, batsman knows that the bowler isn't going to bowl outside off stump, so he moves across and flicks this short of length delivery with a strong bottom hand grip to send it clear of the man at fine leg

no run, a hat-trick of dots, you are kidding me! Slower delivery again that spins across, batsman pokes at it and misses. team review just like that, obviously no edge on that. Gee this is unbelievable stuff

FOUR, one bounce and into the cushions. That'll release a bit of pressure off batsman. Picks the length early, rocks back and pulls the shortish delivery over square leg, one bounce and into the fence
SIX, in the arc out of the park. Full length delivery, a knuckle ball and batsman with a lot of authority picks it up over wide long-on, would have been a six on any ground

SIX, ahh, that was even better than the previous six. Short delivery again, batsman transfers his weight on to the back foot and murders it over square leg with a pull, 96 metre biggie that one, this is why he's in the team
FOUR, he's looking unstoppable, just like the team openers were earlier in the day. Pandya dishes a full length delivery around off, batsman stays put and pummels it right over the bowler's head

out Caught by Rohit!! The Fizz strikes, gets the DD skipper. batsman was struggling and his struggle finally comes to an end. Short of a length around off and the opener goes ahead with the pull. As there's a bit extra bounce on the delivery, it catches the top edge and Rohit Sharma at short mid-wicket does the rest. Should have given the strike to Roy who's striking the ball so well. This wicket might affect Roy's mindset now! batsman c Rohit b bowler 15(16) [4s-2]

FOUR, first one of the innings for batsman. This was short and wide outside off and was meant to be put away. batsman doesn't miss out, reaches for it and thrashes it away, beats sweeper cover quite comfortably

FOUR, strong bottom hand on that. Flatter delivery around off and it's short too, batsman drags it away with a firm pull and beats the man at deep mid-wicket this time around, this was a powerful blow by the pocket-sized dynamite
FOUR, reverse swept! Shortish delivery around off, batsman does well to reverse sweep that over short third man, gets four more
SIX, so much power on that. Was a tossed up delivery around off, batsman went down on his knee and smoked it flat over long-off, even a leaping Pollard near the fence couldn't take the catch

FOUR, bowler is not having a good day with the ball. 10 runs in the first over, already 16 off this. Went down on his knee and swept that flighted delivery over square leg nicely, two boundaries and a six in this over
SIX, batsman pumps it! Shimmies down the wicket and towers the flighted delivery right over the bowler's head for six more, straight as an arrow that was
FOUR, and the boundaries continue to flow. Follows it up with a sweet sweep. Loopy delivery around off, batsman goes down and sweeps it firmly towards the long leg fence
SIX, the partnership between batsman and Roy is more than 50! Tossed up delivery around off, batsman puts on his dancing shoes and slaugters it over long-on to bring up Delhi's 100 in style
FOUR, mid-off a touch squarer and this full length delivery finds a way. Driven with a straight bat. Always on with the ball nicely pitched up in your half
FOUR, just a trifle short that and batsman swivels with the incoming angle. Blasts it one-legged in front of the square leg umpire

leg byes, FOUR, leg byes given but looked like there was some bat. Hung over from the last boundary, bowler tries to cramp batsman for room and overdoes it with a gimme down leg. Glanced away for four runs. Who cares if it's off the bat or not..
FOUR, misfielded by Maxwell at mid-on. Flat from bowler, batsman wrists it away and basks in the glory of someone else's plight

out Lbw!! Big, big appeal from the keeper more so than anyone else. Given. Now then, Suryakumar deliberates with his partner for a reasonable amount of time, before taking the review. Did the ball straighten enough, or was it sliding down? It's clipping leg-stump according to ball-tracking. So the umpire's call will stay. What a precious spell this has been from bowler, standing out amid the carnage to remove both the opening batsmen. Suryakumar was quickly down on his knees to sweep this hard, but failed to connect. It didn't grip the pitch much after drifting in, but gripped just enough to be clipping the stump. batsman lbw b bowler 53(32) [4s-7 6s-1]

FOUR, this is beautifully done from batsman. So deft. Perfectly good delivery from bowler, turning in from a length towards off. batsman's intentions are highly concealed all the way through, but just when the ball is about to pass him, he lays the softest of touches to deflect it past the keeper's glove into the third man boundary
FOUR, oh poor delivery. He's fired this well down leg, Kishan sees the opportunity early and paddle-swats it to the fine leg boundary
FOUR, he's bowled pretty short to Kishan so far, and unlike before, this time he's punished for it. Kishan rocks back and thumps his pull over mid-wicket
SIX, oh my, he's brought out the reverse-sweep and it's gone for six. Completely switched his legs around, got blessed with a full toss and walloped it over backward point

SIX, six more to finish the over, ruins the figures of Tewatia. Puts his dancing shoes on, and despite not getting to the pitch of it, he's able to drag it away over the wide long-on boundary. The key was that he went through with it

FOUR, goes for the slower short ball again, but gets it down leg. With fine leg up, batsman only has to help his pull past the fielder in the circle, which he comfortably does after swivelling into the shot
FOUR, 124kph, short of length delivery just outside off, Kishan cheekily dabs it fine of short third man

FOUR, these are weird tactics. Both fine leg and third man are up, so you'd expect the length to be full. But bowler's gone short more often than not. Now agreed, this one rushes Kishan on the pull as he's taken by surprise. But he swings into it and the top-edge balloons past the keeper. Always a risk with this field
2 runs, short of length delivery angled in on middle, 116kph, thwacked through square leg on the front foot. They amble back for two
FOUR, just over extra-cover! 117kph, length ball wide of off, Kishan had to reach out for it but he throws everything and is able to smear it over the fielder

out Bowled!! Switches his legs, looks for the reverse-sweep again but completely misses this full toss. It rams into middle and leg stump from round the wicket. He was doing a decent job of hitting straight, probably didn't need to do that. But a superb knock nevertheless. batsman b bowler 44(23) [4s-5 6s-2]

out Bowled!! Would you believe it, bowler now has two in two. batsman walks out to him first ball, tries to work this length ball round the corner but misses it. The ball gets stuck in his thigh pad and dips behind to knock over off-stump. These are crucial strikes as Delhi hope to reign things back. batsman b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, off-cutter from bowler, but it's right in the slot for Krunal to hammer it over mid-off

out Caught by Roy!! Sliced up in the air, Roy lumbers across from long-off and takes it comfortably. Lovely bowling from bowler. He slanted this off-cutter away from batsman's swiping zone, and it gripped further away from him after pitching. Despite that, batsman doesn't quite smarten up. He swings cross-batted and slices it off the outside half. batsman c Roy b bowler 18(15) [4s-2]

out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! What is happening? It's been lapped straight into the hands of short fine leg, but the umpire has gone upstairs for some reason. Oh wait, his decision was not out, and so Delhi reviewed it immediately. Bizarre. It looked like it came straight off the bat-face. Krunal walks across for the scoop, gets a thick inside edge onto thigh pad and it spoons up to Tewatia. So the decision will be overturned. batsman c Rahul Tewatia b bowler 11(10) [4s-1]

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Another one falls. An off-cutter from bowler, Hardik mistimes the slog off the inside half and holes out. Iyer, it seemed like, had lost it in the sun initially. But he picked it up in time and then sunk low for the grab. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 2(3)

2 runs, dropped by Trent Boult but geez that was a good attempt. Top-edge on the slog-sweep -- told ya that bowler was bowling slower in this over -- Boult runs back from backward square leg, doesn't get beneath the ball but doesn't stay put there. Rushes in front and stops the boundary. Top class athlete with a short term memory loss for good
FOUR, nicely done. He's not giving up. Pitched it right up there again, desperately hoping for some swing, but is driven handsomely down the ground

FOUR, that's box-office chic and very good thinking. Short ball angled across, batsman's ducking initially, then sees that the height isn't much and ramps that over to the third man fence with utter style
SIX, early signs: good pitch against the new ball. Length ball right in batsman's arc and he goes for it. Will go, 10 out of 10 times. Swings it over long-on
FOUR, that's dropped a touch short, so even though it's turning the ball's hittable. batsman rocks back and slaps that disparagingly wide of mid-off

SIX, that's been hit to the ESA kids in the stands. Brings up Mumbai's fastest fifty in IPL. Dragged down from round the wicket, left-handed batsman goes back and clouts it over deep mid-wicket. It was a pull but more casually ruthless
SIX, bowler does this. Drops it harmlessly on a back of a length on leg-stump, and batsman's been served a pie. Helps it over fine leg with a good arm swing
FOUR, now this is a fine, fine yorker.. and look what happens. batsman squeezes it out with an open bat face and has that scooting to the third man fence. Who says cricket's for egalitarians?!

FOUR, let's say bowler's gotten obsessed with bowling yorkers. More yorkers. Better yorkers. He wants redemption for that boundary that batsman hit earlier in the over. Goes for one again, bowls a low full toss on leg-stump instead -- how? why? what? -- and is flicked round the corner
FOUR, from over the wicket and that's been pitched full. Right there to be hit. batsman doesn't even bother about the footwork. Stays put and slamns that through wide mid-off
FOUR, about time we saw a half-volley. All he had to do was stay leg-side of the ball and deflect it with an open bat face. Does so, and it's a boundary through cover-point

FOUR, another. Keep 'em counting. Another half-volley, and this one's been scorched through covers with an elegant bat flow. The deliveries remain the same, only batsman's shots are evolving into something more telegenic
SIX, this is unreal unravelling of bowler, and Delhi Daredevils. Slower on a length say, batsman clears his front leg and sends it romping over long-off. More timing than anything else
SIX, it's a slower googly from bowler, which allows batsman to come down the track and lever it over straightish long-on

out Caught by Roy!! Looked like a googly but replays show it's a quick slider, angling across from over the wicket, which gets the wicket. batsman shimmies down the track, isn't quite to the pitch of the ball and ends up slicing it to long-off, where Jason Roy runs in and takes the catch reverse-cupped. batsman c Roy b bowler 48(28) [4s-4 6s-4]

2 runs, now he's hanging the ball flat in the air. Full, worked to long-on and that's a half-century for batsman off 29 balls. Second of his career. Wankhede crowd go berserk with the flags. Quite blue.

FOUR, that's a cracking shot. Width on offer and Lynn makes the most of it. Short and wide outside off, throws his bat at it and crunches it past the fielder at point, races away to the fence in no time

FOUR, Williamson pulls off a blinder, almost. Good length delivery around off, Lynn goes ahead with his lofted shot and miscues it over mid-off, Williamson goes back running, extends his right arm but can't take the catch, the ball crawls away to the long-off boundary
FOUR, throws his hands at another ball drifting away and shoots an outside edge over the two fielders behind square on the off-side

out Caught by Williamson!! This is just a culmination of what was brewing. bowler's getting the ball to drift away, batsman's throwing his bat and getting lucky. Not this time. Off the toe-end, there's Williamson at wide long-on, having covered some ground from mid-wicket and tumbling behind to take this one. Lovely catch. He's on fire in the field, is Williamson, this IPL. batsman c Williamson b bowler 9(10) [4s-1]

out Caught&Bowled!! bowler's stretched into double his height with this sideways dive and taken this left-handed inches above the ground. A bit of replays there to ascertain the dismissal but that's out. Kolkata crowd knows it. Arm-ball again that sticks a bit in the pitch, batsman's making room down leg and can only tamely pop it back down the pitch. And then bowler takes over. batsman c and b bowler 49(34) [4s-7 6s-1]

SIX, Hooda's flown in the air, caught it reverse-cupped and strewn that back in the playing field. Or has he? Nah, the left foot just hits the deep point ropes. Russell throws his arms at the width, with weight still on the front foot. Just throwing his arms..

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Manish Pandey, that's some catch. But what's Russell upto? Another one that he totally wanted to hit into the stands. Stays leg-side of the ball and wafts, and ends up slicing it. Into the night sky, Manish Pandey runs back from backward point, with his back to the ball, and leaps in front to take that. There was third man in the vicinity too but he just leaves it to Manish, and for the right reasons. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 9(5) [6s-1]
FOUR, back of a length delivery, punched exquisitely behind point

out Caught by Shakib!! bowler is too good for a debutant. Takes the pace off again with his knuckles and gets the ball to dart away. And batsman, overcommitted on the front foot, reaches out, only to slice that over to extra cover. batsman c Shakib b bowler 3(9)
FOUR, another leg break, batsman waits and waits before dabbing that just wide of the keeper. Boundary through third man

2 runs, Rashid thinks he has batsman LBW and Williamson reviews.. Missed his sweep there, deflecting the ball to short fine leg. And guess what, he hasn't missed it. It's taken the under-side of the glove and gone to short fine leg, who with a wide throw at the bowler's end allowed the second
SIX, what a price to pay. Slower ball again, batsman picks it up and mauls the free-hit ball over long-off

out Caught by Saha!! These knuckle balls are sticking in the pitch and darting away. batsman gets a top-edge on his attempted flat-batted swish, for the keeper to take a good catch few paces to his right. batsman c Saha b bowler 29(27) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, the power of Lynn on that shot will take that away to the fence. Slower delivery, the knuckle ball by Bhuvi, Lynn backs away and goes through with his horizontal slap, beats the man at mid-on and finds the fence. Wasn't middled properly but those muscles help him

out Caught by Saha!! batsman thought that he would get away with it but DRS comes to Sunrisers' rescue. Short delivery outside off, Robin tries to run that down to third man but ends up getting a slight edge to that. UltraEdge confirms the same and the ploy to open with batsman has back fired. batsman c Saha b bowler 3(8)

FOUR, crunched away! Good length delivery angled away from the batsman, Rana rocks back and slams that through the gap at point, lightning speed on that as the batsman gets his first boundary, on the first ball. Positive start for the southpaw

out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Imagine Bhuvneshwar escaping a collision with Stanlake.. he offers a smile but I think it's for more than just pulling off this catch. It's relief personified. Another knuckle ball this from Kaul, batsman reaches out and pops it behind off the toe-end. It's Bhuvi's catch at short fine leg but there's Stanlake, rushing past the keeper to attempt to take this. Just about evades his teammate to my relief. batsman c Bhuvneshwar b bowler 7(8)
FOUR, slapped away! Knuckle delivery, fraction short and outside off, Lynn frees his arms and goes aerial, evades cover-point with a cut and manages to get four runs

FOUR, lucky favoring Lynn tonight. This is a slower delivery again, full in length around off, the big man swings hard at it and manages to get an inside edge, past the stumps, past the man at short fine leg and into the fence

FOUR, glorious! He's off to a flier, like always. This is a full length ball and well outside off, Lynn doesn't miss out and drills it through covers, right into the gap, Kaul greeted with 14 runs, quite expensive.
SIX, that's massive. Such sweetly it was timed. Picks the googly early, gets down on his knee and slog sweeps it over mid-wicket, high and handsome that was
FOUR, ends the over with a cracking boundary. This was short and width was there, enough for the batsman to go ahead with his square cut and find the fence

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Excellent grab by Manish that, fumbles on the first attempt but manages to hold on as he's about to hit the ground. Was short and wide outside off, Rana cut that hard to point where a rather sharp Manish pulled off a screamer. Replays confirm that the catch was taken and team strike right aftter the break. bowler is absolutely loving this, bounce and pace has helped him put the pressure on Rana as he gets his scalp. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 18(16) [4s-2 6s-1]

1 run, Manish Pandey is on fire in the field tonight, as he almost pulls off yet another stunner. Leaps up in the air near the boundary, takes the catch and parries it away as he's about to hit the ground. batsman walked down the track and lofted that to long-on where Pandey plucked it, parried it and tried to take it on the second attempt with a desperate dive, but hard luck. Could have been six on any other day.

SIX, that's high, miles up in the air... Was the knuckle ball and Lynn went hard at it, towers it up towards long-off where Rashid settles underneath but goes for it only with his left hand, gets a bit on that and eventually parries it over the fence. Was a very tough chance that, difficult to spot those in the night sky
FOUR, another inside edge and Lynn survives. Fullish around off, Lynn swings hard at it and gets an inside edge past the leg-stump, moves on to 46* with that boundary
FOUR, first runs off the bat from batsman and team. It was on the stumps, batsman gets in the position quickly and whips it wide of the fine leg fielder for a four
FOUR, just over of the square leg fielder. It was on a good length and outside off, batsman pulls it off the front root, manages to clear the fielder and ball races for a four

FOUR, another short of length delivery, batsman gets into position quickly and pulls it in front of square for a four. He doesn't time it as well as he would have liked but the placement is good enough
FOUR, batsman puts this away. Much needed release of pressure. Short googly from Yadav, the team captain sits back and pumps it through mid-wicket
FOUR, four more. Two short balls in a row from Yadav. He'll be disappointed by this. Googly on leg-stump, batsman picks length early, gets down low and swats it through backward square
FOUR, batsman swivels into the pull but is clearly hurried by this short of length delivery. He's lucky that the top-edge has flown over the keeper's head
FOUR, now goes over mid-off! He was actually done in by the slower ball, as evidenced by his bottom hand coming off, but more importantly, he went through with it

SIX, woah, the ball has gone skimming over the third man boundary. Boy he hit this hard. Short and wide, a ferocious slash from batsman. Gets all of it. Massive over in the context of the game - 16 off it. team back in control

SIX, batsman uses the pace of Mavi, all 140kph of it, and whips the pull away over long leg. What a brilliant shot. He swivelled across, remained on the front foot while pushing his weight back and used his wrists gloriously

out Bowled!! Through him. Flat through the air from bowler, zoots it through batsman who's on the prowl down the pitch. Never allowed him to get anywhere close to the ball, cramped him up and it deflected off his pad onto middle stump. Do team still have hope here? batsman b bowler 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]

no run, now then, there's a review from team for leg-before. Hooda didn't pick a googly from bowler and was hit on the back pad. But in real time, it looked like the impact may have been outside off. Oh wait, there's an inside edge too. So that's that
1 run, another out-swinger on a good length, punched down to long-off. Brings up the fifty for batsman. He has to finish this off for his team, lest the follow the route they took against Mumbai

out Caught by A Russell!! batsman flicks this straight into the hands of square leg, what a soft dismissal! He immediately throws his head back, not able to believe what he's just done. Good length ball on leg-stump, and this is a loose shot from the captain. Just so lacklustre. This could get interesting. batsman c A Russell b bowler 50(44) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, Pathan kills the crowd's enthusiasm, crashes this full ball through extra cover. What a hit. He nailed this drive to the fence

FOUR, hoists this over extra-cover. Pathan's stepping up to the occasion against his former franchise. Back of length delivery outside off, he gets it close to the bottom of the bat but there's enough on the drive to clear cover
SIX, that will be it. The team dugout rises as Pathan pulls this short ball into the stands. team pull off their first win at the Eden Gardens
FOUR, bowler is becoming predictable here with his length. It was on a short of length again, batsman holds his shape and pulls it over square leg for another four.
FOUR, another slower ball outside off from bowler. batsman reads the change in pace and drives it through the off-side for a four

FOUR, cracking shot! It was touch fuller of good length, batsman lofts it wide of the mid-on fielder for a four. he played that shot with a straight bat and that made it even better. Minimum risk and effective result!

out Caught by Karthik!! team gets the much needed breakthrough. batsman doesn't even wait for the finger to go up as he walks back. It was an off-spinner down the leg-side, batsman gets a faint tickle to it and Karthik behind the stumps makes no mistake. batsman c Karthik b bowler 24(15) [4s-5]
FOUR, beautiful use of the feet from batsman. He comes down the track and drives it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four
FOUR, goes on the back foot in a flash and drives it through cover for another four. Stellar timing from the skipper

out Bowled!! bowler is on fire! His second wicket in that many overs. He is ensuring that team remains in the game. It was an off-spinner and batsman was late onto it, trying to play across the line. Ball hits his pads and goes onto hit the stumps. batsman will be gutted with this shot. batsman b bowler 7(7) [4s-1]

out Lbw!! Pandey was chatting with Williamson regarding the review but umpire says time is up and batsman will have to depart. It was a flighted delivery which turned in after pitching, batsman's bat was behind the pads and ball raps him on the pads. It looked adjacent, the only question was whether it was going down the leg-side. Umpire thinks it wasn't and he raises his finger slowly in a stylish manner. batsman lbw b bowler 4(11)

FOUR, McCullum is off the mark and so is team, that too in style. Short and wide outside off, Brendon punches it hard towards cover and a misfield by Samson results in a boundary. He has scored 91* but can't take fielding lightly

out Caught by Stokes!! Whatta catch that! Eye-candy that take was. Was a short delivery around off, McCullum rocked back and pulled it hard to deep mid-wicket where Stokes timed his jump and he was in the air as he reverse cupped it. Probably one of the best catches of the season. batsman c Stokes b bowler 4(4) [4s-1]

FOUR, elegance personified there. Full length delivery outside off, batsman walks down the track and creams his drive, through the gap at cover and there's no stopping that, such was the precision in the placement

FOUR, Chinnaswamy erupts as batsman smokes one. Backs away, reaches for it and slams the length delivery over covers, one bounce and into the fence. Was middled to perfection, sweet sound of the willow too

FOUR, another impressive shot. After two shots on the off-side, batsman gets one through the on side. Moves towards the pitch of the delivery, keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket. Three boundaries already in the over. This is going to be an exciting run chase if batsman keeps playing like this

out Caught by D Arcy Short!! He's got him, he's got him. bowler is running around with an arm raised. Pretty much a half-tracker which batsman pulls in the vicinity of deep mid-wicket. It's D'Arcy Short there, who leaps across for an excellent take. Oh what a game-changer this. batsman c D Arcy Short b bowler 57(30) [4s-6 6s-2]

FOUR, slower back of length ball again, this time there's a little bit of width which allows AB to carve it away between backward point and short third man. It was uppish, but the placement was spot on

out Caught by Unadkat!! bowler has turned this game right on its head. First Kohli, and now batsman. team should really back themselves from here. Another half-tracker really, but batsman doesn't get hold of his pull and hits it straight towards long leg. Unadkat seemed to have misjudged it initially, but he's able to make amends by taking an excellent low catch. Wry smile on batsman's face. He could have hit this anywhere. Just not his day. batsman c Unadkat b bowler 20(18) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, nailed over long-on. Gentle off-break from bowler which is right in the slot. batsman grounds his back knee and wallops it through the line

out Caught by Buttler!! Done in by the off-cutter. batsman tries flicking it through mid-wicket, but there was enough cut on the ball to take a thick outside edge. Good take from Buttler diving forward, should help his bruised confidence. batsman c Buttler b bowler 3(4)
FOUR, normal pace from bowler this time, batsman uses those extra 10kph and slices it away through backward point. Nicely done
SIX, punishes the slower ball this time. He set himself up for it and launched it over wide long-on

FOUR, short of length delivery outside off, batsman slices the cut away through backward point. The ball spun away from sweeper cover who dived too early and fell at least 3 feet short of getting to it
FOUR, bowler not having a great time here. Bowls this full and wide outside off, batsman stretches across and slices it for another boundary, this time wide of third man

SIX, parried over the ropes for six! Gowtham was standing around 5 yards inside the boundary, stretched his arm out while back-pedaling but never looked like taking it. May have been a different story had he been all the way back. Slower short of length delivery, sits up for Sundar who thwacks it down the ground
FOUR, these are all useful runs to reduce the margin of defeat. Surely they can't win this can they? bowler misses his yorker by a couple of inches and is sliced away over backward point
SIX, now carves this slower ball inside-out for six. Wow. Clean strike from batsman who picked the variation early and smoked it into the crowd. Brings the crowd to life

out Bowled!! How unlucky is this for Sundar. He's lapped this full toss right off the bat-face onto middle stump. Walked across, got down low, and set himself up perfectly. But just couldn't get under it unfortunately to gain the elevation needed. batsman b bowler 35(19) [4s-1 6s-3]
FOUR, gets inside this short of length delivery and helps the pull over short fine leg. It was really well done because this was a slower ball and there really wasn't a lot of pace to work with
FOUR, slower ball which swings away from batsman. He gets down low, uses the swing and slices it past short third man. Wonderful batting
FOUR, just short of the yorker mark, and batsman takes toll by hammering it down the ground for four. Really good showing from him, even though in a losing cause
FOUR, batsman continues to deal in boundaries. Rocks back, picks the length early and punches it through the gap at covers again, away she goes, into the fence

FOUR, first one of the innings for batsman. He has joined the skipper now. Flatter in trajectory and outside off, batsman doesn't miss out on it and slaps it through the gap at covers, he needs to play along with Kohli if team want to make a match out of it. Can't be chased alone this target
FOUR, beautiful! Pitches it on middle and leg, batsman makes sure to send it to the long-on fence with a fine on-drive, team... team... are the chants all across the stadium
FOUR, there's no stopping these two. Tossed up delivery around off, batsman reaches for it with a shimmy and times his chip over long-off, quality shot

FOUR, another one! The bowlers have no answers to this brilliance by the team pair. The left hand - right hand combination is make it difficult for the bowlers. This was floated on middle and batsman went down on his knee to sweep it through square leg
FOUR, "welcome into the attack Mr bowler," says batsman. Picks the length on that short one early and makes sure to pummel it over mid-wicket, he's in the zone guys.
1 run, 50-run stand up with that single as batsman drags it away to deep mid-wicket, the crowd thought it was in the gap, but it wasn't

FOUR, can't bowl such freebies to a batsman of this class. It's a juicy full toss outside off, batsman brings his bat down in time and angles it past the fielder at point, he's toying with the field here, finding those gaps with ease
FOUR, right into the gap there! Shortish delivery on middle and leg, batsman goes back and pulls it with authority beating the man at deep mid-wicket
SIX, smoked it! batsman's one hand came off but then too he manages to get a six. One hand or two hands, doesn't matter. Was a floated delivery around off and batsman towered it over long-on

out Caught by Unadkat!! Failed with the bat earlier today but makes up for it with this huge wicket. Bowls a shortish delivery on the pads and batsman who looks to put it away with a pull finds the fielder in the deep, it's Unadkat who grabs it. Wait on... it's AB who walks out to bat in next. Get ready for some more fireworks! batsman c Unadkat b bowler 26(19) [4s-4]
1 run, 31st IPL fifty for batsman! team want him to get a big one tonight, he's not done yet. Was a loopy delivery that was driven down to long-on

SIX, insult to injury! Missed on a wicket on the last ball and goes for a six on the very next ball. Shortish delivery, a half-tracker and batsman pummels it over wide long-on for a towering six, that was huge again
SIX, only one hand on that. Full length delivery outside off, batsman goes for it with full swing and manages to clear covers
FOUR, juicy. He's in some weird mood, happy to go horizontally right away, gets that length that sits up, hoping to be smacked. Obliged. Airy over mid-wicket
FOUR, that sitting up length. On the tummy, quite batsman' staple. He stays up, lets it get in his arc and heaves. Those muscles .. through mid-wicket

SIX, blimey, what a blow! Some momentum into the team innings now. This was fired fuller around middle and leg, batsman held his shape and swung through the line. Sent it soaring over long-on for a biggie

FOUR, high quality shot! Why move around the in the crease and swipe when you can play shots like this. This was full and quite wide as well, batsman played the square drive late to bisect short third man and backward point with precision. Top stuff!!
SIX, ahhhh, this is vintage batsman! Back of a length around middle and leg, easy for him as he swivels just a touch before drop kicking this over deep fine leg. Easy pickings

out Bowled!! Chopped on! Massive strike from bowler, just like he did in his previous over. The leg spinner to a left-hander is always a double-edged sword, this wicket proves it. Slows this down and drags it wider outside off, batsman wanted to fetch it with a slog sweep but only managed a thick under edge that clattered onto the woodwork. Just when this partnership was gearing up to go up another level, it was been halted. batsman b bowler 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]
FOUR, signature batsman start! Wastes no time to get going. Brings out the reverse sweep and takes this on the full, makes enough connection to beat a diving backward point. Finds the fence

byes, FOUR, geee, that's beaten everyone! Comedy of errors really. batsman went for premeditated paddle, de Kock anticipated and was en route to his left already but guess what, the stroke didn't connect and the ball went through the yawning gap between first slip and the keeper
SIX, hammered away! batsman is on the rampage now. Of course, half-trackers like these help as well. Was on the back foot in a jiffy and smashed the pull over deep mid-wicket

FOUR, edged but no slip! You don't expect one at this stage of a T20 inning either for most bowlers. Lovely piece of bowling from bowler, floated up nicely to invite the drive from batsman and forced the edge as well. Too hard for de Kock and it raced past him to the fence
SIX, gobbles up the Free Hit! Umesh is having a horror day. This is a full toss on leg, batsman just shuffles a touch and mows it over deep mid-wicket. Deep into the crowd

SIX, just over deep mid-wicket! Slower and a fraction short from bowler, batsman sits on the back foot and went through with the pull shot. Didn't quite middle this as much as he would have wanted, still got it over McCullum who tried with all his might

1 run, another excellent yorker, it's been a top over from bowler thus far. batsman squeezes it out towards point to get to his 8th IPL fifty! Is this the breakthrough season he wanted? Has definitely started that way

SIX, deep into the crowd! batsman has activated the beast mode, danger signs for team if they don't get him quickly. Back of a length around middle and off, batsman sat on the back foot and smoked it way over deep mid-wicket. Huge biggie

SIX, what a beautiful shot! Jeepers, this kid is such a delight to watch when on song. Such class! Full and outside off, his bat face did turn in his hands but he got it dead straight even then. Cleared long-off easily

SIX, batsmannnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn! What quality strokeplay! Fullish ball around middle and leg, batsman makes room by backing away lot and just goes through with the extension of the loft down the ground. Such timing and over long-off again it is, deeper this time. 16 off the over!

out Caught by Kohli!! Soft dismissal! bowler tried the yorker but ended up delivering a pacy low full toss. batsman just tried to check the lofted stroke, perhaps got a touch late on it and ended up chipping it straight to mid-off where the team skipper swallowed it up. He's wearing an animated look on his face as well. Vital wicket this for team, batsman could easily have a made a difference of about 10 runs. batsman c Kohli b bowler 23(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

SIX, hammered into long-on! batsman's merry ways continue. He is batting on another level now. Slower ball on a shortish length, he just waits for it and slaps through the line. No real effort there, at least not visible but gee the timing, ever so perfect! Another biggie

FOUR, gets it away very, very fine! Didn't intend to get it that fine perhaps but he won't mind, will he? The perfect yorker from bowler but batsman digs it out with an open bat face. Manages to slice itwell past a diving de Kock to the fence. When it's your day, it's just your day!

FOUR, didn't I tell you that this is his day? batsman survives once more. Fuller ball and he goes for the lofted stroke over cover. For a moment, the man at sweeper cover thought he had a chance but was late I guess. Put in a late dive and it bounced before him, then sped through to the fence

SIX, H-U-G-E! For a change, it's not Samson who hits a biggie. The young batsman joins in the fun now and boy, he has clubbed this almost into the top tier of the ground. Slower and fuller, tries to follow the batsman but batsman is equal to the task. Makes room and clubs it easily over long-on. The crowd had to take cover there
FOUR, bleeding runs! Slower and short, the leg stump line doesn't help and batsman swivels to pull it easily over square leg. Another boundary
SIX, no stopping batsman here! As if he needed a Free Hit to hit them big. Very full from Yadav and batsman gets under it with ease, clubbed comfortably over long-off. Ho ho ho!!

SIX, this time over deep extra cover! Incredible stuff from batsman, it's been an exhibition from him this afternoon. Full and wide outside off, he just makes room to lift it over the sweeper cover fence for a boundary. Unstoppable!
FOUR, thank the injury. When you can't run, you slog. batsman sits, uses the line already down leg to sweep. Hard. Behind square. One-bounced
SIX, now downtown. Sundar overcorrects going fuller, batsman steps away, gives his hands room. And they swing, into the sightscreen
FOUR, backs away in the crease, converts it into one in his slot and goes all bottom-handed in lofting into cow corner. One way of avoiding run-outs
FOUR, hoick. Mid-wicket. Again. It's getting familiar. Another friendly length for batsman to get under and smoke it down

FOUR, on the sweep. Never mind the top-edge, the powerplay is his ally. His stride doesn't quite get him to the pitch of it, the spin's big too. But these big bats allow him to clear square leg, and that's enough
FOUR, oh these nice float-ups. Short ain't getting foxed, lets it dip. Loads up. Might swing. And flat down the ground

FOUR, he's toying around. May his leg never recover. Makes bowler bowl straight, threatening a move around. But sways inside the line, flat-batted and hammers it round the corner. Pile on the powerplay

out Caught by U Yadav!! There's the miscue. It was coming. This entire stay was so un-batsman. Slogging, but with good reason. So he gets a fuller-slower one now, he's camping on his back foot, goes to smoke it straight over. Doesn't time, gets it off the bottom half, flies high. And down mid-on's backtracking reverse cup. batsman c U Yadav b bowler 36(20) [4s-6 6s-1]

out Caught by de Kock!! Oh dear. A teasing half-tracker, with generous width, asking to be slapped. Short does the needful, gets deep in the crease, lines up and throws his bat out in looking to cut it away. There's a hint of spit up, enough to grope a fat chunk on the top-edge. And Quinton's ever-so-sharp. batsman c de Kock b bowler 11(17) [4s-1]
SIX, spots the length. It's that in-between one, and batsman makes it look worse. Swivels, pulls and heaves without bothering to keep it down. All brute
FOUR, throws his hands out. He's already given himself width with his exposed stance. Swings, uppish and slices it with ease over point. Never mind the mistime

FOUR, 137.7kph. Turns cheeky. Mohit tries to correct, getting the channel close to off, but batsman's not getting foxed. He stays back, arches and ramps it ever so late, teasing the man at short third
FOUR, short ball, this time Yuvraj does not have time to react. The ball races away towards his right and into the fence
1 run, fullish and outside off stump, batsman guides it towards point

SIX, finally a maximum! The asking rate is up high, the runs weren't flowing and batsman gets a much needed six. Read the slower ball very early, moved across the stumps and waited for the short ball to come and smashed the ball into the backward square leg fence

out batsman Run Out!! Mix-up and the captain fires a direct-hit from extra-cover. Look at him roar. team's best batsman on show thus far has been sent back. Massive setback. batsman drove this full ball straight to Ashwin at extra-cover and set off, Dhoni said no straightaway - probably because of the niggle on the lower back.
