SIX, that's why he eats those dots. He knows he can make up for it big time. Flighted delivery on the leg stump, batsman gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps it from the middle of the bat over square leg

FOUR, he's muscled that! Look at that ball go so flat and one bounce into the wide long-off fence. Slower delivery outside off stump, batsman steps out and the ball sat up nicely for batsman to free his arms and smash

FOUR, oh that's a timely hit! Slower ball on the shorter side, batsman made room, lost balance but managed to cut that nicely over cover-point and there's no protection in the deep. 12 off the over, 55 more needed

FOUR, in the airrr, could be out, oh the fielder makes a mess of it. Low full toss, batsman slogs, should have been held at deep mid-wicket, Dagar the sub wasn't quick enough to move forward, he dived but let it pass. He's immediately moved out of that position

SIX, oh that's gone a loooong way into the stands. Stand and deliver stuff! Full and in the slot, bowler goes for the yorker, misses the yorker by some mark and batsman gets under it to send it over deep mid-wicket
1 run, that was a wide ball but batsman chose to have a swing at it, mistimed with one hand to long-off and that's fifty for the captain. No celebrations but he gets a big applause from everyone
SIX, he's smoked that away, Jaddu! This is the second time he's hit a big shot despite being off balance. Slower delivery from bowler, batsman somehow connects and gets enough power to clear long-on
1 run, oh he's missed a big hit here. Full and outside off stump, better of going over cover but knowing batsman, he believes in muscling the ball rather than lofting over cover

out Caught by Ashwin!! That's mistimed and only goes as far as cover. Normal seam-up delivery, full again for a big hit, batsman wanted to go over long-off, sliced it high in the air and the team makes no mistake. Important thing is Dhoni has crossed over and will be on strike now. batsman c Ashwin b bowler 19(13) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, smashedddd! Why are you not bowling slower balls bowler? Strange! Length ball, goodbye! You are asking for trouble. batsman actially felt some pain after launching this over deep mid-wicket

FOUR, talk about presence of mind and there's batsman with a bit of deftness. Short ball with third man inside the ring, unbelievable from the bowler. batsman spots the field, just guides the ball over the infield to the third man fence. Sehwag smiles from the dug out

SIX, can you believe it? An injured MS batsman has hit a six with one hand. Take a bow sir! Low full toss, no one at deep square, batsman backs himself, has an excellent willow in his hand and swings across the line and over the boundary line

FOUR, he's squeezed this in the gap. There were three fielders behind square on the off-side - point, backward point and short third man, yet batsman finds the gap. Can't blame the bowler for bowling a wide yorker, he bowled to the field

out Caught by Barinder!! Too cute, and that's never ideal. Mohit gets his line wrong, slipping into the legs, but he's neatly disguised this slower back-hander. batsman's fooled as he loads up and commits to swipe it, knowing there's nobody at fine leg. Goes through early, gets a fat splice and short fine pockets the balloon. batsman c Barinder b bowler 11(9) [4s-2]
FOUR, all timing. Back, lining himself behind and drills it to mid-off's right. Ashwin isn't the quickest, manages a palm. The outfield isn't Punjab's ally either

SIX, he's hit this all the way but it won't matter - full ball outside off stump, batsman lofts it to over long-off. team have escaped home by 4 runs. Oh these team games and run chases. They get so deep. You got to admire this man - MS batsman. Injured very early in the innings, takes some treatment, takes it upon himself and almost takes his side home.
SIX, roll back the clock - it's that batsman of the old. Sran goes short, eventually sitting up and batsman smokes, flat-batting it big into cow corner
FOUR, on the charge, converts the length into his arc and on-tonks. Not the legs, but nobody's cutting this off with nobody in the vicinity of long-on

out Caught by Barinder!! So damn ungainly. batsman sheds his grace, well you have to when you are chasing 200, ends up one-handed. So it was the knuckle ball, Tye's staple, batsman gets down the track in trying to dispatch it into long-off. FOUR, too straight. Never an ideal follow up delivery, never an ideal any delivery. batsman's quick to pounce, shuffles inwards and tucks, splitting the gap between the keeper and short fine
FOUR, a heap of runs. A half-tracker, then the googly starting from middle and spinning well down leg. batsman isn't happy pocketing a wide, he reaches leg-sided, connects and heaves it into fine leg

out Lbw!! bowler runs to appeal. He wants an LBW. But the umpire's given runs. When you are the skipper and the bowler, you don't consult anybody. We're upstairs. It started with batsman shuffling, exposing his stumps and sweeping. bowler smartly slips in the quicker one, bang in line with the stumps. UltraEdge shows no edge. FOUR, drags the length down. Very defensively. batsman doesn't have time to pat things back tonight. He chases, hard, and powers it behind point
FOUR, doesn't matter what spinner this is - it's a full toss, down leg. batsman's on a knee, sweeping, slogging, everything
FOUR, oh the deft. Some width, batsman's surgical, waiting on it, shedding that brutal muscle, putting some nerves to use, dabbing it between point and short third
FOUR, breaks the barrier of respect and drives it on the up, uppishly. Over cover and into the fence. The ball was in the zone and the batsman did not hold back to smack it away

FOUR, ho ho ho!! That was creamed away. Length ball, dangling away and the batsman eases the cover drive away into the gap. The ball speeds away into the fence. Again the ball curved away but the neat footwork towards the line of the ball ensured the batsman had it covered. Action-packed start
FOUR, leaning drive! Classical touch play with a big stride forward and the ball screams past cover for a four. Slightly flatter it might have been and the batsman got it away. That would help
SIX, hit through the line and off she goes into the stands. Seam-up, half-volley on the stumps, Agarwal bends his back knee and smokes it over long-on. Off the meat of the bat

out Caught by Tahir!! Watto strikes! Removes his former team teammate. FOUR, picked the gap beautifully did batsman. Short ball at 123.6kph, batsman picked the length early. Stood tall and pummeled the pull between long-on and deep mid-wicket

FOUR, follows the bumper with a yorker and batsman brings his bat down at the right time. Manages to get some wood off the cue end and the ball goes fine of the man at short third man. Bravo is appealing! For what? Bat before the wicket? Was clearly off the bat

out Caught by Jadeja!! Agarwal holes out! A mistimed loft and he finds one of the safest pairs in the world. The leg-break on the stumps and Agarwal moved leg-side to go downtown. out Lbw!! Aaron batsman is given OUT lbw. Back-to-back golden ducks for him. He has reviewed. That looked plumb. Let's see. Fair delivery. No bat. Three reds and he is outta here. Here's the comeback from team. It was the quick googly from bowler and batsman definitely didn't pick that. Presses forward to block and got rapped on the front leg in front of off. FOUR, good shot to get off the mark. In-drifter, slightly errs in line. Too straight and batsman's wrists does the rest. Flicks it through mid-wicket

out Caught by Dhoni!! The teamians go up, batsman starts to walk. Doesn't wait for the umpire's decision. The cross-seamed short ball from Shardul Thakur and that's the reason for the extra bounce. batsman read the length and line, but couldn't account for that tad extra bounce. FOUR, bad ball and batsman takes full toll of it. Length ball on the pads, tickled away fine to fine leg

out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni catches and batsman has to walk back to the dressing room. That's not something we are used to. FOUR, team have not done their homework. That was short again and the batsman stays back to pull the ball away with a lot of control. The man at deep fine had no chance
FOUR, short ball again, the batsman does not time the pull away. But he gets enough meat on it and sends it past mid-on for a four. Fifty up for team. All carnage at Mohali
SIX, that is into a parallel universe from the universe boss. Length ball was like a dead meat and batsman picks the bones out of it. Over cow corner for a mighty six. That was poor bowling

FOUR, full toss on the pads and batsman adds four to his tally. That was clipped away and the slide from the man at deep mid is not good enough

1 run, Curran shortens his length outside off, steered to the left of cover-point. batsman waits for the ball to pass the fielder and then jogs across for a single

SIX, off the mark with a six. That's what he can do. Can recover momentum and up the rate so quickly. This was a full delivery on the stumps, batsman connected well and sent the ball over wide long-on, he needed that for his own confidence and for the team's sake

no run, bowler is jumping for an lbw appeal. Does not get it and Gambhir takes it. To the naked eye, looked like an under edge. Need UltraEdge to confirm. No bat. So we move on. Impact? Outside the line and that is such a poor review and DD burn their only review. Was very full to be sweeping, batsman went for it and managed to get himself outside the line

no run, DK has been given out lbw. By umpire Nand Kishore. Looks a dodgy decision. That's why the team skipper went for the review straight away. UltraEdge shows a big spike and the crowd cheer. SIX, that is a magnificent shot. For a moment he was cramped by the short of length delivery into the body, but he adjusted at the last moment and slashed it into his team's dugout at the third man fence. Needed to get it fine and did so

2 runs, fantastic work by Roy from long-on, but he can't get to the ball, in fact gets a fingertip on that on the dive forward. SIX, he is unreal. When it comes to hitting a cricket ball. The predictable short delivery arrives, with no pace or height, brutalised over mid-wicket. The Kolkatans have gone mental at the Eden
SIX, now batsman gets into the act. Short ball and batsman pulls handsomely over deep mid. Looked like he was waiting on the back foot for that one and when it came, didn't miss out

SIX, my word. There's so little margin of error against this beast from Jamaica. A man-mountain. bowler errs by slowing the pace down, lands right in the swinging range of Russell who sends it high into the deep mid stands. Such clean striking!

SIX, straight up in the air, can someone get under this one. What! It has landed over long-off's head. What does he have everyday? Just pass that to all those who want to put on weight. This is jaw-dropping stuff from Russell. Looked like he had pulled the short ball straight up in the air, but such is the power he possesses that it has landed beyond the boundary. What more can I say?
1 run, full on off, batsman looks to flick and the leading edge dribbles to backward point. 50 for batsman and it's his first one in team colors

Superb bowling and that wicket could mean a difference of 20 at least to the eventual score. No big celebrations from bowler, just a fist pump. out Caught by Maxwell!! Tag-team work and batsman is gone. They are checking the height on this. But bowler is fine on that count. batsman didn't get bat on the last delivery, this one he gets a thick edge on the slash and Pant tipped it over the bar, but great anticipation from Maxi at slip who tracked back and pouched it. Alert mind and good cricketing nous from the Australian. Deserved wicket for bowler. batsman c Maxwell b bowler 1(4)

out Caught by Maxwell!! bowler is pumping his fist and punching the air. Three wickets in that over and just one run off it. Fantastic effort from the leggie. batsman too like Chawla charges the bowler and can only find long-on. batsman c Maxwell b bowler 2(3)
FOUR, that is smashed. Belted by batsman as he saw the short of length delivery outside off and didn't hold back. Went aerial over cover-point and gets four

FOUR, he wants to go only one way - through the off-side. This is a good shot, hammers it hard and wide of extra-cover, who didn't dive. It was a quicker one and on the stumps, but batsman found the gap
FOUR, shot. Slightly fuller than a good length on the stumps, batsman just biffed it over the bowler's head. Not a very good connection, but good enough to clear everyone. Breaks the shackles a bit

FOUR, clobbered by batsman. bowler went round the wicket to cramp up the batsman, but provided the ideal length for the Aussie to hit, brutalised past the stumps at the other end. The ball was gone before bowler could stick his boot in

FOUR, nearly holed out. But gets four thanks to Morris' fumble. At long-on. He went for the catch, but the ball bounced in front of him and since he didn't get his body behind the line of the ball, it runs away. Was a full-toss and batsman biffed that in the air
SIX, heaved over deep mid. Sliding on, on the middle and leg line, batsman sunk under that and clouted it high and over mid-wicket

SIX, sheer power. That's all made in the gym. What a shot this is. Must be contending for one of the shots of the tournament so far. This is a length ball on off, batsman went back and used his forearm power to great effect as he flat-batted it dead straight back over the bowler. A flat six. bowler shouldn't feel too disheartened with that hit, it wasn't a bad ball by any stretch of the imagination
FOUR, drags it short, the arm-ball went wrong. Fired it outside off, batsman cuts that hard and eludes a diving cover-point to his left. As soon as he got it past the fielder, it was four
SIX, slog-swept by batsman and six over deep square. Went down quickly and sheer timing on the shot sees the ball sail into the crowd

out Caught&Bowled!! That is bowler's wicket. Full marks for slowing it down and getting purchase from the wicket, which brought about batsman's downfall. He had swept bowler last over for a big six over mid-wicket, but this turns slightly and the top edge goes straight up. This time into the hands of bowler. Just when batsman was looking dangerous he gets out. Has been the story of his life. batsman c and b bowler 35(19) [4s-2 6s-3]
SIX, the slog-sweep from batsman and he has sent it over Morris' head at deep mid. Right in the range for that shot and Rana sent it into the stands
SIX, comes down the track and launches into the lofted hit, gets good height and the desired elevation over deep mid. Clears the fielder
FOUR, now shows his intelligence by sweeping wide of short fine leg. Knows deep square is too square and won't get there, got outside the line and knelt down to play the sweep well

out Bowled!! What a cracker to start! It's a golden duck for batsman. A beaut from Umesh to begin, gets this to nip in a touch from a straightish off stump line. It was full and drew Suryakumar forward but he didn't anticipate the late movement. As a result, ended up playing around it and missed it completely. The woodwork is disturbed and up go the team players in jubilation. Umesh is absolutely pumped. batsman b bowler 0(1)

out Bowled!! Got himmmmm, yess goneeee! Umesh is breathing fire I tell you. If the first one was a good nut, talk about this one! What a corker! Goes full and it's almost the ideal inswinger that lands around off, Kishan plays around it, quite like Suryakumar did and sees the off stump go for a walk. Fab sight for any fast bowler and Umesh is on a hat-trick now, folks! team have started this game with a bang. Pressure mounting on the hosts. batsman b bowler 0(1)

FOUR, classy shot! He has been out of form but strokes like these should set batsman up nicely. Half-volley and not all that wide, but he leans nicely to caress the drive through the covers. Raced away to the fence in no time

SIX, dumped over deep backward square leg! Doesn't take long for batsman to launch. Gets one that's fractionally short and he is on the back foot in a jiffy. Swivels to absolutely clobber the pull. Went deep into the stands

SIX, he's done waiting for something deft. He's down, running, bowler's gone slower as well for some reason. Swings, big time, and it's more a miscue .. never mind when you've got hands like these. Way over long-off
SIX, typically dragged down. batsman' smart, he sits, gets it in his slot and heave-sweeps. Checks the railway tracks behind square leg..the ball's there

out Caught by de Kock!! And the twist comes from a stress-fractured off-cutter. They've realized there's no point in bowling your best ball, and Anderson smartly floats up a slower change up. batsman can't wait, he commits to a lofted slice, loses timing, has the ball grab the upper half of his bat and fly. Fly higher. Over Quinton, who's already messed up a few. He runs behind, under the swirl, comes back and collects. batsman c de Kock b bowler 65(42) [4s-6 6s-5]
FOUR, rubbing insult. A nothing half tracker, drifting down leg and batsman loads up on the back foot, swivelling as he swats it powerfully behind square. One-bounced
SIX, connects. Cleanly at last. And then it's going only one way. bowler tries a flipper, but Krunal with his shuffle gets under, sits under and dispatches it into long-on. Nothing subtle
SIX, raw meat. That length, you are obliged to smack. batsman smokes, swinging flat-batted, into the first tier over square leg

FOUR, now compensated with width too. The length stays short and friendly. batsman carves, doesn't even bother keeping it down, given how fine third man is. And yes, it's a fifty .. his first of this season
FOUR, and now feeds the pads for some reason. Umesh's dealing in binaries here. Whipped away, typically bottom-handed, teasing fine leg
FOUR, angling wide across. batsman in some form, he leans, frees up his hands, taking it head-on in hammering it square. Oh the way he opens up the face in slicing,check the leather!

out Krunal Pandya Run Out!! 1 run completed. More running troubles. Anderson standing in the way and Krunal has to take a step away to ensure he doesn't collide again. Can't afford getting injured. Well the tournament can't afford anyone else getting injured, the replacements aren't leaving their Counties. Right, batsman smashed it down the ground, wants the strike. Pandya has to sacrifice. Hesitated for the second, stopped and takes the longer route. Alas, the dive is too late. Krunal Pandya run out (Woakes/bowler) 15(12) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, that short-wide combo. And batsman has no shortage of time on anything. Gets in line, angry bat, angry hands on the revenge from the run-out he's caused. And into deep point

SIX, oh my. As if the half trackers weren't enough, the hospitality has stretched out to dishing out full tosses on the hips. All batsman has to do is impart direction and that's swiping it into fine leg. A railway tragedy wouldn't be far
SIX, wow. Okay Google - search for descriptions. bowler errs for a change, letting the length sit up in batsman arc .. and that arc's ever-expanding. Flat-bats, high and into long-on. Save your faces

out Caught by de Villiers!! Smart slower stuff. batsman never comfortable when he has to slog without getting set. Today's no different. Doesn't quite get his power right on the cutter that bowler digs into the pitch on length. Tries whacking it over long-on, but AB's there. And he's good to take it reverse-cupped. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 5(7)

no run, a peach. Oh it doesn't get better. And to imagine it coming in the death in the midst of an onslaught. Oh and amidst all this noise, the umpire's heard a tickle. He's given him caught behind. But Pandya isn't amused, he goes up instantly. Why bother consulting your partner with 10 balls to go in the day. And UltraEdge is a murmur all through, but when it passes the bat it gets a little bigger. The sound's deaf. Oh and forget the spikes, the third umpire overturns
SIX, feeds him a revenge gift. Short, on the body, and Pandya swivels, almost base-balling it into the second floor. Where else, but behind square
SIX, and now length. The cardinal length. Pandya rubbing it in and how. Holds his pose, lets the ball get close and clears long-off with his lofted shovel
FOUR, clears his front leg. Goes conventional. Full meat, over the bolwer, and trickling further in. Deadly death batting this
SIX, makes him bowl a full toss. Misses the yorker, the dew isn't helping him either. And batsman doesn't need these, really. You don't have to be this kind. Carved away, deep extra cover
FOUR, another juicy full toss. Oh dear. Oh dear. Flat-batted, heaving it downtown. Oh the bleeding, it's getting painful to watch

out Caught by Woakes!! Real quick. Talk about timing even when you are getting out. batsman backs away, smacks it down long-on's throat. And it's so flat that Pandya can't even cross over. batsman c Woakes b bowler 94(52) [4s-10 6s-5]

FOUR, wrong line and is duly punished. Short of a length and is down leg as well, cannot do that with fine leg in the ring. batsman swivels across for the pull and although it came off the inner half, was always a percentage shot. Beats the fielder in the ring comfortably and races away
FOUR, finishing touches. Make it 21 off the over -- and Pandya's done it with a flash straight down. 213 it will be ..

FOUR, doesn't start well and on this pitch, there is little margin for error. Slightly short and a bit of width as well, batsman sits back and crunches it through the covers. Found the gap and the outfield did the rest

FOUR, super shot! Sundar is being put under pressure here. Flatter and a touch short outside off, batsman waits on the back foot and punches this through the gap at backward point. Lovely stuff! Even Kohli cannot help but applaud the stroke

FOUR, this is getting disastrous for the young off spinner but he has only himself to blame. Another fuller ball down leg, this time batsman doesn't fail to connect. Sweeps it very fine down the leg-side and past the fielder who was in the ring

1 run, close shave for batsman! Didn't put in the dive and trusted his long reach to bail him through. The direct hit at the bowler's end did test him to be frank but the West Indian got through in the end, only just though. It was a nicely floated off break to start with, gripped a touch and forced a leading edge towards backward point. There was a slight stutter in the running before they eventually decided to go ahead with it. No harm done in the end

SIX, welcome to the attack Mr.bowler! batsman is absolutely nonchalant as he dispatches this rubbish short ball way into the stands at deep backward square leg. At his pace, bowler needs to be careful about the lengths he bowls, especially in the Powerplay

FOUR, bleeding runs here! This is a fab counterattack from these two and the team bowlers are wilting under the onslaught. Slower but short with a lot of width, allows batsman to chance his arms with a slap cut through backward point

5 wides, poor from bowler and nothing much de Kock can do about the bad bounce. Tries the variation and it slips outside off, could say that the wide call was marginal but the uneven bounce means that de Kock couldn't get down in time. Races away to the fence

FOUR, raining boundaries! Cannot understand this ploy though, back of a length outside off with third man in the ring. batsman stays back and glides it, just had to beat that man in the 30-yard circle and he does it with ease

SIX, down the pitch and bang! The team skipper has decided to up the ante a little. Shimmies down the track on seeing the flight and the leg-stump line helped as well, launched into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Super shot

FOUR, not Sundar's night at all. Another drag-on, leg-stumpish and these are easy pickings for batsman. Sits back and swivels across to clatter the pull to the deep mid-wicket fence. The offie has been unusually erratic so far

SIX, that's hugeeeeeeeeeeeee! batsman continues on his merry ways. Picks the top spinner quickly and brings out the imperious slog sweep. Huge maximum over deep backward square leg. Brings up his 50! He is looking deadly tonight

FOUR, how hard has he hit this one! Boy, that's some power from batsman. Charges down the track and makes room to create width. The length wasn't all that short but he clobbered it over cover. Rocketed away

FOUR, does it again! batsman is determined not to let his former team teammate settle. Stays in the crease this time and just gets leg-side of the ball a touch before launching it inside out over extra cover. Delicious strokeplay!

1 run, direct hit would have been close! Lewis was certainly in double but Mandeep's throw at the keeper's end misses by a whisker. Was a goner if it had hit. Wide yorker that was squeezed by batsman towards backward point
FOUR, what a shot. bowler overdoes, overpitches and that's too easy for batsman. Gets forward, with a full face of the bat and creams it past mid-on. That boundary will ruin a decent over by bowler

FOUR, is greeted to the crease with a boundary. Flighted on the stumps, batsman gets and sweeps. Gets it more off the top-edge but it sails over behind square. No-one there and they'll collect a boundary

FOUR, uppish and through Pollard's hands at short mid-wicket. Trademark batsman whip. Clears his front leg and swats it off his pads. Pollard leaps but in vain. Races away to the boundary at deep mid-wicket
FOUR, this is tripe. Gift packed and delivered to batsman. Flat and short outside off, batsman goes back and thrashes it through cover
FOUR, lovely hit inside-out by Washi! The googly from bowler, seemed to have picked that from the hand, got a stride forward and lofted that beautifully over cover

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! He got smashed in the first over, but he's got three wickets now. The widish delivery across the left-hander, Sundar mistimes the lofted drive over cover, hits it high and straight to long-off. Celebration time for bowler. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 7(8) [4s-1]

FOUR, he's guided this in the gap past backward point and it's running away for four. It was the slower delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz gets the placement right by opening the bat face at the last moment
SIX, that's classic Virat batsman for you! Flighted delivery just outside off stump, batsman lofts the inside-out drive from the middle of the bat, hits the rope on the full. Stand and deliver stuff

out Stumped!! Blind swinging from batsman. Advances and goes for an almighty swing, but bowler is clever enough to bowl this wide outside off stump and force the batsman to reach out, completely missed and Tare, the sub keeper, does the rest. batsman st (sub)Tare b bowler 5(6) [4s-1]
1 run, fifty for VK, but he won't celebrate. Doesn't even raise the bat. Just nudges this length ball into the on-side and gets to the milestone
FOUR, he's middled this alright, doesn't bother running! The off-cutter, batsman launches it over the bowler's head and beats long-on
SIX, that's a lovely hit! Hit on the rise, the bat made a good sound as it made contact with the ball. Slower delivery again and batsman went straight towards the sightscreen
SIX, take that! Short of a length delivery on the off stump, batsman shows no respect and pulls the ball handsomely over mid-wicket. Brilliant hit

out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Soft dismissal. Slower delivery outside off stump, batsman plays early and slices it straight to short third man. bowler gets his name into the wickets column to please himself and the ones who have taken him in their fantasy teams. By the way, that was bowler's 50th IPL wicket. batsman c Krunal Pandya b bowler 11(11) [6s-1]

out Caught by Rohit!! Another one. Catching practice. They are checking for the no-ball. Oh no! More than half of his foot is inside the line. Why check that? It was a shortish delivery, Umesh slices the slog and skies it to cover. Hang on, the replay looks like it's not the wicket taking delivery. Umesh is at the non-striker's end. batsman c Rohit b bowler 1(2)
SIX, cracking sound. Full and in the slot, batsman muscles that way back over the long-on fence

SIX, oh he's connected this brilliantly! Give him a promotion next match! Slower delivery sat up nicely, batsman hangs back and pulls powerfully over deep mid-wicket and easily clears the fence. Will this make Kohli smile?
FOUR, outside edge and third man is inside the ring, the ball flies over him as batsman goes hard on the attempted lofted drive. Can he get a hundred? 14 to get, 4 more deliveries to go
SIX, down the one knee and smashed! Back in the crease with a step and then he picked the bones out of this slower delivery and sent it over long-on

FOUR, su-sweet. Ends the over with a boundary. Juicy half-volley from bowler, well outside off. batsman isn't sparing those. Leans across, plants his front foot towards the ball and slashes it through extra cover. Beats a crowed off-side field

FOUR, this wasn't timed as he would've liked, but batsman will still earn a boundary. The slower delivery from Fizz, batsman didn't pick it as he was through the shot early. Still managed to get enough wood to place it over mid-on. There's no stopping that
SIX, batsman has found his bearings. Rahman errs, bowls it full on QDK's strong zone. Just bent forward and lifted it through the line. Ah, all timing as it sails over the ropes over mid-on

out Bowled!! And call it the text commentator's curse. bowler snuffs out batsman and Wankhede erupts. Nothing shot from batsman. It was full and a semblance of tail back in. The batsman stepped forward and swung, completely down the wrong line and enough gap for the ball to sneak through to knock the off-stump. team lose their first wicket. batsman b bowler 19(12) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! batsman perishes. Huge blow for team. Two wickets in the over and bowler is turning it on here. Seemed like a certain ploy and batsman fell into the trap. Dug in short and there was a fielder positioned at deep mid-wicket. AB forgets, goes for the pull, doesn't bother to keep it down either. Flat and straight to Hardik, who cupped it. Straight down the gullet, didn't even had to move there. team on top. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 1(2)

FOUR, edgy but looked like it was intentional from batsman. The slower ball from Rahman, ends up as a wide yorker. batsman digs with an open bat face, runs it more off the outer half and it beats short third man

FOUR, cracked. Rohit isn't happy, asks Rahman to bowl towards the stumps. Fizz overpitches and offers it outside off, minimal effort from batsman. Shifts his weight forward and caresses the drive that beats extra cover

1 run, fired it in quick on off, batsman pushes it to the right of Rohit at extra cover, who swiftly moves across and releases the throw in one motion. Hits the target but batsman's makes it in by dragging his bat

out Caught by (sub)Duminy!! Anderson departs for a blob. Not a sweet IPL 2018 debut for the Kiwi all-rounder. Pandya gets two in two. Slowish and lured Anderson into a big shot. The batsmen went low and slogged, no timing whatsoever and he ended up hitting it straight to deep mid-wicket. Pandya is chuffed, so are rest of his team-mates. team digging a hole for themselves here. batsman c (sub)Duminy b bowler 0(1)

wide, out Stumped!! Once bitten twice shy. No mistake whatsoever from Ishan Kishan this time. batsman has been hokey-pokeyed for the second time and no repreive on this occasion. Very smart from Krunal; batsman announced his intent of stepping out early. Krunal sees it and lasers it wide of off. Very similar to the last over, Ishan Kishan doesn't panic, grabs it cleanly and whips the bails off. team lose their third wicket. batsman st Ishan Kishan b bowler 16(14) [4s-1]

out Bowled!! Duck for batsman! Couldn't have been a better start for the Royals, this. Lynn not having a great time, dropped a catch earlier and departs without troubling the scorers. It's a short delivery and with a bit of off-spin, Lynn goes back to cut and gets undone due to the lack of bounce and spin on that. No Lynn special tonight and the crowd at Jaipur erupts. batsman b bowler 0(2)

FOUR, edged but safe! A short delivery around off, too close to cut and batsman goes ahead with the shot. Gets a top edge that eludes the leaping keeper and finds the fence. Lucky to be still out there, but this is how he plays
FOUR, low full toss outside off, Rana puts bat to ball and it skims away through the covers. Didn't go too hard on the drive, just focused on timing which was spot on
FOUR, bowler darting them in real quick - 95kph this one. Rana goes back, uses the pace of it and tickles it nice and fine. Bit too straight this one from round the wicket

out Caught by Stokes!! Superb catch at the boundary from Stokes, showing great awareness here. It was drilled back hard by batsman, and Stokes had plenty to do at long-on. Initially, he had to take a brilliant overhead catch while making sure that he times his jump nicely. And then he had to toss the ball back in as his feet were going to encroach the cushions. He judges the situation to a nicety and the execution is spot on. batsman c Stokes b bowler 48(36) [4s-6 6s-2]

FOUR, oh lovely. He's already showing some excellent touch out there. 102kph delivery from bowler, batsman stays back to it and then dabs it out of the keeper's gloves. So so late and really really fine

no run, slower length ball on off, Rana defends back towards the bowler and sets off for a single. Ridiculous judgement. Karthik obviously sends him back, but even a dive wouldn't have saved him if bowler had hit the stumps direct. Michael Clarke calls it the worst attempted single in the history of cricket
SIX, oh what a freebie, and what a time for it. Any pressure that had built on team has evaporated. Slower short ball on leg-stump, batsman whip-pulls it witheringly over the long leg boundary

SIX, pretty full from bowler, and this is brilliant use of the crease from Rana. He takes a step back which allows him to get under the ball. Mid-off was up in the ring, so the idea was to just loft it over him. And despite the bat turning in his hands, it still clears the ropes
FOUR, full toss outside off, 144kph, batsman carves it away through backward point. Rocketed off his bat
2 runs, an inswinging slower ball on middle and leg, Rana clears his front leg and drives to the right of long-off
SIX, hoisted over long-on to wrap up a clinical win for team. Set himself up for this length ball and launched it into the night sky, falls way back into the stands
FOUR, showed glimpses of form in the previous game too. This is short around off, batsman camps back and punches it well past the fielder at mid-off, placement was bang on there

FOUR, finally manages to get a boundary. Was trying it since a while. This was a tad on the slower side but short enough for batsman to thrash it, goes aerial over covers and finds the boundary, his first convincing shot of the day

FOUR, this was even better than the previous one. No fielders moved, just mere spectators. Short of a length outside off, batsman throws his hands at it and times his drive through the gap there, that came right from the meat

FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries. Kulkarni put under pressure by batsman. Picks the length early on that short one, transfers his weight on to the back foot and pummels it through mid-wicket, the fielder there was too square to cut this off
FOUR, pulled away! Short of a length on middle and leg, batsman picks the length on it and pulls it neatly over mid-wicket, on a bounce and over the fence there
FOUR, slower delivery and that's been put away to the fence again. Just outside off and on a length, batsman stands tall and pumps it right over the bowler's head
FOUR, cheeky. That's batsman's experience for you. Shortish in length around off, batsman simply guides it down to third man and finds the fence again, can't keep a fielder so fine

FOUR, poor line! Can't bowl such freebies when a batsman is in good touch. This was a shortish delivery on the thigh and all batsman wanted to do is get it past the fielder at short fine leg, manages to do so. Drags it past the fielder and gets another boundary

SIX, 50-run stand up between batsman and Uthappa! Short of a length around off, batsman clears his front leg and pulls it over mid-wicket to end the powerplay with a maximum. Good recovery by team after the loss of Lynn in the first over of the innings
SIX, short and punished! Gopal drops it short on off, batsman camps back and times his pull over mid-wicket, an impressive blow
FOUR, another edge, another boundary. On a length around off, batsman goes hard at it and gets an outside edge that makes it fly past the keeper. Even a dive by Buttler wouldn't have helped his cause

out batsman Run Out!! Poor piece of running there. First of all he tried to reverse sweep it and as it went off the pads to short third man. batsman wanted the run but Uthappa sent him back. There was no chance that Uthappa would have completed the run. Unadkat is the man who throws it at the keeper's end to catch batsman well short of his crease. batsman run out (Unadkat/Buttler) 35(25) [4s-5 6s-1]

SIX, a biggie to end the over! Excellent timing on that. Full and floated on middle, batsman doesn't miss out on the chance to slog it over mid-wicket, a meaty blow that was. That'll spoil the over for the bowler

FOUR, misfield by Unadkat and bowler isn't pleased by that. Was a back of a length delivery outside off, batsman went for it with hard hands, threw his bat at it and got an outside edge. Unadkat slips at square third man and misfields as the ball goes through him

FOUR, well-timed and four. Sliding down and batsman didn't miss out. Short fine was inside the ring and deep square back, he beat the latter with a beautiful flick off the hips. That should hopefully get him going

FOUR, this is another short-arm jab, one bounce over the ropes at deep square. Way too short by bowler, on middle and leg, batsman picked him off easily, bisected the two men either side on the leg-side
FOUR, this is so unlike bowler. He hasn't looked himself tonight. Another drag-down, batsman controls the pull and beats Mavi to his left at deep mid. 10 off that over

SIX, what a blow that is. This is what batsman can do. Backs away and bowler follows him with a back of a length delivery, but batsman clobbers the pull miles into the deep square stands. At one point looked like clearing the crowd and going out of the stadium

FOUR, he can do finesse too. Not only raw power. Used the pace of bowler to full effect. Watched the back of a length delivery onto his bat and steered it to the right of the diving backward point, beats him and gives third man no chance

out Bowled!! batsman's painful innings comes to an end. A fist pump from bowler. Bowled the slider and it rushed past the cross-batted hoick of batsman. Clipped off and credit to DK for getting bowler back on. The bowler has justified that move with another wicket. batsman b bowler 44(43) [4s-5 6s-1]
FOUR, this is a proper pull. Dragged down by bowler and batsman was onto the back foot in a flash, pulled it between wide long-on and deep mid. Found the gap to perfection. Hit hard as well

out Caught by A Russell!! Good catch by Russell at short cover. Leapt at the right time to catch. batsman went inside out but couldn't keep the in-to-out shot down, bit more elevation and he would've got a couple at least. batsman c A Russell b bowler 15(11) [4s-2]
SIX, as soon as he saw the tossed up delivery, a chinaman, batsman goes downtown. Kneels down and then slogs it miles back into the long-on stands. That's what batsman can do

out Caught by Nitish Rana!! bowler has bowled very well tonight and gets the dangerous batsman out. To the left-hander he has been bowling mainly googlies and this one is the same as well. batsman was charging bowler and it kept on going away from him. Sliced it high up in the air and Rana backtracking from cover takes a good catch. Not easy to judge that in the lights. batsman c Nitish Rana b bowler 14(11) [6s-1]

SIX, can Gill get there? He can but can only parry it over the ropes. Good effort from him running to his left at long-off. Not easy at all as batsman lofted it superbly after using his feet. Had enough to get it over the left-hand of the diving fielder
FOUR, brutal. Fraction short and that's enough for batsman, who marmalises the back foot forcing shot. Long-off wasn't even in the picture. A rare off night for bowler

out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Easy for backward point. Back of the hand slower delivery, bowler bowls that well. He is so confident with that delivery that he regularly and surprisingly bowled it in the Ashes Test. To not great effect it must be said. But here he gets batsman slicing it off a thick outside edge and grabs a wicket. batsman c Shivam Mavi b bowler 12(7) [6s-1]

out Bowled!! Both Karnataka men gone in consecutive balls. To bowler. He takes off his aeroplane and Mitch Johnson is seen clapping from the dugout. Pacy length delivery, on off, batsman was late on the defence and it knocked the stump out of the ground. Played a bit inside the line and had no footwork to deal with that sharp delivery. bowler is now on a hat-trick. batsman b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, slightly off-line and four. Can't err in any way to batsman. Low full-toss and swung to the left of long-on, one bounce over the ropes
1 run, Lynn at backward point drops a simple catch. Kulkarni sliced it and Lynn drops it. What's more it brings Buttler on strike too

out D Kulkarni Run Out!! 1 run completed. Almost a royal mess-up. But bowler recovers to run Kulkarni out. Driven to long-off. No way the second was on, not with Kulkarni running like that. bowler fumbled the throw but recovered to run Kulkarni out, who couldn't make it. But importantly batsman will be on strike. D Kulkarni run out (Shubman Gill/bowler) 3(3)
FOUR, first ball from bowler and batsman takes the seam-up delivery and sweeps it through backward square leg, hit well and found the gap too
FOUR, lovely batting. Down the track and to the pitch before slamming it in the air, but wide of the diving Russell at mid-off. Consecutive boundaries
FOUR, three in a row. Too short outside off, batsman has played around with bowler's mind. Takes full toll of this, by cutting this wide of point and cover-point

FOUR, four more. This is brilliant batting. Without any risk too. That's 16 runs off the over. The last two balls have been short, even though this bounced from a back of a length, batsman was back and across, cuts again and does so well, to find the gap between point and cover-point. An injection of momentum, so badly needed by team

SIX, smashed. That's some way to treat a bloke who's bowling at over 140 clicks. Down the track and flat-batted the short of length delivery straight back over the bowler's head. Had enough on it to go all the way
FOUR, first one he has timed tonight. Picks the slower delivery from a length and swings cleanly over mid-off's head

FOUR, magnificent cover drive. When batsman is on song, there are few better timers of the ball in India. This is overpitched and he leans forward to caress the drive wide of cover and extra cover. Threaded the needle there
FOUR, sliding down, just needed bat on that and batsman gets the glance going. Fine leg is too square and he had no chance

out Stumped!! Brilliant from DK but felt that batsman gave up all too easily. Could've put pressure on DK by attempting to dive, none of that and he goes. Was down the track looking to flick, richocheted off the pad and went in front of DK who calmly collects the ball and then backflicks to hit direct. One glove was off quickly and that made it easier for DK. Can't understand why it has been changed to stumped. According to the laws of the game, when a batsman is attempting a run - batsman surely was - it should be declared run-out. Weird! batsman st Karthik b Rana 36(19) [4s-5 6s-1]

FOUR, he attempted that off the first ball and missed. Not now. Uses the pace of bowler to great effect. Steers late and with an open face, right off the middle of the bat and Uthappa running around from third man can only watch it run away

out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Gone now. As soon as he hit that, batsman knew he had made a mistake. Good short of length delivery on the hips, rising, batsman cannot keep the short-arm jab pull down and picks out deep square to perfection. Kuldeep didn't move a muscle there. batsman c Kuldeep Yadav b bowler 7(8) [4s-1]

leg byes, FOUR, bonus runs! batsman checks his back a bit as that had struck him above the thigh pad. Back of a length around leg, he missed the flick off the back foot and it sped past a diving Saha to the fence

out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Such a soft dismissal! Often been the story with Agarwal, gets a good looking start and then weirdly, throws it away. Slower ball from Kaul and it was a bit short, Agarwal was in two minds whether to go hard at it or just use his touch. In the end, all he managed was to spoon it straight to Hooda at backward point. A dolly that is and once again, team get a wicket at just about the right time. batsman c Deepak Hooda b bowler 18(9) [4s-2 6s-1]

SIX, "Will he catch it? Yes, he will! No, he won't!", yelps Mbangwa on-air! Good effort by long-off but too difficult in the end. Pandey was the man there, leapt to take it one-handed but the momentum was taking him past the ropes and in the effort to throw it back into play, fails to do so. Floated ball and was lofted down the ground by Karun, gets a maximum

SIX, he has got under this one, oh yes! bowler was trying to steer clear of batsman's arc but misses it for once. Full and on middle and off, the big West Indian just clears his front leg and launches it over long-on for yet another six

1 run, slower and very full on the pads, nudged towards the big spaces at mid-wicket. bowler has to chase it himself and that allows the single. 23rd IPL fifty for batsman, second on the trot to start a new season. The Jamaican is making a statement, that's for sure
SIX, not off the middle really but who cares? He has enough power! The googly and batsman decided to go with the turn, sliced it away over long-off and easily cleared the fence! Whoa!
SIX, this is off the middle alright! batsman storm alert! The shorter length and batsman sits on the back foot to flat bat it straight down the ground. As straight as an arrow and well over the ropes

SIX, 3 in a row! Has Rashid ever been hammered like this? I cannot remember at all but this is what batsman does. He can destroy the best of bowlers. Fuller length once more and he just lifts it straight down the ground. Into the sight-screen! He is in the savage mode

SIX, it keeps coming! It keeps coming! 4 out of 4 for batsman! Floated up on middle and off, he gets across on one leg and clobbers the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Oh boy, this is some exhibition!
2 runs, mistimed but clears mid-wicket with ease! Short of a length around middle and leg, drags this flick off the inner half and clears the infield
FOUR, up and over! Good batting from Karun, saw mid-off up in the ring and decided to go over the man. Succeeded easily. Fuller ball outside off,

FOUR, does it again! This time, Jordan at mid-off thought he had a chance and leapt full length but the ball sailed over him. Short of a length outside off, Karun flat-batted it with all the power and although he didn't keep it down, didn't matter at all. Runs bleeding at the moment

SIX, bowler doesn't get the landing rights in Mohali. The slower delivery, bowls it half-way down the pitch. Seemed as though batsman was waiting for it. Rocks back and bulldozed it into the deep square leg stands. "Catching practise for the crowd," says Pommie Mbangwa on air. 14th maximum for the universe boss

FOUR, mid-off inside the ring and bowler bowls it right in the arc for batsman. He just gets under it and tonks it with a straight bat and clean swing over mid-off. Beautiful hands from batsman. Ah, poses for the paparazzis as well

out Caught by Dhawan!! batsman targets the longest boundary and holes out. bowler gets his man, finally. Length delivery just outside off, batsman moved across and whiplashed it. Needed to generate more power to clear the ropes. Fails and hits it straight to Dhawan at deep mid-wicket, who grabs it and does the thigh-five celebration. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 31(21) [4s-3 6s-1]
SIX, batsman moves to 99. Spoils a good over by bowler. Pitched up just outside off, batsman spots it early and smokes it disdainfully over long-off. High and handsome

1 run, put your hands together for the universe boss! Christopher Henry batsman brings up his 6th IPL hundred. Off comes the helmet, raises his bat to soak in the applause from the Mohali crowd and unleashes the 'Baby in the arms' celebration. Reached the landmark with a squeezy drive to point

1 run, oh this was nearly a run out! A highish full toss miscued to extra cover, who with a direct hit could have gotten batsman. Throw is right on cue to Kaul but he's not in a position to under-arm the ball onto the stumps. Chance missed, batsman makes it back in...
FOUR, batsman gets into the act. Backs away, makes room and Rashid helped him by slanting it on the stumps. Golf-swung over cow corner
SIX, Rashid has been taken to the dry cleaners today. Proper pasting. Went too full this time does Rashid, batsman was waiting for it. Muscles it straight down the ground

FOUR, elegant shot! The flourish of the bat was a sight to behold. Knuckle ball from bowler but too full and also too straight as well, batsman shuffles a touch to flick it away sweetly. Bisected mid-on and mid-wicket with ease. Yusuf gave a chase but was never going to stop it even with the slide

no run, good use of the technology by batsman! He was very sure that he had hit it and UltraEdge confirms the inside edge. He was stuck on the crease to this inswinger and got pinged on the back leg. Cannot fault the umpire for raising his finger because if not for the edge, it was dead plumb
SIX, crunched! The big man kicks off the six-hitting for the night. Expected the short ball and was ready on the back foot, swatted the pull over mid-wicket. Made a cracking sound off the blade

FOUR, on the off-side now! Fuller ball on middle and off, batsman is sensing the lengths early and backs away for the loft over cover. Carved it away over the infield with ease. He is getting into the groove
SIX, hammered into the stands! That's a bad ball to most players, let alone batsman. Juicy full toss and he just blasts it away over deep square leg for a mammoth biggie. Clean strike
SIX, smashed over long-on! Huge test this for Rashid, batsman is in the mood to destroy him tonight. Loopy leg break and it's too full, launched down the ground for another huge biggie

FOUR, shot of the night so far! This guy makes batting look really simple, doesn't he? Fuller ball and batsman got the stride forward nicely before absolutely creaming the drive. On the up and what stood out was the precision in placement, bisected extra cover and mid-off with such ease
FOUR, over the infield this time! batsman also joins in the fun. Another half volley from Kaul and this is lofted straight over mid-off. Comfortably over the fielder and away she goes to the fence
1 run, saw batsman giving the charge and smartly shortened the length around middle and leg, eased away down to long-on. 50 up for team

out Lbw!! Rashid draws first blood! team needed this and not surprisingly, it's their star spinner who does the job. The slider that shoots through a touch low, batsman wasn't anticipating the lack of bounce and went through with a pull. Got pinged on the pad and that's as plumb as it gets. End of a smooth opening stand but team haven't really been allowed to get away. batsman lbw b bowler 18(21) [4s-3]
SIX, booooooom! Cannot bowl it in his arc when he is in this mood. Full and in the slot on off, he just lofts it down the ground effortlessly. Crashes into the sightscreen

FOUR, almost carried to backward point! Reprieve for Agarwal, he went after this flighted delivery on seeing the width but couldn't connect the drive well. Sliced it in the air and it just fell short of the diving fielder. Sneaked past him eventually and sped to the fence

FOUR, beautiful placement! Tossed up generously from bowler but it's too wide and Agarwal executes the inside out lofted stroke with finesse. There was a man at long-off but he's got this well wide of that man

SIX, clobbered away! Agarwal is wasting no time in switching to top gear. Floated up around off, he just clears his front leg and deposits this over the long-on fielder for a maximum. Good proactive batting

no run, Punjab have gone for a review. My naked eyes tell me this is high and it might be going down the leg side. batsman is jumping in the crease when ball strikes him on the back pad. It is clipping the stumps -- the top of middle and leg -- but just clipping so it is umpire's call and Punjab retain their review. Good inward shape from bowler on that back of a length ball

FOUR, we have seen brute power from gayle earlier but this is total touch play from batsman. It was a good length delivery outside off, batsman gets in a good position and drives it on the up, ball beats the mid-off fielder for a four
FOUR, picks up the slower ball early but doesn't time it as well as he would have liked, but he gets enough bat onto it to get a four to fine leg

out Bowled!! batsman wasn't timing it at all and this was always on the cards. It was a good length delivery at the stumps, batsman wanted to play it across the line, his willow misses it totally and ball disturbs the furniture. Punjab are off to a dream start here. The ball just brushes the off stick. batsman b bowler 6(7) [4s-1]
FOUR, 50-run stand up. Goes for the yorker but he's bowled a nice little full toss here -- something that batsman uses to hit his first boundary. Scythed round the corner, that full toss
FOUR, room offered outside off and batsman's sliced it without fuss to the third man boundary. That will do
SIX, some turn on this leg break but batsman stays put and swipes this over deep mid-wicket. Just a little short, which allowed batsman to go against the spin there
1 run, back to off breaks, is bowler. batsman slaps it to sweeper cover to hoist a fifty
FOUR, 129ks on a back of a length, and veering down, there's only one way the ball's going. To the boundary. Pulled behind square

out Caught by Finch!! batsman will now know that this is a big, big ground. Steps out to a slower delivery -- knuckle ball, actually -- but can you blame him? Mistimes this attempted loft and there's long-off waiting, secretly thanking the big dimensions that this ground entails. batsman c Finch b bowler 54(41) [4s-3 6s-2]
FOUR, deftly played. Googly but it's wide, and batsman waits and glides it just wide of the keeper

out Caught by (sub)Manoj Tiwary!! That's been hit high but team here are unravelling, surrendering to Mohali's big dimensions. Knuckle ball, another one yeah, and batsman finds long-on with this big loft. Manoj Tiwary there, who takes it and then kicks the ball away in celebration... batsman c (sub)Manoj Tiwary b bowler 5(5)
no ball, FOUR, that's above the waist, and hence a no-ball. batsman nicely arches away before realizing that he can get some bat on this. Glides it uppishly through third man

SIX, a 37-ball fifty for Pandey. 40 from 10 needed now, which means literally every ball has to be a boundary. A bottom-handed loft from batsman that, getting under that full ball and launching it over long-on
SIX, switches to the off break and batsman launches him over deep mid-wicket. Just the length you can swing across
SIX, another one pretty much there. A bit slower you'd think, and batsman goes straighter here

1 run, dropped by Mujeeb at deep mid-wicket. bowler actually did well by spinning it into batsman but batsman's in that mood. Carved across the line, only to be let off. That's the long side of the boundary and that should have been taken
FOUR, Ashwin mistimes the jump and ball goes over him at mid-off for a four. It was fuller length ball at the stumps, Pathan lofts it over mid-off, just gets enough blade on the ball to clear mid-off

1 run, what are you doing Yuvi! He drops a sitter. This is as easy as they come. Pathan mistimes the cut shot and he hits it straight to cover point where Yuvi makes a mess of it. Reacted very late as he went reverse-cup style and it popped out
FOUR, slower delivery at the stumps, it was fuller in length and Pathan picks up the slower ball early. He gets in a good position and hits it over mid-wicket for a four
FOUR, no one moved on that ball. It was a good length delivery outside off, Pathan swats it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four. Power and placement from Pathan

out Bowled!! Chops it back onto the stumps. This is a back of the hand slower ball from bowler and Pathan was completely foxed by it. He wanted to drive it through the off-side but gets a thick inside edge and ball comes back in the direction of the stumps. Clever variation in pace from bowler, he is having a good night thus far. batsman b bowler 19(13) [4s-3]

FOUR, gorgeous shot! Pure class from batsman. It was a leg-spinner from bowler, batsman comes down the track and lofts it with the turn over cover for a four. One of the toughest shots to play but he reached the pitch of the ball and made it easier for himself
SIX, batsman sends it into the crowd. It was an off-spinner from bowler, batsman comes down the track, reaches the pitch of the ball and lofts it over the long-off for a maximum. Clean connection!

no run, Punjab have gone for a review. batsman is a long way down the ground. Ultra edge shows no edge and DRS shows ball is just hitting the leg stump. Punjab retains the review again. batsman comes down the track on the ball and misses the bat totally, ball hits his pads
FOUR, he won't miss out on that, will batsman! Waits for the slower delivery, rocks back and pumps it right over the bowler's head to get off the mark in style

FOUR, that's bread and butter for Watto. Back of a length delivery outside off, batsman camps back, transfers his weight on the back foot and crunches this through the gap at covers, no fielder moved there

1 run, edged and dropped! Rahul Tripathi the culprit on that occasion. Puts down a sitter. Was a full length delivery outside off, batsman goes for a drive and the away swing induces an outside edge. However, Tripathi - the lone slipper makes a mess out of it

FOUR, who would want to be a bowler in this format? Dropped catch just on the previous ball and this one has been belted away. Full in length outside off, batsman advances down the wicket and smokes it over cover for a boundary
SIX, first maximum of the match! Loopy delivery around off, batsman backs away, makes room and towers it cleanly over long-off for his first big one of the night

FOUR, these runs are hurting Royals, really bad. Both batsmen are looking unstoppable. Shortish delivery on leg, batsman swivels his pull past the fielder at short fine and ends the over with a boundary again. How often has that happened tonight!

FOUR, the boundaries continue to flow.. Room to leg and that opens up the off-side field nicely for him, even though it is back of a length, batsman thumps it on the up over extra cover. No chance for the sweeper

SIX, flat six! That barely left the ground. Banged in and at bowler's pace it sat up for Watto, who was quick to rock back and nail the pull in front of square, right between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket
FOUR, streaky! But that's how batsman plays. No half measures. Darted in outside off and batsman threw his bat at that, sliced the drive over backward point and started another over with a boundary

FOUR, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and batsman picked it right out of the hand. Got into position to play the inside out shot and struck it handsomely over extra cover. The timing was exquisite

out Caught by Gowtham!! Stunner! Needed something like this to break this partnership and the two Karnataka lads combine to send batsman back. Another wrong 'un from Gopal and batsman once more spotted it early, sat down on his knee to play the slog and sweep, struck it powerfully and flat towards deep mid-wicket, the ball was dying in front of Gowtham, who covered good ground, dived full length and took it inches from the ground. batsman c Gowtham b bowler 46(29) [4s-9]
FOUR, easy pickings! Back of a length on middle and leg, batsman waits and gently tickles it fine, the man is inside the ring at 45 and it was well wide of him, raced across the lightning outfield

FOUR, consecutive boundaries and this was not a poor delivery. Fab shot from Watto. Spotted third man inside the ring, waited for the back of a length delivery on off and dabbed it past a diving backward point, the quick outfield takes care of the rest

FOUR, third boundary of the over. bowler is going for plenty. Short delivery and at 132 clicks it is not going to trouble batsman, who pulls it along the ground in front of square, the placement was perfect
FOUR, 19 runs off the over. Raina's wicket has done nothing to slow down the scoring rate. Off-cutter on a length, batsman just guides it past backward point and short third man

out Caught by Gowtham!! Juggled and taken. Gowtham must be a relieved man. For a second it seemed like he parried it over. batsman shimmies down and gets close to the wrong 'un, smokes it flat and hard towards long-on, Gowtham times his jump and goes reverse cup, but the ball bursts out and luckily for him goes straight up, he gathers himself and completes the catch. batsman c Gowtham b bowler 5(3) [4s-1]

FOUR, edged and four! Not where he intended, but when luck is on your side, everything goes your way. bowler comes round the wicket and cramps batsman for room, he attempts a cut shot and the outside edge runs away to the right of Buttler

out Caught by Stokes!! Third for Gopal. He's been exceptional today. Standout bowler by far for Royals. It was the sort of half-tracker that got Kohli and de Villiers couple of matches ago, batsman went deep in the crease to play the pull and hit it straight to deep mid-wicket. The big England all-rounder ain't dropping that. team fighting back with a couple of wickets. batsman c Stokes b bowler 3(7)

FOUR, batsman needs to keep going for team. The runs have dried up a bit in the last few overs. Trifle short and outside off and batsman waits before playing the cut shot past the diving backward point fielder

FOUR, delicate! Slower back of a length delivery, Bravo walked across his stumps to get inside the line and then glances it off the hips past the short fine fielder, just a roll of the wrists to pocket a boundary

1 run, hundred for batsman. Two in two days in this IPL. Gayle yesterday and batsman today. The helmet comes off and the bat is up in the air to acknowledge the applause of the traveling fans. There was also a little fist pump as soon as he placed it in the gap. He scored a hundred for Royals while playing against team and now he's done the vice versa - the first player to do that. Coming to the ball: Back of a length around off, batsman knocks it wide of point and reaches the milestone

FOUR, offers room on this slower delivery and Bravo is quick to capitalize, he waits before unleashing the cut shot over backward point, no one in the deep to stop that. Much needed boundary for Bravo

1 run, dropped! Samson the man who puts it down. Bravo tried to repeat the previous shot, but does not get the elevation on the cut shot, Samson jumps up at backward point and parries it over him. Should have done a better job there. team have not had a good day in the field

FOUR, one-handed pull from Bravo. He was deceived by the slower delivery and the bottom hand comes off the bat handle, but the placement is behind square and a desperate dive from Klaasen is not enough to stop the boundary
FOUR, ends the over well. Made room while dancing down, the width on offer made him free his arms and send the ball sailing over the extra cover fielder. Rocketed away to the fence

out Caught by Buttler!! Edged and taken. Some of the team players run up to Watto and congratulate him. He was one of them for eight years and walks off to a standing ovation from the yellow army. Fine innings from the Australian. Fuller and outside off, batsman with his typical bent knee looks to smoke it over long-off, only manages an outside edge to Buttler. batsman c Buttler b bowler 106(57) [4s-9 6s-6]

1 run, dropped! Short and wide outside off, batsman cuts it firmly to point but a diving effort by Tripathi saves a certain boundary. In fact it was a chance, Tripathi got his hand to it but couldn't take it

SIX, Watto is off to a flier. Although he has been dropped twice, he's continuing to take on the bowlers. This was a length delivery around off, batsman stood tall and clobbered it over the extra cover fence for half a dozen more

SIX, last ball of the over fetches six more. bowler wouldn't like this. He's the most expensive buy of this IPL among Indian players. Short of a length around off, batsman camps back and hammers it over mid-wicket for a flat six
FOUR, boundaries continue to flow. Short and slow on middle and leg, batsman swivels and pulls it past the fielder at short fine leg, does well to get it past him

FOUR, all bowlers are proving to be expensive. team openers are making the most of the powerplay. Again this was a gift of a delivery. Fullish and on the pads as batsman flicks it nonchalantly away to the fine leg region
1 run, 50-run stand up with that single! Short of a length on middle and leg, batsman nudges it away to short mid and scurries across to the other end

out Caught by Buttler!! bowler strikes in his first over and sends batsman back to the hut. It was a length delivery outside off, too close to the body and batsman attempted a cut, he got an edge to it. Buttler behind the wickets makes sure to hold on to it. The batsman was in two minds there, whether to guide it to third man or play a cut shot. The dilemma resulted in his downfall. batsman c Buttler b bowler 12(8) [4s-2]
FOUR, typical batsman there. Full length delivery around off, gets down on his knee and sweetly times his inside out shot over covers, looked pleasing to the eye that shot
FOUR, short one on the thigh and batsman drags it down to the fine leg fence. bowler has struggled with his lines so far. Bowled a few looseners in his first over too

FOUR, commits the same mistake again. Fires in a low full toss on the pads and batsman makes sure to get some bat on that. Tickles it away to the fine leg fence and gets four more, that's the third boundary of the over

FOUR, brilliant! That's batsman's experience for you. This was a length delivery angled away from him and batsman played it late in order to guide it down to third man, the fielder was too square to cut it off. 16 runs of the over, all in boundaries!

1 run, a risky single! What was batsman thinking here? Knocks the flatter delivery to the left of the bowler and takes a single. bowler had the time in the world to parry it to Rahane but he decides to go for a direct hit and misses out on a run out opportunity. batsman had given up
SIX, gets to his fifty in style! It's a short delivery and batsman camps back and slaughters it over Stokes at long-on. Reaches the milestone and raises his bat, acknowledges the crowd
FOUR, there's no stopping him tonight. This is short again outside off, batsman goes back in his crease and slams it through the gap at covers
SIX, smoked it! Tossed up delivery around off, batsman slogs this over mid-wicket for half a dozen
FOUR, that's the second 50-run partnership of the match. Short and wide outside off, batsman beautifully cuts it over point and adds four to his tally

no run, dropped! Deja vu! Watto was dropped in the first over at first slip and he does the same now. A beautiful delivery from bowler. Seam-up delivery on a good-ish length that decks away a tad and batsman dangled his bat out. The thick outside edge carries to Watson, but that's been put down. batsman survives. The centurion wasn't quite ready - was late to react

SIX, shot! One of best shots played today. The team skipper gives the charge by coming down the track and then offers a straight bat to thump this length ball over long-on. Off the middle and off she goes into the stands. Poses for the photographs too
FOUR, edged and four. 14 off the opening over. Streaky, but batsman wouldn't mind much. The ball came in with the angle and batsman got an inside edge on his push, runs away to the fine leg fence

FOUR, through the gates! That won't please the bowler, nor the captain. A fullish ball on middle and leg, batsman flicks it superbly, but was straight to the man at mid-wicket. Karn Sharma there allows it to go through his legs. First boundary in IPL for batsman

out Bowled!! Gone! Shardul Thakur strikes. A nothing shot from the South African. No feet movement either. A cross-seamed length ball attacking the stumps, batsman stays leg-side of the ball and plays down the wrong line. The stumps get shattered. team have an early breakthrough. batsman b bowler 7(7) [4s-1]

out Caught by Tahir!! Bravo is on his way with those celebrations, shaking it real nice. Completely deceived batsman with this slower ball. It was a short of length delivery well wide of off, batsman was looking to drag it away through the on-side. But by the time it arrived, he had completely lost his shape. The top-edge balloons towards short third man where Tahir moves a few yards back and settles under it comfortably. batsman c Tahir b bowler 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, drilled straight back, goes right through bowler and then sneaks through Rayudu as well. Clumsy sliding effort at long-on there, but considering his bruised knee, we'll cut him some slack

out Caught by Billings!! Goes down on the back knee, wanting to unleash a big slog-sweep against this slower ball, but he's miscued it off a thick top-edge. He'll be taken at deep mid-wicket. Yes. So Bravo has his second, and there's more moves from him. batsman c Billings b bowler 5(5)
FOUR, he's somehow glanced this yorker into the fine leg boundary. Really well done from batsman. The line - which was on leg-stump - helped his cause
SIX, stretches out to reach this googly and then flat-bats it over long-off. Brute power

out Caught by Billings!! batsman's head dropped as soon as this left his bat. Knew he hadn't got it off the middle. Flighted leg-break from bowler, it comes off a thick top-edge as batsman looks to slog-sweep and it's calmly taken at the mid-wicket boundary. batsman c Billings b bowler 45(37) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Caught by Dhoni!! Slower short ball, batsman swings into a pull but all he manages is a top-edge through to Dhoni. The Royals sinking rapidly now. Hardly any celebrations from team. Dhoni just throws the ball back and waves his players to their respective positions. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 1(2)

out Caught&Bowled!! This is a brilliant one-handed return catch from Thakur, who is absolutely fired up. He rushed batsman with the short ball, and then rushed forward in his followthrough before diving and taking it with his right hand. It was flapped up off the splice by batsman, after getting severely cramped. batsman c and b bowler 10(8) [4s-1]
FOUR, oh shot. Nailed this pull shot through mid-wicket. Solid response after the previous ball
FOUR, the width on this delivery spelled it out for batsman's inside-out loft. He frees his arms to cream it wide of long-off
FOUR, quickly onto the back knee to swat this leg-break through mid-wicket. Plenty of muscle from batsman as he swishes it to the boundary
out Bowled!! Clatters the stumps with a googly. batsman has had his fun, no more. Tries for another slog-sweep but probably didn't pick the variation. batsman b bowler 16(10) [4s-3]

out Caught by Dhoni!! Faint tickle from batsman, and that's it. team bowled out with nine balls to go. Flat leg-break, batsman makes room to drive off the back foot but it climbs on him due to the overspin imparted. Dhoni takes care of the edge. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 0(1)

no run. Another appeal for lbw and this time team decide to review. Fair delivery. The knuckle ball and batsman didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and got struck on the back thigh. Was there any bat involved? A light spike on the UltraEdge. An inside edge. team lose their only review. It was on a length and batsman walked forward to work it through the on-side. Didn't pick it, on that occasion did batsman

out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Two down! batsman is distraught as he walks off. He has picked the man in the deep perfectly. Short of a length delivery on the body and batsman went aerial on the heave. Got it off the top portion of the bat and found Karn Sharma at deep backward square leg. As he walks off, mocks the pull shot (to be played along the ground). Too late! batsman c Karn Sharma b bowler 2(3)

out Bowled!! Another knuckle ball, another wicket. Simple, right! Rajasthan are now in deep trouble. bowler changed the position of the ball in his hand at the last moment and batsman had no clue about it. Waltzed down the track and wanted to pull it away. Early to swing the bat and the ball scoots under the blade. 32/3! batsman b bowler 16(11) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, hit hard! batsman uses his feet to good effect. Dances down the ground to convert it into a half-volley and drills it down the ground. Long-on had no chance to mop that up

SIX, 14 off the over! batsman has ensured that bowler is not settled. For the third time in as many balls, he comes down the track. It was the googly from bowler, but batsman made it into a half-volley and bludgeoned it over the bowler's head. A gigantic hit

FOUR, poor delivery and that's been put away. First boundary for batsman! With fine leg inside the circle, he bowls a short ball down the leg-side. batsman gets a glove on the pull and the ball goes fine of the fielder at 45
FOUR, cracking shot! batsman backed away even before the ball was delivered and that allowed him to free his arms. It was darted outside off and batsman crashed it through extra cover

out Caught by Nair!! No batsman show today. Falls cheaply and it's the youngster from Afghanistan, who has struck in his first over. Full credit to Ashwin, perfectly set a trap and batsman has fallen into it. It was the googly from Rahman, batsman cleared his front leg and whacked across the line, forgets there is a fielder in the deep. Nair nearly made a hash of it as he misjudged it initially. Recovers in time by diving head first at deep mid-wicket and pouched it superbly. batsman c Nair b bowler 1(4)
FOUR, loosener from Rahman and Lynn puts it away with ease. Stand and deliver stuff. Short, wide and outside off, Lynn says thank you very much and bashes it through cover
FOUR, nicely played by DK, this was flighted well outside off, batsman went down low, rolled his wrists over and slog sweeps it past mid-wicket, beats the fielder getting across from deep mid-wicket

FOUR, lovely, has to be the shot of the day so far. Even bowler looks perplexed, this was tossed up nicely outside off, batsman leant forward, played with the turn and drove it wide of mid-wicket, split the two men in the deep to perfection
FOUR, cheeky and four, slower and wider of off, batsman waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it past short third man, no need to run for those
FOUR, that's powerfully struck! bowler dropped this one short and just outside off, Lynn backs away and bludgeons past the bowler, the fielder at long-off had no chance

2 runs, 4th IPL half-century for Lynn, he gets a big applause from the crowd, the dug out seem relaxed as well. This was pushed through flatter and quicker, Lynn had to reach out as he hacked it wide of long-off, hurries back for the second run

SIX, smashed, length delivery and Lynn is all over it like a rash. Lynn was waiting on it, plays with the angle and sends it high and deep into the stands at long-on, 103 m hit - the second longest of IPL 2018
FOUR, cracking shot, Tye is running out of ideas, back of a length and well wide of off, Lynn gets on top of the bounce and clatters it over cover-point

2 runs, chance and Sran has dropped it. He did all the hard work, ran across to his left from deep cover, got both hands as he slid across, but fails to hold on. A life for Lynn, how costly will it prove to be? This was short of a good length and well outside off, Lynn threw his hands at that and carved it over cover, no real timing on the shot and it should have been gobbled up

FOUR, the boundaries are flowing for team, fraction short and sliding down the leg-side, batsman went half-way down and pulled it behind square on the on-side, the man in the deep was square and has no chance
2 runs, slower and wider of off, Lynn went hard on the drive once again and mistimed it wide of long-off, that actually allowed the batsmen to come back for the second run

FOUR, dropped short and wide of off, Lynn makes room and cuts it square past point. Sran has a lot of distance to cover, he slides and pulls the ball back in. The third umpire has several looks and reckons that his boot was touching the ropes as he pushed it back into play, given as a boundary

out Caught by Rahul!! Edged and caught! A pre-meditated slog from Lynn as he shuffled right across the stumps, Tye saw it coming and fired it wide of off, Lynn was aiming for the mid-wicket fence, gets a thick and audible edge through, KL doesn't drop those and it's a much needed wicket for team. They have got rid of one dangerman, but here comes the bigger danger - it's Andre Russell. batsman c Rahul b bowler 74(41) [4s-6 6s-4]
FOUR, easy pickings for Russell, bowler misses the yorker by an inch, turns out to be a swinging full-toss, Russell cleared his left leg, got his bat down and punched it back past the non-striker

FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Russell, the slower short ball from Sran, but it was short and way down the leg-side, Russell swivels across and pulls it over backward square leg, couple of bounces and over the ropes

out Caught by Nair!! That's a big wicket for team! That might turn out to be a difference of 20-30 runs. This was another yorker from Sran, he missed his length by a bit, Russell brought his bat down like a sledge-hammer and heaved it back over the bowler's head. Only the timing wasn't as great as it normally is. Good captaincy from Ashwin to have long-off fine as well, straight down the throat of Karun and team have lost their fifth wicket. batsman c Nair b bowler 10(7) [4s-2]
FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide of off, Gill gets on top of the bounce and cuts it square past point, beat the diving fielder and raced away to the fence in a hurry
FOUR, that's a poor start from bowler, short and wide of off, batsman waited on that, played with an open face and beat Mujeeb's dive at short third man
FOUR, cheeky and four, this is excellent cricket from batsman, fraction too short and wide of off, batsman waits on it, opens the face of the bat and runs it past the keeper

FOUR, beautifully played, too much of width on offer and Gill doesn't let it go. Prods across and crashes it square past cover, the man in the deep has no chance. 17 runs from the over, a terrible one from bowler
