out Caught by Andrew Tye!! team are not finishing on a high! batsman falls after a fine cameo, this was a slower length ball from Sran, batsman was deep in the crease as he shovelled it towards the on-side, went off the inner half of the bat and straight to Tye at deep backward square leg. He takes it reverse cupped and team continue to chip away at the wickets. batsman c Andrew Tye b bowler 43(28) [4s-6]

out Caught by Rajpoot!! team are losing some momentum towards the end. Tye has another wicket to his name, this was a yorker length delivery outside off, Curran jammed his bat down hard, gets a thick outside edge and the ball loops to Rajpoot at short third man. Some other day, it might have gone either to his left or right, but not today. batsman c Rajpoot b bowler 1(3)

1 run, chance and Mujeeb has dropped a dolly, short and just outside off, batsman backed away and dabbed it in the air towards short third man. Mujeeb didn't spot it early, the ball was dying in front of him, he bends down low and can't hold on. He then has a shy at the striker's end as the batsmen sneak in a single and misses, but Shubman Gill was always in

FOUR, edged but just eludes Gayle's outstretched right-hand. bowler gains trampoline bounce outside off with this back of a length delivery, batsman pokes with hard hands and outside-edges it towards Gayle, who was at a widish slip. Gingerly stretched his right hand but it escaped away to the fence
SIX, third short ball in a row and Lynn punishes it with ease. No venom on this occasion, Lynn gets under it and hacked it comfortably into the fine leg stands. First maximum of the innings
FOUR, adventure from batsman. Deals another flatter ball by bringing out the reverse sweep. Picked the length early and broomed it away to the third man fence. Key was he rolled his wrists there
FOUR, two fours in a row for batsman. Sliding down leg as Rahman corrects his line. batsman drags the sweep, more of the bottom. But it beats short fine leg and races away to the fence

FOUR, this was more streaky and batsman won't mind. Hat-trick of fours. Quick and skidded through, batsman was stuck on the back foot, looked to work it to the leg-side. Ends up squirting it more off the inner half and it eludes short fine leg, who's chase is vain in the end

FOUR, the slower version of Sran's slower ball, Lynn didn't read it as he was early into the shot. But got it off the meat as he went for the pull and sent it behind square on the leg-side. No-one there and he'll collect a boundary

FOUR, this was out of the top draw. The slower delivery from Tye, on a short of length around middle and leg. Knuckle ball to be precise. batsman picked it early, with a roundhouse and helped it over short fine leg. Easy-peasy

SIX, bosh! Shot. Never bowl short to batsman, Sran finds out why. Short ball aimed at the torso, batsman was ready for it. Picked the bones out of it and muscled it way back into the deep square leg stands

FOUR, brute force from Lynn. Such quicksilver hands. Was a decent delivery as Sran saw Lynn back away to leg and fired it wider of off. But the Australian threw the kitchen sink and managed to stroke it over extra cover

SIX, woah! Has he launched this one into the moon or what? What a shot. 97-metre hit. Length ball in the slot for Lynn, Lynn set himself and whacked it with ferocity, behind square on the leg-side and into the crowd
SIX, 23 runs to cap off the over. Back of the hand slower ball goes awry for Sran. Lynn bent low to free his arms and launched this over deep square leg once again

out Caught by Nair!! Straight down the gullet of Nair. The time-out has broken batsman's concentration. Was looking so good and has thrown it away. Flat and shorter from bowler, batsman rocked back and hammered it off the sweet spot. Hit it flat and didn't have enough wings to clear the ropes. Nair didn't have to move an inch at deep mid-wicket as he cupped it. Eden Gardens has been muted. The half-trackers working well for the spinners throughout this tournament so far. batsman c Nair b bowler 34(23) [4s-5 6s-1]

out batsman Run Out!! Oh, what happened there? team have gifted a wicket away to the visitors. Hare-brained running from the duo. Complete break in communication results in a run-out. Flatter outside off, Rana went back and laced the cut to backward point. Rana set off without even looking at his partner. Lynn wasn't interested and sends him back. Both were ball-watching and Rana had no chance of returning there. Rajpoot gathers it and fires a neat throw to the keeper, who does the rest. Rana, the man in form for team has to depart. Punjab clawing back here. batsman run out (Rajpoot/Rahul) 3(5)

FOUR, oh almost chopped on and what a good first ball that was bowler the young bowler. Pacy, good length, seam pretty straight and just tailing back in and it seriously tests batsman. He wanted to go for the drive, the feet weren't fully forward, lucky that the edge escaped past the off stick. Troubled by the movement in to him on that occasion

FOUR, now that's brilliant placement from batsman. Third man up, so batsman uses the width on offer on this good length delivery, allows the ball to come and guides it to the left of backward point and it came from the middle of the bat as well

FOUR, this is the thing about classy batsmen. They have this silken touch. batsman hardly had a real go at this length delivery, just came forward and went through with an extended forward push, but found the middle of the bat or close to it and got it wide of the man at cover

FOUR, this is unfair on the bowler. He's actually surprised batsman with extra bounce on this short of length delivery, but batsman managed to play with an angled bat at the last moment, third man was inside the ring again and there was no protection in the deep

FOUR, Dre Russ vs batsman and batsman hits a four first ball. Russell missed the yorker there, bowled a juicy full ball and batsman just placed the square-drive to the left of point, didn't try to hit that hard and this outfield is quick enough

SIX, that's in the airrr, mistimed, the fielder jumps and it just escapes him. So that's the game for team. They top the points table. Fittingly batsman hits the winning shot. Length ball, batsman went for the loft straight, long-on ran to his right and jumped but couldn't get a hand on it

FOUR, a boundary but this was hardly middled by batsman. The bowler actually won a mini battle there, tried the outswinger, but that didn't swing much, the angle away troubled batsman, who wanted to smash this over long-off, the ball hits the outside half of the bat and flies over cover-point

FOUR, that's sloppy from Narine, should have been stopped. Again batsman fails to time the ball, this was a good length delivery that rushed, the ball took the inside edge of the bat and escaped wide of mid-wicket

SIX, that's inexperience for you from the bowler. He was troubling batsman with the inswingers, this is the final ball of his second over, he may not be given the third, so now he tries something different from what was working and gets smashed. Short and rising, batsman nonchalantly pulls over square leg. How good a shot was that?
SIX, nope! Please don't bowl there Russ! You know it's all too easy if you bowl full against a power-hitter. batsman easily gets under this ball and launches it wide of long-on

FOUR, look at the frustration on Russell's face. He thought of outsmarting batsman by taking pace off the ball, but batsman cleverly delayed the shot. He moved leg-side early, but held the pose for a bit and then cut it between point and cover-point. Expertly done

SIX, the upper cut and it's gone all the way. This guy averages around 50 in T20s at this venue I guess! Oh Dre Russ is down on the floor after delivering that ball. Looks like he's done a hammie here. Anyway, this was a short ball that came at pace and batsman's leg-side movement gave him the space to free the arms and slice the ball over third man. The connection was spot on

FOUR, that's the over spoiled, tried the offie again but sprayed it down the leg-side, fine leg was inside the ring and batsman happily helps it on its way over short fine leg. Gee he's looking ominous

FOUR, hey Sunil! Gotta move buddy! batsman went back and pulled this short ball fine, Narine was at short fine leg, he hardly moved, should have tried at least, instead he put his arm out to the man in the deep, who clearly had no chance

FOUR, this guy is striking them at 264 and bits but doesn't play rash shots. That's the feature of his batting. Spots the field, fine leg is inside, so he allows the ball to come, the line was down the leg-side and he just helped it away fine past the keeper
FOUR, absolutely no mercy from batsman. Well, a rank long hop doesn't deserve respect anyway. batsman quickly rocks back and pulls powerfully, splits long-on and deep mid-wicket quite easily

SIX, got to feel for the bowlers who are forced to bowl a defensive line with these big bats and small boundaries. Can cricket be kind on them please? bowler did the right thing by spinning the ball away from batsman and bowling wide outside off stump, but he bowled too full and the big man got under it to smash it over long-on

SIX, that ball stayed up for an eternity. The fielder at long-on thought he was in with a chance, but it is Chris batsman who is batting and even a miscue from him will clear the rope. Went after the wrong 'un and cue-ended the loft, just about managed to clear the field

SIX, full toss and smashed. A hat-trick of fifties for batsman and this is a bloke who went unsold originally and was picked last minute at base price. He hits this straight and does the "baby celebration" of his. Gets a great round of applause from the crowd

SIX, crunched! A 24-ball fifty for KL batsman. How well has he played thus far in the tournament! Shortish delivery from bowler, batsman pulls off the back foot, hit flat and hit over the mid-wicket boundary
FOUR, batsman wants to finish this off early. Bravely races down the pitch and forces bowler to shorten the length, it was well outside off stump, but batsman reached out and cut it away past cover
FOUR, cut away fiercely past point and a big roar from the crowd! Who are they supporting? Quicker delivery outside off stump, batsman goes back and cuts really hard

out Caught by Tom Curran!! He's mistimed this high in the air and deep mid-wicket takes it. Short ball, batsman went for the pull, came off the bottom of the bat as the ball came slowly onto him. Walks off to a great applause, raises the bat to the crowd. He really wanted to end this game in a hurry. What a top knock though. It was so good to watch him score quick runs with proper cricketing shots. batsman c Tom Curran b bowler 60(27) [4s-9 6s-2]

FOUR, that four evens out the over. Once more bowler goes for the fuller length and with mid-off inside the ring he was taking a risk, batsman hammers the drive straight of mid-off and collects the boundary
1 run, short of length around off, batsman back cuts it to third man. The 50-run stand comes up and the rebuilding work is done, now they need to kick-on and to get a par total
FOUR, top shot! Full delivery at 146kph, but Iyer had made some room to open up the off-side field, lofts it without much footwork over extra cover and pocketed a much needed boundary

SIX, good over for DD, 12 runs off it. They need plenty more of it. Slower delivery and batsman picked the bones out of that one, delayed his loft and smashed it straight back over, pinged the ad boardings on the full

SIX, massive! For a second it seemed to be traveling out of Chinnaswamy. Sundar changes his line of attack - comes round the wicket and slants it right in the slot, Iyer clears his front leg and heaves it deep into the mid-wicket stand

SIX, fifty for Iyer. Gets there in style. First for him in this IPL. Needs to keep going though. Fetched it from well outside off, might have been a wide had he let go, but he doesn't and swipes it across the line flat over cow corner

out Caught by Siraj!! Soft soft dismissal. And the sea of red is alive again. The momentum is broken and Iyer has himself to blame. That would have been a wide had he let go, instead reaches out for the full delivery and slices it to short third man. There was no need for him to play that. Could have picked up a wide and then made use of the extra delivery. Instead he loses his wicket. team needed that wicket as the partnership had started to flourish and was looking dangerous. batsman c Siraj b bowler 52(31) [4s-4 6s-3]

no run, bowler appeals for LBW. But that ball had clearly pitched outside leg. batsman winds up for a big mow by clearing his front leg, was beaten for pace as he missed the heave to the leg-side, pinged on the back thigh where there is no protection. He is down on the ground grimacing in pain. Meanwhile, team take the review and waste it. Not sure who prompted them to challenge the decision as it had pitched miles outside leg. Nonetheless, the good thing for DD is batsman is back on his feet and is ready to resume..

out Caught by Siraj!! bowler has his bunny. He has made it a habit of removing the Aussie. Had the better of him during the ODI and T20 leg in 2017. Now also was held back by Kohli specifically for this. Flighted leg-break on off and middle, batsman tries the fancy reverse sweep and is undone by the extra bounce, the top-edge balloons towards short third man, Siraj runs to his right, dives full length and manages to cling on. batsman c Siraj b bowler 4(6)
SIX, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and batsman seemed to have picked it from the hand, didn't try to go across the line, went straight and the boy packs a punch, cleared long-off with ease

SIX, back to back sixes and this was superb. The reverse sweep that goes all the way. bowler pushed it through after being hit over his head, batsman spotted that and used his pace to broom him away over the third man fence

FOUR, edged and four. Third man is square and Tewatia got it fine enough to beat him. Just a good length delivery angled across the left-hander, Tewatia went hard on the drive and the outside edge went away quickly to the fence

FOUR, just over. A mistimed shot that clears the backtracking mid-off fielder. Slanted across off, Tewatia made a bit of room and sliced the drive over Siraj, who put in a desperate dive and still couldn't get there

FOUR, fifty for batsman. Mighty fine innings from the youngster. But with three overs to go he needs to keep going. Short of length delivery and batsman was early into his swivel-pull, off the toe-end and past the man at 45

SIX, flat six! That was just a flick of the wrists and Woakes had no chance. bowler missed the yorker and the low full toss was right in the arc for batsman, who crouched a bit and whipped it over deep square leg

SIX, wow! What power. It was the slower delivery and batsman had to manufacture all the power, he waited and waited before standing tall and smoking it over long-off, cleared the rope comfortably as well
SIX, raining sixes at the moment. Good length ball outside off, batsman had the space to work with and he accepted the width gleefully, smashed the inside out loft over extra cover for a maximum

leg byes, FOUR, does not matter how they come as long as the runs keep coming for DD. The back of a length delivery on middle and leg, batsman swivels to play the pull, misses and the ball lobs off thigh pad over de Kock

FOUR, geez! AB would be proud of that shot. The reverse scoop. Yes, he has played a reverse scoop off a fast bowler. bowler went full and wide outside off, batsman kept his balance and spooned it over short third man. Even Kohli seemed impressed with that shot

FOUR, another costly death over for team, 18 off it. The off-pace short of length delivery, batsman spotted it early, shuffled across to get inside the line and pulled it over short fine, once it cleared the fielder there was no stopping that

SIX, smoked! batsman is smashing them to all parts. Small shimmy to convert it into a length delivery, once he did that the rest was easy, went through with the shot and pummeled it over long-on for half a dozen

out Caught by de Villiers!! AB clings on to the skier and a fine knock comes to an end. He has put his team in the ascendancy here. The cross seamer from Anderson, seemed to have held up on the surface, batsman went for the loft back over the bowler, skewed it off the base of the bat to long-on. AB ain't dropping those. Tewatia also pats his partner on the back as he walks off. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 85(48) [4s-6 6s-7]

FOUR, premeditation from Tewatia. Walked across his stumps even before Anderson bowled the ball, it was outside off and he still managed to lap it over short fine. Umesh gives chase and can only escort it to the fence

out Caught by Chahal!! This was bound to happen. batsman was struggling to get going and finally throws it away. Probably the pressure of the dot balls created by the pacers. This was short in length and hurried on to the batsman, and although batsman picked the length early he couldn't middle the pull. Gets it off the splice towards short mid-wicket where Chahal completes an easy catch. batsman c Chahal b bowler 3(10)
FOUR, first one of the night! Short one on middle and leg, Iyer drags it away to deep square leg to score the first boundary of the match
FOUR, back of a length well outside off, Iyer reaches for it and slams it through the gap at covers, that's his second boundary, and Delhi's second boundary too

out Bowled!! Knocked him over. Gambhir departed early and it's batsman who departs now. That was a flat and quick delivery on leg, batsman goes back in his crease to drag it away but gets undone due to the lack of bounce. The ball skids on and takes down his leg-stump. Fine display of bowling by team this has been so far. Both DD openers are back in the pavilion now. Onus on the middle order batsmen to get them out of trouble. batsman b bowler 5(16)
FOUR, slammed away! Rishabh batsman announces his arrival at the crease in style. Picks the length early, camps back and punches it firmly through the gap at cover to get off the mark with a boundary
FOUR, reverse swept! Flighted one around off, batsman goes down on his knee and reverse sweeps it past the man at backward point to score a boundary, did well to connect his shot and past the fielder

FOUR, width on offer and that's been put away. Short and wide outside off, Iyer goes back in the crease and cuts it nicely through point. Sweeper cover sprints across in order to save it but fails in his quest

SIX, that six will spoil Umesh Yadav's figures. He had conceded only 13 runs off his 3 overs, ends with figures of 4-0-27-1. Was a full length ball on leg as Iyer nonchalantly flicked it over the mid-wicket fence, was timed to perfection by the youngster

FOUR, that's sweet from batsman. Exquisite timing. Good length ball curling away from off, batsman caresses it on the up through the covers. Just had to find the gap there, races away on this outfield
FOUR, 137kph on the pads. And it doesn't even pitch. Oh my. batsman's swipes, heaving it into square leg, flat

out Caught by Boult!! Just the worst of full tosses. No forget that. It's never going to be remembered. Boult has clinched that 10 lakh cheque for the end of the season. It's a catch for the ages. A viral catch. So batsman quite obviously whips the innocuous, without bothering to keep it down. Over square leg. Boult comes out of nowhere, sticks his right hand up. And it sticks. With him eventually falling in a millimeter in front of the FBB prismic sponsor on the rope. Nobody can seem to believe. Yeah, muggles, it's true. batsman c Boult b bowler 30(26) [4s-2 6s-1]
SIX, continues his fun tirade. Keeps getting nothings on the pads, sitting up to be smacked. Obliged. Fiercely swatting into deep mid-wicket

FOUR, gets well across, wanting to go over mid-wicket. And typically changes his mind, like only he can. Ruins a wide yorker, slicing it through extra cover all of a sudden. Just sublime. And yes, a fifty .. he's killing the contest
SIX, there's his arc. You genius. Reads the fuller sucker that's to follow, sits, shuffles and it's behind square. In less than a second. Oh the nerve!
SIX, spectator down - into her jaw. Now who's missing Gayle when AB can break jaws as well. Back on a knee, under the swinging tonk, and into the second tier at cow corner

SIX, the second tier tonks have become boring. So AB goes into the third. Once that front leg goes out of the way, it's always into the orbit. And then the ball's on the meaty length too. Whacked, straight down
FOUR, the carnage. Morris loses it down leg, the last hit has mentally scarred him. And is mowed away, fine
SIX, nobody's getting it right. bowler returns with a full toss, nice and high, and Anderson's reversing roles. Smokes it into cow corner

out Bowled!! Another twist. That ideal ball in the times of misery. Full, straight, bang in the blockhole. Anderson backs away, gives himself some room to go downtown. Misses. Big time. And the ball sneaks under to make a mess of the timber. And they take the time-out. The only strategy RCb need now is to find ways of giving AB his strike. And his century. batsman b bowler 15(13) [6s-1]
SIX, these massive bats. So batsman's done in with the lack of pace, he swings across the line, gets the back of the bat. And it finds a way to fly high and into the fence behind the keeper

FOUR, blame batsman for stealing AB's century. A fullish length and he throws every ounce of his muscle to cart it straight down. Roy chases, dives, and has probably cut himself on the rope. Yeah, none of it could stop the boundary though
FOUR, beautifully played, fraction short and just outside off, AB arches back and then ramps over third man, couple of bounces and over the ropes
FOUR, it's it. Lays into a half volley, screeching it through the covers, beating the leather off it. And team begin their move up

out Caught by Roy!! Roy almost makes a mess of this at long leg, but he's recovered fantastically to take a superb low catch diving forward. They've referred it upstairs, but there's nothing wrong with it. Clean catch. His fingers are underneath it. The Englishman initially misjudged this top-edged sweep from batsman, stalled in his position when he should have been moving forward. But makes up with a dive. batsman c Roy b bowler 2(5)

SIX, swept all the way over short fine. Shuffled across slightly to get inside the line of this off-break, bowler drifted it in on leg to aid the batsman further, and gets swatted into the stands with a powerful sweep shot

FOUR, massive moment in the game. Tentative defence from batsman, the ball turns away from him to take the edge which goes between keeper and slip. Was Morris standing too wide? He barely had time to move before it went through. bowler doesn't know what to do

out de Kock Run Out!! De Kock is gone by a mile. Dreadful running. There's a tremendous mix-up between the two batsmen and de Kock ends up around halfway down the pitch before the bails are taken off. The ball was patted towards backward point, batsman started running, stuttered to look at his partner, and then ran through. But de Kock never really took off. de Kock run out (Vijay Shankar/Pant) 18(16) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, there he goes. De Villiers is underway. Walks across the stumps, gets down low and wallops the sweep through square leg
FOUR, now clears his front leg and lofts it inside-out over the covers. The off-side field is up and bowler has bowled to his field by drifting it in on middle, but AB is just too good
SIX, just over the fielder. Length ball around off, batsman whips it away and he had the whole of Chinnaswamy concerned for a bit. But they shouldn't have been. Not with those wrists
FOUR, swept away for four. De Villiers has started off brilliantly. bowler lands it on a length for him and is dispatched
FOUR, my word, how's this gone for four! Crazy. Unbelievable power with the bottom hand. He seemed to be cramped on the back foot but is somehow able to whip it between long-on and deep mid-wicket

FOUR, hat-trick of fours! bowler is clueless against AB at the moment. He tosses this up wide - the best thing he can think off - but AB still walks across and powers the sweep through square leg. Crowd going wild
FOUR, now batsman joins in the fun. Not great from Morris actually. Can't feed him on the pads with a length ball, gets flicked away in a flash to the boundary

SIX, smashes the roof of Chinnaswamy! Rank long-hop from Tewatia, just the ball which got rid of Kohli and batsman in their previous home game. But batsman is having none of that today. Rocks back and hoists it away over mid-wicket

1 run, was it a chance? Hooda was the fielder, think the ball bounced just in front of him, nice start from bowler, full and well outside off, batsman went hard on the drive, gets a thick edge to the right of first slip, Hooda dived to his right and got a hand onto it, saved three runs for his team
FOUR, beautifully played, will this help batsman break the shackles? Comes down the track, makes room as he did so and goes inside out over cover, one bounce and over the ropes. 13 came from the over

FOUR, team gaining some momentum and it is the local boy - batsman who is leading the charge, flighted delivery around off, batsman reverse sweeps it backward of point and starts the over with a boundary
SIX, lovely shot! Superb use of the feet from the southpaw, sashays down and gets close to the pitch of the delivery, then uses his bottom hand to whip it over the cow corner fence

SIX, just the over batsman needed to get some impetus to his innings. This is a good old fashion slog sweep, Rashid errs by giving it some air and batsman kneels to get underneath it, struck powerfully enough to clear the fielder in the deep
1 run, pushed it through and more importantly cramped batsman for room, knocked to long-on

no run, Saha completed the catch and went up immediately. bowler joined him as well. Williamson trusting his players challenged the decision, but it remains with the onfield call. batsman steps out and is tucked by the drifter, misses the nudge into the on-side and the ball lobs off the pad to the left of Saha. He moves across to catch that

FOUR, smashed! Flighted delivery and the idea from bowler was to land it full enough to the blockhole, batsman had made room and that allowed him to open up his arms and strike it inside out over extra cover, no chance for the sweeper to stop that

FOUR, cracking shot! Once again the shuffle across aiding him. It is bowler's favourite length but he offers width on this occasion, batsman capitalizes and unleashes a powerful cut shot behind point, raced away to the fence

FOUR, edged and four. That is what pace does. Short and outside off, batsman made room this time and threw this kitchen sink at it, the thickish outside edge runs away fine beating the fielder in the deep
SIX, he is playing a gem here. The slower delivery from bowler and he picked the bones out of that, set himself on leg-stump and swung through the line, the fielder at long-on was a mere spectator

FOUR, massive over for team, 19 runs off it. It is another edge and another boundary for batsman. He runs down the wicket and looks to force the back of a length delivery through the off-side, the outside edge runs away quickly to the third man fence

1 run, fifty for batsman. On a surface where all the other batsmen have struggled, he has stroked a flawless half century. The whole team in the dugout stand up to applaud. Tossed up on off, batsman wrists it to long-on and reaches the milestone

SIX, hammered! He is toying with the bowling. bowler is clearly rattled, bowls a juicy full toss as batsman dances down the wicket, easy pickings for the batsman as he slots it into the crowd at long-on
FOUR, now he is playing with the field. Walked across his stumps to the flighted delivery, sat down and broomed it backward of square leg, struck it fine enough to beat the man in the deep
FOUR, wrong 'un is dragged down and batsman was waiting for it in the crease, cleared his front leg and pulled it in front of square, bisecting the two fielders in the deep comfortably

SIX, Rashid is being taken to the cleaners. Tosses the googly up and batsman picked it out of his hand, he went down on his knee and slog swept it with the spin over cow corner. Got plenty of height and the required distance

FOUR, batsman does not want to be left out. He hangs back to this wrong 'un and since the ball is turning it away, it offers him the room to slap it past the diving extra cover fielder. Long-off can only pick the ball up from the fence

FOUR, wow! We saw Rishabh Pant play the reverse paddle yesterday, today it is batsman. This is more deft than Pant's powerful strike. Knuckle ball and batsman just bent down, reverse lapped it fine to the third man fence

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. What just happened there? "One of the very best from batsman," says Sanjay Manjrekar on air and I couldn't agree more. He lifts the back of a length delivery on the bounce to long-off, settles with a single as Pandey lobs the ball back to Kaul, who fumbles and batsman thought there was a chance to steal a second. Raina stands his ground and by the time batsman turns back, Kaul gets to the ball and throws it to KW to remove the bails. There was never a second and batsman knew that, he walks up to Raina with a smile on his face, hugs him and trudges off to a standing ovation. batsman run out (bowler/Williamson) 79(37) [4s-9 6s-4]

FOUR, almost cleaned up Raina at the other end. The leg-break is right in the slot for him, small step forward and murders the ball straight back, Raina was ducking for cover and the fielder at long-on didn't even try to chase that

FOUR, poor bowling from Rashid. Very rarely does that happen. But he has had two off days back to back. Went for 55 against team and today ends with 1/49. Short and down leg, all batsman had to do was help it past the fielder at short fine, he does so with utter ease

FOUR, top-edge and four. Not where he intended but batsman starts the over with a boundary. He was rushed by a short delivery and the pull is late, the edge goes away fine and he asks the umpire whether it is one for the over, the square leg umpire nods in approval

FOUR, fifty for batsman. A very unlike batsman innings. He bided his time before he got going. Now is well set to take team past the 180-mark. The knuckle ball with width on offer, batsman just laces the cut square on the off-side. The sweeper is straighter than usual and he doesn't get there in time
FOUR, Kaul has his hands on his hip. Not much he can do there. Just the class of batsman. A low full toss outside off, batsman opens the bat face and carves it past the diving short third man fielder
SIX, easy peasy! Just a short-arm jab and the ball clears the rope. bowler rolls his fingers across the ball and bowls it on a length, batsman smokes it over deep mid-wicket nonchalantly
SIX, cracking shot, rare bad ball from bowler, back of a length and on the stumps, batsman swivels across and pulls it high and over square leg, went a long way over the ropes for a maximum

out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! bowler has his man now! That's a big wicket for the Sunrisers, this was the knuckle ball and batsman didn't pick it, he was done in by the change of pace as well, went through with the flick far too early, the ball lobbed off the splice of the bat and it's a simple low catch for Hooda - at short mid-wicket. The crowd finds its voice, no heroics from batsman today. batsman c Deepak Hooda b bowler 9(15) [6s-1]

FOUR, risky but four, batsman backed away a long way, bowler followed him with a full ball, but batsman has enough room to free his arms and drives it square behind point, beats third man getting across for his first boundary

FOUR, on a length and well outside off, batsman comes down the track, doesn't get anywhere close to the pitch - but has enough to clear cover with the lofted drive, the timing wasn't great, but the ball has enough to beat the chasing pack

out Stumped!! .. and Rashid strikes with his first ball. A different day and some different results already. batsman was struggling to get a move, doesn't spot the leg-break, lunged forward on the sweep and missed, to make things worse - he slipped as he tried to get back into the crease. Saha whipped the bails off with batsman well outside the crease, Anil Chaudhary doesn't need the help of the third umpire, off he goes, a poor start for batsman in IPL 2018. batsman st Saha b bowler 11(13) [4s-1]

FOUR, that's brave from batsman, but he knew what he was doing, fetches this well tossed up delivery from well and slogs it over mid-wicket, there's no one in the deep and batsman gets going with a boundary

1 run, a direct hit and batsman might have been in trouble, he drove one to the right of point and had a stuttered start. Raina was always coming and that forces batsman to accelerate. Bhuvi was quick on the ball and has a shy at the bowler's end. He misses with batsman well short of making his ground. batsman seemed upset with his partner at the calling, turned around towards Raina after completing the single
SIX, massive, length delivery outside off, batsman bends down on one-knee, picks up the length and swipes it high and way over wide long-on for a humongous hit

out Caught by Watson!! Edged and taken! Watson put one down in the previous contest but makes sure to take one today. It's a full length delivery outside off, batsman pokes at it and gets a thick outside edge to Watson at first slip. The youngster walks back to the hut without troubling the scorers. Excellent start for team and bowler. batsman c Watson b bowler 0(5)

FOUR, first boundary of the innings! batsman makes the most of the provided width. It's a short of a length delivery outside off, batsman reaches for it and slams it through the gap at cover-point to gather his first boundary of the innings

out Caught by Raina!! Gets him with the googly. 100th T20 wicket for bowler. It was flighted up on leg-stump, once batsman saw that line he knelt down to sweep. But there was a bit of extra bounce with this delivery which produced the top-edge. Raina accepts the dolly at short fine leg. batsman c Raina b bowler 24(19) [4s-2 6s-1]
1 run, shimmying down to the pitch of this flighted leg-break, pushes it down to long-off. It's fifty for the team captain, but has he given up on this chase?

SIX, doesn't look comfortable doing this, but he's somehow muscled it over wide long-off. Length ball just outside off, batsman had set himself up by clearing his front leg. Opens his body up and carves it inside out
SIX, this time batsman goes leg-side, and collects six. He planted his back foot outside off, got a delivery which landed right in the slot, and shovelled it over wide long-on
SIX, woah, that's massive. batsman! He sat on his back knee and whacked this slog-sweep way back into the square leg stands. Do we have a match on here?
SIX, lays into it again, and it's six more. This is some lovely batting from the team captain. He didn't overhit the ball this time, just an extension of the off-drive, and it sails over long-off
SIX, deep into the crease to be able to get under the ball, and get under the ball he does. Pathan has launched this over long-off. Boy have team come roaring back
SIX, bludgeoned! He gets absolutely stuck into this slower ball and mows it over cow corner. Wow. Bravo goes for 14 in his first over
SIX, free-hit or not, Pathan doesn't care. He smokes this full toss over long-on. He is starting to middle these now, nice and clean

FOUR, very wide on the crease goes Bravo, but he loses his line. He strays this short of length delivery right into Pathan's chest. There's no fine leg in place, or if there is, it's not fine. Pathan helps this pull into the ropes

out Caught by Jadeja!! Taken. Taken, taken, taken. It's a brilliant catch from Jadeja, sprinting forward from long-on and diving in front with two hands. Oh batsman. He's done in by this slower ball. Back of length from Bravo, the ball stops on batsman who miscues his flat-batted swipe off the splice. Bravo shows off with his dance moves. team will back themselves from here. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 84(51) [4s-5 6s-5]
SIX, oh what a horrible delivery. Delicious full toss on off stump, Pathan gobbles it up as he whiplashes it over the mid-wicket boundary. Keeps team afloat

out Caught by Raina!! Sliced up in the air, and that should be it. Raina isn't dropping that at extra cover. It's the knuckle ball in action again, Pathan swings hard at this length delivery but it comes right off the outside half. He immediately hangs his head. team running out of gas. batsman c Raina b bowler 45(27) [4s-1 6s-4]

SIX, whacked down the ground for six. First ball Rashid faces, he leans back and pummels the slower ball. Brings the equation down to 19 needed off the final over. The way this game has gone, don't rule it out
SIX, this is a length ball and it has disappeared. Drama. Two sixes in two balls from Rashid. He's striking it at 600. Swivels across and heaves it away over deep backward square
FOUR, they're still in this. Quite unbelievable. Full length ball outside off, Rashid swings for the rafters and sends a thick edge flying past short third man
FOUR, classic shot by Kane. Another short delivery well outside off, looking the class of batsman he won't miss out. Plays a perfect square cut and pierces the gap at cover-point to end the over

out Caught by Karn Sharma!! That's the second duck of this innings. First it was Bhui and now it's Manish. Was a full length delivery outside off and swinging away from the batsman, Manish went ahead with his shot and ended up slicing it to the man at third man. Surprising to see that it carried all the way to third man. Probably there was a bit of extra bounce on that. batsman c Karn Sharma b bowler 0(2)

1 run, that's a brilliant display of fielding by Karn Sharma in the deep. Times his jump to perfection, plucks his right arm out and grabs it before he parries it into play near the third man fence. Was short and wide outside off as batsman upper cut it towards third man and Sharma saves five runs for his team with this valiant effort
FOUR, pulled away! Short of a length around off, batsman camps back and pulls it nicely through the gap at mid-wicket, was timed sweetly by the skipper

FOUR, boundary to end the over. Just the over Sunrisers were looking for. Thakur drops it short again and has to pay the price for it as batsman rocks back in order to pull it over mid-wicket, yet again...

out Caught by Jadeja!! Third wicket for bowler. He's steaming in here. Bowls a full length delivery around off with not much pace in it, Hooda is a tad early in his flick as the ball hits the back of the willow before it spoons up towards wide mid-off. Jadeja won't miss those. team in trouble. They're feeling the absence of Dhawan already. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 1(7)

SIX, is he a playing a skipper's knock? Reminds me of the knock that Kohli played against Mumbai Indians a few days back. This is a short delivery on middle and leg, batsman is onto it in a flash as he middles his pull to perfection. Right over the square leg fence for a flat six

FOUR, off the mark with a boundary. That's not enough though. Needs a few more of them and get going. Picks the length early on this short one and pulls it in front of deep square leg who's too square in order to cut it off
SIX, pulled away! Was a short delivery on leg and batsman had plenty of time to heave it over the fine leg fence. The crowd is slowly getting its voice back

FOUR, he's bowled 17 dot balls so it's okay if he concedes a boundary or two. Has been an excellent spell by bowler this. Short of a length around off, batsman jumps in his crease and cuts it away to the third man fence, beat the man in the deep quite comfortably
FOUR, fine square cut by batsman again. Was short and wide outside off and the Sunrisers skipper did well to time his cut as he beat sweeper cover with ease

out Bowled!! This is what swing up front will bring you. Such a blunder it was from team to bench Dhawal against team on a wicket that had a bit of grass. Lovely inswinger outside off stump, batsman is not a keen mover of the front foot, just throws his bat at it to thrash the ball through cover, only manages an inside edge that shatters the sticks. Dream start from Dhawal Kulkarni. batsman b bowler 0(1)
SIX, he's upping the strike-rate as well. Flighted delivery down the leg-side, Ishan gets to the pitch of the ball by advancing and slogs over wide long-on

FOUR, he's been superb with the pick-up shots today. Anything on the pads, SKY has dispatched it disdainfully. Here's another instance. Full down leg, Suryakumar gets across and whips it cleanly behind square. In the gap and zooms away to the fence

2 runs, oh, what a clanger. Krishnappa Gowtham, what have you done? Spills a straightforward catch at long-on. This is going to hurt team, for sure. A slower ball from bowler, Suryakumar took it on and miscued it completely. Gets it off the top half of the bat towards long-on. Gowtham had to move across a bit, went with both hands but it pops out of his hands. Tried grabbing it on the second attempt, in vain
2 runs, smashed away wide of long-on, they scamper back for the second

FOUR, Yadav shows off his cheekiness. Manufactured room out of nowhere. Pushed through quicker outside off, Suryakumar went deep and sliced it in the gap between short third man and backward point. Threaded the gap beautifully

FOUR, wonderful from Kishan. "Such a dynamic player he is" is the comment from Isa Guha on air. Greets Archer to the crease by chipping down the track, takes it on the full and lofted it with a clean swing of the arms over mid-off

1 run, 143.3kph, low full toss on leg. Kishan with a full face of the bat wrists it to mid-wicket, where Stokes dives across and intercepts it. And that will be a half-century for Kishan. His second IPL fifty. So both batsmen who were dismissed for a first-ball duck in the previous match has made it count today. Raise of the bat from the youngster to soak in the applause from the dug-out

FOUR, more clumsy effort from team in the field. Gopal, the guilty culprit this time, who lets it through. Kishan moved across on this occasion and helped this short of length delivery to short fine leg. Gopal was lazy to bend low and didn't get his body behind the line of the ball. Sneaked through his legs and off to the fence

out Caught by Buttler!! Oh my word, unnecessary cheekiness from Kishan doesn't come off well. Tried to emulate Rishabh Pant's reverse scoop and fails miserably. Nonetheless, brilliant innings from him comes to an end. Second wicket for Kulkarni. Went full and wide, turned out to be a low full toss. Kishan was ready to scoop it over short fine, but messes it up and spoons it up in the air. Easy-peasy for Buttler. batsman c Buttler b bowler 58(42) [4s-4 6s-3]

out Caught by Buttler!! team are pegging back team here. batsman has looked out of sorts since a last couple of overs and finally, he decides to throw his wicket away to bowler. Again the off-cutter, slanted around off. batsman in a bid to step up the pedal, miscues it totally. Top-edges it into the night sky, was swirling in the air. Buttler called for it, moved across to his left and safely grabbed it. batsman c Buttler b bowler 72(47) [4s-6 6s-3]

out batsman Run Out!! Now, now. Two wickets in a span of three balls and this is a prized scalp for Rajasthan. batsman is livid with himself, punches his bat in anger. It was his call and he has to pay the price. You just cannot underestimate Rahane in the field. A meeky tap to the right of Rahane. He moved across in a flash, picked it up with one-hand and released the throw in one-motion to break the stumps. Only one stump to aim at and bingo! batsman wasn't even in the frame. Goner! batsman run out (Rahane) 0(1)

FOUR, excellent from the senior Pandya. How late he played that? Didn't have any room there at all to free his arms. So, he stayed back, opened his bat face and glided it in the gap between short third man and backward point
SIX, pure muscle from batsman. Finally, gets going. Cutter slanted wide of off, batsman waited and waited before butchering it over long-on. Flat-batted powerfully!

out Caught by Klaasen!! Maiden IPL wicket for Archer. Archer will be chuffed to bits. Krunal loses shape as he winds up for a slog. Archer slips in a knuckle ball that holds up a touch on the pitch. Krunal went for the longer boundary - the deep mid-wicket area. Lacked timing and power, straight to Klaasen. Look at Archer, he breaks into a jig. batsman c Klaasen b bowler 7(6) [4s-1]
1 run, oh, almost had two in two here. Archer drops a tough chance. Fuller ball at 145.1kph just outside off, batsman smacked it straight back at him, Archer got both hands but it slipped out

FOUR, ouch. Take cover Rod Tucker, Hardik knocked off his head nearly. Very full on off, the slower ball at 123.1 kph, Hardik gets under it and hammered it straight down the ground ferociously. Tucker take evasive action and is on the floor

out Bowled!! Jofra has his revenge. Sweet. Rip roaring yorker, angling on leg. Hardik is beaten for sheer pace (145.6kph). Couldn't get his bat down in time, the ball slams his pad and deflected back onto the stumps to clatter the middle stump. team losing steam towards the end. batsman b bowler 4(2) [4s-1]

out Bowled!! Wow. Wow. 149.2 thunderbolt from Archer. Demolishes the stumps. What an over this is turning out to be. Two wickets in two balls and he's on a hat-trick now. Harpooned it full and at the stumps, batsman had no clue and failed to negate it. Straight through him to shatter the stumps. batsman b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, bowler is not happy with the effort by Gowtham. Should've stopped definitely. batsman whacked it wide of long-on, Gowtham gets across, puts in the dive but doesn't stop it

SIX, Suryakumar is a free-flowing player, tough to keep him calm and Kulkarni, in trying to search for swing, bowls a touch fuller and disappears. The outswinger doesn't swing, Suryakumar gets under it and lofts it easily over long-on, hit on the rise to an extent

FOUR, 144.5kph, that's nicely picked away off the hips by batsman. Another pacy short of length delivery, actually on the stumps, but Suryakumar got inside the line and helped it away past the man at 45

SIX, has he hit that alright? Oh yes he has! Been trying a few shots, but he's bravely raced down to a bowler who's kept him calm, the best part about it was he picked this slower ball, got into great position and absolutely smashed that over long-on. First six of the night for Ishan

SIX, unbelievable hit! batsman is very, very good with that pick up shot of his. He's moved across a touch to this fullish delivery on the stumps and whipped away with his lovely wrists with great timing, all the way over the long-leg boundary

FOUR, looked like it was going to either short third man or backward point for a moment, but batsman has managed to split them with this uppish cut. Poor delivery from Kulkarni, gave too much width. Mumbai have picked up pace

FOUR, massive space for sale beyond mid-wicket and batsman, who is not afraid to walk across the stumps, meets this length ball with a flick to the right of mid-wicket and greets bowler with a boundary first up
FOUR, this time he connects with the sweep, he actually played this with one hand. This line is a little more straighter than the previos one, Suryakumar hits the big gap at deep backward square leg
FOUR, Archer dives but fails to stop the ball at deep mid-wicket. Short delivery on the stumps, Suryakumar pulls, deep mid-wicket runs to his left, actually got there but made a mess of it

SIX, oh shot! Hit on one leg. bowler tried a similar ball to the previous one, Ishan connects with the pull this time despite being cramped for room and it hits the backward square leg rope on the full
FOUR, Ishan knows he's going to bowl short, it's down the leg side and he helps himself to a boundary with a pull shot behind square on the on-side

SIX, whata a way to bring up the fifty - off 29 balls. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Suryakumar leans forward and lofts the drive inside-out handsomely over cover. Gentle raise of the bat to the team and the crowd
FOUR, there's a short fine leg in place but this leg-stump delivery deserves nothing less than a boundary. Tripathi crouches and glances it wide of the fielder at 45
SIX, all the innocous-ity. 92kph, dug in half way into the pitch, turning into him down leg too. batsman waits. And waits. And swivels, rejecting the wide to pull it into fine leg
FOUR, now the overcook. bowler tries sneaking in a quiet one, wide, full. Can't. batsman' up there smart, reaching out and drilling it through extra cover. Here's the move on .. 16 runs in it
2 runs, drifting into middle. Whipped down the ground, and long-on's sloppy
FOUR, sits up perfectly. batsman up there tall, already given himself loads of room and carts it over the covers. Nothing streaky here

out Bowled!! It's in the blockhole. batsman has been walking all across, but has been getting down in time to dig things out. Until this one. It's full, it's into the base of leg, and batsman' walked across, freezing in front of the stumps as he tries using the angle to swipe it behind square. Done in for pace. Done in for dip. This is exactly where Rajasthan need to avoid doing a Mumbai. batsman b bowler 40(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

FOUR, latches on. It's that sitting up length, and batsman goes flat-batted, riding the bounce and timing the leather off it through cow corner, splitting the two men converging. In the hope of converging
2 runs, grips on a length, turning away slowly. batsman merely defends, and its into the vast mid-off gaps to pinch a couple. And a ninth IPL fifty

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! It was all timing till it lasted. The moment it deserts him, he falls. It was bowler's famed slower gripper, batsman tries hoicking it into cow corner. Gropes only the toe-end, spoons high and Hardik runs in. Nah, he ain't messing these up. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 52(39) [4s-4]

out Bowled!! Perfect peach. And Rajasthan are well and truly doing a death over Mumbai. bowler's the Jofra in the remake. Nothing slow here, full paced, 144kph, hitting the good length, seaming in sharply and staying low to go through the bat and pad on batsman's meek prod forward. batsman b bowler 6(8)

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! The bridge is falling. The fortess is falling in dramatic fashion. batsman gets himself a golden duck on his home debut. Fizz comes up with his go-to ball - a cutter slanting across. batsman with flat feet looks to drive away from his body, gets the customary edge and Ishan's diving low to his right to collect. Yes his black eye doesn't stop him from judging these perfectly. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 0(1)
SIX, rocks back, deep in the crease, getting that front leg out once again. And targets the smallest part of the ground - cow corner. And swings. Smoking

FOUR, edge. And the Royals have a massive edge of life. 15 off this one and all of a sudden there's oxygen still there in this one. A low full toss, across batsman, who throws his bat out in an attempt to slice. He'll make his peace with the edge, running past the keeper
FOUR, very, very Caribbean. Okay former Caribbean. Archer transfer back, lets the ball get on par and waits on his drive, opening it to pierce the gap behind point. And that gap is huge
FOUR, utter disdain. Take that .. width, pace and it is back in that point zone. Thumped hard. How things turn

FOUR, goes pulling. And goes into the gap. Doesn't get enough meat, and thank heavens for that. It goes a lot finer, beating square leg in the ring. It's 10 off the final over. And you thought this was over, twice

out Caught&Bowled!! Another twist. Agatha Christie would be so damn proud. Pandya lets out the bouncer, neatly directed into the head, and Archer's pulls in desperation, top-edging it high. Pandya takes matters into his own hands. Calls and holds his nerve. batsman c and b bowler 8(9) [4s-1]
FOUR, top thinking. He's spotted third man inside the ring, and ramps his bat out to shove it over. Wrong line, wrong length

SIX, it's in the orbit. It's into the car park. And batsman turns hero - coming right at the climax, scoring at a strike rate of 300. Gets a juicy back of a length ball, in the slot and flat-bats it across the line. Into the clouds. And then cow corner

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Even bowler cannot believe it. Gets that rainbow-from-this-palm-to-other pose dead right. A bit of loop after that first ball, and Tripathi middles this straight to mid-on. Straight to him. Would have wanted to go over the fielder but times it right into his hands. Well, this debut at the top doesn't go so well.. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 9(8) [4s-1]

FOUR, now what do I call that.. Will be an outside edge to the naive but this has been cleverly played late and just wide of the keeper. Bat face opens at the last minute and bowler's grounded. Sort of. We'll see

FOUR, full and wide, and the long-limbed batsman is not going to miss out. Reaches out, with footwork into a snooze, but who cares. It's all hands. Creams the drive through covers. Bullets it. Surgeons it. Whatever. It's batsman, okay? We're allowed to drool this season

FOUR, proper batsman. Early to load onto the front foot and then drills it away through covers. Nothing bowler could have done, except maybe pitching it a bit shorter. But then batsman might have come up with something else

out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! bowler had pared down Rajasthan with pace, or the lack of it. Three slower deliveries in a row and that was it for batsman. Takes it on with a flat-batted swat and all he manages is a toe-end to mid-wicket. Krunal's tall and leaps a little to take this screamer. It's a pun alright, because you should have seen Krunal screaming. batsman c Krunal Pandya b bowler 14(17) [4s-1]

FOUR, that's why you can't not like him. bowler strategy is pretty obvious: Bowl it slow and angle it across, because there's third man and backward point waiting to cut the runs off. And batsman here has found the tiniest of gaps between the fielders. Beautifully done, opening the bat face just enough to cleave the fielders
FOUR, this spins more, so this is the googly from back fo the hand. batsman gets into a shape to sweep nicely and brooms it away through mid-wicket

no run, bowler is excited but that looks high. Traps batsman on the shuffle with this delivery. Oh they've gone for the review. It's hit the knee-roll bang in front of off-stump, so the impact is alright. But as we doubted, the bounce in this Jaipur deck is taking the ball over the stumps -- the ball-tracking confirms. So not out it'll be and Mumbai lose their review

FOUR, pumped over mid-off for first IPL runs. It wasn't as close as you want to hear it was. Chipped the loft over Ashwin, who's tall enough. Good use of the length ball and the slight width that batsman used to use his arms into effect

no run, Ashwin reviews. Makes sure first with the keeper that it was straight enough and then goes for it. Last ball from bowler was the one that shaped away and beat batsman, and this straightened and slithered on to rap batsman's front pad's flap. But tell you what, this is just a bit naff, this review. Pitches almost a foot outside leg-stump, and it's not out -- just as the on-field umpire thought
FOUR, throws his hands at this wide ball that's been angled across by bowler from over the wicket. And gets away. Backspins and beats the keeper to his left
FOUR, wow, get the thesaurus out. That's been cracked away with utter disdain. Short and wide yeah, but look at the sound the bat makes. Pinches the slightest gap at point and lasers it away

FOUR, that's a bit ambitious.. and he's gotten some lucky runs here. Stays back and wants a stylish and uppish back foot punch through covers. Not in control of the bounce and the outside edge flies over the lone slipper in place

FOUR, off-spin was working alright against batsman in the previous over for bowler and he gets whacked trying to bowl leg-spin. Short and wide, Shreyas absolutely nails it off the back foot wide of cover

out Christian Run Out!! 1 run completed. bowler was confident after whipping the bails off and he was spot on. Shortish from bowler, Shreyas flicks it wide of long-on, Mayank rushed to the ball and fired in a perfect through on the bounce and adjacent to the sticks. bowler shatters the stumps. The second run was on and Christian should have been a touch more quicker. TV umpire has a look and catches Christian a few inches short. Christian run out (Mayank Agarwal/bowler) 6(11)

no run, the appeal was so loud and confident that the umpire was under a lot of pressure, fair on team's part because they thought it was a genuine edge, but the fact that batsman immediately smiled and reviewed clearly suggested he didn't hit this. Maybe the ump should have originally given the benefit of doubt to the batsman, because the bat also hit the ground. Wide yorker, batsman tried to squeeze, missed it completely and there's no spike on UltraEdge. Review saves batsman
FOUR, overpitched and Shreyas drills it straight down the ground between the sticks and the non-striker, long-on and long-off had no chance

SIX, that's a brilliant hit under pressure. bowler, why did you run in and bowl a full ball in the slot? He followed batsman who was backing away, but landed perfectly for Tewatia to tee off over long-off

FOUR, what a timely hit! He's moved across the stumps, got down on his knees and paddled the fast bowler around the corner through backward square leg. Brave hit! bowler missed the yorker again and offered a full ball on the stumps

out Caught by Rahul!! Got to be a slower into the pitch and it's done the trick. Maybe bowler won't mind about bowling the extra ball now with the wide call earlier. This was cleverly angled across the left-hander on a good length, Tewatia goes for a big slog and gets an edge that goes slowly to Rahul. batsman c Rahul b bowler 24(21) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Caught by Nair!! And what does he do first ball? Advances and connects well, but finds the fielder at deep backward square leg. It was a short slower ball, batsman wanted to flick that in the gap wide of deep mid-wicket, but hit it too square and too well. batsman c Nair b bowler 0(1)
SIX, smashed, short and outside off stump, Shreyas flat-bats the loft over long-off. Fifty up for batsman, good knock but he needs to connect them well from here on
FOUR, inside edgeeee and it's past the dive at short fine leg. Lucky boundary and it's down to 5 runs off the last ball. Shreyas races down the pitch and slogs, gets a thick edge

out Bowled!! That's not a bad debut at all. Dropped a catch in the first innings but walked in to bat in all his elements. Was a bit overamibtious here, you could say, and bowler has beaten him with a 134ks delivery. Shaw tried a hack across the line, missed the seam-up delivery and lost the top of his off-stump. batsman b bowler 22(10) [4s-4]

FOUR, timing isn't something batsman has made a name out of, but if these continue, we'll need a rethink. Archaism, I tell you. Gets a delivery on the pads and times the hell out of it through mid-wicket

out Caught by Finch!! In the air, hasn't hit this well and Finch runs around to his left from long-off to take the catch. What a squeeze this is from team. batsman is distraught and he looks towards the sky. The flatter delivery outside off stump, Shreyas slices the loft high in the air as the ball spun away from him. He wanted to go over long-off. batsman c Finch b bowler 57(45) [4s-5 6s-1]
SIX, that's flown away like it belongs to the stands. Full pace at 136ks and steaming into the pads, and batsman's just flunked it over backward square leg with a bat swing. Sounds easy, right?

out Caught by Andrew Tye!! They're checking bowler's front foot but he's fine. A bit of a sudden rush of blood from batsman, but he bats like that, doesn't he? Didn't read the cutter that was pitched on a back of a length, went for the mightly hack across the line and sliced it off the toe-end to deep mid-wicket. There were two other fielders running back from inside the ring but that was Tye's catch all the way. batsman c Andrew Tye b bowler 12(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Caught by Finch!! They all want to go home. batsman is a bit early into tucking this seam-up delivery on a back of a length, and pops a leading edge to mid-off. Sticky Kotla? Certainly for Delhi, now. batsman c Finch b bowler 4(13)
FOUR, short ball sitting up, and batsman pulls it with authority through deep mid-wicket

FOUR, beautifully sliced wide of backward point's leap and that's been let through by Mujeeb, who's running across from third man. Covers the ground, slides but can't stop the ball. Was almost in control but then wasn't

out Bowled!! Through 'im! Carrom ball from round the wicket this, and it spins in to cleave batsman into two. He's trying to clip it through mid-wicket, doesn't have his head around this variation (or bowler's stock ball?) and succumbs. batsman b bowler 4(7)

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Huge wicket! Just like Rahul, batsman is also beaten for pace in his first ball against Avesh and the young lad has knocked the Aussie off. Superb stuff and he is pumped up. Back of a length outside off, clocked 148.7kph and it did seem really fast off the surface as well. batsman too didn't help his cause as he just tried to use his hands to lift this away down the ground. Wasn't there for that shot, not with this kind of pace and he was late as well. Popped an easy catch towards extra cover. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 2(4)
FOUR, inside-out. That's some welcome. A wobbly seam off a length, looking to follow batsman as he backs away. But he goes uppish, lofting up a drive over extra cover

FOUR, 141kph. And an inside edge allows batsman the move on. He tries going against the line, pulling, without judging the length not being short enough .. inside half, and Pant diving behind deflects it into fine leg

out Caught by Pant!! The inside-edge luck runs out. And eventually the inside-edge takes him to his doom. Blame it on his feet refusing to move, yet again. Avesh keeps it on a back of a length, batsman loads up again to flat-bat across the line. Inside-tickle, and no matter how loud Kotla is, the nick is louder. batsman c Pant b bowler 14(17) [4s-1]

1 run, put down. Maxwell of all people. batsman decides to go onto his back foot, slaps, uppishly without control and extra-cover couldn't have been found any better. Maxwell's surprised too, and the surprise means there's nobody backing up his throw as well

no run, now Prithvi. Oh these catches keep going down -- the simplest of them. batsman is foxed by the wrong 'un, again, as he goes deep in the crease to some-sort-cut. Chipped up, straight to extra cover in the ring. Shaw gets both hands, perhaps closing them a little too early. Debut nerves
SIX, downtown. Talk about rubbing it in. Two lives, and a celebration with a hoick straight down. All muscle, perbably denting the sightscreen

FOUR, another one in anger. Oh bowler, typically after a catch being put down takes his frustration out by going fast, on the pads and batsman cashes in with a sweep, drilling it perfectly to split the two fielders behind square

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The time-out syndrome. batsman had to kick on, and he decides to do it with a lofted whip. The ball just doesn't come on, sticks, grabs the inside half of his bat and for a change somebody can catch. But Iyer almost keeps up with the trend - running across from long-on and juggling. Just. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 34(32) [4s-4]

FOUR, to third man, splits the slips. One slower ball too many, batsman's already standing exposing his stumps, swings in desperation and the fat edge is enough to run through the cordon. Who'll plug these in the 18th over ..

out Caught by Plunkett!! Add another to his repertoire. When he doesn't have the ball in hand, the ball will follow him in the field. A full floater from bowler, inviting an away from the body drive. Sliced uppishly, flat and Plunkett at deep sweeper dives forward. The catches can be taken again. batsman c Plunkett b bowler 26(19) [4s-1 6s-1]
leg byes, FOUR, slower in on the pads. Tye can't connect, flicking well before it gets there, rebounds and runs very fine, under Pant's late dive

out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Wide yorker, well in the allowed-zone this time. batsman stretches, and he knows there's nobody square of the wicket in the deep. All he has to do is clear point. Tries squeezing his steer, but ends up spooning it out to backward point, where Tewatia times his jump superbly, reverse cupping. batsman c Rahul Tewatia b bowler 6(7)

FOUR, streaky runs! Terrific end to what has been a sensational over from Avesh. On a good length just outside off, 143.7kph and batsman was late on the forward push. Got a thick inside edge that just flew past leg stump and with fine leg really square, bonus runs for team
FOUR, crashed away! Short of a length angling across Mayank, a bit of width and he stands tall to flay the cut through point. Cracking stroke!

FOUR, delicious, absolutely delicious stroke! More width and the length is shorter as well, Mayank doesn't go hard at it, instead relies purely on timing and boy, didn't he time this or what? Stays back and guides it past the left of the backward point fielder and it raced away. Third man had no chance at all

FOUR, would have been a wide if batsman left this but he chooses to go after it. Didn't time it well enough, still clears the infield on the off-side comfortably. Shorter length slower ball that was lifted over cover

out Bowled!! Dragged on. bowler goes back to his trusted full-wide yorker. Tye loads up for yet-another-hoick, giving it his all in his swing. Gets some bat for a change, it's the inside-edge and it's chopped onto off. A four-run-wicket final over, you really can't get greedier. batsman b bowler 3(9)

SIX, terrific stroke! batsman is in some serious form and we've seen it already this season. Dug in short and angling into the body, he just shuffles across to get inside the line and uses the pace to control the pull. Easily over fine leg for a biggie

FOUR, kabooom! Mayank is off the blocks in a flash once more. Short of a length outside off, he just backs away a bit and hammers it on the up through the covers. Found the gap well and nobody really budged

FOUR, up and over! Cannot bowl this length in the Powerplay, not on a true surface like this one. Half-volley and batsman lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Perhaps not middled as much as he would have liked but still got enough on it

out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Excellent catch! It's the young man Avesh Khan, you cannot keep him out of the action and this is a massive wicket for DD. The dangerous batsman needs to depart. Clever from bowler, the slower ball on a shorter length and I don't think that batsman picked this variation. Went across on the back foot for the short arm jab but got no pace to work with at all. Mistimed it badly and Avesh at short fine leg judged it brilliantly with a dive forward. Plucked it inches above the ground. Brilliant! batsman c Avesh Khan b bowler 23(15) [4s-3 6s-1]
FOUR, glorious! Top quality stuff from batsman! Half volley from Avesh but look at the execution. Textbook front foot cover drive on the up. Brilliantly timed and picked the gap as well

FOUR, smart from bowler but Karun is smarter. Slower and short outside off, probably foxed the batsman initially but he adjusted well in the end. Stood tall and waited before guiding it past short third man. Mishra was probably a bit slow as well to come down on the slide and bowler clearly wasn't happy with the effort

out Bowled!! The off pole has gone for a walk! What a sight for any fast bowler and bowler is thrilled! Horror stroke from Mayank though and he has wasted another start. Slightly short of a good length around off, this was just above 145kph and that's what probably foxed Mayank who was expecting the slower ball. No excuse for the shot though, a wild slog across the line and misses it completely. Ruffled his pad before crashing into the stumps. DD are right on top here. batsman b bowler 21(16) [4s-3]
FOUR, poor delivery to start off. Short and wide outside off, batsman reaches for it and punches it firmly through the gap at cover

1 run, dropped? Just grazes his fingertips. Fizzes in the quicker one on a fuller length, SKY got forward and got sucked into the drive, he miscued it off the cue end and the ball just evaded Rashid in his followthrough. He did well to bend low, but just couldn't lock his wrists
FOUR, short and wide, Krunal takes full toll of it, rocks back and nails the cut behind square

out Lbw!! Much-needed wicket for team. Never looked close to the naked eye, but technology - as ever - always finds a way to surprise us. That quick release off the wrists from bowler, that canny variations off the front of the hand... batsman unfortuantely didn't read it well. Was playing for the ball spinning into him and was a tad late in bringing his bat down. The ball zoomed back in at a rapid pace to catch him close for a lbw call. Not a confident appeal, but team make full use of the DRS system. batsman lbw b bowler 24(20) [4s-4]
SIX, full and right in KP's arc, he has no second thoughts. Just dismisses it out of his presence by using those long levers to full effect, sent into the galaxy. Over long-on

out Caught by Dhawan!! Reminiscent of Sarfaraz Khan's dismissal against team. Neatly guided down to lone slip. KP hung back to this legbreak and was wanting to glide the ball past the slip, the ball arrives much quicker and lobs low off the splice off the bat. Five down team. Well judged catch from SD considering the pace and height on that. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 9(6) [6s-1]

out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Huge wicket in the context of the game. Back of a length, angling into the hip, SKY's eyes lit up on seeing the short ball in that channel and he fell back onto his favourite shot in the cricket dictionary - the whip pull. Hit it too good and looped up in the air for deep square to take a straightforward catch. batsman c Rashid Khan b bowler 34(38) [4s-4]

out Lbw!! Nowhere near the line of the delivery, played all around it and was a dead duck. Siddarth Kaul got the ball to hold its line around middle stump and the ball didn't rise as much, batsman was searching for it but couldn't prevent the ball from smashing his pads. Plumb. Just below the knee roll. Umpire S Ravi's finger went up instantly and in the meantime the duo looked to steal a non-existent single. batsman was sent back and had to put in a dive. batsman lbw b bowler 0(2)

out Lbw!! Can't get more plumb than that. Easier one for the umpire too. Full and straight from Siddarth Kaul, batsman went for the cross bat shot and missed the line completely. Gets hit low on the pad and looked guilty straightaway. No reviews left for team. Siddarth Kaul is pumped up and so is the entire team team. batsman lbw b bowler 1(2)

1 run, half-a-chance. Seam-up delivery, gets great bounce outside off, batsman runs it off the splice of the bat and it evades Dhawan to his right, he dived full length but could only manage a fingertip on that

out Caught by Basil Thampi!! Caught at third man. That's the end of batsman and most probably the game for team? Sid Kaul, you bewdy. Look at him go. Oh, give him a machine or else he might end up digging the pitch with his fists. Nice change of pace from him, bowls it far from off-stump of batsman asking him to fetch from there. Pandya slogs and could only lob it as far as third man. Good running catch from Thampi. batsman c Basil Thampi b bowler 3(19)
FOUR, angled in, all batsman needed to do was help the ball finds its direction, he swivels and manages decent contact on the pull to slam the ball backwards of square leg

out Caught by (sub)Deepak Hooda!! Sunrisers have pulled this off miraculously. Fifth loss for team. Second lowest ever total defended in IPL history. What.A.Thriller. Final wicket razzmatazz: Short ball angled in, batsman top-edged the pull before mid-wicket swallowed the swirling ball. Easy as you like. batsman c (sub)Deepak Hooda b bowler 1(3)

FOUR, timed to perfection that was. Short of a length delivery angled away with a bit of away swing too, batsman sits back in his crease and punches it through the gap at cover. Was in the air for a while but the placement was pretty good

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a well deserved wicket for Sandeep. batsman never looked comfortable against him. This was another full length delivery with away swing written on it, as batsman tried to flick it away, he got a leading edge to the man at point. Manish wouldn't miss out on that. Another failure for batsman in his maiden IPL season, second on the trot. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 5(9) [4s-1]

FOUR, shot, good shot! Picks the length early on that. Was a shortish delivery outside off, Suryakumar doesn't miss out on it and slaps it towards mid-off. Thampi who's manning that position slips as the ball beats him and goes through. That won't please the bowler

out Caught by (sub)Deepak Hooda!! Duck for Kishan! This is why bowler is in the team. There are many left handed batsmen in Mumbai's batting line-up, gets one of them. Tosses it up nicely and invites the batsman to come down the track. Kishan does so, goes for it and ends up spooning it up to long-off where the sub calls for it and hangs on to it. These wickets are making the match interesting. So far, so good. batsman c (sub)Deepak Hooda b bowler 0(3)

out Caught by Dhawan!! Edged and taken! bowler likes that, claps hard after getting the team skipper. A flighted delivery outside off, batsman looks to go big, tries to loft it over the in-field but as the ball turns away, it catches his outside edge and flies straight to the lone fielder in the slip. Dhawan makes no mistake and takes it. Mumbai Indians need a Pollard special tonight, it seems. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 2(6)

FOUR, he's been playing so well since he has been promoted. This was played very late by Suryakumar. Was a quicker delivery outside off, he went back in his crease and guided it sweetly past the man at short third man. No chance of stopping that

FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the opener. Picks the length early on the shortish delivery, rocks back and slams it into the gap at cover. Sweeper cover is too square to cut it off as the ball wins the race

FOUR, beautiful. What a cracking cover-drive that was. Full length delivery around off, Pandya transfers his weight on his right knee and creams it through cover. Right into the gap and the fielders could do nothing but admire the timing and placement on it
FOUR, good competition between bat and ball, this. Short of a length around off, Pandya does well to pummel it past the man at mid-on and get a four more

FOUR, poor delivery to end the over. Tries for a yorker and ends up bowling a full toss. Pandya doesn't miss out on the gift and drills it past the diving Williamson to gather the third boundary of the over. Expensive over by Kaul and Mumbai fans get their voice back

FOUR, magnificent shot. What a way to get off the mark. Wasn't a bad ball at all. On a back of a length and outside off, with extra bounce too, batsman plays a top square cut, getting on top of the bounce and hitting the gap wide of cover-point

FOUR, beauty! batsman is in some form. bowler goes full and outside off, gets a hint of outswing too, batsman though is almost on one knee as he bent forward and then opened the bat-face at the last moment to essay a square drive that left cover-point as a spectator. Not much bowler can do when he gets to see two world-class shots like that. Credit to batsman

FOUR, where's third man? No-one there. On a length and outside off, batsman throws the bat at that and the edge flies away to the unmanned third man fence, batsman gets a boundary to get himself going

out Bowled!! End of batsman's painful innings. No feet and he is bowled off a thick inside edge onto pad and then falls on the off-stump. bowler is absolutely thrilled to bits. Shouting and screaming in delight. Length delivery on off-stump, batsman gets forward to drive, is late on the shot and the rest is history. batsman b bowler 5(6) [4s-1]

no run, that is a very ambitious appeal for lbw. Pathan is a huge man and with that big stride of his, always will get his front foot outside the line, this one is the leggie and the impact looks outside off and what's more it is spinning away. Hang on - team have taken the review. Could well lose it. Replays show that the impact is outside off and that's team's review gone down the gutter

out Bowled!! batsman doesn't want to go. But he has to. He has been bowled here. He can't believe that the ball has hit the stumps. Superb googly, tossed up and invited batsman to play the big shot. An almighty hoick to leg but only after the ball has missed the inside edge and clipped the top of middle and leg. Top-class bowling. batsman b bowler 14(10) [4s-2]
FOUR, poor delivery and cut away. Short and wide outside off, Pathan had to miss backward point and he did that. Races away once it moved past that fielder

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Gone. bowler jumps up and down in delight. Angled in on a short of length on off, batsman was trying to run it down between the keeper and the wide slip. But finds Ishan Kishan who hangs on. He is catching all the snicks tonight, apart from those, his keeping has been shoddy. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 6(9)

out Bowled!! Looks like batsman has only one shot in his arsenal. The cut. Very risky against a promising bowler. The leg-spinner fizzes off the deck and beats the late-cut, knocks the off-stump back. Not a very wise shot when he should be looking to give the strike to Pathan. batsman b bowler 3(6)

out batsman Run Out!! Confusion. Chaos. Gone. Long way out too. Finally Kaul gets bat on ball, driven to backward point where there's a slight fumble, Kaul is desperate to get to the other end, Pathan sends him back but Pandya has all the time to direct his throw back to Ishan Kishan who does the rest, even as he almost lost the ball while attempting the run-out. After he flicked the bails off, the ball slipped out. The third umpire completes the formalities. batsman run out (Hardik Pandya/Ishan Kishan) 2(9)
SIX, a smile from KW after that big hit. On a length and around off, too predictable these cutters from bowler, Pathan stays back and lofts cleanly miles into the stands at long-on

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Good catch and that's the end of the innings. Pathan really smashed the pull but Rohit has kept all his athletic fielders on the fence. Hardik at deep mid judges it to a nicety as he takes it reverse-cup over his head. A smile breaks out after he completes the catch. Pathan can't believe that he hasn't cleared the fielder. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 29(33) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! batsman walks. And Mumbai erupt. No need for the review as well. Similar to the last delivery, but a bit wide, batsman again reached out with his hands with the feet stuck, all he managed was an edge to the keeper. Ishan Kishan makes no mistake and the ploy to send batsman at 3 has backfired badly. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 0(2)
