FOUR, his famed cut. Those four dots were always leading into this, doesn't try and go too hard, waits for the room dished out outside off get big and bisects mid-off and extra cover
FOUR, you mind-reader batsman. Knows he's going to get it full, so moves away, gives room and with a measure of mid-off in the circle, goes inside-out in his lofted drive over. So very easy

SIX, stands, plants his leg out and holds his position to punch it through the line. High, mighty, and Kotla's switched sides .. team, team. And you thought the earlier one was the shot of the night. Poor you
FOUR, nothing half-tracker, AB's quick to pounce. And he does with a swipe, mowing it into mid-wicket. On, on
FOUR, no it gets better. Some width in the float up, batsman crouches, with his rubber wrists, whisking it through extra cover
1 run, flat and short enough for batsman to go back and tuck into the on-side towards long-on

SIX, okay, you have to learn! Got away with one previous ball bowling full, this time the line is outside off and allows batsman to swing his arms. Easily lofted over long-off and AB is pretty good with his timing, isn't he?

FOUR, tickled and fifty for captain batsman. Immediately raises the bat to the dug-out and the crowd. Looks determined as always. Really terrible short of length delivery down the leg-side, just helped on its way with fine leg inside the ring

SIX, that's the bowler getting greedy with the turn on offer and offering a freebie. Way too full, the length is still acceptable, but the line is way outside off stump, got to be closer to the sticks. AB just waited for it and smashed that lofted drive over extra-cover
FOUR, Sandeep offers width and batsman doesn't let it go scot-free. Flails his hands and creams it with super timing past a diving Manish Pandey at cover-point. First boundary of the innings
SIX, bowler goes short and batsman dispatches it over long-on. Went back and flat-batted it disdainfully. The key was - he picked the length early

FOUR, just bowled a slower ball, tries to repeat, but this is well outside off stump and the batsman read this from the hand. No third man, so batsman camps back and cuts past backward point. A 31-ball fifty for Watto, another very handy innings at the top

SIX, gee there's a lot of audaciousness with the way he bats. He knows Kaul way too well. Two short balls first up in the over, but expects Kaul to try another one, the bowler dished out exactly what the batsman wanted and that back and across movement from batsman makes a strong statement that he is bossing the show, out comes the pull shot and clears deep mid-wicket. Brilliant fifty

FOUR, wow! Just wow! The yorker goes as a juicy full ball and batsman thrashes the drive wide of extra-cover. Interesting to see Kaul try three bouncers and then only try the yorker. What's the thought process there?

SIX, has he sliced this? Yes he has, but that bat in his hands is very good and it takes the ball all the way. The leggie outside off stump, batsman gets down on one knee and goes hard at it, looked like it was going to long-off for a moment, but this isn't Uppal. The boundaries are smaller

SIX, this is precisely why team need batsman ASAP! Just look at him run down at team's key bowler. Got beaten previous ball, but no respect whatsoever and he forces Bhuvi to shorten the length, with it swings across the line with a pull and powers it over the mid-wicket boundary. He's just toying with them
FOUR, the runs are leaking. Short of a length on the leg stump, poor line with not much of protection behind square on the on-side, batsman pulls and sends it to the long leg boundary
SIX, oh my god! This guy is playing some outrageous shots. Flighted delivery from bowler, batsman steps out, gets closer to the pitch of the ball and slogs it hard over deep mid-wicket

out Watson Run Out!! Shane Watson was moving slowly as he went for that run, wonder if he was carrying a niggle there. batsman pushed this flatter delivery towards extra-cover and set off, Watson was slow to take off, captain Kane threw it to the keeper, who did the rest. Finally a breakthrough for team, but Watson has done his job. Watson run out (Williamson/Goswami) 57(35) [4s-5 6s-3]

out Caught by Williamson!! Now then, is there a change in the tale? team are masters at staging comebacks from nowhere. Don't write them off yet. Short of a length delivery it was from bowler, batsman wanted to play across the line, but he ended up slicing it towards mid-off, hit high on the bat, Kane ran to his left from extra-cover and put in the dive to complete the catch. batsman c Williamson b bowler 2(3)

1 run, I can't believe my eyes. Manish Pandey has dropped a sitter by his standards. It's MS batsman too! Pandey is one of team's finest fielders. Flighted delivery on the stumps, batsman steps out and mistimes the loft, hit flat to long-on, Pandey was close to the rope, took it too casually and it popped out
SIX, he's back to taking the aggressive route again. Advances, takes it on the full and muscles it over the man at long-off
FOUR, use of the feet again, batsman is just rubbing it into bowler, who has had a catch being put down. Goes straight down the ground and over the umpire's head. Into the 90s now
SIX, he got away with a couple of full tosses earlier in the over, but batsman has had enough. Absolutely tonks it flat over the square leg boundary. Just 8 needed now.
FOUR, oh he's hit this for four. team need 3 more to win and Rayudu needs one for a hundred. Length delivery down the leg-side, batsman swings it away behind square on the on-side

1 run, that's it! Maiden IPL hundred. The crowd roars. What a knock from Ambati batsman. He takes the helmet off, raises the bat and enjoys the moment with a big smile. He has been exceptional this season. The teams applauds and Dhoni congratulates him too. Short of a length delivery on the leg stump, batsman moves across and works it towards square leg
SIX, Sandeep's slower ball goes awry. It was the knuckle ball and batsman spotted it early. Squated low and helped it over short fine leg. Clears the rope for a maximum

SIX, 'don't bowl short to me' - batsman's body language suggested as Sandeep overbakes and goes short. batsman stays in his crease, allows for the ball to come and pulls it with brute force over mid-wicket
SIX, batsman gets into the act. Reaches out for a fuller length delivery outside off and effortlessly lifts it over extra cover

FOUR, batsman brings out the sweep. Safe bet against the spin. Went low, rolled his wrists and placed it in the gap in front of square on the leg-side. Hooda from the deep ran across and dived near the ropes, but in vain
FOUR, begins with a tripe on leg-stump. batsman accepts it with glee and glances it off his pads, beats short fine leg and races away to the fence
FOUR, 50-up for team with this boundary. batsman takes on bowler, uses his feet and reaches the pitch. Lets his bottom hand do the talking. Lofting him over bowler's head
FOUR, short, no real purpose and batsman pulls it away to the mid-wicket boundary. Didn't time it alright, but placed it in the gap. The ball hurried onto him a bit and that foiled his timing

SIX, in the air and clears Hales at long-on. He seemed to have misjudged it there, runs forward and later realises that the ball is sailing over his head. Short again, batsman stayed back and smacked it flat and hard - enough wood to take it all the way
FOUR, magnificent. No half-measures whatsoever. Saw a pitched up delivery outside off, props forward and presents a straight bat to drill it past mid-off. Third boundary of the over so far
FOUR, splits the gap perfectly. bowler goes short once again, batsman stays low and pulls it through mid-wicket. Beats long-on and deep mid-wicket
FOUR, half-tracker and punished. batsman camped back, twirls his wrists and hammers it to the cow corner fence. Shikhar had no chance cutting that off

FOUR, a french cut to get his first boundary. On a good length around off, shaping into the batsman. batsman tries to fend it late and ends up getting an inside edge. Past the leg stump and all the way to the fence she goes, in a jiffy.
FOUR, that was four the moment it was hit. A good length delivery around off, batsman is quick to camp back and punch it away. Beats the fielder at extra cover and the man at sweeper cover too
1 run, another 50-run stand up between these two. This was a short delivery and batsman pulled it down to long-on
SIX, only a hit away from his fifty now. This was a full delivery outside off and batsman smoked it over long-on for half a dozen. Great shot by the southpaw
FOUR, the boundaries have started to flow. A good length delivery outside off, batsman moves away and carves it over point. No chance for the fielder at third man to cut this down
SIX, impressive! How well was this timed! Length ball on middle and leg, batsman pulls it over square leg for a well timed six. Came right from the meat of his willow
SIX, what a shot to reach his fifty! Shortish delivery around off, batsman doesn't miss out on the opportunity and swings it over mid-wicket. Flat and over the ropes, she goes!

SIX, if Dhawan from other end is changing gears, batsman decides to up the ante as well. Skips out, bowler gives more flight. KW isn't to the pitch, but still goes through by getting his weight forward. Sends it soaring over long-off. All the way!
SIX, bread and butter for batsman. It looked as though he was waiting for it. bowler drops a rank long hop, batsman sits back and smokes it over cow corner. Into the crowd

FOUR, 100-run stand comes up between the duo. Cross-seamer from bowler, but it's too full outside off. Can't bowl there with mid-off in the circle. batsman leans forward and drills it over the fielder's head beautifully

FOUR, swings south does batsman. But the ball goes in the direction of north. He won't mind though as long as boundaries are coming. Shortish outside off, batsman goes hard and gets a thickish outside edge that flies away to the third man fence

FOUR, stand and dismiss stuff from batsman. Just admires the shot, knew the moment he connected it was a boundary. bowler serves it full, in the slot and batsman blasts it with ease to the long-off fence. The fielder was squarer and had no chance
FOUR, Bravo is welcomed to the crease with a boundary. Feeds it full, overpitches it a tad and batsman makes him pay by cracking it through extra cover

1 run, and that's fifty for team's skipper batsman. His 10th IPL fifty. Continuing from where he left off from the last game. Eases a single to long-off and reaches the milestone, raises his bat to soak in the applause from the dug-out

FOUR, expertly done. Uses his quick-silver hands to direct this wide yorker into the third man fence. Gets his bat down in time and threaded the gap between short third man and backward point with perfection

out Caught by Harbhajan!! The breakthrough has been achieved. End of the 123-run stand between batsman and Williamson. Bravo, the man, with the much-needed wicket for team. Change of pace deceives batsman, who was into his cheeky lap way too early. Had to generate some power to get it over short fine leg, couldn't and ended up hitting it straight to Harbhajan, who pouches it at the edge of the ring. batsman c Harbhajan b bowler 79(49) [4s-10 6s-3]

out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Woah. Screamer from DJ Bravo. This wicket purely belongs to him. Two wickets in two balls for team and they are fighting back here. Both set-batsmen back in the hut. Thakur went wider of off, batsman sliced it airly, there was a fielder at deep point. Bravo had to run across to his left, does so and brilliantly gobbles it up. He's a mighty fine fielder, breaks into a jig as well. batsman c Dwayne Bravo b bowler 51(39) [4s-5 6s-2]
FOUR, mid-off in the circle and Hooda goes over his head. Scrambled seam lengh delivery around off, Hooda backs away and gives charge to lift it over mid-off

no run, Hooda has been given out LBW, he has a word with his partner and decides to review. Bravo's foot is way behind the line, so no problems with the no-ball. Moving on, looks like no bat as well. Ultra-Edge confirms it. HawkEye in - Pitching - In-line. Impact - In-line. Wickets - missing. Superb review from Hooda. It was full and spearing in, Hooda was shuffling across and misses the clip. Is thudded low on the pad, the on-field call was OUT and Hooda challenged it. Gets the decision in his favour in the end with the ball missing the leg-stump

out Caught by Willey!! Pandey perishes. team lose their fourth wicket. Cross-seam full ball from Thakur, Pandey went hard at it and the bat turned on impact in his hands. Hence, skies it towards long-off. Willey steps forward and grabs it with ease. The visitors are losing steam here. batsman c Willey b bowler 5(6)
SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Thakur gets his line closer to off, Hooda stays still and biffs it powerfully over long-off

FOUR, just eludes Rayudu's outstretched right hand. Bravo lands the slower ball on the middle stump, batsman gets low and slogs it across the line. Rayudu tried his best at square leg, but it evaded him
FOUR, that'll give him some confidence. Length delivery on middle, batsman stands tall and pummels this one over mid-wicket, that's a fine shot by the southpaw
FOUR, this one is even better. Full length ball outside off, batsman reaches for it and slaps it through the gap at extra-cover. The fielders on the off side had hardly any time to react

out Caught by Raina!! First blow of the match for Sunrisers. His struggle finally comes to an end. Never looked comfortable at the crease. Throws his hands at an away swinging length ball and ends up chipping it straight to Raina at cover-point. He wont miss those and reverse cups it in that region. Another fine start for the pacer. How often have we seen him doing this? batsman c Raina b bowler 2(9)

FOUR, that's the form he is in. Picks the length early on the shortish delivery. He's quick to transfer his weight on to the back foot and pull it to perfection through mid-wicket. Made sweet sound of the willow as the ball met it

FOUR, well played! This was a tossed up delivery, batsman comes down the wicket and smokes it right over the bowler's head. Straight as an arrow, on a bounce and over the fence. Hit the cushions in fact

FOUR, here it is! Finally a boundary against bowler. This was a half-volley outside off, batsman is quick to lean ahead and cream his drive through cover. Beats the two fielders chasing to stop this from reaching the fence
FOUR, finally a boundary of batsman! That'll give him some relief. This was short one on leg, batsman does well to drag it down to the fine leg fence

FOUR, poor effort by Bhajji near short fine leg. Perhaps he slipped there, hence couldn't stop the ball. This was a short one down the leg-side and batsman pulled it away, beating Harbhajan at short fine
FOUR, now the homeboy roar. On the dance, in the slot and tonking it straight down. Oh the bat flow
FOUR, defensively wide. Suryakumar smart enough, stays back, stretches and carves it away through extra cover
FOUR, oh boy. If 0.3 was timing, this is its square. Pitched up, batsman strides, flows through with a defensive push. Yeah, that's all. And screeching past mid-off. Wow, Wankhede ..

no run, chipped up. And just short of a diving mid-on. Suryakumar's early into his flick, miscues, balloons, but Gowtham just can't dive down in time. Blame his frame. Oh no wait, these dastradly slomos tell us it's into his fingers first before it pops out
FOUR, width. A helpful dragged back length too and he stays back, opens his bat face and whacks, hard, square

out Caught by Unadkat!! All it required was for Archer to come back. Bends his back, digs it into the surface, climbing into Yadav, who given the pace is predictably late into his pull. Off the splice and Unadkat at fine leg almost makes a mess -- loses it in the light, spots it very late and plucks it right off the grass. batsman c Unadkat b bowler 38(31) [4s-7]

out Caught by Unadkat!! And another. Oh batsman can't score against the Royals .. it's certified. A golden duck in Jaipur. A golden one now. Archer's bouncer ploy consumes him, with batsman being the compulsive puller going through with the swivelling flat-bat, timing it rather well in fact, but just not right when fine leg is that square. Another wobble, carrying on from the SMS? batsman c Unadkat b bowler 0(1)
SIX, full toss. Talk about ruining a quiet over under the radar. batsman has his muscles blowing them out of here. 88 meters into the stands behind the sightscreen. And it's a fifty
SIX, welcome back Kulkarni! Off-speed delivery and batsman picked the bones out of that, spotted it early and powered straight back over the bowler. He then stood and admired that shot

out Caught by Samson!! Big wicket for Rajasthan. A well-set batsman throws it away. Kulkarni is delighted and his hands arm up. He had a chat with Unadkat before this delivery and whatever it was, it has worked. Nothing but an away angler outside off, batsman throws his hands at that and slices it towards sweeper cover, Samson covers ground to his right and clings on to a good catch. Royals fighting back after that opening partnership. batsman c Samson b bowler 60(42) [4s-4 6s-4]

FOUR, not timed, but Kishan will collect the boundary. Rushed him with a short delivery and Kishan took it on, pulls off the splice and once it clears the fielder at mid-wicket, the lightning fast outfield does the rest
FOUR, cheeky! He plays this shot quite a lot, does Pandya. Banged in and the line being outside off allowed Pandya to periscope the ramp to the third man fence. Got it fine enough to beat the fielder

out Caught by Samson!! Another one down. What are you doing Mumbai? From 86/0 they have slipped to 119/4. Slower short of length delivery and Kishan didn't have the required room to free his arms on the pull shot, miscues it towards deep mid-wicket. Samson almost overran it, but then leaped back and took it reverse cup. batsman c Samson b bowler 12(11) [4s-1]

out Caught by Gowtham!! Gowtham juggles but manages to hang on. Krunal never looked in. Yes, seven deliveries is enough to judge that. The off-cutter from bowler, Pandya had to for the heave and all he could do was sky it up towards long-on. Gowtham settled under it and almost made a mess. Luckily for him it didn't go far from his body and he took it on the second attempt. batsman c Gowtham b bowler 3(7)

SIX, into the second tier. bowler is predictable with his change of pace and Pandya was waiting for it, cleared his front leg and smashed it straight back over the sightscreen. Mumbai need plenty more of this

FOUR, now the attempted wide yorker goes wrong, full toss outside off, Pandya crouches a bit and slices it deliberately over backward point, one bounce and over the fence. Wankhede finds its voice again..

SIX, bowler is dishing out freebies. Another nice juicy full toss outside off, just the right amount of width for Pandya to tonk the loft over extra cover. He didn't overhit; just a lift and off she went into the crowd. 17 already off the over

1 run, dropped! Archer puts down a sitter. Warne is livid in the dugout but he isn't showing any emotions. batsman was deceived completely by the slower delivery and miscues the big hit towards point, Archer was a bit too casual with his approach and hence spills it
SIX, batsman making team pay for the drop catch. bowler is slower ball is right in the slot, batsman delayed his shot for a second and hammered it with a clean swing over long-on
FOUR, premeditated. Pandya shuffled across early and bowler smartly dragged his length back, Pandya still went through with his paddle and got the faintest of connection to beat Buttler to his left

out Caught by Samson!! Stunner from Samson. Wow! The replays show it to be even better. Should be in the top five list. Full and angled in, Pandya whips it with plenty of bottom hand towards deep mid-wicket, Samson runs across to his right, but the ball seemed to be out his reach, that is when he decides to put in the full length dive and the ball sticks in his right hand when he is parallel to the ground. Simply superb! batsman c Samson b bowler 36(21) [4s-3 6s-2]

3 runs, slogged high. Woah, it's checking the stratosphere. A cool ten seconds for it to come down, where Binny's done all the hard work of running back from mid-on .. to misjudge. Goes reverse cupped. There's never a good time to wait for anything, certainly not these swirlers
FOUR, connects. Kulkarni gets a touch too straight in trying to cut off the off-side play, but Yadav's quick to get one-legged, lifting a glance of sorts over mid-wicket

FOUR, he's expensive. Can't expect to pitch it up to Suryakumar and not pay the price .. it's the delightful price of watching it being driven straight back. Thank god for Lewis' duck, it's saved a head
FOUR, short, nothing in terms of pace, everything in terms of width. And batsman makes it worse with him backing away, throws his hands out, gets a fat edge. And a vacant cordon is enough

FOUR, 118.3kph. Those hands, those adjusting hands. It holds up for much longer, batsman almost commits into his slap early, but all of sudden can hold it, let the ball get close and guide it to point's left. Now ..
1 run, digs out a drive, almost drilling it past mid-off. Almost. Because Stokes is swooping down, releasing before he collects. A direct hit and Yadav was going back
FOUR, full toss number five. And for a change batsman can put it away. Swings a little too hard, mistimes his swinging slap, but the powerplay is enough to find him the gaps at sweeper
FOUR, nothing two-paced when you grant out a friendly overpitch. Lovely bat swing, opening up the gap over mid-off and timing the pants off it .. inside-out slap
SIX, the launch. Can't bowl down leg, not a googly either. Knee, slog, sweep, backward square leg. It's flatly powerful enough to damage a billboard
SIX, on the move, Gopal corrects on middle, but batsman' gone over extra cover. Throws every cell in his body into this hoick
FOUR, that backlift. And then that drive on the up. So damn predictable. With mid-off in the circle, these are serious runs being leaked

FOUR, streaky! bowler thought he had his man, so did Rohit. An curling low full toss right at the stumps, Short does extremely well to bring his bat down and squirt it off the inside edge to the fine leg fence. He was a goner had he missed

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Short is gone. He's had a forgettable IPL season. Could not play spin and now has succumbed to pace as well. Back of a length and seaming away around off, Short goes feeling for the ball and the outside edge is found, it was carrying to first slip, but Kishan decides to dive across and glove it. The much needed early breakthrough for Mumbai. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 4(5) [4s-1]

FOUR, cracking shot! Losing Short might not be the worst thing happening for Rajasthan. Brings batsman in early and he likes the new ball coming on. Pitched up outside off, batsman leans forward and creams the drive through the packed off-side field. Off the mark in style
SIX, that ones with the crowd now. Big hit over long-on there. bowler bowls it a touch slow, and batsman makes that last-minute room to chidingly loft it away

no run, Krunal has won here. Not with a wicket yet, but with a review. Implored Rohit, convinced him, and the captain yielded. On first sighting, that's going down leg. Arm-ball that batsman's trying to sweep. Misses and is hit on the front pad. Ball-tracking suggests that the impact is on leg-stump, so with the left-armer's angle from round the wicket, that must be going down. Is actually. Not out. Review wasted.

FOUR, a helluva lot happened off this one ball. Now batsman was shaping to scoop, and bowler nicely bowls the cutter wider of off-stump. batsman adjusts though. Slices it, making the most of the room he had, but wasn't in control. Just cleared short third man's right-handed leap

FOUR, five fifties in a row for batsman in IPL 2018. He's equaled the record of Sehwag, who was harvesting runs for a living back in 2012. And what a way to get there. Backs away, exposes the stumps and slaps the ball from in front of them audaciously. Connects. Anyone who's near as good as Sehwag -- statiscally! -- will connect
FOUR, some width on the cutter, and that cut shot creams past Lewis's dive at deep cover. Just slid through the ball there, cutting the trajectory at 90 degrees. Must be a good outfield

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! That's a crucial wicket. batsman's found long-off, where SKY takes the catch and has a pratfall. Just lost his balance a bit and slipped backwards. Was a front footed power-punch but there's not enough wattage in the shot. So much for being a touch player. And here's Pandya picking a wicket just when you least expect him to. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 37(36) [4s-4]
SIX, not quite as pretty as those Dhoni's bottom-handed whips over long-on but this is good enough. Carries all the way. Takes on the seam-up length ball and muscles it across the line

FOUR, front leg is already out of the way, and this fuller delivery goes for a four. Just moved a little to the off-stump and opened his torso side-on, and goes through with the flat mow through long-on

FOUR, he's making a living out of his hands. Nicely keeps his weight distributed between front and back, so he can go either way. Opens the stance and swats this back of a length delivery over mid-wicket
SIX, and now one better. Swivels this time, and deposits the short ball over long leg this time. Game slipping, or has it already?
FOUR, drifting on leg-stump and it's been cutely paddled away. Runs very fine, through keeper's left and runs for a boundary. Not a great start that by bowler
FOUR, he's joining the party. Very slow from bowler, trying to get batsman to miscue one, but doesn't on this occasion. Makes room, waits for the dip and lofts it over straight mid-on
FOUR, that's been muscled through long-on. Going against bowler's angle from over the wicket and going through the line. One bounce and into the ropes. Just the 16 needed

SIX, that's flown off batsman's bat. He walks stone-faced to the middle of the pitch and punches gloves with Buttler. Slow ball sitting up and batsman mowing it over cow corner has to be a sight to behold
SIX, this is a glorious glorious pull. Pandya just stares and walks back to the top of his mark. You do that when you've been pulled off the front foot, and the ball flies over deep mid-wicket

out Caught by (sub)Rahul Chahar!! With 4 needed, he goes for the glory hit and falls. Slow cutter, batsman went for the all-hands loft over cover and found Chahar in the deep. batsman c (sub)Rahul Chahar b bowler 26(14) [4s-2 6s-2]
SIX, Mumbai batsman'ed at home. Slow ball sitting up and martyed over cow corner
FOUR, wrong lines. Off-cutter down leg, batsman tickles it fine past short fine leg. The fast outfield does the rest
FOUR, second boundary and it is to the same area. This was not on leg-stump, but straight enough for batsman to glance it wristily past short fine leg, just used the pace on the ball

FOUR, wow! That is a fine shot. Moved away to leg and even a dragged back length didn't deter him, went up and over the infield off the back foot. A very difficult shot to play but batsman made it look easy

SIX, just over Hardik. The slog sweep and batsman almost found the only man in the deep on the leg-side, shuffled across and mistimed the sweep towards deep mid-wicket. Hardik jumped but the ball was well over him
FOUR, that's more like it. Stand and deliver. Gets a length ball in his arc and he gives it his all. In fact it was the knuckle ball and batsman dispatched it straight back over Hardik

FOUR, that was an attempted slower delivery but it turned out to be a full toss. Manjrekar on air said how he's never seen bowler bowl "such a slower ball." Anyway, batsman makes a bit of room and thumps that to the fence through long-off
1 run, a low full toss in trying to bowl flat from over the wicket, batsman pats it to long-on to bring the 50-run stand up
FOUR, a bit of flight and batsman goes through the line. Weight on front foot and boom, it's flying over straightitsh long-on already

no run, dropped!! Parthiv dives to his left and the ball pops out of his left mitt. That angled away late and the batsman poking at it, got a thick edge. The keeper went for it one-handed only to drop it. His left hand was lower than the actual trajectory of the ball and that meant he was hit higher on the palm, forcing the spill
SIX, welcome to the attack bowler! Dragged back length and batsman makes room to thump the pull over deep mid-wicket. That is a monster hit from the Aussie and he remains the key for team

out Caught by Kohli!! bowler strikes. Each of Kohli's moves have paid off today. Brought in Siraj got a wicket, de Grandhomme did the same and bowler follows. Bit of air on this one and batsman is down on one knee to play the slog sweep, does not get the required elevation to clear deep mid-wicket and finds Kohli to perfection. The skipper had moved himself there after the third ball. team slip further and their chances of getting a good total are gone with batsman. batsman c Kohli b bowler 26(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

out batsman Run Out!! That's what wickets and pressure do. There was never a single in it and batsman wanted the run, Axar was tad late in sending him back and the skipper's dive was in vain. Nothing but a tossed up delivery which batsman taps to the left of cover, Axar took a step out before aborting from the run. And with batsman not being the swiftest he was always in trouble. Put in a desperate dive but was still short by some distance. batsman run out (Negi/Parthiv Patel) 0(1)

out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! What happened there? Looks like Tye wanted to review. But he's walking back. Not sure what happened. Banged in and with Umesh's pace the ball climbs up awkwardly, Tye goes for the pull and a faint top-edge settles into Parthiv's mitts. Did he run out of time to review? That might be the only reason. Nonetheless, there was a sound as the ball passed the bat. batsman c Parthiv Patel b bowler 0(3)

out batsman Run Out!! A typical number 10 run-out. Mohit works the off-break past mid-wicket, but was not sure whether to go for the run or not, he decides late and AB from mid-wicket runs back, slides and fires a throw to Mo, who deflects the ball onto the stumps. Brilliant bit of work from AB and Mo. batsman run out (de Villiers/bowler) 3(5)

out Rajpoot Run Out!! 1 run completed. team have been bowled out for 88. batsman wanted to keep the strike and pushed Rajpoot for a non-existent second. In fact, it was Rajpoot who wanted the second. batsman worked the flatter delivery towards wide long-on, he was content with the single but upon seeing Rajpoot charge across, he relcutantly went for it, nice flat throw right next to the stumps from Southee and Mo did the rest. Rajpoot run out (Southee/bowler) 1(5)

SIX, hello says the batsman as he was greeted with a short ball. The batsman did not waste time to transfer his weight on the back foot and hammers it over deep backward square leg off the front foot. Terrific hit
SIX, short ball, journey ball and goes the distance. The batsman this time stayed firm on the back foot and hammered the pull over deep fine leg for a sixer. Into the second tier
FOUR, powers the ball away! That is a four. Little backing away movement and the batsman gatecrashes that one past cover for a four. The lack of pace did not help

FOUR, that is typical batsman! Clears his front leg, moves to the leg-side and then the long tentacles get into the act. Fetches the short of length delivery and clubs the pull away towards the deep mid area for a four
FOUR, absolute gift! Full toss, little dip on it but the batsman lifts the ball away easily over mid-off's head for a four. This will break the shackles

SIX, picks the slower short ball like dead meat and picks the bones out of it by smacking it over deep mid-wicket. He waited on it and then smashed it out of his sight. Third six of the evening for batsman

out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The short ball does it. You live by the sword and you die by it as well. The short balls had been disappearing but not this one. This came on slightly quicker on to the batsman, skidded on and batsman went for it by hitting it flat. The man at deep square leg raced to his right and took it really well as the momentum on the ball threatened a drop from CDG. But that is a huge wicket!! batsman c de Grandhomme b bowler 21(15) [6s-3]

FOUR, clears his front leg again, the typical batsman template to get the boundaries away and is successful. The men at cover and mid-off had no chance. The length ball also helped the cause of the batsman

out Caught by Siraj!! The short ball is doing the trick here. The batsman got a huge top edge and Siraj at deep square leg gobbles it up. Banged in short at a good pace and again the batsman never got a lot of distance on it. The ball went really high and the fielder did well to munch on it. team have already got their back broken. And team are looking to inflict more wounds. batsman c Siraj b bowler 18(14) [4s-4]

out Caught by Kohli!! Catching practice! And taken to his left at slip by the skipper. That was an away going short of length delivery and the batsman just opened his bat face to run it down. Cardinal sin it was with a slip in place. team are all over team like a rash. The battle of the reds certainly has seen the visitors having the upper hand in the powerplay period. batsman c Kohli b bowler 1(3)
FOUR, tries to land it on a length and is greeted with a drive on the up. Lovely timing and placement on it takes it away to the fence. batsman is away

out Bowled!! The yorker from bowler. Played it too late and did not pick the length to york himself. The ball sneaking under the bat. How on earth?! That was the googly. team in deep waters now. batsman can't believe his luck. That was just a well flighted ball and he fails to pick it up. The LED bails sparkled red and team rejoiced more. Where is the fight team? batsman b bowler 2(3)

SIX, this is exactly what team don't want. That was full and that disappeared. Booming hit over covers for a sixer. Flat and powerful. This landed in the range of the batsman and batsman drop kicked the ball away. Is there batsman magic on the cards?

out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! It cannot get any worse for team and batsman. He is having a terrible season and has only dashed the hopes of a team revival in this game as well. Gentle delivery on the pads and the batsman ended up nicking it to the keeper. The keeper went up almost instantly and team have their man. batsman c Parthiv Patel b bowler 2(6)
FOUR, Parthiv decides to get a move on. On the shorter side from bowler and it's leg stumpish as well. Pulled away through the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on. Races away
FOUR, gift for Parthiv and he accepts it with glee. Tye strays on the pads with a half-volley, easily glanced away down to the fine leg fence
FOUR, that's a signature batsman stroke. Not all that full but there was width and that's what the southpaw loves. Uses his quick hands to power it on the up through the gap at cover

SIX, look at the swagger on this shot! With due respect to bowler, the man facing him is just too good. Full and in the slot, it's in the arc for batsman who nonchalantly clubs this into the stands at cow corner. Cold welcome for the young man
FOUR, hammered away. Cannot bowl that length at this pace to batsman. He'll punish you all night. Back of a length from bowler and it's pulled away wide of mid-on. All too easy

FOUR, he is on the charge, is batsman. He doesn't want to let this opportunity of a crushing win slip. Charges down the track and makes some room for this good length delivery. Slaps it away over point comfortably

1 run, dropped! Finch the culprit at mid-off, was late to trek backward and in the end, he did get a hand on it but spilled it. Low full toss from bowler that batsman mistimed. The loft came off the toe end and eventually, he got lucky. Second life for the skipper

leg byes, 1 run, batsman survives easily in the end. Looked closer to the naked eye but when team reviewed it, Hawk Eye showed it to be missing leg stump comfortably. Fuller ball that angled into batsman, he was on the shuffle and missed the flick. Looked really close initially, not to be
FOUR, crunched away! Full and quite wide outside off, right up Parthiv's street and he feasts on it. Unfurls a lovely square drive through cover-point. Blazed away in a flash
FOUR, good adjustment from Parthiv. Seemed like he was early on this slower bouncer but then decided to just control it. Got it wide of short fine leg and that was enough. Brings up the 50 as well

FOUR, this has been pummelled away. Banged in short by Mohit and this is the normal pace delivery, sits up nicely for Parthiv who swats the pull through backward square leg. The man from deep square did try hard to get to it but was never going to reach it in time
FOUR, deft touch from batsman. Pacy back of a length delivery, he just waits on it and dabs it late. Only had to beat the short third man fielder and he did it with ease

SIX, that's dumped over long-off. team cantering away to victory. Just a few blows away if they go at this rate. Too full from Andrew and it's criminal with mid-off up. batsman launches it over the infield and it goes away for a flat maximum

FOUR, sublime, really sublime. Oh, he is making this look like an exhibition match. Short of a length, a touch wide and he stands tall to punch it beautifully through backward point. Timed it so sweetly
FOUR, fantastic placement. A trifle too short from bowler and batsman clobbers the pull by standing up tall. Splits deep mid-wicket and long-on with precision
FOUR, back to normal pace and Tye suffers. Shortish length and Parthiv waits to ramp it just wide of Rahul. Got it very fine and third man had no chance. Just a hit away now

FOUR, team have demolished team! Not the fairytale big hit to finish but a boundary nevertheless. Short ball and batsman only manages a top edge on the pull. Gets it comfortably over a leaping Rahul and that's the end of that
SIX, how that's! Skid it into batsman, who went with it and swung it over deep mid-wicket
FOUR, this flies squarer but he's middled it again somewhat. Swivels a little, carting the ball round the corner
SIX, now puts on the wheels. Comes down the track and mauls it over long-on. bowler clasps his hands but that's not in appreciation, as you'd have guessed
FOUR, he's an antidote to everything that bowler can be tonight. Backs away and lofts one at the stumps, splitting the air-gap between mid-off and extra cover

out Caught by Gowtham!! Gowtham is dramatic in his celebration. If you don't know why, scroll down and see how he was taken for runs in the last over. Takes the catch at extra cover and flings the ball at the stumps, and aggressively. A little OTT, the celebrations, but team will take it. A short ball from bowler does the trick. batsman is awkward as he goes back but is not really in a position to swat that across. Miscues that in the air and is caught. batsman c Gowtham b bowler 21(7) [4s-2 6s-2]
FOUR, 119.3kph. And then half way down the pitch. And then down leg. Well .. well. Lynn swivels, adjusts to the lack of bounce. But pulls, very fine
FOUR, that's the ruin. All the width put out for batsman to get .. and he chases, carving it over extra cover
FOUR, 118.9kph. And then length and width. Lynn gets forward, and rocks back in a fierce cut. Nothing a diving point can do
FOUR, rub in the luck too. Neat bouncer, at the nose, but Lynn's already moving away, putting everything in his hooky-swing. Gets a fat edge that proves just enough to clear the keeper
FOUR, gets cheeky. Picks up the floaty leggie outside off, knows there's nobody at third man. And reverses. Nailing it past slip

out Caught by Anureet Singh!! Strokes has another. Oh where was he hiding all this while? Anyway, it takes him to dish out a short-slower sticker into the pitch. Lynn as usual can't resist, loads up with a leg-cleared-cut. But doesn't quite adjust to the time the ball takes in getting there, slices off the top-edge and deep point couldn't have been placed better. batsman c Anureet Singh b bowler 45(42) [4s-5 6s-1]

leg byes, 1 run, it slams the pad. Buttler seems to be jumping up in appeal. bowler is busy trying to clean up the possible leg bye. Oh Rajasthan have to take it up. It's all up to the angle .. how big is it getting? Okay so DK has missed the glance, he's stuck in front of middle. And yes, HawkEye shows it clipping the edge of the bail. Everyone's happy
FOUR, innocuously short, dishing out full pace. Russell gets back fiercely on his back leg, swings his cut, going over point and almost into deep point .. millimeters

FOUR, pulls out some deft dabs from his bag of tricks. bowler keeps going through with full-paced seam ups .. batsman's waiting, showing it the opened up face and dabbing it just wide of Buttler's dive
FOUR, oh the hammer. Brute. Archer misses the yorker by an inch, Russell takes out a mile. Launching into the overcook to crunch it through the covers

FOUR, genuine edge. Zips up off the turf to take the splice on batsman's lost overused dab. But the pace is enough to run it into third man. Or is it? Gowtham chases, dives, but nope, can't get his hand off the ball while his leg touches the rope
SIX, goes over. And Kolkata keep the 16-pointer dream alive. Shortened length, batsman deposits it into long-on with an all muscle heave
SIX, a 145ks delivery no good for all-hands Lynn. Moves a little leg-side and scythes this short incoming delivery over backward square leg. Didn't even rock back fully. Didn't need to
FOUR, now over third man. Just bounces inside the ropes and hits the cushions on the half-volley. bowler bowled it short again but shifted the line to outside off, and batsman nicely ramps it away

out Caught by R Tripathi!! This is not over yet, folks. Second short ball from bowler that gets the wicket. Got a little big on batsman, who agreeably was pirouetting well on the back toe. Ended up top-edging it high to deep backward square, where Tripathy was waiting. batsman c R Tripathi b bowler 4(6)
FOUR, that's a nice drive through covers. batsman leaning a bit into it and reminding bowler that he wasn't the batsman who faced the short ball, so a full ball outside off isn't going to work
FOUR, past Samson's one-handed effort at backward point. An uppish cut shot that he placed just wide enough of the fielder

FOUR, that's past backward point's dive. Got the ball to straighten on off-stump, which makes batsman's shot a good one. Didn't have much room to work, so uses his cocked wrists and thrusts the ball away
SIX, bowler's horror isn't over. Brilliant loft from batsman, stepping out and timing it over extra cover. Flew into the crowd

out Lbw!! Loud shout for LBW. And Rajasthan go upstairs with the review. Drifted across from over the wicket and it spun into the left-hander, surprising him with the turn. Pitching just outside off-stump -- slowmo replays suggest -- and rapping the front leg near the knee-roll. Impact on middle and that's crashing into the top of leg-stump, says ball-tracking. So batsman will have to go, as team hold on to their review. batsman lbw b bowler 21(17) [4s-2 6s-1]
FOUR, that's a glorious front-foot punch through covers. Gets on his toes and on top of the bounce to pack a punch through diving cover

1 run, dropped! Fired in on a short of length @144.8kmph, angling in towards leg, Tripathi is intimidated and tentatively defends off the back foot, gets an edge to third man for a single as Rana drops it at slip... Went flying for it two-handed but no dice
SIX, full and not too wide, on off-stump in fact, Tripathi makes his own width by making room outside off and slices that over the sweeper cover fence for six! Massive hit!
FOUR, short and a little wide, no power, just a dab off the back foot, placed perfectly behind backward point for four. Surgical precision...
FOUR, a bit of swing away from a good length outside off, Tripathi tries a preempted helicopter and gets a leading edge to third man for four.
FOUR, perfect length, but it doesn't matter which variation it was, batsman reaches out and sweeps it hard to backward square leg for four. Incredible shot, and four...

out Lbw!! The flattish ball spun in sharply and hit the batsman high on the back leg. Looks a little high. Was there an inside edge? NO! The height is not an issue. Three Reds. team are going down like a lead balloon. The ball skidded on and the batsman was late on the attempted swat on the on-side. This is tragedy for team. From 59 in 4 overs to this. T20 cricket and its speed taking a toll on team. In dire straits. batsman lbw b bowler 12(10) [4s-2]

out Stumped!! The googly and team implode further. The batsman predictably does not read it. Looks to whip a flighted ball outside off and misses it. The ball turned away past the blade and DK does the rest. He whipped the bails off in a flash. Kuldeep leaps up in his celebratory jump. The spinners are choking their opponents here. You have seen this script from team. Haven't you?
batsman st Karthik b bowler 1(4)

out Caught by Karthik!! The pace has the last laugh. Disconcerting bounce coupled with it forces an almost evasive action from batsman, who fails to get his gloves out of the way. The ball flicked the gloves and went up for the keeper to take it with ease. The Eden is alive and noisy. Eden has witnessed many collapses and this one is dear to team. batsman c Karthik b bowler 3(5)

out Caught&Bowled!! The last straw is gone. team will drown it seems. Too full, flighted as well and the toe-ended push finds the bowler. The bowler stays low and pouches it. DK and team erupt. A hattrick against Aussies and now this. Kuldeep can't do anything wrong at the Eden. A 4-fer in a big game. batsman ends a horron run in the IPL. He has been off-color throughout and it has ended like that as well. batsman c and b bowler 11(13)
FOUR, just a push..may be an exagerrated punch. But that raced away across the turf past the man at cover. Whatta shot. Not a pushover for sure

SIX, short ball and six! That was a splendid hit. More of a reactive shot as he looked like he was slightly late on it but that travelled the entire journey. Over the deep square region and Mavi takes some more punishment
FOUR, little short outside off and the batsman latches on to it. Smokes the cut past point and the ball reaches the ropes. These are useful runs on the board

FOUR, phew! That was close. Shortish, again slightly turning in and the cut is played off the top-half of the bat. The man at backward point leapt up but still could not even get finger-tips to it. 10 runs of the over and team fight on thanks to this cameo from batsman. bowler ends a decent spell - 4-0-29-1

out Caught by Karthik!! The yorkerish delivery was jammed out and it popped up. team think it went off the boot and into the keeper's gloves. They may be right!! It seems the batsman did jam it out off the inner half of the bat but into his boot. And then it went up for DK to take it and bring to the notice of the umpires that they should go upstairs. They did, the soft signal was not out but was not to be as the replays were conclusive enough for the third umpire to make the decision. batsman c Karthik b bowler 1(6)
FOUR, not a bad start! Short ball at the body and pulled away into the on-side for a four. The man at fine leg had no chance. He played it slightly late but did well to get enough meat on it

out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Another one bites the dust. team fans find their voices again. Short ball, rising up and the batsman trying to pull it away, managed only a lot of height. The man at deep square leg came in and took it, not exactly with a lot of ease but effectively in the end. Might have lost it in the lights. batsman c Shubman Gill b bowler 6(5) [4s-1]

out Bowled!! team won't play out their quota of overs. That was a slower delivery and the batsman went for the slog sweep but was outdone by the lack of pace on it. The batsman knelt down, may be guessed the pace right, but could not connect at all for the LED bails to lighten up. team camp is chuffed. So is the crowd and the entire team. The on-field umpire did check for a no-ball but it is team's evening and nothing can go wrong. batsman b bowler 26(18) [4s-3 6s-1]
FOUR, why try the helicopter when you can play these? Half-volley, on middle and leg, Tripathi gets slightly forward and push-drives it straight down the ground for four. 19 off the over.
FOUR, short and wide, batsman is about half a meter outside leg reaches out Sehwagesquely to slice it towards the third man boundary for four
SIX, fuller length delivery just outside off, batsman preempts the periscope and laps it over the tiny fine leg boundary for six!
FOUR, short and fractionally wide, batsman has a lower and wide stance and has a solid base to execute the perfect cut shot to deep backward point for four. Unbelievable...

FOUR, length ball outside off, a cardinal sin in T20, batsman opens up his stance, clears his front leg, and carts it away cross-battedly to long-on for four. team bowlers under fire, and batsman's epiphany continues...
SIX, he moves leg, moves to the off-side again, picks up the good length ball on the stumps to ramp it over fine leg for another six. Last 9 balls: 6 fours, 3 sixes.

FOUR, full and wide outside off, batsman reaches out and slices that away to square third man for four, and that's the second time Mavi has conceded more than 28 in an over in this IPL. Surreal hitting...
FOUR, flatter trajectory, off-break and in the slot, batsman gets on his knees and mows that to wide long-on with a slog-sweep. Up comes the 50 partnership!
FOUR, thats almost an inch-perfect yorker outside off, errs marginally, batsman, with all his hockey experience, gets under it to bottom-hand that away to the deep extra cover fence for four

out Caught by Karthik!! Gone! A sigh of relief for the hosts! Short one angling towards the leg-side, and the side-on stance of Tripathi gives him that fraction of a second less to get into the hook. Beaten for pace, and he gets a feather of a glove on it to DK behind the stumps. Is this the breakthrough, or the rhythm-breaker that team needed? The crowd would certainly hope so! batsman c Karthik b bowler 27(15) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, shortish off-break, erring in line, drifting into the pads, whipped away off the back foot to the backward square leg fence for four. Threaded the needle there...

out Bowled!! Oh, it's ugly when a batsman with a Test hundred in almost every country tries circus tricks. Kuldeep fires in the googly on middle and leg, batsman gets across his stumps and tries to whack it away behind point with a reverse sweep, misses it altogether and ends up making a fool of himself. The furniture is knocked over, and a the flashing red bails reflect ominous signs for team. batsman b bowler 11(12) [4s-1]
FOUR, just a fraction short, a tad outside off, batsman pokes it with an angled bat away to the third man fence for four. Races away...

out Caught by Searles!! Massive moment! Fullish one, too full to reverse, batsman goes for it anyway, and gets it off the top half of the bat, and lobs it to Searles at short third man. A tame end to an otherwise excellent innings, and batsman's streak of 5 consecutive 50s comes to an end. 3 down, and Kuldeep has made an important breakthrough. batsman c Searles b bowler 39(22) [4s-5 6s-2]

SIX, long stop! Leave the bat regulations alone, they've gotta have some boundary regulations! A 64-meter six! A shortish ball on the hips, batsman shuffles across and swat-pulls it half-heartedly, gets a top-edge over the long stop fence for six
FOUR, that's well done. batsman walked across, expecting Krunal to keep it straight and quick. He got inside the line of the ball and then swept it powerfully past short fine leg
1 run, 102kph, batsman knocks it down to long-on to bring up yet another fifty this season. What a time he's having

1 run, back of a length, batsman is hopping back in the crease as he defends it to the left of short mid-wicket, so he really has to put the skates on as he bolts towards the non-striker's end. McClenaghan throws himself forward as he releases the ball in one motion along with the dive, but batsman gets there

FOUR, short fine leg is motionless as batsman helps this pull shot past him. Poor ball really. Angled into the body from round the wicket, all batsman has to do is to miss the lone fielder after swivelling across and that's what he does as he leaves Surya a mere statue

FOUR, mid-off is up so batsman clears his front leg in order to go over the infield. It's a short of length delivery from bowler, not the ideal ball to hit straight down the ground, but batsman had his mind made up. He flat-bats it hard enough, and although it came off the toe-end, it's enough to go over the fielder. Cutting gives good chase and tries hauling it back in with a slide, but his foot was in contact with the ropes

FOUR, he's hit that with a battering ram! Makes some room, Krunal darts it into the slot for batsman who tonks the leather off it by muscling it back over the bowler's head. Krunal tried going for the catch, but by then the ball was whistling into the fence
SIX, this is the ball he wanted. A bit of flight from bowler, batsman gallops down to the pitch of it and lofts it cleanly over long-on

SIX, and again. Much cleaner, much bigger. The Kings XI dugout is on its feet as batsman finishes the over off with back-to-back sixes. Puts his dancing shoes on again and swings through the line of the delivery

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Outstanding pressure catch from Hardik Pandya in the deep. batsman had skied this up a mile off a top-edge, he had Evin Lewis in the corner of his eye - converging towards him, but Pandya calls for it and takes it much to the delight of the roaring fans at the Wankhede. Length ball, batsman saw the opportunity and cleared his front leg to make the most of it. But his heave came right off the toe-end. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 46(35) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Hoho, batsman doesn't have a clue of what's happened. He's too slow. This bumper from bowler hurries on from the middle of the pitch, and even as batsman tries sitting down to it, he leaves his gloves up there. The ball kisses them enroute to Ishan Kishan. A gamechanger this bowler over. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 1(2)
FOUR, batsman gets this away! This is the man standing between team and victory. Short of length at the body, batsman nails the pull backward of square

FOUR, oh my, this is extraordinary. The expression on Rohit's face, rather the blankness of it tells the story. Wide leg-cutter from bowler, batsman switches his stance and reverse-scoops it over short third man
FOUR, he's done it again. He has done it again. Quite brilliant. Slower ball wide of off, and batsman puts it over short third man's head. He's whisked into the 90s. Some player this lad

out Caught by Cutting!! bowler wins the battle with batsman. He has sent Wankhede rocking. Slower ball, it deceives batsman as he lofts it right off the toe-end into the grateful hands of Cutting at long-off. So then, is that it for Punjab? batsman c Cutting b bowler 94(60) [4s-10 6s-3]

out Caught by Lewis!! Full ball outside off, batsman slices it straight to Lewis at sweeper cover. He was right back in the crease expecting the fuller length, and was probably aiming to go inside out over extra cover. But the bat twisted in his hands. A fist-pump from bowler. batsman c Lewis b bowler 1(3)
SIX, it's not over yet. batsman has pumped this full toss over the ropes. bowler misses the blockhole, and disappears over mid-wicket
SIX, abysmal start for Hardik (sans highlights), a lousy half-tracker, batsman just swivels into an effortless six in front of deep square leg
FOUR, another short one, this time across the left-hander, batsman tries to cut it away, gets a top-edge over the fly slip and towards fine third man for four

FOUR, edged, and gone for four! Fortuitous boundary to third man. Knuckle ball pitching on a length, seaming away, batsman gets a controlled outside edge with soft hands and it rolls away to the third man fence
FOUR, short of length delivery at the body, swivelled away past short fine leg. But it doesn't matter. team clinch this by three runs to stay alive in the tournament

FOUR, yet another slower one, errs in length this time, half-cook, and batsman transfers his bodyweight into an elegant extra cover drive for four. Balances himself and poses for the cameras after the shot. Yep, that was right out the meat!

FOUR, geee, that was hit hard. Fuller ball just outside off, batsman clears his front leg and slugs that over mid-on to the long-on fence for four. Lands just short of the rope. Odd how the top-edge carried and this didn't :O

out Caught by Cutting!! A short one, outside off, batsman tries to fetch it and attempts a pull, gets a top-edge. The ball crosses the stratosphere, makes a trip to heaven and lands up in the lap of Ben Cutting coming in from deep mid-wicket. Made it look rather easy. Universe Boss departs. batsman c Cutting b bowler 18(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

SIX, gigantic, massive, monstrous! Length ball outside off, a huge no-no in T20, batsman gets room to swing his arms, and goes through the line, golf-swings that over wide long-on for six. Monumental hit...
FOUR, a hint of flight, pretty good length, on off stump, batsman gets down the wicket and lofts it nonchalantly towards long-on for four
1 run, slightly short, batsman is early into it as it stuck in the pitch a little, carved to cover where Cutting makes an excellent effort but drops it!
FOUR, fired in on the stumps again, lap-swept expertly to fine leg for four. Knew where the short fine fielder was and got it well past him
FOUR, flat leg-break just around off-stump, batsman crouches low and cuts that when it was inches from the stumps past backward point for four
FOUR, short and wide outside off, batsman carves it away to deep backward point for four. A hit-me delivery and gets the treatment.
2 runs, back of a length delivery around off, batsman gets on the back foot and punches that to deep backward point for a brace. 50 partnership up!
FOUR, edged and four, width on offer from bowler and Suryakumar threw his bat at that, gets a healthy edge that flies through the vacant second slip region

SIX, the first six of the evening - on a good length and just outside off, batsman got forward on the lofted drive, didn't time it all that well - ended up slicing it high and over mid-off - has enough to clear the ropes on the full

SIX, just over the outstreched hand of Ankit Rajpoot at long leg. Just! Krunal went for the pull, didn't get all of it, dragged it off the bottom half and it eluded the fieldsman near the boundary ropes. Rajpoot kept his head still and flung himself backwards, but it fell tantalizingly past his fingertips
SIX, nothing half-hearted about this. Picked the length (short) early and deposited this over wide long-on with an air of nonchalance. Typical Krunal
FOUR, half-volley, keep 'em coming screams Krunal's willow. Just leans forward slightly and creams it off the middle wide of mid-off

SIX, becoming too predictable is bowler Patel. The last four balls have been over 100ks. This one's no different either; KP did the smart thing, gave himself room outside off by jumping to the leg-side and tonked this into the cow corner stands with a mighty swing of the bat

SIX, KP is upping the ante now. A risky shot, but he generated enough power to clear the ropes. A 76-metre six. Short ball wide of KP's off-stump, he fetches from there and hacks the pull over long-on. Manoj Tiwary was interested for a bit, but that was always travelling
FOUR, sloppy work from Finch. A crisp drive to the left of mid-off, Finchy was late to react and hence the dive came in late, gets some hand on it, but ends up parrying it to the fence
FOUR, full on the pads, CYA TOMOteamOW! KP was quick to pounce, just needed to help the ball and he did that with some ease, past square leg with courtesy a magical wristwork

out Caught by Rajpoot!! Deceived him with the slower short ball there. It never arrived. Krunal decided to go for the pull and he fails to arrest the momentum, ends up feeding the top-edge and offers a dolly of a catch to Rajpoot at short fine. batsman c Rajpoot b bowler 32(23) [4s-1 6s-2]
FOUR, cross-seamer, fuller and wider of off, KP manages enough contact on the rash drive and the edge flies wide of the keeper
FOUR, another wild swing and another edge. Looped up and kept third man interested for a while, Yuvi with the dive to his left, but he fails to flick the ball back into play
SIX, a 22-ball fifty for KP. He pumps his fists and lets out all the excitement. It was full and right in his swinging arc, KP gets underneath that and launches it many-a-mile over long-off

out Caught by Finch!! Skipper strikes! Lovely stuff from Ash, didn't get great turn on this but ensured there's no pace and made KP fetch for that by tossing it far of off-stump; KP made room and went hard with his flat-bat swing, straight into the pocket of Finchy at wide long-on. batsman c Finch b bowler 50(23) [4s-5 6s-3]

out Caught by Axar!! Poor shot selection from Ben batsman. Carrom ball bowled wide of off-stump, batsman drags the slogsweep from there and hits it straight to the man at deep mid-wicket. Axar trundles forward and gobbles it with ease. batsman c Axar b bowler 4(7)
SIX, batsman's known for this; hitting biggies at will. Stoops to one knee and gives it a full monty on the slogsweep, found the middle and off she goes. Into the mid-wicket stands

out Caught by Ashwin!! Third fourth wicket haul in four games for bowler. He is increasing the gap for the leading wicket takers tally. Pitched the ball short and got it to grip off the surface, it kept decking away from Hardik's reach, he slapped hard and got a thick toe-edge to short third man. batsman c Ashwin b bowler 9(12)
FOUR, full toss wide of off-stump, batsman thrashes it powerfully square on the off-side. No-one there and it's a boundary
FOUR, seam-up short ball wide of off-stump, batsman waits and opens the bat face to ramp it over short third. Smart batting
FOUR, lovely shot, too short from bowler, Suryakumar swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it past square leg, no one in the deep and it's a boundary - Suryakumar's second of the night
SIX, top-edge and six, Suryakumar was done in by the bouncer, was clearly late on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that sailed over the ropes at fine leg

SIX, lovely shot, back-to-back sixes for Suryakumar and he was in complete control here. This was the slower ball from bowler, Suryakumar gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, went sailing over the ropes for another maximum

FOUR, cheeky and four, back of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar waits on it, lets the ball come onto him and then defltly glides it past the keeper, third man was square and has no chance, 21 from the over

out Bowled!! Brilliant from Tye and he has his 21st wicket of IPL 2018. This is deception at its very best, the knuckle ball, pitched around off and seamed back into the left-hander, the length drew batsman into an expansive drive, the gap between bat and pad was created, the ball snuck through and the off-stump went for a walk. batsman b bowler 9(7) [6s-1]

FOUR, edged and four, unlucky for the bowler, on a good length and a hint of seam away from the left-hander, drew Kishan into the drive and found a thick edge, past the lone slip and races away to the fence

SIX, massive, too short and the angle worked against Mohit here, Kishan swivels across, doesn't bother to keep the ball down and sends it soaring into the second tier - way over backward square leg for a maximum

SIX, back-to-back sixes for Kishan, came charging down the track, Mohit went full and wide of off, Kishan was committed to the drive, gets it off the outside half and still has enough to sail over the ropes - at deep backward point

out Caught by Stoinis!! Kishan's streaky innings comes to an end and it's that man - Tye, who takes the wicket once again. This was another knuckle ball that angled across the left-hander, Kishan was looking to heave it over mid-wicket, doesn't cover for the angle, gets it high on the bat and spoons it over mid-on. Stoinis was the fielder there - he kept his eyes on the ball as he back tracked and completed a simple catch. batsman c Stoinis b bowler 20(12) [4s-1 6s-2]

out Caught by Rahul!! Back to back wickets and Tye is on fire. This was short and just outside off, Suryakumar was looking to help it on its way with a flap pull, gets a big inside edge that pops up off his knee-roll. KL runs forward and completes the catch, silence at the Wankhede as Tye scalps his 23rd victim of the season, he's on a hat-trick as well. batsman c Rahul b bowler 27(15) [4s-3 6s-2]

out Caught by Yuvraj!! Another low score for batsman, he's been undone by the short ball once again. This was banged in short and just outside off, skidded through and hurried batsman with pace, he was in a terrible position as he pulled, got a top-edge and all he managed to do was to find Yuvraj at mid-on. He accepts the chance gleefully and his reaction suggests how pumped up he's for this match. The customary check for the front-foot no-ball and bowler is fine on that count. Off he goes, batsman. batsman c Yuvraj b bowler 6(10)

FOUR, beautifully played, this should give batsman some confidence, back of a length and wide of off, batsman stands tall andc punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and races away to the fence

no run, dropped first ball! What a beginning that would've been to the game. Straight in and straight out. Deepak Hooda at short cover who got both hands and then it went out. Was a fairly straightforward chance too. Driven in the air and batsman gets lucky

FOUR, what a shot to get off the mark. batsman on the walk, trying to get ahead of bowler and prove his superiority over him. Converts a length ball into a half-volley and drives it wide of mid-off, superb shot and all along the ground, lovely way to get going and a statement made by batsman

out Caught by S Kaul!! Top edge and gone. batsman wasn't going to die wondering. He was going to play his shots, here he pays the price, short of length on the stumps with steepling bounce, batsman gets a fat top edge and third man takes a good catch. That was a skier and not easy under the lights. But Kaul hangs on. bowler strikes in the first over. batsman c S Kaul b bowler 1(4)
FOUR, like Kohli batsman too gets off the mark with a boundary. Fraction short around off, batsman makes room and cuts wide of point. Expertly placed and it raced away

FOUR, this is how he started against Nadeem. Went bang bang. This is a top top shot. bowler loops it up on the stumps, batsman gets forward and opens his body to go inside out over extra cover. That's trademark AB
SIX, batsman is dealing in sixes. bowler has a wry smile on his face. Down the track and to the pitch before lofting this clean over long-off. The fielder was just a spectator

FOUR, how good is batsman. Unbelievably good. Was a back of a length delivery around off, batsman pummelled the cut and left the sweeper with no chance. The fielder just had to cover a little distance but gave up as it rocketed to the fence

FOUR, now pulls regally and gets to fifty. Is this the knock that will win team the game tonight? Was a length ball on the stumps, powerfully hit wide of deep mid, again one bounce over the ropes and the fielder was left helpless

SIX, batsman is taking all his frustration at not being selected for the Test side against the team bowlers. He was a sureshot selection last year at this time, not anymore. This short ball is at batsman's chest, he plays a smashing pull high into the deep square leg stands. That was meaty

FOUR, batsman gets to his maiden fifty. Gets a hug from de Villiers. Kohli punches the air in delight. They are happy for him and rightly so. What a time to come to the party. Low full-toss, sliced in the air but in the gap as well

FOUR, only he can execute this shot with so much success. Sits down and moves across even before the ball has come out of the bowler's hand. It is a slower delivery on the stumps, batsman waits and pulls over short fine

SIX, that has gone out of the Chinnaswamy! And might have landed on something or someone outside the ground. What's AB's reaction - stoic! Again his trademark shot, sit down, move across, a juicy full-toss and it has been sent over the deep backward square leg roof. A souvenir for someone to take home. Chants of "AB" echo around the ground as the players wait for a fresh cherry. Meanwhile AB and Moeen Ali have some refreshments

FOUR, he doesn't want the wide, he wants more. Sits almost as he connects, back knee on the ground, reaches out to a slower delivery outside off, carves it over backward point. That's enough. Had he left that, it was a wide

SIX, it has gone for six. A checked loft. Are you serious? Dhawan can only smile wryly, as it loops over his head. bowler deceived batsman completely, with a slower delivery outside off, batsman arrested his shot at the last moment, but it just flew and flew

out Caught by Dhawan!! bowler has done the double over AB this season. Got him both times. This wicket the credit has to go to Dhawan. What a catch under extreme pressure. Could mean a difference of 30 easily. batsman slogs and doesn't get the elevation, Dhawan at deep backward square was on the edge, but leapt at the right time, caught it and ensured that the left leg didn't trod on the cushion. He raises his finger Ricky Ponting Sydney style to say it's out. Kohli is anxious and cranes his neck out to check whether this is a legal catch. It is and batsman walks. Again silence at the Chinnaswamy. 150th wicket for Rashid in T20s. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 69(39) [4s-12 6s-1]
FOUR, from round the wicket, tossed up and batsman has smote it back over bowler's head. Flat hit and bisects long-off and long-on. Super shot. He is continuing his stroke-making

out Caught by Goswami!! Brain-melt from batsman. Nothing more than that. Suddenly he has kicked the door wide open for team to come back into the game. bowler's last over and with AB gone, he decides to play a cute reverse paddle, when he was hitting them so well straight down the ground. Such a low-percentage shot and one must applaud Goswami's take. On the rebound and it was a clear deflection too. batsman walked as soon as Goswami took it. That shot could potentially send team out of the tournament. But batsman plays that way and has got out many times previously very softly. Fantastic innings nonetheless. batsman c Goswami b bowler 65(34) [4s-2 6s-6]
FOUR, thick outside edge and four. Wide full delivery outside off, batsman's edge flies over short third
SIX, right up there and batsman has teed off. Full on the stumps, batsman lofts and clears long-off. He can time them really well too
SIX, does loft over extra-cover really well. Bit of air outside off, batsman launches bowler inside out and gets the maximum. Good end to the over

out Caught by Dhawan!! The slower delivery does the trick. Dhawan takes it at long-off and does his trademark thigh-slap. Would make a good South Indian hero in movies. With that move of his. batsman getting under that slower delivery a bit too much. Dhawan does the rest. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 4(6)

SIX, high high and over the backtracking Rashid at deep mid. That was a misjudgement from the Afghan. He was inside the field of play and not at the edge of the boundary. So can't track back in time and it lobs him despite getting his hands across to try and catch. One more biggie to batsman

FOUR, Basil T is having a mare out there. KW - the cool cat - just rubs his beard. That's his way of showing disappointment. Cut late by batsman and Basil diving to his right at short third allowed the ball to sneak under his hands. One becomes four
SIX, that is brute power from CdG. Brutal from the Zimbawean-turned-Kiwi. Waited for the slower delivery and then slapped it high and powerfully over extra-cover. Kohli smiles and claps

FOUR, my colleague Kumar who dines and drinks on stats tells me this - bowler now has the most expensive figures this IPL. Not a proud record if you are the youngster. Good shot, full delivery on off, batsman opened the bat face and that's why he could find the gap with the square-drive wide of the fielder in the deep

SIX, last match they had a fielder just behind the keeper, very fine and he was caught. Not this time. Just reverse-laps a full-toss and it goes all the way. The team dugout love it. batsman is known to be innovative and he is showing us why

2 runs, that has gone into the stars and come back down, KW drops it. Gaping open mouths from the team fans. Who are enjoying the Schadenfreude. A slower delivery is skied miles up, miles literally, KW was setting himself at around mid-off, got both hands, out it went. Sarfaraz Khan dives and makes it back to prevent the run-out opportunity

out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Has to go as one of the best catches in the IPL this season. On par with Boult. So similar. One-handed and behind him too. A pure reflex effort from Rashid at deep mid. Takes it and falls flat on the ground, can't believe has plucked that out of thin air. That was hit so powerfully and flat by batsman, but Rashid pulled off a blindy! batsman c Rashid Khan b bowler 40(17) [4s-1 6s-4]

2 runs, good effort by Sandeep, but he has dropped batsman at long-stop! Ran in and got there, but the ball went out. A thick top edge on the pull and batsman almost gets out in the same fashion for the second game running

FOUR, one-handed back foot square drive. On a short of length outside off, batsman didn't intentionally pull the bottom hand off, but it raced off the middle and split cover-point and backward point. AB is in the mood tonight
FOUR, superb shot. The crowd go wild. So cleanly struck too. On a length and around off, lifted over extra-cover. A proper cricketing shot
FOUR, batsman has played his part. Whips a full-toss on the stumps wide of backward square and it raced away. Grand end to the innings and he walks back with a swagger. team end on 218
FOUR, he is looking to play aggressively and maximise the powerplay. This is tossed up outside off, batsman moves across and slog-sweeps over mid-wicket, one bounce over the ropes. Lovely batting
FOUR, short and pulled over mid-wicket. Judged the length so quickly, left deep square chasing shadows. Top shot

out Bowled!! The team fans are stunned into deathly silence. Deathly. While bowler celebrates with a finger-twirling celebration. batsman doesn't pick bowler, slogs in hope to a googly which is bowled on a fuller length and sees the stumps re-arranged. Difficult to say whether bowler has the wood over batsman - a very small sample size for that. But for sure Rashid has the bragging rights over the team skipper. batsman was so disappointed at missing that. Rarely does he miss those, but tonight he did. Massive massive wicket too. batsman b bowler 12(11) [4s-2]

FOUR, not sure whether it is four or six. batsman grits his teeth and it is not a six. Maybe AB thought it didn't go all the way. It has been sent upstairs. Has the ball landed bang on the cushion? After batsman lifted a length ball on the stumps towards wide long-on. Still looking. Umpire Chettithody Shamsuddin wants to get this absolutely correct in the third ump's box. They are zooming in and zooming out. Crowd keep waiting. S Ravi does too. To get the orders from above. They could have taken the strategic timeout and got done with it. More than 3 minutes as I type. Finally a decision has been made. It is four. And it is the right call too, one angle showed clearly that the ball bounced in front of the cushions. The game moves on - thankfully

FOUR, not sure what bowler is appealing for? Clearly off the bat as batsman reverse-swept and got a bottom edge, also batsman had got outside the line when playing the shot, beats short third and it raced away
SIX, batsman launches bowler over long-off. Was right in the slot to play the lofted drive, hit it cleanly and went all the way. bowler came round the wicket and bowled a loosener, paid the price

SIX, this is a fine shot. He has a problem with the short ones, much like Raina, but not at that height, at waist-height, he pulls handsomely and sends the white Kookaburra over the deep square leg's head. That shot brings the crowd back to life

FOUR, his eyes were wide open as bowler was running in, maybe he was waiting for the short ball. Murdered through mid-wicket. That's actually so disrespectful to a fast bowler, but this is a tough game

SIX, caught by Shikhar Dhawan but goes over the rope. Six more. batsman powered this flat and over the head of Dhawan at long-on, he caught it well but went one step back and trod on the cushion. Still manages a wry smile and a "ooooohhhhhhh"
SIX, so easy. Overpitched by bowler and he sees the white ball fly over long-on. Clean bat-flow and sweetly struck. A welcome bowler won't like
SIX, it has gone for six despite it coming off the bottom of the bat. Again a bit too full from bowler, in the hitting range and batsman tees of. Over long-on
SIX, fractionally short outside off, batsman stays low and shuffles across, gets under it and pulls it flat to deep mid-wicket. Goes just over the rope for six. Magnificent hitting.
FOUR, slower one @117km/h, batsman waits for it, calm as a cucumber (maybe change the idiom to Dhoni), steers it away to deep backward point for four
2 runs, 8th fifty for KW this IPL, his 11th IPL fifty in his 28th game. Flat and shortish, whipped away off the back foot to deep mid-wicket for a brace

SIX, in the slot, a bit of air too, batsman gets on his knees, and puts all his might into that slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket for six. Didn't seem to time that perfectly, managed to clear it. How does he look elegant while slogging? 50 partnership is up, and it almost hits a car.
FOUR, not even close to a half-tracker, just outside off, uses those beautiful wrists and splits that gap surgically behind backward point for four. Class. Yes, even T20 can be classy.
SIX, this guy is amazing! Not a T20 player, they said. Short one outside off, drags that with a pull over deep mid-wicket for a massive six. He's carting sixes on his way to a win.

FOUR, anti-climactic end to a superb effort. Put in a pool like dive at deep mid to get to it. But then kept sliding and the ball slipped away. Just touched the ropes and their was dismay on the face of the skipper. The short ball was thumped away between mid-wicket and long-on by the batsman
FOUR, low full toss, dipping and the batsman clips the ball away past deep square leg for a four. That was superb from batsman as he gets it away

SIX, low full toss and batsman goes one step better compared to his mate. That has been drop-kicked over deep square for a maximum. The runs are raining now. team ducking for cover but no where to hide
SIX, gargantuan! More height and enough distance. That was on a length and the batsman dismisses it over long-on for a sixer. Only 67 now off 30 balls as 22 is leaked in that over
