SIX, too predictable from bowler. Another slower ball and the length is way too short, AB had all the time in the world to pick his spot and he marmalizes it into the mid-wicket orbit without breaking sweat

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Needless stuff from batsman. Wanted to go for the glory hit and perished; was fullish and angling in, batsman made room early and cleared his front leg to go over the leg-side, slices it off the toe-end and Hardik Pandya takes the simplest of catches at mid-off. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 5(6)
1 run, 29th IPL fifty for AB batsman! Punches a length ball square of sweeper cover and gets to the landmark with an air of nonchalance
no run, clipped to the left of mid-wicket and they think of a quick single, Suryakumar Yadav was quick to gather the ball and he missed the direct hit at the batting end
FOUR, AB shuffles and meets this ball on the full, sits on one knee and swats it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square

SIX, for a fleeting moment AB seemed to have mistimed it. Wasn't to be. AB was moving to the leg-side but Hardik kept it wide of off, bowled it on a length and made AB fetch; carved off the bottom half but no problems, it keeps traveling and sails over the leaping sweeper cover fielder
SIX, full toss on the pads, see you tomorrow! Can't bowl there to AB and that's disappeared at the rate of knots. Straight into the third tier over square leg

out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Similar lines again: wide of off, CDG thumps it into the air sans any conviction and KP at sweeper cover runs forward to snaffle a dolly of a catch. batsman c Krunal Pandya b bowler 2(7)

SIX, this is why he's been picked in the IPL. Shows no sign of nerves and pumps the full ball over long-off, bowler didn't have the pace to trouble the batsman and it was righ in the slot for a left-hander

1 run, dropped! Bumrah is the culprit. Slower length delivery outside off, Dube slices it high into the air and it kept swirling backwards behind the keeper, Bumrah runs back from short third but can't cling onto it
FOUR, that's a nice pull shot, he's short in stature, but he packs a punch with his shots. A gentle step forward and then a pull over mid-wicket
FOUR, top edge, but it flies high over QdK. Short fuller length on the stumps, Moeen was beaten for pace on the pull shot, gets away with it
SIX, oh what a shot! bowler will be kicking himself for bowling a freebie full ball on the leg stump, Mo flicks with a strong bottom hand grip and it sails over backward square leg

out Moeen Ali Run Out!! This is a big moment. What a direct-hit from the skipper. Mo was starting to time the ball well, a stutter has cost him. Parthiv flicked this slower ball in front of short mid-wicket and set off, Ro attacked the ball and knocked the sticks over with a rocket through. The crowd, disappointed for a fleeting moment with the dismissal, yells out a loud roar. Enter King Kohli! Moeen Ali run out (Rohit) 13(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

FOUR, oh this could so easily have been in mid-on's hands. Shortish delivery, batsman pulls off the front foot, not in control, Yuvi was very wide there and had no chance. This is the battle of the best bowler v best batsman

FOUR, outside edgeeee but safe! batsman really throws his hands at this length delivery wide outside off stump, wanted a drive through cover, got a thick edge that went wide of slip and beat third man
FOUR, this is a brilliant shot. Not a bad ball at all for the field set. Fullish and outside off stump, batsman leans forward and punches it with an angled bat, splits backward point and cover-point

FOUR, bowler missed his length by a couple of yards and that's all waht batsman needed to get going. Back of a length and well outside off stump, batsman cuts, beats backward point and look at him, he's fired up. Cheers himself up with a soft of fist pump, he didn't like being dominated/threatened by bowler for those three deliveries

FOUR, and look at this cover drive, he's moved onto 20 and all have been boundaries. Fullish delivery outside off stump, batsman leans forward and creams the ball along the ground, raced away to the boundary
FOUR, flicked along the ground, big Polly runs to his right and dives, misses the ball and it escapes for four. Too full from bowler and he pays the penalty
SIX, this is a brave ball, but Parthiv is a good player of spin and he loves the slog-sweep. Landed full and Parthiv went aerial over mid-wicket
FOUR, driven wide of long-off, oh dear, Hardik Pandya has let this go through between his legs. Off-drive along the ground, should have been stopped

out Bowled!! A chop on from Chota Gayle. He gets a start, but throws it away. We have seen that way too many times. Did the job though. Googly from bowler, Parthiv goes back to cut, looked too close for the shot and ended up dragging it back onto the sticks. batsman b bowler 31(22) [4s-4 6s-1]

no run, Yuvraj Singh, what have you done?. He's dropped batsman first ball. Flatter delivery outside off stump, batsman was looking to punch off the back foot, gets a thick edge that travels, Yuvi moved to his right and the ball came to the left and hit the knee
FOUR, just a chip and off she goes. Full and in the slot, batsman extends his forward push and sends it over mid-off, who was inside the ring. The timing was brilliant as the ball flew off the middle
FOUR, runs starting to flow from both ends now.. batsman has also up the ante. Picked the short ball and pulled it backward of square, giving the fielder at deep square no chance of getting across

SIX, hit-me delivery and batsman obliges. A gift on the pads and batsman picks it up nonchalantly over backward square, struck it flat and got it over the rope. Bhuvi also might have misjudged as he came in before running back, too late by then

FOUR, it is not working for bowler. Hyderabad's fifth bowler is becoming a problem. Nadeem leaked runs and bowler too is going for a few. The back of hand but overpitched it, batsman delays the loft and sends it soaring over extra cover, one bounce and over the rope

1 run, fifty for batsman. First of the season for the skipper. Just a quick bat raise towards his team and on his goes.. Wrong 'un and on the shorter length, tucked away in front of square on the leg-side

FOUR, shot! He's bisected the two fielders with precision. 107ks knuckle ball around off, batsman makes room and drives on the up past extra cover, where KW can't go full throttle on the dive as it is to his left and Rashid also can't get across from sweeper cover

2 runs, Rahane was in trouble here. Full and outside off, batsman drives it towards deep extra cover, Rashid swoops down and releases the ball quickly as well but Sandeep fails to gather it, Rahane puts in the dive to make his ground

1 run, fifty for batsman. 11th in the league and Rajasthan's mentor, Shane Warne picked him as the player to watch out for in this edition. He's started off nicely. Picked the slower delivery and works it into the open mid-wicket area

FOUR, batsman getting innovative. Rashid is taken by surprise. The fast wrong 'un and batsman decides to play the reverse sweep, more of a top-edge and the ball clears backward point before running away to the fence

SIX, woah! What timing. Rashid thought he was in with a chance near the rope but the ball kept sailing over him. bowler in an attempt to dart it in offers an half volley, batsman backs away and chips the loft inside out, yes just a chip and off went the ball clearing the rope comfortably
FOUR, cheeky! Smart batting by batsman. He knows that bowler is firing 'em in and he uses that to his advantage, walks across his stumps and laps it over the keeper, the pace takes care of the rest

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Gone! The partnership has been broken. But it might be a good thing for Rajasthan. batsman has done his job - setting it up for the likes of Stokes and Gowtham. He shimmies down and is deceived by bowler's dragged back length, still goes through with the loft and gets more height than distance, Pandey takes it easily near long-on. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 70(49) [4s-4 6s-3]

2 runs, dropped! Bairstow charges from behind the sticks and grasses it. He should have left it to Rashid, who was coming in. batsman is deceived by the knuckle ball and is early into the flick, the leading edge balloons towards square leg, Bairstow sprinted across and Rashid ran forward, in the end the man with the mitts called for it and he only got a tip of the glove on the ball

SIX, fabulous shot! This for me is the shot of the innings. The leg-cutter on a length outside off, batsman plonks his front foot forward and lofts it over extra cover. The power he generated on the slower ball was ashtonishing
FOUR, wow! He's playing a gem here. Bhuvi misses the yorker by a couple of inches and that is enough for batsman, he opens the bat face and square drives it to the fence. Sweeper had no chance

FOUR, and again.. Bhuvi does not look at his best in the death. Taken to the cleaners by Russell in the previous game and now batsman getting stuck into him. Missed the yorker and the squeezed drive beat Pathan near backward point and raced away

FOUR, this is class batting. He is toying with the field. Third man was inside the ring, Bhuvi bowled a short of length leg-cutter and batsman opened the bat face to guide it behind square on the off-side - between backward point and short third man

FOUR, 24 runs off the over. This is batting of the highest quality. No slogging or blind smashing but pure textbook cricket shots. Full delivery outside off, batsman slices it over the point region and though there was a deep point in place, Pathan could not get there

SIX, into the 90s now.. Sandeep offers a friendly full toss just below the waist, batsman deep in the crease is set up for a heave into the leg-side, the ball was right in his arc and he swings it away 20 rows back near deep square leg

FOUR, geez! batsman showing he has the innovative game. He set up for the heave, then wanted to scoop but since the line was outside off, he reverse scooped it over short third man and the connection almost took it the distance

FOUR, hundred for batsman. Second in the IPL for him. Both have come in the last two seasons. He is making sure that Warne was right about his prediction. A innings of top quality. He raises bat and fist pumps both his hands. The Royals family love it and all are on their feet to applaud the innings. Short of length and batsman slaps the pull to long-on, the fielder gets across and dives but does not get enough to stop the ball
FOUR, batsman being cheeky. He telegraphed his ploy very early, batsman shuffled across to get inside the line and scoop it over short fine. He generated enough power to clear the fielder
FOUR, 125.3kph. Top hands, and batsman lets them overcompensate for the lack of feet. Leans back, lets it get close and steers his drive square

FOUR, Rajasthan Royals finish with a mammoth 198. Bhuvi concedes 45 runs from his last 2 overs. Full and wide outside off, batsman throws the kitchen sink and the outside edge flies over short third man

out Bowled!! Yeah, that's how you halt rampagers -- with drift. Rashid starts wide of his crease, entices batsman to go sweeping with the angle. But he gets a little too greedy, shuffling way across, sweeping, and getting fully foxed by the dip, which sneaks under the bat, kisses the glove and is still quick enough to uproot leg. batsman b bowler 5(8) [4s-1]
FOUR, streaky edge. batsman has no clue which way this one's spinning, sticks his bat out away from his body desperately and runs it just wide of the diving slip
FOUR, this is simple. Sandeep strays into the legs, and batsman isn't foxed on this side of the wicket. Whips, with a lot of bottom-hand, splitting mid-wicket and mid-on
SIX, bang in the slot. And here's batsman's lazy elegance. On a knee, swinging, sorry slogging, and depositing it deep into cow corner

SIX, another knuckle pace-off. But batsman picks it perfectly, staying on the front foot and pulling it high. Shankar's waiting for this at deep mid-wicket, he leaps one-handed as well, but despite the 73-meter boundary, the timing takes it just over
FOUR, deft. batsman clears his back leg, perhaps forcing Rashid to go straighter - which he does - and then uses all his pace on offer to merely stick his bat out in a paddled sweep, very fine
1 run, miscued front-footed pull. Straight to long-on. Also, the 50-stand between these two
SIX, runs down, gets close to the pitch of it and smacks it straight down. He's been looking for this for quite some time now, and he really needs this
FOUR, strays on the pads, swings into the left-hander from round the wicket, a little too much, batsman just has to tickle it away to the fine leg fence for four

SIX, geez that's massive! Banged in on a back of a length @143.5km/h, batsman gets his weight on his backfoot and carts that into the second tier over the cow corner fence. Brutal with a dash of panache...

FOUR, round the wicket, fires it in flat on a length, batsman steps across and just whip-jabs it with a checked followthrough (or lack thereof) over the fielder at square leg inside the circle for four
FOUR, fires it down leg, out of fear more than anything else, batsman gets on his knee and gets some bat on it, deflects it away towards the (extremely) fine leg boundary for four

1 run, dropped by Kulkarni at third man! Short one just outside off, angling in, batsman stays low and gets under it, runs his hands through the upper-cut, Dhawal runs from third man in to take the catch but fluffs it - concedes a single

out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Dhawal Kulkarni dropped a relatively easy one last over, but he's taken a blinder at long-off. He was close to the boundary, had to jump to grab the ball, got the timing right and managed to hold on and also stay inside the rope. batsman was running back for the second and stood midway in disbelief that the catch was taken. It was a flighted delivery outside off stump, batsman steps out and toe-ends the lofted drive, holes out in the end. So both the set batsmen have been removed in quick succession. batsman c D Kulkarni b bowler 45(28) [4s-6 6s-1]
FOUR, oh what a shot! Leans forward and plays that drive with an angled bat to get it past backward point, timing very good and it runs away for four

FOUR, lovely pull shot. Short delivery, but batsman rocked back to power it through square leg, Unadkat runs to his left in the deep but can't stop it. But why is he running around near the rope and not bowling?
SIX, he's powered this all the way over long-on. Backs away, gets a nice short ball, and batsman flat-batted that hard over the boundary

SIX, gee he's hit this really, really hard! Slower delivery, but batsman went back in his crease and positioned himself nicely for the pull shot over mid-wicket, the man in the deep was interested for a bit but it cleared him comfortably
SIX, it's a slower ball alright, but this bloke is picking them from the hand, so he's being disguised, nicely gets under the ball and smashes it over mid-wicket
FOUR, in the air but wide of backward point, short delivery outside off stump, batsman cuts hard, the fielder jumped to his right inside the circle but it was well past him

out Caught by R Tripathi!! This is going to hand. Slower delivery, batsman jumped out of the crease to cut, but this one bounced a tad extra, so batsman couldn't keep it down, easy grab at backward point. batsman c R Tripathi b bowler 14(10) [4s-2]

out Caught by (sub)Chopra!! He's mistimed this loft and long-on swallows the ball. This is an area batsman has to work on. He gets set, looks so good, but throws it away. It's something that will be on his mind. Lovely googly from bowler, gave it a lot of air, batsman wanted a maximum, but the bat turned in his hands on impact with the ball and the timing was messed. Anyway, such a good innings from batsman. batsman c (sub)Chopra b bowler 35(15) [4s-1 6s-3]

out Lbw!! Appeal and given. bowler wins the Karnataka battle and he's on a hat-trick. Pandey knew he was plumb, didn't bother reviewing. The googly from the bowler, Pandey was lunging forward in his defence, ball hits the pad first and then the bat. Impact in line and it would have crashed into leg at least. Middle and leg according to HawkEye. batsman lbw b bowler 1(4)
SIX, gee! The bloke is bowling over 140kph, but Yusuf didn't bother going back to pull this hard, hit it flat and all the way over deep square leg
FOUR, that's the strong bottom hand grip on this punch from Rashid, stayed deep in the crease, converted this yorker into a full ball and crashes it to deep cover

SIX, oh wow! What a hit and what a shot to finish. Just a whip of the wrists, bowler's pace helped here, but he middled that so well. Leg-side line again from Archer with the yorker, just a flick with those rubber wrists. team win with an over to spare
FOUR, wide yorker length delivery @135.8km/h, just slightly too full, ends up being a full toss only after batsman leans forward, just times it through the gap in the cover for four
FOUR, short one from round the wicket , cross-seamer, batsman opens up his stance and clubs that pull away to wide long-on for four
FOUR, just short of a half-volley, not quite to the pitch, batsman just goes through the line and lofts it over mid-off towards the long-off boundary for four
FOUR, another slower one @112.9km/h, batsman backs away into the on-side, gives himself some space, and slaps it over the in-field towards the sweeper cover boundary for four
1 run, fuller length delivery on the pads @138.4km/h, clipped away to backward square leg for a single - and that brings up the half-century opening partnership!

FOUR, slightly more open-chested from bowler from wide of the crease, angles it into a short of length spot, batsman gets under it and has a slash at it, gets a top-edge that just evades the 'keeper's leap to the third man (almost long stop) boundary for four. 17 off the over!
FOUR, that's the mother of all cross-batted shots! @149.4km/h, no width on the short of length delivery, and a straight pull past the non-striker to the long-off fence for four

2 runs, short of length delivery angling away @140.3km/h, but not too much, batsman backs away into the on-side and chips it only just over Samson at mid-off towards the extra cover region for a couple to bring up his fifty - raises his bat to the local crowd
FOUR, 149.8km/h, but it's a half-volley on the pads - wasted pace. Just an effortless whip to the backward square leg fence for four

FOUR, 132.6km/h, that's a slower one, shortish and no width on offer, batsman is asked to manufacture his own, and he does so byb moved away into the on-side and slapping it through the gap in the cover region to the deep extra cover fence for four
FOUR, skids through towards leg, batsman steps across and sweeps, in the air for a while, and falls short of Kulkarni at fine leg who can neither catch it, nor stop it, as it goes away for four
SIX, right in the swinging arc for batsman, wide and full outside off, batsman steps forward and lofts it flat over long-off for a six

FOUR, pulls the length back, nothing wrong with this one, batsman opens the face and threads the needle that is the gap in the cover region - touch and class, and away she goes to the deep extra cover fence for four

SIX, what a way to bring up the hundred partnership! Dropped short, a rank half-tracker, batsman uses the depth of the crease, rocks back, and throws his entire weight behind that pull over cow corner for six

FOUR, 140.4km/h, back of a length delivery without width, batsman backs away into the on-side, gives himself room, and carves it away towards the deep backward point fence for four. NOT a lot of width, but the arm-power made up for it...

out Caught by D Kulkarni! When batsman departs in an away venue, you can hear the combined sound of a city sighing in relief - but at home, you can hear a pin drop. Bangs it in short this time, batsman gets under it by shuffling across to hook, gets a bit of a top-edge and spoons a catch to Kulkarni at the fine leg boundary! The God of Carnage departs. batsman c D Kulkarni b bowler 69(37) [4s-9 6s-2]
FOUR, shortish, marginally wide, batsman just stays back and focuses on the placement - carves it away towards the deep backward point fence for four

FOUR, batsman plays the ramp now, safe shot as third man was inside the ring - short and well wide of off, he waited on it, opens the face of the bat and ramps it over the empty slip cordon, one bounce and over the ropes

SIX, that's quality hitting from batsman. He didn't try to hit it hard, comes close to the ball, keeps his shape and larrups it down the ground. The timing was good enough to clear the long-on fence which is not a short boundary at all
1 run, pushes it with the spin to deep cover and he will retain the strike
SIX, he is playing the innings of his life in the IPL. Gets a six off the first ball of the over- doing it the Kohli way. Holds his shape, clears his leg and smashes it down the ground for a six

out Caught&Bowled!! An excellent innings from batsman comes to an end. He is a disappointed, looks upwards after giving the catch. It was a flatter one on the stumps and batsman smashes it straight back to the bowler. It was hit at a ferocious pace and bowler did really well to grab the catch. He takes off the bails at the non striker's end too, not sure why. batsman c and b bowler 43(21) [4s-4 6s-2]

SIX, this is more like batsman. This is the batsman we know. It was a back of a length delivery wide of off, there was enough room available for batsman. He backs away, brings his willow down at a tremendous speed and cuts it over deep backward point for a six
FOUR, tell you what, his touch is back. It was fuller and batsman creams it wide of Rohit at cover. He wasn't far from the ball but it was hit very hard and will canter to the fence

FOUR, nicely done by batsman! Expensive over from bowler. 19 runs off it. It can be a match-changing over. It was short and was aimed on the body, batsman gently clips it wide of the keeper for a boundary

FOUR, fifty for batsman! Not the most ravishing innings but it has been a fighting knock from the Karnataka lad. And he looks like taking his team home. It was a short of length delivery on the face, batsman gets inside the line of the ball and pulls it fine of fine leg for a boundary
FOUR, bowler misses the yorker. This is rare from India's number-one bowler. batsman has got his touch back and he punches it wide of long-off for a boundary

FOUR, he looks in fabulous touch, how quickly things can change for a batter in this format. It was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, batsman hops a touch and half-pulls it wide of deep square leg for a boundary. Sweet timing!

FOUR, smashed! Punjab are just a hit away from winning this. It was a fuller length delivery and was wide of off, batsman backs away, makes room and thumps it wide of deep cover for a boundary. It rockets to the fence!
wide, 50-run partnership comes up. It has been a match-winning one for Punjab. bowler gets his line wrong this time, it was well down the leg-side and batsman lets it go

FOUR, cheeky from batsman. He is taking his side over the line for sure. It was on a length and there was just a bit of room, batsman waits for it to arrive, opens the face of the bat at the very last moment and guides it fine of third man who had no chance to stop it
SIX, massive, you can't bowl short to this man - this simply sat up to be smacked, batsman stands tall and pummels it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum, 101m hit, a colossal one
SIX, back-to-back sixes for batsman, his 300th six in IPL, length ball at the stumps, he leans forward and thumps it high and over mid-on, went a long way over the ropes
FOUR, beautifully played, fraction too full and well outside off, batsman leans into the drive and places it into the gap past cover-point, beats the infield and runs away to the ropes
FOUR, lovely, very full and at the stumps, batsman gets his left leg out of the way and plays a pristine straight drive - past Rahul and beyond Pollard's reach - running across from long-on
FOUR, batsman is in his elements today, slower short ball outside off, batsman picked the length early and found the gap past cover-point with the cut

SIX, clears the mid-wicket fence, but only just. It's a baby six by batsman's gigantic standards. It was a slower one on the stumps, batsman backs away, clears his front leg and powers it over deep mid-wicket.

SIX, you can't miss your length by an inch when Universe Boss is in this mood. Attempted yorker goes wrong, batsman goes deep in his crease, makes it into an overpitched delivery and larrups it straight down the ground for a massive six

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Pandya brothers come together to get rid of the Universe Boss! This is excellent captaincy from Rohit. He was brave enough to bring his left-arm spinner against batsman and the man from Baroda hasn't disappointed him. It was wide of off and batsman wanted to clobber it down the ground. Doesn't get it off the sweet spot and it went a long way up in the air. Hardik at long-on takes it with ease in the end. It wasn't the easiest of catches. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 40(24) [4s-3 6s-4]
FOUR, just a chip shot from batsman but he has timed it to perfection. And has placed it well too. It will beat the straight fielders for a boundary

FOUR, he looks in great touch does batsman. It wasn't that bad a delivery, just a little bit short. batsman rocks back and powers it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. He bisected long-on and deep mid-wicket to perfection
FOUR, batsman is seeing the ball really well. And he is placing them well too. He goes on the back foot and pulls it wide of deep mid-wicket. Doesn't try to hit it too hard, placement was the key
FOUR, 18 off 7! He is playing a gem. Backs away on this delivery, creates his own room, wanted to cut it wide of backward point. Gets an oustide edge and it ends up fine of short fine for a boundary
FOUR, can't bowl short to batsman when it's not that high. He'll pick on you every single time. Swivels this time and helps it along, clearing short fine leg quite easily

FOUR, classy shot! Sublime stuff from batsman, struck this punchy drive on the up and once he pierced the gap at cover, it was always racing along. It wasn't a bad ball to be honest, just one of those things this man can do when on song

FOUR, one-handed check drive from batsman, aerial as well but then, the intention was to clear the infield. Therefore, the deception didn't of the slower ball didn't dent his intent and he went through with the chip shot. Over extra cover and to the fence

FOUR, straight as an arrow! Now this shot should boost batsman's morale. Low full toss alright but the execution was admirable. Punchy drive that was straight back past the bowler and it rocketed to the fence. Didn't overhit it and that was the key

FOUR, in the air....safe and to the fence! Was a lofted hit from batsman and he got more height than distance on the stroke. Long-on and deep mid-wicket were converging on the stroke but with no real chance of getting to it. The former, Mayank, tried in vain as it landed short of him and to the fence. 50 for QDK! Super knock so far
1 run, cramps batsman with this good length ball, stabbed towards extra cover for a sharp run. 50-run stand comes up! Valuable one for team who now have the platform to launch at the death
SIX, sensational pick up shot from batsman! Treats bowler as a spinner here by walking across and just drop kicks it over deep square leg. Beautiful connection

out Lbw!! Much-needed breakthrough for team. batsman was getting into overdrive and this shot perhaps, was a result of that. Premeditated by walking across the stumps and bowler did the basics right, full and straight. batsman couldn't connect the sweep and once he got hit on the pad, it was always going to be out. The umpire felt so too and although the South African opted for the DRS, there was nothing on UltraEdge to save him. Three Reds on HawkEye to compound the misery and team have lost the review. Excellent innings nevertheless. batsman lbw b bowler 60(39) [4s-6 6s-2]

out Caught by Shami!! This was coming - batsman was being tied down and he falls while trying for that big hit - picked the wrong 'un as he went down on the sweep, couldn't roll his wrists over and ended up swiping it in the air. Shami was the man running across to his right from deep backward square leg, gets himself into a good position and holds on. team are stuttering once again in the middle overs. batsman c Shami b bowler 18(22) [4s-2]

FOUR, edged and four, another wrong 'un from Murugan, fraction short and spinning back into the right-hander, Hardik didn't pick it as he went for the cut - cramped up for room, gets a thick outside edge that brushes Rahul's gloves and runs away to the third man fence
FOUR, cracking shot, tad too short from bowler, Hardik swivels across, rolls his wrists and finds the gap between the two men in the deep, much needed boundary for the Mumbai Indians

out Caught by Agarwal!! That's a high catch and Mayank has judged it to perfection at long-off. 'This went to the moon and came back' chirps Danny Morrison on air. batsman got this one very high and it took an age to come down - but it looked like it didn't have enough legs to clear the fielder, Mayank was the man under it, he held his cool, waited for the ball to arrive and pouched it with both hands. The knuckle ball and batsman didn't spot, was way too early on the lofted drive - plenty of height but not the distance. batsman c Agarwal b bowler 7(9)

FOUR, Oh dear! That's extremely poor from Shami - ran across from deep backward square leg, got close to the ball and then let it for the other fielder - in the end, both are nowhere close to the ball and it costs them a couple of extra runs, short and at the stumps, pulled away past square leg

FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Krunal, he's getting a move on, length delivery outside off, Krunal delayed his drive by a moment and then placed it wide of extra-cover - no one in the deep and the ball ran away to the fence

out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! That's a good wicket at this stage of the innings - Krunal was opening up, but bowler has his man. Short and angling down the leg-side, Krunal was looking to help it on its way with the shovel - didn't get hold of the shot and popped it in the air over square leg. Murugan Ashwin ran across to his left from the deep and completed the catch with soft hands. batsman c Murugan Ashwin b bowler 10(5) [4s-2]
FOUR, short, wide and four, Hardik has plenty of width on offer as he scythes this one past point, no need to run for those

SIX, and this is why - another full-toss and it has been sent into the mid-wicket stands, presses across and then whips it with the bottom-hand, high and long into the crowd - bowler can't bowl such stuff at this stage of the innings

out Caught by Mandeep!! That's the end of Hardik, but he has played another fine hand for his team. Short and just outside off, he got into a good position on the pull, but doesn't get hold of the shot. Went high and straight into the hands of mandeep - who was standing in front of the ropes at mid-wicket. Hardik has his bat on his shoulder as he walks away in disappointment. batsman c Mandeep b bowler 31(19) [4s-3 6s-1]

FOUR, just over a leaping Viljoen! Nervy moment for batsman who went for the slog sweep and it wasn't that far away from backward square leg where Viljoen leapt with all his might, only to clear him en route to the fence

FOUR, up and over! Might have been the slower ball from bowler but it's was quite wide and that allowed batsman to extend his arms. Didn't connect the loft perfectly but had enough to clear the infield

FOUR, genius stuff from batsman! Was giving the charge and then got a slower ball in response, quite shorter too but the team skipper adjusted with an elegant back foot punch through backward point. Style, grace and placement all ticked
FOUR, more runs! batsman is shifting gears now. This was a touch too straight in line and he just shuffled across to help this away past short fine leg

out Lbw!! Massive strike from bowler! batsman was looking ominous and if team needed him gone, it was right here right now and that's exactly what the South African has done. Must say it wasn't a great shot from the team skipper, stood rooted on the crease to an extremely full in-angler, attempted to just slog across the line, only to get struck on the back leg. Looked plumb in real time itself unless there was an inside edge but there wasn't. batsman lbw b bowler 32(18) [4s-5]
FOUR, deft touch from Yadav! Too straight in line from bowler and it's clipped softly wide of short fine leg

FOUR, ominous! Whoa, the bloke is looking in sync from ball one. Got forward to this fuller one and just eased it past the bowler. Just a mere push and such was the timing that it raced away, beating mid-on comfortably

out Lbw!! The other Ashwin gets into the act! Just two balls to take the wicket and it's another vital one as Yadav can be dangerous. This was slider and kept a trifle low perhaps as he tried to whip-pull across the line. Once he missed it, there was no doubt on the LBW. As plumb as it gets and Yadav knew it too as he continued the walk to the dugout. batsman lbw b bowler 11(6) [4s-2]
FOUR, too close to cut! batsman pulls it off though and gets it away very fine, beating short third man to the fence. 1000 IPL runs up for QDK!
FOUR, bulldozed away! Came down the track and Ashwin adjusted with a shorter one wider outside off, flat-batted powerfully straight down the ground. Long-on was wider and had no chance

FOUR, to the other side of long-on this time. Was floated up fuller outside off and batsman whipped it away with that strong bottom hand of his. Power and precision in placement as he got it between long-on and deep mid-wicket

SIX, dumped into the crowd! Fractionally short from bowler and it's not that high to threaten batsman either. The South African swivels across to shovel the pull high and handsome over deep backward square leg. Huge hit!
FOUR, boundary to end the over. The short of length delivery sits up on the surface, Shaw had plenty of time to swivel and nail the pull in front of square, no chance for Ferguson this time
FOUR, whippage! bowler tries the slower delivery but offers a half volley on middle and leg, Shaw leans forward and whips it with a lot of bottom hand to deep mid-wicket

SIX, proper drag down - as bad as it can get. And it's the googly as well in it, giving Iyer all the more time to read it better - not that he needed it - but then he waits slogging it several rows into deep square leg
SIX, now the advance, stepping away from the line to free up his hands. And his hands take it inside-out over long-on
FOUR, quickly on a knee, and to his credit doesn't try getting under the already-full length. Instead settles to sweep, and does it straight down the ground
FOUR, juicy overcook - oh no it's a full toss - and Shaw has half a helicopter and half a flamingo. So he Dhoni-Pietersen's it through cow corner. Go, figure ..

FOUR, there's insult. And then there's this. Firstly Russell's bowling because he has to, and then he's been carted around, and to top it all, the one chance he creates it put down so damn casually. Iyer whips uppishly, doesn't get the distance, straight to Gill, who just lets it spill through
FOUR, full, outside off, Iyer slices hard, drilling it in fact through extra cover. More insult .. an injured soul to top an injured shoulder

out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Catching confusion. Gill - in redemption - has done a Dinesh Karthik, plucking pretty much one he would've been forgiven for putting down after dropping one he couldn't have been forgiven for. Iyer whips again, airily, Gill, at cow corner's boundary goes reverse cupped right at the edge over his head. But, but, is his foot touching the cushions? The umpires aren't taking a chance, they go up. And gee, this is really tight. The soft signal wins - OUT. batsman c Shubman Gill b bowler 43(32) [4s-4 6s-2]
FOUR, quick, short, outside off. Never mind it spinning back in, Shaw's already deep enough in the crease and very cheekily dabbing it off the keeper's gloves

FOUR, it's getting predictable. 97.8kph here, which batsman first presses forward to and then piles on the line already on the pads to help - with a lot of power in his whack of course - behind square
FOUR, sitter googly. Shaw sits over it, no sorry stands over it, and slaps it away hard, and doesn't even bother keeping it down as he goes over cover
FOUR, threatens with the bouncer, but Shaw's not not taking it on. He's waiting deep in the crease just for it and swivels in his hook to put it away very fine
FOUR, short again. Shaw goes 180-degrees the other way now .. makes room and upper-cuts, over short third man
FOUR, oh he wants a century. And Krishna surely is helping him to it. An overtly friendly drifter down leg, Shaw stays his ground, picks and dispatches it off his legs past the diving keeper

FOUR, and he has the time to rub in some grace as well into this carnage. The full-faced punch down the pitch, which should ideally have been just a couple, but Russell just doesn't dive. Poor guy, he just can't

out Caught by Chawla!! Miss. Miss. Connect. And when he does, it picks out the man in the deep. batsman refuses to ditch his failed slog sweep from a ball earlier, goes through but Kuldeep very smartly has dragged his length back on this one, making batsman eventually go one-handed in his followthrough. Miscued severely, to deep mid-wicket. batsman c Chawla b bowler 11(15) [4s-1]

out Caught by Karthik!! Kotla heartbreak. A quicker bumper, Shaw can't resist, but for once doesn't find his bat's middle. Big fat top-edge, ballooning high, where DK calls, and nearly makes a mess under the skier, eventually having to take his tummy's help in holding on. So Shaw may have missed out on becoming the youngest IPL centurion, but he becomes the second in these 12 seasons to get out on 99. It's all about getting into trivia books after all, right?! batsman c Karthik b bowler 99(55) [4s-12 6s-3]
FOUR, short, angling across. But batsman goes almost as deep as his stumps and waits for the slant to get big as he pulls it away, splitting the massive leg-sided gap perfectly

out Caught by Shubman Gill!! It will twist, ever so slowly, but it will twist. Short, skiddy, heaved, and it's straight down deep mid-wicket's throat. The favourites have turned, clearly. batsman c Shubman Gill b bowler 2(3)
FOUR, batsman has his first boundary. Delhi need him to fire and fire quickly. Picks the fullish length and just lofts through the line, clears mid-on quite comfortably

FOUR, up and over. This is good intent from batsman. Shimmies down the wicket and gets a bit too close to the delivery, but still goes through with the loft and clears a leaping Russell near the mid-off ring
SIX, now follows it up with a maximum. This is batsman at his best. Googly around leg-stump, that is easy pickings for the left hander, kneels down and sweeps it with a clean bat swing over long leg

out Caught by A Russell!! Gone! One shot too many from the southpaw. team have got their early wicket. He cleared mid-off a couple of deliveries ago but not this time. He advances and once more gets very close to the ball, spoons the loft straight into the bucket hands of Russell at mid-off. batsman c A Russell b bowler 16(8) [4s-2 6s-1]

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. Swipes behind square. And he runs. He HAS TO. Beats short fine leg. But all his desperation is good enough for a single. Uthappa swooped in there, and capped it with a flat throw at the striker's. And DK turns the lights up .. SUPER OVER. Oh Kolkata have stolen this, right under Delhi's nose. batsman run out (Uthappa/Karthik) 10(7) [4s-1]
FOUR, overpitched and Shaw does not miss out, he stays leg-side of the ball and lifts it over mid-off. Just managed to clear Ferguson on the edge of the 30-yard circle
SIX, cracking shot! Shaw picked the length so quickly there, it was fraction short and he was onto it in a flash, gets into a good position and nails the pull flat into the crowd at deep mid-wicket
FOUR, he connects and that should be a relief. Floated up outside off and that was in the slot for Iyer, who free his arms and smashes it straight back over his partner

SIX, in the air and over the rope. Seemed like a mishit by Shaw but it carried a good fair distance. Flighted outside off and Shaw lofts it down the ground, clearing long-off. 13 off the over and it was much needed for Delhi
SIX, conventional, leg-lined, but Iyer's smarter. Clears his forward leg, steps away too and then swings. Into long-on's first floor
FOUR, too short. And that fiendly short. Iyer jumps, doesn't mind pulling it with an air-swivel, powerfully through mid-wicket

FOUR, bowler almost strikes on his first ball, almost! Pitches this one up around the off-stump line, batsman looks to defend this and ends up getting an inside edge. The ball whizzes past the leg stump and races away to the fine leg fence. Lucky start!

FOUR, excellent timing! Another delivery pitched on a full length by KG, batsman leans forward and just play a gentle push. Timing is good enough to beat the fielder at wide mid-off as the ball rockets to the fence, two boundaries in the over so far..

no run, Delhi have taken a review in the second over of the match itself. They've challenged the umpire's call. Has batsman edged this? Rishabh Pant was excited but there's clear daylight between the bat and ball. Delhi lose their review! Was a quicker legbreak outside off and the batsman was looking to steer it to third man before he got beaten on his bottom edge
SIX, 100 runs for Russell in the league after this six! Was a tossed up delivery around off and the Dre Russ muscles it over long-off for a flat six
FOUR, batsman brings out his sledge hammer! Treks back and clobbers it through mid-wicket. Sheer power and the placement was perfect too
SIX, Muscle-Russell in the house! Reads the googly and pumps it over deep mid-wicket with all his might. There was a fielder in the deep but he was a mere spectator

SIX, is this going to be another one of those nights? If Dre Russ stays out there, it probably might. Down on his knee as he clubs the juicy legbreak right over the bowler's head. That was absolutely launched by the beast

FOUR, classic batsman! Takes a forward stride and flicks this one effortlessly through mid-wicket. All about timing, yet again. Not for the first time has DK timed it so well, have been quite a few in this innings so far

FOUR, uhhh! That was streaky but team won't mind it. Low full toss close to the yorker range, Russell bends down to try and squeeze it out, the under edge bounces past the stumps and races to the fine leg fence
leg byes, FOUR, loses his radar does Morris. Tries to follow Russell and cramp him for room, but sprays it too far down leg, the ball takes a deflection off the pad and beats Pant to his left

SIX, straight over the sightscreen. Morris goes off-pace but the length is right in the slot, Russell spotted it out of the hand, waited for the ball to arrive and smacked it with all that Caribbean power back over Morris

FOUR, power from one end and finesse from the other - perfect combination. A low full toss outside off, batsman just had to put it in the gap, he leans forward and creams the drive through extra cover - splitting the two fielders
SIX, massive! This one hits the roof of the top tier and falls back into the ground. Length and that is one thing you can't bowl to Russell, he just uses that raw muscle power to club it over long-on

SIX, oh geez! Absolute carnage at Kotla. How things turnaround in T20 cricket. Just a while back team looked down but now they are bossing this game through Russell and Karthik. Another length ball and Russell says thank you very much and puts it into the crowd near the cow corner region

FOUR, fifty for Russell. This might be a very typical Russell innings but the circumstances were different as compared to the previous two outings. Came in to bat inside the 10th over and has bailed his side out of trouble. Dug in short and Russell is waiting for it, nails the pull wide of deep mid-wicket

FOUR, even fours matter for Russell. It is not only about sixes. A few inches short of yorker length and that is enough for Russell to go through with his heave, one bounce and over the ropes near deep mid-wicket

FOUR, this is top top batting. Fires the yorker from round the wicket but Russell is up for it, he makes room and bends down to squeeze it past backward point, the pace of Morris took care of the rest

out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! A collision between the fielders but more importantly the catch is taken. A brutal innings from Russell comes to an end. He's put his side in the ascendancy here. The slower short of length delivery and Russell was a tad early into the pull shot, the top-edge flew up towards deep square leg and Tewatia ran in to catch it. Rabada was the one who collided as he ran back from short fine with his eyes on the ball. batsman c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b bowler 62(28) [4s-4 6s-6]
SIX, that is dismissive from batsman. Off the mark with a maximum. Wrong 'un and batsman picked it, went down on his knee and slog swept it with a clean bat swing over long leg

SIX, fifty for batsman. Cometh the hour, cometh the captain. This is what responsibility has done to DK. He is a completely different batsman and this knock should rate among his best. Shuffles across, bends down and sweeps it high and into the stands at fine leg

out Caught by Pant!! He walks! Some respite for bowler, who has taken a beating in this over. This would have been a wide had batsman let go but instead he goes chasing after it. The leg-break trying to keep it away from the batsman's range, but DK reaches out and feathers an outside edge to Pant. He does not even wait for the umpire to raise his finger. batsman c Pant b bowler 50(36) [4s-5 6s-2]
FOUR, poor bowling from bowler. He misses the yorker and bowls a juicy full toss outside off, Kuldeep uses the pace and steers it to third man, no one there to stop the boundary
FOUR, all these are bonus runs. Banged in short and aimed for the badge on the helmet, batsman pulls and the top-edge runs away fine beating Patel near the fine leg fence

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. Confusion and it results in a run out. batsman mistimes the loft towards long-on and he was never interested in the second, Kuldeep pushed for it and batsman decided to go, but the batsmen didn't cross each other when bowler removed the bails which means batsman was the one to be dismissed. batsman run out (Dhawan/bowler) 12(5) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Lbw!! batsman's struggle comes to an end. Walks back after consuming 16 deliveries for his 7. Scored a boundary that too off an inside edge. Hard luck. Was the wrong 'un around middle and the batsman got beaten due to the googly. Struck in front of middle and going on to hit the leg-stump. Lamichanne makes an impact in his first game of the season. batsman lbw b bowler 7(16) [4s-1]

FOUR, off the mark with a boundary! Scored a fifty in the last match too. Plants his front foot forward and creams the legbreak through the gap at covers. The outfield is quick enough to get him off the mark with four runs
FOUR, clean strike! Width on offer on this length delivery and batsman chips it over wide mid-off. Clears the infield comfortably and gets his second boundary of the match
FOUR, hacked down to fine leg by batsman! On the shorter side around middle and leg, Chris swivels and puts it away to the fine leg fence for another boundary
FOUR, that shot proves how good a form batsman is in. Was a shortish delivery outside off, Robbie makes the width on offer and chops it past the fielder at point

out Lbw!! That's P.L.U.M.B! If that's not out, nothing else can be. Patel outfoxes Robbie with the off-cutter. He was looking to flick across the line but he gets beaten due to the lack of pace. Struck in front of middle and it would have crashed into middle and leg. Middle, probably. No reviews left and even if there was one, it wouldn't have made a difference. batsman lbw b bowler 11(6) [4s-2]

out Caught by Pant!! That's a terrific catch by Pant. Is there anything, he can't do? Flies to his left and plucks this one with his left glove. Knight Riders in trouble with three of their top-order batsmen back to the hut. A short delivery down the leg side and batsman gets a glove as he looks to play the pull shot. The run rate is well under 6 at the moment. Can they stitch in a partnership? batsman c Pant b bowler 20(18) [4s-3]

FOUR, intent from the skipper! Wastes no time. Gets a half-volley on the pads and DK flicks it with nonchalance. The timing was such that the fielder had deep mid-wicket could nothing else than admire the shot

out Caught by Rabada!! Wickets continue to tumble at the Kotla. team struggling big time in their first away game of the season. Patel bags his second wicket! This was a back of a length delivery down the leg side and batsman flicks it straight to fine leg. The ball flew of the blade and Rabada in the deep took a well judged catch running to his right. 44/4 stands the score. The crowd at Delhi is lovin' it. batsman c Rabada b bowler 1(2)

SIX, 50 up for team with a maximum! Too hot, too cool. A short delivery down the leg side and batsman picks it up over deep backward square leg for a flat six. Right over the opposition's dug-out she goes

FOUR, that's a lucky boundary for team! Was the slider outside off, DK goes for a cut and gets an underedge. Nutmegs the keeper and races away to third man fence. There were two fielders chasing but both were inside the circle, hence there was no chance of stopping this

out batsman Run Out!! 2 runs completed. team sink further! Not their day, perhaps. All credit to Rabada though, he dived full stretch to his left after he sprinted across from sweeper cover. Gill had square driven it through point and was expecting a boundary but is denied that due to some brilliance it the field. KG had parried the ball to Patel in the deep and the throw came in at the bowler's end. The batsman was ball watching while going for the third run and has to pay the price for it. batsman run out (Harshal Patel/bowler) 4(5)
FOUR, lovely, on a good length and well outside off, Parthiv leans into the drive, plays it on the up and finds the gap to the left of cover - no need to run for those
FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from bowler, Parthiv is quick to pick the length early, rocks back and pulls it over mid-wicket for a boundary
SIX, knuckle ball from Kaul, Grandhomme picks it early and waits back to heave it over deep square leg. Didn't come off the middle but enough to clear the fielder's head
SIX, rare loose delivery from Rashid and Grandhomme comfortably smokes it over the fence at deep mid-wicket. Dragged it short, sits up superbly for Grandhomme and he takes toll..
FOUR, Grandhomme shows some deftness. Uses the pace of this delivery, goes deep in his crease and guides it past backward point. Cleverly done

FOUR, well-directed short ball from Kumar but Barman manages to help it over the keeper. Gets himself into a tangle as he was late on the pull, however gets some glove on it and it purrs away to the fine leg fence
FOUR, Kumar continues to struggle with his lines. Attempted pitched up delivery, ends up in the slot for Grandhomme who makes merry. Hoicking it over wide long-on

FOUR, that's hit uppishly and Manish Pandey at long-off tries his best diving to his left but it eludes him. Floater outside off, Grandhomme plants his front foot across and lofts it towards long-off and luckily gets away as Manish's outstretched lefthand was far enough

no run, leading edge lands short of Bhuvi at point. And there's some confusion in the running but Barman gets back in safely at the non-striker's end. Lures Grandhomme into playing an across-the-line-heave, loses shape as the ball sharply turns away and it drops a couple of inches in front of team's captain
FOUR, 50-partnership comes up with this boundary. Short ball that lacks pace, Barman gets into a wonderful position and connects the pull sublimely over square leg

out Caught by Hooda!! bowler foxes the young Barman with a knuckle ball but he's showed his skills with the bat. It was full and Barman was early into the shot, ends up chipping it Hooda at short mid-wicket, who takes the sitter. The spirited partnership has been broken and team have lost their seventh wicket. batsman c Hooda b bowler 19(24) [4s-2]
SIX, you can't keep bowling knuckle balls every now and then. This was right in the arc for Umesh, who swings his bat and muscles it into the second tier at long-on
FOUR, drilled wide of mid-off. bowler overpitches outside off, Umesh loads up and bottom-hands the drive in the gap between extra cover and mid-off

no run. Bairstow appeals but umpire S Ravi signals it a wide. The wicket-keeper has a word with his bowler and the captain, off they go for a review. Nothing wrong with the front foot and there's a certain deflection but I think it's come off the trousers. Clearly missed the bat and it's a smart review from team because S Ravi changes his decision about the wide and it's deemed a legitimate delivery. Full and nipping down leg, Umesh lines up for the swipe and it brushes his trousers on the way to the keeper

out U Yadav Run Out!! 1 run completed. This is suicidal. Chipped away towards sweeper cover and Grandhomme wanted the second. Just went through without looking at his partner who was busy ball-watching. They stumbled mid-pitch and Umesh eventually paid the price. Vijay Shankar fires a clean throw to Rashid, who waits before dislodging the bails. Umesh was not even in the frame and this sums up team's day. U Yadav run out (Shankar/bowler) 14(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

1 run, Bhuvi drops a straightforward catch at extra cover but team won't mind match. Williamson and Co. are in all smiles at the dug-out. Hammered airly, went straight to Bhuvi, who mistimed his jump and ended up shelling it

no ball, out de Grandhomme Run Out!! Low full toss outside off, batsman drives it to extra cover and went for the single. Grandhomme took a few yards before backing out. Both batsmen tries to return back to the crease and the throw from the fielder comes to the non striker's end. The Kiwi all-round was pretty lazy in grounding his bat and bowler breaks the stumps to catch him short of his crease. There was also another run-out chance at the striker's end as batsman was struggling to make his ground. bowler lasers the throw to Bairstow, who ends up crashing into the stumps. Total confusion there. Phew! de Grandhomme run out (Bhuvneshwar/bowler) 37(32) [4s-3 6s-2]
1 run, anti-climax. Nabi puts down a tough chance at long-off. batsman miscues the pull and Nabi comes charging in from long-off, bends forward and gets both hands but fails to hold onto it

out Caught by Hooda!! End of team's misery. batsman surrenders. Short delivery, too pacy and batsman went for the pull, launches it into the night sky as far as mid-wicket. Hooda cups it easily and that's the game in the bag for team. batsman c Hooda b bowler 1(3)

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a gift from Parthiv and Manish takes it with glee - a low full-toss from bowler, Parthiv backed away as he looked to clear the infield - doesn't get hold of the shot and pops it straight to cover. Not the start team wanted - their little pocket dynamo falls early. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 11(8) [4s-2]

SIX, clubbed, batsman comes with a reputation and he gets his first six of the IPL - back of a length and just outside off, he clears his left leg and hammers it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

out Stumped!! One shot too many and bowler has two-in-two. He's on a hat-trick now. Gave his intentions away quite early, came charging down the pitch, allowed bowler to shorten his length - once past the swinging blade of batsman, there was no coming back. Quick work from Bairstow and batsman is well short of his ground. batsman st Bairstow b bowler 9(9) [6s-1]

out Bowled!! bowler is running through team single-handedly - the dangerous AB falls and the Banglaore franchise are in a mess. Lovely loopy delivery on off, dragged AB forward as he looked to go inside out over cover, the ball drifted away and then dipped past the outside edge - clatters into the stumps and that's the end of AB - End of team? Think so. batsman b bowler 1(2)

byes, FOUR, a rare botch-up from Bairstow tonight - he has missed a simple stumping chance. Moeen rushed down the track, swung in hope against the ball kept slanting in, past the inside edge and past the gloves of the keeper

out Caught by Warner!! If it wasn't over, it's definitely over now. batsman falls and team are staring at humiliation. Length ball and it was there to be smacked - batsman leant into the drive and drilled it towards cover - didn't bother to keep it down - straight into the hands of Warner who made it look easy - a head-high catch and he clasps it with ease. The misery continues for team. batsman c Warner b bowler 3(10)

out Moeen Ali Run Out!! Make it five down now. I'm pretty sure that Moeen is short of his ground, his bat is in the air and he already looks downcast. Well short, Moeen is OUT. Oh dear, team are batting and now running like senseless chickens. On a good length and just outside off, Dube clipped it towards mid-wicket and took a start, that prompted Moeen Ali to make a dash, sent back late - too late though - Nabi shies and misses, sandeep has time to break the stumps with the batsman well short. Moeen Ali run out (Nabi/bowler) 2(8)
FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer and Dube gets on top of it with the cut - behind square on the off-side and races away to the ropes

out Caught by Hooda!! It's getting worse and worse for team. bowler is having a dream spell as he picks up his fourth wicket. Dube had a chance to prove his mettle but he just miscues one into the hands of long-on. Nothing shot really and the nightmare continues for the visitors. It was flighted just outside off and kind of held up on the pitch, Dube was deluded by the flight as he went after it and could only succeed in finding Hooda. batsman c Hooda b bowler 5(7) [4s-1]
FOUR, team are away in a fine fashion. He takes a huge stride forward. Comes close to the ball and sweeps it like a boss. It goes over backward square leg and thuds into the fence

FOUR, offie or no offie. batsman is not concerned at all. He is in brilliant form and look how easily he lofts it over cover. Mind you it is one of the most difficult shots in our game. He backs away, makes room and dispatches it over cover for a boundary
FOUR, third boundary of the over. And team are off to a flyer. There was room on this delivery, batsman stays put in the crease and cuts it past backward point for a boundary. Excellent placement!

SIX, this is batting of the highest quality from batsman. It was an overpitched delivery on the stumps, batsman is not shy to hit the first ball of Yadav's spell. He clears his front leg and larrups it straight down the ground for a sensational six

SIX, has he got enough bat on it? Yes, he has. Nothing is going right for team. It was a full-toss on the stumps, batsman stays put in the crease and clobbers it over long-on for a flat six. It was inches over Hetmyer at long-on who leaps in the air but fails to reach it
FOUR, this is sheer carnage from Jonny and Warner. It was a back of a length delivery on the body, batsman pulls it brilliantly wide of deep square leg for a boundary
SIX, wow! Just wow! Outstanding hitting this is from batsman. He backs away, clears his frong leg and disaptches it over long-on for another six

FOUR, gee! Look at the bat speed on that speed. It came at around 140 kph and was dispatched by Jonny even quicker. On a fuller length and on the stumps, batsman smashes it wide of mid-off for another boundary

2 runs, his comeback has been like a dream for team. He has been out of competitive cricket for one-year but that hasn't made an iota of difference to his batting prowess. His third fifty of this IPL season in that many matches. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps and he pushes it to long-on for a brace
SIX, oh no Jonny show some mercy on the 16-year-old. He dashes down the ground, takes it on the full and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket with utmost ease for a maximum
SIX, lovely, it's raining fours and sixes at the moment, fraction short and at the stumps, batsman rocks back and pulls it flat and hard - went sailing over wide long-on for a maximum
FOUR, thumped, no mercy for the team bowlers, flighted delivery on off, batsman gets a big stride forward and drills it wide of mid-wicket, no chance for the fielder in the deep

2 runs, maiden IPL hundred for batsman - and look at the celebrations, this means a lot for him, punches in delight, removes his helmet and lifts both arms towards the dug-out - the Hyderabad crowd has certainly enjoyed it. Coming to the ball, it was tossed up on the leg-stump line, he got close to the ball and whipped it wide of long-on for a brace
SIX, massive, a little shimmy, batsman gets close to the ball and lifts it nonchalantly - wide of long-on for a maximum
FOUR, that's a poor ball, flighted and drifting down leg, batsman backs away and then heaves it over backward square leg for a boundary

SIX, smashed, what more can team do? Even muscled mishits are sailing into the stands, a back of a length delivery outside off, batsman stood firm and then clubbed it over long-on - makes the boundaries look so short. batsman on fire, team look down and out at the moment

out Caught by U Yadav!! There's the wicket for team - ends an outstanding knock from batsman. It's not a no-ball, so bowler can relax, the leg-break, slower and turning away from off, batsman was down on his knees as he hoicked, gets a thick top-edge, it looped in the air and looked like was falling short of backward point. Umesh charged in athletically, dived forward with both hands and holds on. A standing ovation as batsman walks away. batsman c U Yadav b bowler 114(56) [4s-12 6s-7]
SIX, .. and batsman needs just one ball to continue team's torment, flighted delivery at the stumps, he leans forward and smashes it high and over long-on for a maximum
SIX, that's straight into the team dug-out, the yorker strategy lasted one ball, bowler drops this one an inch short, allows batsman to get under it and thump it over Hetmyer's head at long-off

out Shankar Run Out!! 1 run completed. Has Vijay Shankar run himself out? Has the dive saved him, NO - he's well short and team have a second wicket. batsman got lucky, but his partner wasn't. bowler followed batsman as he backed away, induced a thick outside edge on the heave - was in the air for a long time, but dropped right in between AB - who was running back from cover and Hetmyer - running in from long-off. Shankar wanted the second run, but didn't spot that his partner wasn't coming back - stranded in the middle, he made a dash towards his end, put in the dive, but all in vain. Shankar run out (Hetmyer/Parthiv Patel) 9(3) [6s-1]

FOUR, cheeky and four, low full-toss from Umesh, was trying to follow batsman as he made room - he waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it behind square on the off-side for a boundary
SIX, this is a poor ball from Umesh, slower ball, but the length was short and just sat-up to be smacked - pulled with disdain and pulled over long leg for a maximum

FOUR, hundred for batsman and another team batsman is thrilled to bits - rushes half-way towards the team dressing room, delight on his face as he punches his fist - raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from the Orange Army - full-toss and it was squeezed behind square on the off-side. Backward point dived, but to no avail
FOUR, smashed. He is playing with the mind of the bowler. This time backs away, makes room for himself and cuts it past cover for a boundary. Great timing and equally good placement
FOUR, that's an old-fashioned heave from batsman. He gets behind that back of a length delivery and tonks it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary.

FOUR, that's edged and four. They are dealing in boundaries here. It was short and there was width, batsman throws his hands at it. It comes off the outside half of the bat and it runs wide of third man for a boundary

FOUR, 50-run-partnership comes up between this pair. They have been the best opening pair in this season's IPL so far. It wasn't that short and there was hardly any room. But batsman backs away creates his own room and cuts it wide of backward point for a boundary. He is a magician in that area of the ground

FOUR, oh Jonny, you are clearing the fields with mishits too. It was a slower one, batsman wanted to loft it down the ground, his timing was in a mess. But he gets just about enough bat on it to clear mid-off and it races to the fence
FOUR, don't bowl short to batsman. You just't can't, bowler. It was short and was wide of off, batsman cuts it formidably well, beats point and cover and it races to the fence in a canter
SIX, that is a comprehensive hit from batsman. And he has deposited it a long way back. It was fuller and was wide of off, batsman larrups it over deep cover for a maximum

FOUR, this is an ordinary effort from Siraj at long-on. And he gifts a boundary to batsman. It was on the pads and batsman flicks it wide of long-on. Siraj at long-on was clumsy in the deep and he lets it through

FOUR, maiden fifty for batsman in the IPL. Brilliant innings from the Englishman. He is giving a taste of IPL cricket to the young man now. It was on the stumps and batsman paddles it fine of fine leg for a boundary. Sweet timing!

SIX, that was a miserable delivery and batsman has given it the treamtment it deserved. It was a slower one on a short of length, batsman goes on the back foot and pulls it over deep mid-wicket for a massive six

SIX, back-to-back sixes for batsman. It's raining sixes here in Hyderabad. It was a good length delivery on the stumps, batsman clears his front leg, keeps his shape and tonks it deep into the mid-wicket stands for a six
SIX, flush in the slot, and batsman's V is always smoke-worthy. He gets his front leg out of the way, makes room and slogs it high and long into cow corner
FOUR, 125.5kph. Juicy stuff sit up on the legs, and batsman's just too good to miss out on all this. He swivels, swats hard and nails the backward square leg gap
FOUR, 130kph. Just too straight, and this in no way is helping Rajasthan's cause here. batsman won't complain though, surely not with fine leg in the circle, tickling it fine

FOUR, that's how you deal with the slower balls. A short of length delivery from round the wicket, batsman dances down the track and smashes it over Raina's head. One bounce and into the long-on fence. All power!

no run, a direct hit there would have been curtains for batsman. The southpaw shuffled across and tucked this length ball to short fine and set off for a quick single. Dhoni wasn't interested and sent him back. Kulkarni had all three stumps to aim, but missed the target at the striker's end

out Bowled!! The partnership has been broken. bowler yells out a loud roar. Change of pace does the trick. Fullish ball at 116.5kph, batsman backed away a long way and exposed all his stumps. The southpaw didn't pick the slower one and wafted his bat at it, probably looking to go over the covers. Connected with thin air and the ball smashed into the sticks. batsman b bowler 36(32) [4s-4 6s-1]
1 run, 132kph, batsman dances down the ground and batters it to the right of extra cover. It travelled quickly to Gowtham and he failed to hold onto it. Would be very harsh to call it a drop
FOUR, bowler shortens his length, Bravo waits for it from the crease and uses his wrists to elevate it over extra cover. Didn't quite middle it, but had enough to get it over Gowtham

FOUR, 137.1kph, full and outside off - you can't be bowling there to this guy. He plays one of his favourite shots. Throws his blade with an opened bat-face and sends it over backward point. 11 off the over

FOUR, superb placement! Another off-pace ball from a back of a length at 109.9kph, batsman spotted that and delayed his shot from the crease. Dabbed away through the gap between short third man and backward point
SIX, and, the skipper takes full toll of the freebie. A low full toss outside off at 132.9kph, batsman bends his back leg, gets under it and then lofts it over deep extra cover
FOUR, 99.9kph, too slow. Bravo picked that but still was early into his shot. Gave himself some room to go over point, gets a top-edge that evades short third man to his right

SIX, that's the trademark batsman shot! Kulkarni doles out a half-volley, right in the DJ's arc. The right-hander moves leg-side, arches his back and lofts it handsomely over deep extra cover. The maximum also brings up the fifty run stand!

FOUR, 21st IPL fifty for batsman, and his first against team. A pacy low full toss, batsman uses the bowler's pace to drive it through the gap between backward point and short third man. The placement was spot on

out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Bravo perishes trying to play a good shot. Archer banged it in short at 132kph and Bravo went through with his pull shot despite not being in a good position to play it. The top-edge balloons up and settles into the safe hands of long-on. He went too hard and in the process lost his shape. batsman c D Kulkarni b bowler 27(16) [4s-3 6s-1]
SIX, terrific shot! It was a slower delivery, batsman deals with him like he'd treat a club bowler. Waltzes down the ground, gets to the pitch of the ball and bludgeons it over long-on for a flat six

SIX, slower ball bouncer, sits up nicely for the right-hander and batsman deposits it into the stands. The ball doesn't rise as much as bowler would have liked it to. batsman stands tall and pulls it fiercely over deep square leg. team have crossed 160
SIX, this is exactly what the Chennai crowd wanted. A fuller than a good length ball outside off, batsman hoists it over long-off. Set his base and then bludgeoned

out Caught by Buttler!! 0.0.0.0.0 and batsman - injured forearm and all - can't stay patient any longer. Archer stays quick on a back of a length, but it sticks on the surface as it kicks up, making a real mess of batsman's attempted upper-steer to third man. All he gets is a thick feather on the outside edge, straight to the keeper. batsman c Buttler b bowler 1(8)

no run, batsman reviews, and then stands in disbelief that it has to come down to this. It's a leg-line, and Buttler was probably appealing for the strangle down leg only to avoid this from being given a wide. But the umpire - Nandan - is fooled. It's clearly off the thigh pad, and the bat's not even close. Overturn
FOUR, goes swinging. batsman isn't foxed by the short length, presses forward to it instead and pulls it away hard, over mid-wicket. Chennai have their move on ..

SIX, 28 off the over! It was another off-pace ball from a short of length, batsman waits and flat-bats it over long-on. The fielder in the deep - Tripathi - jumps in an attempt to catch it. It beats him comfortably

SIX, gets hold. And gets it into the empty deep square leg, and then into the empty stands behind that. bowler bangs it in short, batsman - now with more of a measure of this pitch - rocks behind and pulls it yummily, uppishly. Also, there's nobody in those stands to give the ball back as well. So, get the fourth ump working ..

out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Short again. And this time batsman can't resist not poking. He goes back in the crease, goes up tall and tries half a cut, half a punch, and a full flirt after getting tied up with the zip in. Ends up with a thick outside splice, flying straight to the fine short third man placed perfectly out there. batsman c Jofra Archer b bowler 13(13) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, too short, too leg-sided. Jadhav swivels inside it and then doesn't hold back on his pull, uppishly, into fine leg

FOUR, another bumper, another pull. Jadhav's not in control, but it doesn't matter, it's the powerplay after all. Drags it from outside off in front of square, and nothing the chase or the dive from the guy chasing it from square leg can do to stop
FOUR, 131.3kph. Kulkarni will have to do with a moral victory. It's the bouncer, which makes batsman wait on his committed pull position, only to then take the top-edge and fly over the keeper

out Caught by Buttler!! A wide innocuos delivery does what all the variations haven't. It's full, way outside off and Jadhav stretches out to drive. Hard. The problem though are his feet, which are stuck in the crease, just not getting close as he ends up getting a fat outside edge. And Chennai are officially on a top-order collapse. batsman c Buttler b bowler 8(3) [4s-2]
FOUR, another drag down, and batsman makes it worse with his camp deep in the crease. And the uses the width outside off to carve it away behind point
FOUR, when it's turning, when it's batsman, this inside-out was only a matter of time. bowler tosses it wide for a drive, but batsman goes over extra cover. Ahh, those hands

out Caught by Jadeja!! Ideal start for the hosts. A corker from Jaddu at backward point. Another outswinger and batsman drives with hard hands. Only gets an outside edge that dips as it approached the backward point fielder. Don't think many would have taken it. But, Jadeja is one of the best fielders in world cricket. He swoops forward and takes a diving catch inches above the ground. batsman asked the fielder and decided to walk off. But, the umpires wanted to be 100% sure and hence went upstairs. Legal ball and a clean catch. A 2-ball duck for the Rajasthan skipper. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, batsman is underway straightaway! Poor ball from Shardul Thakur. Ample width outside off, batsman doesn't over-hit, reaches out and cuts it through point

out Caught&Bowled!! It's a leading edge, and taken! The cross-seamed leg-break, fired in full @90ks, full and outside off, Tripathi tries to get forward and flick it away against the spin, gets a leading edge back to the bowler who throws it right up into the humid skies in glee to see the back of Tripathi. An important partnership broken, and the aggressor, Tripathi, departs. batsman c and b bowler 39(24) [4s-5 6s-1]

out Caught by (sub)Shorey! GONE! That's a key wicket! The leg-break, very full, batsman charges down the track, feeling the pteamRessure, and takes it on the full - tries lofting it straight into the sightscreen, but literally plays right into the hands of Shorey at the long-off boundary. bowler is thrilled to bits. He knows how important this wicket is. batsman c (sub)Shorey b bowler 28(30) [4s-2]
SIX, fired in flat from over the wicket, angled in, batsman gets on his knee and throws the kitchen sink at it - flat-bats that over deep mid-wicket for six
SIX, absolutely smoked! A googly on leg and middle, batsman comes down the track and swings it against the turn over cow corner for six

out Caught by Raina! GONE! A very full one outside off, batsman, in a bid to up the ante, throws it all behind that carve over cover, ends up scooping it towards Raina at cover, who picks up yet another catch for himself. team's morale is inversely proportional to the teamR. Six down. batsman c Raina b bowler 9(8) [6s-1]
FOUR, back of a length and wide outside off, batsman throws his hands at the cut, beats backward point to the deep backward point fence for four

SIX, swings through the line of that half-volley and connects! Angles it in towards the leg and middle-stumps, right in the slot, batsman clears the front-leg a little and brings those massive forearms into play - goes right through the line, beautiful head position, and deposits that over the long-on fence for six
SIX, is there a twist? 104.9km/h, a slow length ball outside off, batsman waits for it and clubs that flat over deep extra cover for six!

FOUR, back of a length delivery angling in from round the wicket, batsman gets under it by getting across, shapes up to scoop, gets enough on it to paddle it away past Dhoni towards the fine leg boundary for four
SIX, oh that's a poor ball. A absolute no-no at this stage, bowler takes the pace off, and batsman swings through the line, clubs it over long-on for six
SIX, he's nailed it! Angles it in from round the wicket, batsman gets under it, gets the bottom-hand off, and gets topspin on that flat hook over backward square leg for six!

out Caught by Raina! GONE! Let the DJ's party begin. Off he goes, on his turntable - a yorker length delivery on off, batsman tries getting under his, with the bottom-hand dominating, scoops it, gets his wrists over it, and Raina is waiting at cover - straight to him, and he holds on to yet another low catch today. A pressure catch! A key wicket, this, and this is going to be interesting. Surely, not another late-night/early-morning super-over. batsman c Raina b bowler 46(26) [4s-1 6s-3]

out Caught by Tahir! The Yellow Army explodes! Another one @130.7km/h, on a length and angling into the body, batsman clears his leg and backs away going for a wild heave, gets a massive top-edge towards third man where Tahir gets under the pressure catch - pouches it and sets off on a celebratory run. batsman c Tahir b bowler 0(3)

FOUR, eye-pleasing! Yes there was width on offer, but still had to be put away. On a short of length, batsman stays put in his crease and then the there's the perfect eye-hand combination. Caressed through point with a horizontal blade

out Caught by Raina!! The centurion in the previous game is gone! A 134.1kph fullish ball outside off and batsman threw his bat at it. The bottom hand comes off the handle and hence the miscue. Raina takes a sharp catch bending forward, but batsman stands his ground. The on-field umpires send it upstairs with OUT being the soft decision. An easy one for the TV umpire as Raina had both his palms underneath the ball. batsman c Raina b bowler 8(10) [4s-1]

out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Rajasthan Royals lose their best batter and are in deep trouble. A fuller-than-a-good-length ball on the stumps and batsman wanted to bash it over mid-on. The ball might have held up into the wicket and that robbed the batter's timing. The bat turned at the point of impact and batsman ended up slicing it over mid-off. Bravo takes a couple of steps backwards and snaffles it with ease. batsman c Dwayne Bravo b bowler 6(7) [4s-1]
FOUR, Steven batsman gets off the mark in an emphatic fashion. Shortish ball at 132.6kph that sits up nicely for the Australian. batsman moves back and across to pull it through square leg
FOUR, back-to-back fours. Thakur doles out a full toss. There's the customary shuffle from batsman and then he glances it neatly through square leg
FOUR, 76.9kph, not a great start to your IPL career. A rank full toss and Tripathi's thumped it over mid-on for a boundary

SIX, Tripathi goes downtown and the sightscreen has to take the brunt. A fullish ball at 90.6kph, Tripathi gets low and underneath it to hoist it over the bowler's end. 15 runs off 3 legal balls in this over
no ball, FOUR, another high full toss - above-waist and Tripathi slashed his bat at it. Gets a fat outside edge that beats first slip and runs away to the third man fence
