FOUR, nicely played by batsman, fraction too short and drifting onto batsman's pads, he waits on it and then works it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
FOUR, edged and four, on a good length and in that channel outside off, drew batsman into playing at that - pushed away from his body, the edge runs away through the vacant slip cordon

out Caught by Buttler!! Gopal is on fire. Third wicket and all big ones. batsman's struggles in IPL continue.. team in a spot of bother now. The wrong 'un spinning across the left hander, batsman stays back and has a tentative poke at that, feathers an outside edge and Buttler does the rest behind the wicket. That is 9 wickets in 3 games now for Gopal against team. batsman c Buttler b bowler 1(9)
SIX, just over.. bowler knows how close it was. Short of length and there was no pace on the ball, Parthiv goes for the pull and the top-edge clears a leaping Tripathi near deep backward square
FOUR, offers pace and width, Parthiv will feed on that all day, he cracks the back cut behind point and pace on the ball meant it raced away to the fence beating third man

SIX, exactly what batsman needed to get himself going. He takes full toll of the free-hit. Archer went off-pace but the length allowed batsman to flexes those muscles, he powers it over wide long-on. Lot of height and the much needed distance as well

no ball, 1 run, so many things happening on one ball. Lets first acknowledge Parthiv's fifty. A fine knock on a surface where the rest have struggled. And whatsmore it is his fastest IPL fifty. Now to the rest of the ball: Archer oversteps to deliver the slower ball, dabbed to short third and Parthiv wanted a single, Stoinis sends him back and he makes it just in time as there was a direct hit, the deflection forces Stoinis to go for the run and they steal it in the end quite comfortably

FOUR, top shot! He knows his strengths and hitting areas. Another slower length ball outside off, Parthiv uses the depth of the crease, gets underneath the ball and lofts it over extra cover handsomely

FOUR, much needed boundary for team. Parthiv has been mistiming those pulls/heaves but not this time. He waits for the delivery to arrive and pummels it to wide long-on, couple of bounces and into the fence

out Caught by Rahane!! Gone! But Parthiv has done more than his job. A fine knock from the 'keeper. Slower delivery at 125.4ks and Parthiv does not have the power to clear this big boundaries, he still goes through and makes a decent connection, holes out just in front of the long-on rope. batsman c Rahane b bowler 67(41) [4s-9 6s-1]
FOUR, streaky! Spears a full delivery at 147.6ks and Mo squirts a thick inside edge through his legs, the placement is such that he splits fine leg and deep square leg perfectly
FOUR, thumped! batsman picks the slower delivery, maintains a good base by going deep in the crease and whips it with a lot of bottom hand to wide long-on, one bounce and over the ropes

no run, pacy short ball from bowler and batsman is a bit surprised by that, he is late on the pull/hook and the ball flies over the top-edge. Buttler went up but bowler gestured he didn't hear anything

SIX, another six that is just over.. Archer bowls the slower delivery on short of length, Mo picked the bones out of that, he was expecting this and it was right in his arc, hammers it over a leaping deep mid-wicket fielder

FOUR, past Gowtham's dive. Lands the slower delivery in a fullish range, Mo with a readymade clear of his front leg pumps it straight down the ground, the wet outfield makes the ball skid off the ground
FOUR, cheeky! batsman had made up his mind even before Archer was about to bowl. He crouched low, moved across his stumps and scooped the full toss to the fine leg fence, 17 off the final over
FOUR, nicely played - was in the air for a long time, but batsman got the placement right - took a step down the track on the flick, didn't time it all that well - but found the gap

FOUR, lovely shot, the slower ball from Dhawal, but sprayed it onto Parthiv's pads, whipped away over short fine, couple of bounces and over the ropes - team needed some momentum and 9 came from this over
FOUR, cheeky and four, short and just outside off, Parthiv arches back, opens the face of the bat and then runs it late - past the keeper, one bounce and over the ropes

FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Parthiv - not all that convincing, but he will take the runs on offer - the idea was right, fine leg was inside the ring and he was looking to clear him - late on the shot, off the gloves and past the diving keeper
FOUR, beautifully played, length ball and Parthiv was waiting on it, gets a good stride forward and thumps it over mid-off, couple of bounces and over the ropes

out Bowled!! No need to appeal for this - a corker from Gopal and he has got rid of the team and India captain - A loose shot from batsman, another wrong 'un and he didn't read it, lazily pressed forward on the drive - big gap between bat and pad and the ball found its way through, crashed into the off and middle stump and batsman has to go. Not the most convincing of knocks from the captain - 23 off 25 is plain average at this level. Replays suggested a thin inside edge. batsman b bowler 23(25) [4s-3]
FOUR, cheeky from AB, a pre-meditated lap sweep, bends down low, uses the pace on the ball and laps it past the keeper for a boundary
FOUR, lovely shot, bowler - from round the wicket, slides this one onto Parthiv's hips, he gets inside the line, uses the angle and clips it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
FOUR, streaky and four, fuller length delivery and well wide of off, AB saw the width and threw his hands at that, gets a thick inside edge that races past the off-stump

FOUR, Parthiv is putting on a show here - bowler leaks 16 in his first over, width on offer and Parthiv chopped it behind square on the off-side, to backward point's right and the man in the deep had a lot to do - can't get there despite the slide

out Caught&Bowled!! Gopal got rid of Kohli, he now gets rid of AB - this is simply sublime stuff from the Karnataka leg-spinner - and he's doing all the damage to his home based franchise. Another wrong 'un, think AB read as he went back, stayed a bit low and that meant the ball caught the leading edge on the flick. It was dying down on the bowler who does remarkably well to dive forward and grab it. After the fine start, team have lost their two big guns. batsman c and b bowler 13(9) [4s-2]
FOUR, batsman is off and running. Done with his sighter and stands tall to this length delivery. Gets on top of the bounce and caresses it through the gap at extra cover

1 run, edged and dropped. That's an early chance that goes begging for team and Saini can't do much because it's the skipper Virat Kohli who puts it down. Short of a length and held its line just outside off, batsman chased with no feet and feeds an outside edge that flew very quickly to first slip where Virat was standing a bit wide. The team skipper moved swiftly to his right, got both hands but grasses it. Probably, didn't anticipate it to come so quickly at him
FOUR, batsman rubs salt into team's wounds. Fullish and stops on the pitch a bit, batsman didn't go with full conviction, just checks his loft straight down the ground and it races away to the fence

FOUR, wow! This was brute power. Dismissive stuff from batsman. Saini floats up a half-volley just outside off, batsman with his quicksilver hands lunges across and slaps it with precision through extra cover

FOUR, streaky! Slightly slower - 129.9kph, doesn't bounce much and batsman is early into his pull shot as he fetches from outside off. Gets a fat inside edge that eludes the leg-stump and runs away to the fine leg fence

FOUR, batsman doesn't need sighters against his fellow countryman! Fifty for batsman and he brings it up in style. Tossed up ball, batsman skips down the pitch and batters it straight down the ground. No chance for the long-off fielder
SIX, bowler as expected shortens his length, but in the process has over-corrected. A half-tracker, batsman is quick to jump back and pummel the pull over deep mid-wicket

out Caught by Stoinis!! Second wicket for bowler. Needless from batsman. The asking rate is under control and he wants to go after team's best bowler. Pays the price for doing so. Smart bowling from bowler, though. A slow, tossed up ball outside off, which spun further away from the right-handed batsman. batsman decides to thump it over long-off, miscues and Stoinis takes a calm catch well in front of the boundary ropes. batsman c Stoinis b bowler 59(43) [4s-8 6s-1]

FOUR, 139.8kph, length ball outside off, batsman gets a thick outside edge as he looks to force it through the off-side. He did open his bat-face, but it was clearly off the edge. Goes fine to third man for four more
FOUR, 125.3kph, a harmless short ball that sits up nicely for the right-hander. Tripathi waits for it on the back foot and easily pulls it over mid-wicket for a one-bounce four

1 run, dropped! No, team don't want to bat sensibly. batsman decides to go after this flighted delivery outside off from bowler with an inside-out loft. Doesn't middle and hits it straight to sweeper cover, where Umesh decides to be generous and puts down a dolly! Oh, team!

FOUR, 139.5kph, fuller than a good length ball outside off. The width was on offer for Tripathi to free his arms and the Royals batter takes full toll of it. Presses forward and lifts it handsomely over extra cover. Classy shot!

SIX, heaved away for a maximum. Too predictable. Yet another slower delivery from bowler, it was in the arc outside off. batsman picked it early, moved across towards off and swung his bat hard to smash it over cow corner
FOUR, 142.2kph, full toss on the stumps, Tripathi backs away a long way and carves it behind backward point. Used the bowler's pace to his advantage did Tripathi
1 run, Negi dives forward at mid-wicket, but fails to hold onto it. Short ball and batsman pulls of the top part of the bat, it kept dipping at the fielder, but carried to Negi. Tough chance
1 run, another drop! Short again and Tripathi gets a top-edge on his pull, Moeen runs to his right from deep mid-wicket and slides, fails to snaffle it. Dew factor?

out Caught by U Yadav!! bowler bowls length outside off, batsman clears his front leg and backs himself to clear the fence. Doesn't get the timing right and spoons a simple catch to Umesh at long-on. batsman c U Yadav b bowler 38(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

SIX, Tripathi caps off the match in style. A short ball at 139.1kph, Tripathi picked the length early, got into a good position and pulled it fiercely over deep mid-wicket. Rajasthan Royals win by 7 wickets
FOUR, that's criminal from Umesh. Veers it down leg with fine leg inside the ring, easy-peasy for batsman. Slower ball, goes all awry and batsman with soft hands that beats the keeper

FOUR, consecutive fours for batsman. Umesh corrects his length and pounds it short just outside off, batsman exploits the width and flashes his bat. Hetmyer should've done well at point, fails to stop it and off she goes to the fence in a hurry

FOUR, boom! That's a fierce slap from batsman. Suddenly, it's raining boundaries for team. Very full and overpitches in the process just outside off, batsman conserves some energy by wielding his bat and creams the drive through extra cover

byes, FOUR, nothing is going right for team at the moment. Sloppy from Nath. Full and swerved in a little, batsman failed to connect on the big heave and Nath makes a mess of it behind. Very lazy stuff, was late to bend down and misses it altogether

FOUR, this looked intentional from batsman. Shows off his dexterity. Lenght delivery cutting back in just outside off, batsman uses the pace and opens his bat face at the last moment in running it past short third man, who's dive went in vain

FOUR, woah! This is a very uncharacteristic from batsman. Kohli-esque wristy flick. Very full and around off, batsman shuffles across and twirls his wrists at the nth minute to clip it nonchalantly through mid-wicket. All swag from the team skipper!

FOUR, lofted over extra cover. He's one of the best manipulators on the off-side. But Saini keeps providing him with freebies like these. Pitched fuller and just outside off, batsman shifts his weight forward and handsomely lifts it over the in-field

out Lbw!! bowler strikes. Gets the breakthrough for team which should give them some respite. Googly, spinning in and batsman was trying to make room to cut. Was late to get his bat down and fails to read it. It thuds him on the pad - in-line with the stumps. Total misjudgement from the team skipper, looked plumb straightaway and the umpire was spot on. Would've crashed into the middle stump. batsman knew that he was in trouble and didn't bother it review it. batsman lbw b bowler 22(20) [4s-4]
FOUR, short and put away behind square with disdain. Nothing delivery from bowler, can't drop at this length, especially at his pace. Sits up nicely for batsman, who takes full toll of it

FOUR, expertly done by batsman. bowler went for the slower short ball but batsman was upto the challenge. Jumped high and plays the pull off the front foot over mid-wicket. Generates some power and collects four

out Caught by de Kock!! There's a noise and batsman's gone. His poor form continues and it's a first-baller for the opener. But what a corker from bowler this was. Pounded it short, sprang up like a spitting Cobra after hitting the deck just outside off. batsman was just pushing his bat forward aiming to defend. Scary extra bounce scraps the shoulder of the bat and carries to QDK. bowler is elated and Mumbai have struck early. batsman c de Kock b bowler 0(1)

FOUR, edged and flies over the slips. Doesn't matter how they come but batsman will take it. Fuller length and seaming away just outside off, batsman goes hard on the downtown swing and gets a thick outside edge which balloons over to the third man fence

out Caught by Pollard!! In the air and taken. Straight to Pollard at cover-point, who juggles a bit and holds onto it. Both openers back in the shed for team and it's been a wonderful start for Mumbai. Short and well wide of off, batsman cuts and doesn't keep it down. Hits it airly and finds Pollard, who leaps and it bobbled out of his hands, but he keeps his calm and grabs it on the second attempt. Wankhede explodes.. batsman c Pollard b bowler 5(6) [4s-1]
FOUR, much needed boundary for team! Jadhav didn't get hold of the slog sweep that well here, still got enough and also found the placement well. Speeds away to the deep square leg fence

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! batsman departs! Never got going today and with the required rate soaring, he had to take a risk. Tries but doesn't work. Stepped out in a premeditated manner and Hardik smartly dug it short, at the body, cramping MS completely. The result is a forced pull and it's aerial too. Dolly for Surya at square leg. Massive dent to team's already fading chances in the game. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 12(21)

out Caught by de Kock!! Second in the over for Hardik! What a game he is having! A blitzing cameo earlier in the night and now two strikes with the ball. Pounded this on the hard length with good pace, batsman was backing away for the slash but got done in by the speed. Too late and gets a healthy nick that's pouched by a beaming de Kock. Wheels coming off for team. Not far away from hearing the fat lady sing. batsman c de Kock b bowler 1(2)
leg byes, FOUR, not off the bat but team won't mind. Was angling in on leg stump and Bravo shuffled early for the flick. Off the pads and races away down to the fine leg fence

FOUR, cheeky way to bring up a fine fifty! Shortish with good bounce from bowler, Jadhav just waits and dabs it with an open face. Well wide of de Kock and quite fine to the third man fence. It's been a good knock so far from Jadhav but he has lacked support

FOUR, sensational stroke! It was fed on the pads, yes, but the execution of the stroke was superb from Jadhav. Drop kicks it through backward square leg and a sliding Bumrah from fine leg can't cut it off. Perfect start for team in this over

out Caught by de Kock!! Jadhav's defiance ends. Fought hard but with this kind of a target, he needed support which he never got. Slower ball from bowler and Jadhav went for a wild heave across the line. Only manages a thin feather through to de Kock who is having a good time behind the sticks. batsman c de Kock b bowler 58(54) [4s-8 6s-1]
SIX, smoked! Probably has come a bit too late in the game I reckon. Bravo picked the slower ball this time and swung this merrily into the third tier at long-on. Mammoth blow

out Caught by de Kock!! Stunner from QDK! Brilliance from the South African and that's the end of a forgettable night for Bravo. Made room for the big shot but this was in the blockhole, cramped him as well and he got a faint inside edge. De Kock was initially blinded, as keepers usually are in such a scenario, but reacted sharply with a two-handed diving catch to his left. Excellent work indeed and that's the third of the night for bowler. batsman c de Kock b bowler 8(9) [6s-1]
FOUR, nicely struck! Overpitched and batsman makes room to biff it over extra cover. Clean hit and in the gap as well

out Caught by Bumrah!! Another one bites the dust. The hard length has done the trick many a time on this pitch tonight and here is another example of it. Well-directed pacy bumper and batsman gets into a tangle on the pull after having backed away early. Gets a top edge towards deep backward square leg where Bumrah takes a running catch, having covered decent ground from fine leg. batsman c Bumrah b bowler 7(7) [4s-1]

SIX, in the air for an eternity and it's also cleared the ropes! Not a bad hit from a lower order batsman. Fuller length from Hardik and Thakur lifts it high down the ground. Plenty of elevation and just about has the distance to clear long-off

FOUR, smacked hard! Thakur having some fun here. Another overcooked delivery from Hardik with width on offer, blasted away through extra cover and well wide of long-off. Handy runs for team to reduce the margin of defeat
SIX, typical inside-out shot from batsman. Triggers his back leg, creates some room to this full ball and lifts it beautifully over cover. The timing was supreme and it clears the ropes for a maximum

SIX, flicked away for a six. Horror delivery from bowler, very identical to the previous ball. Slanting it on the legs, Jadhav ain't missing out on these freebies. Walks across and helps it away expertly over short fine leg. Almost smashed it towards the Harrier car

FOUR, this is poor bowling from bowler. He's just not finding his lines right. For the umpteenth time, drifts it down leg. Bread and butter for Jadhav, who picks it away over short fine leg. Behrendorff leaps but it comfortably clears him

FOUR, educated edge and batsman collects a boundary. Shortish just outside off, batsman intentionally opens the bat face at the last minute and guides it through the vacant slip cordon. Cheekily done!

FOUR, consecutive fours for batsman and the "team, team" chants are back. bowler wafts it full and gives some width for batsman to free his arms. Lifted over mid-off, holds his shape nicely and desperate chase from the fielder but in vain

out Caught by Pollard!! Oh my word! There's that customary stunner from Pollard for the season. His batting form may have dipped but not his fielding and catching. This is smart field placement from Rohit and bowler executed it well. Dug it short and offered width, batsman forgets there's a fielder at sweeper cover. Slashed it on the up and Pollard was waiting for it. Though he kind of charged in a bit early, he made sure he kept his calm and stretched his giant right hand to nonchalantly grab it. Dives and thumps his chest towards the team fans in the stands. Blinder from the big man and team in trouble now. batsman c Pollard b bowler 16(15) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, dismissive pull from Jadhav. Skiddy short of length just outside off, Jadhav gets quickly onto the back foot and short-arm jabs it wide of mid-on. Rolled his wrists at the right time to find the gap

FOUR, wow! Helicoptered over mid-on. Brilliant from Jadhav. It was nearly a yorker length from bowler, Jadhav took his front leg out of the way and stayed deep. Lifted it excellently over mid-on. Even the inventor of the helicopter shot, MS Dhoni - who's at the other end - would've enjoyed that

FOUR, four more. He's a smart customer, is the pocket-rocket Jadhav. bowler is under pressure now. Peppered it short outside off, Jadhav cleverly arched his back at the last moment and elevated it over the slip. Third man had no chance and he'll collect a boundary

FOUR, outside edge and beats short third man. Floated up, spins away after pitching and lures Jadhav into a drive, who goes with hard hands and gets an thick outside edge. Zooms away to the third man fence
FOUR, fired down the leg-side, Suryakumar gets down on one knee and sweeps it fine past the man at 45

FOUR, this will ease his nerves a bit. bowler is bowling back of length balls so there was no long-off in place. batsman moves forward, and lofts it over mid-off. The timing again wasn't great but it was good enough to get it over mid-off

FOUR, poor effort from Rayudu in the deep. And that will result in a four. Back-to-back fours for team and Krunal. It was short and was on the body, batsman gets behind it and pulls it with a lot of power to deep square leg. Rayudu there should have easily stopped it but instead he lets it go

no run, in the air and dropped! Mohit Sharma is the culprit. Krunal wanted to clear mid-off, fails to do so and ends up hitting it straight to Mohit at mid-off. It was hit hard and Mohit fails to get his fingers in the right position to grab it

no run, Review time: batsman has been given out lbw. And he has taken the review. I don't reckon there is an inside edge on it. UltraEdge will confirm it. And there is a spike on UltraEdge. Just a tiny bit but that will be enough to save Krunal. Rod Tucker will have to change his decision. It nips back in off the deck, batsman wanted to heave it to the on-side, plays it down the wrong line and it raps him on the pads. It looked plumb to the naked eye but an inside edge saves Krunal
SIX, that's an old-fashioned heave. And it will clear long-on with ease. It was a leggie on the stumps, batsman clears his leg, keeps his shape and dispatches it into the stands
FOUR, nicely done from batsman! He was anticipating a slower one and it indeed was one, batsman backs away, makes room and eases it past short third for a boundary. No need to run for that!
2 runs, yorker on the stumps and batsman drills it down the ground. Jadeja of all people misfields it at long-off and that will allow batsmen to take an extra run

FOUR, time to buy a lottery ticket, Krunal! He has been saved three or four times in this knock so far. It was a slower one wide of off, batsman attempts a slog, it comes off the outside half of the bat and just about clears short third. Jadhav gives a chase but ball will win

FOUR, just above the cover fielder. Can you believe it, he is teasing the fielders to the fullest at the moment. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, batsman gets it just enough bat on it to send it to fence

out Caught by Jadeja!! A scratchy innings from batsman comes to an end. But it was an important innings. It was a slower one on a length, batsman wanted to clobber it to the on-side. He swings it down the wrong line, it clips the outside half of the bat and was in the air for a long time. Jadeja at long-on comes under it and takes it with utmost ease. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 42(32) [4s-5 6s-1]

SIX, that's Surya-special for you! He shuffles towards the off-side, picks up the slower one, goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket. Into the stands!. Fifty for Surya with this big-hit!

FOUR, that has been clobbered down the ground. And it will beat Jadeja at the long-on fence. bowler misses the yorker just a bit but that allows batsman to get under it and power it straight back past the bowler. Jadeja dived full-stretch but his effort went in vain

out Caught by Jadeja!! A brilliant innings from Surya comes to an end. His knock has ensured that Mumbai reach close to the par score on this wicket. He fails to get under the yorker, but still goes through with the hit. Ends up skying it in the air and Jadeja at long-on makes no mistake. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 59(43) [4s-8 6s-1]

SIX, that's an air-strike from batsman. You cannot bowl length to Hardik at this stage, he gets behind it, keeps his shape and absolutely smashes it over deep mid-wicket. It went a long way back into the stands

1 run, steers it wide of backward point and they will take a single. Dhoni fumbles and batsman wanted a double, MS quickly recovered and had he hit at the non striker's end, Pandya would have been in trouble

SIX, batsman power for you! It was on a length and was wide of off, batsman stays in the crease and smashes it over long-on with utter disdain for a maximum. Hardik Pandya at the non striker's end loved it too!

no ball, SIX, just praised his skill of bowling yorkers and guess what, he delivers a full-toss above the waist height. batsman larrups it over deep mid-wicket for a gigantic six. Free-hit coming up! It wasn't above the waist height so that was a harsh call from the umpire

SIX, wow! Just wow! You will very rarely see a better power hit than this. It was a yorker on ths stumps, batsman was deep in the crease and uses his wrists to dispatch it over deep mid-wicket for a massive maximum. Wrist of steel from the younger Pandya!

FOUR, he has powered this one for another four. batsman is playing a gem. It was a fuller length delivery wide of off, batsman reaches for it and pumps it wide of cover for another boundary. He loved it! Punches the air in delight!
FOUR, inside edge past the sticks. It's always dangerous playing a horizontal shot to an inswinging delivery, batsman wanted to cut, luckily it missed the poles and beat fine leg

out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! He does it again, bowler! Bowls tight, builds pressure and forces the mistake. Such as asset he's turned out to be for Dhoni and Co. This is an inswinging short of length delivery, batsman wanted to smash this to the mid-wicket boundary as the runs weren't coming, the bat turned in his hands as he slogged at this and it went straight to square leg. bowler roars in delight. Mind you, QdK is in great form and it's not easy to keep him calm. batsman c Kedar Jadhav b bowler 4(7) [4s-1]

SIX, 29 off the last over! And Mumbai ends the innings in a sensational fashion. It was a fuller length delivery wide of off, batsman uses his wrists brilliantly again to lift it over deep backward point for another maximum

FOUR, overpitched and Suryakumar just essays a lovely cover drive. Gentle step forward and then the free flow of the bat, he ball bounced over cover-point, that tells you how good the square is. A batsman's paradise it should be

FOUR, team need more of these. The start doesn't justify the surface on offer, yes team bowled tight, but they could have had more runs. This is full and on the stumps, Suryakumar on-drives and beats mid-on

FOUR, in the airrrr and just wide of cover-point. It went just a yard or two away from Raina's outstretched left arm. Short and wide delivery, poor delivery, batsman cuts uppishly and gets away with it

FOUR, now then, this is too much from team! Yes, the ball is swinging away, but you can't have such a big Test-match kind of gap at cover in a T20 game and this isn't the red ball which moves better. Fullish and outside off stump, Suryakumar easily drives and picks up a boundary

FOUR, oh shot! Brilliant hit, the shot of the game thus far and will take some doing to beat this. A simple on-drive it looks like, but it's tough to play an on-drive with a straight bat to the right of mid-on, let the short of length delivery come and timed it sweetly, Rayudu gives chase and loses the race
FOUR, freebie down the leg-side and Suryakumar won't miss out after this kind of a start, a gentle flick shot in the gap at mid-wicket and that's all you need at the Wankhede with a fast outfield

out Caught by Dhoni!! What a start for bowler. Gets a faint edge and Dhoni manages to cling on. Flighted delivery pitching on the off stump and spinning away sharply, batsman tried defending but the feet were stuck in the crease. Dhoni made no mistake and also checked the bails off to be doubly sure about the dismissal as Ro was close with his back foot in the crease. Tough catch because the ball almost shaved the off stump as well. Oh they are checking for the no-ball, Raina blocks the side angle from deep cover, but the other angle shows a very minute portion of the heel to be behind the crease when bowler landed. Third umpire is convinced and it will be OUT. A sluggish start from batsman, he needs to be a lot more positive as an opener. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 13(18) [4s-1]

out Caught by Rayudu!! bowler takes off on his celebratory run. Fullish delivery outside off stump, batsman lofts looking for a six, targetted the long-off region, but Rayudu was stationed perfectly under it. He was very close to the rope, but did exceedingly well to balance himself just inside the boundary. Umps check with the third umpire with the soft signal being OUT, replays confirmed it was a clean catch. batsman c Rayudu b bowler 4(6)
FOUR, out comes the reverse paddle from Krunal, third man was inside the ring, so he did well to get bat on ball and it escaped to the boundary to ease some pressure

FOUR, oh my word! What a shot, definitely not a bad ball at all. The end result of this back foot punch was great, but that's not how you should actually be playing. Worked on that occasion, could have been a drag on another day. Inswinger from Bhuvi, Shaw has this strange ability to play off the back foot to ones that aren't actually short, the ball escapes through the gap at cover

FOUR, it's such a poor idea to remove the slip without seeing through at least one over, Bhuvi does this time and again, now one escapes through the vacant cordon, a wide slip would have had him. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Shaw looks to punch off the back foot, gets a thick edge that runs away to the third man fence

no run, close call! But umpire Anantha Padmanabhan is a happy man. The slider which skids on and pings Tewatia on the front pad before deflecting onto the back, he played for the turn when there wasn't any. Ball-tracking showed it to be clipping leg-stump

FOUR, lovely shot! Tewatia can bat. And he can to do it at a brisk rate. Delhi would want him to get them the momentum. On a length around off, Tewatia stays leg-side and uses the space he created to drive on the rise past mid-off

out Caught by Nabi!! Gone! The promotion does not work out for Delhi. Another knuckle and this time there is no bounce to save Tewatia, he is completely fooled by it and just leaves his bat hanging in front, the ball pops towards cover and Nabi completes the dolly. batsman c Nabi b bowler 5(7) [4s-1]

FOUR, much needed for Delhi. The crowd find their voice with this boundary. Sandeep bangs it in short and at his pace on this surface it sat up, Iyer thumps the pull over mid-wicket and the ball raced away to the fence
1 run, Ingram had given up. Iyer taps it in front of point and sets off, Ingram had to respond and he just hoped Pandey missed, he did and the southpaw survives. It was not far though

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Pandey has his man this time. Missed the direct hit but makes up with a terrific catch. Delhi slip further as the experienced batsman departs. He sees the shortish length and the width outside off, cracks the cut towards backward point and the ball was dying in front of the Pandey, who dived across and caught it centimeters from the ground. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 5(8)
FOUR, almost similar to the Ingram delivery. Slow but on the shorter side outside off, Morris keeps the cut down and hits it behind point, got enough power to beat third man in the deep

no run, that did not look close. Not sure what made Rashid go for the review. The leg-break and Morris misses the sweep, the ball misses the front pad and strikes the back thigh, impact was always one of the issues and the turn took it past off-stump

FOUR, that is a top shot. Iyer has been so good today. He has waited for the bad delivery and once he has got one, he's ensured to put it away. This was an overpitch and Iyer smacks it straight back over Rashid

out Bowled!! Cleans him up! Body blow to Delhi's chances of posting a fighting total. It's the skipper who's fallen. Iyer looked alright in his stay tonight but won't be there for the final flourish. Not the wisest of shots either, goes for a wild slog sweep against Khan, was the googly and hence, the shot was on. But it needed better execution as well which didn't happen. Sneaks through to ruffle the sticks. batsman b bowler 43(41) [4s-3 6s-1]
SIX, clobbered! Got hold of this alright, big Morris! Slower ball on a shortish length, the South African picked it early and swatted it high over deep square leg. Much-needed one for team

out Caught by Nabi!! Another one falls prey to the slower ball. On such a sluggish surface, it's expected really but even then, team's batsmen have mostly failed to apply themselves. Can't fault Morris though for going big with less than two overs left. Tries to go over cover but it's the slower ball that's well wide outside off, he had to reach it and mistimed it horribly. Spoons a dolly to extra cover. batsman c Nabi b bowler 17(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

2 runs, Sandeep spills a sitter! Inexcusable really. Was a fuller one from bowler and batsman went for the pick up shot. Got more height than distance on it and Sandeep should have gobbled this. Got under it well but probably lost balance a touch. Not only has he dropped it, but also allowed team to get a brace
FOUR, fine shot from batsman! Width on offer and although the length isn't very full, his hands do the rest as he powers this through extra cover. Finds the gap perfectly

out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! That's the end of batsman. Had to try the big shot with this being the final over but Kaul outsmarts him with an off cutter that's quite wide outside off. Was always a risk to go across the line and the result is a miscue that goes up in the air for a while towards short third man. Bhuvi calls for the catch and takes it comfortably. batsman c Bhuvneshwar b bowler 3(4)

SIX, that's some power from batsman! Didn't seem initially like he hit this that well but it went soaring over wide long-on. Slower ball on a good length, it's leg stumpish and the southpaw whips it merrily

out Bowled!! Finally, bowler Kumar has a wicket against his name this season, in his fourth game. Well disguised slower delivery, not the knuckle ball, the traditional off-cutter, Shaw didn't read this and played an ugly swipe across the line, only to see the off pole cartwheeling. Will be interesting to see if Bhuvi refrains from bowling the knuckle ball. People have been picking them easily of late off his hand! batsman b bowler 11(11) [4s-2]

SIX, cracking blow from batsman! Perfect finish for team. Picked the slower ball early this time, was actually getting predictable from Kaul and it's deposited straight down the ground. Clean hit and it goes crashing into the sightscreen

SIX, excellent shot, because he played that almost with a straight bat, full and down the leg-side, the front foot opened up meant he had that area open for a free swing of the bat, timed it sweetly to clear wide long-on
FOUR, this time backward square leg is back for bowler, but batsman sweeps this very fine from him and also takes out the man at 45, nicely placed

out Caught by Sandeep Sharma!! This is astute planning from bowler. batsman plays the sweep to the spinners. He knows this is a spinning surface, so pushed backward square leg back and kept fine leg in to invite batsman, who fell in the trap top-edging a sweep to short fine leg. The length was full enough to play the shot, but it turned to take the edge. The line was also slightly outside off. batsman c Sandeep Sharma b bowler 12(14) [4s-1]
FOUR, full toss to begin with, Iyer creamed that nicely along the ground to cover, freebie to begin with from bowler

out Caught by Hooda!! Wicket right after the break. How many times have we seen that! And it is a big one. batsman, who scored a hundred against this team last yer at the same venue, holes out in the deep. Flighted outside off, batsman bends forward and does not go through with the loft, just a check-lift and it still ends up near the long-off rope, Hooda used his height well and took it over his head right on the edge of the fence. batsman c Hooda b bowler 5(7)
FOUR, fine shot to start for batsman! Picked the googly and got across on one knee to sweep it hard. Connected well, got it wide of short fine leg and it raced away

no run, dropped! bowler has landed badly it seems. Was a fairly straightforward chance though and he spilled it. batsman used his feet for the lofted hit and ended up stroking it straight back at bowler who reacted quickly, had two bites at the cherry but couldn't cling on. Would have been a massive wicket for team

out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! Pick. Heave. And perfectly picking out the fielder. bowler Sharma - hidden all this while for some strange reason - comes, keeps hitting his trademark back of a length on the tummy. Pandey tries making some room to this and swipes it in quite an agricultural hack. Can't keep it down. Can't get the distance on it either. Bang. Deep square leg. batsman c Prithvi Shaw b bowler 10(13)
FOUR, and here's the overcompensated rubbish to follow up the ripper. Drifting well down leg, very full too .. and swept away firmly behind square
no run, dropped -- Shreyas Iyer of all people -- and it just doesn't get simpler. batsman drives uppishly, hard, finds extra cover, where Iyer reverse cups, and is a little too casual

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The pitch-grip does its bit. And add to it batsman's attempt to go a little too powerfully at this. It was short, innocuous-looking, and then it sticks in the surface, making batsman lose all shape as he commits to his slap -- eventually dragging it tamely to extra cover, where life gives Iyer a second chance, and he doesn't mess it up. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 16(21) [4s-1]

FOUR, when you're six-foot-something, you'd rather use it. Well Pathan does, stretching forward big time, getting to the pitch of the ball outside off and nailing his sweep behind square. Rabada tries sweeping and diving, but no, can't

out Caught by Rabada!! bowler ends with a googly. bowler ends with a wicket. batsman hasn't been reading it well all innings, so does what the manual teaches on such occasions - sweep - and so what if the line is well outside off? batsman commits, gets a big top-edge and Rabada's waiting there at deep mid-wicket. Delhi making Hyderabad pull off a Delhi? batsman c Rabada b bowler 10(11) [4s-1]

FOUR, oh easy. Short, but not short enough. Leg-lined and leg-lined enough. Quick and real quick enough. All batsman needs is a bat, swivelling, pulling and getting enough of a tickle fine past the keeper

FOUR, drags it off the inside half, ahh, no wonder it's a batsman's game. bowler tries a slower cutter on the stumps, which batsman makes room to and tries slicing over the covers -- but ends up with the edge on the inside pulling through an empty cow corner. Just a shot stands in between Hyderabad and a victory

SIX, oh and he isn't wasting around. bowler tries delaying things with a real fierce bumper, you know, quick, climbing up outside off. But batsman backs away bigger, swishes outside off and upper-slices .. and Kotla is tiny, really tiny to stop Hyderabad from topping the table
SIX, G-I-G-A-N-T-I-C! Made a cracking sound off the blade and batsman has sent this into the top tier at long-on. There was plenty of flight and he absolutely clouted this
FOUR, more runs! A wild slog this time from batsman who picked the googly but got it off the inside half of the blade. Still had enough on it to find the deep mid-wicket fence

no run, review wasted! Shockingly poor review! Iyer didn't do the right thing by agreeing to an emotional bowler. This pinned batsman on the pad after missing the sweep. Always seemed to pitch outside leg but the leggie somehow convinced his skipper, despite a rejection from Pant. Result is, pitched outside leg and review gone in the drain. Poor, poor stuff

FOUR, he's carrying on from where he right off in Hyderabad. team are helping him by offering pace too. Morris bangs this short and that's right down batsman's ally. Forehand pull pumped away to the deep mid-wicket fence

FOUR, clears the infield! batsman's intentions very clear, he wants to kill the game in the Powerplay. Not really in the slot but he goes through with the chip shot down the ground. Easily over mid-on and it speeds to the fence
FOUR, he's toying around with the bowling, batsman. Another loose half tracker and he picks it up with a shovel pull over short fine leg. Wrong line and duly punished

leg byes, FOUR, bonus runs! They all count though. Pacy delivery on leg stump, was a freebie in every sense and though batsman couldn't get bat on the flick, it brushes the pad and splits the keeper and short fine leg

byes, FOUR, It goes through everyone. It was a short of length delivery, keeps low, batsman was taken aback by the low bounce. He fails to get any bat to it. It misses the leg-stump by a whisker and the low bounce beats Pant too
FOUR, Jonny is on fire! He dashes down the ground, wasn't to the pitch of the ball still goes through with the shot and times it well enough to smash it down the ground for a boundary

FOUR, kind of a shot Jonny would salivate upon for days! It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, batsman takes a good stride forward and creams it through cover for a boundary. Another 50-run wasy partnership for Jonny and Warner. It's an easy game for them at the moment
FOUR, wow! Jonny, you champion! He can't do nothing wrong at the moment. Waits for the slower one, delays his bat swing and tonks it straight down the ground

FOUR, that's edged and four! All of a sudden, this has become a different match. We are playing on the same wicket, mind you! It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, batsman waits for it to arrive and opens the face of the bat at the very last moment to guide it past third man. No stopping that!

out Lbw!! bowler gets the all-important breakthrough. But is it too late for Delhi? It was a slider on a fuller length, it skids off the deck. batsman was late on the shot, it misses his bat and raps him on the pads. Umpire raised his finger straightaway but optimistic Jonny challenged that decision (I don't know why) and was proved wrong within minutes. He misses his fifty by 2 runs. But has done enough damage at the top to put his team in the driver's seat. batsman lbw b bowler 48(28) [4s-9 6s-1]

out Caught by Chris Morris!! Two quick wickets for Delhi and they are still alive in this match, only just though. The middle-order of team hasn't been tested yet so the next phase can be an interesting one. It was a fuller length delivery attacking the stumps, batsman was getting restless. He goes back and wanted to lift it over mid-off, no timing on it and ends up hitting to Morris at mid-off who takes a good low catch. batsman c Chris Morris b bowler 10(18)

FOUR, gee! He is in some form these days, few months back, he would have hit it straight to cover. But, not now! He clobbers it over cover, bat turns in his hands but that didn't make any difference. It canters to the fence

2 runs, massive top-edge. Massive swirl on the ball and it's gone a mile into the night-sky. Who wants it? Parthiv and Saini back-track but it's taking an eternity to come down. Oopsy. Saini gets to the ball but can't quite hold onto it. So, it will go down as a drop, tough chance but lucky Lynn. It was a shortish and bounced more than Lynn expected as he went for the pull. What's worse is that it dribbles away to the boundary after Saini shelled it
FOUR, adding insult to injury. Poor follow up delivery from bowler, drifting on the pads and Lynn duly puts it away with a fine clip off his pads over short fine leg

FOUR, not a good finish by bowler. Another loosener outside off, too short and wide of off. Lynn throws his bat and drills it hard along the ground through extra cover. Strong bottom-hand power and beats a desperate dive from Klaasen at sweeper cover

FOUR, the plan was right from Saini, almost had batsman in trouble but somehow the batsman manages to help it away towards the fine leg fence. Bouncer following batsman, who was moving to leg and he gets cramped for all room because of the spicy bounce but batsman manages get it away to the boundary

FOUR, miss the yorker, get set to face the penalty. Saini misses it by an inch, ends up as a low full toss and batsman after clearing his front leg, whips it to the left of mid-on. Raced away in a jiffy

out Caught by Negi!! Chinnaswamy breaks the sound barrier because batsman's dismissed. Hang on! They are checking for the no-ball but Saini's foot is fine on this occasion. So, batsman can continue his long walk back to the pavilion. Ushered it short at an awkward height for batsman - tucking him for room, who tamely pulls it without any timing. Loops up to Negi at fine leg who has to cover some ground and also mind the ad cushions. Keeps his calm and snaffles it in front of his face, making sure he doesn't make any contact with the boundary. Outstanding catch and team have lost their first wicket. Good comeback from Saini. batsman c Negi b bowler 10(8) [4s-2]

1 run, Siraj puts down a sitter! Will this be the decisive moment in this game? team will hope not. It's a massive though, it's Lynn. Smart from bowler as he kept this slower ball wider outside off, forced Lynn to reach it and the result was a miscue that flew at a comfortable height to sweeper cover. Siraj had it covered and then let it pop out. VK is livid

SIX, that's in the crowd! Typical powerhit from Rana. He will go after it from the word go. This was the bouncer, leg stumpish and he got inside the line to help it over fine leg. Into the second tier

out Bowled!! Absolute ripper from bowler! bowler had been getting it to turn since ball one and with Lynn not being great against spin, this was on the cards. He was premeditating the charge down the track and bowler smartly held the length back. Kept it straighter too on middle and leg, spun sharply past the outside edge to make a mess of the stumps. The left arm spinner might well be the difference between the two sides. Lynn was looking threatening but has been removed at the right time as far as team are concerned. batsman b bowler 43(31) [4s-4 6s-2]
FOUR, blasted away! Much-needed for team. Gets width on offer and he was hanging back for the slap-cut. Smashed hard and it's wide of sweeper as well

SIX, clubbed over long-on! The home crowd were extremely hopeful that it would carry to the fielder but it's cleared him comfortably. Rare bad ball from bowler who gives one in the slot for Rana who doesn't try to overhit it. Just a clean bat swing to send it over the fence

out Caught by (sub)Klaasen!! bowler has his man! He's deserved a wicket and has got a timely big strike. The ploy of bowling googlies against Rana pays dividends. The left hander charged down and wanted to go with the spin on the off-side but skewed it aerially towards sweeper cover. The sub, Klaasen, clings onto the chance, much to the relief of his mates and the energetic home crowd. batsman c (sub)Klaasen b bowler 37(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

no run, good review in the end by DK. Got flummoxed by the fastish leg break, got pinged on the back pad as well with the turn and fizz doing him in. The umpire was late in raising his finger and batsman chose to go for the review, almost out of hope. He probably was banking on the turn to save him and that's precisely what happens. HawkEye shows to be going over the stumps

FOUR, almost a blinder at mid-off by Kohli! Dived swiftly to his left and had it in his left hand mid-air but couldn't hold on. team have spilled quite a few already tonight and though this isn't an easy one, you'd hope that some stick at least. Was a bludgeoning drive from DK and he couldn't quite keep it down. Nearly paid the price but eventually gets a boundary

SIX, just clears deep mid-wicket! Typical DK stroke. Half volley on leg stump, he holds his shape and doesn't go hard at it. Rather swings with the flow and it has enough to clear Chahal in the deep. The skipper is keeping team afloat

out Caught by Chahal!! Gone this time. Can't clear Chahal on this occasion. Was again in the slot from Saini but batsman didn't get the timing right on the slog. Could only skew it high towards deep mid-wicket where the team leggie is waiting for it. Pouches the catch safely and celebrates wildly. VK is also chuffed, as he usually is when he gets excited. team are slowly going towards the finish line. batsman c Chahal b bowler 19(15) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, six more! Russell has woken up! Slower and wider outside off, Russell sits back and flat-bats it down the ground. Clears the ropes with ease, as is the case when he connects well

no ball, SIX, bowler is out of the attack! Another high full toss, Russell stays put and smokes this over deep mid-wicket. Clean hit and it goes all the way. Timely one for team but they need plenty more. Second beamer by bowler and the umpires rightfully inform VK that the pacer can't bowl anymore

SIX, smokeyyyyyyyyyyy! Another one! In the slot from bowler, tried to keep it wide of the big man's reach but Russell gets there and swings clean through the line. Booming hit into the crowd at long-off. The chase is alive and in fact, team are now in danger
SIX, swings it into the stands! The carnage continues. In the slot for Russell who shovels it over deep mid-wicket. Clobbered deep into the crowd. Pressure on team

SIX, just over the third man fence! Raining sixes now. Short and wide this, third man is up and Russell goes for the upper cut. Got more height on it actually and Chahal from deep backward point fancied a running catch. Not to be

SIX, he's gone nuts, he's gone absolutely nuts here Dre Russ! bowler misses the yorker from round the wicket, it's a low full toss and it's dumped over wide long-on. Flat maximum. It's a storm out here
FOUR, more runs! He can do no wrong! Short ball this time, Russell waits for it and ramps merrily over Parthiv. Races away to the fence in no time

SIX, 29 off the over! Russell has killed the game. team are dead and buried with this onslaught. In the slot from bowler, doesn't miss the yorker by much but that's enough for Russell who blasts it over long-off for another six. Scores level!

FOUR, top-edge and over the keeper. Sometimes extra pace can let you down but Saini shouldn't mind this. Bouncer, rearing off the deck and batsman for the nth time tries the pull and gets a top-edge to his favour
FOUR, larruped over mid-on. Easy-peasy for Lynn. bowler missed the yorker, Lynn gets deep and clears his front leg to whip it firmly over the in-field

FOUR, back-to-back fours for Lynn. He's getting a move on. bowler overcorrects and slips in the slower short ball, Lynn waits and pulls it after twirling his wrists behind square. Big gap and he will earn a boundary

FOUR, textbook-esque inside-out loft from batsman. All class from Robbie. Expensive over for team. Nothing delivery from bowler, pitches it right in the slot and batsman gets forward and just stylishly lifts it over extra cover

SIX, Lynn gets into the act. Oh boy! He's launched this out of the ground. Nicely tossed up, Lynn quickly used his feet and outsmarted the bowler, flaunts his muscle power and dismisses it over long-on. New balls please!
FOUR, woah! All timing from batsman. Very cheeky, saw the width provided, so just waited deep and steered it behind point. This outfield is pretty quick and third man can't cut it off
FOUR, bowler is epitome of waywardness. Slips this one down leg, just help-your-self-with-a-boundary ball. batsman accepts it with glee and walks across to tickle it very fine

no ball, SIX, this is dreadful stuff from bowler. What was he trying to bowl there? Steams in and hurls in a full toss that is just over the waist, Lynn takes full toll. Dispatches it into the deep square leg stands. It's called a no-ball for height

FOUR, stand and deliver from batsman. Half-volley from bowler, begging to be hit and batsman takes his front foot across and slams the drive with brute power past mid-off. Nobody moved and it sped off the bat in a hurry

FOUR, this is ridiculous from bowler. The slower bouncer, well wide of off and third man was inside the ring. Too easy for batsman, just waited and dinked it effortlessly over the fielder at 45. Big over for team, 19 coming off it

out Caught by Southee!! This was on the cards. The pressure was building on and batsman perishes. Excellent from bowler, kept hitting the right length and forced batsman into playing a bad shot. Looped up temptingly just outside off, the batsman was early into the loft and didn't go with full conviction. Ended up checking it and offers a sitter to Southee at long-off. Virat roars in delight. Much-needed wicket for team, just to lift their spirits. batsman c Southee b bowler 33(25) [4s-6]
FOUR, early signs that this deck is a beauty. It was banged in short, came at a comfortable hip-height for Parthiv and he whips it over short fine for a boundary

FOUR, batsman-special! Treat for the crowd. It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, batsman takes a good stride forward and leans into it, he times the drive superbly well. It beats the cover and races to the fence

FOUR, back-to-back fours for batsman. And this crowd is buzzing with excitement. bowler is looking for some swing on offer, he bowls another fuller length delivery, batsman takes a good stride forward and drives it like a boss through cover. No stopping that!
FOUR, gets loop, gets room, gets turn too. And AB decides to help it along .. stepping forward a touch and lofting it inside-out over extra cover
FOUR, 50*35. bowler drags the length back, which means batsman decides to wait. And wait. And wait some more, before fetching a real late cut out of DK's gloves to guide it real fine

2 runs, big miscue. Ugly, like really ugly slog-sweep, gets only a big top-edge on it -- and the skier goes into a no man's mid-off. Ferguson gives it the charge from the deep, and even his dive can't get him under it cleanly
FOUR, dropped short. AB makes it look much, much worse, rocking behind in the crease and then throwing his weight behind a tonked loft, splitting long-off and extra cover in the deep perfectly
FOUR, another backing in, another flat-batted throw, and another hammer over extra cover. Oh he's making it a habit, a very, very lovely-looking habit

SIX, it's THE battle of ego .. and AB's setting it up for Russell to match. Gets a sitter on the body - yes - but picks it perfectly with his pull as he deposits it into the second tier behind square. 88 meters
SIX, 134.4kph. And all of it is bang in the slot. Russell bowls length for some reason, ask him, and AB sinks, gets under and smokes it over long-off .. 16 off the over
FOUR, 105.6kph. Yorker. Leg-lined. batsman's wrists are quicker, with a lot of bottom-hand flicking it away behind square. Kuldeep sweeps from fine leg, dives, and his palm can only parry it over
SIX, 105.1kph. Length now, batsman's into death mode already, committing big-time into a tonk downtown, smashing the free-ticketers at long-on
SIX, another cardinally ball-gone-wrong length. Oh at leasy give AB a challenge - for now he continues rocking behind and muscling them high over long-on
FOUR, 110.9kph, ah, Djoker! The change up finally goes wrong. AB reads the long hop, stands up full height and forehands it inside-out over extra cover. It's his fifty too -- 30th
FOUR, the horrors of a wide full toss. High. Lots of width. AB doesn't overhit, piling on and just slicing it behind point
SIX, rank length. batsman lays in, pulling it away, hard, long, cow corner. Such is this pitch, such is this ground, such is I0$ guy, such is I0$ carnage
FOUR, 130.7kph, just too full. batsman's already deep in his crease, incubating half vollies and then carving them inside-out over long-off
2 runs, tickled it so damn softly into long-on, and they steal a couple well before long-on could come in .. somebody, check their shoes for nitro-boosters

SIX, make it 19. Poor bowler's tried out everything - full tosses, bouncers, length - andhence decides to try out the one thing that remained, a back of a length sitter on the tummy. AB obliges, with a swivel, and a proper hack behind square

out Caught&Bowled!! Ah, the perils of timing them so damn well. But Kuldeep - to his credit - is really brave to toss it up despite the carnage, and is really full as well. batsman doesn't get under, just whipping it down the pitch, hard, flat, and Yadav's stuck out palms come in between. THIS is silence. batsman c and b bowler 84(49) [4s-9 6s-2]
FOUR, big edge. batsman misreads the googly, wafts down the wrong line, but what are outside-edges for? The ball gropes at it, running through the slip cordon

out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Mis-pumped. bowler goes back to keeping them short, which AB actually does well to pick up and try and launch over long-off. But no, there's only SO much even a superhero can do. Gets it off the under half, without a lot of bottom-hand and Gill waits at the boundary, reverse-cupped. batsman c Shubman Gill b bowler 63(32) [4s-5 6s-4]

FOUR, 150.3kph in a low full toss. batsman' measured this field, he knows Krishna can't bowl short with the first ball wide and then sits way, way inside his crease to slash it away through an empty point
SIX, slower cutter, and the levers have been cut loose. batsman rocks behind and swings. No, murders. Many, many rows into mid-wicket
FOUR, gee! batsman is in some form. He goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket with utmost ease for a boundary
FOUR, and gets funky. Shuffles, doesn't mind showing away his stumps as he scoops this one really fine .. 18 off this one, 205 in all, and Bangalore nail the perfect finish!

FOUR, ball has flown off the bat. Wow! What timing! bowler did the mistake of bowling on the pads and batsman generally punishes when someone makes such mistake. He gets in a good position and whips it wide of mid-wicket for another four

FOUR, it's raining boundaries here! It was on a fuller length and wide of off, batsman plunges forward and times the drive incredibly well. The placement was excellent too, it beats backward point and third man. And canters to the fence

FOUR, an on-drive with a straight bat is one of the hardest shots to play in our sport. But how insanely easy batsman made it look. Class, sheer class! He comes on the front foot and drives it past mid-on for another four
FOUR, he wants to match Kohli, It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps. Parthiv brings his bat down early and sweeps it wide of deep backward square leg for a four. Incredible bat-speed!
1 run, 50-partnership comes up! batsman steers it wide of short third for a single

out Lbw!! Gamble to give bowler the ball has worked for DK. Parthiv was trying a little to hard, he was looking to smash everything. But was not able to time most of the shots. This one was a slider on a good length, it skids off the deck. batsman was late on the hoick. It misses his balde and raps him on the pads. Plumb infront! batsman lbw b bowler 25(24) [4s-3]

FOUR, bonus runs for team, exacly what they want. Very rarely, a bowler of Kuldeep's caliber delivers a morsel like this. It was down the leg-side and batsman just helps it to the the fine-leg fence with a flick
FOUR, rank length, quite leg-lined too .. and batsman's quickly under it, sitting on a knee and sweeping it firmly through square leg
SIX, lovely shot! Should be the shot of the match. Carrom ball from Ash, Faf picked it out of the hand, charged out and lofted it with a straight bat right back over the bowler. All the way!

SIX, fifty for Faf. Picked for the first time and he's grabbed the opportunity. Why were they hiding him? Flighted delivery around off, Faf kneels and smokes the slog sweep into the advertising hoardings near deep mid-wicket

out Caught by Miller!! Carrom ball and Faf is gone. Second wicket for the skipper. He spotted Faf clearing that front leg and kept the carrom ball close to him, the South African could not get underneath it and hence the mistime, Miller claims it comfortably near the long-on fence. The crowd erupts at Chepauk and that is because Thala Dhoni has walked out. batsman c Miller b bowler 54(38) [4s-2 6s-4]

out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Two in two for bowler. Third in the game and he's delighted. On a hat-trick as well. Very poor from the experienced batsman. Just had lost Faf and he tries to slog sweep this ball, it is slower through the air and beat batsman for lack of pace, missed and the furniture is left in a mess. Wrong time for team to lose wickets. Two new batsmen at the crease now, advantage team. batsman b bowler 17(20) [4s-1]

FOUR, pace is one thing you can't bowl on this surface. 143.2kph and batsman even advanced to make his own speed, makes just enough room to thump it over extra cover, Miller tried his best but the timing was good enough to beat him
FOUR, and thumped! That was a mini helicopter as he smashed a full ball down the ground past long-off for a four. The ball was full, batsman just gave himself a little room and smashed it
SIX, you can't be slotting in those balls. That was up there, missed the length by a little margin and it was smacked over deep square leg for a sixer. You miss, batsman hits it out of the park

wide, fuller and slipped down leg-side. MS allows the ball to go through to the keeper. Ashwin has reviewed this. Was it a nick down the leg-side? It was wided and Ashwin out of the blue decided to review. Nothing of the UltraEdge and it stays as a wide. That was bizarre
FOUR, and that wasn't timed! Off the inner half of the bat and the ball escapes into the gap between deep square and deep mid for a four. Poor delivery and was put away

FOUR, fuller and channelling away, batsman lifts the ball away over cover and that is a four. One bounce into the fence. These death overs are his territory and bowler is messing up his lengths as well
SIX, length ball? That was a poor one from bowler and has disappeared over long-on. batsman expanded his long handle into the shot and smoked it over long-on
FOUR, not the smartest of bowling from bowler. The deep fine was in and bowler bowls it short. batsman hangs back and pulls it over short fine leg for a four. The Chennai crowd loving every bit of it
FOUR, ah, neat. When there's no pace off the pitch, Faf decides to generate some himself. Lovely step away, step down and goes inside-out over mid-off

FOUR, another bowler outfoxing. Faf continues coming down the pitch, bowler tries pulling his length back, but then Faf is happy to wait on it, present a nice full bat face in slapping it away over point
SIX, 138kph. Now the adventure. He's done coming down the pitch, so shuffles, sits and waits under the good length to scoop it really fine .. 16 off the over
FOUR, juicy. Full, easily down leg, and all batsman has to do is tickle - but he swings, middles his sweep behind square powerfully
SIX, the cross-seaming sit up. bowler stays in the slot, and batsman stays tonking. Holds his pose, doesn't over-hit, and still manages to loft it all the way over long-off
SIX, rank overcook, and Faf doesn't even have to advance out to this one - managing to stay his ground, clear out his front leg and go through the line, swinging, smoking into cow corner
1 run, short, but nothing at all on the ball. batsman has to wait, wait some more, and then when he pulls, drags it away into the leg-side with no timing whatsoever

no run, smashed hard .. and flush into Curran's collar bone. batsman holds nothing back here, forehards a slap down the ground, where Curran tries his desperate best to get his hands in the way, or even save his face. Is hammered into his chest
FOUR, ruins what should've been a really good over. Slips into the pads and batsman plays some sort of a half-flick, half-sweep to nail it in the gap behind square

out Caught by Sam Curran!! batsman has picked out cow corner - the longest part of this ground - and bowler knows this, so ends up bowling a carrom ball forcing him to go across the line and against the spin. But once a Watto commitment stays a Watto commitment, ending up in the slog sweep leading to a big top-edge, which Curran - a cool few yards inside the boundary - runs across to gather. batsman c Sam Curran b bowler 26(24) [4s-3 6s-1]

FOUR, that line was not going to work for long, especially with third man in. Angled outside off and batsman uses that smartly to steer a boundary behind point - splitting backward point and short third

FOUR, prodigious movement for bowler. Pitched up and late shape away for bowler just outside off. batsman goes after it, hard hands and gets a thick outside edge which eludes Bhajji at short third man

out Caught by Dhoni!! It's throwback to 2011 IPL finals. Ravi Ashwin got rid of batsman in a similar fashion and 8 years later, Bhajji repeats it again. Big scalp for team and the crowd are delighted. bowler loads it up with flight, extracts some turn after pitching just outside off and batsman wields his bat ungainly. Slight nick and MSD grabs it and knew it straightaway. Throws it up and batsman is a goner. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 5(7) [4s-1]
FOUR, and the dilscoop! Done really well as he scooped it over the keeper's head for a one bounce four. And batsman has a go at someone after playing the shot
SIX, length delivery and has been driven on the up! What a shot! Has lifted the ball away over long-off for a sixer. This might be the game changing over
1 run, very full and on the stumps, batsman knocks it down to long-off. And he will reach his maiden IPL fifty with it. He is finally coming off age
2 runs, fuller length delivery turning back into batsman, he nudges it to the on-side. And will come back for a brace
1 run, very full and on the stumps, works it to long-on. And he will bring up his fifty too, he is palying the role of anchor to perfection here, needs to carry on for his team

out Caught by Jadeja!! bowler's first wicket in the IPL is a huge one of batsman. This is a match-changing event for sure. batsman was waiting for the seamers to come on. And it was a given that he will go after them. He sets himself to slog this one out of the park. bowler again is smart enough to bowl an off-cutter. He gets the desired help from the deck and batsman's timing was in a mess on the slog. He could only hit it to deep mid-wicket and Jadeja there makes no mistake. He takes it with utmost ease. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 55(47) [4s-3 6s-1]

FOUR, it was in the arc for batsman and he dispatched it for a boundary. bowler after bowling brilliant slower ones decides to bowl a yorker. He fails to get the yorker right, batsman gets under and powers it wide of long-off. It rockets to the fence

no ball, FOUR, it slips out of bowler's hand. And this is not the first time it has happened. It was a full-toss above the waist height and batsman reaches for it and smashes it wide of third man for a boundary. Free-hit coming up!

out Bowled!! That word of advice from MSD after two shockers from bowler has made a massive difference. And he has probably won the match for team. It was a length delivery on the stumps, batsman swings and misses and it smashes the stumps. The leg-stump goes for a toss. batsman b bowler 6(5) [4s-1]

out Caught by du Plessis!! bowler on debut has won the match for team with some excellent death bowling. He has bowled slower ones after slower ones and that has worked for him brilliantly on this deck. bowler = Replica of Bravo. It was on a good length and batsman wanted to clobber it over long-on not enough willow behind it and Faf takes an easy one at long-on. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 67(59) [4s-4 6s-2]

out Caught by du Plessis!! What an over this. Double-wicket maiden. team have been jolted early and it's the in-form batsman who departs. Another tempting tossie, batsman stepped out and doesn't quite time his loft. Skies it up as far as long-on and there was a fielder waiting for this. Faf doesn't make any mistake and batsman shakes his head in disappointment. bowler roars. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 0(2)

FOUR, glorious from batsman. Indipper on a fuller length at the stumps, batsman doesn't try to hit it too hard. Just presents a straight bat face and drives it elegantly past mid-on. His drives are a thing of beauty..
SIX, you can't bowl short at this pace. And batsman is a good puller of the cricket ball. Quickly spotted the length, went back and hammered it powerfully over cow corner

FOUR, follows it up with another loosener down leg, batsman makes him pay again. Tried the in-angler, overcompensates and batsman gets across to tickle it very fine. Good over for team, all the pressure created has been released now off the final two balls

SIX, welcome to the IPL, says Sarfaraz. No respect whatsoever. It was dished out right in the arc just outside off, Sarfaraz freed his arms and opened his bat face at the right moment to clear the in-field. Lost a bit of shape but managed to chip it over point. Superb timing and it just clears the fence for a maximum
FOUR, poor finish to the over. Too short and too wide of off, Sarfaraz goes back and opens his bat face to lace it past point. Sweeper cover tries his best but in vain
FOUR, wonderfully done! Waits on it, and then dabs it away with an open face of the bat. Dhoni did spread his legs in anticipation but it nutmegged him
FOUR, was that a punch or a cut! But was beautifully done as he used the pace of the bowler to send it away. The man at deep cover put in a clumsy dive but couldn't cut it off

no run, angles the ball in, the ball strikes the inside edge and thuds into the pad. The bowler, keeper and almost the entire squad miss the inside edge and take a review. The UltraEdge makes it clear. batsman survives

1 run, and Kaul has dropped it. Lost it in the lights may be or might have been the swirling ball coming down. Eventful first over. batsman danced out, looked to loft, got a big fat outer-edge and the man at deep third dropped it. The fielder did not even get a hand to it
SIX, that's huge! Outta here! On the pads, batsman lifts the ball away and it soars away over deep square leg for a massive sixer

FOUR, and the extra delivery costs them a boundary.. Quick and drifting across the left hander, Kishan plays the late cut even though there's a slip in place, but the pace of Rashid was too quick for Warner to react

out Caught by Bairstow!! Krunal is not resurrecting the innings today like he did against team. Kaul celebrates ala Afridi - with the legs spread and the arms aloft. Mumbai sink further. A sharp short ball and Krunal is rushed on the pull, the top-edge goes straight up and Bairstow accepts the dolly. The front foot is checked again and Kaul is fine, again. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 6(13)

out batsman Run Out!! Excellent awareness from Bairstow. He even fooled Warner at slip, who gestured that it was not out. Kishan pats it towards cover and sets off, Pollard doesn't move and the young man has to turn back, run and puts in the dive as well. By this time, Bairstow had disturbed the stumps with his pad before the throw came but he ensured he uprooted one of the stumps with the ball in his hand. Kishan's dive meant the bat popped up and he was caught short of the crease. If the stumps were not uprooted, Kishan would have survived this. batsman run out (Shankar/Bairstow) 17(21) [4s-2]

SIX, boom! Finally, Pandya swings his bat and connects, connects big. Sees a flighted delivery, just outside off and takes it head-on. Strong muscles and biffs it a long way over the stands at long-on. Wears a cheeky smile on his face

out Caught by Shankar!! The case of Rashid winning the battle, it's not the first time and the arms go wide in celebration. Pandya is stunned but has to go. This could dent team's prospects of posting a par total. Tosses it outside off and forces the batsman to fetch for it. Pandya goes on one-knee and clouts it across the line, airy and Vijay Shankar, manning the deep mid-wicket fence moves across and takes a smart catch. batsman c Shankar b bowler 14(14) [6s-1]
FOUR, oh, this is nicely done by Rahul. He's no mug with the bat. Picks the googly, waits and waits before dabbing it past slip. Has enough legs to reach the fence

1 run, in the air and Rashid grasses it. Instantly puts his hand up and apologises. Another cutter, thrown outside off. batsman flashes his bat and spanks it towards sweeper cover. Rashid runs across, covers good ground in getting towards the ball but unfortunately can't hold onto it as he slides. bowler is not happy

FOUR, well, this is clever batting frm Rahul. He's too good with the dinks. Again picks the length delivery, gets deep in his crease and opens his bat face at the last minute to glide it past Bairtsow

out Caught by Bairstow!! Edged and gone. Slower balls in loop from Kumar, this was much fuller and Rahul swings blindly. Is too early into the shot and ends up nicking it to the keeper. bowler picks up his first wicket and team lose another wicket. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 10(7) [4s-2]

SIX, oh jeez! What power from batsman. For a second, thought he mistimed it as his bottom hand came off the handle but such is the power from the big man that he still manages to deposit this 10 rows back over long-off. It was another canny slower ball from Kaul, batsman didn't pick it and threw everything at it and gets the desired result

SIX, low full toss and batsman clouts it over cow corner. If you miss your length against batsman, he will make you pay. Kaul misses his yorker by an inch or so, batsman connects and launches it into the stands
SIX, takes full toll. Kaul again misses the yorker, offers a juicy full toss outside off and batsman takes it on the full to smoke it over cow corner. 83-metre six, batsman is on song here
FOUR, chipped over extra cover! Fuller and wide of off, batsman with his long levers spanks it over the in-field. It came off the cue-end but comfortably cleared the fielder

SIX, dropped. Nabi palms it over for a maximum at deep square leg. Very sloppy, should've taken by his standards. Whipped across the line and went towards deep square leg, Nabi sprawls across and gets both hands on it, only to tip it over the ropes
SIX, easy pickings. Picked off the pads and heaved away behind square for a sixer. Not the biggest ground and the ball went over the ropes. Little charge down the track and then the club

FOUR, another blemish and it's a boundary. team and batsman will not mind this. Very full from Kumar, batsman clubs it down the ground. Hooda misjudges it and charges in way too early, doesn't get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it through to the boundary

out Caught by Hooda!! Hangs the ball in the air by bowling it slower, batsman fails to control the hack and holes out at deep mid. He inner-halved the stroke and never timed it. The ball was tossed up at 82.9kph and all the power in the shot had to be invested by the batter. That is where he lost his shape trying to hit it hard and the length also was dragged back. Huge wicket for team. batsman c Hooda b bowler 11(14) [6s-1]
FOUR, punched down the ground! Hits it on top of the bounce with the full face of the bat and beats mid-off with elan

out Lbw!! He plays such unorthodox shots but falls prey tonight. Looked to slog a slower delivery and missed it completely. The impact looked a little dicey at first but was umpire's call as batsman decided to review. team are on top now. batsman lbw b bowler 7(8) [4s-1]
FOUR, bad ball on to the pads and has been paddled away fine past short fine leg for a four

out Caught by Hooda!! Gone! Mumbai's in-form batsman has been sent back. Front foot no-ball - check. QdK has to continue his walk back. The well-disguised knuckle ball and batsman thought it was in his slot, so he went through with the heave but the slowness didn't allow him to clear the rope, Hooda settles under it at deep mid-wicket. batsman c Hooda b bowler 19(18) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, what timing! It was just a short-arm jab on the dab and the ball races to the fence. Short of length, Kishan rides the bounce and steers it late behind point, Pathan had no chance in the deep

FOUR, crunched through cover. Shows the kind of form he's been in this tournament. Short and fraction width provided, enough for batsman to cash in. Getting on top of the bounce and slapping it in the gap

out Caught by Rohit!! batsman absolutely belted that but hits it straight into the hands of Rohit Sharma at mid-wicket. Sharp reflexes from Rohit though, a meter to the right or left of him would have been a boundary. But this sport is all about few centimeters. And this dismissal was just a vindication of that. It was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, batsman got a lot of willow behind the pull shot but when luck is not going your way you tend to find fielders. And that's exactly what happened there with Pandey. batsman c Rohit b bowler 16(21)

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! team are committing a harakiri here. They are five down now. Ishan Kishan in the deep makes no mistake. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 0(4)
FOUR, goes on the back foot and cuts it well, beats deep backward point for a boundary. Welcome boundary for team!

SIX, 120kph. In the back of a length zone just outside off, but batsman's happy to open up his cards early - which are the same cards he's been trying to deal with all over - backing away and then generating enough power in this lofted tonk of sorts. It looked like he only had the height on first impression, but no, the legs are there, over long-off

out Bowled!! It was a troubled stay, and the end is just as troubling.
