But it's too quick. Too full. Under the bat and leaving a mess behind. batsman b bowler 20(24) [4s-1]

out Caught&Bowled!! There's the virtual nail into Hyderabad's coffin. It's quick, it's bouncy and it's into Rashid's shoulder. Poor Rashid, he didn't even get a sighter to deserve this brute. So he backs away, tries to get some bat, somehow in a weird pull of sorts. Ends up with the bat's shoulder, onto his shoulder for Joseph to run under the balloon up. batsman c and b bowler 0(1)

out Caught by Rohit!! Remember what team did to team last year at the Wankhede? Well, this is revengeful payback. JUST AS COLD. bowler bangs it in, continues cramping batsman up for room, for height as he continues swinging desperately -- this time for the bat face to turn in his palms, get a big fat top-edge, as far as mid-off. batsman c Rohit b bowler 11(14) [6s-1]

out Bowled!! WWWWW -- IPL debut you say! It's easier than an EA Sports Cricket '07 debut. He needed Malinga to return home, and he's perhaps even nudged him further into Sri Lanka here. So it was the same old usual stuff, full, on middle and batsman's tried funky scoop does him no good. Only uproots middle. batsman b bowler 2(6)
FOUR, on the legs at full pace. Sharma gets a tickle, and that's all he needed to .. into fine leg

out Caught by de Kock!! Sorry Sohail Tanvir, Joseph's knocked you out -- It's the BEST IPL figures by a bowler. EVER. And it's taken 12 years and a 22-year-old from Antigua to do it. Again, a Ripley's Believe-It-Or-Not fact, he's on debut. Hits the hard heavy back of a length just outside off, which Kaul sticks his bat out in a poke to - and the feather to the keeper will do. batsman c de Kock b bowler 0(1)

FOUR, seems like batsman read the bowler's mind here. Expected the short delivery, went deep in his crease and cleared his front leg to mow it over mid-wicket. Vijay Shankar in the dug-out enjoyed that
FOUR, strokes it on the rise but it beats Rohit's dive at mid-off. Fullish just outside off, batsman hammers it hard and luckily the ball teasingly evades the team skipper

FOUR, batsman latches onto it, on this occasion. Pushed through quicker on middle, batsman took some time in getting his bat down on the heave, gets it off the inner half in the pocket between short fine leg and square leg

out Caught by Bumrah!! No batsman show today. Perks of having a leggie in your team. Leg-spinners might go for a few runs but on most occasions will fetch you a wicket. bowler has just done that and gives team the first breakthrough. The outcome is a top-edge which spoons up to Bumrah at short third man, who takes the sitter. batsman c Bumrah b bowler 16(10) [4s-3]

out Bowled!! Wow! First ball in IPL cricket and bowler gets one of the most successful batsmen in the history of IPL. Stuff of dreams! It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, batsman throws his bat at it in a clumsy fashion perhaps some overconfidence. It clips his inside edge and comes back to disturb his timber. batsman b bowler 15(13) [4s-2]

1 run, Pollard drops a dolly at long-off. Can you believe it, I can't. Let me pinch myself. Yes, Pollard has dropped. It was a miscued loft from batsman, was in the air for a long time. Pollard comes under it but for some reason fails to grab it. Rohit is stunned
FOUR, width available that time, batsman waits for it to spin and steers it wide of backward point for a boundary

1 run, direct hit and Shankar would have been gone. batsman taps it to cover and charges for a single. Surya picks it up cleanly but fails to nail the direct hit at the striker's end. And Shankar survives!

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! The decision to play bowler is proving to be a masterstroke for Mumbai Indians so far. out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! Dream start for team as batsman departs for a duck. Pitches this one up and tempts the batsman to go after it. The crowd is ecstatic as the Kiwi pacer strikes early. batsman c Navdeep Saini b bowler 0(1)

1 run, dropped by Parthiv! That could possibly have been the second wicket of the innings, but bowler has his hands on his head. The keeper has let him down. Iyer went for a drive away from his body as an outside edge flies straight to the keeper. Parthiv dives to his right, gets his glove to it but fails to cling on to the catch. SIX, oh so very defensive. bowler continues firing them wide outside off to cut off batsman's leg-side play - square of the wicket he goes slicing, flat over extra cover

out Lbw!! What happened there? Against the run of play, team have lost batsman. Looks to play the scoop and misses it completely. SIX, well looped up delivery and has been smacked down the ground. Only a shot away now are the Capitals from investing in a win. Poor delivery again from bowler and batsman was in no mood to let that go away

out Caught by Chahal!! The short ball gets big on him and the top-edge has been taken at cover. out Caught by Akshdeep Nath!! SIX, and that has crashed into the demonstration car! Went down on to his knees and slammed the slog sweep flat out of the ground. Cliched but was Lynntastic

1 run, and that might have been an outer edge! Kept low and went between the keeper's legs for a single. Fifty for Lynn. He has set it up for team for a big win. Needed this knock to bolster his confidence as well

out Caught by S Midhun!! Top-edge on the sweep and is taken by the man at deep backward square leg. You live by the sword and you die by it as well. 1 run, Tripathi has dropped a sitter and Kulkarni can't believe it. Got deceived due to the slower delivery as he was early in his chip. The ball was in the air for an eternity and Tripathi, at point, had all the time to get under it. Gets his hands to it and spills it out

out Lbw!! Loud shout for LBW and batsman decides against a review. A little bit of a nibble and batsman was caught right in front. FOUR, lovely, the wrong 'un from bowler, but the length is way too short, allows batsman to go back and whip it behind square on the on-side - no one in the deep and the ball runs away to the ropes
FOUR, nicely played, batsman was so quick in reading bowler's slower ball, prods across and clips it in front of square on the on-side - beats mid-wicket and runs away to the ropes

Straight in and straight out

SIX, team have gone after Siddarth Kaul from his first over and they aren't holding back now either. Was on a length and Mayank had ample room to free his arms outside off, transfers his weight onto the back foot and pumps it high and over the long-off fence
1 run, 5th IPL fifty for Mayank batsman! Gets there with a tickle off his pads through square leg

FOUR, thwacked from the crease. No feet. Just stand and deliver: pumps the length ball to the right of long-off and Manish Pandey does well to flick the ball back while on the move. He, however, took a brief while to regather his momentum and by that time the ball had rolled back to kiss the boundary hoardings. Unlucky!

out Caught by Shankar!! Mayank perishes trying to seal things early. Slower short ball outside off, was dug into the pitch with plenty of effort, and therefore Mayank's ill-timed pull shot couldn't clear the ropes. Straight down the throat of Vijay Shankar at deep mid-wicket ala Manish Pandey's dismissal. batsman c Shankar b bowler 55(43) [4s-3 6s-3]

out Caught by Hooda!! Another greedy dismissal. Knuckle ball bowled a shade outside off stump, batsman doesn't pick the variation and lofts it high into the night sky, Hooda had a week's time before catching that around his throat at long-on. Easy! batsman c Hooda b bowler 1(3)

out Caught by Hooda!! Excellent final over from Sid Kaul. Kept his composure and bowled a slower full ball outside off asking batsman to take a risk from there, Mandy obliges and goes for the smack over long-off. Doesn't quite get the elevation and Hooda claims his third catch of the game. Did well to run a few yards to his left from long-off. batsman c Hooda b bowler 2(3)
FOUR, flat and full on off, batsman hammers it straight and got enough power to beat the diving fielder at long-off. Crowd going bonkers now
SIX, 138.1kph. It's the good length with batsman in the slog mode. He steps away, frees up his hands and lofts the flat-batted tonk over long-on

out Caught by Hooda!! They've played with his ego, and batsman's fallen right into it. A leg-breaking skidder in the slot inviting batsman to go over long-on. He does just that, gets it flat, but with the lofted drive coming off the inside half. And Hooda steals the show, spotting it quickly from a wide long-on and sliding under it in front of the sightscreen. The show's over boys. batsman c Hooda b bowler 16(14) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, quicker slider in the slot, and batsman's already taken his front leg out of the way to drill it uppishly down the ground

FOUR, 138.4kph. Too full, batsman does well going inside-out with his slice over backward point .. but Kaul runs across from third man, gets the slide in as well, but probably ends up slipping with the dew, slipping all over it
SIX, rank sitter. batsman holds his pose, holds his shape and decides to time it out of here - rocking behind and playing it with the straightest of bats as he punches it straight down, flush

FOUR, just doesn't give out any pace to work around with, but batsman has enough of his own. Making some room, and going back in the crease to pile on the drag down as he slaps it damn violently through extra cover

SIX, quickly down a knee and there's no missing about. Slogs. Holding his pose as he goes through with the swing in depositing it long and deep into cow corner. Shankar, fielding at the fence does try but ends up parrying it over

FOUR, wow! That was a superb shot. High elbow in combination with a still head helps the ball to speed past the dive of the man at mid-off. Pitched up delivery and batsman hit it on top of the bounce to thread it through
1 run, stabs the ball out with soft hands into the off-side and gets a single. Fifty of the partnership comes up as well

out Caught by Ashwin!! Big wicket! It is not swing but spin that breaks this dangerous pair. The carrom ball drifts in and batsman wanted to clip it off the pads, he does not keep it down the ground and Ashwin at mid-wicket takes a good low catch. He dived forward and scooped it inches off the ground. batsman c Ashwin b bowler 1(6)

FOUR, finally a boundary for Hyderabad! All about timing, this shot was. A floated and full delivery and the batsman chips it straight to long-on. The fielder in the deep was a touch square, hence he couldn't cut this down

out Caught by Rahul!! bowler strikes! Bowls a carrom ball in the channel outside off, batsman looks to slice it but all he can manage is a feather to it. Sharp catch by Rahul and the gritty partnership has been broken. Probably a blessing in disguise for the batting team as the pair was consuming too many deliveries. batsman c Rahul b bowler 26(27) [4s-2]

FOUR, that's a rare loose delivery by Punjab tonight. bowler darts this one outside off on a shorter length and batsman makes the use of the width on offer. Reaches out for it and slices it past the fielder at point. No fielders in the deep and that shall be the second boundary of the over
FOUR, nicely done by Davey! Premeditates and puts this straighter delivery away to the deep point fence with a well timed reverse sweep

out Nabi Run Out!! That's a fine effort by bowler as he's ran Nabi out. batsman had smashed the short ball back to the bowler and bowler stops it with his right hand. Nabi was backing away and he was miles outside his crease. bowler parries the ball on to the stumps and the Afghan all-rounder is gone. Nabi run out (bowler) 12(7)
FOUR, short ball down the leg side and batsman drags it past the fielder at short fine leg, sends it to the fence and adds four more to his tally

SIX, first six of the innings! It comes in the 16th over. Better late, than never. batsman makes room and thumps the fullish delivery right over the bowler's head. Straight into the sightscreen and that's a maximum

2 runs, another fifty for batsman! Has been a very gritty knock as he hasn't been at his fluent best. Reaches out for this widish delivery as he drives it to deep cover. Takes two runs and gets to the landmark but there are no real celebrations. His job ain't done yet
FOUR, backs away and blasts it past mid-off for a four. That was on a length, batsman backed away, created room and allowed his hands to do the needful
FOUR, backs across, gives away and swords the ball past point for a four. Much needed boundaries these for team. The run rate getting a facelift here. Poor length again from bowler

FOUR, slower length delivery and jhas been upper steered away past the short third fielder for a four. Was preempted and despite that being a slower ball, batsman managed to usher enough pace on to the shot to get it past the fielder. Cheeky Pandey
1 run, the partnership between batsman and Manish Pandey is now 50. Lowish full toss on the pads. The best that batsman can do is whip it away to deep mid for a single

FOUR, and a good ball but a bad result. Squeezed through the third man region for a four. Got bat to ball and almost an educated edge to put it fine past short third for a four. 11 off the over. 31 runs off the 3 last overs

out Caught by (sub)Nair!! The field was set for the short stuff and it has worked. batsman despite waiting on the back foot could not place the pull past the man at deep mid, who hardly moved to cup that. Short ball bereft of room and the pull despite being decently timed wasn't placed in the gap. batsman c (sub)Nair b bowler 19(15) [4s-2]

FOUR, walks across his sticks and tickles the ball away fine. Perfect ball but batsman managed to get enough bat on it to peel the ball away fine. bowler almost went up in an appeal before realizing that it was off the bat
FOUR, brilliant shot! Straight drive down the ground. Back past the bowler and it was a four. Was full and batsman nailed it

FOUR, overpitched and batsman puts it away. bowler overcooks the flighted delivery and offers width as well, batsman bends his back knee and creams the drive through extra cover. He did well to pierce the crowded field
SIX, 1 off the first 3 balls and 14 off the next 3. T20 cricket for you. Low full toss and batsman climbed into it. Smoked it over long-off for a sixer. Much needed finish as they scale 150
1 run, close! Shortens the length and batsman taps it to the left of backward point, Miller has a shy at the striker's end and he misses, Warner might have been in trouble there
FOUR, that might just ease batsman. Full and on the stumps, batsman stays back but leans forward and clips it wide of mid-on, Ashwin's dive is not good enough to stop the ball and it races away
FOUR, proper half volley. That's no hard work for batsman, just cruising through the line and drilling it through deep extra cover
SIX, dragged down short. batsman is quick to pile in, rocking behind, making it look all the more worse and pulling it away, high, long, into cow corner
FOUR, this was probably the first quicker one from bowler, it was on a fuller length. And batsman goes down on his knees and slog-sweeps it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary

2 runs, and action immediately after the break! Krishna at deep cover drops it. Came charging in, got to it but fluffed it. batsman takes two. Was the leggie and the inside out shot scaled more height than distance

out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Goes for the slog sweep, gets a top-edge and Rana at short cover calls for it and takes it. That was unneccesary. May be at the break they decided one of them will go for it but this hasn't worked for team. Is the game still alive? Too tough for team. batsman c Nitish Rana b bowler 21(31) [4s-2]
FOUR, whatta start! Gets a flighted ball outside off and has been lifted over cover for a four. That was unexpected. First ball and he went for it
FOUR, low full toss and slapped over cover for a four. Few bounces and into the fence. Stayed steady and slammed it
FOUR, waits on it and pulls it down past short fine leg for a four. Drops it short and slow, batsman stayed still and waited on it before pulling it past the fielder. Only 6 runs needed now

FOUR, quick legs. And quicker hands. bowler starts short with an off-break spinning into leg-stump, giving batsman ample time to go deep in his crease and punch it away as he splits the two men on the off-side

out Caught by Chawla!! The bonus off a half-tracker. bowler produces another sitting up off-spinner, but that manages to confuse Watto whether to go uppishly or keep it along the floor. Ends up doing a bit of both, dragging it in the end and picking out square leg perfectly. batsman c Chawla b bowler 17(9) [4s-2 6s-1]
SIX, bang in the arc, batsman obliges it out of the park. Does well to stay inside the line and free up his hands to tonk it into his own dug-out at long-off
FOUR, vintage. Typical. Backs away, makes a lot of room and slices it inside-out over cover. Timing, placement don't really get better

out Caught by Chawla!! In the air and taken. Brilliant catch by PC, he charged back from mid-on, kept his eye on the ball and takes a beauty. It was a flighted delivery wide of off, batsman wanted to loft it over long-on, it comes off the bottom half of the willow and goes a long way up in the air. And PC there did exactly what the team wanted him to do in the outfield. batsman c Chawla b bowler 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, batsman makes full use of the free-hit, he picks up the slower one early, gets himself in a good position and tonks it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. This should get him going
FOUR, bowler is guilty of providing width on this one, batsman delays his bat swing and cuts it wide of backward point for a boundary

5 runs, direct hit would have taken out batsman! Rayudu the man at mid-on but he can't get it on target and what's worse, there is nobody backing up. Races away to the extra cover fence. Bonus runs for team. Was worked softly with a straightish bat but it was a risky run and batsman is lucky to survive

out Lbw!! bowler draws first blood! Was getting the ball to shape inwards and Lynn was never going to die wondering irrespective of the surface. Sits back to this nip backer and goes for an agricultural slog, only to miss it altogether. Past the inside edge and raps him on the back leg. Looked quite plumb in real time and I don't think a review would have saved Lynn. Hence, he walks back to the hut. batsman lbw b bowler 0(5)

out Caught by Chahar!! bowler has the last laugh! He is just too good on such surfaces and you can't just slog him away, which is what batsman does to spinners anyway. Used his feet early and made room but bowler cleverly dragged the length back with no pace whatsoever. The result is a miscue that bobbles over the backward point region and Chahar trekked back to take a good tumbling catch. Both the openers sent back to the hut really early. batsman c Chahar b bowler 6(5)

out Stumped!! Oh goodness! Has he got another one? Has MSD pulled off a stumping here? bowler is already celebrating and yes, Gill has started to walk. team in complete disarry now with six down. It was the googly from bowler, such deception that Gill is foxed by the spin. Goes searching for the drive away from his body and doesn't read it at all. It beats his inside edge and overbalances himself by dragging his back leg out of his crease. MSD was quick to spot it and whips the bails off in a flash. No need to go upstairs as well. team all over team like a rash. batsman st Dhoni b bowler 9(12)
SIX, muscled over cow corner. Russell has seen enough, clears his front leg and whacks it with ferocity across the line. It goes sailing over the ropes at deep mid-wicket

no run, oh dear, Bhajji makes a mess of this skier. Stunned faces in the crowd, they can't believe it. Uff! This is a costly miss, can't give a lifeline to someone like Russell. What have you done Bhajji? Phew. Slower and tempted Russell, who clears his front leg and aims a biggie across the line, totally miscue and sends it into the night sky. Bhajji at mid-wicket steadies himself, it was swirling in the air for a long time and he makes a meal of it. So much so that he doesn't even get a hand on it as it lobs behind him. He sort of lost his balance and slipped over
SIX, clubbed over deep mid-wicket. batsman takes on bowler, gets underneath it and slams it powerfully over cow corner

1 run, Jaddu nearly took a blinder at deep mid-wicket. Very hard to call this a drop but Russell continues to ride his luck. Banged in short outside off, Russell stays back and pulls it hard towards deep mid-wicket. Jadeja was a few yards inside the ropes, sees the ball sailing over his head so he backtracks and uses his one hand to keep it on. The momentum was taking him over the ropes, so he couldn't quite cling onto it. But certainly saved some runs for his team. Brilliant from Jaddu
FOUR, short again and Russell pulls it in the gap this time. Backed himself, stayed deep in his crease and puts it in the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket
FOUR, that's crunched past long-off. Loopy low full toss, Russell makes a bit of room and frees his arms to slap it firmly down the ground. Long-off had no chance

no run, lands the leggie on leg-stump, Russell's head was falling away as he was looking to flick. It grips and turns past his blade to knock him on the pad. bowler went up straightaway but umpire Chettithody Shamshuddin was spot on with his call as the ball was spinning too much and eventually missed the off-stump by a few inches

out Stumped!! The wheels are coming off for team. Another one goes and bowler picks up his second wicket. Saw the batsman skip out, so Bhajji smartly slowed it up and pulled his length in addition to getting some spin off the deck. batsman was nowhere near the pitch and flashed his bat in vain after getting beaten by the flight. MSD collects it and breaks the stumps. Easy stumping and team on top. batsman st Dhoni b bowler 8(13) [6s-1]

out batsman Run Out!! Kuldeep has been dismissed off his first ball. Mix-up between both batsmen and Kuldeep was not even in the frame there. Gee! Another one bites the dust. Flighted outside off, Kuldeep pokes it to backward point and Russell wanted a single. Kuldeep was ball-watching and was late to kick-start. The fielder collects the ball and fires a throw to the bowler, who takes the bails off to catch the batsman short of his crease. batsman run out (Rayudu/bowler) 0(1)

out Caught by Harbhajan!! Kolkata are dominos and Harbhajan - if not pushing them out on his own, continues having himself in some form or the other on the scorecard. This time, courtesy a lame flick uppishly off his legs, picking out a funky silly mid-on perfectly. batsman c Harbhajan b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, 110.2kph. Slow, short, spinning in. Russell clears out his front leg, very agriculturally in a murdering heave through mid-wicket

SIX, yup, a smoke. bowler continues keeping it on a good length, and this time Russell connects, slogging, getting a slight top-edge, but those biceps have been good enough to clear most ropes, so what is Jadeja's diving there now at long-on? ..
SIX, never mind those wrists, Russell will forget them for a second. He continues his love affair with cow corner, swatting it hard, flat and several rows back

FOUR, another muscled heave. It couldn't have gone quicker through square leg, where Rayudu tries his best to leap up on the bounce and pull it back into play, but no, such is the momentum on this that even his palm-ricochet has the legs to roll over

out Caught by Rayudu!! Sharp stuff from Rayudu! team are falling apart quite early here. The shot selection is going awry at the moment. This was slightly short but not much bounce as Rana looked to whip this away aerially on the leg-side. Didn't get the required timing as it dipped on short mid-wicket where Rayudu took a really sharp catch. batsman c Rayudu b bowler 0(3)

FOUR, and it'll end with another. Russell - like he has been all season - continues to be the lone hand, getting under another pretty full delivery and still manages to generate a lot of bottom-handed power to drill it straight back, beating long-off as well .. 108 it will be

FOUR, edged but doesn't carry and beats first slip! bowler is getting some bite off the pitch, got this to spin away sharply but batsman did well to play with soft hands. Hence, the edge fell short of Watto and beat him as well to the fence. Bhajji gave chase but in vain
FOUR, uppish but just through the gap! Was a 'hit me' ball from bowler, shortish with width on it but batsman didn't want to keep the cut down. Not a wise thing on this pitch but he got it in the gap
FOUR, fab shot! More authority this time from batsman who sat back to the half-tracker and nailed the pull comfortably over mid-on

out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Outrageous shot from batsman! Was looking in good touch but just when he should have started to kick on, falls to a terrible stroke. Despite a deep mid-wicket in place, he goes for the aerial pull off the shortish length ball that had no pace at all. Gets it off the top half of the blade and it's a rather easy catch for Jadhav stationed there, precisely for this kind of a stroke. It's one-way traffic in Chepauk at the moment. team don't seem to have turned up yet. batsman c Kedar Jadhav b bowler 11(9) [4s-2]
FOUR, good shot! Fraction short and this time batsman sits deep in the crease for the cut. Beats the diving point fielder and it races away

FOUR, oh risky but it's come off for batsman. Preempts, gets down low and paddles it. Nutmegs Dhoni and runs away to the fine leg fence. It skimmed the under-edge but it's DK's pet shot, so he earns a boundary

out Caught by Harbhajan!! Redemption for bowler. Sombre faces among team fans in the stands and bowler unleashes the Baby-in-the-arms celebration for a change. No celebratory run on this occasion. But poor shot this from batsman. Just runs out of patience and goes hard on the whippy flick, hits it airly and finds Bhajji at short mid-wicket, who takes a sharp catch. bowler gave more flight and it kind of dipped which tempted the team captain into playing that false shot. batsman c Harbhajan b bowler 19(21) [4s-3]
SIX, lots of flight on this delivery, batsman clears his frong leg and pumps it straight down the ground for a maximum

SIX, that's been hit off the back foot, straight back down the ground for six. Some shot. And that's his fifty too. Krunal must have thought he'd done enough by sliding it across on back of a length to prevent damage. But batsman just leans across and thumps it
SIX, that's a googly delivered outside off, not a bad idea. But it's too full, right in the slot, which counters Chahar's thinking. batsman reaches out and clobbers it over long-on
1 run, eases this full ball to extra cover, thus bringing up his fifty with a quick single

out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! bowler's got batsman, or maybe the Mumbai heat has. This is the exact kind of delivery that was disappearing earlier in the night when the Jamaican got stuck into bowler. But after a brief delay where he was attended by the physio, batsman - even batsman - fails to find the strength to clear deep midwicket. It's right in the slot for him, but he drags it off the inside half to Krunal Pandya. batsman c Krunal Pandya b bowler 63(36) [4s-3 6s-7]

FOUR, not where he intended but it's a welcome boundary for Kings XI. Just been a bit of a lull after Gayle's dismissal. Length ball angling away outside off, throws his bat at it and carves it off a thick outside edge between short third and backward point

out Caught by de Kock!! Full and wide, batsman has a go, only to get it through off the outside edge. This wasn't in his arc to hit outta the park. Well bowled by bowler who lets out some steam in his celebrations, probably still angry with himself for the previous wide. batsman c de Kock b bowler 7(8) [4s-1]

out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! This has been a superb comeback from bowler, and from Mumbai Indians indeed. He was taken for 17 in his first over, but has come back strongly. Low full toss at the stumps, batsman attempts a cross-batted swing - more like a sweep, and skies it up off a thick top-edge. No problems for Chahar at long leg. batsman c Rahul Chahar b bowler 5(6)
FOUR, quite a start from batsman who effortlessly lofts bowler on the up over extra cover, with no one back at the boundary there
FOUR, two fours out of two. Clears the front leg and scythes this full-wide delivery to the left of sweeper cover

out Caught by de Kock!! Yeah, bowler has the final laugh, as he so often does. Slower ball, probably a response to Curran going for a scoop. And scoop he does, straight up and to the keeper with there being no pace to work with. batsman c de Kock b bowler 8(3) [4s-2]
FOUR, full ball outside off, not quite in the blockhole, and batsman uses that error in length to slice it through past backward point
SIX, good length ball outside off, batsman slaps it over extra cover for six
FOUR, over extra cover again. This time it's close to the bottom of his bat, so doesn't have enough power to clear the ropes. But it does have enough power to clear the infield
SIX, the result of that deliberation is a short ball at the body. It's brisk from Pandya, but batsman's sharper. He's onto the back foot quicker, swinging the pull over fine leg

SIX, and six more. He's tearing into bowler here. 22 off the over already, with two balls left. And Pandya doesn't know how to react. Poor bowling to be honest. Offers length outside off and is slapped back over long-off
SIX, here's six of them. He's deep in the crease to bowler, he's cleared his front leg and he's swung this into the stands behind deep midwicket. bowler missing his length there

2 runs, he's slipped at the non-striker's end while coming back for two, but he manages to pick himself up for the second run. Take a bow, KL batsman, it's been a pleasure. Slower ball wide of off, jams it towards long-off and then pushes hard on the first run. Mandeep is a willing ally at the danger end, and so batsman gets to the ton he deserves

FOUR, kind of a shot batsman would salivate on for days. Wow from batsman! It was on a good length and was wide of off, batsman rocks back and punches it off the backfoot. It beats the cover fielder and races to the fence on this rapid outfield
FOUR, short of length delivery outside off, batsman makes room for himself and spears the cut between short third man and backward point. Smashing finish for the Kings XI

SIX, that is a high-quality shot. Oh hold on, bat turned in his hand at the point of contact. But the velocity of his bat swing helps him in clearing the fence. It was a pacy delivery on the pads and batsman takes out this closed-faced whip shot and clears the fence
SIX, seven balls faced and he has got his eye in now. It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, batsman clears his front leg and clobbers it over long-on for a maximum

SIX, back-to-back sixes for batsman. Are we in for a batsman-storm at the Wankhede! There was hardly any effort behind it. He just waits for the delivery to arrive, it was in his arc around his off-stump and he lifts it over deep mid-wicket for another maximum
FOUR, another off-cutter from bowler and this time, batsman was ready for it. He hangs back and smashes it over the in-field on the off-side for a boundary

SIX, 23 off the over! Wow! Universe boss is on fire! bowler delivers another slower one, he is not learning from his mistake. It was on the stumps, batsman waits for it and unleashes it straight down the ground for another six

FOUR, these two compliment eachother so well. If, Gayle bludgeons the ball, batsman just caresses it. It was a slower one from bowler, batsman picks it up easily, gets in a might fine position and punches it like a boss. It beats cover and races to the fence
1 run, runs it down to third man. 50-run partnership comes up! These two are looking ominous for Mumbai

SIX, he is looking in his elements today. Form is back, it is certainly back! He identifies the length in a canter(sign of a batsman in form), gets a terrific position and pummels it over deep mid-wicket for another maximum

FOUR, another terrific shot, his back leg was flying when he attempted that shot. And white cherry was flying too. Picks up the slower one quickly, delays his bat swing and lifts it over mid-off for another four
FOUR, terrific shot! Flighted delivery on the stumps, batsman whips it with a lot of class and authority. It beats deep mid-wicket and canters to the fence. He is in fabulous touch!

SIX, that is hugeeeeeeeee! Into the second tier! It was a bumper on the face, batsman stays put and smokes it over deep backward square leg. Good bye ball! Sit back and enjoy that! We are in for a batsman-storm today
FOUR, that has been smashed. Wow! What power. It was on a fuller length and was in the arc of batsman, he clears his front leg and pumps it straight down the ground for a boundary. No stopping that!

FOUR, bowler needs a hand on his shoulder. And yes, Bumrah is there. He is your mate, Pandya. This is serious hitting from batsman, it was wide of off and batsman carves it wide of long-on for another four
1 run, very full and wide of off, batsman went for a reverse, ended up missing it. It might have clipped his edge, it deflects off QDK to the leg-side

SIX, ho ho ho! He might have waited 5 years for an IPL debut with team but has taken one ball to make an impact. Short, down leg and has been lifted over fine leg for a sixer. Whatta start for batsman!
FOUR, back of a length delivery and has been helped off the hips again. Tucked past deep fine leg for a four. A strike-rate of 500 for batsman
FOUR, slapped over extra cover! Just the kind of release shot Kishan was looking for. Wide half volley, he reaches out and chips it comfortably over the infield. No protection in the deep

SIX, just over a leaping Miller! If there was one team fielder who could have gotten to this, it was him but not to be. Drag down from bowler and batsman launches it off the back foot down the ground. Raw power and just about manages to get it over long-on. Miller leapt high as much as he could but it kept going over

SIX, launched over deep square leg! Short balls might trouble batsman but not this harmless drag down at generous pace. Climbs onto the pull and smashes it into the crowd. Curran better be on his toes because batsman seems to be lining him up

FOUR, just past the diving mid-wicket fielder! But this was struck beautifully by batsman. Sat deep to this extra fullish delivery and jabbed it with those strong wrists of it. Flew off the bat and sped to the fence in no time

SIX, another flat maximum! batsman has started to find his range and team are clawing their way back into the game through him. In the slot again from Curran and it's been powered down the ground with loads of power. Long-on tried to get across but it was comfortably over the fielder's head

out Ishan Kishan Run Out!! Sharp work from Curran! He lets out a roar too. Surely might have been frustrated at the onslaught in the over and although it's not the wicket team wanted, it's definitely potential danger out of the way. Was a good full ball that cramped up batsman on leg stump. He squeezed it to the left of Curran who was quick to get to the ball and fired a direct hit at the bowler's end. Ishan Kishan was always going to be in trouble if the throw hit and that's what happened. Ishan Kishan run out (bowler) 7(10) [4s-1]

FOUR, not in control but he's found the gap behind square on the leg-side. Short ball that climbed on Pandya who miscued the pull over backward square leg. Split fine leg and deep square leg with precision
FOUR, here we go, Hardik gets off the blocks. Rubbish half tracker from bowler, not much bounce but Hardik crouches low and slaps the pull into the gap at deep mid-wicket fence

SIX, muscled away by batsman! Once again, not off the middle but who cares when he can clear the ropes? Makes room and swings through the line over long-on. More off the toe-end but it goes deep into the stands

SIX, bang into the comm box! There was a cracking sound and it's back into the ground. batsman has gone bonkers here. In the slot this one and he just extends the chip shot down the ground. Beautifully done and comfortably goes over the fence. Wow!

out Caught by Miller!! There's the wicket that team were looking for. Precisely why bowler was brought on, in this over. Not a wicket-taking ball, was actually in the slot but was pacy from bowler and Hardik didn't get hold of it. Never really got going tonight to be honest and the miscue finds a gleeful Miller at long-on. Dolly it is and that's the end of HP. batsman c Miller b bowler 19(13) [4s-2]

out Caught by Miller!! Clever from bowler! Second strike in the over and he's doing exactly what he was asked to do. Removes the Pandyas and now, Pollard is stranded with the tail left. This was a slower ball, comfortably slower than his stock pace and Krunal got early into the loft. Ends up chipping it towards extra cover where it's that man, Miller, again. Another sitter for the South African. batsman c Miller b bowler 1(2)

FOUR, dropped! Henriques at deep square leg got across to his right and put in a dive, got his hand on it too but didn't stick. And worse, it trickled past him to the fence too. Did take a fine catch earlier and nearly had another really good catch to his name. Joseph was clearly rushed on the bumper and he managed only a top edge on the pull. Gets himself a useful boundary in the end

SIX, that's a six to begin with! Can't bowl in the slot to a rampaging batsman, you just can't. Just lifts it down the ground, this is another mishit that clears long-off comfortably. How does he hit these mistimed shots for six? Insane!

SIX, freebie and away she goes into the crowd! 50 on captaincy debut in the IPL for batsman. Promoted himself at a crucial part of the run chase and now seems in command. Has to finish it though. Poor ball from Curran who gives a full toss and it's swung over deep square leg Way into the crowd

FOUR, hammered wide of mid-off! Joseph showing that he can fetch boundaries too. Not the right length from bowler who put this on a length and Joseph just made room to biff it through the infield. Found the gap perfectly

FOUR, that went to the fence like a bullet! Oh, my! Curran missed his length and delivered a slot ball, width on offer as well and batsman won't miss out. Smacks the bones out of this one and it goes on the bounce to the wide long-off fence

SIX, dumped over long-off! This is incredible from batsman. We've seen this so many times over the years but still, it looks better every time he repeats it. Another horror ball from Curran, widish length ball and it's dumped with that clean bat swing

SIX, that's into the second tier! H-U-G-E! Curran is extremely young and he's paying the price for inexperience. Still doesn't justify the lengths he's bowling. Middle and leg, in the slot once more and batsman bulldozes it over long-on. Mammoth hit. Wow!

FOUR, team are almost there! The captain for the night is producing a knock for the ages. Shortish one on leg stump, batsman just swivels across and helps it well wide of short fine leg. Just a hit away now!

no ball, SIX, one-handed shovel over deep mid-wicket! The Wankhede is roaring in delight. Whoa! Fantastic scenes at the moment. bowler loses his composure, gives a full toss and he's overstepped too, so many blunders and it's picked over deep mid-wicket. Just another mishit you know, but that's the big man for you

out Caught by Miller!! Stunned silence at the Wankhede! batsman falls! Gee, what an anti-climax! The big man thought he had hit another six, the match-winning one but nope, he's found Miller at deep mid-wicket. Was a short ball outside off, had to really fetch it but batsman rode his luck on the pull. Could only sky it high and not long enough. What a turnaround! bowler could still be the hero. Wowza! batsman c Miller b bowler 83(31) [4s-3 6s-10]
FOUR, length delivery on the pads and heaved away off the inner half of the bat. The ball dribbled away towards the deep mid fence for a four
FOUR, walks down the track, gets hold of the slower length delivery and pierces the gap between cover and extra cover for a four with a drive on the up. Back-to-back fours

out Bowled!! batsman walks across his sticks and misses the clip to be clean bowled. Quick yorker and batsman was late on it. The leg pole was pegged back. The pressure of 3 dot balls got to batsman and he tried something different. bowler had been bowling the wicket-to-wicket channel and slips in the yorker to out do the batter. Silence prevails at Wankhede. batsman b bowler 15(13) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, starts the over with a short one and has been dispatched away past point for a four. batsman played it late and got it fine enough

no run, what happened there? Miller has spilled this one. Ill-timed jump and he manages to grab a left hand to it and the ball doesn't stick. He leapt up too early and in the end only had to go with a left-hand. batsman gets a life here
FOUR, in the slot and disappears over the bowler's head. The cameras pan on Miller, who has a clueless expression on his face. Poor delivery it was and batsman muscled it down the ground

FOUR, he does this so often! Uses the pace of the bowler and just dabs it fine to send the ball racing away to deep third man for a four. Was wide, and batsman just got enough wood to send the ball away. 12 runs off the over. bowler has gone for 37 already
FOUR, pulled or tucked? Decide for yourself. Was very wristy though as he got hold of the short ball and just gave it direction to get it past short fine leg. That scorched away

1 run, dropped down the leg-side. Second drop of the innings. This might turn out to be costly for team. Short ball, down leg, batsman goes for the pull and gets a glove. The ball flies fine and Rahul got both hands to it diving to his right but spilled it. The two batters steal a single as well. And to make matters worse, a bout of cramps seem to have engulfed Rahul. He seems to be in some agonising pain

out Caught by (sub)Henriques!! Flicked off the pads and taken superbly by the man at deep backward square. That was on the pads and batsman nonchalantly clipped it away without even thinking of keeping it down. The ball kept flying away before being plucked out by the substitute fielder. batsman c (sub)Henriques b bowler 21(15) [4s-4]

out Caught by Miller!! Charges out, slams it down the ground and Miller makes amends for the drop by taking a good catch here. Miller covered some good ground to his left, then put in the slide with his knees dug into the ground and plucked it out of thin air. team making this game their own with a couple of good catches here. batsman c Miller b bowler 24(23) [4s-2]

out Bowled!! That is a peach, an absolute peach. Give Kulkarni the new cherry and more often than not he will deliver. It was on a good length and it shapes away from batsman a bit, he wanted to whip it across the line, ends up playing it down the wrong line. It breaches his defence and clatters the stumps. The horrible season for batsman continues. batsman b bowler 0(4)
FOUR, batsman is away and how! He is fearless and he flaunted that there. It was on a length and was wide of off, batsman backs away, makes room and thumps it wide of cover for a boundary

out batsman Run Out!! Stephen Fleming shakes his head in the dug-out. And this is probably the first time he is showing discontentment in this IPL season. It was on a length and batsman tucks it straight to Archer at short fine, Faf charges for a single and batsman for some reason instead of running was ball-watching ( A criminal thing to do). Archer picks it up cleanly and smashes the stumps at the non striker's end where batsman was short of the crease. team are off to a perfect start. batsman run out (Jofra Archer) 4(4) [4s-1]

SIX, batsman powers this slog-sweep to the left of deep midwicket, sending it crashing into the ad cushions. That's hit them on the full. batsman has come out firing from the onset in contrast to his usual formula
FOUR, nails this overpitched delivery straight back down the ground. This is excellent batting. They've not allowed Rahane to get through a few cheap overs of spin which he would've so dearly loved

no run, huge shout of "no" from batsman, but that came only after he took a couple of steps down which set Rayudu on the charge. Rayudu had made it almost halfway down before having to turn back. Back of a length just outside off, patted to backward point. Rayudu changed direction while running and had the throw hit him, or even with a direct-hit, he was gone
SIX, fetches this leg-break from well outside off and muscles it over long-on. Gopal turns back as if to say he didn't do much wrong there, and he maybe right. But batsman looks on tonight

SIX, advances to a slower ball and slaps it over mid-off, and over the boundary too. He had stepped towards the leg-side, and found himself reaching for the ball that was outside off. But that didn't seem to hamper the timing
SIX, batsman is getting there. He's getting back to being the player he is. Steps out and swats this length ball over long-on
FOUR, sits back deep in the crease to a slower ball, getting in a great position to dispatch it through midwicket. That brings up his fifty, just the boost in confidence he needed
FOUR, short of length at the body, carrying none of the venom that Archer's bouncer did. So batsman just leans back and helps the pull away comfortably wide of fine leg

out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! That's turned out to be a superb catch from Shreyas Gopal. He may have misjudged it initially, came running in, but then has to cut back to the right, almost going zig-zag. Eventually takes it behind his body. It's the slower ball from bowler that brings out the miscue from batsman, and these long square boundaries ensure that it doesn't go over. batsman c Shreyas Gopal b bowler 57(47) [4s-2 6s-3]
2 runs, slower leg-cutter just outside off, batsman steers it through point and charges back for two
FOUR, and the inside edge for four. That's just kept team in it. Full ball angled in on leg, it was in the slot and batsman swings hard, only to send it racing off the inside edge

SIX, this is an unbelievable shot from Ravindra batsman, even going past the one that Russell hit against team. Russell was only about to fall down while reaching for a wide one outside off, but batsman has proper fallen down but has still managed to club it down the ground for six. This is ridiculous

out Bowled!! He probably won't bowl a better yorker than this one. That's just perfect from Ben bowler as he cannons it on middle and has batsman playing over it. Smashes into the base of middle stump. Phew, what drama! batsman b bowler 58(43) [4s-2 6s-3]

SIX, he's hit this miles! slower ball around off, right in the slot for batsman who smokes it down the ground. This has cleared the boundary, and then some, as he clinches it for team. What an insane, insane finish to wrap up the drama of a final over which will be talked about for a while

out Caught by R Tripathi!! Oh dear! Oh dear! What is happening! team have turned ON the HARAKIRI mode! This is rare, very rare. And look at bowler, he is pumped. It was a short of length delivery around hip-height, batsman pulled and he gave the impression that he got decent amount of willow behind it. But square boundaries at SMS are massive and Faf picked up the man in the deep to perfection. Tripathi dives forward and takes a terrific catch. Fielding has been top-notch from the Royals! batsman c R Tripathi b bowler 7(10)

SIX, this is typical batsman, he charges down the ground to gather momentum, transforms the good length delivery into a fuller one. And lofts it straight down the ground, the timing was pretty good and it sails over the fence for a maximum

no run, Steve Smith thinks batsman has got an outside edge to it. And Rahane has showed trust in the Australian, he has gone for a review. batsman has missed it by a country mile. And I have no clue what Smith heard there. It proved to be a horrible decision as there was a huge gap between the bat and the pad. It was a good length delivery wide of off and it beats the outside edge of batsman

out Caught by Stokes!! Wow! What a moment in the match. Stokes you beauty! David de Gea would have been proud of that effort. It was a short of length delivery wide of off, batsman cuts and cuts hard. It was in the air, Stokes flies in the air, times the jump to perfection and pulls off a stunning catch. Catch for the ages! He charges towards third man and punches the air in delight. Such moments can change the match, such moments can turn around the tournament for your team. team are in huge huge trouble now. batsman c Stokes b bowler 1(6)

SIX, this is an air-strike from MS. Even IAF would have been proud of it. He dashes down the ground in a canter, gets to the pitch of the ball and clobbers it into the night-sky. It sails into the crowd!

FOUR, batsman gets off the mark in style! A 132.7kph length ball, batsman walks forward and across, closes his bat-face and clips it through the mid-wicket region. The fielder on the on-side got a hand to it, but the outfield is swift here

SIX, incredible shot! Wasn't a bad ball by any means. A short of length delivery from bowler, batsman stayed in his crease and went downtown. Thumps it over the bowler's head for half a dozen. It was on the stumps and batsman generated all the power from the crease
FOUR, good shot! The team skipper shimmies down the track, gets close to the pitch of this quicker ball and chips it over wide mid-on

FOUR, once again batsman advances down the track, bowler saw that and shortened his length. It was slower as well. But, batsman is well equipped. Despite not getting to the pitch of the ball, he holds his shape and lifts it over extra cover

out Caught by Rayudu!! It's not happening on the night for the Royals. An ugly looking slog for batsman and he becomes RJ's 100th IPL wicket. A nothing shot from one of the premier batsman across every format - this was tossed up around middle, batsman bent down on the slog sweep, didn't get close to the ball and only managed to shovel it into the safe hands of Rayudu at deep mid-wicket. A disappointing shot and the Royals have lost half their side. batsman c Rayudu b bowler 15(22) [4s-1]

no run, was there an edge on that? Yes, but it was too fast - even for someone like MSD - pushed through flatter and quicker of off, stayed a tad low as well - batsman was back on the punch, gets a toe-end that rolls off MSD's pads
FOUR, lovely shot, a juicy full-toss from bowler, Parag comes down the track and clears mid-wicket with the lofted on-drive

FOUR, that was a half-chance, but bowler was way too late to react - dropped short and at the stumps - Parag backed away on the punch, was done in by the wrong 'un and looped it back at the bowler - huit it hard enough to bisect both men in the deep

out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and caught! Shardul can buy a lottery ticket today - this was a cross-seam delivery that was short and wide of off, Parag's eyes lit up as he saw the width, went hard on the cut and only managed a thick audible edge. Straight through to MS and young Parag walks. Six down and the Royals are struggling to set a competitive score. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 16(14) [4s-2]
FOUR, lovely, tossed up just outside off, batsman is quick to bend down, rolls his wrists and then plays the reverse sweep - past short third man and runs away to the ropes

2 runs, a run-out chance and Thakur has missed it - couldn't collect the ball - had he done so, Jofra Archer was a long way short - was called for the second run and he wasn't ready for it. Gave up the ghost - but so did the bowler, who didn't gather an awkward throw - it was worked square past point and batsman always wanted two

out Bowled!! A big heave and batsman has missed it completely - the leg-stump is on the ground and bowler continues to be impressive. The knuckle ball, pitched on off and kept coming back with the angle, batsman backed away on a mighty heave and missed - stumps in a mess and so are the Royals' hopes of getting to 150. batsman b bowler 28(26) [4s-1]
FOUR, lovely, the slower ball and Shreyas picked it, backed away and lifts it over mid-off, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes for a boundary
FOUR, cracking shot, Shreyas is playing a handy cameo here, length ball and he drilled it back over the bowler's head - mid-off was inside the ring and the man at long-on couldn't get across in time

SIX, lovely, Shreyas is making the team captain think - length ball outside off and he lifted it nonchalantly over the head of the fielder at mid-off - the timing is sweet and the ball sailed over the ropes for a maximum
FOUR, cracking shot, this is a poor over from Thakur, banged in short and at the stumps, Archer swivels across and helps it over short fine, one bounce and over the ropes

FOUR, shot! A short of a good length ball at 133.4kph, batsman stays back in his crease and punches it superbly through the gap between cover and cover-point. Once he found the gap, the outfield did the rest

out Lbw!! MS has a chat with the bowler and decides to review .. in the nick of time. batsman shuffled across and missed the flick. A fair delivery. Clearly no bat. The impact is on middle and ball-tracking shows it to be hitting leg! Bruce Oxenford has overturned his original decision. The bowler had a lengthy chat with skipper and a jovial-looking MS Dhoni signalled 'T' only at the last second. Turned out to be the correct move. A fuller-than-a-good-length ball and batsman had walked across a long way to work it square on the leg-side. Three reds on HawkEye! batsman lbw b bowler 14(11) [4s-3]

FOUR, terrific shot to get off the mark! bowler shortens his length, no real pace to threaten the batsman. batsman stands tall and pulls it backward of square leg. The man in the deep dives, but in vain
FOUR, batsman welcomes Thakur with a boundary. Another venom-less shortish ball, batsman pulls it hard behind square on the on-side
FOUR, shot! Thakur bowls length at 140kph, batsman stays in his crease, slightly clears his front leg and batters it between mid-off and extra cover
FOUR, hat-trick of fours! Too straight on this occasion and batsman tickles it to fine leg for another boundary

out Caught by Rayudu!! Shardul Thakur has the last laugh. MS applauds. A horror shot from batsman, though. After hitting three successive boundaries, batsman tries to play another biggie. He hung back and wanted to thump it downtown - this short of length delivery - similar to the shot he played off Chahar. But, this time, Jos lost his shape in the process and the ball ballooned up a long way off the top part of the bat. Rayudu settles under it at the extra cover region and snaffles with both hands. The danger man has thrown his wicket away here. batsman c Rayudu b bowler 23(10) [4s-4 6s-1]

FOUR, makes contact on this occasion and the ball reaches the fence in a jiffy. Similar length - back of a length - normal-paced though. batsman picked the length early and pulled it through the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket

out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! One, two, three and taken in the end. The substitute fielder takes a juggling catch. Rajasthan lose their third wicket. Hint of away-spin, and batsman doesn't get the timing right on his one-legged sweep. It was on the leg-stump line and hence batsman went for that shot. Shorey ran in from deep square leg and almost made a mess of it. It brushed the cap and made contact with his right arm too. In the end, he pouched that. batsman c (sub)Shorey b bowler 6(6) [4s-1]
no run, turns away tantalizingly beating to the outside edge. Replays show that there was an outside edge and MS dropped it
FOUR, shot! bowler bowls it slightly fuller and Tripathi plays the inside-out shot superbly. Faf runs across and slides to his left, but allows it to go past the ropes

out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! Kedar takes a smart catch and Rajasthan lose their fourth wicket. Tripathi tries to play another inside-out drive against this 94.6kph fullish ball. The ball spins away and flies off the outside edge. Kedar Jadhav at backward point, jumps and goes for a one-handed catch. Doesn't succeed in the first attempt, holds his nerves and gobbles it with both the hands in the end. batsman c Kedar Jadhav b bowler 10(12) [4s-1]
SIX, an absolute treat to watch him bat. Especially when he gets his timing right. Goes down on his knee early and carves the length delivery over deep point, that's a flat six for Shaw

SIX, one-handed slap! Wow! Over long-off for a sixer. Tossed up ball and batsman danced out to canon the ball over the deep long-off fielder's head for a big six. The ball has been kissed by the curse of oblivion as well

FOUR, the partnership between batsman and Pant is now 50. Sublime! Pitched up delivery outside off and batsman cracks the drive past cover for a four. The ball sped away past cover in a flash. Stand and deliver from Gabbar
FOUR, pitched up delivery and that has been spanked on the up. The ball rockets off the bat and past the dive of the man at cover for another four
FOUR, thrashed! That was a poor delivery and has been spanked off the back foot. Picked the googly and smashed it past cover for a four

FOUR, takes it from well outside off and sweeps it away squarer. That was off the inner half of the blade and made enough contact to speed away into the gap on the on-side. 49 needed. The game getting easier for team
FOUR, the sound of the bat when it met leather! Wow. Pitched up delivery and smoked past mid-off. Russell put in a pool-like dive but in vain. The pitched up deliveries aren't working
FOUR, chips down the track, converts it into a pitched up delivery and smokes it down the ground for a four. He has been finding gaps at ease tonight. That was the googly from bowler
FOUR, blasted! Full again. The length on the fuller side has disappeared. That was rocketed past cover for a four. 26 off 22

SIX, the partnership between batsman and Dhawan is now 100. Kneels down on one knee and smacks it over long-on for a sixer. Slower delivery and batsman picked the bones out of that dead meat of a delivery

out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! And the move works. batsman has again thrown it away and failed to finish. Not what team wanted. Not what Ponting wanted either and not what he himself wanted ahead of the WC selection. All these little things matter. Fantastic knock but he has thrown it away at the brink of it. 17 still needed. Was loopy ball, batsman charged out, threw his weight behind the shot with one hand off and the ball landed straight into the hands of the man at long-on. batsman c Kuldeep Yadav b bowler 46(31) [4s-4 6s-2]
FOUR, handy runs! Looks to smash it away and the ball runs away off the outer edge for a four. 7 more needed now. He wanted to smack it out of the park but ended up edging it

SIX, and another team batsman has been denied a century here. This time by his partner but the team wins. Was a floaty delivery and was heaved over long-on for a sixer. team were favorites and have been humbled here by a professional team team, who move to number 4 in the points table

SIX, two sixes in the over, just the kind of momentum Delhi were looking for. Shaw was expecting a short ball and bowler gives him what he desired for. The ball skids on, Shaw takes his eyes off the ball and swivels. Gets a fat top-edge that flies over the keeper's head. 14 runs in the over!
SIX, Delhi openers dealing in sixes! Another short ball outside off, batsman slashes hard at it and gets an outside edge. This one flies over the cordon and that's six more for the Capitals

FOUR, both batsmen have a good time out in the middle. They're making the most out of these powerplay overs. batsman puts down on his dancing shoes and slices the short ball over cover-point. No fielder in the deep and that's a boundary

no run, team review! Has batsman nicked it? Or did it come off the jersey? There was a certain sound but don't think it came off the willow. Or is it the trouser? Waiting for the replays. There's a spike on UltraEdge but not sure whether it's the inside edge or off the trousers. A tough call for the third umpire. No conclusive evidence and the onfield decision stays. team have lost their only review. A short delivery that was angled into the batsman, batsman was looking to block it as the ball brushed his trouser and settled into the keeper's gloves

SIX, team bowlers have been too short so far! bowler bowls another short ball outside off, batsman hops a touch and slices it over deep backward point for six more. It's raining sixes at the Eden Gardens, Delhi Capitals off to a flier

out Caught by Karthik!! Terrific catch by a flying DK! Excellent delivery too. Short of a length around off and jags away a tad. Shaw tries to defend it off his back foot, gets squared up somewhat and gets a thick outside edge. The team skipper flies to his right and plucks it out of thin air. Not for the first time have we seen him take such a blinder. Quite an eventful over that. 17 runs and a wicket to cap it off. batsman c Karthik b bowler 14(7) [6s-2]
FOUR, that's an awful misfield by Krishna! Russell ain't a happy man. Was a short delivery that was chopped to short third man where Krishna lets it through him and gifts four to the batting team

FOUR, edged but safe! On a length outside off, slanted away from the batsman, batsman pokes at it and gets a regulation outside edge. Rana was stationed at wide slip throws himself to his right but fails to cling on to the catch

FOUR, gorgeous shot by Shikhar! Gets an overpitched delivery and the southpaw makes sure to make the most out of it. Drills it straight past the fielder at mid-on who was a touch square, four more for batsman

FOUR, 50 up for Delhi and it has come at the rate of knots. bowler serves another overcooked delivery and the Delhi skipper plays an exquisite on-drive. Mid-on is no where close to cut this down, beautiful shot!

FOUR, dispatched with disdain! Short in length around off, batsman stands tall and hacks across the line. Times this one to perfection and sends it to the deep mid-wicket fence. Proper knock-out punch this is proving to be. Things are only going to get worse from here on, especially with the dew setting in

out Caught by Karthik!! Is there anything that Dre Russ can't do on the cricket field? Wasn't that great a delivery but Kolkata will take it. A short ball down the leg side, Iyer tries to play a leg glance but gets a feather as the ball swings away. A much easier catch for DK this time around and Iyer doesn't wait for the umpire's call. Starts walking straight away. Probably the reason why they're ranked first in the Fairplay points table. batsman c Karthik b bowler 6(6) [4s-1]

FOUR, slogged away! batsman gets his first boundary of the night. Goes down on his knee and places the slog to perfection. Finds the pocket at cow-corner and that shall spoil bowler's opening over. Had conceded only six till then, but the boundary takes it into double digits
2 runs, short in length around middle and leg, batsman shimmies down the wicket and tucks it through the leg side. Hadn't got the timing right and that allowed him to easily come back for two
FOUR, 34th fifty for batsman! Gets there in style in. Slower ball outside off, batsman reaches for it and smashes it through the gap at covers. Gets to the milestone and announces his return to form
FOUR, gift of a delivery for the batsman. Short in length on leg and batsman pulls it with nonchalance. Beats the fielder at deep backward square leg and adds four more to his tally

out Bowled!! A first-ball duck on IPL debut for batsman - a perfect start to the game for bowler, this was pitched up and nipped back in sharply - batsman hasn't had an idea about the conditions, went with hard hands on the drive - the ball burst past the inside edge and rattled the off-stump. It goes for a walk and the celebrations start in the team camp. batsman b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, beautifully played, a gentle loosener from Morris, half-volley on Shubman's pads, he gets inside the line, brings his wrists into play and flicks it past square leg
FOUR, lovely, too straight from Morris, he hasn't hit his stride as yet - batsman gets inside the line and clips it neatly through mid-wicket, no need to run for those

SIX, superb shot! Much-needed for team. Probably the first one that bowler floated ever so slightly and Gill was down the pitch in a flash. Lofted through the line and send it soaring down the ground. Clears the ropes with ease

1 run, 2nd IPL fifty for Gill! First innings as an opener and he's grabbed the opportunity. This kid is class apart and it's only a matter of time before he proves that. Good knock so far and will want to bat deep. Reaches the landmark with a slice down to third man

SIX, just clears Dhawan! For a moment, he was certainly excited but it just about cleared him. The miscued pick up shot from Rana and he got plenty of height on it. As it panned out, the distance too by a whisker

out Bowled!! Yorks him! Brilliant riposte from Morris. Nails the yorker with perfection and Rana who was backing away to make room, had to get his bat down in time. Couldn't due to the pace and precision of the delivery. Timber. team are keeping a squeeze on this game with some superb planning in the bowling department. batsman b bowler 11(12) [6s-1]
FOUR, Russell is away. Gets width on offer and he just backs away to hack this through point. Well wide of sweeper who had no chance

SIX, smoked over wide long-on! Gill has to up the ante now, being the set batsman and seems like he has made up his mind. In the slot, slightly oustide off and he fetches it with a clean bat swing. Slog swept merrily over the ropes
FOUR, deft touch and more runs. bowler fires it well down leg and Gill responds with a calm paddle sweep. Gets it past the diving short fine leg fielder and this outfield shows no mercy

FOUR, batting of the highest class! There is a backward point and short third man in place, it's a slower ball and what does Gill do? Calmly open the face of the blade to split the two with pinpoint precision. The lad is putting on a show here

out Caught by Axar!! What an anti-climax for Gill! For someone who batted with so much authority, he's got out to a poor delivery, a scoring delivery. Was fed down the leg-side and he went for an aerial flick. Just had to beat short fine leg to get another boundary but picks out Axar stationed in the ring. Soft dismissal and Gill knows it. Superb innings nevertheless from the young man. batsman c Axar b bowler 65(39) [4s-7 6s-2]
FOUR, wrong line from Paul who gets this shortish length ball on the hips, Russell just gets a tickle down to the fine leg fence

out Caught by Dhawan!! Another soft dismissal. bowler has his second and team are pressing the advantage home here. Pacy full ball on the pads and batsman goes that favorite aerial flick of his. Only that this time, there is a deep square leg in place for such kind of an adventure. Dhawan gobbles it up and gives his signature thigh slap. bowler was brought to break this potentially threatening pair and he does precisely that, although Russell is still there. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 2(3)

FOUR, clever from Russell. Was winding up for the big hit but sensed the slower ball, adjusted and opened the bat face ever so late. Split the diving backward point fielder and it was wide of short third man too
SIX, length ball, boom! Slower ball from bowler but misses his length, right down Russell's street and he clears his front leg to dump this over wide long-on. First maximum for the big man

SIX, high full toss and Russell clobbers this over deep square leg. Meaty hit and it's goes deep into the crowd. Not given a no ball and Russell is livid! Maybe DK should walk out into the field? No such drama this time but to be honest, this is another of the countless umpiring howlers we've had this IPL

SIX, top-edge but it's six! And he's not even looking at the ball while connecting here, yet gets a maximum. How Dre Russ? How? Was rushed by the pacy bumper which was well-directed, wanted to duck but couldn't and the fat top edge sails over fine leg. Whoa!

SIX, he's got a big piece of this one alright! Short ball again, right approach but Russell backs away and blasts the pull over deep square leg. Again not off the middle of the bat but these trivial things don't matter for Russell

out Caught by Rabada!! Massive wicket! Good planning from team for this wicket. Morris went round the wicket and wanted to execute the wide yorker from that angle. Didn't get it fully right and was a low full toss but induced the slice from Russell who didn't get the desired connection. It's flat and towards deep backward point where Rabada accepts it with glee. This wicket will definitely make a difference of 15-20 runs to the eventual total and team know it. batsman c Rabada b bowler 45(21) [4s-3 6s-4]

FOUR, fortune for batsman but he won't mind as long as the runs keep coming. Wanted to heave this away but got deceived by the slower ball and got an inside edge onto the pad. Trickled past leg stump and went very fine down the leg-side to the fence. Handy for team

3 runs, in the air...falls safe! Rabada and Tewatia were after the chance, was ideally the South African's catch but his mate tries with a dive, only to get nowhere near the ball. batsman had got the timing wrong once again on the loft but survives. Excellent running gives team three more

out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! batsman's innings ends. Rightly played second fiddle to Russell earlier although he could have tried at least one big shot. Now, in an attempt to up the ante, doesn't get the placement right on the slog. Timing wasn't great either and holes out to deep mid-wicket. batsman c Rahul Tewatia b bowler 6(7)

FOUR, squeezed away by batsman! He's providing the hosts with some useful runs. Terrific yorker from Paul and it's stabbed with an open bat face. Gets it wide of short third man somehow and away she goes to the fence

1 run, a direct hit might have been interesting - Shubman pushed this one in front of mid-on and called for a quick single - it was always a dicey single - Shreyas was quick on the ball and has a shy - had he hit, Shubman would have been short, despite the dive
FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from bowler, Shubman stands tall and pulls it in front of square on the on-side - beat mid-wicket and raced away across the fast outfield

FOUR, that's a typical batsman shot - made room to a good length delivery and then sliced the drive over backward point - didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to clear the fielders inside the ring

FOUR, lovely, floaty half-volley on the pads and batsman needs no second invitation, gets inside the line and flicks it behind square on the on-side - almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes
FOUR, nice touch from batsman, back of a length and just outside off, batsman waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it fine, good enough to beat third man
FOUR, lovely, tad too short from bowler, Shubman waits on it and then flat-bats it wide of mid-on, no need to run for those
FOUR, beautifully done - he's got a promotion and he's showing his class, leg-stump half-volley from bowler, Shubman gets inside the line and flicks it over square leg, one bounce and over the ropes
SIX, batsman breaks the shackles, back of a length and well outside off, sat up to be smacked and batsman pulled it high and over long-on for a maximum
FOUR, lovely, back of a length and well wide of off, Shubman stands tall and caresses the punch behind point - the timing is sublime and the fielder at third man has no chance

out Caught by Pant!! That's a top catch from Pant and bowler has got his man - followed the slower yorker with a fiery bouncer - short and angling down the leg-side, batsman was looking to help it on its way - all that he managed was a glove. The ball was travelling, but Pant tumbled to his left, leapt high and completed a fine catch. batsman c Pant b bowler 28(30) [4s-4 6s-1]

out Caught by Buttler!! bowler finds the breakthrough. A length ball at 146.3kph, batsman tries to smash across the line by fetching it from outside off. Loses his timing - courtesy the extra pace - and spoons a straightforward catch to Buttler at long-on. batsman isn't happy with himself. He knows that he has gifted his wicket away here on a belter. batsman c Buttler b bowler 47(32) [4s-6 6s-1]
1 run, eighth IPL fifty for batsman - second this season. bowler pulls his length back, batsman has ample time to muscle the pull to deep mid-wicket. Just a raise of the bat from the southpaw

SIX, batsman goes downtown and he's made good contact. Gopal slightly overpitches and the right-hander takes heavy toll of it. Stays leg-side of the ball, stands tall and bludgeons it over long-off for a maximum

out Bowled!! Bowled 'em! 'You miss, I hit' stuff. It was a cutter from Dhawal Kulkarni, not sure if batsman picked that. He backed away to crash it through the off-side. But the ball sneaked under his blade to dislodge the off-bail. batsman b bowler 16(10) [6s-1]
FOUR, spanked! Slow, short and wide - asking to be punished. batsman makes room as he walks down and slaps it through extra cover. Raced away to the fence
FOUR, 114.1kph, slower full ball around off, batsman gets down to swipe across the line, gets a fat top-edge and the ball runs away fine for a one-bounce four into the third man fence
leg byes, 1 run, good yorker, follows batsman who was backing away. Off the right boot towards short fine leg. Direct hit would have gotten Pollard who was lazy as he ambled in

out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! Archer wins the battle straightaway! Massive strike, considering batsman's recent hitting form. He never got going today though, seemed scratchy and even disinterested a bit. Had to launch now with enough batting in the shed and opts for the muscular slog of his. The length isn't there and the result is a miscue that goes miles in the air. Brilliant catch from Gopal who steadied himself nicely at mid-wicket to take it with a tumble. Never easy these catches, especially if they are of a dangerous batsman, the pressure just adds up. batsman c Shreyas Gopal b bowler 6(12)

FOUR, streaky runs but team won't mind it at this stage of the innings. Full toss and should have actually been dispatched for a six but batsman doesn't middle it well enough. Gets a fat inside edge that's well wide of short fine leg and speeds away
SIX, this is a Hardik special! Picked the slower ball early and shuffled across to slug this over deep mid-wicket. Clean bat swing and struck it ever so cleanly
FOUR, clears a flying extra cover fielder! Good hit from the increasingly tired batsman. Made room and read the slower ball well before slapping it over the infield. Smashed it really well

out Caught by Buttler!! Stunner of a catch from Buttler! Wow! Had to cover a lot of ground from long-off, did so and timed the dive to perfection as well. Mind you, he didn't have the reaction time to do it with ease and so had to really rush. But that's the hallmark of a superb fielder, made it look like regulation stuff. Ends a fine knock from batsman who was visibly jaded. Went for the loft but was undone by the slower ball this time. Sliced it down the ground and on some days, might have survived but not today. Not with Buttler manning that area. batsman c Buttler b bowler 81(52) [4s-6 6s-4]

SIX, lovely mini-helicopter from Hardik! It's a shot that he's developed in recent times and not only is it great to watch but also is extremely effective. Archer didn't really miss his yorker by much here, was quite full in length but HP is sitting very deep, waiting for any slipup in length. Then just propels it with that flourish of his to send it deep into the stands
FOUR, Kishan joins the party now. Length ball from bowler, horror stuff at this stage of the innings and it's heaved away over the gap at mid-wicket. Struck really hard

out Caught by Buttler!! Buttler is having a field day with his catching. This is a dolly though. Was a low full toss and Kishan couldn't quite get the desired distance on the loft. Skewed it more off the toe-end and it went flat to long-off where Buttler made no mistake. Hardik Pandya has got back on strike though as the batsmen crossed and that's a positive for team. batsman c Buttler b bowler 5(3) [4s-1]

FOUR, two was the call from Hardik as he hit this but he's got enough power to get this all the way to the fence. Slower short ball, he tried to muscle it with all his might and forced this through the gap at mid-wicket. Bisected the big gap on the leg-side and though the mid-wicket fielder tried to get across, he couldn't

SIX, smoked away! Slower ball but it's in the slot and Hardik has picked it as well. Sits deep to clobber this over long-on. For a moment, Buttler thought he had another catch but in the end, it's well over his head. Brilliant cameo from Hardik
SIX, massive, tossed up on off, batsman gets close to the ball and lifts it with the angle, sent it high and deep into the stands at long-on
FOUR, nicely played, flighted on the leg-stump line, batsman bends down low and then helps it over square leg with a half-lined sweep, couple of bounces and over the ropes

FOUR, this is excellent batting from batsman, tad too full from bowler, can't do so with mid-on inside the ring - batsman gets a good stride forward and lifts it over that man, almost went all the way, one bounce and over the ropes - 18 from the over
FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Dhawal, batsman leans into the drive, played with a closed face and found the gap wide of cover-point for a boundary
FOUR, this is all too easy for batsman, length ball outside off, he backed away, opened up the off-side and cleared cover with the lofted drive, one bounce and over the ropes

FOUR, cracking shot, too much width from Dhawal, can't do so against the quality of batsman - he leans into the drive, plays with an open face and drives it square past cover-point for another boundary

FOUR, edged and four, wry smile on Archer's face, shortened his length and got it to hold its line, batsman was looking to work it to the on-side, closed the bat-face, got a thick leading edge that raced away through the vacant slip cordon
SIX, massive, batsman is in the mood today, short of a length and at the stumps, batsman swivelled across on the pull and sent it miles in the air - high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
SIX, the attempted off-break from bowler, turns out to be a juicy full-toss, batsman leans forward and deposits it high and over long-on for a maximum
SIX, lovely, too full from bowler, batsman gets under it and clobbers it high and over wide long-on for a mamximum
SIX, a biggie! Krishnappa bowler fires a ball right in batsman's slot. The skipper, with a big back-lift, swings his bat hard to deposit it over cow corner
FOUR, bowler bowls it slightly wide of off, but batsman is well equipped to put that away. Bends his back leg, gets underneath the ball and tonks it over the bowler's head
FOUR, a dart at 99.8kph wide of off, batsman throws his bat at it and slashes it through backward point. 15 off the over with two balls to go

FOUR, dropped by Rohit! Sharp chance but he didn't time the leap well, ended up getting a hand and it dribbled away down to the long-off fence.
