Was in the slot as batsman went for the loft down the ground. Didn't get it off the middle and if not for Rohit's lapse in fielding, the team skipper might have been on his way

no run, good review in the end from batsman! Fell across a bit on the flick and missed the indipper to get pinged on the front pad. The umpire didn't waste any time in raising his finger for the LBW but batsman wanted to review it. Height was the only thing that could have bailed him out and even that didn't look likely in real time. However, the nature of the Wankhede surface aids Jinks in the end as HawkEye shows it to be going over the sticks

FOUR, lifted over the infield! One of batsman's go-to shots in the powerplay. Stands tall this time to the good length ball and carves it over cover. More off the cue-end really but he's got enuugh power to clear the field and it trickles away

1 run, fifty for batsman. He holds the key to this run chase for both sides. The longer he stays the better for Rajasthan, but not for Mumbai. Fuller and outside off, batsman is happy to push it down to long-off and take the single
SIX, this was coming with Bumrah's quiet over. batsman shimmies down the wicket, gets close to the flighted delivery and smokes it into the second tier near cow corner
1 run, delivers this by coming in between the umpire, batsman nudges it to mid-wicket
SIX, they have made up for Bumrah's over. batsman comes down the track, takes it on the full and the rest was easy, he uses a clean bat swing to clear long-off
SIX, steps leg-side, gets a full toss and biffs it straight back down the ground. Another six, his sixth of the evening
FOUR, they're taking the game away in a rush. Pitched up outside off, batsman stands where he is, no movement of the feet and crashes it through extra cover

FOUR, no stopping him here. Joseph's given a full toss, he's pitched one full and wide, and now he's gone for a back of a length slower ball outside off. batsman picks it up, waits on it and cuts it through backward point
FOUR, and even a yorker isn't spared. Reaches out for this outside off and squeezes it past the keeper. Third man was in the ring anyway

FOUR, steers another yorker to the third man boundary. Mumbai looking absolutely clueless. Rohit claps for his bowler who's hardly faltered with his execution, but that's hardly much consolation for bowler
SIX, in the slot for batsman who swipes it into the stands over wide long-on. 28 off the over. He's killed this game off just like that

1 run, that sums up the kind of day Mumbai are having. Sliced up in the air off the outside half, falls right between extra cover and sweeper cover. Rohit may have fallen on his face while diving back. He looks to be all right

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! He's skied this up off the outside half and is caught down at long-off. No hundred for Jos batsman, who wasn't playing for it either. Saw the flight and went for it. This is very well bowled from Chahar as he slowed it up and teased him with a leg-break well outside off. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 89(43) [4s-7 6s-7]
FOUR, premeditates a paddle-sweep, then has to reach for it as Krunal bowls this well wide outside off, but somehow gets a top-edge over the keeper's head
FOUR, drifting in on off and middle, batsman bends across and deflects it fine with a paddle-sweep

out Lbw!! batsman steps across the stumps, swipes across the line and misses. Given out leg-before. But is this slanting down leg? That's what he's hoping for while going for the review. But as is the case, the ball's just clipping the side of leg-stump to make it stay with the onfield call. batsman lbw b bowler 31(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! This is poor from Rahul Tripathi. Really unnecessary. Looks to slog-sweep bowler and top-edges it to deep midwicket. From nowhere, Mumbai's celebrations show that they haven't given it up yet. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 1(2)

out Bowled!! There's going to be drama here, make no mistake. This is getting a bit too uncomfortable for the Royals, and when you see shots like this, you understand why. batsman has swiped right across the line of this delivery, missed it completely and lost his stumps. batsman b bowler 1(2)

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Huge appeal from bowler, and batsman walks. Don't think the umpire was raising his finger initially. Anyway, this is unbelievable from the Royals. How they've found themselves in such a position after that Buttler innings is just... Back of a length, gains pace of the pitch and takes a faint outside edge through to Ishan Kishan. Massive blow to lose someone with batsman's experience. Now into the lower-order. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 12(15) [4s-1]

FOUR, flies away off the outside edge through to the third man boundary. Short of length outside off, maybe not the best option from bowler as it gives a slashing Gopal more than a fifty-fifty chance. He just needed to get something on it, which he did

1 run, dropped by Ishan Kishan! Back of a length around off, Gopal is squared up while moving around in the crease, gets a healthy outside edge. Would've been a sharp catch. Kishan dives full stretched to his right but puts it down
FOUR, full on off, Gopal doesn't time it perfectly but manages to drive it through the gap at extra cover. Rajasthan Royals, who almost messed up the chase at the end, have been bailed out by batsman

FOUR, paddlescooped just past short fine leg! Once again, batsman hasn't got it off the middle but still has enough wood to get it past the fielder in the ring. Walked across very early, signaling his intentions to this fuller ball, had to fetch it from outside off but his brisk initial movement allowed him to do that, just
FOUR, not a kind of shot that you would associate with batsman. Gets a length ball and just clears his legs to club this over mid-wicket. An agricultural hoick of sorts and it's come off

SIX, chipped all the way! Superb stroke from batsman. Sat deep in the crease and didn't try to overhit this one. Just hit through the line and stressed on timing more than power. Served him well as it's cleared the ropes at long-off
FOUR, silky stroke from Jinks. Was a bad ball though, full and down leg, he just got across to glance it wide of short fine leg. The outfield here is the batsman's ally once he gets past the infield
FOUR, full and outside off, batsman bends down and spoons it over the infield, there was a man at deep point but he couldn't get there in time to stop the boundary
SIX, up and all the way! He has been good with this shot today - the heave over mid-wicket. Shuffles across and down, gets the right length to send it sailing over the fence
FOUR, now the finesse. Banged in and the ball was climing around off-stump, batsman arches back and ramps it over de Kock, one bounce and over the ropes. Rohit looks worried!

FOUR, welcome, Mr. bowler. This is batsman at his best. Full delivery outside off, he has a good front foot stride, the high elbow and the straight bat - creams the drive textbook style through extra cover. None of the fielders moved

FOUR, boundaries continue to flow.. Even bowler has conceded two in the over. A venomless short delivery that sits up for the Englishman, batsman swivels and pulls it over the square leg umpire. No protection in the deep

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Gone! How many times have we witnessed that? Wicket right after the break. Big one for Mumbai as batsman looked in his elements today. Slowed up and got a bit of purchase as well, batsman goes for the slog sweep, the ball turns away with some bounce, the top-edge balloons towards deep mid-wicket, where SKY takes a sitter. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 37(21) [4s-6 6s-1]
SIX, Chahar errs by landing one in batsman's arc, it was the googly which was right in the slot, batsman goes with the spin and smashes the loft over the long-on fence
SIX, batsman has taken over the baton after Rahane's dismissal. Runs down the wicket, gets close to the delivery and then uses his power to muscle the ball over the cow corner fence
SIX, he just stands there and admires the shot. Darted into the slot, batsman with a cleared front leg helps himself to another maximum, smacks with minimum backlift over long-on

FOUR, worrying signs for Mumbai. They can't afford to leak runs from both ends. batsman holds a good shape and lofts the length delivery inside out over extra cover. A calculated shot as mid-off was inside the ring
FOUR, the angle works against bowler. He slips on the pads and that is easy pickings, batsman got some wood on that, the ball then deflected off the pad to the fine leg fence
FOUR, batsman has had enough of pushing and prodding, makes room to a good length delivery and hoicks - off the thick inside edge and past square leg, runs away to the ropes in a jiffy
FOUR, poor delivery and bowler knows it immediately. Drifts it way down leg and Sarfaraz helps it along the way with a bit of glove, the fast outfield takes care of the rest
SIX, it is not Gayle but Sarfaraz who will have a piece of bowler. The cheeky right hander, goes down to play that over-the-head-scoop, makes decent connect and the ball sails into the stands

out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Gone! bowler learns quickly from his mistake this time. He also gives a send off to Sarfaraz. Dug in short and it was pacy, Sarfaraz swivels to play the pull but only manages a glove to Parthiv, who takes a good catch over his head. batsman c Parthiv Patel b bowler 15(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Lbw!! Mo has deserved this wicket. The promotion to send Curran up the order does not work for team. The offie kept it simple, pushed it through and attacked the stumps, Curran tries a cheeky reverse sweep and is beaten for pace, struck right in front of the stumps and the umpire had no doubt. batsman lbw b bowler 1(3)
FOUR, in an attempt to keep it away from batsman's range, bowler sprays it down leg, the left hander gets enough bat on the glance to take the ball fine and into the fence
SIX, he's sent this to the moon! Oh, my! What a hit! Short of a length, sits up nicely for batsman who clears his front leg and goes booooom! Soaring into the skies at the deep mid-wicket region

FOUR, timely boundary for batsman who has been looking to make a move on for some time now. Shortish and angling into him, was pulled away hard in front of square through the leg-side. ABD in the deep got across but probably timed the slide wrong. Ends up palming it past the ropes

FOUR, full toss and you can't be bowling those at this stage to a well-set batsman. He shovels it over mid-wicket, into the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on. Was more of a chip stroke and gets the boundary

1 run, Kohli spills a dolly! An extremely unusually sight, especially when he is fielding in the deep. batsman mistimed this low full toss and hit it flat towards long-on. Was a regulation take for VK who timed his run forward properly, only to let it through in the end. Poor!
SIX, smashed into the stands! Another full toss and this time, batsman makes no mistake. Wades into the slog and sends it comfortably over the ropes at deep mid-wicket
1 run, short of a length, follows batsman who mistimes the heave towards deep mid-wicket

FOUR, batsman inches closer to another IPL ton. Wide full toss and there aren't many worse deliveries to bowl to a set batsman. Especially with third man in the ring. batsman slices it away, well wide of the fielder in the ring and away she goes to the fence
FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short from Umesh, batsman stands tall, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square on the on-side, no need to run for those
SIX, lovely, length ball outside off, batsman clears his left leg and heaves it back over the bowler's head, went high and sailed over long-on for a maximum

FOUR, he almost did! Ends unbeaten on 99! batsman would have wanted that one run but then, don't think he will be too worried about not getting to the milestone. bowler missed the wide yorker marginally this time and it was sliced away, well wide of short third man and to the fence for a boundary. batsman is only the second batsman to end on 99 not out in the IPL after Raina
FOUR, that has been muscled away, think he didn't get it off the middle of the bat, but almost sent the ball over the ropes - backed away to a length ball and went over the bowler's head
FOUR, that's easy pickings for an in-form batsman, leg-stump half-volley and batsman whips it away behind square on the on-side for a boundary
FOUR, that's some timing from KL, length ball at the stumps, batsman leant forward and played a one-handed on-drive - was in the air for a while but rushed past the diving fielder at mid-on
FOUR, that's some way to welcome bowler to the crease, length ball outside off, batsman backs away and drills it through the line, one bounce and over the ropes at long-off

SIX, you simply can't bowl short to this man - not at bowler's pace, back of a length and from round the wicket, batsman made room and swung - didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to sail over long-on for a maximum
FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short of a length and well outside off, batsman leans across and cuts it in front of square on the off-side, past AB at cover and runs away to the ropes
SIX, hammered, tad too short from bowler, batsman swivels across and muscles the pull - high and over square leg for a maximum, turning out to be a big over
FOUR, make that 24 off the over, length ball on the pads and it's flicked away disdainfully past short fine. team need time to breathe and they call for a strategic break
SIX, lovely, nicely tossed up at the stumps, batsman leans forward and lifts it nonchalantly over long-on for a maximum. Pressure straightaway on bowler

out Stumped!! That's a fine comeback from the leggie. The leg-break and he has got rid of the dangerous KL. Was it the adrenaline that was pumping inside KL? He lost his head and he has lost his wicket now. Came rushing forward, didn't spot the leg-break, beaten in the flight and the drift - swung all over the place and Parthiv has an easy stumping to his name. batsman st Parthiv Patel b bowler 18(15) [4s-2 6s-1]
FOUR, cheeky and four, tossed up well outside off, Mayank bent down low, used the pace on the ball and lapped it fine, fine leg is very square and has no chance

1 run, fifty for batsman. He continues his fine form.. Third of the season and this against his old team. Just a bat raise and on he goes.. Turning into the big man and batsman is happy to nudge it square on the leg-side

SIX, fabulous shot! bowler gets wicket with this delivery but not that of batsman. Floated it outside off and tempted the batsman, batsman keeps a low base, gets low and underneath that to loft it handsomely over extra cover. Goes all the way

out Bowled!! Timbah! What a response. He's pumped. Celebrates the wicket with a fist pump on his knee. batsman is left clueless with this delivery. Drifts in the air and lands near leg and middle-stump, batsman is caught in the crease because of the length, he then tries to maneuver with his hands, but the ball spins across to hit top of off-stump. Dream delivery for any leg-spinner. batsman b bowler 15(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, classy shot from Parthiv! Curran provides a floaty half volley and it's creamed through the gap at cover. Lovely timing and it raced away. team are away in style
FOUR, the signature batsman straight drive! Like Curran, bowler also starts with a half volley. The team skipper leans forward and strokes it past the bowler and beats the diving mid-off fielder

FOUR, batsman is off the blocks in a jiffy. Not that bad a ball, just a superb shot. Was on a length around off, he shuffled across and clipped it away sweetly through mid-wicket. Once again, outstanding timing on the shot. Nothing much you can do as a bowler except applaud the batsman
FOUR, heaved away! The length is wrong from bowler this time, gives one in the slot for Parthiv who is ready to throw his bat at anything that's within his reach. Clubs it through mid-wicket

FOUR, the partnership between batsman and de Villiers is now 50. Slow through the air - 81.6kph, batsman cuts off the back foot and Shami at backward point is too slow to bend down to his right. Doesn't get a hand on it and the ball reaches the fence in a jiffy. bowler isn't happy with that effort

1 run, fifty for batsman! A different bowling action from bowler as he bowls a fullish ball outside off. Drilled to long-on for a single and batsman points at his team's symbol on the shirt before rasing his bat
FOUR, wayward ball. Slips it down leg and batsman clips it square of the man at short fine leg. Easily put away
FOUR, plants his back knee across off stump and swipes this slower ball over short fine leg. Almost went for six, just the one bounce

out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! batsman absolutely smashes this pull shot, but it goes straight to Murugan Ashwin who was standing at least 15-20 yards inside the boundary. That positioning was probably to stop the second run, which this pair has so frequently charged for to exploit the long boundary. But it works brilliantly in a separate context here. Short ball, hammered off the front foot well in front of square, it goes flat and hard - straight to deep midwicket. Ashwin comes charging across in celebration. There might yet be some more chapters to write before this game is done. batsman c Murugan Ashwin b bowler 67(53) [4s-8]

FOUR, nicely whipped away by batsman. He's timed it beautifully, although bowler did much of the work for him by giving a gentle full ball on the pads. And then batsman gratefully picked it up backward of square, past fine leg

FOUR, short of length delivery wide of off, it's a slower ball but on this pitch, it has come on so brilliantly onto the bat. batsman has just opened the face, that's it, but it's sped away through backward point

1 run, Murugan Ashwin drops a skier! The nightmare in the field continues for Kings XI. Back of a length outside off, batsman looks to hoick through midwicket but gets a thick top-edge that goes way up in the air, giving Murugan plenty of time to settle underneath. Almost too much time. He makes a meal of it
SIX, short of length delivery wide of off, punished by batsman who slaps it over extra cover. Turning out to be a great over for team

1 run, full and wide, creamed to extra cover where Ashwin does a brilliant job of a pick-up and throw. A direct-hit might've even had him, or maybe not. He's in, well in. And that's his fifty too. The job's not done yet though
FOUR, this won't please Ashwin one bit. Having called mid-off inside the ring, bowler bowls a low full toss and is tonked straight back over that fielder. Another chat
SIX, and this should seal it from batsman. He gets low, bends across, moves late to the off-side and sweeps this low full toss into the crowd backward of square. Classic batsman
FOUR, drops it down short and is smoked back down the ground. Slapped to the fence for four

FOUR, ominous signs for team because batsman is timing them sweet and crisp. Not that full in length but he is well forward and punches it on the up. Beats the diving mid-off fielder and it's sped away to the fence
FOUR, raining boundaries in the Powerplay. Just the kind of start team were looking for. Too full from Curran and it's hammered straight back past him and down the ground. Mid-off had no chance

FOUR, Curran is spraying them all around. Shortish this time but at a gentle pace and leg stumpish, Parthiv just had to beat short fine leg to get a boundary. He ends up clearing that fielder comfortably with a half-pull

FOUR, smacked straight back past the bowler! Those famous wrists of batsman and although it was aerial, bowler had no chance. Was a float up that got drilled mercilessly down the ground. Rocketed to the fence

out Caught by Agarwal!! Clever from bowler! Sensed Parthiv giving the charge and slowed it down considerably, while also dragging the length back ever so slightly. The attempted lofted stroke ended up as a miscue and Mayank at long-off accepted the sitter with joy. team have broken through, courtesy their skipper who is actually having a fine season so far. batsman c Agarwal b bowler 19(9) [4s-4]

FOUR, AB batsman is underway! Seam-up ball, the length is on the shorter side and batsman is quick to pounce on it. Jumps on the back foot and punches it wide of mid-off beating the fielder to his left. Excellent placement

FOUR, nicely done! Good length, seam-up delivery, marginally outside off, batsman opens his bat-face at the last moment and runs it very fine to the third man fence. Used the bowler's pace to good effect
FOUR, too wide from bowler and batsman punishes. Camps back and cuts it in the direction of the turn. Beats point and races away to the fence

FOUR, four more! A desperate dive to his left in the deep from Mayank, but in vain. A length ball and batsman walked across towards off to clip it away through mid-wicket using those mighty wrists. Agarwal got a hand to it, but couldn't stop the ball from going past the ropes
FOUR, batsman has no trouble this time. Slow, short and wide outside off. AB jumps and slaps it up and over extra cover. Easily done

FOUR, sloppy, slippy! KL Rahul, the culprit. batsman drove this flighted delivery all along the ground to the left of long-off. There was no need to slide, but KL does that and over-does - courtesy dew? In the end, he could only watch the ball go past the ropes
FOUR, and that's a fine start for team! Fuller delivery and has been on-driven down the ground. The full face of the bat showcased and the ball sped away
FOUR, fuller ball on the pads and clipped away past the square leg umpire for a four. Poor from bowler. Too full and put away off the pads

SIX, oh, he's miscued this but guess what? It's sailed all the way for a maximum. Plenty of flight from Kuldeep, Jadhav sits low and goes across the line with the spin on the swipe. Gets enough bat on it to send it into the stands

FOUR, rank long hop and Jadhav takes full toll. bowler knows it was a bad delivery and he's disappointed with himself. Pulled his length back, Jadhav pivots back and muscles it in the gap - splitting deep mid-wicket and long-on

out Lbw!! Jadhav's been trapped in front but he walks down the pitch to have a chat with Raina in quest for a review but nope, the Southpaw advises him against going for the review and off he goes. Eden explodes. bowler picks up his second wicket and he's keeping team in the game. Such a vital wicket this because Jadhav was looking ominous. Quicker delivery, skidded through after pitching and KJ misjudged it, ended up playing it down the wrong line and it pings him on the front pad. HawkEye's in and it says the ball is crashing the leg-stump. Good call from umpire Rod Tucker. batsman lbw b bowler 20(12) [4s-3 6s-1]

SIX, and now he middles it.. into the crowd. Advances down, it's a googly again and this time batsman picks the bones out of it. Crucially, he went with a straight bat and not across the line. Deposits it over long-on
FOUR, this time he knows exactly what bowler has bowled. Picks the googly, steps away from the line and opens the face on his cut past backward point
SIX, steps out close to the pitch and launches it down the ground. May have come close to the bottom of his bat, but there's still enough for a 74-metre six
FOUR, that's a shocking delivery. A full toss on the pads from round the wicket, that too with fine leg in. batsman can't believe his luck as he glances it to the fence

out Lbw!! batsman given out leg-before. Now then, this is a big moment. He has gone for the review. Oh this looks close on the front-on replay. There's some turn, and batsman is well forward. So there's a chance it might go down. No, it doesn't. Per ball-tracking, it's crashing leg stump - three reds. team needed this desperately to have any hope of getting back. And they're surely back in it now. Like the previous delivery, this one turned in as well with batsman having little clue on the front foot. And this was much more adjacent. batsman lbw b bowler 16(13) [6s-1]
1 run, short of length, batsman hops back and tucks this through square leg for his fifty. Much appreciation shown from the team dugout
FOUR, now that's been struck extremely sweetly. Full ball around off, batsman gets the front leg out of the way and nails the drive straight of mid-off
FOUR, what a bonus for team. Don't think they're looking to attack bowler, but he himself has presented a half-tracker. batsman happily belts the pull wide of long-on
FOUR, advances down close to the pitch and hammers it down the ground, with bowler having to duck for cover

FOUR, pitched up on middle, batsman swipes right across the line of it, and it somehow balloons off his leading edge over backward point. Third man was inside the ring, so it runs away for four. Back-to-back boundaries for batsman

FOUR, really poor from bowler, who switched to round the wicket and delivered a low full toss on the pads with fine leg inside the ring. The second time he's done that tonight. Easy put away for batsman

FOUR, 120kph, seam up delivery that's short and wide outside off. Definitely surprised batsman who was late on it, but he managed to get it off the toe-edge. The pace on the ball did the rest as it raced past a helpless short third man
FOUR, short ball, bad ball and has been put away. Swivelled on the back leg and pulled it in front of square for a four
FOUR, not too short but punished again. Stood up, bent his back a bit and pulled it flat towards deep mid for a four
FOUR, the short ball ain't working here. Walks across his sticks and scoops it fine on the on-side for a four. Third four in succession
FOUR, Russell getting a taste of his own medicine. That was a slower delivery and batsman walked across his sticks again and scooped it fine. The short fine fielder had no chance

out Lbw!! That was a length ball and has trapped batsman plumb in front of the sticks. Nipped in from a length, batsman was trapped on the back leg and missed the line to be adjudged LBW. His bad form with the bat continues. team lose their first wicket. That was the pacy and skiddy delivery from bowler which angled in from round the wicket. batsman lbw b bowler 6(7) [4s-1]

no run, the inside edge saved the southpaw. Length delivery angling in, batsman hopped back to defend and missed it. But there was an inside edge and that helped him overturn the umpire's decision which was out
FOUR, on the pads, clipped away to deep mid-wicket and that has raced away to the fence in a jiffy

FOUR, that's a buffet ball from Krishna. Sends a length delivery down leg, easy pickings for batsman as he gently shuffles across and helps it very fine. Fine leg was inside the ring and just watched the ball elude to his left
FOUR, oh, this is wayward stuff from Krishna. Another loosener down leg and batsman tucks in the gift. Moves across, allows for the ball to arrive and glances it past short fine leg

out Bowled!! bowler gets his man and sends the dangerous batsman packing back to the hut. He's been short on confidence with the ball in this tournament but this wicket is a much-needed boost. Poor shot from batsman, perhaps was tempted by the flight there as he leant forward aiming for an agricultural heave, didn't fully commit himself as the ball dipped in after pitching. Sneaks in with a hint of spin and rattles the off-pole. batsman b bowler 24(16) [4s-5]
FOUR, that's a horror delivery from bowler. Slips it down leg, too easy for batsman as he bends low and sweeps it very fine, earns himself a boundary

out Caught by Uthappa!! Talk about lapse in concentration. It happened with team and now with batsman. Just throws it away, probably has thrown his spot away as well in the Indian team for the World Cup. bowler with the golden arm; tosses it luringly outside off and batsman chases with hard hands. Slaps it uppishly and finds Uthappa at cover, who takes a good catch. batsman c Uthappa b bowler 5(11)

FOUR, Jadhav picks the googly and lifts it over extra cover. High percentage shot against spin. Waited for the ball to arrive, lunges forward and cashes in with a nonchalant loft. All grace from Jadhav

FOUR, now the cheekiness. How smart is Jadhav here? Nothing wrong with the delivery from bowler, it was flighted delivery just outside off but KJ cleverly went deep in his crease and opened his bat face at the last moment to guide it past short third man. The fielder gave a long chase but the ball wins the race
FOUR, 1000 runs for Lynn in IPL! Wide-ish delivery in the channel outside off, very close to tramline, Lynn gets down on his knee and smacks it over covers, one bounce and into the fence she goes
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the opener! This was slightly short in the channel outside off, batsman treks back and slaps it wide of the fielder at sweeper cover, great timing and power on that

out Caught by du Plessis!! Rana looks to up the ante and falls in the process. It's turning out to be another season where Rana gives it away in the middle and latter half. He spotted the leg-break, made room for the lofted on-drive, didn't quite get hold of the shot, off the inner half of the bat and dragged it down the throat of du Plessis at long-on. A simple catch and the South African holds on. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 21(18) [4s-3]

out Caught by du Plessis!! A ripper from Faf du Plessis - but what was batsman doing? First ball and he was looking to smash bowler out of the park, it was the leg-break and he didn't spot it, ended up slicing across the line, gets a thick edge that goes high and over the bowler's head. Faf charged in from the deep, kept his eyes on the ball and held on - despite sliding forward. team are losing the plot in the middle overs. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 0(1)
SIX, cracking shot, too short from bowler, Lynn swivels across and then helps it on its way, high and over long leg for a maximum
SIX, smashed, a flat six from Lynn, backed away to a short ball and clattered it over cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
SIX, back-to-back sixes for Lynn, tad too short from RJ, allows Lynn to rock back and pull it hard and over mid-wicket for another maximum
SIX, hat-trick of sixes, RJ is under the pump here at the Eden - tossed up on off, Lynn came down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum

FOUR, cheeky and four, nicely done by batsman, this was the drifter that was angled down leg, he bent down, used the pace on the ball and lapped it behind square on the on-side for a boundary, 23 from the over

out Caught by SN Thakur!! Wickets keep coming for bowler and this is his trademark celebration on show. Pushed through with a flatter trajectory, Lynn bent down on the slog-sweep, struck it hard and flat, but didn't find the placement that he wanted. Shardul was the man at deep backward square leg, bends down low and accepts the catch gleefully. Exit Lynn, but enter Andre Russell. batsman c SN Thakur b bowler 82(51) [4s-7 6s-6]
FOUR, .. and he's off and running with a boundary - tossed up on the leg-stump line, Russell gets forward and thumps it wide of mid-wicket - no one in the deep to stop that

SIX, thumped, the leg-break and it has been dropped into the second tier - Too full from bowler, Russell bent down low and heaved it with sheer power - didn't middle it but the ball went a long way into the stands

out Caught by (sub)Shorey!! One shot too many and the celebrations start in the team camp - Look at bowler go, he got Lynn first and now Russell - surely has cut short team's final score by at least 25 runs if not more. Another leg-break and Russell brought out an ambitious slog-sweep - Didn't get hold of the shot, off the toe-end and dragged it towards long-on. It was dying onto him, but Dhruv Shorey bent forward and held on. batsman c (sub)Shorey b bowler 10(4) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, nicely done, low full-toss from bowler, batsman leans forward and chips it over mid-wicket for a boundary

out Caught by du Plessis!!Jinxed! Poor from the skipper. Length delivery and he just skied it up in the air for Faf, the ball magnet for the day, to take it at mid-off. That was a nothing shot. The bat face turned in the hands of the batsman for it to sky up. Fourth catch of the day for Faf. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 18(14) [4s-2]

out Caught by Jadeja!! And a tough learning curve for batsman is over. Slaps a shortish ball straight down the throat of the man at deep mid. That was slower and batsman despite timing it found the fielder. team have lost the plot here. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 15(20)

FOUR, that's in the air but it's wide of the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Lynn latches on to the short ball and hacks it over mid-wicket. On a bounce and over the ropes. The fielder near the boundary was sprinting across but couldn't reach there
SIX, that's nailed over deep mid-wicket. Shimmies down the wicket and pulls the short ball over the fence for half a dozen, way back into the stands
FOUR, drilled through extra cover! Pitched on a full length and Lynn creams it past the fielder at wide mid-off. Pressure on the bowler, 14 runs of the over already. Still 3 balls to go!

out Kuldeep Yadav Run Out!! Swinging in yorker and a run-out as the keeper lobbed the ball to the bowler who whipped the bails off with the non-stiker stranded in the middle of the crease. batsman almost fell down failing to wood the yorker and Dhoni behind the sticks did the rest. team has derailed pretty badly here. Kuldeep Yadav run out (Dhoni/bowler) 0(0)
FOUR, bludgeoned down the ground! An overpitched delivery around off and Lynn had absolutely hammered it past the bowler, no chance of stopping that. Thakur hardly had any time to react

FOUR, looks a belter of a wicket this one. Just look at the timing on that. Minimum effort, maximum result. Was swinging into the batsman this full length delivery and batsman creams it past the fielder at cover-point. Lynn has scored six boundaries and a six, Narine none

out Caught by du Plessis!! bowler strikes in his first over! A tossed up delivery around middle and leg, batsman looks to clear long-on with this loft but finds the fielder stationed near the fence. du Plessis is the man who takes a safe catch. Just like his previous match against team, batsman fails to fire yet again. The bowling change works for Dhoni. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 2(7)

FOUR, good move by DK to send Rana at number 3. With two left arm spinners in team, he can get a few handy runs. This was wide outside off and Rana slaps it wide of the fielder at cover, placement was the key on this occasion
FOUR, Lynn is looking in good touch today! Intent in his gameplay. This was short and wide outside off, the opener makes use of the width on offer and thrashes it past the man at cover

SIX, going, going and gone! One of the cleanest strikes of the afternoon. Lynn puts on his dancing shoes and lofts it over long-on for a towering six. Could have been a maximum on any ground, anywhere in the world
FOUR, excellent square cut by Rana! This was another short ball and well outside off, Rana sees the opportunity there and cuts it very late, past the fielder at backward point and that's four more
1 run, fifty for Lynn, his 8th in IPL, the leg-break from bowler, but the length was short, allowed Lynn to go back and cut it towards backward point
FOUR, lovely, RJ dropped one short and wide of off, Rana made room and then chopped it behind square on the off-side for a boundary
FOUR, oh outside edge and it's flew past the man at slip. Outswinger from a good length, batsman tries to defend, gets a thick edge and gets away with it

out Caught by Bairstow!! bowler gets a wicket in his first over of the season. Short of a length delivery just outside off stump, Shaw tries to punch off the back foot, the ball bounces, hits him high on the bat and the edge goes straight to the keeper. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 4(5)

FOUR, another edge and batsman escapes this time. Hands on the head for team's fielders. It was pitched up outside off, batsman's eyes light up as he goes hard on the drive. No feet, just hands following the ball. Thick outside edge beats Bairstow to his left - who dived but it was far from him
FOUR, smacked over mid-wicket. Rare loose ball from Rashid, a rank long hop and Iyer was so quick to read it. Hangs back and places it supremely in the gap

FOUR, oh, poor Rashid. The ball's following him and this time he fails to stop it. Should have done better definitely because the standards he sets in the field is amazing. Shortish from Sharma, well outside off. batsman gets deep and cuts it past point. Rashid did cover good ground but ended up letting it away to the fence at sweeper cover
2 runs, 50-stand comes up between Iyer and Pant. Slower delivery from Sharma, on the pads and Iyer whips it wide of long-on. Easy two as even Warner can't do much

out Caught by Bairstow!! Kumar's worked Iyer out with a short ball. The team captain doesn't even wait for the umpire to raise his finger as he trudges off the field. It's Bhuvi's 100th scalp for team. Followed a full ball with a spicy short delivery, Iyer was backing away and tried to ramp it over the keeper but failed in execution. Gets a slight edge and Bairstow makes no mistake. The partnership has been broken. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 45(40) [4s-5]

out Caught by Hooda!! Proving to be a fruitful night for bowler. Comes back into the attack and gets the big fish. Bowls a low full toss and batsman looks to lift it over long-on. Gets it off the bottom end of the bat as it's miscued towards the man charging in. Hooda is the man in the deep who takes it. batsman c Hooda b bowler 23(19) [4s-3]
no run, Bairstow puts down a catch! Was a googly outside off and Morris got an outside edge as he tried to punch off the back foot. The keeper shows some generosity by not holding on to the catch

out Bowled!! Rashid ends his spell with a wicket. Pitches this one on a tad fuller length and bowls a quicker legbreak, batsman with lack of footwork tries to punch it, can't get any connection however. The ball knocks the top of off stump and Morris is gone! batsman b bowler 4(8)

FOUR, finally a boundary for Delhi! It has come after ages. A wide full toss by Sandeep and batsman makes sure it's sent to the boundary. Reaches out for it and slaps it past the man at cover, also manages to beat the sprinter in the deep

leg byes, 1 run, team review against Keemo Paul! Doesn't look out though as the impact was outside leg and it was clearly sliding down the leg side. Was a slower delivery on leg and Keemo got beaten as the ball moved away to an extent. Impact - umpire's call and it's missing leg confirm the replays
SIX, Paul has picked the bones out of this! A slower length delivery around off, Keemo lines up for it and swings it over the cow corner for a gigantic six

out Lbw!! Bhuvi has the last laugh as he gets his man. Concedes a six and comes back strongly to dismiss Keemo. Nails his yorker to perfection and traps the batsman in front of the wickets. He was looking to swing his bat but got beaten due to the hint of inswing. Out from the moment it struck his pads and the batsman doesn't even think of reviewing it. batsman lbw b bowler 7(4) [6s-1]
FOUR, a man at slip would have swallowed that. Outswinger outside off stump, batsman slashes hard, gets a thick edge and escapes
FOUR, driven hard into the square and it bounces to the right of the man at cover, Rashid tries to hunt it down, but can't cut it off in time, he flicked the ball but it touched the rope

out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Top edge, oh Bhuvi juggles but manages to take it on the second attempt. Lovely short delivery, batsman goes for the hook shot, gets a thick edge, Bhuvi takes a few steps forward and manages to hold on. Great start from bowler, got both the openers. batsman c Bhuvneshwar b bowler 7(8) [4s-1]
FOUR, fullish and swinging away outside off stump, batsman stays in the crease and cuts hard, through cover-point and it races away for four
SIX, what a shot! He's very good with that pick up shot, fullish and on the off stump, batsman gets his front across the line and sends it all the way over backward square leg
FOUR, outside edge and it's escaped past the diving man at slip, fullish delivery outside off stump, Iyer plays inside the line and tries to push at the ball, gets away with it
SIX, slower ball and smashed, batsman danced down the pitch and slogged at this, didn't catch the middle of the bat but caught enough to clear the fence
FOUR, oh good bouncer but batsman has managed to top edge this fine to the fine leg boundary, smiles at the bowler acknowledging that it was a good ball
FOUR, how did he cut a ball that wasn't short! Iyer gave himself room and sliced the ball square past backward point, Ricky Bhui couldn't cut it off
SIX, lovely hit, down the pitch, lofted with the spin and way back over long-on, the leggie again, picked that from the hand and smashed it, highest IPL score for batsman

out Caught by Bairstow!! And he nicks off immediately. Full and wide outside off stump, batsman tries to square-drive, but gets a thick edge and he doesn't wait for the umpire. bowler gets his first IPL wicket. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 40(24) [4s-4 6s-3]
FOUR, wow! Surgical precision from Iyer. Two fielders dived but in vain. Juicy half-volley from bowler, Iyer gets his front foot across and nails the drive fabulously through extra cover

FOUR, batsman greets Rashid to the attack with a boundary. Not the ideal start as he drops it short, batsman rocks back quickly and swats it in front of square on the leg-side. Threads the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket to perfection

FOUR, edged and flies past slip. Steaky but Iyer won't mind. Loopy delivery, almost a yorker length outside off. Iyer squeezes it and gets a healthy outside edge which eludes slip and beats short third man as well

FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. bowler! Back of a length delivery at 150kph, batsman swings hard and gets it off the inside edge through square leg. No fielders stationed in that region and that shall be the first boundary of the innings

FOUR, not a great line by bowler! Short ball at the hips and batsman glances it past the fielder at short fine leg with nonchalance. All he had to is get some bat on it, which he does. The pace at which bowler is bowling makes it easy to take it away to the fence

out Caught by Rabada!! Done in by the slower ball, chips it up to the right of mid-off where Rabada comes flying across for the catch. Clings onto it. Then clings onto Prithvi Shaw who jumps right onto him. Brilliant from Paul to turn it around for Delhi. Pressure on the vulnerable team middle-order again. batsman c Rabada b bowler 3(8)

no run, loopy ball and slammed down the ground for the man at long-off to drop it. That was a poor drop from Munro coming in from long-off. Warner at the other end is furious as batsman didn't even stay alert to take a single. The young man is under the pump here

FOUR, takes strike after sometime but that doesn't deter him from getting a four. Jumped on to the short ball and pulled it away towards deep mid for a four. Played it in front of square and got it in the gap
FOUR, gift of a delivery. A full toss. And batsman laces that by backing away. Crunched it past cover for a four. Important four
no run, and bowler ji has dropped a tough one! That was muscled back to the bowler. Quicker one outside off and was spanked back to the bowler who got both hands to it before dropping it

out Caught by Axar!! This is proving to be a match defining spell by Keemo Paul. Ricky batsman never looked settled and his struggle comes to an end. Was a slower delivery outside off, the batsman swung his bat and got it off a thick leading edge towards backward point. Axar Patel sprints across towards his left, puts in a dive and pulls off a brilliant catch. This match is going right down to the wire. batsman c Axar b bowler 7(12)

2 runs, starts with a length delivery and that has been lifted away over the bowler's head for a double. Fifty for batsman. This has been scratchy knock from the southpaw. Wasn't timed at all as he tried to lift that away

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The slower delivery does it again. Dada and Ponting at the dug out are roaring out loud as well. Big moment in the game. batsman looked to slap it, toe-ended it and the man at midoff back-pedalled a bit to take it. Huge, huge wicket for team in the circumstances. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 51(47) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Caught by Pant!! The short ball does it now. The quick short ball, no room for the batter and only musters a top-edge for the keeper to cover some distance and take it at the short third cordon. Back-to-back wickets have almost sealed the game for team. batsman could have been the man for team but not to be. The ball skidded on to him and he was late on the shot. batsman c Pant b bowler 1(2)

out Bowled!! The corker yorker has got the leg pole cartwheeling here. Looked to open the face of the bat on that yorkerish delivery but missed it and the leg-stick went for a toss. team are crumbling too quickly here. Perfect yorker and the perfect result as well. batsman b bowler 3(4)

out Caught by K Paul!! And another South African is on a hat-trick. Slower delivery, batsman got under the ball and slammed the slog sweep for it to be taken at deep mid. Keemo Paul in the deep mid region gobbled it up. bowler is on a hat-trick now. batsman c K Paul b bowler 0(1)

out Caught by K Paul!! Keemo Paul is like air. He is everywhere. An easy catch around the mid-off region. Length delivery and was heaved away off the toe-end of the blade, never went anywhere and the catch was taken easily. team going down like a lead balloon here. Totally messed up the chase in the second part of the innings. batsman c K Paul b bowler 2(3)

out Caught&Bowled!! What's happening here? They keep getting sucked into more miseries team. Short ball, looks to pull and the top-edge was taken by the bowler himself. The keeper also went for it as no one called for it. But bowler kept his balance to take it. batsman c and b bowler 2(4)

out Bowled!! Backs away, creates room and misses the fullish ball for team to complete the formalities. From 101 for 2 to 116 bowled out. team jump to second in the points table. batsman b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, batsman knows only way! The aggressive way. Sees the width on offer and slices the shortish delivery over point. Enough wood on it as the ball races away to the boundary
FOUR, successive boundaries for the Englishman. This was on his pads and batsman flicks it wristily over square leg. Very VVS-esque shot that and it's four more for the opener
SIX, stand and deliver! Length delivery around off and batsman stays put and lofts it straight over the bowler's head. Straight as an arrow and that shall be a maximum

FOUR, slightly short, batsman quickly responds by jumping back on the cut. But it's not really that short. So he's not in control, gets a thick outside edge and it runs away through the vacant slip region
1 run, low full toss on middle, eased down to long-on
SIX, bashes this into the crowd. The way he took stance, it was clear he fancied a bite of bowler. Sensing this, bowler blinked. He dropped it short and was muscled over midwicket

FOUR, only slightly short, not a lot, but batsman has gone so far back in the crease, using the depth of it superbly. He's manufactured this pull shot through midwicket, and then succeeds in beating deep midwicket too

out Caught by Rabada!! Fuller, slower and wider, batsman reaches out for it and drills it straight down long-off's throat. That's the opening Delhi needed. Because he was stretching for it, batsman wasn't as balanced as he would've liked to be. And so, that affected - or rather hindered - the power he was able to generate. Went flat to Rabada who made no mistake. batsman c Rabada b bowler 41(31) [4s-5 6s-1]
FOUR, bottom-handed whip and it finds the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on for a four. On a length, batsman swipes across the line and gets it into the gap for it to dribble away
FOUR, poor channel from Umesh, slips it down leg and batsman swivels on the back foot to pull it fine for a four. Was a gift of a delivery from Umesh
SIX, did he hit it that well? Got hold of the short ball and just rolled his wrists over that. The ball seemed to have flown away over fine leg for a sixer. Might have been a bit of a top-edge
SIX, that's another monstrous hit from batsman! Shimmies out of his crease and smokes this well flighted delivery into the cow corner orbit with a dash of swagger

out Stumped!! Gets greedy does batsman and throws his wicket away. Didn't pick the top-spinner outside off and his wild bat swing only meets with thin air, PP completes the formalities behind the stumps sans any fuss. batsman st Parthiv Patel b bowler 21(9) [6s-3]
FOUR, smartly played by batsman! Gets down on one knee and paddles the full legbreak in the gap through short fine, Siraj puts in a dive after a long sprint but ball wins the race
FOUR, gets as low as he can, picks the flighted delivery from outside off and swipes it over square leg for his first boundary
FOUR, why bowl a short quick ball when the flighted deliveries are doing the job for you. Surya stays back, lets the ball come and cuts to the right of short third man

out Caught by Navdeep Saini!! This is a big wicket for team, the move to bowl bowler has worked. Just as SKY was looking very determined to take team home, he gifts his wicket. Flighted delivery spinning away outside off stump, not easy to loft the away-spinning ball on this surface, goes for the extra-cover region but hits it too high and very straight. Long-off moves to his left and swallows the ball to delight the away camp. batsman c Navdeep Saini b bowler 29(23) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, I have no idea how Hardik has cut this all the way towards widish third man. Short ball yes, but looked like Hardik was slightly late on the shot, but he actually middled it, just fell an inch inside the rope, poor start to the over for team

FOUR, in the airrr, Southee was at mid-on, runs back but only manages to fingertip it to the boundary. Clever batting from Hardik, he lofted that deliberately in the air knowing there was no one in the deep, bowler bowled very full this time and paid the price. Hardik went back and across for this ball, he went so deep in his crease that he would have been out hit wicket had he been in line with the stumps
FOUR, don't understand this field. Mid-off in at this stage to a player who loves lofting the ball straight. bowler dishes out a full ball and Pandya happily powers it over the bowler's head

out Caught by (sub)Milind Kumar!! Yikes! That was an ugly hit with no real intent from Krunal. Ugly because his front foot was pointing towards cover and when you do that, there's no way you can flick the ball with control. Just a chip in the end to this back of a length delivery and deep mid-wicket ran forward to take the catch. In fact he caught that with one hand despite going with both hands. Crowd cheers as they see Pollard walk out. batsman c (sub)Milind Kumar b bowler 11(21) [4s-1]

SIX, now then, now then, it's not a well timed hit but it timed well enough to just clear long-on. Shortish delivery spinning away, Pandya goes back and powers the ball in the air and gets a vital maximum
FOUR, is that the game already! Poor short ball wide outside off stump, Pandya slaps it hard and splits long-off and deep mid-wicket to perfection
FOUR, batsman has killed the game. Or should I say bowler? Why dart the ball when it's turning! Pandya slogs and hits it well enough and wide of long-on
SIX, take a bow Hardik. This time bowler actually gave it some air, Pandya got under the ball and muscled it hard over wide long-on
FOUR, fuller ball and has been laced off the front foot past cover for a four. Fuller, wider and batsman got enough bat on it to send it away into the gap
FOUR, and off the outer edge. Toe-end may be. Cruel game for the bowlers. Length delivery outside off, batsman looks to mow it across the line and gets it off the edge

SIX, that was a golf hit! That has gone into orbit. Outtaaaaaaa here! Short ball and batsman has picked the skeletons out of that. Muscled over deep square leg for a sixer. Hardly transferred his weight on to the back foot to slam it away

no run, length delivery and has been pushed back to the bowler. Umesh went for the throw after picking the ball up and misses. Had he hit, QDK wasn't even trying to get back. The batter had chipped out to push it back to the bowler
SIX, this is silly from bowler. You can't be bowling short and wide to batsman. batsman stays back and square cuts the ball over deep point fence for a sixer. Easy peasy!
FOUR, this is pick your spot bowling from bowler. Short delivery outside off, pleading to be hit and batsman slaps it over cover. team are off to a flier
2 runs, full on leg-stump and batsman's swept that to the left of backward square who fumbles to allow the second
FOUR, sits down on one knee, picks the length early and swipes it over square leg with sheer timing
FOUR, in the slot for batsman Sharma! Full and plenty of width outside off, batsman lashes on it with a crunchy drive through extra cover, superbly timed!
SIX, 143ks dug in short at the batsman, batsman picks the length slightly late but he has such wonderful hands and he clouts it for a 77-metre maximum over mid-wicket

out Bowled!! Wicket off the first ball for bowler. He can do no wrong today. Lands the offbreak miles outside off stump and thus, batsman Sharma thinks he can cut that off the back foot, wasn't to be. The ball spins a long way and clatters quickly into middle and leg. batsman b bowler 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]

out Lbw!! Plumb. batsman's caught on the crease and bowler is chuffed to bits. Pitches this on a length and gets just the right amount of turn into the left-hander, batsman's stranded on the back foot and that's crashing into middle and leg. Played all around it and paid the price. batsman lbw b bowler 40(26) [4s-5 6s-2]
SIX, charges out of his crease, gets closer to the pitch of the delivery and clubs it many-a-mile over long-on
SIX, make that two in a row! Closer to the pitch of the delivery again and batsman has nailed that over cow corner for a flat maximum
SIX, tossed full outside off and SKY pumps it for a 73-metre maximum over extra cover, well timed!
FOUR, stylish shot to get off the mark! A tad too straight in line, full as well and batsman wrists it away past the diving forward square leg fielder. Timed it sweetly

SIX, top-edge and over the keeper. Oh, in fact, it's gone all the way. Fortune favouring batsman at the moment. Pandya bends his back and digs it into the pitch, batsman went for the pull and gets a fat top-edge to his benefit

SIX, shouts of "ABD, ABD" were ringing across Wankhede and batsman treats them by dismissing this into the deep mid-wicket stands. What a strike! Gee. Picked the short delivery early, it sat up well for him too. Easy-peasy as he nails it off the meat and smokes it over the fence

no run, was it a chance for de Kock? He's having a off-day behind the stumps today. Well, looks like there wasn't any edge there. So, won't go down as a drop. It was tossed up luringly outside off, batsman wanted to have a piece of it as he threw his bat without any feet movement but the ball straightened and beats his outside edge
FOUR, batsman brings out the innovation. Spotted the leg-break early, gets low and reverse-sweeps it past short third man. Brilliant!

SIX, Ali tees off and oh, that's a poor effort from the fielder at long-off. Surely should have done better as he parries it away for a six. Looped up just outside off, Ali got underneath it and blasted it - didn't get it off the middle but fortunately gets away. Seemed like SKY was the fielder, who made a meal of it

SIX, and he spoils the over with a maximum. Pandya gives a bit of flight, Ali extends his arms and clubs it over long-on. He had to fetch it from well outside off but Ali's got some long levers. Clean strike from the southpaw

FOUR, slapped through extra cover. bowler goes full, overpitches it in the process just outside off. Ali stays deep and creams it hard, beats a desperate dive from Chahar at sweeper cover. Flawless timing from Ali
SIX, he's started to tee off here. bowler misses his mark, bowls a slower ball on a length. Ali was just waiting for this, backs his muscle power and smokes it over cow corner
SIX, wow! This is a big over for team. Second six and 17 has come off it. bowler fails to nail the yorker, misses it by an inch and Ali makes him pay. Gets under it and dumps it over cover

3 runs, lofts the low full toss over the bowler's head and a misfield from Pollard allows the duo to take a triple. Fifty for batsman. It has been labourious by his standards but now is the time, when he can cash in

1 run, waits on the slower delivery by hanging on to the back foot but inside halves the ball away into the on-side for a single. Fifty for batsman as well. This has been one cracking innings from the English all-rounder. Has delighted the crowd with some luscious big hits. Even Kohli gets up and applauds this quick fifty

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Fifty and gone. Slower delivery and batsman was early into his uppish tuck. batsman was through with his shot too early and the ball soared away for it to be taken at deep mid by Pandya, who moved across to his left and took it. End of a game changing innings from Mo! team will take this with both hands. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 50(32) [4s-1 6s-5]
SIX, ABD kneels and he will eventually bring you down on to your haunches. Stays low, and scoops the ball over fine leg for a huge six. Full marks to the anticipation and execution

out Caught by Rohit!! The slower delivery does the trick. Tucked the batsman up with an off-cutter, which bounced on the batter, who got a leading edge and was taken by the man at cover. tried to close the face of the bat a bit but was undone by the clever change of pace. Top-clas from bowler. batsman c Rohit b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, misses the yorker, not by much and batsman was quick to squeeze the ball between mid-off and cover for a four. Genius on show
FOUR, again bowler misses the yorker and batsman shows his wizardry. Gets deep, opens the bat face and pile drives the ball past cover for a four. Superb from Mr. 360
SIX, misses the yorker again, this time bowler, and batsman has hammered it over deep square leg for a big six. Sized up for a length ball and got a full toss to scream it away

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. That was superb from Pollard. A bullet of a throw from deep long-on and has found ABD short. batsman slogged it away towards the long-on area and wanted to come back for a second only for him to sent back by Akshdeep Nath. ABD tried to turn back but the direct hit found him short. batsman run out (Pollard) 75(51) [4s-6 6s-4]

out Caught by de Kock!! Charges out, looks to loft the slower ball away and top-edges it for the keeper to run towards the short fine area and take it. This again won't please the skipper. QDK had his eyes on the ball and took it nicely despite the ball going away from him. batsman c de Kock b bowler 2(3)

out Caught by de Kock!! And another one for the Slinga! Slower delivery cutting across, batsman throws his bat at it and skies it up. The keeper again calls for it and catches it near the point region. This is extremely poor from team. Throwing it away at the end of it. batsman c de Kock b bowler 0(2)

out Caught by de Kock!! Body blow by bowler! Cracking delivery and batsman has been sent back early. Was angling across from a good length around off, held its line after pitching and bounced just a bit more than batsman anticipated it to. He was looking to force it through the off-side and got cramped, thereby getting an inside edge through to de Kock who took it with ease. Just the kind of start team were looking for. batsman c de Kock b bowler 8(9) [4s-1]

FOUR, just clears mid-on! Was a miscued lofted flick from Parthiv who saw the length full and tried his luck. Wasn't off the middle of the blade, yet managed to get it past the leaping fielder in the circle
FOUR, slapped over mid-wicket! Fractionally short and Parthiv picked the length early, didn't bother going back as he pulled this comfortably over mid-wicket. Clean strike

SIX, just over deep mid-wicket! Kishan was the fielder there and he leapt as much as he could but it went well over him. A taller fielder, Pollard perhaps, could have had a better chance. Take nothing away from Parthiv though, this is a cracking stroke. Picked the slower ball early and though he had to fetch it from outside off, did so with a cross-batted slap
FOUR, deft touch this time from Parthiv! Uses the pace of bowler and steers it with an open bat face. Splits the slip and gully fielder to pick up a boundary. Smart batting

FOUR, more runs! This is a good counterattack from Parthiv. Not in control this time as he goes for a flashy drive, slices it wide of the slip and once again, it's wide of gully and races away to the fence

FOUR, clubbed over point! First confident shot from batsman for the night. Short and wide, he stands tall and bashes it square through the off-side. Didn't connect cleanly enough but had enough wood to clear the infield with ease

no run, Parthiv Patel was in some trouble here but puts in a dive as the throw at the bowler's end misses. Might have been 50-50 if it hit. Shortish delivery that struck batsman on the thigh pad as he got cramped on the flick

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! What a soft dismissal! For all the shots he's played so far, Parthiv departs in tame fashion. It's been the story of his IPL career by and large. Gets attractive starts but perishes after the Powerplay. This was a cleverly bowled off cutter from Hardik and Parthiv wanted to go aerial through his favorite region square through the off-side. Misread the pace and ended up chipping it straight to Yadav at backward point. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 28(20) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, cheeky from ABD! The reverse paddle and it's actually risky with a slip in place but the South African connects fairly well. Well wide of backward point to get a boundary

FOUR, french-cut from batsman and it almost shaved the off-stump. Nervy times for the South African these. This good length delivery nipped in a bit and batsman was cramped for room as he went for the cut - too close for comfort. Thick inside edge goes teasingly past the stumps to the fine leg fence

SIX, effortless flick from Ali and it sails over the deep mid-wicket fielder's head for a maximum. It was floated on the pads, Ali's propensity on leg-stump balls is well documented. Just stays inside the line and latches onto the freebie

no run, was there an edge? QDK can't collect it cleanly and yes, there was a definite bottom-edge there. Googly from Chahar, dropped short and it was spinning away from Ali. He went for the pull a tad early and feeds a tiny edge but QDK messes it behind, grassing it onto the floor

SIX, this was in the air for a long time, for a second the fielder at deep square leg looked in business but the breeze here in Mohali takes it away over the ropes. Probably, Archer - the fielder - was standing a few yards inside the rope, had he been near the boundary, he would've had a better chance of catching it. Big misjudgement from him there as batsman gets away. It was banged in short, batsman after a few sighters takes it on and pulls. Didn't time it as he would've liked but luckily, the ball sails over the ropes for a maximum

SIX, after a few sighters, batsman gets into action. bowler lands a length ball, sits up nicely for batsman to free his arms. Whacked elegantly over long-on. Back-to-back sixes for the Universe Boss. He's starting to tee off. Ominous signs for team

FOUR, first boundary for the opener has come in the 12th over! batsman makes room for himself, shimmies down the wicket and lifts the shortish delivery over mid-off. The fielder was inside the circle and all he needed was to clear him, which he does. A sigh of relief for KL
FOUR, finally a boundary for batsman! He was trying to find this gap since quite some time. Goes down on his knee and finds the fence with a nicely timed sweep shot, first one of the innings for him

SIX, that's huge! Short length by Sodhi, batsman waits for it and smokes it over deep square leg for a massive six. Just the kind of delivery he was looking for in order to break the shackles. Sodhi has just given him that
SIX, thumped down the ground! A googly by Sodhi, batsman reads to perfection, treks back and bludgeons it over long-off for the second maximum of the over. Pressure on Sodhi!

FOUR, time for the batsman show! Goes down on his knee and scoops the length delivery over fine leg. The fielder was inside the circle and the opener clears him comfortably. That almost went the distance

SIX, Bowled a rather decent spell in the last game against team but he's back to leaking runs. Bowls a gift of a full toss on the pads and batsman with utter ease flicks it over deep mid-wicket. The timing was bang on!

SIX, bowler has run out of ideas! batsman moves miles away from the leg stump and the bowler tries to follow him. Goes full though and the batsman goes inside out to clear covers with this exceptional shot. Wow!

FOUR, super shot! Saw the length slightly short and though there wasn't room, he created some by backing away and punched it sweetly wide of the mid-off fielder. Raced away to the fence. Another 50 for batsman this season! This has been brilliantly paced, was really slow to begin with but is shifting gears with ease now

out Caught by Jofra Archer!! bowler has the last laugh! Was carted around in the last over but responds by breaking the partnership. Was the slower ball and quite full as well, batsman wanted to carve this through the gap square through the off-side but ended up slicing it straight to Archer at backward point. Simple catch and it ends a decent knock from KLR. So, the gamble works for team and Rahane. batsman c Jofra Archer b bowler 52(47) [4s-3 6s-2]
FOUR, launched over extra cover! Spoils an otherwise good bowler over. A trifle too full and a bit of width as well, batsman stood still and lifted it easily over the infield. Clean strike

out Caught by Rahane!! Mistimed and picks out extra cover. batsman has been done in for pace here, it's a low full toss but quite brisk and hence, isn't able to connect properly. Ends up cue-ending the shot towards the off-side where the team skipper takes a tumbling catch, diving forward. This is a fine passage of play for the visitors. batsman c Rahane b bowler 5(6)

out Bowled!! The leg stump has been flattened! Outstanding over from Archer, just three runs and has taken two wickets too. After a series of fiery pacy deliveries, he opts for the slower one, the back-of-the-hand option and batsman clearly hasn't picked it at all. Saw the length very short and backed away for the pull but the ball never really arrived. Ends up getting an inside edge that damages the woodwork. Brilliant fightback from the Royals. batsman b bowler 0(2)

out Caught by Buttler!! The team innings is falling apart at the final leg, thereby derailing that flourish that they were looking for. The well-set batsman is the latest casualty. Made room for the big shot but Kulkarni followed him with a slower ball on a good length. Couldn't free his arms properly and ended up skewing the loft high into the night skies at deep mid-wicket. Not easy, these high catches but Buttler is a pro in the outfield. Pouches the skier with ease. batsman c Buttler b bowler 40(27) [4s-2 6s-2]

FOUR, useful boundary for team! Width on offer and shortish as well, batsman was waiting for any room to be provided and sliced it away wide of backward point. Third man had no chance of cutting it off
SIX, crunched! Solid hit from the team skipper. Picked the slower ball and the shorter length helped, he sat deep on the back foot and clouted it merrily across the line. Superb batting!

FOUR, this is erratic from Kulkarni. Serves up a low full toss outside off, batsman reaches out and throws his bat. Gets a thick outside edge but the third man is inside the ring and it beats the fielder at 45 before running away to the fence

SIX, terrific cameo from batsman to finish! Premeditates the yorker and walks across the stumps early, thereby putting Kulkarni off. The result is a full toss that's paddle scooped beautifully. All the way over fine leg
FOUR, very predictable from Kulkarni. He's bowling an array of slower balls, batsman anticipated it and made room to spank it in the pocket between short third man and backward point

SIX, woah. This is very uncharacteristic from batsman. Let's the world know about his cheekiness too. Spotted the short ball early, arched his back and ramped it beautifully over the keeper. Normally, it's all about power but not on this occasion

byes, FOUR, messy. Archer is fuming as Samson fumbles behind. Can't blame him much because he got an iffy bounce. Off-pace delivery, snaked away sharply outside off. The keeper couldn't get his body behind the line and it runs away to the boundary

out Caught by Samson!! Archer gets the prized scalp of batsman. He's such a smart operator and gives team the first breakthrough. It was on a back of a length, decked away with some extra bounce. batsman with a tentative and loose poke at that, it brushes the outside edge and Samson makes no mistake this time. Stunned silence in the crowd as team have lost the in-form batsman. batsman c Samson b bowler 30(22) [4s-2 6s-3]

SIX, batsman at his very best. He's very good against spin and shows no respect whatsoever to Sodhi. Flighted with more air, batsman lowers his stance and lifts it straight down the ground. The timing is really good and it goes all the way for a six

FOUR, what a shot. Gopal drags it short, batsman is extremely quick to read the length. Pivots back and hammers it through mid-wicket. Stuart Binny from the deep sprints across and dives, but ends up parrying it to the boundary
SIX, launched over long-off! batsman is looking in superb touch today. Tosses it enticingly just outside off, batsman props forward and clobbers it disdainfully for a maximum

out Caught by Jofra Archer!! batsman perishes in his quest to clear long-on. Goes down on his knee to thump this one over the fence but miscues it completely. The ball goes miles up in the air and Jofra in the deep settles underneath the skier. Waits for an eternity but does well to position himself under the night sky as he reverse cups it to perfection. batsman c Jofra Archer b bowler 26(12) [4s-1 6s-2]

SIX, dispatched over long-on! Clear intent from batsman, doesn't want to settle bowler settle. There is a long-off in place, so he charges down the pitch and goes in the other direction. Over long-on and it was struck so well that it soared into the second tier

out Bowled!! The sweep has brought about his downfall this time. After crunching the previous two straight to the fielder, batsman goes for it again but misses it completely. That it was a carrom ball that straightened on off may have had to do with the error. Or it may not have. But it's floored the off stump all right. batsman b bowler 27(21) [4s-2]
FOUR, great timing from batsman as he whips this delivery backward of square. Back of a length on middle and leg, batsman climbs onto it. A boundary at the start of his innings
FOUR, poor from bowler. Bowls a hit-me on leg-stump and Tripathi tickles away neatly in the gap between deep square and fine leg
1 run, flighted around off, Tripathi pulls to deep mid-wicket and that'll be his first fifty this IPL

out Caught by Agarwal!! The carom ball has done the trick again! It was pushed around fifth stump channel and Tripathi intended to clear the fielder in the deep, went for the loft but sliced it off the bottom half straight into the mitts of Mayank Agarwal at long-off. batsman c Agarwal b bowler 50(45) [4s-4]

out Caught by Miller!! No Mohali heroics from Ashton batsman tonight. Unfortunately he doesn't have the time to play the nudge-and-nurdle game, prefers to attack and uses his long levers to tonk bowler into the stands, wasn't to be. Connects right off the cue end and Miller ain't dropping that at long-off. batsman c Miller b bowler 0(1)

out Caught by Rahul!! KL Rahul is such a brilliant fielder and boy, he makes catching look so easy. A pacy short ball outside off, Archer's so tall that he could actually stay flat-feeted and swipe at it with full throttle, hit that real hard but flat it went to the right of long-on. KL Rahul sprints across and controls the slide before tumbling over to complete the catch. batsman c Rahul b bowler 1(3)
FOUR, batsman's off the mark with a boundary! A gentle short delivery on the stumps, batsman waits on the back foot and pummels it over mid-wicket with brute power

SIX, there's nothing brute about this shot. Just a serene pick up off his hip, just watched the ball spear into the leg-side and did well to get inside the line and help the cherry on its way for a 75-metre maximum over fine leg

out Caught by Shami!! batsman's ordeal comes to an end and the 20-year old is absolutely pumped. Couldn't have asked for a better debut. Rolled his fingers over this full delivery and asked batsman to fetched it from outside off, the aimless slog loops up high in the air where Shami runs around to take a fine catch from short third. batsman c Shami b bowler 26(21) [4s-1]
SIX, length ball in the slot for batsman, he stands rooted to the crease and powers it into the cow corner orbit with tremendous timing
SIX, no missing this time around. Watches the ball like a hawk, sets himself deep inside the crease and smokes the full ball straight back over the bowler's head

out Caught by Agarwal!! Pacy full ball from bowler, followed the batsman and fired it around the pads, Gopal had made room outside off but the extra pace from bowler skid onto the bat and hit the toe-end on the loft, a simple chance for Mayank at long-off. batsman c Agarwal b bowler 0(1)

SIX, scorching hit from batsman! Prowled down the track in a jiffy and although this wasn't that short, he picked it up beautifully. Propelled it over deep mid-wicket with a shovel-flick. Such power! He's looking ominous tonight again

FOUR, another beautiful shot! batsman is turning it on. Sees width on offer and just eases it through backward point. Just relied on timing and boy, didn't he time the pants off this one! Sweeper tried hard but was never chasing it down

FOUR, team - 2, team - 0 this season! A comfortable victory for the home team, win by 12 runs. batsman sliced the full ball one-handed and managed to get it over extra cover, Mayank Agarwal chases the ball to his left but he couldn't arrest him momentum and ended up sliding over the ball

out Caught by Pooran!! bowler has got Jos batsman as his maiden IPL wicket. What a moment for the 20-year-old left-arm seamer. He's deceived him with the off-cutter here. It was slanted across well wide of off, batsman - almost premeditatedly - wanted to slug it through midwicket but goes through with it too early. Went up off the toe-end and the keeper Pooran took a fine catch running back towards fine leg. Big celebrations from Punjab, particularly Ashwin. batsman c Pooran b bowler 23(17) [4s-1 6s-2]
FOUR, full and wide, Tripathi grounds his back knee and carves it up and over backward point. Beautiful shot

FOUR, that's gone through Shami's hands at short third man. Poor effort. Length ball outside off, the angle induced the error from Tripathi as he drove away from the body. Went quickly off the outside edge to Shami's left, should've been comfortably stopped
FOUR, uses the pace superbly. Murugan was mostly flat through the over, so Tripathi anticipated a similar trajectory, stayed back to the ball and then dabbed it fine
FOUR, it's been helped away quite fine from batsman, capitalizing superbly on just a bit of misdirection from bowler who strayed ever so slightly on middle and leg

FOUR, now this is class batting. He's chopped a ball - that was on off stump - and sent it really fine into the third man boundary. What makes it an even better shot is that it was the off-cutter from bowler, so it's not as if he had a lot of pace to work with
1 run, wide on the crease again is bowler, straightens it on off stump, it takes a thick edge from batsman before rolling to short third man

out Caught by Bairstow!! One brings two!! bowler uses his height and bowls the scramble seam short of length delivery outside off, Faf made room early and was looking to go over cover, gets a faint outside edge and YJB does the rest behind the stumps. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 45(31) [4s-3 6s-3]
FOUR, risky shot and he gets a boundary! Expects the googly and jumps deep inside the crease, plays the cut at the last instant and the edge flies wide of Warner at slip
FOUR, streaky! A full throttle cross bat swing against a length delivery and batsman sends a huge chunk of top-edge on that, one bounce and over the ropes at third man

out Lbw!! batsman has been given out lbw off Rashid. team review: Fair delivery, looks to be pitching in line and no bat involved. Umpire's call on hitting and he has to go. Hasn't been at his fluent best and this shot is a firm proof of that. Just looks to slog without having a real sense of where the ball pitched and he loses his shape in the process, swings way too early and Rashid's floaty legbreak clonks him in front of middle. Technology shows it to be brushing the leg bail. Just enough. batsman lbw b bowler 13(13) [4s-2]

out Lbw!! batsman's out lbw. Another review from team: Legal delivery and there seems to be no bat involved. Has it done too much though, the googly? He's struck in line with off and there's another umpire's call on hitting. Shaving the top of leg peg. OUT!! A rather simple set-up this from Rashid, bowled the wrong 'un and gave it ample flight to draw Jadhav on the front foot. The batsman clearly didn't pick the variation and his forward stride meant he was struck adjacent to middle and leg. batsman lbw b bowler 1(2)

out Caught by Shankar!! Nought for batsman. Been strangled with a slew of dots and he lets the pressure get better off him. A slower full ball outside off, batsman didn't really have the pace to force the uppish drive but he goes for it and chips a dolly of a catch to Vijay Shankar at cover. batsman c Shankar b bowler 0(4)
FOUR, slower ball again but batsman has second guessed bowler there. Waited deep inside the crease and pounced on the width to flay it behind backward point

no run, ripper from Rashid, absolute ripper. So good was the ball, that they feel compelled to go for a review after batsman is beaten on the outside edge. He's missed this by inches. Only clipped the trouser on the way through. Oh well, team have retained their review because ball-tracking shows it to be umpire's call on off stump. I'm sure they weren't appealing for leg-before there
FOUR, slower ball outside off, there was enough width for batsman to free his arms and he does so by slapping this through backward point

FOUR, that shall release some pressure. batsman throws his hands at a wide-ish delivery as a thick outside edge is induced. It flies over Warner at slip and races away to the third man boundary. First one of the night for team!
