no ball, SIX, oh this is just awful from Saini, not only with the delivery he's bowled, but also that he's overstepped. With third man inside the ring, he bangs it in short outside off. batsman happily throws his hands at it and whirls it into the crowd

out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Short of length on off, Bravo swings wildly but only manages a top-edge through to the keeper. There's a check on the no-ball but Saini is fine, just. batsman c Parthiv Patel b bowler 5(4)
FOUR, he goes short first ball and batsman dispatches him through square leg. Oh those nerves, watch those nerves team
SIX, oh my! This is gigantic. It's gone on the roof. Short of length, another really nothing ball that batsman absolutely destroys. It's a 111-metre six
SIX, six more. Umesh Yadav crumbling. Tries a yorker but misses it at least by a couple of feet and batsman lofts it with enough power - if not timing - to clear long-off

SIX, stunning scenes! A full toss is fiercely swiped over the deep midwicket boundary. An absolute skimmer from MS batsman who is on the verge of doing the unthinkable at the Chinnaswamy again. team in shock
1 run, slower delivery and was ill-timed to mid-off. Faf wanted a single and set off. ABD had to get the direct hit in but didn't take his time to throw the sticks down. Faf was gone for all money

out SN Thakur Run Out!! What drama! What unbearable drama. But team, who almost looked like having a meltdown in the final over, have been bailed out by a direct-hit from Parthiv Patel. Very brave from Umesh initially to go for the slower off-cutter. And his execution is spot on, as it sneaks through batsman's attempted cut. They have to run, and Parthiv is alert to it. With the ball bouncing just in front of him, the gather couldn't have been easy, but he makes no mistake and his throw at the stumps is on target too, finding Thakur just short. SN Thakur run out (Parthiv Patel) 0(0)
leg byes, FOUR, terrible delivery! That's Umesh for you. Two ends of the spectrum can be seen. Was well down leg and clipped the pads off the attempted heave to run away to the fine leg fence

out Caught by de Villiers!! Short ball, gets big on the batter and batsman looking to pull, gets a top-edge for ABD to take it. Almost collided with Nath trying to take it. But completes the catch without any fuss. team are three down now and in deep trouble. Once again are three down inside the powerplay. team have turned this game around on its head. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 5(15)

no run, inswinger on a length around leg-stump, Jadhav looks to get some tickle on that but fails to make any contact off the bat. It brushes the thigh pad and flies to PP to his left, Kohli checked with his bowler and keeper and then went up for the review

FOUR, luck's written all over that delivery. A peach of an inswinger from bowler, bowled at 139ks and nearly cut Jadhav into half. Was caught poking around the fifth stump channel and the inside edge flies wide of PP to his left
FOUR, just a flick of the wrists, nothing less nothing more! Sees the ball angle into his pads and unveiled those whippy wrists on the flick did batsman, all the way through mid-wicket...

out Caught by de Villiers!! team pacers are on fire and we haven't said that very often in the history of IPL. Ah, this is some night for the team fans. Umesh kept rattling the batsmen with pace and something had to give; Jadhav tries to go across the line and doesn't bother to move his feet while at it. It takes the thick top-edge and lands straight in the bucket hands of AB at mid-off. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 9(9) [4s-2]

FOUR, streaky! Would have been out had there been a backward point, wasn't to be. batsman gets a full ball outside off and he fishes at it sans any feet, sliced it off the thick outside edge and it flies square past non-existent point
FOUR, short ball outside off, batsman had some extra time to adjust as it was around the 130ks, he arches back and ramps it over non-existent short third

FOUR, batsman's so good at playing smart cricket shots and this is one of them. Sees the ball slide down leg and paddles it in a flash past the keeper, played it late but found the middle which is what matters the most
FOUR, short ball down the leg-side, batsman swivels and powers the pull in the gap behind square on the leg-side, no need to run for those
FOUR, batsman is off and running. bowler gets a bit greedy. Tries to swing it from middle-stump and in the process gives batsman a freebie, flicked away uppishly over the square leg umpire

SIX, that's a great shot by batsman. Walks down the wicket and flicks the shortish delivery against the turn, the pitch makes it easier for the ball to go the distance, clears deep mid-wicket comfortably
SIX, pumped over deep mid-wicket! Patel reads the googly to perfection and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for half a dozen. Couldn't have played it any better

out Caught by du Plessis!! bowler gets rid of batsman. He shimmies down the wicket and lofts the delivery high up in the air. FOUR, Patel ends the over with a boundary and moves closer to his fifty. Gets a full toss and the southpaw makes sure to chip it over the infield at covers. No fielders in the deep and that's an easy four
SIX, that's a huge six! Slightly short ball and batsman treks back to smoke it over deep mid-wicket. Could have been a six on any ground. Just the kind of shot batsman was looking for to cut loose

FOUR, team fans give Parthiv a standing ovation as the opener gets to his fifty with a boundary. Waits for the slower delivery and whips it through the gap at mid-wicket to send the ball away to the fence. Has been a crucial knock but he needs to get a move on

out Caught by Watson!! Parthiv departs after getting to his fifty. That has been the problem with him this season. Not able to carry on and get a big score. Heaved down the ground, Faf held his balance at the fence and scooped it up for the man at long-on - Shorey - who was closeby to take it. Credit to Shorey as well not to distract Faf and also linger closeby in case something like this happened. Superb presence of mind to throw the ball away in the nick of the time. batsman c (sub)Shorey b bowler 14(13) [6s-1]
FOUR, tickled away fine as that was the quicker ball. Has run away to the fence for a four
FOUR, bangs the ball short and has been pulled away! There was no one at deep mid and it was a four

out Caught by Rayudu!! Scoops up a length ball which bounced a touch higher and the man at point takes it. That got big on him, batsman could not keep it down and the man at point took an easy catch. team have been poor at the death. batsman c Rayudu b bowler 5(6)
FOUR, with the point and cover point in, the fuller ball was a bad idea. batsman got his bat down and slammed it over point for a four. The wrists of steel came into play
no run, that was full, wide, batsman threw his bat it and misses. There was a noise, MS went for the DRS but there was nothing on the UltraEdge. Mo continues..

out Caught by SN Thakur!! Looks to launch the slower ball and holes out at long-off. Thakur after it taking does a gig. team continue their good work at the death. batsman c SN Thakur b bowler 26(16) [4s-5]
FOUR, streaky! Not where he intended but he won't mind it. Runs down the wicket and swings through the line, the outswinger takes the outside edge and flies over short third man

out Caught by Dhoni!! Gone! bowler has the big wicket and he's unstoppable. He goes off on a run like Tahir. Perfect start for team. team's lynchpin is sent back early. FOUR, AB is away. They need a move on and who better than batsman to rely on. Not a bad delivery by any means. Back of a length delivery and batsman thumps it over mid-on, one bounce and over the ropes

SIX, good end to the over. Parthiv hits the first six of the game. He waits for that short of length delivery and picks it off with a well timed pull shot, sails into the crowd near backward square leg
SIX, this time it comes off. bowler was a bit straight in his line and that allowed batsman to make contact, sets up a firm base and heaves it over deep square leg. That should make him feel good

1 run, oh! Faf almost pulls off a stunner. This would have been the catch of the tournament. batsman struck the off-drive uppishly towards mid-off, Faf times his jump perfectly and goes with one hand, it doesn't stick
SIX, Parthiv is peppering that backward square crowd. Another good length ball right in his arc, he maintains a low base and heaves it with a clean bat swing over the rope
FOUR, Thakur has lost his line in the last 10 balls or so. Strays on the pads and that is easy pickings, batsman flicks it in front of square and Tahir's dive was nowhere close to the ball

FOUR, 16 runs to end the powerplay. Thakur tries to follow the backing away batsman with a full delivery, but ends up bowling it in the slot, pumped right back over and the ball bounces just inside the fence

out Caught by du Plessis!! batsman gone! Faf judges it perfectly. bowler gets the big wicket. team's backbone is back in the hut within 7 overs. batsman shimmies down the wicket, isn't to the pitch and the ball turns a bit as well, the cue-end skies up towards long-off and Faf is right on the edge of the boundary rope. FOUR, lovely shot! Right out of the coaching manual. Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Fuller and outside off, Nath leans forward and creams the drive past mid-off. Thakur can only fetch it from the fence
SIX, that's the kind of form he is in! Can't bowl it there. On the pads and batsman flicks it over deep square leg with utter ease. Sweet!

FOUR, just look how quick the outfield is. This wasn't middled whatsoever but the pace makes it easier for batsman. Gets heaves across the line and gets it off the inside half of his bat, beats the fielder at short mid-wicket initially and finds the boundary thereafter
FOUR, sliding in on leg stump, batsman picks the line early, bends his back knee and swings it backward of square

FOUR, this is such a fantastic shot. He was beaten in length after stepping out, as Gopal pulled it well back. But Shaw remains undeterred, going through with the cover drive and creaming it to the fence
SIX, clears the front leg to a googly that was right in his slot and lofts it through the line over long-on. Clean strike from batsman

FOUR, Shaw has found the gap to perfection. There was a man at fine leg and at deep mid-wicket but batsman pulls it right between the two fielders. The timing was also good enough and it races to the fence

SIX, high and handsome! This should get batsman going. bowler was bowling brilliant slower ones but for some reasons he went for a yorker, misses it and ends up serving it right into the slot for batsman. He clears his front leg and hoicks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

2 runs, direct hit from the fielder at deep mid-wicket. But batsman is easily home. It was on a good length and was on the stumps, batsman tucks it wide of deep mid-wicket and charges back for a quick double

FOUR, excellent from batsman, he knows Kulkarni is one of the weaker bowler in this Royals attack and he wants to target him. The pace of Kulkarni allows batsman to go down on his kness and he half-sweeps-half-whips it over fine leg for a boundary

FOUR, batsman tumbles but batsman connects and gets a boundary. Things only batsman can do! He gets inside the line of the ball, goes down on his knees and almost paddles it over short fine for a boundary

SIX, fifty in a canter for batsman. Wow! This guy is a gem of a player. Archer misses his yorker, it was in the slot for batsman. He clears his front leg, gets in a good position and lifts it over deep square leg for a maximum
FOUR, fuller and on the stumps, batsman pumps it straight down the ground for a boundary. That went to the fence like a tracer bullet
no ball, FOUR, batsman has dispatched it for a boundary. It is a No-ball too, it was a full-toss above the waist height, batsman pumps it wide of fine leg for a boundary. Free-hit!

out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Much- needed wicket for Royals. It was a flighted delivery on a fuller length, batsman wanted to dispatch it over long-on. It spins away and due to that batsman failed to time it as well as he would have liked it. Parah at long-on came under it and takes it with utmost ease. batsman c Riyan Parag b bowler 42(39) [4s-4 6s-1]

SIX, first six for batsman in his IPL career. I am sure it's not the last. You cannot bowl length at this stage and bowler did exactly that. It was wide of off, batsman reaches for it and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket. It comes off the bottom half of the willow but the power that he posseses takes it over the fence

FOUR, that has raced to the fence in some micro seconds. It was in the slot for batsman, on that fuller length. He clears his leg and powers it with utter disdain, wide of deep cover for a boundary. The young man loved it too, he punches the air in delight

out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Staright to long-off. A short little cameo from batsman! He has helped bring down the required rate but would have wanted to take his team home. It was a slower one on a back of a length, batsman wanted to lift it over long-off ends up finding it where parag makes no mistake. batsman c Riyan Parag b bowler 11(5) [4s-1 6s-1]

SIX, batsman has dispatched it over for a maximum .Whatta hit from batsman! This has surely sealed the match for team. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, batsman comes under it and pumps it over long-on for a maximum

SIX, batsman has finished off the things in style. team win by 6-wickets and go top of the table. Incredible hitting from the southpaw. Hold On! Umpires are still checking whether that ball hit the rope on the full. It's a six and Delhi has sealed the victory!
FOUR, another sublime shot by Shikhar! Puts on his dancing shoes and bludgeons the shortish delivery through mid-on. The fielder was very square, hence this was always heading to the fence
SIX, what a superb shot by Shikhar! Trying to outplay the shots played by Rahane. Goes down on his knee and picks this one up with nonchalance to clear the fine leg fence

FOUR, he loves to bat on these kind of tracks, doesn't he? Walks down the wicket and lifts it over the bowler's head for four more. There was a fielder at long-on but this just manages to beat his sprint
FOUR, Gopal struggling against the left hander! batsman goes down on his knee and lifts the tossed up delivery over square leg for four runs this time around
FOUR, some lovely wristwork from batsman. Length ball at the stumps, picks it away through midwicket with great force off the wrists
FOUR, short of length at the body, Shaw's arms don't have the space to move freely, but he manages enough power through the swing to heave this over midwicket

1 run, Ashton Turner is having a nightmare. After three ducks in a row, he's now put down a skier. Thick top-edge on the pull shot from Shaw, Turner went back from position at midwicket to get under it, but it bounced off his palms
FOUR, walks across the stumps, receives a full toss and paddles it past short fine leg
FOUR, swats the off-cutter through midwicket for four more. He's looking in ominous touch. Just sits up so beautifully on this pitch for batsman to have a biff

1 run, driven off the back foot wide of Smith at extra cover. Good effort there with the dive, but can only make a half-stop, not enough to stop batsman from getting to his fifty. He's gone a few notches higher in these last few games
FOUR, short ball from Parag which is almost nonchalantly dispatched through midwicket. Way too easy
FOUR, short googly outside off, really ordinary stuff, and batsman isn't in the mood to let them get away. Smashes the pull wide of deep midwicket

out Stumped!! Gopal's come back superbly. He's spotted batsman advance down the pitch, and so he's fired this well wide outside off to beat him. Samson completes a nice stumping. batsman st Samson b bowler 54(27) [4s-8 6s-2]

out Caught by Stokes!! Iyer holes out at deep midwicket. Maybe the perils of good form, which gave him enough confidence to go after the bowling straightaway. But this comes right off the toe-end as he heaves it from outside off. Easy catch for Stokes. batsman c Stokes b bowler 4(5)

FOUR, batsman at his sublime best! Not all that full but a hint of width and he trusts the surface by driving on the up. Relied on timing and placed it through the crowded off-side cordon. Raced away past point in a flash

out Samson Run Out!! Absolute waste of a wicket! Samson is livid as he walks back to the hut but he is also partly to blame. Was an in-angler on a good length and batsman dabbed it towards the short mid-wicket region. Always was a risky run with bowler quickly moving across in his followthrough and there is a massive mix up with Samson way down the track. All three stumps to aim at and bowler doesn't miss. Not the start that the Royals were looking for. Samson run out (bowler) 0(0)
FOUR, crisply struck! Another delightful shot from batsman. Overpitched and he is well forward to this one, times the straight drive with aplomb to send it racing past the right of mid-off
FOUR, typical Steven batsman! All wristy. Ambles down the pitch and uses those whippy wrists to time and place the flick in the gap wide of long-on
FOUR, stays inside the crease this time, uncorks his wrists and flays the cut in the gap behind point
1 run, skates down and flicks the flatter delivery off his pads to deep mid-wicket. 100-run partnership's up
FOUR, poor delivery from bowler! Bowls a slower ball but he's dished it on batsman's pads, tickled away past short fine. Easy!

FOUR, this is batting practice for Steven batsman. He had all the time in the world to smash this slower length ball outside off and smash it he does. Clears his front leg and clobbers it wide of the fielder at long-on
FOUR, make that three in a row! Too full and batsman slices the drive behind point
SIX, this is innovation at its very best! Moved across his off-stump and uses Morris' pace to lap the full ball high and over the fine leg fence

FOUR, that's just a check shot and batsman timed that to perfection. Waits for the pitched up delivery to arrive and crunches it with a straight bat face, no heavy backlift but it still flies over the man at mid-off
1 run, biffed to mid-off and that'll be Steven batsman's 8th IPL fifty

out Caught by Chris Morris!! How often have we seen this? A batsman throwing it away after reaching the milestone. batsman uses his feet, looks to go straight and throws his weight into the lofted hit over mid-off, he seemed to have got enough height on that but Morris set himself cleverly on the edge of the long-off boundary to claim a well-judged catch. batsman c Chris Morris b bowler 50(32) [4s-8]
FOUR, comes dancing down the pitch and punch-drives the full delivery to the left of mid-off, batsman batting with full freedom and he has got the license to do that

FOUR, timed! That's what you get with class players like batsman. Just stands his ground, waits for the fullish delivery to arrive and chips the drive over cover with an air of confidence. All the way...
FOUR, full toss around the knee roll, batsman stays still and flicks it over the square leg umpire. No need to run for those...

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! batsman is disappointed with himself and rightly so. He's failed to take toll of a full toss. Doesn't really move around the crease, just looks to power it away over mid-wicket but doesn't get the required timing on that. Catching practice for Shreyas Iyer at long-on. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 8(8) [4s-1]

2 runs, batsman drives this one to long-off and calls for two. The throw came in at the bowler's end and Turner just manages to get back in, the throw was a flat one but a direct-hit would have been curtains for the Austraian

2 runs, relief for batsman! What a fantastic knock this has been. Notches up his second IPL century and raises his bat to acknowledge the crowd. There was no need for him to bat down the order. This is where he's at his best - as an opener. Plays the length delivery with soft hands to long-on and manages to storm back for two. Take a bow Jinx!

out Caught by Rutherford!! Hat-trick of golden ducks for batsman! Becomes the first ever batsman to get out for five successive ducks in T20 cricket. Can you believe it! Things going from bad to worse! Gets deceived due to the slower delivery once again and chips the fullish delivery straight to Rutherford at extra cover. batsman c Rutherford b bowler 0(1)

FOUR, not a great day for bowler in the field. Since that run-out of Samson, nothing has gone his way. Even this was a false shot but the end result is a boundary. Nothing's working for the speedster. Drags back the length on his delivery and batsman ends up top-edging it over the keeper's head as he hacks across the line

FOUR, boundary to end the over but Morris wouldn't mind - concedes only 8 runs in it. This was in the slot and batsman heaves it into the vacant region at cow-corner. The fielder was perhaps inside the circle and that shall be four more for the all-rounder

out Bowled!! You miss, I hit. bowler goes full and straight, very close to a yorker. batsman makes room to smash that but the speed is enough to beat him. Goes through his flashy drive and knocks over the middle-stick. Picks up the ball and hands over to bowler too. batsman b bowler 19(13) [4s-2]
FOUR, that's a full toss on the pads and batsman whips it past the man at fine leg who had no chance to stop this. He was a touch too fine in order to cut this down

FOUR, whipped over the infield! Clever batting from batsman, got one tossed up and he didn't go hard at this one. Just used his wrists and ensured that he got it over mid-wicket as there was nobody in the deep. Makes terrific contact and reaps the reward. He's looking good tonight

out Bowled!! Bull's eye! bowler cleans up Parag with a full toss as the batsman backs away to smash the ball away. At the speed of which bowler is bowling, it's never so easy. The leg stump is uprooted but Rajashtan have managed to post an excellent score of 191/6. batsman b bowler 4(3) [4s-1]

FOUR, just past a diving Rabada! Was always difficult for him to take this but made a heroic effort nevertheless. Pitched by bowler and batsman went for loft down the ground. Got it straight but Rabada from mid-on sensed it and moved swiftly to his left before diving mid-air. Past him and to the fence

no run, Ishant spills a sitter! Embarrassing stuff from team's senior man. batsman shuffled well across for the sweep and skewed it aerially to short fine leg. Straightforward take but Ishant spills it. How costly will this be?

SIX, superb hit! Adding insult to injury, is batsman. Charges down on seeing the flight and hoists it merrily straight down the ground. Plenty of elevation and also has the distance as this crashes into the sightscreen
FOUR, Ishant won't want to watch this, his drop has started to cost heavily already. Flatter one from bowler and batsman gets across to sweep this well over short fine leg. Clean strike and more runs

SIX, excellent hit from batsman! Refreshing intent from the team former captain and he is wading into the bowling. Short of a length from bowler and Jinks just backs away to flat-bat this down the ground. Such fine connection that it goes all the way. Superb stuff!

FOUR, batsman is in overdrive in this Powerplay. Raining boundaries at the moment. bowler spills one on the pads and that's criminal with fine leg up. batsman just gets a tickle on it and sends it racing past that fielder to the fence in no time
2 runs, superb running and it's an easy brace. Was knocked gently through mid-on and with the dimensions being as big as it is, there's a two to be had if you can run hard

FOUR, fist pump from batsman as he gets to his fifty! Seems determined to make a statement tonight and to be honest, it's been his best knock in ages. Fractionally short and he dispatches the pull over mid-wicket. There is a man in the deep but Jinks has placed it wider. He is flowing freely at the moment, needs to bat through from team's POV

FOUR, brilliant placement! There is a fine leg and deep mid-wicket in place but batsman has bisected them beautifully. Gets on the pads and he duly flicks it through square leg. Called for two but such is the timing that it leaves the deep fielders with no chance of getting to it
FOUR, excellent placement from batsman! Uses his feet, gets closer to the pitch of the delivery and whiplashes it over mid-wicket, right in the gap between the fielders in the deep
FOUR, batsman unleashing class! Skips out of his crease and plays a gorgeous inside out drive over extra cover with sublime timing
FOUR, batsman is looking unstoppable at the moment! Picks the arm-ball, settles on one knee and paddles it fine of the fielder at short fine

out Stumped!! Walks right past the googly, didn't have a clue about it! Fuller length from Rashid, pitched around middle and batsman was looking to work it through the on-side, expecting a leg-break. Excellent stumping from Bairstow. batsman st Bairstow b bowler 38(24) [4s-6 6s-1]
FOUR, short of length outside off, guides it with an open face between backward point and short third man
FOUR, great crack of the bat as batsman crunched this flat-batted swipe wide of deep midwicket. Sandeep's slower ball was short in length and sat up
SIX, brings up his fifty in thunderous style! batsman roars back to form for team. Short ball, 116kph, and it goes soaring into the second tier
FOUR, smashed away! A trifle too short from Rashid and batsman picked the length early. Swivelled and pulled it hard, bisecting deep mid-wicket and long-on perfectly
FOUR, smacked away by batsman! Got down on his knees and swept this hard in front of square through the leg-side. Sandeep got across with a slide but couldn't palm it away properly

SIX, batsman is putting on a show alright! This is what confidence can do. He's a different player now and in some mood. Gets a flattish low full toss that's sent over cow corner with a slog sweep. Such a clean hit and he stares at Rashid

FOUR, he's in autopilot mode now, batsman! Gets to 8000 T20 runs! Not a bad ball, almost the perfect wide yorker from bowler but batsman is in the zone now. Waits deep in the crease and opens the bat face late. Bisects short third man and backward point easily

FOUR, deft once again! batsman wants to finish this in a hurry. Slightly shorter this time, not much room but he plays is late with an open face. Gets it wide of Bairstow and short third man had no chance

SIX, smokedddddddddddd! Nothing much you can do when batsman is hitting them like this. Not even Rashid has any answers. Tossed it up, inviting the big hit and that it was for sure. Blasted away by batsman over long-on for a mammoth blow

FOUR, 15 off the over! batsman is motoring towards yet another IPL century! Too short from Rashid and the Aussie sits back to pull this away through backward square leg. Short fine leg is the only man there
SIX, this is some hitting from batsman! Slower and short, climbs onto the short ball and muscles it over deep mid-wicket. Another huge hit!

out Caught by Bairstow!! batsman is walking! No century but hasn't he put on a show tonight or what! Was a good short ball from bowler and batsman got rushed on the pull. There was a definite top edge as it went through to Bairstow who took a stunning one-handed catch, diving to his left. Ends a sensational knock from one of IPL's and T20 cricket's legend. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 96(53) [4s-9 6s-6]

Was a skimmer and Pandey in the deep showed good awareness as he caught this mid-air in an attempt to palm it back. Managed to parry it as well but the foot touched the ground outside the ropes Just 2 needed now!

out Caught by Shankar!! Anti-climax for the team fans in the stadium. batsman wanted the winning hit but departs. Ends up miscuing the pull and top edges it straight in the air. out batsman Run Out!! Appeal for a run-out taken upstairs! It's a direct-hit, mind you. Looks very close. Although batsman had put in a dive at the bowler's end, it's not enough. Touch and go! FOUR, that shall give him some confidence! Tad full in length around middle and leg, batsman goes down on his knee and sweeps it uppishly over square leg. Almost went the distance
SIX, short of length on middle, this off-cutter from Khaleel sits up nicely to be whacked. And batsman isn't one to refuse such opportunities. Belts it over the square leg boundary

FOUR, length ball outside off, batsman plants his foot back in the crease and hoists it over extra cover. Extraordinary shot, generating all that power from the bottom hand. Vijay Shankar's diving effort in the deep not enough
FOUR, short balls have had a history of troubling batsman, true, but not at 118kph. Muscles this pull well in front of square
FOUR, slower length ball on leg stump, too easy for batsman who is well aware of short fine leg's presence inside the ring. Just whips it past the man

FOUR, this isn't intentional, but it's useful. Length ball outside off, batsman had charged down looking to biff no matter what. So it doesn't matter to him that the ball's far away. He throws his hands at it, and ends up slicing it off the outside half over short third man

FOUR, fourth boundary of the over, third one in a row. The shackles have been broken. Slower ball on middle, batsman swipes agriculturally and gets enough off the inside half to impart the legs to roll into the square leg boundary
SIX, massive over for team, 22 off it. Short of length on leg stump, pulls it away ferociously and hits the cushions on the full

SIX, this time he does get under the short ball, and absolutely pummels it over backward square. It's his favourite pull shot, and bowler's lack of bounce isn't going to dissuade him once the length's there

FOUR, Rashid jumps away from the path of this bullet-drive from batsman. He had made the mistake of overpitching, but he wasn't going to make the mistake of risking himself once batsman drilled it back. Smartly so
FOUR, short ball outside off, seemed like an intentional dab from batsman, although Warner wasn't far from getting a hand at slip. With the pace of Rashid, this absolutely flew off batsman's bat

1 run, dropped by Bairstow! It was a meaty outside edge from batsman, who was looking to swing through the line of this full ball. Bairstow dives to his right, goes with one hand, but it doesn't stick
byes, FOUR, goes right through batsman, but bounces over the stumps. That's beaten everyone. An absolute ripper from Rashid

out Caught by Dhoni!! An excellent IPL comes to a sorry end for Jonny. And bowler as he has done throughout this IPL delivers for team with the new ball. It was a quicker one and was wide of off, it skids off the deck, takes the outside edge of batsman who plays down the wrong line. And Dhoni makes no mistake, he never does! batsman c Dhoni b bowler 0(2)

FOUR, intent from batsman straightaway, much better from the Karnataka lad. It was a flighted delivery and was spinning back into Manish, he plunges forward and lofts it straight down the ground for a boundary
FOUR, Pandey is absolutely belting it today! Sees the slower full ball dip outside off and times the slap-drive to perfection, raced away to the deep cover fence
FOUR, one of batsman's best IPL innings this, brings up his fifty in 25 balls. Picks the slower ball early, times his swivel and pulls it past the diving left hand of short fine
1 run, quicker on middle and leg, tucked away into the leg-side and that'll be 43rd IPL fifty for David batsman
FOUR, he's in overdrive is batsman! Jumps out of his crease, shows no signs of fear and pumps bowler straight down the ground for a one-bounce boundary

out Stumped!! Gives it plenty of air and catches batsman on the move. No balance from pocket rocket, swings wildly and the bottom hand comes off while doing so, his back foot got dragged too far in the process and Dhoni ain't missing that stumping chance. batsman st Dhoni b bowler 57(45) [4s-3 6s-2]
SIX, effortless stroke from Vijay batsman! Lets the googly dip and marmalizes it for a 84-metre maximum over long-on
SIX, dispatched! Short in length around off and batsman pumps it over the cow corner for half a dozen! Sweetly timed blow

FOUR, another fine shot by batsman! Looks in sublime touch. Reaches out for the overpitched delivery wide ball and chips it over cover-point. There were two fielders inside the circle and this ball cleared them by some distance

1 run, Raina drops a sitter! Not only his batting, but his fielding hasn't been great either. A couple of misfields earlier in the innings and now he puts one down. Pandey got deceived due to the slower delivery as he miscued it towards mid-off where Raina fails to cling on to the catch
FOUR, in the slot and batsman drags it over the infield at mid-wicket. There were two fielders in the deep but this was placed right into the gap as he heaved the length ball across

out Caught by Jadeja!! Deepak bowler ends his spell with a wicket. Just 7 runs in that over. batsman was looking to clear the deep mid-wicket fence with this heave but he couldn't get the timing right. Holes out to the fielder in the deep and that brings an end to batsman's handy cameo. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 26(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, you cannot miss your length by an inch against batsman. It was marginally short and was directed on the body, batsman gets in an excellent position and times the pull shot brilliantly. It goes over square leg and races to the fence

SIX, batsman attacks bowler straightaway and gets a maximum. This is going to be an interesting battle. It was a flighted one and was on the stumps, batsman takes a good stride forward and lofts it straight down the ground for a maximum

SIX, Pandey Ji means business today! He has promoted to number three and he looks in no mood to waste this opportunity. It was an offie on the stumps and batsman larrups it over long-off for a maximum

FOUR, that's a tennis forehand, Roger would have been proud of that. It was a good length delivery and was just wide of off, nothing wrong with the delivery. But batsman flat-bats it wide of the bowler and the timing was so good that it canters to the fence
FOUR, smashed! It as full and was on the stumps, batsman pumps it down the ground, bowler did well to get his head out of the way. It runs along the carpet for another boundary
FOUR, flighted delivery down the leg-side, batsman goes deep in the crease and tucks it wide of the leg-slip, it beats short fine and will reach the boundary too. Pandey is on fire!
FOUR, Dhoni shouts Na na na from behind as it was a short one, it was wide of off too. batsman rocks back and cuts it wide of short third. Another boundary for Pandey!
FOUR, dispatches the first delivery of bowler for a boundary. It was wide of off, batsman plunges forward and tonks it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary. It spilts the gap to perfection

1 run, sharp bumper on the face, batsman was surprised by how quickly it came to him. He mistimes the pull totally and ends up hitting it just to the left of the side wicket. Bravo charges quickly towards but fails to pick up the ball cleanly. And he is gutted with himself
SIX, launched!! Slightly fuller and in the arc for batsman, he stays low and smokes it into the stands over cow corner
SIX, that's the biggest of the lot! Pandey on fire...picks up the flight, gets underneath it and hammers it high and soaring into the second tier over long-on
FOUR, batsman is underway! Fullish ball outside off, batsman reaches out and throws the kicthen sink. Sliced over point and the Universe Boss collects his first boundary

FOUR, nicely done! Not a shot that you'd normally assocciate with batsman. Short of a length ball outside off and the lefty used the bowler's pace to guide it through backward point and short third man
FOUR, 14 off the opening over! bowler continues to have a terrible IPL. A wide half-volley outside off and batsman flays it over backward point. Third boundary for batsman!
FOUR, another bad ball! Slants in a back of a length delivery at 137kph, straighter line as well. batsman, with one leg off ground, controls the pull through backward square leg
FOUR, horror ball! An overpitched delivery on the pads - almost pleading the batsman to punish. And, KL doesn't miss out. Flicks it handsomely behind square on the leg-side

out Caught by Southee!! Ali strikes with his very first ball. His introduction was too tempting for batsman, who advanced down and wanted to loft it straight. But he gets too close to the pitch of it, and miscues it off the toe-end for a simple catch at long-off. Kohli explodes in celebration, probably even gave a send-off. Two new batsmen at the crease now. batsman c Southee b bowler 42(27) [4s-7 6s-1]

SIX, he has got his eye in and he has smashed this one for a gigantic six. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, batsman backs away, clears his leg, gets under it and tonks it over long-off for a maximum
SIX, another six. batsman gave himself room again, bowler follows him but batsman still had enough room to clear his arm and dispatch it over long-off again
SIX, third six off the over! In the same area again. It was very full and on the leg-stump, batsman gets under it and launches it over long-off again. Into the stands
FOUR, batsman looks in his elements today. It was a slower one on the stumps, batsman picks it up early, delays his bat swing and smashes it over cover for a boundary
SIX, Mr batsman why were you hiding in the dressing room in the previous matches. It was a flighted one on a good length, batsman backs away, makes room and dispatches it over long-off
SIX, fifth six for batsman. He is putting on a show here. batsman clears his leg, keeps his shape and tonks it over long-on for another six. He is dealing in sixes at the moment!

FOUR, batsman welcomes bowler with a four. It was a good length delivery on the stumps, batsman wanted to cut it wide of backward point, gets an outside edge and it races fine of third man for a boundray
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for batsman. It was a slower one on the stumps, batsman picks it up early and powers the pull shot wide of deep mid-wicket for another four

1 run, the horror IPL for team in the field continues. It was a sitter, an absolute sitter. Kohli must be livid, he has turned his face away from the camera. It was a length delivery on the stumps, batsman fails to time the heave. It was in the air for an eternity and Stoinis at long-on had all the time in the world to settle himself. He spills it though

out Caught by de Villiers!! ABD takes it again. He is having a dream of a match. And the dangerous batsman departs. team are surely winning it now. SIX, wow! batsman has dispatched it for a six. Can he replicate MSD? Yadav misses the yorker, batsman comes under it and pumps it over long-on

And he has hit it straight to Kohli who it seems was asking batsman what the heck he was doing? batsman fails to get under it and mistimes it, hits it straight to Kohli at long-on. batsman absolutely throws his gloves after crossing the fence.
