1 run, dropped! Kohli drops a dolly. He might have been more worried about the celebration. Slower one on the stumps, batsman is completely deceived and he still goes through with the big hit, mistimes it towards long-on and the team skipper makes a mess of it

FOUR, batsman greets the new bowler with a boundary. Shortish ball at 139.7kph, batsman stays back in the crease and pulls it straight of mid-on. He got it almost off the toe end, but that's more than enough to run away for a boundary
FOUR, shot! Class written all over it. A short of length ball at 145.1kph, batsman gets on top of it and punches it superbly through the covers, beating a diving Chahal
FOUR, Saini over-corrects. He doles out a half-volley at 146.4kph outside off. batsman gets forward and plays the lofted off-drive over extra cover
SIX, this is bad bowling! A full toss and batsman doesn't need second invitation to put it away. Hoisted over long-on for half-a-dozen

out Caught by de Villiers!! batsman's gone, Kohli is pumped. Umesh Yadav shortens his length and batsman is a touch late into his stroke. The southpaw was trying to heave it away and got it slightly off the top edge. Almost went the distance, but there was a fielder manning the fence. AB, at long-on, takes a calm catch. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 23(10) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, wow! Those wrists. Full ball on leg - a hit-me delivery and batsman whips it over mid-wicket
FOUR, stylish from Mayank batsman, whipping a length ball round his front pad. Nice bent front knee there, as he picked it away from off stump to the long leg boundary
FOUR, if the last one was batsman's brilliance, this one is bowler's mediocrity. Strays on leg stump and is glanced fine for four
SIX, this one drifts in on leg, sliding on with the arm, and batsman just lifts it through the line over long-on. A shot requiring great ability, especially as he's not to the pitch
FOUR, now he waits on the inevitable short ball and latches onto it. Cut away through the gap at point
FOUR, that's been absolutely lambasted through extra cover. Back of a length outside off, batsman slaps it red, leaves a vapour trail enroute to the boundary

FOUR, good length ball outside off, tentative footwork from batsman. But it doesn't cost him. Instead, he benefits. The loose poke results in an outside edge which runs away fine to the third man boundary

FOUR, short of length at the body, batsman's eyes aren't on the ball all the way through, but he's controlled the pull nicely behind square. And the timing is brilliant, even though he's checked the shot

SIX, skims over long-off's reach! Picked the googly there, which was overpitched anyway, and hammered it down the ground. Would've been worried for a brief moment, as he hadn't found the elevation, but it's high enough to escape Saini's one-handed leap
FOUR, short ball on off stump, which to be fair isn't that short as batsman's made it out to be. He collapses his back leg to get low and swats it wide of long-on

out Caught by Chahal!! He's got this pull high on the bat, and the miscue is taken at midwicket. bowler screams in celebration, Kohli screams louder. Short of length, it was onto batsman quicker than he expected, and so there was no timing on the shot. Much needed for the team. batsman c Chahal b bowler 35(21) [4s-5 6s-1]
FOUR, 135ks hint of width outside off and Parthiv lashes on it with a fierce cut through point. team and batsman off the mark in style
FOUR, 137ks, keep that coming says batsman...leans onto his front foot and hammers the pitched up delivery straight back over his skipper

no run, dropped! Hardus Viljeon is the fielder. Full and swinging into the pads, batsman unleashes his whippy wrists and sends a dolly of a catch to mid-wicket where Viljeon makes an absolute Bisi Bele Bath (dal rice) out of it. Oh dear!
FOUR, adding insult to injury. This one sits up outside off on a good length and batsman doesn't need any second invitation, holds his pose and crunches it wide of cover-point
FOUR, make that two in a row! This one's slightly wide of extra cover but batsman has timed the punch-drive to perfection
FOUR, a gimme on the pads, batsman gets inside the line and helps it away to the fine leg fence, bowler's pace takes care of the rest
SIX, much needed six for batsman and team. Also gets the crowd out of their slumber. Tosses up the leg-break and offers space for batsman to free his arms, he muscles it over long-off
FOUR, can't bowl short at 135.2ks to batsman, he rocks back and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Couple of bounces and into the fence. team will hope this can get AB going
SIX, and again.. bowler persists with the short of length delivery, this time batsman decides to put him in the crowd, quick swivel on the back foot and the pull is sent over deep mid-wicket
SIX, a hit-me delivery and batsman bludgeons it. Half tracker and batsman picked his spot - deep mid-wicket and sends the ball sailing into the crowd with a pull shot
FOUR, that's a freebie from bowler! A low full toss at 139.7kph on the pads, batsman flicks it fine and the ball reaches the fence in a jiffy. The boundary brings up AB's fifty!
SIX, watch out, those in the press box! Off-pace ball from bowler, but he's doled out a half-volley. AB batsman gets underneath it and bludgeons it downtown for a massive six
SIX, slower ball at 124.2kph, it was wider outside off and batsman had to reach out for it. Slightly bends his back leg and lofts it over long-off
SIX, back-to-back sixes! Almost an action replay off the previous ball. batsman was clearing his front leg, bowler bowls another slower delivery and AB smokes it over long-off

SIX, make that three in a row! This one's landed on the roof! An above-waist full toss - not called a no-ball though. batsman, surprised by the height of the ball, takes his eyes off the ball, but managed to heave it over long leg. Incredible! Gayle, meanwhile, suggests that it was a fair delivery. Another non-no-ball controversy at the Chinnaswamy?
SIX, batsman moves into the 80s. bowler bowls length - a crime at this stage and AB slogs it over cow corner for another sixer
FOUR, full toss and batsman has flicked it away through backward square leg. team nearing 200!
SIX, 17 off the over with two balls to go! In the slot and batsman has smoked it over long-on
FOUR, high full toss - just below waist - and sliding down leg. batsman helps it on its way to the fine leg fence
FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes! batsman picks the length early, swivels and bullies the pull shot over square leg umpire, fine leg had no chance
SIX, 27 runs off the final over! Poor bowling from bowler. Another length delivery, sits up nicely for batsman, who swings his bat hard and deposits it over long-on

out Caught by Mandeep!! batsman throws it away once again. Looks to thump the drive over the ring, but gets hit high on the bat and Mandeep takes a dolly of a catch (head-high) at extra cover. bowler always gets a bit of extra zip with his pace and the ball seem to have arrived much quicker than batsman anticipated. batsman c Mandeep b bowler 13(8) [4s-2]
FOUR, 142ks sits up nicely outside off, AB thrashes it with a cross bat swing past the diving left hand of mid-wicket
SIX, slower ball in the slot for batsman. Doesn't move an inch, just pumps it for a clean maximum straight down the ground
FOUR, juicy length delivery outside off, Parthiv had plenty of time and he takes full toll of it, lifts the drive over mid-off with an air of nonchalance
FOUR, full toss outside off, Parthiv leans back a touch and slices the drive behind point. The height on that seemed a bit touch-and-go but guess the umpire got it right
FOUR, Parthiv is belting it to all corners. Poor bowling from bowler, gives plenty of width on offer outside off and that's been smashed over cover in a jiffy
SIX, too easy for batsman! Angling in and perfect length to hoick, he creams it over mid-wicket for scintillating maximum

out Caught by Ashwin!! The Ashwin duo does it. batsman stands in disbelief, he is cursing himself as he walks back to the pavilion. A well flighted delivery around middle and leg and thus, Parthiv thought he could flick it away into the leg-side, wasn't to be. Might have played the shot a touch too early and the leading edge pops up straight to the team skipper at extra cover. batsman c Ashwin b bowler 43(24) [4s-7 6s-2]
FOUR, off the mark with a boundary, although a streaky one. Legbreak outside off, Moeen seeks to drive and feeds a thick outside edge which flies fine past the fielder at short third

out Bowled!! bowler is jumping in joy and he has every reason to be so. Throws in a slider and he has beaten batsman all ends up, there was a huge gap between bat (on the lazy drive) and pad and the ball snuck through at a cunning pace to rattle middle and leg. batsman b bowler 4(5) [4s-1]

out Caught by Mandeep!! Stunned silence at the Chinnaswamy. They lost three wickets in three overs and are now in big trouble. Clever change of pace, on a length as well, Nath presses forward and has to check his shot, spoons a sitter to cover. batsman c Mandeep b bowler 3(7)

out Bowled!! Chopped on! bowler strikes and early troubles for team. A back of a length delivery at 140.9kph wide of off. It was there to be hit, but Lynn was lethargic as he threw his bat at it without any feet movement. Gets a big inside edge which cannons onto this sticks. Replays show that the ball nipped in a touch. batsman b bowler 0(3)
leg byes, FOUR, drifts one on the pads and batsman fails to put bat on the tickle. The ball brushes the thigh pad and beats the diving keeper to run away to fine leg

FOUR, uppish, but in the gap. bowler offers width on this short of length delivery and batsman doesn't go hard at it. Stays back in the crease and dabs it aerially through the gap between backward point and cover-point. He used the bowler's pace (143.4kph) to good effect
SIX, much needed shackle-breaker for batsman and team. Gopal drags back the length and batsman is all over it, quickly pouncing back in his crease and nailing the pull over deep mid-wicket

FOUR, cheeky! team need a kick on and who better than their skipper. batsman waits for the leg-break and he opens the bat face at the last second, the ball races past the diving short third man fielder

FOUR, sloppy! Binny has just gifted three runs. Nothing but a nudge to long-on and he came racing in to stop the second, the batsmen were never going to take it, overruns the ball and allows it to trickle into the fence
FOUR, batsman getting the momentum for team. A low dipping full toss outside off, batsman creams the drive past extra cover and long-off had no chance to get across
SIX, batsman joins the act. Big over for team, 25 off it and brings the innings back on track. Googly in the slot, batsman bends a bit and muscles the slog sweep into the crowd near deep mid-wicket

SIX, Archer looks around in disbelief. He's not sure how that cleared the rope. Short of length around the hips, batsman is on the hop as he plays the flick and the ball keeps sailing over backward square leg

out Narine Run Out!! Oh no! What have you done batsman? team didn't need this against the run of play. Slower delivery is nurdled in front of fine leg, batsman is always looking for the second but he should know his partners well, Narine is not the swiftest and he's relcutant to go but does so after seeing his skipper next to him. Aaron throws to the bowler's end and Narine is nowhere near the frame. Narine run out (Aaron/Rahane) 11(8) [4s-1 6s-1]

SIX, sails into the crowd. Not the delivery to bowl on this surface - short and outside off, batsman at no point in time tried to keep the cut down, used the pace on the track and slashed it over backward point

FOUR, finishes his spell with a boundary. But that still doesn't spoil his figures - 4-1-20-2. bowler stopped and caught his hamstring and then went back to rebowl this final ball. A bit of a niggle might have hampered his line and length - short and outside off, batsman slaps the cut square and it races off the turf to beat sweeper cover

1 run, dropped! Oh no Stuart! That is the last thing you want to do to a batsman like Russell. Slower short of length delivery outside off, Russell delays his slap and still hits it straight to sweeper cover, Binny bends down and lets it slip out of his grasp. How costly would that be?

SIX, he's already starting to hurt them. Slower delivery on the stumps, Russell goes deep in the crease with a cleared front leg and then uses that raw power of his to deposit it into the deep mid-wicket stand

SIX, shot! The only thing wrong with the delivery was it was too straight, on middle and leg, batsman stays deep in the crease and picks it up nonchalantly over long leg. He just manages to clear the rope

1 run, fifty for batsman. He needed this. team needed this. They needed their captain back in form and leading from the front and batsman has done just that today. Back of a length around off, batsman waits and steers it down to third man

1 run, dropped! Once is a sin. What do you call dropping a guy like Russell twice? Prashant Chopra, on as a substitute, puts down the skier. Short of length outside off, Russell had to reach out for his muscled hoick to leg and all he could manage was a toe-end straight up, Chopra circles underneath near point and spills it. Smith is not a happy captain

out Caught by Riyan Parag!! bowler wins the Caribbean battle. Third time lucky for team. Binny and Chopra can't breathe easy now. No fireworks from Russell today. A good short delivery that had height on it, Russell had to fetch the pull from above his head, he cue-ends it and picks out Parag at deep mid-wicket. The youngster didn't flinch while taking such a high pressure catch. batsman c Riyan Parag b bowler 14(14) [6s-1]

SIX, just over. That last delivery somewhat ruins bowler's figures - 4-0-32-1. He was unleashed on a surface that aided him and the tall pacer has repaid the decision. This was a back of a length delivery and batsman was waiting for it, goes deep in the crease and pumps it over long-on. Not much Stokes could do there
FOUR, nicely played. bowler deceived batsman with a slower ball, but the latter adjusts well to roll his wrist and flick it fine past the fielder at 45. Good start to the over

out Caught by Rahane!! Gone! batsman does not make a mark at Eden Gardens. Another cutter and batsman wanted to heave it into the crowd, does not generate enough power and mistimes it towards deep mid-wicket, where the safest hands are under it. Rahane runs to his right and takes a good catch. batsman c Rahane b bowler 5(3) [4s-1]

FOUR, with all the power hitters back in the hut, the onus falls on batsman to get team to a good score. He waits for the slower delivery and back cuts it behind point - bisecting short third man and backward point expertly

FOUR, Rahane almost pulls off a stunner. Slower short of length delivery and batsman takes it on, the pull goes in front of square and Rahane covered a lot of ground from deep mid-wicket, dives full length to his right and gets both hands, but the ball pops out once he hit the surface and rolls into the ad cushions. He might have hurt himself there
SIX, wow! How did he generate the power? Back of the hand slower delivery, sits up outside off and batsman still had a lot to do, he forehands the slap over extra cover and it travels the distance
SIX, consecutive sixes to end Archer's spell. This short ball was around leg-stump, batsman gets inside the line and plays the pick up pull to send it sailing into the crowd

FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes. batsman needs to keep going for the final four balls. bowler missed the yorker and batsman was up for it, deep in the crease and whipping it with a lot of bottom hand to cow corner

SIX, this time it goes the distance. batsman also gets to his highest IPL score. Can he get a hundred? bowler is bowling it in the slot and batsman muscles it with all his might over long-on. Smith has a worried look

SIX, bowler is not learning. He keeps bowling those slower balls right in the batsman's arc, batsman sets up with a good base deep in the crease and then swings through the line, straight back over the bowler

FOUR, good shot! Used the bowler's pace and Gill collects his first boundary. A short-and-wide ball at 145.6kph, Gill hops and scythes it behind backward point. No chance for the third man fielder to even get close to it

FOUR, batsman gets into an awkward position, but manages to collect a boundary. A short ball that climbs at the batter, but the line was leg-stump. Rana, despite not being in a great position, managed to get a glove on it. Raced away to the fine leg fence
FOUR, put away! A short-and-wide delivery at 150kph, Gill stands tall in his crease and cuts it superbly behind backward point. Reaches the fence in a jiffy

out Bowled!! That's a beauty from Varun bowler! The slower knuckle ball from the pacer swung in sharply and Gill couldn't account for it. He was looking to ease it through the off-side and ended up playing outside the line of it. A faint inside edge and the ball crashes onto the stumps. Varun bowler has removed both the openers. batsman b bowler 14(14) [4s-2]
FOUR, a poor ball! bowler darts a rank half-tracker outside off, cut hard wide of backward point. Easily put away

out Caught by Aaron!! team are struggling here. Varun Aaron in action again. A quick-ish googly that skids through off the deck outside off. On seeing the line, batsman went hard on the cut. He didn't bother to keep it down and paid the price. Offers a dolly to backward point and Aaron doesn't err. batsman c Aaron b bowler 21(26) [4s-3]
FOUR, edged and four! Another away-turner and batsman cut hard from the crease. Gets a fat edge that eludes first slip and runs away to third man for a boundary

FOUR, up and over! batsman is away and so are the Royals. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, batsman plunges forward and lofts it over cover. He gets enough bat on it to clear the in-field and once it lands, it races towards the fence

FOUR, clears the in-field with ease. This is fearless cricket from batsman. It was missing from his game when he was the skipper. It was in the slot for him on a fuller length and he hoicks it over mid-on for another four
SIX, gee! How on earth that cleared the ropes. batsman heaved at this good length delivery, it came off the toe end of the blade and went straight down the ground for a maximum
FOUR, he has whipped it away magnificently well. Gee! This man can bat. bowler misses the yorker, it ends up being in the slot for batsman and he uses his wrists to smash it wide of long-on

out Caught by A Russell!! Miscues the googly off the toe-end, and this is a brilliant catch at the edge of the boundary from Andre Russell. He leapt up, grabbed it overhead with both hands, and then landed with his feet just inside the ropes. batsman is done for this season, a rather disappointing one for him! batsman c A Russell b bowler 11(10) [4s-2]
SIX, nails the slog-sweep over cow corner! Got into position quickly and unleashed his arms across the line of this delivery
FOUR, thick top-edge on the pull from Parag, loops over the keeper's head and bounces once before crossing the ropes

out Caught by Rinku Singh!! batsman goes for the slog-sweep and holes out at deep midwicket. Considering spin has done all the damage so far, and that this is bowler's final over, this isn't the smartest shot. He doesn't connect as well as he would've wanted, and gives Rinku Singh a simple catch in the deep. batsman c Rinku Singh b bowler 11(11) [6s-1]

FOUR, premeditates this. He walks across the stumps for the scoop. His determination enables him to adjust to the length, which is slightly shorter than what he hopes for, but nevertheless, he's able to paddle it away past short fine leg
FOUR, sizzling drive through extra cover, punishing this overpitched delivery from Russell. team are still in this while this pair's around
FOUR, short ball outside off, a response to Gopal's charge off the previous ball you'd think. And Gopal's expecting it. He waits on the back foot and slaps it through backward point
FOUR, short ball again, this time much straighter, and so Gopal pulls it hard through square leg for four more

FOUR, this is brilliant from Gopal, again proving his value and ability with the bat. Such a terrific cricket shot. Flighted up outside off, he stretches onto the ball and creams the drive through extra cover. Superb timing to beat long-off

out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Full ball on off, Gopal's loft is a mistimed one, and it's taken comfortably by long-off running in. Probably didn't need to press the trigger so early. batsman c Shubman Gill b bowler 18(9) [4s-4]
FOUR, short of length at the body, Archer looked like he was expecting it. He thumps the pull well in front of square
SIX, takes bowler on and whacks this length ball straight back down. Flat-batted slap that skims over the boundary ropes in front of the sightscreen
FOUR, shuffles across to a ball that's straying on leg stump and helps it fine for four. What an over this is turning out to be for team
FOUR, that's raced off the inside edge into the fine leg boundary. Nothing anyone could've done about it. Length ball homing in on off, Parag swings off his feet and sees his luck smiling on him
SIX, dug in short at pace, good height too, but it's flown into the crowd. Parag has swivelled across quickly and helped the pull over backward square. This is sensational batting
SIX, just clears Carlos Brathwaite at long-on! Slower short ball outside off, seemed like a mishit initially as Parag swung the forehand into the sky, but it kept going and going

out Hit Wkt!! Oh dear, Parag's bat has clattered into the stumps. He was rushed for pace on this short ball, just managed some glove on the attempted pull but proceeded to disturb the stumps on the followthrough. That's a bit unlucky, if you can call it that. What a knock he's played though to put his team in pole position. batsman hit wkt b bowler 47(31) [4s-5 6s-2]
FOUR, flies off the outside edge over short third man! Full ball outside off, Archer swings for the rafters, only just reaching it with the toe-end and slicing it into the boundary
SIX, it takes two balls for Archer to wrap it up! This one's right in the slot from bowler to which Archer clears the front leg and wallops it over long-off. Sensational win for the Rajasthan Royals

FOUR, brilliant from batsman! Class written all over it. It was on a good length and was just wide of off, batsman waits for it to arrive and opens the face of the bat at the very last moment. He found the gap between backward point and cover fielder to perfection

SIX, that's a high quality shot from a high-quality batsman. It was in the slot for batsman on a fuller length, he keeps his shape brilliantly and larrups it straight down the ground for a maximum. He held his pose for a wee bit too! Gee! He enjoyed it and so did we
SIX, batsman sends it into the crowd. It was a short of length delivery, batsman backs away, makes room, makes excellent use of good bounce and powers it over deep backward point for a maximum
FOUR, nothing much wrong with this delivery but batsman is in magnificent touch now. He identifies the length early, gets in a good position and smashes it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary

FOUR, this is excellent from batsman. He is giving the treatment to the young man. There was just a little bit of width on this delivery, batsman opens the face of the bat at the very last moment, made brilliant use of his wrists and guides it wide of backward point for another four

out Lbw!! bowler gets the first breakthrough for team. Eden has found it's voice back. It was pitched in that brilliant area around off and on a fuller length, it straightened after hitting the deck. batsman plays down the wrong line. It pinned him on the pads and looked plumb. batsman did well not to waste a review for it. batsman lbw b bowler 34(21) [4s-5 6s-1]
no run, batsman went for an across the line shot, and he was hit on the pads. He just managed to get an inside edge to it and that saved him there. An excellent over from bowler

out Bowled!! Cheekiness gets the better of batsman. He was trying to be too cute there, wanted to paddle it first then realised the line isn't there to play that shot. And went for a steer, in the end he got himself in a tangle and played a nothing shot. The googly went between his bat and pad and smashed the stumps. bowler is pumped! batsman b bowler 22(15) [6s-2]
FOUR, that's edged and four. batsman needs a little bit of luck to change his fortune. He drives down the wrong line, it clipped his outside edge and it went wide of first slip for a boundary

out Bowled!! bowler has gone through the defence of batsman. And this match has changed all of a sudden in the last couple of overs. Sensational spell from bowler. There was nothing special in the delivery, batsman just misses it and it smashes his stumps. The decision of DK to give the extra over to bowler has worked brilliantly. batsman b bowler 2(6)

no run, bowler drops an absolute dolly. You can't expect an easier catch than this. And he has no one else to blame. It spins back into batsman who chips it straight back to bowler. But he wasn't expecting it at all and ends up spilling it
FOUR, that's the batsman we know. He backs away, creates room and thumps this over mid-off for a boundary. No stopping that!

FOUR, missed out on his century by 4 runs in the previous game and here's a boundary two nights later. Short of a length outside off and Watto punches it firmly through the gap at covers. Lewis goes for the chase, puts in a dive near the fence as well but the momentum takes it away to the fence
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for batsman. Short ball down the leg side and batsman glances it past the fielder at short fine leg, off to a rocket start

out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! bowler could have conceded three boundaries in the over but luckily for him batsman picks out the fielder at short fine leg. The Sri Lankan had fired this one down the leg side and the Australian flicks it straight to the uncapped Indian at short fine leg. batsman can't believe his luck but such is cricket. He was dropped in the last game by Bairstow but not tonight. batsman c Rahul Chahar b bowler 8(4) [4s-2]

out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Scuffed off the inside half, taken at long-on. He wasn't quite to the pitch while going for the loft, and hence the miscue. team struggling to get the spinners away. batsman c Rahul Chahar b bowler 5(8)

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Has that been taken? They've gone upstairs to check, but it looks like a superb grab from Suryakumar. Soft signal is out. Short of length outside off, slower one, batsman mistimes the cut in front of backward point. Now then, Surya was diving forward there. Did he have his fingers underneath? The ball has bounced into his palm, but did it bounce off the fingertips, or the ground? Tough call with the replays that are available. Soft signal is out, so that may be telling. Or does the third umpire have enough evidence to overrule the soft signal? No he doesn't. OUT on the big screen. team dugout doesn't look too happy. But based on all evidence and the soft signal on the field, that's probably a fair call. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 38(35) [4s-3 6s-1]
FOUR, and batsman takes full toll of the free-hit. Slower ball from a back of a length, Bravo hangs back, stays leg-side of the ball and throws his bat at it to carve it over short third man
FOUR, Chahar pulls his length back and Bravo has taken advantage of that. Sees it, rocks back and swivels to pull it through the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on
SIX, much-needed six for the hosts. Yet another off-pace ball. batsman saw that coming. Waits for this short ball to come to him and biffs the pull over deep mid-wicket

out Caught&Bowled!! All the deliveries have been off-paced ones this over. Finally, it pays dividends for the Sri Lankan veteran. The cutter at 122kph and Bravo was early to close his bat-face. The ball popped up off the leading edge and bowler had to take a couple of steps backwards to gobble it up. batsman c and b bowler 20(17) [4s-2]

out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Krunal takes a good running catch! A seam-up short ball and batsman had to go after it. Looks to pull/heave it away and was a touch late on the shot. Gets it off the lower part of the bat. No timing, whatsoever. Krunal runs in from deep mid-wicket, keeps watching the ball, dives forward to complete a superb catch. batsman c Krunal Pandya b bowler 0(2)

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Third wicket for bowler! The slower ball does the trick again. The cutter at 114.4kph, it was actually in the slot, but batsman couldn't generate enough power with his big-swing of the bat. Holes out at long-on. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 1(3)

SIX, too predictable! batsman knows that bowler will bowl a slower ball. The length was on the shorter side and it sat up nicely for the southpaw. batsman cleared his front leg and thumped it over long-on

out Caught by Pollard!! A low full toss at 119kph, batsman goes for the lofted on-drive. Doesn't get the required elevation and Pollard takes a calm catch at long-on. Mumbai Indian win by 46 runs! batsman c Pollard b bowler 22(20) [6s-2]

FOUR, that wasn't a well timed shot by batsman will take it. Short ball outside off, slow in place and batsman cuts it over point. That was in the air and as he played it over the infield, he managed to beat the fielders

2 runs, blunder by Anukul Roy on debut, drops a sitter. batsman once again got deceived due to the slower delivery as he checked his shot. The ball ballooned towards backward point where the debutant fails to cling on to the catch. Nerves getting the better of him

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! That's a horrible shot by the team skipper! Swings hard at a short of a length delivery and miscues it completely. It's Suryakumar at backward point who takes the dolly, he ain't gonna drop those folks! Wicket on the first ball for Hardik, he got three against the same side at Wankhede a few weeks back. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 2(4)
FOUR, elegance personified! On the pads and batsman clips it with nonchalance over backward square leg. His best looking shot of the innings so far
SIX, another effortless shot! Stands tall and lofts the length delivery right over the bowler's head for a half a dozen. Took one hand off the handle but the timing was just so fantastic

out Bowled!! That last ball, which gripped, must've had a bearing in this dismissal. batsman, expecting some turn this time, plays outside the line of the ball which sneaks through and crashes into middle and leg. 99.1kph from bowler, just zipped through with the arm from round the wicket. batsman b bowler 0(3)

FOUR, uppishly pulled in front of deep backward square where Krunal Pandya charges in for the catch. Tough to say whether it carried, probably didn't, and because all his efforts were directed at going for the catch, he's not able to save the boundary

out Bowled!! Failed twice at the cut shot in the previous over from Chahar, and now Jadhav has perished to it. The line's too close to him this time as it skids in from round the wicket, absolutely no room to free the arms. Chops it back onto the stumps off the under-edge! bowler is having a ball out there. batsman b bowler 6(11)
1 run, drills the full toss back at Roy who got both hands at it, but it was hit really hard and just burst through. Half a chance

FOUR, batsman starts off in a stellar fashion. It was full and was curving away from batsman, he waits for the ball to deviate and guides it wide of cover for a boundary. He doesn't try to hit it too hard. Sweet timing!

FOUR, touch quicker and bowler also gives width outside off, batsman stays low and plays the square drive really late, the timing was such that the fielder from sweeper couldn't get across to stop that
FOUR, cheeky! Bravo goes short and outside off, batsman stands up and elevates it above the 'keeper. He just used the pace on the ball and pocketed a boundary

out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Taken! That ball was in the air for quite some time but Bravo was calm and composed to gobble it up. batsman had to go after the left-arm spinner, he heaves it with all his might towards deep mid-wicket, but got more air time than distance. Bravo never looked in trouble while taking that. batsman c Dwayne Bravo b bowler 32(30) [4s-3 6s-1]

1 run, fifty for batsman. First of the season and first in a long time. His last fifty also came against Chennai last year. He is set now and got the milestone out of the way, needs to launch to get Mumbai to a good total. He eases it wide of cover and calls for the single, there was a bit of confusion but they get it easily in the end

out Caught by Santner!! bowler returns, bowler strikes. Krunal was sent to counter the left-arm spinner and the leg-spinner but he perishes while doing so. Flighted around off-stump, Krunal kneels down and slog sweeps, he didn't get it anywhere close to the middle and ends up offering a sitter to Santner at deep mid-wicket. batsman c Santner b bowler 1(3)
FOUR, batsman looks at the base of his bat. A rank long hop and he cue-ends the pull towards deep mid-wicket, Shorey runs around the rope and dives over the ball. Poor effort from him

FOUR, Shorey again can't get there. Quicker and attacking the stumps, batsman heaves it to cow corner - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on, Shorey runs to his left this time and can't stop the boundary

SIX, ends bowler's spell with a maximum. Fraction short and batsman was quick to pick the length, he crouched a bit to get underneath the pull shot and sent it over a jumping Shorey at deep mid-wicket

out Caught by Vijay! bowler is amidst a magnificent spell, choking the Mumbai batsmen with his spin. Tosses this one up around off and batsman has to stretch in order to reach out. Lifts the ball high up in the air but fails in his quest to the clear the long-on boundary. Tired looking shot by the skipper but he's laid the foundation. Hopefully, Pollard and Pandya finish it off in style. They need to play out bowler first. batsman c Vijay b bowler 67(48) [4s-6 6s-3]

FOUR, first one of the innings for batsman. Finally gets one right. Wasn't middled though! Short of a length delivery that kept a touch low, KP swung hard at it and got an inside edge that rolled past the man at short fine leg. The fielder in the deep was very square too, hence he couldn't quite get there

FOUR, that's hammered! Right into the slot and the big arms take over. KP gets underneath it and smashes it over the bowler's head. Luckily there was some elevation, else Bravo's head could have been in trouble
FOUR, that's a short-arm jab. A full toss on off and Pandya's strong bottom hand does all the talking. Short-arm jabs over Pollard who was ducking for cover. Pressure back on Bravo!
SIX, 150 up for Mumbai and that too in style. Pandya latches on to the slower delivery, right into the slot and it's been muscled over the long-on fence, huge six

SIX, de kock continues his terrific form in this IPL. It was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, not that short from bowler. But batsman identifies the length early, gets in a terrific position and powers the pull shot over deep square leg for a maximum

FOUR, 10 off 2 in this over. bowler has been belted for the first time in powerplay. He is clearly not used to it. And his response will be interesting to see. It was touch fuller of good length, batsman picks up the length early and drives it like a boss. It beats cover and races to the fence

out Caught by Rayudu!! He was put under pressure by batsman in this over and he has responded in the best possible fashion with a wicket. Quality of a champion bowler. It was a well-disguised slower delivery, batsman was totally taken aback by it. His bat swing came down much much early, it clipped his top-edge and went straight up in the air. Rayudu with the gloves takes it with ease. And bowler picks up his mandatory wicket with the new cherry. batsman c Rayudu b bowler 15(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

FOUR, batsman has controlled that shot brilliantly and it will fetch him four. It was slower down the leg-side, batsman picks it up early, waits for it to arrive, gets on top of it and half-pulls it wide of fine leg for a boundary

FOUR, edged and four! Streaky but batsman would take it. It was on a good length and was wide of off, batsman wanted to drive it away from the body. He plays down the wrong line and inside edge takes it wide of stumps and into the fence
FOUR, four to finish the over. He has placed it brilliantly. It was short and was on the body, batsman swivels and pulls it wide of short fine for a boundary

SIX, has he cleared the fence, yes he has! Only just though! It was a flighted delivery, batsman dashes down to come close to the ball, bowler drags his length back. And batsman was not even close to the pitch he still goes through with the shot. And his audacity prevails as it clears deep mid-wicket

SIX, cleared the boundary with utmost ease this time. He looks in his elements today. Again, charges down the ground, wasn't to the pitch but he swings his willow hard and gets enough bat on it to pump it over long-on
SIX, smashed! bowler errs by landing it in the arc and batsman sends it straight back over him. Overpitched and the extension of the arms is enough to take it all the way over the boundary rope

FOUR, and again.. But not as well timed as the previous one. Flighted on a fullish length, batsman lofts it straight back over bowler and the ball bounces just inside the rope before beating the long-on fielder

FOUR, pinged off the middle! batsman starting from where he left off in his previous game in Jaipur. Waits for the length delivery to swing in and presents full face of the bat and massages the drive through extra cover. Sheer timing!!
SIX, magical timing from batsman! A length ball outside off, and this is barely an extension of an off-drive but he's struck it so sweetly. It's gone all the way. Class!

out Caught by Warner!! batsman throws his head back in disappointment as Warner completes the catch at long-off. He wanted to drive this much wider of him after giving himself some room. But couldn't open the face enough on contact. The timing is sweet, which is what brings Warner into play as it carries all the way to him. batsman c Warner b bowler 39(34) [4s-4 6s-1]

FOUR, this time he goes much wider of long-on for a boundary. Nice use of the feet which takes him close enough to the ball that he can confidently whip his wrists against the turn. Good start from batsman

FOUR, just look at the timing and placement on that shot! Making batting look so effortless. Kaul continues to leak boundaries. Goes wide this time around and batsman slices it past the fielder at point. The fielder in the deep sprinted across to his left but couldn't stop it from finding the fence

FOUR, another sublime shot! Tad short in length and batsman picks it with nonchalance over square leg. Again there was a fielder charging towards his right in the deep but the placement was just so perfect and the dive had no effect in the end result

2 runs, one of safest fielders has put down a catch now! Not a great day for team and Rashid's dropped catch sums up Hyderabad's day. batsman had hacked the short ball to deep mid-wicket where the Afghan leggie sprinted in, got his hands to it but couldn't quite cling on to it

FOUR, easy pickings! Short ball and down the leg side, around the hip and all batsman had to do is get some bat on it. Glances it very fine and the fielder in the deep was way too square to cut this down
FOUR, stand and deliver! Everyone's admiring the shot including the bowler. Tad short in length and batsman bludgeons it over mid-wicket. Almost went the distance such was the timing

FOUR, 50-run stand up for the third wicket but Samson has done majority of the scoring! batsman had flicked it to fine leg where Kaul slides to stop the ball. When he releases the ball to throw it, the fielder is in contact with the ropes. Nothing going team's way, nothing!

out Caught by S Kaul!! Khaleel ends his spell with a wicket. Cramps up the batsman with a short ball and batsman takes one hand off his bat as he looks to pull it away. The timing wasn't great as he miscued it to fine leg. Kaul was the man in the deep who almost made a mess of it. batsman has done his job though as his team is within touching distance of an emphatic win. batsman c S Kaul b bowler 22(16) [4s-3]

FOUR, batsman hits the winning boundary! Treks back and drags the short ball into the gap at cow corner. No fielders in the deep and Rajasthan Royals beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 7 wickets to spice up the points table
FOUR, gets a full delivery on the stumps, batsman picks the field change (long-on moved to mid-on for this delivery) and whips it with flair over the ring on the leg-side
FOUR, looks to follow batsman and spills a half-volley on the pads, batsman brings his bottom hand into play by whipping it powerfully wide of the fielder at deep square
SIX, too full on off-stump, batsman picks the flight and sits on one knee to dispatch it for a 75-metre maximum over mid-wicket
SIX, batsman joins the party now! Sees Rashid flight the googly, gets as low as he can and smokes it into the cow corner stands for a crisp maximum
FOUR, makes room to open up the off-side, slashes hard and gets lucky with a thick top-edge that flies over short third man
FOUR, short of length around off, batsman pulls it gleefully past short fine leg. Nothing ball from Siddarth Kaul
SIX, another knuckle ball, and this one's been picked alright! batsman smokes it over deep midwicket. Fifty up for the Royals in just the sixth over
FOUR, back of a length on middle, batsman clears the front leg and mows it over mid-on. He's taken a liking to Kaul
SIX, batsman can't help but burst out laughing. Outrageous shot. Short ball around shoulder height, and he's forehanded this swat right back over the bowler's head for six

no run, Very fancy shot to attempt off someone like Rashid who fizzes the ball through. But the impact is probably just outside off which has saved him. team aren't convinced with the umpire's call, so they go for a review. Only to waste it. Flat leg-break just outside off, batsman wanted to scoop it over the keeper's head, but wasn't able to connect
FOUR, rocks back to this short ball and thumps it through square leg. Rollicking entry into the season from batsman

FOUR, hammers it down the ground. Brute power from batsman, who was nowhere near the pitch of it after stepping out. But the slowness of the surface allowed him to adjust before he brought the sledgehammer down and smashed it

out Caught by Saha!! Flat leg-break turning away from off, batsman looks to whip it through the on-side but only manages an inside-edge which is taken smartly by Saha. He did have a word with Rahane about the review, may not have been entirely sure, but was happy to keep walking after getting little encouragement. Definite edge. Respite for the Sunrisers. batsman c Saha b bowler 44(26) [4s-4 6s-3]

FOUR, Rajasthan having a torrid time in the field. Aaron now concedes a boundary. Fraction short and outside off, batsman backs cuts it to third man and Aaron lets it escape right through his legs. That is now 10 runs given away for free
FOUR, overpitched delivery at 124.6kph, batsman hammers it straight down the ground after walking down the tarck. It went between the umpire and Warner
1 run, drilled back to the bowler, who parries towards extra cover and that allows batsman to take the single. Back-to-back fifties for Pandey! He certainly likes to bat at No. 3!

out Caught by Smith!! Smith has pulled off a stunner! And, batsman can't register his sixth successive fifty. A pacy short of length delivery from bowler and batsman had backed away to slap it away. A hint of extra bounce and hence batsman couldn't time it as well as he would liked it to. The ball ballooned up and Smith ran back and to his right from mid-off before putting a full-stretched dive. He kept his eyes on the ball and completed a superb catch. Snaffled it with both hands and ensured that the ball didn't pop out when his elbows made contact with the ground. A much-needed breakthrough for the hosts. batsman c Smith b bowler 37(32)
1 run, taps a length ball to short cover and sets off for a risky single. Parag fails to hit the target at the striker's end
FOUR, shot! Brilliant use of the crease. It was the quick ball - 113.4kph - batsman made room and lifted it inside-out over extra cover for a one-bounce four

out Caught!! Well, Gopal was not sure why the third umpire was called. In the end, he has the wicket of his fellow state-mate. It was the googly and batsman was cramped for room. He was looking to guide it to third man and it went off the face of the bat. Samson caught it and then dislodged the bails. Wierdly, the keeper didn't appeal for caught-behind. The TV umpire was called for a stumping appeal and Pandey's back leg was in the air. He was out twice and I reckon the dismissal will be changed to caught! batsman c Samson b bowler 61(36) [4s-9]

out Caught by Unadkat!! team are falling apart here. A short ball at 130.5kph - the off-cutter, batsman didn't pick it and was early into his shot - the pull/heave. Got it off the cue end. Unadkat ran in from deep backward square leg and took a sharp low catch. batsman c Unadkat b bowler 8(10)

1 run, dropped! Short ball angled around the ribcage, batsman was cramped for room and despite that he decided to go for the pull, sends it off the thick top-edge and Varun Aaron can't hold on at short fine. He dived to his left but couldn't gather the ball cleanly

out Caught&Bowled!! bowler is on fire!! He has managed to hold on to a one-handed specky. Bowled a loopy full ball on off-stump and batsman clearly didn't pick the change of pace on that, just checked his push and chipped it straight in the air towards the bowler. bowler had to control his momentum, leap up to his full height and grab it one-handed mid air. batsman c and b bowler 0(1)

2 runs, dropped! batsman was in two minds, got stuck inside the crease and played a freaky scoop-pull against the skiddy short ball, it hung in the air for an eternity and Shreyas Gopal - despite covering good few yards to his right - at fine leg spills it off his palms

out Caught by Samson!! Ah, this is more conventional and straightforward. Bowls a pacy short ball and keeps it straight on the stumps, batsman came charging down the pitch and the extra bounce was always going to create trouble. As expected, the short ball got slightly big on him and he feathered a thin edge straight to Samson behind the stumps. batsman c Samson b bowler 5(5)

out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! bowler roaring back into this game in some style. Bowls the slower ball and hits the pitch hard while doing so, it sat up nicely for batsman outside off but lack of pace means he had to power it really hard off the middle. batsman seemed to have found the middle but couldn't manage the desired distance as Gopal takes a fine running catch at long-on (to his left). batsman c Shreyas Gopal b bowler 9(10)
byes, FOUR, bowls the slower short ball on the stumps, Bhuvi misses on the ramp and a hint of deviation after pitching meant Samson couldn't control the pace despite the dive to his left

out Caught by Unadkat!! Excellent running catch from Unadkat. Ran all the way from short fine and caught this around the backward square area with a splendid dive. Bhuvi just chipped a back of the hand slower ball without any conviction and then the theatrics from Unadkat, the fielder. batsman c Unadkat b bowler 1(4)
FOUR, very full delivery outside off, Rashid set himself inside the crease and cleared his front leg while doing so, just pumped it over extra cover with disdain
FOUR, batsman at his best. Pitched up outside off, no movement and batsman creams the square drive past the diving cover-point fielder. No chance of stopping that

SIX, another slower ball and batsman has nailed this for a maximum. Moved back and across, waited for it arrive and smashed it flat and straight over mid-off, it crashed straight into the boundary hoardings

out Bowled!! Cleaned up! Gopal adds batsman to his prodigious list. The googly and batsman did not pick it, he stayed rooted to the crease and tried to read it off the surface, too late. The ball spun back in hit the front pad before ricocheting onto the stumps. A much needed wicket after a sloppy start. batsman b bowler 13(14) [4s-2]
FOUR, this is a shot of a man in confidence. He picked the wrong 'un that was a tad overpitched and lofted it straight of mid-off, superb way to open your account
FOUR, Pandey already looks in his element. Slower short of length delivery and Pandey picked the length so early, short-arm jabs the pull over mid-wicket and it almost went the distance
FOUR, Pandey hitting through the off-side tells you he is in form. Short and just outside off, Pandey makes his own room and slaps it through the crowded off-side field
FOUR, nicely done. Gopal errs on the shorter side and Pandey threads the gap behind point with a delicate cut shot. He played it late and that enabled him to bisect backward point and short third man

FOUR, Pandey is winning this battle against his state mate. Once again he picks the length so early, swivels deep in the crease and pulls to deep mid-wicket, beating the fielder comfortably to his right
FOUR, batsman goes downtown! bowler slightly overpitches and the Karnataka lad takes full toll of it. Right in the slot and Pandey thumps it over the bowler's head
FOUR, fifty partnership! Parag over-corrects and bowls this too short, easy pickings for batsman. Pulled away through mid-wicket for yet another boundary
FOUR, batsman opens his account in style. Just one sighter required for the lefty. Umesh went a tad full, batsman shimmied down the track and flayed it over cover-point. Raced away

FOUR, positive stroke! He doesn't want the spinner to settle in here. Gives the charge by coming down the track, wasn't anyhwere close to the pitch of the ball, but with a big swing of the bat he smashed it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
FOUR, back-to-back fours! A quick non-turner wide of off, Shaw stays back in the crease and scythes it hard and wide of backward point

FOUR, ohh! Shikhar, you cheeky, cheeky fellow. He shuffles well wide of off, bowler bowls it in his area. And it was on a fuller length, the length and line was ideal for batsman to scoop it over short fine for a boundary

1 run, brings up his fifty now! Wanted to sweep it to the on-side, gets an inside edge. And it hits his pads and deflects to the off-side, good enough for a single. Third consecutive fifty for Shikhar. After an average start to the tournament, he has lifted his form brilliantly for the team

out Caught by Washington Sundar!! batsman perishes after reaching his fifty. Boy! team needed that badly. bowler as he ususally does for team, gets the wicket in the middle overs. batsman premeditates the sweep shot, bowler saw that and he is astute enough to drag his length back and bowled well wide of off. It clipped his top-edge and Sundar takes a dolly at short fine leg. batsman has done his job though, over to Pant and Iyer now. batsman c Washington Sundar b bowler 50(37) [4s-5 6s-2]

FOUR, you cannot bowl short to batsman, you just cannot. bowler does the mistake and gets belted for a boundary. He picked up the length early crouched low and powers the pull shot wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary

SIX, top-shot! Dashes down, wasn't entirely to the pitch of it but decides to go with a big hit and gets enough bat behind it to deposit it into the stands. He played it against the spin, mind you! It needs some skill
SIX, reaches his fifty in style! Comes down the track again and launches it over deep mid-wicket for a mighty six. It has been a terrific innings from the skipper!

out Lbw!! Whatta comeback from bowler. After being clobbered for two sixes, he has come back with the vital wicket of batsman. It was a leggie which spins into batsman, he wanted to work it to the leg-side, plays down the wrong line. It misses his edge and raps him on the pads. It looked close and umpire gave him out instantly. Rishabh challenged the decision but was proved wrong within minutes. batsman lbw b bowler 7(7) [4s-1]

out Caught by Kohli!! Spinners are doing the trick for team in the middle overs. batsman wanted to smash it into the crowd again, bowler realized that and bowled it a little slower. It gripped in the surface. The spin on the delivery forced batsman to mistime it and he ends up finding Kohli at deep mid-wicket. batsman c Kohli b bowler 52(37) [4s-2 6s-3]
FOUR, belted! This time he connects and boy doesn't he pack a punch. Good length ball outside off, batsman shuffles across and pumps it straight back over Saini, one bounce and over the ropes
SIX, woah! This is even better. Saini went for the change of pace and batsman spotted it, he made room and waited to play the inside out loft, sent it just over the deep extra cover fence

out Caught by Washington Sundar!! Gone! Saini wins the final battle. Struck for a four and a six and the local boy responds with the wicket of batsman. Very big moment at this stage. Slower ball that is dragged back on seeing batsman move across his stumps, the scoop lacks power or pace and Sundar completes a dolly near short fine leg. batsman c Washington Sundar b bowler 11(7) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, smashed! batsman keeps the boundaries coming for Delhi. He picked the back of a length delivery quickly, got into position and swatted the pull over deep mid-wicket. Clean strike
FOUR, freebie and batsman helps himself to a boundary. Short and around hip height, he swivels and pulls it over short fine. Just used the pace of Umesh to fetch a one bounce four

SIX, he only deals in sixes by the looks of it. Length delivery right in the slot for batsman, he clears his front leg and smokes it into the Delhi dugout near cow corner. Iyer liked it in the dressing room

FOUR, 16 runs off the over and just what Delhi wanted. Umesh goes for the off-cutter, but he bowls it short and outside off, batsman slaps the punch through extra cover and Dube has no chance running across from sweeper cover

byes, FOUR, high full toss outside off and batsman can't put bat on it. Poor Parthiv Patel has no chance as the ball bounces in front of him and races away to the fence. batsman asks for a possible no-ball but gets nothing from the umpires. It was around waist high and might have been given on another day
FOUR, edged and four! This is where Saini needs to learn. He bowls a pacy yorker outside off and batsman squirts an outside edge past Parthiv Patel. He has to take pace off on this slower surface

FOUR, these runs will be hurting Bangalore. Saini is just spearing them in and missing the yorkers, another full toss and batsman looks to heave it to the leg-side, the leading edge balloons over short third man
SIX, batsman greets the new bowler with a maximum! A floaty delivery from bowler, batsman waltzes down the pitch, gets close to the ball and pumps it downtown. The sightscreen has to bear the brunt
FOUR, bad ball and rightly put away by batsman. A drag down by bowler and the line is down leg, batsman moves off-side, gets low and helps it on its way with a pull over short fine leg

SIX, Kohli walks away in frustration. 20 runs off the final over and make it 36 off the last two. Another full toss outside off, batsman slices it over point and the short square boundaries help get maximum result
FOUR, now batsman gets into the act. bowler overpitches, Shaw gets down on a knee and flogs it over mid-on. Clean strike for a one-bounce four. 15 runs off the over!

FOUR, that's a trademark batsman shot! Not a bad ball from Umesh Yadav, he bowled a length delivery around off. Shaw stayed put in his crease and punched it fiercely through point. Got it off the meat of the bat

out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! Edged and gone! Oh, wait PP is down on his feet and the umpires decide to go upstairs. The soft signal is OUT! It's been grabbed by the keeper and batsman has to walk back. Parthiv got hit on the chest before snaffling it with his mitts. It would have definitely pained and hence he went down. Coming to the ball, it was a back of a length delivery wide of off. Shaw stayed in his crease and went for the cut shot. A hint of extra bounce and that induced the edge. batsman c Parthiv Patel b bowler 18(10) [4s-4]

FOUR, cross-seam ball - shortish and wide outside off. batsman, like Shaw, goes for the cut. But, fortunately for him, the ball went through the vacant slip region. The skipper gets off the mark in a streaky manner
SIX, a hit-me delivery first up from Saini. A leg-stump half-volley at 141.2kph. Easy pickings for the southpaw. The Indian opener flicks it nonchalantly over long leg for half a dozen

FOUR, 50 up for Delhi! A brilliant shot from the skipper. A fullish ball at 140.9kph, batsman stayed in his crease and brought his down at the right time to knock it through the gap between mid-on and mid-wicket. Superb timing
FOUR, hammered! Fuller ball at 143.6kph, batsman dances down the track and biffs it down the ground - finding the gap between the umpire and Shreyas Iyer. There's no one to stop that
1 run, once again batsman steps out of his crease, this time to play an uppish drive. Made decent connection, but luckily it falls short of a forward-diving mid-off fielder
SIX, a biggie! Not a good ball, drifts one on the pads does bowler. batsman gets forward to take his front leg out of the equation and hoists it over cow corner
FOUR, another short of length delivery, it was at comfortable hip-height for batsman who gets in a good position and dispatches it wide of deep square leg for a boundary
1 run, batsman cuts it wide of backward point for a single and 50-run partnership comes up.
FOUR, swings one way the ball goes completely in the opposite direction. Parthiv wanted to hack to the leg-side but the thick outside edge flies over and wide of Pant
FOUR, much more like it. That is his strength. Anything slightly full and outside off, Parthiv just frees his arms and lofts it straight back over the bowler, one bounce and over the rope
SIX, deposited into the crowd. Parthiv moves across a bit, gets inside the line and swings it with the spin over backward square leg. Made decent connection as the ball sailed 20 rows back
SIX, cracking shot, that spoils the over for bowler, fraction too short and Dube is quick to latch onto it - rocks back and pulls it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

out Caught by Axar!! Has this sealed the match for team? A superb running catch at deep mid-wicket and yet another long hop has got them a wicket - this was short and AB rocked back on the pull, don't think he hit it all that well - Axar ran across from the deep, kept his eyes on the ball and then latched onto a fine overhead catch. He then had to make sure that he didn't step onto the ropes, which he did. The third umpire has a look and sends AB on his way. The equation has just got tougher for the men in red. batsman c Axar b bowler 17(19) [6s-1]

out Caught by Pant!! Pant takes a blinder to get rid of batsman. The South African was looking play the scoop but makes a mess of it eventually. The ball catches the cue end, deflects on to his helmet grille and lobs to the left of the keeper. Pant charges to his left, puts in a dive and pulls off a stunning catch to bring an end to batsman's short stay at the crease. batsman c Pant b bowler 3(3)

out Caught by Dhawan!! team sink further as Dube departs. Fails to read the googly and swings across. As a result of the wrong 'un a thick leading edge is induced and Dhawan at cover-point takes a well judged catch. Looked good for his knock of 24 but the onus will now be on Stoinis to brave the visitors out of trouble. Can he? batsman c Dhawan b bowler 24(16) [6s-2]
FOUR, chants of 'team, team' as soon as batsman thumps this one down the ground. Reaches out for the tossed up delivery and lofts it straight over the bowler's head for a clean boundary
SIX, just look at the power of this man. A flighted delivery around off, batsman gets hold of it and tonks it right over the bowler's head for a towering six. Massive, believe you me

FOUR, boundary to start proceedings in the final phase of the match. Positive intent by batsman. Eyes the deep square leg fence and drags the short ball away nicely. The fielder inside the circle was a touch too square and the fielder in the deep was very fine, right into the gap and that shall be four runs

SIX, that's hit the boundary cushions on the full. Was a back of a length delivery and batsman heaved it over deep mid-wicket for a flat six. Where was this man all these games? Playing his first game of the season and making an impact right away

FOUR, fortune favours the brave, they say. Back of a length delivery around off, Gurkeerat is a touch early as he swings across the line but the top-edge is enough to fetch him four more, with the fielder inside the circle at third man, this was bound to happen

out Caught by Pant!! Edged and taken! Full and wide outside off, Gurkeerat goes hard at it and gets an outside edge to the keeper. Quality over by bowler so far. Things getting tougher with every delivery for team. batsman c Pant b bowler 27(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Delhi Capitals inch closer to booking a place in the play-offs. bowler bowls a slower delivery on middle and leg, Sundar looks to go big and gets deceived due to the slower delivery. Mistimes his loft to long-on and Iyer completes the formalities. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 1(2)
SIX, dispatched with disdain! It's too late though. batsman latches on to the short ball and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for a flat six
FOUR, bowler is welcomed with a boundary to the attack. The googly lands outside leg and Parthiv swings it away over square leg, just bounces inside the rope
FOUR, he's just toyed with the bowler. The fielder was moved squarer after the first boundary but this time Parthiv goes straighter with his whip, another one bounce four
FOUR, this is the best of the lot. Googly around leg-stump, Parthiv flicks it against the spin to deep mid-wicket. He played it all along the ground and still managed to beat the fielder

FOUR, geez! That is some shot. Pitched up outside off, Parthiv doesn't move his feet much but just drives through the line, the weight going back and the hands moving towards the ball. Nobody moved in the field as the ball rocketed past mid-off
FOUR, batsman joins in. It was only a matter of time. This is a top shot. Good length ball around off, batsman drives on the rise and over Parthiv at the other end. He almost cleaned him up
SIX, lovely, this is adding insult to injury - length ball outside off, batsman leans forward and lifts it high and over long-on - went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

FOUR, this is what pressure does - a fumble from Rabada and he concedes three extra runs to batsman - on a good length and at the stumps, batsman nudged it in front of mid-on and charged across for a quick single - so did Rabada and he took his eyes off the ball, slipped underneath and rolled away to the fence
FOUR, cracking shot, change of pace from bowler, it was the slower ball, but it was well wide of off, Parthiv leant forward and cracked the drive wide of mid-off, no need to run for those

out Caught by Axar!! A smart catch from Axar at backward point and bowler can afford a smile now - much needed wicket for the Capitals - this was short and well wide of off, Parthiv made room and crunched the cut - didn't keep it down and didn't find the gap, straight to Axar who does well to hold on. Parthiv has done his job, but he will be disappointed at having thrown another start away. batsman c Axar b bowler 39(20) [4s-7 6s-1]

out Caught by Rutherford!! Oh dear! That's a killer blow for team, batsman has pulled a half-tracker into the hands of Rutherford at deep mid-wicket. He looks gutted and all of a sudden, team have lost two quick wickets. It was dropped short and at the stumps, batsman rocked back on the pull, but he couldn't have placed the shot any more perfectly for the hosts - straight into the big hands of the West Indian. batsman c Rutherford b bowler 23(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

2 runs, a skier and Tewatia has made a mess of it, another wrong 'un from bowler, slower and spinning across the left-hander, Dube was in no position on the big slog, gets a thick leading edge, high and wide of long-on. Tewatia had plenty of time as he got across, too close to the ball and it bounced out
SIX, that should get AB going, a rank long hop, short and down the leg-side, AB swivels across and pulls it high and deep into the stands at backward square leg
SIX, smashed, tossed up well wide of off, Dube leans across and drags the slog-sweep, didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to clear the fielder at long-on

FOUR, brilliant start for the young batsman and team. It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, batsman uses his wrists to perfection and flicks it wide of mid-wicket for a boundary. Outfield is lighting quick!

FOUR, wow! This man, whatta talent. Nothing wrong with the delivery, it was on a length and around off, batsman jumps in the crease a touch, waits for it to arrive and punches it in the most amazing fashion for a boundary through cover

SIX, dispatched for a six! Stellar stuff from batsman. It was touch short and was on the body, batsman identifies the length in a canter, gets in a brilliant position and powers it over deep square leg for a maximum. team are off to a flier!
FOUR, lovely, but that was a bad misfield from the man at cover - on a good length and well outside off, Shubman leant into the drive and found cover - who let the ball go through
1 run, fifty for Shubman, his second of the tournament, change of pace from bowler, slower ball outside off, dabbed down towards third man for a single

FOUR, was it a chance? Lewis charged forward, nearly got down, dived forward and got a hand - but the ball was always dropping in front of him - can't get his body behind either and concedes a boundary
SIX, beautiful, just a lovely extension of his arms, Shubman came down the track, got close to the ball and then let his hands take over - sent it sailing over long-on for a maximum
SIX, clubbed, the leg-break and Shubman spotted it, gets a good stride forward and heaves it wide of long-on
SIX, too full from Chahar, Russell gets under it and smashes it high and over mid-wicket - his first of the night
SIX, back-to-back sixes for Russell - after a slow start, he's got the move alright. Tad too full from Chahar, right in Russell's hitting arc, he gets down low and pummels it high and over mid-wicket
FOUR, drilled, length ball outside off and Shubman drilled it back at the bowler - was a chance but bowler had little time to react, raced away across the fast outfield
FOUR, too full and too straight from bowler, on Shubman's pads and his neat little flick is good to get past the diving short fine fielder
FOUR, slapped, on a good length and well outside off, Russell threw his bat at that, off the toe-end and races past third man - who was inside the ring. Even bowler is leaking runs

out Caught by Lewis!! For a moment, Shubman seemed to have got hold of the shot - but he got plenty of height but not the distance, good catch at deep mid-wicket from Lewis - backtracking as he was, it was the slower ball and that did Shubman in, had to drag his shot and didn't get the requisite power behind it. Walks off to a standing ovation and after the customary check for a possible front-foot no-ball. batsman c Lewis b bowler 76(45) [4s-6 6s-4]
FOUR, cheeky and four, banged in short and wide as Russell was backing away - he waits on the ball and then ramps it over short third man, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

FOUR, slower ball at 118.7kph, but batsman picked that. It was shorter in length and the skipper had ample time to pick his spot. Stayed back and pummelled the pull over mid-wicket for a one-bounce four
SIX, even better! A normal-paced ball at 141kph from a short of length, batsman picks the length early, stays in the crease and hammers it over deep mid-wicket with a powerful pull shot
SIX, another slower ball - 117.2kph, shorter in length and sits up nicely for the big West Indian to swing his bat. Russell clears his front leg and heaves it over deep mid-wicket. A biggie
SIX, six more! A high full toss, Russell moves leg-side and clubs it over cow corner. Missed the yorker by a long way. Brute power!
SIX, that's an incredible hit! bowler shortens his length and there wasn't too much width either. Russell made room and slapped it over square third man. He managed to slice it all the way for a six
1 run, 146.1kph, another in-angling yorker, Russell moves leg-side and knocks it to long-on. Eighth IPL fifty for Dre Russ! Raises his bat and points it towards his team's dugout

FOUR, 145.2kph, in-slanting short of length delivery, Russell moves leg-side and pulls hard. Didn't quite get it off the middle, but that's the power of this man. Races away to the deep mid-wicket fence in a jiffy

SIX, wow! This is tremendous. It was a slower delivery outside off and Russell had to reach out a long way as he was initaially backing away. He lost his balance, but that didn't stop him from smashing a flat six over sweeper cover
SIX, six to start the over! bowler bowls one right in the slot - pace on offer as well, Russell stays deep in the crease, crouches low and flogs it over deep mid-wicket
FOUR, 131.2kph, full and wide of off, bowler misses his yorker though. Loads of width and Russell got down on a knee to batter it through the covers
FOUR, ah! You gotta feel for the bowler here. A yorker length ball wide of off and Russell threw the kitchen sink at it. Gets a big under edge that hits the ground and lobs over the keeper's head

SIX, Russell finishes it off with a six! Not a single off-paced delivery in this over. Overpitched delivery and the West Indian doesn't need second invitations to put it away. Stays deep in the crease, bends his back leg and clubs it over wide long-off. team finish on 232 - highest score of the season
FOUR, batsman finally dispatches one against bowler. It was a very full delivery and was on the stumps, batsman backs away and squeezes the drive wide of cover for a boundary
FOUR, enough bat on it to clear the man at short fine. batsman goes down on his knees on that delivery on the stumps and slog sweeps it over short fine for a boundary
FOUR, batsman swings and swings hard at it. He wanted to drive it through cover, it hits the inside half of the blade and goes wide of square leg for a boundary

no run, Pollard drops it! It was an off-cutter on a back of a length, batsman wanted to clear mid-off but he mistimed it badly. Pollard at mid-off dives dramatically to his right but fails to time his dive to perfection and ends up spilling it

FOUR, errs in line this time and batsman won't spare him. He gets in a good position and times his nudge to perfection. The outfield at Eden is a highway and it will run away for a boundary through fine leg

FOUR, four to finish the over. And partnership between the pair is 50 now. It was a back of a length delivery around off, batsman waits for it to arrive and tonks it really hard over mid-off for a boundary
FOUR, makes room, creates the room for himself and smashes it wide of mid-off for a boundary
SIX, deposited this into the stands. Lynn means business today. It was a wrong 'un, batsman reads it late but gets himself in terrific position and launches it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
FOUR, he is hitting it really well. Again, moves away, creates room and clobbers it wide of long-off. Pollard ran to his left but fails to get there
SIX, into the stands! Lynnsanity at the Eden today! It was fuller and on the stumps, batsman gets under it and larrups it over deep mid-wicket for a mighty six
FOUR, he's in some mood tonight - tad too full and well wide of off, Lynn gets underneath it and then scoops it over extra-cover, one bounce and over the ropes
1 run, the slower loopy full-toss from Sran, would have been called as a wide had he let it go, went chasing and chips it wide of cover-point, raises a 27-ball half-century
FOUR, hammered, he's having a ball tonight, length ball at the stumps, Lynn clears his left leg and shovels it wide of long-on, no need to run for those

SIX, beautifully played, the leg-break from Chahar, Shubman gets a good stride forward, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and lifts it majestically over cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum - team making a statement with the bat and the ball has been lost in the crowd

out Caught by Lewis!! Chahar and his funky bowling action has the better of Lynn - this was the leg-break, pitched outside leg and spun across the right-hander, Lynn opened himself up for the big slog, got underneath the delivery, ended up slicing it high and towards wide long-on. FOUR, nine runs off the opening over! A harmless short ball on leg-stump line, rises up to the hip and that's easy pickings for the Mumbai captain. batsman plays a one-legged pull shot over backward square leg for a one-bounce four

out Caught by A Russell!! batsman goes back without troubling the scorers. bowler was amongst the wickets in the previous match. Gets rid of the dangerous opener in his very first over. It was the carrom-ball from bowler that went through with the anlge (over the wicket). batsman went for the sweep and only managed a top edge. Russell comes in from deep backward square leg to snaffle it with ease. batsman c A Russell b bowler 0(4)
FOUR, once again, batsman steps out of his crease, this time he manages to get under it and club it over wide mid-on for a boundary
FOUR, this is the battle to watch out for. Off-break drifts on the legs and batsman picks it away effortlessly in front of square on the leg-side, just bounced inside the rope
SIX, Pandya slowly giving Mumbai the push. He picks the off-break, shuffles across and heaves it with the spin over deep mid-wicket. Struck it flat and got the distance
SIX, round the wicket angle is not working, for now. Fraction short and Pandya is quick to pounce on it, he stays deep in the crease and smashes it a good 20 rows back
SIX, Pandya is going down with a fight. Short and down leg, Pandya waits before swiveling across and pulling it over long leg. Another huge one from the allrounder

SIX, the helicopter has arrived in Kolkata. Goes deep in his crease and flicks it with a lot of power. He's started playing this shot even better than the man who invented it. Towering six over the deep mid-wicket fence

FOUR, wide full toss outside off and it's been sliced over cover-point. What a knock this is proving to be. If team had Russell, team got Pandya. Two of the cleanest strikers of the cricket ball playing this match

out Caught by Nitish Rana!! bowler comes back into the attack and breaks the partnership that was turning out to be a threatening one. A floated delivery delivery leg, batsman flicks it towards deep mid-wicket in his quest to clear the fence but doesn't get the timing right. Rana who was stationed near the fence, charges forward and puts in a dive to complete the catch. batsman c Nitish Rana b bowler 20(21) [4s-2]

SIX, fastest fifty of IPL 2019. This is insane hitting by the six hitting machine. He's turning it on here! Heaves the flatter delivery over the deep mid-wicket fence for a massive six, gets to his half century in style. What a knock!
FOUR, full in length by Narina and batsman hacks it into the gap at deep mid-wicket. The ball is just sailing all over the park, the fielders are going to have a neck-ache by the end of this innings
SIX, batsman joins the party now. Why should Hardik have all the fun, says the elder brother. Goes down on his knee and smokes it over long-on for half a dozen

1 run, dropped! Miscommunication between Karthik and Uthappa and they've put down a sitter. Uthappa had called for it but DK tries to go for the catch and the former ends up spilling it. Pandya had horribly miscued this slog as the top-edge ballooned into the off side
byes, FOUR, fires this one at 120ks around off and beats both the batsman and the wicket-keeper. Frustration creeping in and that delivery by bowler says it all
FOUR, floated outside off and Hardik has chipped it over covers for four runs, runs are leaking as Pandya brothers are having some fun out in the middle
FOUR, hammered! Things going worse for bowler who has now conceded 48 runs. Another floated delivery outside off and Hardik slams it through the gap at covers. Hardik's looking unstoppable
FOUR, Hardik is in some pain but he's keeping the scoreboard ticking. Smacking 'em all over! Goes down on his knee and bludgeons it right over the bowler's head for a boundary

1 run, 50-run stand up between Hardik and Krunal! Slaps the shortish delivery to mid-off for a single, does Hardik

FOUR, into his 90s is Hardik! Full in length outside off and Hardik chips it over covers for four more. Amazing display of batting by Pandya

out Caught by A Russell!! That brings an end to Hardik's belligerence. That was some knock! He set Edens on fire! Goes hard at a slower short delivery and mistimes it to deep mid-wicket. SIX, Krunal is not done here yet! Down on his knee and slogs it over wide long-on for half a dozen

out Caught&Bowled!! Piyush bowler becomes the third bowler in the history of IPL to claim 150 wickets. Calls for the catch, sprints back and takes it eventually. Was another googly and Pandya got a top-edge as he tried to slog it across the line. batsman c and b bowler 24(18) [6s-2]
SIX, 138.5kph, short and wide outside off which allows batsman to free his arms. The southpaw throws his bat at it and flays it over deep point for a maximum

out Lbw!! batsman goes for the big hoick, gets hit on the back leg. team players go up for an lbw appeal and the umpire has raised his finger. batsman decides to review it. Legal ball. No bat involved. What does the HawkEye say. Umpire's call on hitting wickets. The on-field call stays. batsman has to walk back. While going back, batsman has a word or two with the umpire. He knocked down the bails with his bat at the bowler's end too. It was an in-slanter from round the wicket and batsman wanted to play it across the line. SIX, that is his area. Anything on off and middle, Suryakumar picks it away nonchalantly over mid-wicket. The ball lands right on the ad cushions - second six of the innings
