FOUR, full delivery and batsman picked the bones out of that. It was in the slot and batsman lofted it through the line ovr extra cover, couple of bounces and into the rope

out Caught by Karthik!! It is Russell's day. He can do no wrong today. Strikes with his first ball. Back of a length in the channel around off, batsman looks to force it from the crease and the outside edge nestles into the safe mitts of Karthik. team are running away with the game. batsman c Karthik b bowler 15(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

FOUR, sloppy from Chawla. Russell will not be a happy man. It was a brilliant over until this misfield. Back of a length outside off, Suryakumar steers it to third man and Chawla is all over the place with his dive, the ball just escapes past him
SIX, much needed six for Mumbai and Suryakumar. They need to put their foot on the accelerator. Shuffles across, crouches a bit and flicks it over deep square leg. Just managed to clear the rope

out Caught by Karthik!! He's getting wickets of full tosses. That smile on his face says it all. Russell is enjoying every minute of it and he also has a quick jig for the team supporters. SIX, bowler is welcomed with a straight six by Pandya. Flighted delivery and Pandya just swings through the line, clean connection and the ball travels the distance
SIX, second six of the over. Fired in but the length allowed Pandya to get under it, he just elevated himself and launched it into the crowd near cow corner. DK walks up to have a word with bowler
FOUR, googly but on the shorter length, batsman does not go hell for leather, slides on the back foot and crunches it square on the off-side, no chance for a diving sweeper cover

A length delivery outside off, batsman goes hard at the first ball he faces and as a courtesy of the power on that shot gets a four through square third man, that was in the air for a while but well over the fielder inside the circle

SIX, Bhuvi has taken it. But he has jumped over the ropes. bowler would be gutted! Bhuvi throws the ball in disgust. It was a short of length delivery on the body, batsman mistimes the pull to fine leg but he gets just enough bat on it to fetch a maximum
FOUR, smashed! This is an excellent shot. On a length and on the stumps, batsman uses a straight bat and tonks it straight down the ground. It rockets to the fence

FOUR, another boundary from batsman. He is putting on a show here for Punjab. It was a slower one and was wide of off, batsman goes down on his knees and sweeps it through fine leg for a boundary. Great connection!

Umpires have gone for a review just to be absolutely sure. Soft signal is OUT and he is OUT. It was a terrific short delivery on the face, batsman was clearly beaten by the pace there. The situation demanded him to play another big shot and he went after it again via: A pull shot. SIX, batsman has no other option but to go for it. Even though he is losing partners in a heap at the other end. Quicker and outside off, batsman lofts it handsomely over extra cover and clears the rope comfortably. The most difficult shot to play against an offie and he's made it look ridiculously easy

SIX, now is helped by bowler. A full toss just below the waist, batsman waits and swings it over long leg. Back to back sixes and with that it also brings up the fifty for batsman. The chase depends on him
SIX, clobbered! Bhuvi starts with a length delivery right in the slot, batsman with a cleared front leg swings through the line and gets plenty of distance over long-on

SIX, a one-handed six from batsman. A full toss, batsman went deep in the crease and smashes it straight back over Sandeep, with the bottom hand coming off the bat handle
SIX, wow! Seemed to be a mishit but Warner watches it sail over him. Full, slow and outside off, Simran lofts it off the base of the bat and it soars just over long-off

out Caught by Williamson!! Fine catch! Khaleel picks up his third wicket. He's been the pick of the bowlers along with Rashid. Change of pace and batsman went after it, cleared his front leg and swung as hard as possible, came off the toe-end and went straight up, Williamson ran across from extra cover and took it near mid-off. out Lbw!! Looked a 50-50 call and that's why only Sandeep went up for it. A slow dipping yorker and Simran swings blindly without watching the ball, the ball lands in front of him and strikes him on the back leg around leg-stump. out Bowled!! It was a matter of Sandeep getting it on target. Another knuckle ball and batsman slogs without a clue in the world, the ball arrives later to mess up the stumps. Is it going to be a double wicket maiden for Sandeep? batsman b bowler 0(3)

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! bowler strikes as Manish Pandey takes a skier. No special knock by the Universe Boss tonight. Goes hard at a length delivery and gets a top-edge that goes miles up in the air. Manish at point settles under it and takes it, not on the first but on the second attempt. SIX, that's the kind of form, KL batsman has been in. Stands tall and flicks the length delivery over deep mid-wicket for a towering six, his first one of the night
FOUR, deft touch! On the pads and batsman clips it past the fielder at short fine leg. The fielder in the deep was very square in order to cut this down

FOUR, all about class! Down on his knee early and picks the slower delivery over fine leg for a boundary. Was the slower delivery and batsman played the lap shot to perfecion. Almost got a six as the ball hit the cushions on a boundary

FOUR, Rashid lost in the lights there. And he has allowed it to go for a boundary. batsman rocks back and thumps it straight to sweeper cover. Rashid should have stopped it on the bounce but instead he lets it go and gifts a boundary to Kings

FOUR, batsman is flowing like a river. He is timing the ball so very well. But the required rate demands more out of this. It was a slower one on the stumps, batsman flicks it handsomely, beats fine leg and it races to the fence

SIX, that's been belted by batsman. He sure has some muscle power and he has flaunted it there! He plunges forward, clears his front leg, keeps his shape and absolutely smashes it over long-off for a gigantic six

SIX, that's more like it, Kings need more of these hits. It was on a fuller length, batsman gets under it, clears his leg, opens up his shoulders and dispatches it over long-on. High and handsome!

FOUR, erratic and batsman puts it away this time. Arshdeep strayed on the pads once more with this pacy inswinger, the southpaw just had to get bat on it and he tickled it past the keeper. Fine leg was quite squarer and had no chance

FOUR, this is poor bowling from Arshdeep after a good start. Once again errs in line, feeds it down leg and batsman takes full toll of this inswinger. Fine is up in the ring and this is clipped fine enough. All too easy

SIX, beautifully struck! Turn on this off break but there is width on offer and batsman does the smart thing, goes with the turn as he chips it over wide long-off. More of an extended defensive push and it goes all the way. Shot of a man in supreme form

FOUR, delicate hands from Pandey. Ashwin pulls his length and feeds him with width outside off, Pandey goes deep in his crease and opens his bat face at the last moment to place it in the gap past point. The timing is flawless and the sweeper in the deep had no chance

1 run, oh boy! He almost had it till the last second there is Ashwin, would've been a stunner had he held onto it, but unfortunately, he couldn't and Pandey gets a lifeline. Fullish and on off, Pandey lifts it hard and ends up hitting it towards team skipper at mid-off, who leapt high and plucked it with his right-hand. He was air-borne when he took it but just when his heels touched the ground, the ball popped out of his hands. Very unlucky

FOUR, fifty for batsman. It's most likely his last game for the season and he wants to finish on a high. Shorter and wobbled away just outside off, batsman waited deep and slashed at it, thick outside edge runs away to the third man fence. team dug-out up on their feet and batsman acknowledges them with a raise of the bat

SIX, 50-stand comes up between the duo with this maximum. Such a clean strike from Pandey. Tossed up at th stumps, Pandey loads up big time and hammers it over the bowler's head. Held his shape and connected it beautifully

FOUR, There's the trademark switch-hit from batsman. Flighted full just outside off, batsman changes his stance and lifts it over short third man. He was itching to play this shot for a while, does so now..

FOUR, well, the plan was good from Arshdeep, but the execution part went wrong. Swerving in, tried for the yorker but missed by a few inches. Ends up as a low full toss on the pads for batsman, who gets across and flicks it past Gayle at short fine leg. Cricket can be cruel sometimes, ain't it?

FOUR, this is poor from the youngster. Nah, nah, not where you bowl with fine leg inside the ring. Went for the bouncer, but didn't quite hit his target. Pandey gets on top of it and pulls it over short fine leg for a boundary

out Caught by Shami!! bowler removes Pandey. Finally, a wicket for team which should give them some lift. Wasn't that great a delivery from bowler. Rifled it quick - the carrom ball and down leg, Pandey tried to be cheeky and thought of helping it over the man at 45. But he didn't get the required timing to clear the fielder and hits it to Shami at short fine leg, who clings onto it. First wicket for bowler and let's see if they can put the brakes from here. batsman c Shami b bowler 36(25) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Caught by Mujeeb!! Wow! Is this the game-changing over from bowler? He's gotten rid of both the set-batsmen in this over and batsman is livid with himself as he thuds his bat onto his pads. But doesn't matter because he's played a fabulous knock here. The Hyderabad crowd gives him a rousing reception. It was the round-arm darter from bowler, bowled it quick outside off. batsman with a tired looking shot as he threw his bat and skews it up towards point, who takes a couple of steps back and grabs it. batsman c Mujeeb b bowler 81(56) [4s-7 6s-2]

FOUR, what has Gayle done there? He's kicked that ball away to the boundary. Went for the chase from short third man and ends up kicking it away to the fence. batsman went hard at this one as the thick outside edge flew over the fielders at short third and backward point
SIX, that's more like it! Goes down on his knee and hacks the floated delivery over deep backward square leg for half a dozen does the team skipper
SIX, time for batsman to join in the party! Takes on his Afghan team mate and thumps the floated delivery right over the bowler's head for a clean six, couldn't have played it any better

SIX, bowler has conceded 65 runs already! batsman gets underneath the full ball and smokes it right into the sightscreen. He's turning it on here, brilliant striking and the decibels have gone a notch higher in Hyderabad. Crowd is loving it

out Caught by Murugan Ashwin!! That's a stunning catch by Murugan Ashwin at cover as he times his jump to perfection and plucks it out of thin air. Was a back of a length delivery and batsman had chipped it in order to clear the infield, however the fielder does well to pull off a blinder. With 10 balls remaining, batsman had to go for it and perishes in his quest to get some quick runs. batsman c Murugan Ashwin b bowler 14(7) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Bowled!! bowler has ripped the stumps apart. Dishes out a sizzling full length delivery and it was the pace that got the better of him. batsman swung hard but there was daylight between his willow and the ball - end result is that the sticks are rattled and it's game over for batsman, at least with the bat. batsman b bowler 20(10) [6s-2]

out Bowled!! Wickets are tumbling towards the death but the total is more than enough. bowler nails his yorker right and uproots the leg-stump as batsman fails to squeeze it out. Some decent death bowling by Kings XI Punjab. batsman b bowler 1(2)

FOUR, that's a crispy drive by batsman! An overpitched delivery outside off and the southpaw creams it through extra cover. Miller in the deep sprinted across and although he put in a dive, he couldn't quite stop the ball, four runs for the young batsman
FOUR, heaved over mid-wicket! Looked ungainly from batsman but he's managed to clear the infield with ease. Was a length ball, picked from outside off and lobbed with a heave across the line

byes, FOUR, bonus runs! It's an IPL debut for Simran Singh and this won't do much to his confidence, that's for sure. Was a slower ball from Arshdeep and batsman wanted to hoick across the line. Got beaten by the lack of pace and it went on the bounce to Simran Singh who just couldn't cover the line as it sneaked past him to the fence. Don't want to be gifting easy runs to the opposition, not in such high-pressure games
FOUR, batsman is having fun! Slower and fuller, he just shuffles a bit and slog sweeps merrily over backward square leg. Clean strike and it races away to the fence

FOUR, this is superb batting! He's toying with the field, batsman. Makes a bit of room to the loopy off break and goes with the turn on this chip over extra cover. Another clean connection and the boundaries continue to rain here in Hyderabad

FOUR, fastest fifty partnership in IPL 2019! team are on rampage here! batsman joins in the fun with a lovely paddle sweep, the line was too straight from bowler and it was helped away quite fine. Well wide of short fine leg who could do nothing
FOUR, sublime from batsman! He's looking in great touch tonight, isn't he? Too full from bowler and it's been drop kicked over wide mid-on. Supple stuff and easily over the infield

SIX, my word, hasn't he clobbered this or what! batsman is going bonkers here! Gets one slightly too short from bowler and belts the pull over deep backward square leg. Absolutely waded into the pull and sent it deep into the crowd

SIX, the team skipper is welcomed with some rough treatment! batsman shuffles around in the crease and slog sweeps this over fine leg for a maximum. No respite whatsoever from the Orange Army thus far

out Caught by Simran Singh!! Murugan draws first blood! Was a quickish slider and batsman wanted to pull across the line. As team were about to review, the umpire raised his finger but batsman didn't probably see that. He was standing with Warner, which made it seem like he wanted the review. It seems like he wasn't clear of the decision and once it was clarified, he walked away batsman c Simran Singh b bowler 28(13) [4s-3 6s-1]

FOUR, superb shot! Pandey is in some form and this shot is a reflection of it. bowler went wide of the crease to cut off room but Pandey backed away a touch to drive this inside out through extra cover. Bisected the deep fielders well
SIX, batsman wasting no time whatsoever. bowler pitches it right in the slot outside off, batsman doesn't want any sighters and leans across to dump it into the long-off stands

SIX, six more! Not so convincing this but batsman won't mind. This was a short of length delivery from bowler, corrected his length and slightly cramped the batsman for room. batsman throws his bat hard and skews it off the outer half. Such is the power that it sails over the third man fence for a maximum

FOUR, batsman is off the mark with a boundary. Streaky but he'll take it. Length delivery that gained some extra bounce, ABD flashes his bat and ends up getting a thick outside edge that beats short third man. bowler can't believe his luck, got to feel for him

FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes. 23 have come off the opening over. Went fuller, aimed at the stumps and batsman made room. Cleared his front leg and blasts it over cow corner. The fielder in the deep gave up the chase..
SIX, this is some statement from batsman. team fans are going berserk in the stands. Flighted delivery from Gopal, batsman stays low and pummels it over long-on. Welcome to the attack, Gopal..
FOUR, oh my word! He's hammered it past mid-off. What a hit. Gopal went quicker and fired it outside off, batsman gets under it and drills it with ferocity down the ground

out Caught by Livingstone!! The fun comes to an end for batsman. Bunny alert! Gopal gets the prized scalp of the team skipper for the second time in the tournament. What a tournament he's having. Some relief for team here. It was tossed up luringly at the stumps, batsman flexes his arms and slogs it, didn't connect it as he would've liked and picks out Livingstone at long-on, who comfortably holds onto it. batsman c Livingstone b bowler 25(7) [4s-1 6s-3]

out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Wowza! It's two in two for Gopal. Pin-drop silence in the ground. Put your hands together for this young leggie. He's been a star for team and continues to impress. Well-flighted delivery again, drawing batsman into a false shot. AB wielded his bat hard, loses his balance and shape completely. Skies it into the night sky as the timing goes for a toss. out Caught by Smith!! He's done it. Hat-trick for bowler, take a bow. Look at him celebrate, totally deserves it. team dugout is over the moon. team fans are stunned as they are quaking now. Loopy delivery outside off, batsman gets under it and bashes it airly. Finds Smith at mid-off. Gopal is off on a celebratary run. batsman c Smith b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, what happened there? Pushed through flatter down leg, Mann sinks low and is a bit early into the shot. Gets a top-edge which balloons away to the fine leg fence

out Caught by Lomror!! The procession continues. Parag joins the party as he removes Mann. Also, breaks into a jig. team have lost the plot completely. out Caught by Thomas!! Another soft dismissal and another instance of an team batsman throwing his wicket away. Patel tried to be cheeky and walked across his stumps to lap it over the fielder at 45. out Caught by Livingstone!! batsman perishes. Fast, fiery and full outside off, batsman was beaten for the pace as he loses his shape attempting an across-the-line mow. out Caught by Samson!! No escape for batsman this time. bowler picks up his second wicket. Short of a length delivery outside off, batsman slashes his willow and gets an outside edge which is gobbled up by Samson. batsman c Samson b bowler 4(3) [4s-1]

SIX, batsman is underway with a six. Stunning hit! Short of length around off, batsman picked the length early. Stayed in his crease, waited for the ball to come to him and deposited it over deep mid-wicket with a pick-up shot

FOUR, poor ball! The line is too straight, ends up bowling the length ball on the pads and that's easy pickings for any batter. batsman helps it on its way with a flick through the gap between short fine and backward square leg
FOUR, skiddy and pacy back of a length delivery at 152.4kph, batsman sees that coming. Clears his front leg and heaves it hard and over mid-wicket. Couple of bounces and into the fence

SIX, Saini bangs it in short, batsman once again cleared his front leg to pummel the pull. Didn't quite middle it, got it off the top part of the bat. But, he swung his bat so ferociously that it went all the way over long-on for a maximum

1 run, 152.8kph, full toss, batsman clobbers it through the off-side - off the top part again. Klaasen dived full length to his right at cover-point, but the ball doesn't stick. It'd be harsh to call that a drop. Saved three runs for his team there did the South African

SIX, two men in the deep (long-on and deep mid-wicket), but all they can do is watch the ball sail over the ropes. A harmless short of length delivery, batsman swings his bat hard and dispatches it over cow corner
SIX, much-needed six for team. Touch fuller from bowler, batsman crouched a bit low, sets the base and smokes it over long-on for half a dozen
FOUR, edged and four! Away-angler at 136.4kph, batsman throws the kitchen sink and gets a thick outside edge that runs away through the gap between the keeper and short third man

out Caught by Negi!! This is a big wicket! bowler strikes. Flat, quick and outside off, batsman had to reach out and he tried to go over extra cover. The ball lobs up off the outside half. Negi settles under it at backward point and gobbles it up. batsman c Negi b bowler 28(13) [4s-2 6s-3]
1 run, short of length and batsman hops to tuck it backward of square. The 50-run stand comes up
FOUR, just over Morris. Lands the wrong 'un outside leg, batsman is down on his knee to play the sweep, waits for the ball to turn across and helps it over a leaping Morris

SIX, first of the game and Chennai need plenty more of this going into the final phase of the innings. Slower cutter on a length outside off, batsman delays his loft and crunches it over extra cover. That came right off the screws and went a long way

out Caught by Dhawan!! Taken! It was in the air for a long time but Dhawan kept his composure to snaffle it well inside the rope. FOUR, not where he intended but batsman will take the final result. He went down to play the slog sweep, but dragged it off the inner half of the bat to cow corner - bisecting deep mid-wicket and long-on

FOUR, fifty for batsman. It is his 50th fifty in all of T20 cricket. He gets there with a fabulous shot. Charges down the wicket, reached out for the delivery and pumped it over Suchith, couple of bounces and over the rope

SIX, Boult tries to take a one-handed stunner but fails to hang on. batsman has decided it is time to go, puts the skates on and heaves it towards wide long-on, Boult runs to his left and dives full length, goes with his left hand and the ball doesn't stick. out Caught by Dhawan!! Suchith has his man. But batsman has done his job. He resurrected the innings after a slow start and given them the impetus going into the final 5 overs. SIX, parried over. batsman has been sent above to do this. Goes for the slog sweep and hits it to deep backward square, Rutherford is running back to take the catch but he could only palm it over. The momentum did not help him there
FOUR, charges down and bowler makes him reach out by firing it outside off, batsman still goes through with the big hit and the outside edge flies away fine, beating Pant to his left

FOUR, he is playing a cameo here, is Jaddu. It was an off-cutter, there was just a little bit room. batsman waits for it to arrive, opens the face of the blade at the last moment and guides it wide of short third man for a boundary. Exemplary placement!
FOUR, you cannot bowl short with fine leg up in the circle. batsman knows where the fielders are and he pulls it over fine leg. The connection was good enough and it runs for a boundary

SIX, this is the best we have seen batsman bat in this season. And it is a positive not only for team but also for India with WC coming up. bowler misses the yorker, it ends up being in the slot. batsman clears his front leg, keeps his shape and larrups it over long-on for a maximum

FOUR, not where batsman wanted it to go but he will take it with both hands at this stage of the innings. It was on a fuller length and was attacking the stumps, batsman swings his willow hard. He gets a thick inside edge and it beats short fine for a boundary

out Caught&Bowled!! That's a brilliant running catch from Morris. The slog was miscued by batsman, it went a long way up in the night sky and was about to land in no man's land. FOUR, he doesn't want to get his eye in, does batsman. It was in the slot for batsman and he smashes it over deep mid-wicket. Not timed as well as he would have liked. So, it didn't go over the ropes but will fetch him a boundary

no ball, SIX, that's a nasty nasty delivery from bowler. He came to batsman to apologize immediately. It was a full-toss above the waist height, batsman gets his bat down in a good position and smashes it over short fine for a maximum

FOUR, check for a spark on the bat! Wow that was hit hard! Hard is an understatement of the highest order. It was a yorker on the stumps. batsman was standing deep in the crease, he gets under it and pumps it straight down the ground. It rockets to the fence!

SIX, smashed over deep mid-wicket. You cannot bowl length to batsman at this stage. It was a slower one on a good length, batsman waits for it to arrive and tonks it high and handsome over deep mid-wicket. It sails into the crowd!

SIX, he has finished again with a maximum. batsman and last ball sixes is a story for the ages! It was angled away from batsman, was on a length again. batsman slogs, gets batsman power behind it. And gets just about enough bat to clear deep square leg who jumped but it was out of his grasp

out Caught by Axar at mid-wicket! He's picked him out! A half-tracker that stays low, picks out the ONE man at cow corner with the pull - a shot he nails every time. FOUR, low full-toss on leg-stump, easy pickings, just a deflection away towards the fine leg fence for four - team's first boundary comes after 26 balls

out Caught by Watson!! More energy expended by Imran bowler in celebration. Tiring just to watch. He floats this googly wide outside off, makes batsman reach for it, and then turns it away further. out Stumped!! That's another addition to the Dhoni collection of brilliant stumpings. Coming to the ball, it was another slowish leggie that spun away sharply outside off, batsman on this occasion gropes at it and nicks it off behind. team reclaim the top spot! batsman c Dhoni b bowler 8(11) [4s-1]

SIX, batsman has belted this one. Geee! He is in amazing touch. It was a nicely flighted delivery wide of off, batsman dashes down and larrups it against the turn over long-on for a maximum. The connection was sensational and it sailed over!

out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! out Lbw!! Spins in and traps batsman on the crease. Up goes the finger. The ball was spinning sharply, which probably prompted the review, but it wasn't enough to save him as it would've clipped the top of leg stump. Delhi go from 52/1 to 66/4. batsman lbw b bowler 1(5)

no run, fuller length delivery swerving down leg, Hardik shuffled a bit in a bid to flick it fine but couldn't make any contact. It skims the outer half of the pad en route to the keeper

SIX, another full-toss just about waist high from round the wicket, batsman gets his front leg out of the way and slams it into the deep mid-wicket crowd for a massive six! Looks confident, doesn't he?
SIX, skids through once again, but batsman is waiting on the backfoot - very decisive, and he thumps it away over long-on for a six
FOUR, fired down leg, batsman is late on the expansive fine sweep, gets some bat on it though, and gets it away to the fine leg fence for four

out Caught by Abhishek Sharma! 120.9km/h, a slower bouncer on the body, the off-cutter, the easiest of all slower balls, and he foxes batsman. Early into the pull, induces the top-edge as the ball goes high in the air towards deep backward square leg and Abhishek Sharma rushes in to take an impressive catch diving forward. batsman c Abhishek Sharma b bowler 10(9) [6s-1]
SIX, short one angled into the body, gets behind the line and transfers his weight onto the backfoot to deposit it over deep mid-wicket for six

FOUR, another boundary to finish the over. batsman is off to a flyer here. It was on a short of length and was wide of off, batsman powers the pull shot wide of mid-on, Nabi puts in a valiant effort there by chasing it down. He puts in a dive too but his foot was touching the ropes when ball was in his contact and that will be signalled as a boundary
FOUR, bowler strays on the pads and batsman punishes. All batsman had to do was to beat the short fine fiedler which he did with ease with the flick shot, and it raced to the fence
FOUR, batsman joins the party too. It was slower one a short of length, batsman swivels, gets in a terrific posiition and thumps it wide of deep backward square leg for a boundary.

out Caught by Nabi!! batsman would be gutted with himself. He was timing the ball beautifully but the pressure of five dot balls that de Kock consumed in the previous over probably got to him. And he played an overambitious pull-shot. bowler got the ball to bounce extra off the deck. It hit the splice of the bat and popped up in the air, Nabi takes a sitter of sitters at mid-on. batsman c Nabi b bowler 24(18) [4s-5]
FOUR, shot mahn! batsman has this unique way of pulling the ball. It was around the hip-height, batsman swivels and powers the pull shot wide of short fine leg for a boundary
FOUR, class written all over it! It was on a good length and was wide of off, batsman drives it like a boss, places it well and it runs along the carpet

FOUR, he has bisected the gap between long on and cow corner to perfection! It was an offie on the stumps, batsman uses his bottom hand to good effect and whips it with the spin to the on-side for another boundary. He has started really well!

FOUR, he has placed it to perfection! It was on a good length and was wide of off, batsman opens the face of the bat at the very last moment and guides it in between backward point and third man for a four! His third of the innings!

SIX, batsman has looked ultra-positive from the start and this is an effortless hit. He's predominantly a leg-side player and very good with the pick-up shots. bowler tosses it on the pads and Suryakumar makes him pay. Gets under it and whiplashes it away into the cow corner stands
FOUR, whatta start! A wide half-volley, batsman leans into the square drive and caresses it behind point and wide of third man for four
FOUR, slings away with the arm, back of a length, a whippy cut attempted, toe-ended away wide of the 'keeper to the third man fence for four. Fortuitous.

FOUR, the boundary releases all the pressure Chahar built up. Poor bit of work from Anukul Roy. It was on the shorter side and Pandey pulled it to deep square leg, Roy was late to spot the ball and by the time he did and put in the dive, it was too late

FOUR, consecutive boundaries for Pandey. Once again the length is wrong - on the shorter side, Pandey makes room and slaps the cut in front of square, no chance for Sran coming across from sweeper cover

out Caught by Pollard!! The nudge and nurdle around ploy comes to a halt. With required rate shooting up team had to find momentum and in the process of finding some, batsman goes after a floated up delivery and toe-ends the loft to long-on. KP moves a few yards to his right and takes it comfortably. batsman c Pollard b bowler 12(17)

out Caught by de Kock!! bowler ambles forward with a smile, doesn't even bother appealing for he knew Abhishek nicked it. There was a sense of doubt as Abhishek stood his ground momentarily but he started walking off soon as the umpire gave his verdict. Short, skiddy and angling away outside off, Abhishek looks to steer it square on the off-side and sends a fine bottom edge through to the keeper. Excellent low take from QDK. batsman c de Kock b bowler 2(3)
FOUR, batsman responds in style; keeps his head still and smashes the straight drive past the non-striker, that was timed to perfection and no-one's gonna stop that
FOUR, sits on the back foot this time, expects the length to be short and swivels into his pull in a flash. Placed it in the gap behind square and that's batsman's first boundary

FOUR, slice of luck for batsman and team. bowler executes another yorker outside off and batsman swung himself (quite literally) into that, managed to get a thick inside edge which flies past QDK to his left

SIX, batsman ruins a fine over from bowler. Plenty of width outside off, all batsman had to do was watch it close and get it over point (no fielders in the deep). He does exactly that by timing his upper cut and slicing the ball over the boundary ropes for a crisp maximum

FOUR, a rare bad ball from bowler and batsman takes full toll of it. On seeing Pandey shuffle forward, bowler loses his length and feeds a full toss at the body, Pandey knows where the gap is and he swats it for a one-bounce boundary over square leg

FOUR, batsman thinks it's a no-ball for height, but wasn't to be. A fair call from the umpire as it was clearly below waist. Full toss again, Pandey clears his front leg and hammers it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square

SIX, Pollard is flirting with the boundary hoardings today, another crash avoided. A full toss from bowler and batsman got all of it; he seemed to have mistimed it for a fleeting moment but got enough height on it to get it well and over the leaping fielder at long-on. Pollard tried his best and nearly crashed into the hoardings

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Gone this time. This one looked like a six to the naked eye, wasn't to be. A full ball outside off, batsman went for the loft over extra cover but he skewed it off the toe-end and offered a dolly of a catch to SKY at wide long-off. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 31(20) [4s-2 6s-2]
FOUR, short and wide, a slash at that, and just wide of a diving Rahul Chahar at backward point for four. batsman is away. The confidence reflects in his conviction of the shots and his footwork.
FOUR, short of length delivery wide outside off, batsman clears his front-leg and drags it from outside off, clubs it away flat and wide of mid-off to the wide long-on fence for four

SIX, it's a tie and we have a Super Over!! Whew! What.A.Game. After all that long, never-ending confab bowler delivers a juicy length delivery on the stumps, Pandey keeps his calm and marmalizes it into the mid-wicket orbit for a scintillating maximum. Pandey knew it was six the moment it left the bat and he pumps his fists before soaking in joy. Rohit doesn't seem too pleased and he is busy picking balls for the Super Over
SIX, round the wicket, a length ball angling in, no insecurities there, as batsman uses his long levers to loft it through the line and over long-off for six
FOUR, fuller length delivery on middle, whipped away from the crease past mid-on to the long-on fence for four. Fantastic shot.

FOUR, short one outside off, pulled away with very little timing to deep mid-wicket for four as Pollard chases and tries to kick it back, but ends up being carried over the advertising board by the momentum. Hopefully, he hasn't hurt himself

out Caught by Lewis! On a back of a length and just outside off, batsman gets low and tries carving it away through backward point, but fails to find the gap, picks out Lewis at backward point and that's the end of the road for batsman tonight. An excellent catch by Lewis, diving to his right, and a bit of a send-off by bowler. batsman c Lewis b bowler 25(15) [4s-5]

FOUR, confidence, I tell you is a very big thing in sport. First ball and Pandey has put it away for a boundary. Not a bad delivery - short of length angled at the body, Pandey elevated himself and pulled it past the diving mid-wicket fielder. The timing was spot on
SIX, geez! He's looks so good while playing positively. Banged in halfway down, Pandey waits for the ball to climb on him and ramps it over third man, Bumrah could only collect it from the dugout
FOUR, this is poor bowling. Even the experienced bowler feeling the heat. Sprays it down leg and all Pandey had to do was place it in the gap, tickled fine and the fielder at 45 had no chance

out Lbw!! batsman's first game is cut short by a bowler nip-backer. team are off to a flier but have now lost both their openers. This is a typical bowler wicket - fast, angled in from a length and just beats the batsman for pace, batsman went nowhere with his footwork and remained rooted to the crease, pinged right in front of middle and ball-tracking showed it to be crashing into leg-stump. Second wicket for bowler and he's keeping the game in balance. batsman lbw b bowler 15(11) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, Pandey keeps dealing in boundaries. He waits for the leg-break to arrive and dabs it past Rohit at slip, placed it fine enough and beat Bumrah behind square on the off-side

out Lbw!! Huge wicket and the blue flags are hoisted up at the Wankhede. Rohit is jubliant and so are rest of his mates. They know the value of this wicket. batsman could have played anchor to this chase and he has been sent back early. The team skipper premeditated the paddle and missed it completely, the ball struck him around the thigh pad in front of middle, it was going on to hit leg-stump. batsman lbw b bowler 3(7)

SIX, batsman has belted this into the stands for a 94-meter six! It was on a back of a length, batsman charges down and backs away, keeps his shape and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. This should get him going!

out Caught by Agarwal!! bowler strikes! team needed a wicket and the skipper delivers. He pumps his fist in delight. Carrom ball around off, batsman makes room to go over extra cover, but hit it straighter than he would have liked, Mayank didn't have to move much and took it with his fingers pointing upwards near long-off. batsman c Agarwal b bowler 22(14) [4s-2 6s-1]
FOUR, bangs the slower delivery into the surface, Russell waits and waits some more to play the flat-batted hit, strikes it square on the off-side and leaves sweeper with no chance
SIX, Gill keeps producing some fabulous shots even though he is playing anchor. Picked the carrom ball, used his feet and lofted it through the line, all the way over long-on
SIX, tries a little too much with his action, fires it into middle and leg, batsman gets on his knee and sweeps it high and mighty over deep backward square leg for six

FOUR, another quick skidder outside off, sliced away to the third man boundary for four, bringing up another fifty for Gill as an opener - further accentuating the fact that bringing him in down low was always a bad idea
SIX, errs big time with a full-toss, Russell opens up his stance and swings those brawny levers over cow corner for six. Tough man man to bowl to, this guy...

SIX, ALMOST nails the yorker, on off-stump, Russell backs off and clubs it flat, straight to Agarwal at long-off, who fluffs the catch! He was too far inside, and to add insult to injury, parries it onto the rope to concede six! A crucial drop from Agarwal this. Won't do his confidence much good. And he'd better not look at his captain - the murderous stare of the basilisk will be waiting for him...
FOUR, short and wide, this is poor stuff, Russell has a lot of time to rock back and slap it away through deep extra cover for four. Races away...

out Caught by Tye! GONE! The top-edge is not good enough this time, as the short in-angler cramps him up, beats him for pace and bounce (just about) and induces a top-edge that falls just short of the cow corner boundary. Tye picks up a good catch at the rope and he's pumped - as are the rest of the team team. They seem some light at the end of the tunnel, now that the DreRuss-shaped Frankenstein's monster isn't eclipsing everything. batsman c Tye b bowler 24(14) [4s-2 6s-2]
FOUR, short one at the body, and that's a torso-twisting whippull towards the deep midwicket boundary for four

FOUR, oh, it's a harsh game, cricket. An inch-perfect yorker length delivery outside off, angling in, batsman did try to open the face and run it down, but gets a thin outside edge that just about beats the diving Pooran and runs away to the fence
SIX, short one angling into the gut, batsman backs away and nails the pull, transfers his weight onto the backfoot, and deposits it over deep square leg for six!

FOUR, that's that, then! team live to fight another day, and as do team, who need far too many results to go their way. An in-angler from round the wicket, and batsman sways it away fine towards the long leg for four, to hand team a second consecutive win!

FOUR, that ball had no right to go to the fence. It was just touched by batsman on the whip but the timing was extraordinary and it raced off his blade. It beats the man at mid-on and canters to the fence

FOUR, this one surely hit the sweet spot. And it has reached the fence like a tracer-bullet! It was a slower one on a fuller length, batsman delays his bat swing and powers it wide of long-off for a boundary

FOUR, gee! That has been smashed. batsman looks in his elements today, ominous signs for Kings. It was on a fuller length, was in the slot for batsman. He gets under it and pumps it straight down the ground
FOUR, flurry of boundaries for Lynn. And team are off to a sensational start. It was a short of length on the pads, batsman pulls it wide of the keeper for a boundary
FOUR, edged and four! Lynn won't mind it. bowler starts with a carrom ball, Lynn makes room and swings through the line, the outside edge runs away fine to the third man fence

SIX, that is not the length to bowl to Lynn. Back of a length, is this carrom ball and Lynn sets himself up for a big shot down the ground, his bat speed ensured that the ball cleared the long-off fence with ease

FOUR, poor start from bowler. He needs to be better than that. Back of a length and on the hips, Gill does nothing fancy, whips it with a strong bottom hand backward of square, no chance for the fielder in the deep
SIX, might just be Lynn's night. Even mishits are fetching him runs. This was a short of length delivery at the body, Lynn swivels to play the pull and the top-edge sails over long leg, for a maximum

FOUR, yes, it is his night. Now an inside edge escapes past the stumps to reach the fence. Good length ball and Lynn backs away to swing across the line, the edge evades leg-stump and races to fine leg

out Caught&Bowled!! No, not his night. But he's gotten team off to a flier. bowler is relieved and delighted - throws the ball away after taking the catch in frustration. 127.1ks short of length delivery and Lynn looks to pull it to deep mid-wicket, the top-edge takes it straight up and bowler moves to his right to reverse cup it. team needed that badly. batsman c and b bowler 46(22) [4s-5 6s-3]

FOUR, oh no! Rahul has let one go right through his legs. Drifting on the legs and batsman whips it powerfully to wide long-on, Rahul gets there but allows it to escape past him. That should get batsman going
SIX, one boundary and batsman has found his touch. Flighted delivery and it is in the slot, batsman extends his arms and lofts it straight back over Ashwin, all the way

FOUR, that is the batsman of old. Put the bowler under pressure and then toy with him. Ashwin went short with his length after being hit over his head, batsman waits and back cuts it behind point - bisecting backward point and short third man expertly
FOUR, top shot! Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Cutter on a length, Gill stands tall and drives on the rise past mid-off, the timing he generated on the slower ball was just amazing
FOUR, way too full. batsman opens up his bat face, laying into the width to slice it away through point. That's more the Chris ..

FOUR, 141.5kph. Another juicy overcook. batsman has a big stride to it, making the half volley all the more fuller and holds all his shape to drill it through the covers. There may be three men there, but he's still finding the angles perfectly
SIX, that's right in the swinging arc for Mayank batsman! Loopy on off-stump, he gets underneath the flight and pumps it for a mighty maximum straight down the ground

out Caught by Warrier!! DK's ploy to bring bowler works wonders for team. It was that sort of a delivery where you have too much time and end up tripping over while playing the shot. Short, slow and drifting in, batsman rocked back and nailed the pull as hard as he could, sends the toe-end flat to the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Warrier, who's been involved in all three dismissals so far, claims the catch with ease. batsman c Warrier b bowler 48(27) [4s-3 6s-4]
FOUR, smart cricket from batsman Singh! Sits deep inside for the slower ball and steers it with the finest of touches at the last minute in the gap between the keeper and short third

out Agarwal Run Out!! 1 run completed. Mayank Agarwal and his never-ending love affair with thirties. Lost the count of number of times he's been dismissed around 30s in the last two seasons. So batsman flicks this to the left of deep mid-wicket and calls for two straightaway, Agarwal responds and had to put in a desperate dive to have a sniff at survival, wasn't to be. The throw from Rinku Singh was sharp and adjacent to the stumps, bowler doesn't gather it clean but manages to deflect the ball onto the stumps off his palm, totally unintentional but effective nevertheless. Agarwal run out (Rinku Singh/bowler) 36(26) [4s-2 6s-1]

SIX, that's an extension of punch! Just a mere extension. batsman expected the googly and hung back to target the shorter boundaries (straight down the ground), timed the stroke to perfection while on the move and cleared the ropes with ease
FOUR, full and in the zone outside off, Curran stands still and spanks the drive through extra cover, timing coupled with a hint of power on that

SIX, that is a shot and a half. We have seen him dispatch spinners in Test cricket and he is replicating that in this six-hitting format too. He dashes down with a lot of intent, swings hard at it, gets enough bat on it. The timing was incredible, it hit the sweet spot and it sailed into the night sky over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

1 run, in the air and dropped. Mohali and drop catches, the saga continues! batsman wanted to repeat his effort of the second ball, he miscues this one. And it goes a long way up in the air. Rinku at long-on comes forward, he fails to get his hands in good position and it pops out
FOUR, boundary to finish the over. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, batsman reaches for it and smokes it wide of long-on for a four. It raced off the bat!

out Caught by Uthappa!! Uthappa takes it without much fuss. And Kings lose another one at the wrong time. It was a slower one on a back of a length, batsman moves back, makes room, he wanted to thump it over mid-off. It comes off the bottom half of the bat and pops up in the air. And Robbie makes no mistake at mid-ooff. batsman c Uthappa b bowler 25(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Bowled!! batsman drags it back onto the stumps. This innings is coming apart for Kings! It was an off-cutter around off, batsman went for an old-fashioned heave to the on-side. It comes off the inside edge and shatters the stumps. batsman b bowler 0(3)
FOUR, he is putting up a show, is batsman! He gets cheeky this time, moves to the off-side, opens up the leg-side for himself and paddles it over short fine to collect a boundary

FOUR, now, he flaunts his power! Gee! He hit that hard. He is a short man but sure he has some muscles. It was in the slot, batsman clears his leg, keeps his shape and pumps it down the ground for a boundary
FOUR, Curran-show at the PCA continues! bowler misses the yorker this time, batsman gets under it, makes room, keeps shape and powers it wide of long-off! Amazing bat speed!
SIX, wow! Just wow! He punches his bat in delight. It was a slower one on a fuller length, batsman picks it up, delays his bat swing and smokes it high into the sky and over long-on for a maximum

FOUR, maiden IPL fifty for Curran. He punches the air in delight! We have found another 360 degree player! Whatta cameo this has been! He moves to the off-side, takes it on the full and paddles it fine of fine leg for another four

out Caught by Chris Lynn!! The knuckle's fooling enough. And Chris Lynn - miked up and talking to the on-air comms - is still awake enough to judge the miscued chipped loop going over his head to lap it reverse-cupped without fuss. So it was full, and batsman, early into his flick, ends up without control. And succumbs to give bowler his maiden IPL wicket. batsman c Chris Lynn b bowler 2(7)
FOUR, dishes out width outside off, and it's just too short as well. There may be a gully and a backward point, but batsman lines up really well, opening up and delaying his cut to bisect those two

FOUR, batsman ends the innings in style. This has been the innings of highest quality from the southpaw. And he has powered his team to a formidable total! It was a full-toss on the stumps, batsman shuffles to the off-side and smashes it wide of deep fine leg to end the innings with a four!

out Caught by Shubman Gill!! It's no big secret that Punjab are way too top heavy, but team have successfully knocked out the snake's head. bowler - with another - lets out a nice back of a length sitter on the hips. batsman lines up for a half-hearted swat as well, but the ball just doesn't come on. Ends up taking the upper half of the bat and picks out the only man out there, deep square leg. batsman c Shubman Gill b bowler 14(14) [4s-2]
FOUR, 140.7kph. There's the crunch. bowler gets a little too greedy, going short without a lot of pace and batsman's ready for it, bringing out a short arm jab to smack it into cow corner
SIX, 104.5kph from the back of the hand. And batsman's picking the screws off it, flat-batting, uppishly, way, way over cow corner. Gee, the audacity

SIX, 129kph. There's really nothing wrong with this - it's a tight back of a length in fact, but batsman clears his front leg, takes it off the front foot and goes baseballing it into an empty long-off
FOUR, 130kph, a long hop, and a lucky edge. batsman tries swivelling on a pull intended through mid-wicket, but ends up with a toe-end, running through the slips - the empty slips
SIX, ooh. It's the googly, and batsman couldn't care less. He stands his ground, clears his front leg and swings big, lofting it so damn cleanly, with lots and lots of altitude over long-off
FOUR, another googly taken apart. batsman is reading them perfectly, going really deep to this one and then timing his cut really well behind point
1 run, brings up the 50-run stand with a clip off his pads to deep square
FOUR, lures batsman with flight and bam! batsman had enough time to launch it and he absolutely thrashes it over the bowler
SIX, batsman is in sublime touch tonight! Wasn't all that short, but batsman jumps deep inside the crease and converts it into a half-tracker before muscling the pull over deep square

leg byes, FOUR, help-yourself-with-a-boundary ball, although batsman didn't get any bat on it, still it's a boundary for team. Did he try the slower ball? Could be.. however the line was poor. Slanted it down leg, batsman misses the glance and it goes off the pads, beats Samson and runs away to the fine leg fence

out Caught by Rahane!! And when Pant's extravaganza doesn't consume him, batsman's cheek will. So he tries to be cute, with a late fine sweep past the keeper. But in his pre-guessing, gets a little too early into it and the length's just too full for it as well, resulting in a glove, popping up off his shoulder to a very-alert Rahane - at slip - who runs to where a leg-slip would've been. batsman c Rahane b bowler 12(23)

SIX, full pace at a back of a length - never mind how slow Kotla is when bowler's dishing out juicy freebies. batsman lays into in style, walking across his stumps, making it into a leg-line and then swivelling as well to ensure he makes full use of fine leg being inside the ring with the airy mow
FOUR, still short, and worse, wide too. batsman throws his hands out quickly to slice it away with a lot of power over backward point. Okay, he's officially in a hurry

SIX, the mother of long hops. And batsman nails his pull, flat and with seemingly enough distance over deep square leg. But Parag's there, and he leaps up, doesn't get to the ball but ends up falling flat over on top of the ice-bucket kept in front of his team's dug-out

out Caught by Livingstone!! Brave. He might have been smashed for a six, but now with nothing to lose - except this match which is alrady lost - Gopal tosses his googly up. batsman charges down, doesn't really get close enough but still goes through with the hoick. Ends up with a massive miscues to long-on, where Livingstone runs in to, and then adjusts really well to the ball dipping behind him. batsman c Livingstone b bowler 11(6) [6s-1]
SIX, yea, he's in a hurry. One knee, angry hands and a fierce swing as he swipes it across the line, hammering it flat over long-on. And Kotla's boundaries are no enemy ..

SIX .. aaand Delhi make it to the top two, for today at least. Rajasthan get knocked out, officially. Everything courtesy yet-another batsman slog, the usual, sitting on a knee and smoking it into the first floor at cow corner. Oh also, he has his personal fifty
FOUR, width to batsman? Really? Is that a deathwish? It was short, plenty of width outside off. batsman reaches for it and slaps it up and over point

FOUR, "Rewind and show me that once again," gushes Ian Bishop on air. batsman oozing class here. Innocous fuller length delivery outside off, batsman stretches across and times it off the meat. Didn't try to over-hit it and focussed more on placement and timing
FOUR, that's a loosener from bowler. He's not finished it well as Shaw tucks in a four. Angled it down leg, fine was inside the ring and Shaw glances it past the man at 45

out Caught by Riyan Parag!! What was the hurry? First ball from Sodhi and batsman wants to take him on. Charged down the track, decided to launch it in the 'V' but gets it off the bottom part of the bat. Skies it up in the air and Parag from mid-on calls for it, keeps his eyes on the ball and cups it safely. team have their first wicket, can they nip out a few more? batsman c Riyan Parag b bowler 16(12) [4s-2]

out Bowled!! Chopped on. Sodhi gets two in two and he's on a hat-trick. It's jitters in the team camp now as team are back in the game. Another flop show from Shaw - getting dismissed again for a single-digit score. The top-spinner from Sodhi, gave more loop and Shaw opted to play it on the off-side staying back in his crease. Goes hard away from the body and gets a thick inside edge which shatters back onto the stumps. Sodhi is elated. batsman b bowler 8(8) [4s-1]

SIX, batsman is one of the best players of spin in the country and here's the testament. Sodhi gives more air, overpitches in the process and Iyer frees his arms to thawart it straight down the ground for a maximum
SIX, consecutive sixes for Iyer. He doesn't want Sodhi to dictate terms. Sees another flighted delivery just outside off, extends his long levers and lofts it over long-off. Clean as a whistle!

FOUR, pressure-releasing over from Sodhi. After a great opening over where he picked up two wickets for no run, he leaks 17 in his second. Drags it too short, batsman was quick to pick the length as he pivots back and bashes it through extra cover. This outfield is very quick and there's no stopping those
SIX, so, it was just a sighter from batsman. Spots one in the zone, gets low and imbues his forearm strength to clout this into the deep mid-wicket stands

SIX, gee! How on earth did he get this away for a six? Parag has a wry smile on his face. This was a mis-hit from batsman, lost his balance as he threw everything at it. Skews it off the cue-end and got plenty of height. He placed it in the gap over mid-wicket and in the end, it soared over the ropes for a six

out Caught by Livingstone!! Perks of having a leggie in your team. Shreyas gets the prized scalp of Iyer, who can't believe his luck that he's holed out to the fielder. Shreyas continues to grow from strength to strength and provides his team a crucial breakthrough. Throws it up luringly, Iyer takes his front leg out of the way and launches it down the ground. The timing goes haywire and picks out Livingstone at long-on, who didn't have to move an inch. batsman c Livingstone b bowler 15(9) [6s-2]
SIX, massive, batsman has had enough of prodding and poking, waltzes down the track, gets close to the ball and bludgeons it over mid-wicket for a huge maximum

out Stumped!! This was always on the cards. And bowlerJi wins this battle between leg-spinners! It was a well flighted delivery and was well wide of off, batsman dashes down the track to play a glory shot. It spins away, goes past his willow and Pant takes off the bails in no time. batsman st Pant b bowler 12(18)

out Caught by Pant!! bowlerji is turning it on at Kotla. He will be on a hat-trick. It was a leggie wide of off, it spins away, clips the outside edge of batsman who was probably playing for the wrong 'un. It clips his outside edge and Pant takes it with ease. Golden duck for batsman!batsman c Pant b bowler 0(1)

1 run, oh dear! Would you believe it! Trent Boult has denied Amit bowler his fourth hat-trick in the IPL. And he would be absolutely gutted. It was a well flighted wrong 'un, batsman bends down low and goes for an almighty heave. It comes off the top half of the bat and was in the air for a long time. Two men called for it, one was Boult and the other was Rutherford. Perhaps that put the former off, he misjudged it completely and then had to jump back to complete the catch - can't grab hold of the ball and bowler has his hands on his head
FOUR, short and down the leg-side, batsman rocks back and powers it fine of fine leg for a boundary. Good connection!

out Caught by Ishant!! In the air and taken. What are team doing here? This is the most ordinary batting performance we have seen by any side in this year's IPL. It was a flighted delivery on the stumps, batsman charges down, wanted to loft it over long-off. He failed to time it as well as he would have liked and ends up gifting a catch to long-off. batsman c Ishant b bowler 6(6) [4s-1]

FOUR, bowler is really struggling here. He is bowling all over the pitch. It was on a short of length and was down the leg-side, batsman holds his shape nicely and powers the pull shot wide of fine leg for a boundary

FOUR, it is getting from bad to worse for bowler. And finally, something to cheer for the Royals fans. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, batsman gets underneath it and pumps it wide of cover for a boundary

out Caught by Mishra!! Mishraji in action again! You cannot take him out of the game today! Brilliant with the ball and now brilliant in the field. It was a slower one around off, batsman wanted to turn it to the on-side. He closes the face of the bat early, it clips the leading edge of the blade. And 36-year-old Mishra, dives forward and takes a mighty fine catch. batsman c Mishra b bowler 6(11)
SIX, just enough willow behind it to clear the fence. It was full and was wide of off, batsman clears his leg, keeps his shape and hoicks it over long-off for a maximum. Much-needed for team!

SIX, gets his maiden IPL fifty in style with a maximum. He becomes the youngest cricketer in the IPL to score a fifty! Gee! This young man has some power. And he has flaunted that on this delivery. It was in the slot on a fuller length, he swings his willow, gets it off the sweet spot and it went a long way back into the stands. And boy, isn't he pumped!

out Caught by Dhawan!! That's a soft dismissal for the captain - a leg-stump half-volley from bowler, batsman was looking to work it to the on-side, closed the bat-face early, gets a fat leading edge, high and behind square on the on-side. Dhawan called for the catch, gets across from deep backward square leg, watches the ball all along and completes the catch - cuts to his trademark thighslap celebrations, the Royals have lost an easrly wicket. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 2(4)

out Caught by Rutherford!! batsman will find the fielder. He is disappointed with himself. But cheer up young man, you have just played a special innings for your team. It was on a fuller length again, batsman wanted to dispatch it over long-off, he wasn't balanced at the point of contact. And lost his shape, it comes off the bottom half of the willow and Rutherford makes no mistake at long-off. batsman c Rutherford b bowler 50(49) [4s-4 6s-2]

FOUR, just short and wide of mid-on, batsman came charging down the track, doesn't get hold of the slog - off the toe-end and the ball lobbed in the air, to the left of mid-on who puts in a valiant dive, but can't reach it

out Bowled!! The fallacy of the Kotla wicket does batsman in - this wasn't a slower ball, but there's no pace on this off-cutter - batsman came down the track and was way too early on the slog - completed the shot even before the ball arrived, let a big gap between bat and pad - the ball found its way and rattled the top of middle-stump. bowler loved it, his second wicket of the day and the Royals have lost both openers. batsman b bowler 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

FOUR, nicely done by batsman, his first runs of #IPL2019 - a friendly back of a length delivery on his hips, he gets inside the line and clips it behind square on the on-side, past the diving short fine and races away to the fence

out batsman Run Out!! Oh dear! This is disaster for the Royals - zero communication from both batsman - Lomror kept screaming at his partner who was oblivious to his call, kept running down the track aand then had nowhere to go. This was tossed up on off and batsman pushed it towards cover-point, he took a step down the track and stopped, so did his partner and then suddenly batsman had this urge to run - kept running even as his partner asked him to go back. All Shaw had to do was to pick the ball and throw to the kepeer - he does better and finds the stumps with a direct hit. batsman run out (Prithvi Shaw) 5(8)
FOUR, cheeky and four, on a good length and in that channel outside off, batsman leans across, opens the face of the bat at the last moment, uses the pace on the ball and runs it past the keeper

out Caught by Pant!! The Royals are in a shambles at the moment - a nothing shot from batsman and bowler has his third wicket of the day. He shortened his length and angled this one across the left-hander, batsman's feet went nowhere as he looked to guide it towards the off-side, hung his bat out and the edge carried nicely through to the keeper. batsman c Pant b bowler 8(3) [4s-2]
FOUR, clubbed, tossed up well outside off, Parag bends down low, gets close to the ball and then swipes it wide of mid-wicket, bisected the gap between the two fielders in the deep perfectly
FOUR, smashed, length ball outside off and Parag has drilled it. It was the slower ball and Parag spotted it - gets forward and drivs it back past the bowler, no chance for the man at mid-off

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! The best batsman in the tournament for team flops in the final game of the season. Rare failure for PP as team lose their first wicket. Lenght delivery that gained some extra bounce, Patel was rooted to the crease and whips his bat across. Thick leading edge is found and it goes up in the air. Local boy Manish Pandey sets himself under it at point and pouches it. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 0(3)

FOUR, looks like go big or go home for team. That seems to be the philosophy for them. batsman gets into business rightaway. Flashes his bat at this away-swinger, the bat face turns at the point of contact but he manages to clear the in-field on the off-side. Opens his account with a boundary
FOUR, drilled ferociously past mid-off. That should dent Ahmed's confidence. Pitches it up outside off, it's a tasty half-volley and batsman gets into the act, hammering it past mid-off

SIX, what a shot. batsman special. The lofted on-drive - his signature stroke. Ahmed once again hurls it up, tempting batsman and he nonchalantly picks it with all the dexterity of the wrists over long-on

out Caught by Saha!! bowler crashes batsman's party. And he's off. Gets rid of the Indian captain, team have their tails up. It was short, it was wide and there was width. batsman wanted to have a piece of it, throwing his bat at it. Only succeeds in feeding an outside edge. Saha grabs it in front of his face and Ahmed didn't wait for the catch to be taken. Roars and redeems himself after getting slammed for a four and a six earlier in the over. Pin-drop silence in the stands. batsman walks off for one last time in this tournament, not a great IPL by his standards, definitely. batsman c Saha b bowler 16(7) [4s-2 6s-1]
SIX, goes for a big one and dispatches it over deep mid-wicket. He is taking a liking to bowler! He goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it for a maximum

SIX, wow! That has been smoked from batsman. Maiden IPL fifty for him. And he is pumped, look at him celebrate. He goes down on his knees and connects it magnificently well and dispatches it over deep square leg for a maximum. Insane hitting!

FOUR, well controlled pull shot from batsman. And it will fetch him four. It was on a short of length and was around tummy height, batsman gets in a good position and places the pull shot incredibly well. It beats fine leg for a boundary. He is complimenting batsman pretty well!

FOUR, fantastic touch-play from batsman! This is the best I have seen him bat in the IPL. It was a good length delivery and there was a hint of room, Gurkeerat gets in a fabulous position and just eases it past backward point for a boundary. Stellar timing!

SIX, smashed! batsman-show continues at the Chinnaswamy! This is high-quality hitting from the West Indian. It was short and was around face height, batsman absolutely nails the pull shot. But he failed to get the elevation and Pandey at deep mid-wicket had a chance. But it was hit at such ferocious pace that it went through the hands of Pandey and went over the ropes

1 run, dropped again! This one was much easier. Yusuf Pathan, the culprit. He got to be doing better there. It was a slower one on the stumps, batsman was early into the shot and it comes off the outside edge. It came too slowly to Pathan at point and he spills it
FOUR, another boundary from batsman. He is putting up a show here. It was a flighted delivery and was wide of off, batsman lofts it wide of long-off for a boundary
1 run, pushes it to sweeper cover for a single
FOUR, one shot ball too many from bowler! This one lacked venom! It was around hip-height, batsman gets in good position and he powers it wide of deep mid-wicket for a boundary!

FOUR, Gurkeerat is playing a gem here! He isn't trying to hit too hard just relying on placement. And he is placing them really well. It was a slower one on a short of length, batsman picks it up early, delays the bat swing and pulls it wide of fine leg for a boundary

no run, team have gone for a review for a caught behind. There is surely gap between the bat and the pad. And I will be very surprised, if something comes up in UltraEdge. There is nothing on UltraEdge. And team will lose their review too. It was a brilliant delivery nevertheless, it was on a good length and it snaked back in after hitting the deck. batsman played it down the wrong line and it went between his bat and pad. Manish Pandey strangely heard something and he was the one who pushes Williamson to go for the review!

FOUR, Gurkeerat welcomes bowler with a boundary! It was a slower one on the stumps, batsman whips it in between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket. He found the gap to perfection! The placement was the key their!

FOUR, fifty for Gurkeerat! This has been a sensational knock from the lad from Punjab! He raises his bat in delight! He waits for this delivery to arrive and places it wide of backward point. Again, placement was best aspect of the shot
FOUR, pulls and pulls well. Bhuvi gets a bad bounce at deep mid-wicket. And that will result in another boundary for batsman. It is getting from bad to worse for team!
SIX, bowler has had a rare off day today. It was a wrong 'un on a short of length, batsman rocks back and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Gee! He is in fine touch!

SIX, why were you sitting in the dug-out, Mr. batsman! Red flags flying high and handsome in the crowd. It was touch short, batsman picks up the length early, goes on the back foot and thumps it over long-on

out Caught by Shankar!! batsman has found the fielder there. And he is furious with himself. Look at the anger on his face. It means a lot to these players. Kohli appreciates the effort from the balcony. It was well wide of off, batsman wanted to lift it over long-off. It wasn't timed as well as compared to his previous shots. And Vijay Shankar takes a brilliant catch at long-off. He knew exactly where the ropes were and made sure he didn't touch it. batsman c Shankar b bowler 75(47) [4s-4 6s-6]

out Caught by Y Pathan!! Oh dear! Gurkeerat follows Hetmyer in the dressing room. Don't write team off yet, they are still in the contest. And bowler just can't stop taking wickets. It was a slower delivery on a back of a length, batsman picks it off the hands. He wanted to steer it over short third. It bounces more than Gurkeerat anticipated and hits him high on the bat. Pathan at backward point makes no mistake. batsman c Y Pathan b bowler 65(48) [4s-8 6s-1]

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! team in Kamikaze mode here at the Chinnaswamy. And bowler with the breakthrough again for team. He has been absolutely superb for his side. It was another well disguised slower one and was wide of off, batsman wanted to lift it over mid-on. He was taken aback by the slower one, he miscues it horribly and Pandey at mid-on takes it with utmost ease. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, terrible delivery from bowler! It was full and there was lot of room, Yadav chases it and pumps it wide of backward point for a boundary

FOUR, boundary for Yadav. And he has finished off this match! team win by 4 wickets! Hugs in the team camp. Finally, something for team fans to cheer who have been truly incredible in this season. Kohli with a child-like jump in the dressing room! He has a wide smile on his face! bowler was guilty of providing the width again and it was in the slot again, Yadav throws his bat at it and powers it wide of backward point for another boundary

out Caught by Guptill!! ABD goes. Big, big wicket for team and they are cock-a-hoop. Like Kohli, it's a sorry end to batsman' IPL campaign as he falls cheaply. But it was a nothing shot from the South African. It was shortish and curled away outside off, he just flirted his bat at it without any intent and guided it straight into the hands of Guptill at slip. VVS Laxman is all smiles in the dug-out. team in all sorts of trouble now. batsman c Guptill b bowler 1(2)
FOUR, stamping of authority from batsman. Ahmed gets predictable, bangs it short and it sits up wonderfully for batsman. Rocks back and pummels it wide of mid-on

FOUR, follows violence with finesse. Nothing much wrong with the delivery from Ahmed, saw the batsman move to leg so kept it wider of off. But batsman expertly flails his hands and uses the pace on offer to cream it in the gap at cover
FOUR, that's a quality stroke from Mann. Hint of width and he latches onto it in a flash. Riding the bounce and punching it with all grace and flair - threading the gap between cover-point and point
SIX, whacked over cow corner. batsman tees off, gets under a flighted delivery and pumps it just over the ropes for a maximum
FOUR, spoils it, does batsman. It was turning out to be a good over from bowler. Goes for the quicker ball and messes it up, veering it down leg and batsman glances it past the man at 45
SIX, smoked over cow corner. Flighted delivery from bowler, batsman goes back very quickly on seeing the length and powers it into the stands. Dismissive stuff!
1 run, slower and turning in, Mann knocks it through mid-wicket
FOUR, too short and too straight from Saini, on batsman's pads and it's neatly flicked away towards fine leg, beats CdG - running across from long leg
SIX, lovely, a little shimmy down the track, batsman gets close to the ball, plays with a still head and a straight bat - high and over mid-off, sails over the ropes for a maximum
FOUR, lovely, a rare loose ball from Sundar, dragged short and wide of off, cracked square behind point and the ball runs away to the ropes
FOUR, 134.7kph. He's right up tall to a delivery that's not really short, but then executes a perfect pick-up-swish through mid-wicket. Lots, lots of bottom hand
SIX, comes on. Gets dispatched. A proper sitter, neither-here-nor-there and batsman's always been stylish, clearing out his front leg and pulling it bang off the middle over long-on
SIX, 105kph. Dropped short, batsman still takes it off the front leg, freeing up his hands once again over long-on. Ah, flat
SIX, off a knee now. Sundar tries going down the brave route - tossing it up - and finds it being slog-swept deeper, longer, cow corner

out Caught by de Grandhomme!! Yup, a little too greedy. batsman tries tonking another, revealing his cards a touch too early as he commits down on a knee. Sundar spots, shortens his length a wee bit, letting the ball spin in, which it does to take the eventual top-edge, and CdG isn't messing up the skier, waiting patiently under at short fine leg. batsman c de Grandhomme b bowler 27(18) [6s-3]
SIX, a similar length, but batsman's too smart to be fooled twice in a row. So he walks well across his stumps and pummels it off his legs into deep square leg, 86 meters
SIX, it's an empty cow corner, and KW's exploiting it a little more with his walking-across-carts. Gets behind this back of a length delivery, on top of it as well, in a much smaller smoke

out Caught by U Yadav!! 100th IPL scalp -- and bowler celebrates it by kissing the team badge and just in case you didn't get the message, making a heart as well with his fingers pointing towards the sky to make it all the more apparent. He does it with a pretty innocuous-looking short-wide sitter outside off, but it's foxed Pathan to go hard at it, which he does without a lot of control. Slicing off the outside half in picking out the fielder out there at deep sweeper perfectly. batsman c U Yadav b bowler 3(4)
FOUR, goes funky. And gets edgy. Another usual walk across and then a sit to sweep, but the inside half of the bat gets it fine, really fine
FOUR, 147.8kph. And dispatched at almost double the speed. batsman - cleverly - stays deep in the crease, manages to get under the full length and drill it to bisect extra cover and mid-on

out Caught by Gurkeerat Singh!! Just not in control. Another Hyderabad batsman falls in the quest to pump one over, somewhere, but once again, cannot time it one bit. So batsman picks long-on in trying to go over with a lofted hoick, but ends up getting it high on the bat, dragging it away to Gurkeerat - who runs in, overruns perhaps, but does decently in the end to take it with tummy-support. batsman c Gurkeerat Singh b bowler 4(3) [4s-1]

out Caught by Hetmyer!! Another pull, another miscue. Hurries Rashid into this one, and he tries some sort of a tennis forehand in the end, which ends up getting spooned tamely to deep mid-wicket this time. Hyderabad are falling apart, quite badly too. batsman c Hetmyer b bowler 1(2)
SIX, real smart stuff, he's spotted mid-off in the circle and is happy to loft a very, very flat drive over that guy. It's his fifty as well - the first of 2019

FOUR, oh it gets worse - a full toss now and wide outside off too - for batsman to once again lift it over mid-off. Not quite off the middle, but even the mistime will do when you just aren't bowling to any plan
SIX, shuffle, swing, six. Picks out the off-cutter, gets under the length and heaves it with lots of bottom-hand over mid-wicket
FOUR, 143.2kph. Okay, well it CAN get worse. batsman makes room now for a change, has his hands freed up to the wide full toss and slices it over extra cover
FOUR, lovely, 19 from the over, fraction overpitched and wide of off, batsman throws his hands at it and drills the drive over cover, few bounces and over the ropes
SIX, massive, team have got going, comes down the track - did batsman, makes room as he did so and carves a length ball over cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

1 run, chance and Chahal has dropped - team have been far too clumsy with their catching this season - short and at the stumps, batsman swivelled across and pulled it over square leg - was in the air and Chahal did all the right things, ran across and then slid, got both hands but couldn't hold on
FOUR, make it 28. And Umesh's gifted away the momentum, although with a really good ball here. Bumper, Bhuvi gets under pulls desperately, top-edges, over short fine leg. 175

FOUR, top-edge and four, tossed up just outside off, batsman went down low on the sweep, didn't get on top of the bounce, but he knew there was no one in the deep, bounces a couple of times and rolls over the ropes
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries, bowler dragged his length back a fraction, batsman is quick to rock back and beats mid-wicket with the pull, pressure straightaway on bowler
FOUR, make it a hat-trick of boundaries, he's toying with bowler, comes down the track, gets close to the ball and does enough to clear the leaping fielder at mid-off

out Caught by U Yadav!! This was coming - batsman was throwing his bat with gay abandon, change of pace does the trick for Saini - the slower ball outside off, batsman didn't spot it, went hard on the drive and dragged it to Umesh at mid-on. team needed this wicket - batsman though has done his job. batsman c U Yadav b bowler 20(11) [4s-4]
FOUR, cracking shot, short of a length and just outside off, batsman made room for himself and clattered it over cover, no one moved and that brings up team's 50
FOUR, crisp, length ball and well outside off, Manish leans into the drive, plays it on the up and past the fielder at mid-off, nice way to get going

out Caught by Kohli!! Pace off the ball and batsman has clipped it straight into the hands of Kohli at mid-wicket - yelps in despair, but he can now go and cool his heels in the dressing room. Flatter and at the stumps, perhaps it straightened a bit off the pitch, batsman went back on the clip, didn't account for the drift and the leading edge went straight into the hands of the opposition skipper. batsman c Kohli b bowler 30(23) [4s-2 6s-2]

out Caught by Hetmyer!! Smart catch from Hetmyer, but think he's unsure about the catch. The umpires will go upstairs and the soft signal is OUT. Did he get his fingers undernath the ball? It's a fair delivery and it's a fair catch, but has the ball touched the ground as he rolled over? Was he under control? Sunil Gavaskar thinks it's NOT OUT as he wasn't in complete control. But what will the third umpire think? He thinks Manish is OUT. Two wickets in the over and team are pulling things back - this was dropped short and Manish's eyes lit up - rocked back on the pull, didn't get hold of the shot, was in the air for a long time, Hetmyer got across from deep mid-wicket, slid forward and completed a good two-handed catch. As he rolled over, the ball might / might not have touched the grass. Tough call, but the soft signal was OUT and the third umpire had no conclusive proof to overturn it. batsman c Hetmyer b bowler 9(12) [4s-1]

FOUR, that should make him feel better. Brar errs in his line here - just outside off and batsman is quick to latch on, he moves back in the crease and caresses the punch through cover-point. All timing!
FOUR, gift from bowler and batsman accepts it gleefully. Good length ball on the pads, he leans forward and clips it neatly past the square leg umpire, the quick outfield does the rest
1 run, half-tracker to begin with, keeps really low and batsman accounts for it by getting his body weight down and dragging the pull to deep mid-wicket

FOUR, batsman puts his dancing shoes on and lifts it over the bowler's head. Such clean hitting, holds his shape and earns a boundary. The key was he picked the length and met the pitch at the right time, then his fast hands taking over to execute the shot. It bounces just inside the ad cushions
