FOUR, oh, that's sloppy from KL Rahul. School-boyish error as he fails to get his body behind the line and lets it through his legs. batsman shaved it towards long-on, KL Rahul moves across to his right and perhaps took his eyes off the ball completely. Don't even look at your skipper, KL..

FOUR, appaling from bowler. Splays it on leg-stump, batsman is clever as he moves inside the line and tucks it fine. Harpreet from fine leg was slightly squarer and despite his dive, the ball runs away to the fence

no run, a dipping slower delivery from bowler, batsman didn't pick it as he misses the flick and overbalances a touch. bowler was confident enough to convince his skipper to go for the review but it was confirmed by UltraEdge that there was a clear inside edge
1 run, nurdled away through square leg and that brings up batsman' fifty. He's found form of late and this is a massive boost for team. Raise of the bat to soak in all the applauses from the dug-out

FOUR, bisects the gap on this occasion. batsman reaches his fifty, up goes the bat as well. Similar delivery from Ashwin, getting too predictable as batsman lines up and smashes it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long-on
FOUR, he's changing his gears now. Runs down the track, takes this floater on the full and drills it straight down the ground
SIX, it's getting worse for Ashwin. batsman skates down the track again, meets the pitch and extends his arms into a lofty hit over long-on
FOUR, bullied through extra cover. The intentions are clear from batsman. Knuckle ball, on a fuller length outside off. batsman sets a solid base and crunches it wide of long-off
FOUR, back-to-back fours. It's been raining boundaries in the last few overs. bowler digs it short, sits up emphatically for batsman as he nails the pull in front of square on the leg-side

SIX, bowler is being taken to the cleaners. 14 runs off the first three balls. Pitches up, just where batsman was hoping for. Gets under it and thumps it over long-on for a maximum. Just clears M Ashwin, who was patrolling the fence

SIX, tonked down the ground for a six. It's in that swinging arc, just outside off. batsman arrests his back-lift and launches it over the bowler's head. For a moment, looked like he didn't get it off the middle but still he manages to get it over the fence

out Caught by Shami!! There's the sucker-punch. Curran's the partnership breaker. This should soothe some nerves in the team camp. Went shorter and cramped batsman for room, he tried it help it fine but ended up hitting it straight to Shami at 45 - who gobbles it up. Fine innings from batsman comes to an end. Curran spotted that the batsmen didn't cross, so alerts the umpire about the same. Smarty! batsman c Shami b bowler 53(38) [4s-5 6s-2]
SIX, slotted over cow corner. batsman inching closer to his ton. Another short ball, batsman gets into a brilliant position and sends it a countrymile over deep mid-wicket

out Bowled!! Fiery response from Curran. Very impressive delivery from the youngster. It was full, it tailed in sharply and batsman was all at sea as he falls over. Gets rapped on the pad, then it deflects onto the stumps. Unfortunate end to what's been a thoroughly entertaining knock from the South African captain. The ton was definitely there for the taking. Good sportsmanship from the bowler as he pats Faf on the back. batsman b bowler 96(55) [4s-10 6s-4]

out Caught by Mandeep!! Straight down the throat of Mandeep at deep mid-wicket. batsman is disappointed, reckons he should've got it away over the ropes. Fullish, nipping back in a bit and batsman wallops it off his pads. Didn't impart enough power to clear the fielder and Mandeep doesn't drop those. batsman c Mandeep b bowler 1(2)

out Bowled!! This is turning out to be an outstanding final over from bowler. team falling away. Another top-notch full delivery, straightening on and Jadhav exposes his stumps. Trying to make some room and misses it completely. The stumps are shattered and bowler picks up his second wicket. batsman b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, shot! Just a mere push and the ball races away. Full and angled across off, batsman eases with a forward extension past the bowler and the timing takes care of the rest

FOUR, the pressure is released with a low full toss. bowler went for the yorker and did not get it right, batsman flicks it past the mid-wicket fielder and once it passes the inner ring, there is no stopping that

out Bowled!! Cleaned up! batsman's struggles continue.. Apart from one innings, he has looked woefully out of form. Fuller than a good length and batsman wanted to steer it to third man, too close to him and the off-stump is pegged back. team once again lose a wicket in the powerplay. batsman b bowler 7(11) [4s-1]
FOUR, lovely shot! Good use of the feet. He left the crease and did not allow Curran to change his length, right in the slot and he creams the drive straight down the ground
FOUR, fraction short and batsman is quick to pounce on that, he rocks back and nails the pull in front of square, couple of bounces and into the fence
SIX, that is much better. Why nudge and nurdle when you have the shots? batsman shimmies down the wicket and though he wasn't to the pitch, he went through with the loft and it sailed over long-on
FOUR, neatly done! He waits and the ball was outside off, dabs it past Gayle at slip and the chasing fielder had no chance. Raced away..

SIX, super shot! He is picking his deliveries and time to attack the left-arm spinner. batsman dances down the wicket and gets close to the ball, swings it with the spin over deep mid-wicket. This came right off the screws and went a long way
FOUR, fabulous shot! Good length ball outside off, batsman stays his ground and lofts it handsomely over extra cover, just an extension of the arms and the connection was exquisite
FOUR, poor bowling. Offers width outside off and batsman places it expertly, he waits for the ball to arrive and steers it behind point - between short third man and backward point
SIX, just the perfect over-ruiner. And bowler's to blame -- letting out a rank short sitter outside off, slow as well for batsman to line it up as he swivels and pulls it over cow corner
FOUR, well this is no Chepauk .. Bhajji tries spinning one across from a leg-line, alas, it goes straight on for an easy flick right through square leg
SIX, slowed up just for a change, and batsman's no slow coach - he makes room and goes inside-out in a lofted extension of his arms over extra cover
SIX, now a shuffle, and goes the other way. It's in line with the stumps, which batsman now has the spin for help as well as he sweeps it without even bothering to keep it down. Way over fine leg

out Caught by Tahir! A sigh of relief, as the breakthrough arrives! Looks like the topspinner, that straightened naturally a little from the over the wicket angle, batsman charges down the wicket to loft it out of Punjab (Udta Punjab?) slices it high in the air and Tahir at extra cover settles under it. batsman c Tahir b bowler 71(36) [4s-7 6s-5]

out Caught by (sub)Shorey! "Wickets in packs" - that was Bhajji's catchphrase when he played for India, and it has reappeared all these years later. A gentle half-tracker, batsman rocks back and nails itflat towards long-on but picks out Shorey to perfection! Gives batsman a little smile, and he looks shell-shocked, does batsman. batsman c (sub)Shorey b bowler 28(28) [4s-2 6s-2]
FOUR, flat one angled into middle and leg, batsman gets low and swats a sweep away to backward square leg for four

out Caught by Jadeja! Can you believe it? He's dragged another rank half-tracker with a pull straight to Jadeja at deep backward square leg. What a meltdown. I'm out of words - which can be a pivotal drawback in my line of work. batsman departs. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 7(6) [4s-1]
SIX, dropped short, poor bowling, batsman rocks back, very deep in the crease, and pulls it with an elegant flourish high and mighty into the cow corner crowd
no run, dropped by the substitute, Vijay! A wide and full one, batsman gets forward and lashes it square, straight to Vijay at point where Vijay spills a rgulation chance
FOUR, half-volley right in the slot, batsman doesn't need to get forward just leans into it with the powerful forearms and thrashes it through deep extra cover for four
SIX, half-tracker from round the wicket, flat one, batsman whacks it high and mighty over deep mid-wicket for six
FOUR, another one dropped short, batsman gets his weight onto the backfoot and smokes the pull to the long-on fence for four
byes, FOUR, yorker length delivery, batsman tries squeezing it away, nutmegs Dhoni to the long stop fence for four byes
SIX, dropped short, absolutely abominable delivery, batsman rocks back and deposits it over deep mid-wicket with a pull for six

out Caught by Dhoni! Gone! Another short one, a bit of extra bounce and topspin, batsman tries getting low and carving it away behind point, gets a little big on him, take the top-edge and into the gloves of the unerring MS Dhoni. Another one down, and that delays team's inevitable doom. Not a phrase you use very often, and perhaps one that has made several mortals on the sidelines swallow their words, but this one isn't looking great. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 36(22) [4s-2 6s-3]

FOUR, all over! Bittersweet win for team at home to finish off the season, as they manage to avoid the wooden spoon - that was to be team's destiny this time. It's a very full ball that's swatted over mid-on to the boundary for four to seal a consolation win for team
FOUR, the yorker goes wrong. Just an inch too full, just a degree too leg-sided and batsman has easy pickings, flicking it perfectly behind square
FOUR, 115.9kph, it's a larget buffet. bowler tries overcorrecting, goes short, on the hips and swats don't really get any easier - whacking it once again into fine leg

FOUR, full toss. batsman's cleared out his front leg, laying into it with a fierce cover drive. Bravo - at mid-off - is right there, but he charges at it and his old back is really slow in bending down in time, misfields
FOUR, and now bowler overcompensates with the drag down. batsman rocks behind, pumping the pull over mid-wicket
FOUR, oops. bowler and no-Chepauk is a turning into a nightmare. H continues to keep it short, and batsman continues heaving them mercilessly into cow corner
SIX, oh he'll run down now. Closes in on where it pitches and then goes inside-out, long levers, long-off. It's KL, the 2018 version

SIX, 19 balls | 52 runs -- the third fastest of the season. And it's just as stunning a shot to get there, the usual straight high-elbowed lofted punch. It's not everyday that you leave Gayle stranded at 4 off 5 balls while you have your fun
leg byes, FOUR, hmmm, slips into the thighs, and the thighs are good enough to nudge them away fine, certainly helps his cause when fine leg's inside the ring
FOUR, wide full toss. batsman, thankfully, holds his shape, quietly relying on placing it through the cover gap. And the gap's good enough
SIX, brave toss up, but it goes wrong big time. Just too full and outside off as well with batsman hanging back in his crease to smoke it typically into the sightscreen straight down
SIX, and now he'll use the turn as well. bowler goes length and batsman goes tonking them over long-on, swishing the whack, long, hard
FOUR, walking swat, utterly outrageous. batsman - clearly with no respect - walks down the pitch and then rocks onto the front foot to pull it so damn neatly to bisect deep mid-wicket and long-on
FOUR, more grace, and rubbed in with more team misery. A very short arm drill, leaning back and generating a lot of power to pump it just in front of long-off's ropes

SIX, is that the shackle breaker? He doesn't even want to go to Karthik and punch gloves. Tells his skipper to stay put. bowler dishes out a slower length delivery from round the wicket, batsman clears his front leg and smokes it over cow corner

out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Krunal has plucked it out of thin air. This might be a blessing in disguise for team. They need Russell out in the middle. batsman and Uthappa were going nowhere with this innings. Full and on the stumps, batsman whipped it cleanly and thought he had got it over the man at mid-wicket, but Krunal uses his height and times his jump to perfection to catch it with both hands. batsman c Krunal Pandya b bowler 3(9)

out Caught by de Kock!! Oh dear! The faces in the team dugout tell it all. Russell picked the wrong day to fail. His first single digit score and it has come in a crunch game. He doesn't walk back to the dugout but climbs up the stairs and goes into the dressing room. bowler's ploy to bowl round the wicket has worked. Dug in short and gets it to climb near chest high, Russell arches back to evade it but leaves his gloves hanging mid-air, there is a brush and de Kock does the rest. Umpire Nandan took his time but eventually made the right decision. Russell didn't bother to have a word with Uthappa for the review as he knew he had got something on it. batsman c de Kock b bowler 0(1)
FOUR, needed, much needed. team will take them any which way. Backed away and created the room to get the bat swing, carved behind point and the pace bowler is enough to beat the third man fielder

SIX, four followed by a six. That should ideal get him going but not sure today. Short ball at the body, batsman has no other option but to take it on, the top-edge sails over the deep backward square fielder
SIX, second ball and Rana puts it into the stand. Gentle full delivery outside off, Rana just extends his arms and lofts it handsomely over mid-off, the timing was such that it goes the distance
SIX, 14 off the 3 balls. This is smart batting by Rana. He backs away and waits for the slower short of length delivery, ramps it over short third and the ball just manages to clear the rope
1 run, direct hit and Rana was gone. Full delivery outside off, Rana cue-ends the drive to extra cover and takes on Rohit's throw, he's lucky that it was not on target
SIX, just over Pollard. Misses the yorker and bowls a juicy full toss, batsman goes straight down the ground and gets enough wood on it to clear a leaping Pollard

SIX, consecutive sixes. The slower delivery from bowler and not sure Rana was looking to go deep square leg, he intended to hit it over mid-wicket but ended up dragging it over deep square. He won't mind the final result though

out Caught by Pollard!! Gone! He had to go after every delivery and this time he mistimes it. Third wicket for bowler. Rana's cameo is cut short. Another slower delivery, Rana went deep in the crease and got underneath it, but could not generate enough power to clear the incoming long-off fielder. team needed Rana to play through as he was looking more dangerous out of the two batsmen. batsman c Pollard b bowler 26(13) [6s-3]

out Caught by Rohit!! The pain, the suffering comes to an end. The off-cutter from bowler and it dips on batsman, who looks to go across the line, the toe-end goes straight up and Rohit settles under it near extra cover. He walks back to the dressing room and would love to be a fly in there. batsman c Rohit b bowler 40(47) [4s-1 6s-3]

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Taken! bowler ends the innings with a couple of wickets. A fast full toss on the stumps, batsman gave it his all to clear the field near long-on, but could not get the distance. Hardik is well inside the rope as he takes it calmly. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 4(6)
SIX, there's the first maximum for the evening. Lynn cuts loose, gets the required length to swing his arms and clouts it way back into the cow corner stands
FOUR, smacked. bowler's slower ball provides width for Lynn, frees his arms and throws his bat. Crashes it in the gap at cover. That sped off the bat in a jiffy
SIX, not going to see it off on this occasion. This bouncer is directed at the torso, it was kicking rapidly at him. But Lynn gets his weight back and helps it over short fine leg for a six

1 run, good length, in the channel just outside off. Gill drops it with soft hands in front of extra cover and charges across to the other end. Rohit rushed in and under-armed a throw, but couldn't nail the target

no ball, FOUR, slower ball goes all awry for bowler. Ends up as a waist-high full toss outside off, Lynn was making room and connects with the slash. Sending it over point and free-hit beckons for Lynn
SIX, serves it up in the zone and gets punished. Lynn shows no mercy as he clears his front leg and dismisses it straight down the ground for half-a-dozen

SIX, dumped disdainfully over long-off. He's continuing from where he left off from the last game. Chahar under the pump now. Flighted it more luringly, Lynn gets under it and butchers it over long-off

out Lbw!! Gill walks off after having a chat with his partner. The golden arm of Hardik strikes for team and team lose their first wicket. Gill wasn't looking fluid from the start, found it difficult to get going and Hardik has trapped him. It was the off-paced delivery, dipped upon pitching and the batsman was caught playing down the wrong line. Completely missed it, getting struck in-line with the stumps. HawkEye confirms that it's crashing into middle and leg stump. The blue flags are out and team fans are elated. batsman lbw b bowler 9(16)

out Caught by de Kock!! bowler is turning it on for team. "You cannot keep Hardik out of the game," chirps Kevin Pietersen on air. It was the slower ball, lands it well outside off making Lynn to fetch for it. The batsman accepts the challenge and reaches out aiming for a biggie. Terribly mistimes, slicing it up off a top-edge. QdK back-tracks, calls for it and nestles in his gloves. Huge blow for team this. batsman c de Kock b bowler 41(29) [4s-2 6s-4]
SIX, short one at the body, batsman shapes up to hook - oops, he's late on it - bit of a top-edge, very high on the bat, goes over the expectant fine leg fielder for six! QdK is surprised it carried!
FOUR, off-break. Suryakumar too continues staying on the back foot, whipping it with a lot more intent, under short mid-wicket's dive
FOUR, so very beautiful. And trust batsman to come up with them time and again -- this time courtesy just a punch, splitting the two covers
1 run, 140.7kph, middle-lined, quiet wristy knock down to long-on
SIX, okay, finally, a hurry. Yadav gets half a press in front and lofts his whip, many rows into cow corner
FOUR, drags it down, and fittingly as team's campaign has gone in 2019, bowler too bowls out with a long hop. batsman goes back in, makes it look a lot worse and pummels it wide of long-on
FOUR, another overcook. This time Suryakumar's good enough to ensure he doesn't need a fielding blunder, does it with an on-drive, through a straighter long-on
1 run, just a punch, lining up well as he carves it through the covers. Also, a fifty -- and batsman points his bat to his daughter holding it up against his shoulder
FOUR, it's into the fun zone. bowler gives out another short one well down leg and Surya heaves it further. A tickle would've done here, but no, he'll do a carnage
FOUR, woah. batsman > elegance. It's too full anyways and Sharma lays in with a stride getting to it in drilling a lofted drill straight into long-on

SIX, and the strategy dished out means it needs only one ball to finish things up. Mumbai top the table, Kolkata get wrapped up. Russell takes all his anger out in this delivery, banging it in short, down leg and Suryakumar hooks it away fine, very fine, very long. Mumbai seem calm, but trust Hyderbad to errupt.
FOUR, delicate! Banged in on a back of a length, good bounce, batsman gets low, steers it away fine towards the third man fence for four
SIX, ah, the good ol' length-ball swat! On a length, and hence, in the slot - batsman plays the pick-up swat over deep mid-wicket for six

SIX, consecutive sixes! Another short one @144km/h, batsman swivels on his toe and gets it off the sticker of the bat over the fine leg fence for six. Very fine, and that's landed just in front of the more vocal comm. box!

FOUR, he persists with the short ball ploy, the slower one this time, batsman shapes up for the pull, delays it beautifully, and clubs it over the in-field to the deep square leg boundary for four. QdK with an epiphany here!
FOUR, short and wide, batsman flat-bats a pull over a frustrated, crimson Russell, to the long-on fence for four

out Caught by Karthik! What a deperately fantastic catch that is! A short one at the body, batsman isn't second-time lucky with a top-edged hook, skies it towards fine leg, looks, for an eternity, like it will land in no man's land, but Karthik, the stubborn Karthik, chases it down from the 'keeper's stop and dives full-stretch to take a magnificent catch. It's that kind of inspirational moment by the skipper, the kind of fairytale moment, that can turn a match, or even a tournament, on its head. batsman c Karthik b bowler 30(23) [4s-1 6s-3]
FOUR, short and wide, poor bowling, and a gorgeous punch in front of deep point for four

FOUR, short one at the body, batsman hasn't opened up his stance, finds himself in an awkward position, knows he'll be late on it, and goes for a blind hook - gets bat on it and deflects it away towards fine leg for four
FOUR, fired down leg, batsman steps across, laps it away with a fine sweep towards fine leg for four
FOUR, fuller length delivery outside off, whipped away, dragging it from outside the off-stump with a Laxman-esque flourish for four
FOUR, short, not fast enough - @138.9km/h but a lot of pace lost on this dry wicket. Pulled away off the frontfoot for four through cow corner

FOUR, just over a leaping Bumrah! Fortune for batsman who went hard on seeing the width but was never in control. Ended up slicing it towards short third man and Bumrah despite a great leap could barely get his fingertips on it. Phew!
FOUR, nicely done by batsman, he pre-empted that bowler was going to bowl full, bent down low, uses the pace on the ball and flicks it fine, no chance for the fielder at long leg

1 run, a direct hit from Rohit and Vijay would have been running all the way to the dug-out - a suicidal call from batsman, came down the track and pushed it straight to cover, bounced nicely into Rohit's hands and he had time to to take aim and hit the stumps

out Stumped!! A ripper of a leg-break and Rahul has struck with his first ball of the comeback over - a top delivery and even better keeping - batsman looked good during his stint, but he has to walk back to huge roars - that's because the next man in is MS. A quality delivery from Rahul, drifted in, dragged batsman forward with the length, made him think he could work it to the on-side, then the ball gripped and turned past the outside edge - quicksilver work from de Kock and batsman was stranded way outside the crease. batsman st de Kock b bowler 26(26) [4s-3]
SIX, cracking shot, excellent use of the feet from MS, comes down the track, gets close to the ball, plays with the turn and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum
SIX, massive, the pep talk has worked, batsman dances down the track, gets close to the ball, lets the ball turn and then clouts it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

FOUR, nicely played by batsman - he's taking the lead here, mid-off was inside the ring and batsman chanced his arm - length ball outside off, he didn't time it all that well, sliced it high and cleared the fielder in the ring, one bounce and over the ropes

FOUR, mind-reader batsman. Expected the slower delivery from bowler, so walks across his stumps and gets into a great position to smack the pull over square leg. Picked his spot and executed it to perfection

SIX, monster blow from batsman. He'll make a mockery of you if you miss your length. And this is the shot he will play even in his sleep. bowler misses the yorker, sends it into the swinging zone for batsman and he makes him pay. Gets under it and tonks it powerfully over long-on. That's going, going and goes a long way into the stands
SIX, it's two in two now. bowler under the pump. Errs again, hurls in a similar delivery. batsman was ready for it, waits for it and absolutely clobbers it over long-on again

out Caught by (sub)Anmolpreet Singh!! Chahar strikes first ball! He lets out a roar too and why not! This is a massive strike for the Mumbai Indians as team's last match hero batsman goes. Was a similar shot to the one he survived in the previous over, went hard on the cut this time and it was a fizzing leg break that turned quite a bit. The bounce also undid Faf who sliced it straight to backward point. Super Kings dented early! batsman c (sub)Anmolpreet Singh b bowler 6(11) [4s-1]
FOUR, this time batsman gets the boundary! On the pads and he swings merrily over backward square leg. Lovely bat swing and it races away to the fence

out Caught&Bowled!! Another massive strike! This is another severe dent made by the Mumbai Indians. Rash from batsman who goes for the wrong option on a spinning pitch - against the turn. Wanted to hoick across the line but could only sky it high in the air. Jayant himself called for it, trekked back and got under the skier with ease. What a start this is for team! batsman c and b bowler 5(7) [4s-1]
FOUR, some respite for team as they get a much-needed boundary. Was a bit too straight from bowler and batsman helped it wide of short fine leg with a neat glance
FOUR, crunched away! Fractionally short from bowler and it's the trademark pull from batsman. Rocks back quickly and dispatches it over mid-wicket. Clean hit
FOUR, streaky runs but they all count! Flattish and turning away from around off, batsman was squared up all ends up on the flick. Thick edge and it beat backward point, all the way to the fence
FOUR, this is superb batting from batsman, attacking spin with positive strokeplay. Shuffles a bit early across the stumps and slog sweeps it cleanly over short fine leg. One bounce to the fence

out Caught by Jayant Yadav!! Brilliant catch! Jayant is the man at mid-on and he had to go with his back to the ball. Such catches are never easy but he made it look effortless. Once again a wicket due to poor shot selection, the partnership was budding and batsman opts for a pull off the back foot. Against the turn and ends up mistiming it down the ground. Wasn't in control and perishes. Pressure mounts on team! batsman c Jayant Yadav b bowler 10(13) [4s-2]
FOUR, crisply struck by batsman, got forward to this half volley and creamed the drive through extra cover. Pollard in the deep made an attempt but couldn't quite succeed

FOUR, glorious way to kick-start your innings. Outswinger from bowler, too short and swinging away outside off. batsman stands tall, hands following and creams it stylishly through extra cover. team's captain is off and running

out Lbw!! batsman has been given out lbw, he has a chat with QdK and reviews. Did it pitch in-line? That could be the only factor saving batsman here because there's no bat, HawkEye confirms it. Pitching - In-line. Impact - In-line. Wickets - Umpire's call. It's crashing the top of leg-stump. batsman's a goner. Huge strike for team. Glum faces in the team camp. It's a similar delivery that trapped Chris Lynn. The outswinger again, pitched on a length and straightened viciously leaving batsman all at sea as he plays down the wrong line. Gets beaten on the outside edge and it clicks him on the back pad. Umpire Nitin Menon was quick to raise his finger and he's spot on. batsman lbw b bowler 4(2) [4s-1]

FOUR, Suryakumar flashes and flashes hard, nearly picked out the fielder at short third man but it's just out of reach of Tahir. It was short and plenty of width for the taking, Suryakumar obliged and ended up outside-edging it. Luckily, gets away as it just about beats Tahir's dive to his left and runs away to the boundary

FOUR, oh! This was fraught with danger. The quicker delivery from bowler, gunning at the stumps and batsman went deep for the cut. Manages to get his bat down in time and scythes it past backward point. That was a close call
FOUR, there's some helicopter in this one, piling on the low full toss and whipping it into cow corner
FOUR, more helicopter. A more-standing one here, staying up on the back foot and the power imparted on it is enough to whack it once again wide of long-on

FOUR, lovely batting from batsman. bowler gets slightly short, and he pounces on it. Right back in the crease, waits for the ball and dabs it past slip. bowler livid with himself, swings his hand wildly in frustration
4 wides, that's just bonus runs. Down the leg-side, turning away further and even Dhoni fails to get across in time. Desperate effort from Harbhajan to save the boundary
FOUR, should I, shouldn't I.. while Harbhajan deliberates on the dive, the ball goes through. Another deft touch from Suryakumar, dabbing this flat leg-break fine of backward point

out Bowled!! Beaten by pace, and by the length. Flat and quick from bowler, looked like the flipper which gained pace off a length and went right through Kishan who was in the middle of an attempted pull. Completely misjudged the trajectory. The off stump is knocked over. batsman b bowler 28(31) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Caught&Bowled!! Chipped back to bowler. A yorker length delivery that was squeezed back off the toe-end, and not many team players appeared too excited about it. They thought it was a bump ball. But bowler went up straightaway. And he's right. Third umpire verifies that it landed on the pitch, then came off the bat. batsman c and b bowler 0(1)

FOUR, the outside edge flies between keeper and slip. Absolutely flew off the bat. Length ball ripping away from off, draws Yadav forward in defence and the turn is prodigious. Watson is slow to react, and when he does, it doesn't stick in the left hand
FOUR, drifting down leg, batsman picks the line up quickly, gets down low and paddles it on its way
FOUR, walks across, gets underneath this back of a length delivery and scoops it fine. He's been different class tonight
FOUR, wonderful adjustment from batsman. It was length outside off, batsman sits low, rolls his wrists and laps it to the fine leg fence. Knew the fielder was squarer, so placed it beautifully

out Caught by du Plessis!! Trap set, trap sprung. batsman couldn't have placed it any better and Faf takes a smart catch at long-off. Floated up by bowler, batsman creates room seeking for the inside-out loft and ends up lofting it towards du Plessis at long-off who moved to his right and gobbled it up. The fielder was a bit wider and batsman intended it to go more squarer there. Unfortunately, picked out the fielder. Both openers back in the hut for team. team fans find their voice back. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 8(12) [4s-2]

FOUR, loses radar. Yea, the overestimation of his swing - starting on the middle-stump line and expecting it to go across. But alas, it goes straight on, and Suryakumar makes it worse with his shuffle, tickling it off his thighs fine

FOUR, dropped. Yadav tries a cross-batted whack, but the ball sticks in, just doesn't come on. And Vijay - the mid-on guy - is a touch late in reacting, but does decently towards the end to stretch out, only for the ball to burst through the palms

FOUR, ah, ugly. Really, really bad-looking. Kishan - desperate to breach this pressure he's put on himself - runs down the pitch, hoicks big, hoping to go somewhere over cow corner, but only ends up with a thick leading edge, just past Watson leaping up at slip and managing to trickle under Bravo's diving attempts in the deep
SIX, he'll bite the bait. Is happy to go against the turn, milking the last ball of the powerplay that doesn't allow a deep mid-wicket - sitting on a knee and slogging it over. Cleanly
FOUR, 131.6kph, continues dishing out full pace and Yadav obliges with the elegant-est of cover drives, on the up,through both the dives of extra cover and mid-off

FOUR, batsman is off and running. That is a super shot. Not much wrong with the delivery. Good length just outside off, batsman drives with minimal footwork and pierces the gap wide of cover. The timing was exquisite
FOUR, overcorrects his line and is made to pay. On a length on leg-stump, batsman leans into the flick and strikes it square past the umpire, no chance for fine leg to get across and stop that

out Caught by Saha!! Khaleel gets the breakthrough and he is absolutely loving the celebrations, mimics a phone ring as soon as he sees Saha gather the catch. Bowled it in that uncertainty channel outside off and caught batsman poking at it sans any conviction, a thick edge and Saha does the rest. batsman c Saha b bowler 8(10) [4s-1]

out Caught by Shankar!! One brings two!! Is this the game changer? It's a slower short ball outside off, batsman went for the pull but didn't really move his feet in terms of trying to reach the line of the delivery, it was well wide of him and that meant he got a thick top-edge which has been snaffled by Shankar at point. batsman c Shankar b bowler 56(38) [4s-6 6s-2]
SIX, gets underneath the tossed up delivery and smokes it for a 91-metre maximum over long-on. Gee, that power off the bottom hand...
FOUR, jumps out, looks to slam it away into the on-side and gets a fine inside edge for the ball to whizz past the keeper to his right for a four. Streaky but much needed
SIX, that is where he is very strong! On the hips, just a pick up shot and that has gone many a mile over the deep backward square stands. 53 off 37 looks far more gettable

out Lbw!! Fuller and flatter, batsman missed the clip for the ball to thud his front pad. Bruce Oxenford had his finger up and batsman after some deliberation with his partner decided to review. But that was in vain as it was three reds. team are still breathing.. batsman lbw b bowler 14(13) [4s-1 6s-1]

out Caught by Saha!! And batsman is not a happy man trudging off. Don't think he gloved that flattish leggie. Looked to cut, was cramped for room and the ball jammed off his thigh pad into the gloves of the keeper. team had lost their review earlier in the over and batsman had to proceed with his walk towards the pavilion. team are in disarray!! batsman c Saha b bowler 0(3)
SIX, kneels down and lifts the ball away! That wasn't too far away from Rashid at the boundary line. The ball pops over the fence as well. Much needed sixer for team
SIX, length delivery going across and has been lifted away over deep long-off for a sixer. Poor choice of ball and has been deposited over the fence
FOUR, fuller and slower, thumped down the ground! That was blasted past the bowler. bowler had no chance. Have team made a mistake by giving it to Thampi?
SIX, another slower delivery and has been thumped over deep mid. Got hold of the ball and muscled it over the boundary. Poor execution
FOUR, team and batsman are bossing this chase now! KW has played his cards wrong tonight. Length ball on the pads and has been whipped away past the short fine leg fielder for a four
SIX, you beauty! batsman on beast mode. Only 14 needed now. In the right slot, batsman has smacked it over deep mid. 20 off the over already. What have you done Mr. Thampi?

out Caught by Nabi!! Is there a late twist? Slower delivery going across, batsman lifts the ball away and has been taken by the man at long-off. Was that shot needed? A few dinks here and there would have done it. But batsman wanted to go for the glory shots and slammed it away uppishly without any timing to be caught. batsman c Nabi b bowler 9(12) [6s-1]
SIX, in the slot and that disappears! This man is a visual delight. Pitched up and batsman went bonkers to send it over long-off for a sixer

out Caught by Nabi!! Length delivery going across and was a slower delivery, batsman tried to take the skin off the ball and miscued it for the man at long-off to take it. This is one frustrating aspect of his batting. Looks to finish it with a glory shot and perishes. Three wickets remain. Can team script something miraculous? I feel its too late. batsman c Nabi b bowler 49(21) [4s-2 6s-5]

out Obstructing the field!! This is drama. Some thriller novel will struggle to match up to this. batsman ran completely in the middle of the turf and the throw hit him. team first went up for a caught-behind call and then for obstructing the field. batsman obs 1(2)

FOUR, Paul has done it! team have pulled it off. They are through to qualifier 2. Short ball, Paul got hold of it and pulled it away, the ball evaded Shankar in the deep. A cliff-hanger and team have held their nerves despite huffing and puffing a lot towards the end
FOUR, normal pace delivery and Khaleel is put away over mid-on. Back of a length and Shaw gets into a good position and pumps it over the fielder inside the ring

FOUR, this is even better. Khaleel has to correct his length quickly, short of length and Shaw had the pace to work with, rocks back and nails the pull in front of square, one bounce and over the ropes
FOUR, woah! That is smoked to the fence. Good length ball outside off, Shaw brings that high backlift into play and crunches the square drive past cover-point, no one moved in the off-side ring

2 runs, dropped! Tough chance but you are expected to take at this level. Flatter delivery outside off, Shaw smashes it flat to mid-off, Thampi comes charging in and dives forward, the ball hits him somewhere on the arm and escapes past him. He chases behind and keeps it to a brace

FOUR, that is a good shot. bowler is disappointed but there was not much he could do. Drifting in from round the wicket, batsman fetches the reverse sweep from leg-stump and places it past the backward point fielder
FOUR, batsman is looking in sublime touch. Just leans forward, presents full face of the bat and pings the push drive off the middle past the diving fielder at extra cover
SIX, he is toying with the bowlers now. Stands deep in his crease, spots the short ball early and ramps it over a helpless third man fielder
FOUR, this is sheer stand-and-deliver stuff! Gets a length ball outside off with a hint of extra bounce, batsman doesn't care one bit and thumps it over the mid-off fielder in a jiffy
1 run, gets low and brings up the 50-run stand with a sweep to the right of short fine
FOUR, picks the legbreak and pumps the drive over cover, excellent batting this from batsman. Making great use of the fielding restrictions and looking to pierce gaps as often
SIX, batsman is flying at the moment. First ball against bowler and he launches him way over long-on with a clean swing of the bat

wide, out Stumped!! That's an excellent piece of keeping from Saha, nearly matched MSD (in terms of alertness) there. bowler may have second guessed batsman's intentions and he hurled the ball miles down the leg-side and kept it short too; batsman was never backing away, went charging down and missed the ball completely. Looked to force himself back into the crease, but Saha did a wonderful job stretching across to take the bails off in the nick of time. batsman st Saha b bowler 17(16) [4s-3]
1 run, fifty for Shaw. He points at his badge to the dugout. Delhi need him to kick on and convert it into a big one. Waits for the ball to turn and nudges it past mid-wicket
FOUR, don't want to jinx it but batsman is one of the best batters of spin bowling. Sees a hint of width on this legbreak and jumps on it in a flash, opens the bat face and nails the cut behind point

no run, excellent use of technology and batsman survives! Height was the factor that could have saved him but in the end, inside edge does. Was a lovely nipbacker from bowler that pinged batsman on the back pad. Didn't look dead plumb but the umpire was impressed and raised his finger. After a chat with Guptill, batsman opted for the DRS and it has saved him in the end
FOUR, beautifully struck! Hint of width from bowler and batsman lays into the back foot punch, square through the off-side. Finds the gap at point and it scooted away to the fence. Elegant shot!

SIX, into the night sky, going..going..gone! Jeez, that was in the air for a long time but guess what, he's got the distance as well! And quite a bit of it too. Length ball, just where batsman likes it and he swings merrily through the line. Didn't hold back at all and that helped him in the end to take full toll. Into the second tier at long-on

no run, a chance and Pant has dropped it, that was a regulation catch and Pant didn't go down with the ball - stood tall and fluffed it - the leg-break and batsman pushed at it, straight in and out of Pant's gloves
FOUR, cracking shot, fraction too short and wide of off, Manish makes room, waits on it and then slices the cut past the reach of Munro at backward point - much needed boundary for the Sunrisers

1 run, stunning bit of work from Shaw at cover - a direct hit might have had Manish in trouble. On a length and just outside off, Manish backed away and drove it to the left of cover, Shaw tumbled, stopped the ball, turned around and had a shy at the bowler's end - all in one motion

out Caught by Rutherford!! This isn't happening, not for Manish at least - after taking plenty of time to settle, he's thrown his wicket away. The two West Indians in action - smart bowling from Keemo, spotted Manish making room and followed him with a full ball - with no room to free his arms, Manish shovelled the lofted drive into the waiting hands of Rutherford at long-on. The partnership was beginning to grow, but it's all over now. batsman c Rutherford b bowler 30(36) [4s-3]
FOUR, cracking shot, a half-tracker from bowler, short and wide of off, batsman makes room and clatters it wide of cover - the man in the deep is very square and has no chance

FOUR, poor cricket from Boult - he was never going to get to the ball, not with the angle he was running into - dived forward and then let the ball go past him, concedes a boundary. The slower ball from bowler, rolled away fingers across the seam, batsman picked it and then swung it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

out Bowled!! The perfect riposte from bowler, saw batsman backing away and then went straight with the yorker - right at the base of off-stump. Try as much as he could, batsman was never going to dig this one out - the zing bails go flying and the Sunrisers have lost their fourth wicket. batsman b bowler 28(27) [4s-2]

FOUR, beautifully played, nice way to get your innings underway, back of a length and well wide of off, batsman waited on it, used bowler's pace and then chopped it late - behind square on the off-side and into the ropes
FOUR, that's two delicate shots from batsman for two boundaries. He waits for the ball to turn away, opens the bat face and runs it past short third man. The pace of bowler takes care of the rest

SIX, that is his strength. Anything that is back of a length and batsman is quick to pounce on it, he uses his reach to good effect to thump it with a straight bat over cow corner. Just managed to clear the rope

FOUR, smashed! Stand and deliver from batsman. He literally stood there and admired the shot. Similar delivery to the previous one, but this time batsman does not miss, he hammers it straight back over Paul and the ball almost went the distance
FOUR, very well played. Another short delivery and almost near the badge, batsman is quickly into position and pulls it with a nice wrist roll backward of square leg. No chance for Dhawan in the deep

FOUR, lovely shot! batsman has used the angle of bowler to superb effect. Slanted across the right hander outside off, batsman shuffles across and lofts it handsomely over extra cover, one bounce and over the ropes

SIX, oh no! Iyer did all the hard work and catching the ball, but the toss up to the incoming fielder goes awry. Similar line and length from bowler and a repeat of a shot from batsman, smashes it to wide long-off and Iyer races across to his left, takes it over his head but with the momentum taking him over, he tries to flick the ball up for Dhawan. No dice as he ends up throwing it over the ad boards

out Caught by Axar!! Gone! batsman's cameo comes to an end. He is disappointed with himself. Slower short of length delivery and batsman picked the bones out of that, struck right off the meat but he couldn't have picked the fielder out at deep mid-wicket better. Axar didn't have to move much to take that. batsman c Axar b bowler 25(11) [4s-2 6s-2]

no ball, SIX, Keemo Paul is struggling. He was on his haunches after the second ball and now he has overstepped. Hobbles to his run-up. Is not fit? Full and in the slot, batsman nonchalantly picks it over cow corner for half a dozen

out Caught by Axar!! He might go for runs but Paul has the knack of picking wickets. An off-cutter outside off, batsman reaches out for it and slices it straight to sweeper cover. Another sitter for Axar in the deep. batsman c Axar b bowler 20(13) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Caught by Pant!! Paul has his third wicket. Another slower delivery outside off, the ball dips in front of Rashid and he is down on his knee to play the slog, the top-edge lobs to Pant and he makes no mistake. batsman c Pant b bowler 0(1)

wide, out batsman Run Out!! Here is what happened - Slower ball outside off, batsman swings and misses, the umpire calls it a wide as it was away from the guide line, Rashid calls for a bye and batsman responds, Pant throws at the bowler but Paul doesn't get there, instead batsman trips over the bowler and goes to ground. The ball goes past them to remove the bails. There was no need of a third umpire but Ravi asked Delhi captain Iyer if he wants to continue with the dismissal. He first gave batsman an opportunity to bat on but was convinced otherwise by Pant. batsman run out (Pant) 4(4)

SIX, one-handed chip over deep extra cover! Second time that batsman hasn't quite middled it but has as many sixes to his name. Will this be his night? Was probably undone by the slower ball and got early into the chip shot. One hand came off in the process too but what he did well was to have clarity. Chose to go over the infield and ended up going over the ropes too. Wow!
SIX, muscled away! batsman is on a roll here! Shortish and a bit of width as well, he feasts on the offering with a ferocious slap cut over sweeper cover. Bludgeoned it!

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The hard length inevitably does batsman in! He wasn't shying away from getting on the front foot, even to deliveries that didn't warrant it and that brings about his dismissal in the end. bowler kept it on the hard length and batsman tried to go big down the ground. Never in control and the result is a miscue that Iyer takes at mid-off after trekking back a few yards. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 8(9) [4s-1]
FOUR, poor ball and batsman punishes it! Sprayed on the pads, fuller as well and he just had to pick his spot. Watches it onto the bat and glances it very fine, beating short fine leg with ease
SIX, hacked away! batsman is in the mood! bowler fired this in and the Kiwi sat down to half-pull this over deep square leg. Absolutely clobbered it!

FOUR, misfield allows a boundary! bowler can't even complain because it's his skipper who is the culprit at mid-off. Pandey thumped the drive really well and Iyer wanted to attack the ball to have a shy at the bowler's end. Eventually missed it completely

FOUR, top edge but it's nearly gone all the way! Cons of having pace! Good fiery bumper from bowler and Pandey is clearly late on the pull. But he knew that fine leg was up and hence, there wasn't much risk on the stroke. Eventually fetches a boundary

out Caught by K Paul!! Mishy provides the massive strike! batsman was looking ominous and team badly wanted to see the back of him. That's precisely what their senior most bowler has done in his very second delivery of the match. Floated it up, inviting the big shot but the length wasn't there for the slog sweep as batsman went through with the stroke. Skews it towards deep mid-wicket where Paul took a fine tumbling catch. team have sprung to life with this wicket! batsman c K Paul b bowler 36(19) [4s-1 6s-4]

1 run, huge mix-up and this has to be in list of all-time best moments of IPL. So, before I could miss important details, here's what happened. This was dabbed to point and Watto nearly ran in towards Faf who was struck midway having taken a couple of strides forward. Axar Patel then threw the ball to the bowling end where Munro collects and instead of throwing down stumps at his end he chose to fire a wayward throw at the batting end, Pant dives and misses and in the end they sneak in a run. For good part of this chaos, both batsmen were struck in the middle of the pitch and team had way too many options which eventually led to a disaster

out Caught by K Paul!! Mistimed pull, in the air and it's a very good catch by Keemo Paul running forward and diving low at deep square leg. Short ball, Faf tried to take the bowler on, the ball caught him high on the bat. End of a fine innings. Faf's counter-attack in the powerplay was very crucial with Watto taking his time at the other end. batsman c K Paul b bowler 50(39) [4s-7 6s-1]
SIX, horrible ball, short delivery down the leg-side, batsman pulls and times it sweetly, in fact just helped on the way over long leg
FOUR, short slower ball and batsman has smashed that over mid-wicket, Keemo Paul has been off colour unfortunately for team on the big day
SIX, the slower ball is telegraphed early, got to be well disguised to a top player, batsman picks it, waits and slogs it on one knee to the cow corner fence

SIX, fifty for Watto. From 18 off 20 balls, he's raced to 50 off 31 balls. This is precisely why team never mind a slow start from batsman. Slower delivery full and outside off stump, batsman lofts, mistimes to an extent but has enough power to hit it over long-off

out Caught by Boult! GONE! A premature end to the pyrotechnics. A loopy leg-break on a nice length, batsman is enticed into running down the wicket and lofting over the straight boundary, gets it off the outside half and slices it away towards wide long-off where Boult picks up a catch. Makes some amends for that hat-trick ball. batsman c Boult b bowler 50(32) [4s-3 6s-4]
FOUR, round the wicket, angles it in, batsman was already setting up for this - dances down the track and lofts it inside out towards the deep extra cover fence for four

out Bowled! He's been extremely iffy this over, and finally gives in! Angles in, some turn, batsman tries cut it away, chops it onto his stumps trying to cut and looks disgusted with himself. Just at the stroke of the strategic time-out. batsman b bowler 11(13)
FOUR, the crowd go berserk! A poor delivery on the torso, on the leg-side, batsman just gives it some topspin and swivels on it to deflect it away to fine leg for four
FOUR, erring in line, angling into the pads once again, tickled away fine towards the long leg fence for four
FOUR, short and wide outside off, batsman carves it away with a massive flourish between short third man and backward point for four

out Caught by K Paul! He's gone! This is the very definition of disappointment - from the crowd AND from the team dug-out. A short one, with the pace off, batsman goes for the signature six to finish with a pull towards cow corner where he picks out Keemo Paul. You can hear a pin drop at Vizag. batsman c K Paul b bowler 9(9) [4s-1]

FOUR leg-byes, team are through to their 8th final in 10 editions they have played! A short one that's angling down leg, batsman whips it away off the backfoot (off the pads in fact) past a desperately-diving Pant towards the fine leg fence for four - and there are hugs in the changing room already. team are through to another final - surprise, surprise!
FOUR, too short perhaps and Faf powers it through mid-wicket with a crisp pull off the bottom hand, picked the length early and got onto his back foot in a hurry
FOUR, stands outside leg stump and thumps this in the gap between backward point and cover. Made room early and cuts the quicker delivery in the gap on the off-side
SIX, yet again its that premeditated movement tat enables Faf to smash a big one. Transfers all his weight onto the back foot and clubs this flat over extra cover with a hint of class and elegance

FOUR, pulled away and Faf is looking to mae the most of the final over of the powerplay, back of a length delivery on the stumps, batsman waits and pulls behind square, the man in the deep is very square and it goes to his right
FOUR, guided away uppishly and just wide of Munro at short third man, short of length again from bowler, this time it's slightly outside off stump, Faf guides and gets four more
FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short delivery on the stumps, batsman rocks back and pulls over mid-wicket, easy boundary, team well ahead now
FOUR, oh excellent sweep shot, got low early with no one at deep square leg and absolutely smashed this shot from the middle of the bat to find the fence

5 wides, oh dear, tries the fast yorker and bowls down the leg-side, Pant can't cut if off. 50 up for team and they have got a solid start in the all important Qualifier game after struggling throughout the league phase. That's what experience does!
FOUR, low full toss on the leg stump, easily ball, batsman glances it fine and beats short fine leg

FOUR, this is very unlucky for the bowler. He's actually beaten Faf with a back of a length delivery, inside edge onto pad, goes past Pant, Munro gives chase from short third, dives and pulls it back, probably he was in touch with the rope for a moment and it's been signalled four
FOUR, nicely paddled away, no fine leg, so he was aware of the field and was in position early to help it on its way
1 run, punched down to long-on and a big cheer from the crowd as Faf raises the bat for his fifty

SIX, swept away all the way over backward square leg and team are running away with the game now. The heads are dropping in the team camp. Fired down the leg-side, batsman meets the ball nicely and sends it into the stands, they are searching for the ball
FOUR, smashed! This is the length that Shaw enjoys a lot. Shorter from bowler and it's been dispatched with a nonchalant pull through square leg
FOUR, beautifully timed! Thakur searches for swing and in the process, overcooks this outside off. Stroked sweetly down the ground and beats the diving mid-off fielder with ease

FOUR, this is a stunning shot! Wow! Another fuller one and this time, batsman was merely pushing it straight back past the bowler. Such amazing timing and the ball just rocketed away. Signs that this is a much better surface than the eliminator
FOUR, pressure telling on Thakur and batsman is ruthless. Harmless short ball that's pulled away through square leg. 'Gabbar' seizing the momentum straightaway

FOUR, cracking shot! Tad fuller around off, Iyer brings his bat down in a sweet flow and crunches his drive past the fielder at cover. There was a fielder in the deep to hunt it down but the timing was just about right

out Caught by Raina!! Brainfade for the Delhi Capitals skipper. A googly around middle and leg, Iyer goes down in order to slog it but ends up getting a top-edge. The ball skies up towards Raina at point who settles underneath it and takes it safely. team on top, Delhi in trouble. batsman c Raina b bowler 13(18) [4s-1]

out Caught by Tahir!! The champion strikes! Time to bring out those moves. That shot looked good for a moment but the lack of pace on it results in batsman's downfall. Was a short one around off and the southpaw guides it straight into the mitts of Imran Tahir at third man. Had there been some more pace on the ball, it would have probably gone the distance. batsman c Tahir b bowler 3(6)

leg byes, FOUR, team take a review against batsman! Imran bowler looked excited but the impact looks just outside off, or probably umpire's call. Nope, wait. The impact was in line but the ball was bouncing over the stumps by some distance. batsman was trying to play a drive but got beaten for spin. The ball clips his pads and races away to the fence thereafter. The onfield call stays
SIX, just look at that shot! Unbelieveable, reckons Sunny G on air. Was a touch short around off, batsman treks back and lifts it over covers for a lovely six. Class!

out Caught by Watson!! Bhajji strikes again and brings out his fist pump to celebrate this wicket. batsman plays one shot too many and has to pay the price for it. He had struck a six already and there was no need to go after the offie. Goes hard at it and gets a thick outside edge that flies to short third man. Watto completes the formalities inside the ring. batsman c Watson b bowler 10(12) [6s-1]
FOUR, controlled aggression from Rishabh batsman! Sits on one knee, picks the legbreak and sweeps it in the gap between deep square and deep mid-wicket

SIX, Deepak Chahar catches it......and steps back to ruin the party for team! MSD is not pleased and he immediately brings Chahar into the infield. bowler almost started celebrating, but had to hold back and so are the team fans in the stands. A loopy full delivery outside off, batsman goes for the biggie and slices it high into the air off the cue end, the ball keeps swirling and Chahar at long-on couldn't control his momentum around the boundary ropes. Took the catch cleanly but the momentum way always dragging him back. Big moment in the game?

out Bowled!! DJ Bravo gets the better of Keemo Paul. And the GANGNAM is on. 130ks yorker from round the wicket, goes slightly wide of the crease and pins it at the base of leg-stump, Paul looked to hammer it down with a violent bat swing but his leg peg goes cartwheeling; dips under the bat and crashes into the woodwork. batsman b bowler 3(7)

out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! batsman had to go for the big shot and unfortunately for team, he loses balance as one hand comes off the bat. Hits the slog flat and DJ Bravo times his jump to perfection at wide long-on to gobble the catch. batsman c Dwayne Bravo b bowler 38(25) [4s-2 6s-1]
FOUR, gets across and picks bowler off his pads over fine leg, clean swing of the bat and timed it to perfection
no run, flat and fast on off-stump, batsman forces it straight back at Jaddu who couldn't cling onto a return catch
SIX, shortens his length and keeps it around off, batsman stays on the back foot and thrashes it way over long-on

out Bowled!! Clever from Jaddu. Bowled the arm-ball and managed to beat the inside edge. batsman expected it to be around off-stump and poked at it without much conviction, the ball dips short of him and smashes the leg bail. batsman b bowler 6(3) [6s-1]
FOUR, no spin on this, batsman uses his long levers and muscles it to the left of long-on, Faf tried his best to get behind the ball but batsman, perhaps, timed it too well

out Lbw!! Excellent review and Shaw has to go! He was looking good once again tonight but falls prey to his addiction for the pull shot. The length wasn't really there on this occasion and he missed it altogether to be hit on the back knee as he crouched a bit. team were confident on the LBW appeal and sent it upstairs after the umpire's rejection. Nothing on UltraEdge and HawkEye shows Three Reds. Good review. batsman lbw b bowler 5(6) [4s-1]
FOUR, hammered! Clear intent from batsman as he gives the charge and forces this length ball past the bowler. Well wide of mid-on and it speeds away

SIX, walks down the pitch and smashes it for a maximum. Just the kind of finish team wanted and the whole of Delhi camp are delighted on seeing batsman Sharma get his highest score in IPL. It was straight and short from Jaddu, batsman ambled down and clobbered it straight back over the bowler's head. Crashed flat into the boundary hoardings...
FOUR, 'hit me' ball from bowler and batsman pummels it through the off-side. Slower, shorter and wider as well, gift for any batsman and it gets the treatment. Slapped through point

out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni takes it on the second attempt! Sharp catch as this was a healthy edge and the dangerous batsman has to depart. Was the quicker one and he wanted to essay the back foot cut. Got a thick nick that bobbled up off Dhoni's gloves for a moment and he held on. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 18(14) [4s-3]

FOUR, crashed away by batsman! Got a bit of width on this turning off break, the length allowed him to wait and he slapped it through cover-point. Sweeper is behind square on the off-side and had no chance
FOUR, over the infield! Fuller this time and batsman wisely goes over cover. With the spin and the loft is clean. This stroke should give him confidence

out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! bowler gets rid of the set batsman. batsman was looking so good, until he played this shot. Once again he goes down on his knee to play the sweep shot but fails to keep it on the ground. Dwayne Bravo stationed at deep square leg takes a regulation catch and Delhi sink further. They'll have two new batsmen at the crease now and Imran Tahir is yet to bowl his first over. Interesting passage of play on the cards. batsman c Dwayne Bravo b bowler 27(24) [4s-4]

FOUR, there's never a dull moment when batsman is out there. Premeditates yet again and scoops the floated delivery towards fine leg. The fielder was no where close to cut this down, neither inside the circle nor outside it
FOUR, that's overpitched and it's gone to the fence in a flash. Du Plessis leans across, right on top of it, before drilling it through the covers
FOUR, way too full from Krunal, a half-volley really which batsman pulverizes through the covers. That's too easy, something team can ill afford

out Caught by de Kock!! They sense it. Mumbai are gaining the upper hand. This is such brilliant captaincy from Ro. team just lost a wicket and he brings his key bowler back for an over and prises out another. batsman with a very lame attempt to pull/hook this short ball, wasn't going really hard at it, the ball takes the edge and QdK makes no mistake as it grabs the ball with a jump. Big roar for MSD as he walks out. batsman c de Kock b bowler 1(4)

FOUR, oh Bumrah! bowler will be livid with him. Bowled so well and he's let this go right through him for four. Would have been a single maximum. But Chahar's got to blame himself in the first place for bowling a freebie down the leg-side, Watto sweeps and gets it through short fine leg

out Dhoni Run Out!! 1 run completed. Phew! What drama! team have lost their captain in a big pressure final! This was an overthrow which Dhoni was trying to steal and he will be unhappy with himself for doing something like this in a final. It was a short ball which batsman got the glove on the pull shot, he hit it to Malinga's left and Slinga fired an overthrow at the bowler's end. The ball went only as far as mid-off, but Dhoni tried it take on the fielder but Kishan hit the bulls eye and ignited the stumps. This was a very tough decision to make. One angle showed Dhoni was on the line, but there was another angle which reckoned Dhoni may have just sneaked in. Thoughts of benefit of doubt going to the batsman circled, but Llong took a long time. Saw various different angles and pressed the red button. Dhoni run out (Ishan Kishan) 2(8)
no run, oh is that a dropped chance? Yes it was. It's the set Watto. Full delivery on the stumps, batsman drives hard and hits it back at the bowler, who doesn't accept the offer

SIX, 138.6kph, misses his yorker and worse - he's got reverse swing on it as well - but it's bang in the slot and Bravo also makes it worse by getting deep in the crease as he whips it uppishly, high and over deep mid-wicket. Hardik doesn't help himself either at the boundary, running in at first, and then having to go back .. watches in the nd
FOUR, 138.8kph. Keeps dishing out pace, keeps it wide outside off and batsman's edge will do just as well. There may have been a short third man, but the slice is such that it's very fine
FOUR, oh, better. bowler - with more pace - and with more in the slot. Wide, outside off, batsman moves away, sits down on a knee and carves it away into third man, almost all the way too

FOUR, it's on loop. 15.3, 15.4 and 15.5, each one predictable perfectly -- all pace dealt out outside off, lots of width too and this time batsman picks out deep extra cover with that usual muscular slash

1 run, oh Watto, you four-lifed cat. bowler lines him up perfectly with a sharp nippy bouncer, batsman pulls, gets hurried up big time, gets a top-edge and Rahul Chahar - running in from deep backward square leg wouldn't have had it easier. But alas, it's the finals, he slides, lets it pop out
SIX, this was coming, this was exactly what Krunal was gambling again. He flats it wide outside off, there may have been a deep extra cover, but batsman carves it powerfully, well over that guy

SIX, it had to be short. It HAD to be given the last ball's treatment, but batsman's smarter, rocking behind, going with a straight punch, extending his followthough into the sightscreen down the ground
SIX, well, well, well, it can get cleaner. Krunal's darted this bang into the arc, batsman's down on a knee too and goes slogging. If only boundaries were in the second tier!
1 run, squeezed away to the right of point, Ishan does superbly out there, diving, keeping it to onlly a single

out Caught by de Kock!! 148.5kph of a brute. It's lethal. It's murderous. bowler keeps the seam up, bangs it some more on his neither-here-nor-there lengths and Bravo continues backing away to have punchy wafts over extra cover at them. But this one's too fiery to not be nicked, and a kiss on the outside splice will do just as fine. Just when you thought things were slipping out, eh!? batsman c de Kock b bowler 15(15) [6s-1]

byes, FOUR, oh Quinton .. you may have heard of cups dropped, this is probably the cup misfielded. It was quick, really quick, and going well over the cut, and de Kock, in his quest to throw it quicker and stop the bye, ends up not collecting at all

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. Wide yorker. Squeezed away to deep point. But suddenly, for some weird reason batsman then doesn't want the second. Yes. No. Yes. No. And the half-hearted yes without proper consent ends up with him falling short, clearly short. The throw's f;at, which Quinton collects from well behind the stumps and under-arms it onto the stumps. batsman run out (Krunal Pandya/de Kock) 80(59) [4s-8 6s-4]

out Lbw!! Slower off-cutter, and things don't dip in the slot any better. 2013. 2015. 2017. 2019, you don't mess with Arithmetic progressions and you don't mess with these mathematical Mumbai Indians. Thakur - poor old Thakur - sent ahead of his usual position - walks across his stumps, freezes bang in front of middle looking to flick it across the line. But again, it's the finals, he chokes, misses and is trapped plumb, bang in front of middle. Oh bowler, you really couldn't have redeemed yourself any better. batsman lbw b bowler 2(2)
FOUR, steps outside the leg stump again, Krunal follows him again but he errs with his length this time. It's too full. Du Plessis lofts it over mid-on
SIX, over mid-on again, a much cleaner strike. Krunal is drawn towards batsman down the leg-side, and is bashed through the line
FOUR, completely unsettling the left-armer here. Backing away, making him change the lines. Krunal doesn't follow him this time, so instead, he gets cut through backward point

out Stumped!! Krunal has the final say. He spots batsman's charge early, and yorks him with a quick, wide dart. Animated celebrations from the Mumbai Indians. After the stick he got for most of the over, this was much needed for Krunal. batsman st de Kock b bowler 26(13) [4s-3 6s-1]
FOUR, wasn't in control, batsman. Overpitched outside off, he went so hard on the drive that the poise was lost and his bat-face opened up - slicing it uppishly past backward point
SIX, drifts on leg-stump with this off-cutter and is swept into the stands. batsman, having picked up the line in a flash, got into a brilliant position there before swinging it over backward square

FOUR, finds the gap between backward point and short third man. These are mostly off-cutters from bowler, which explains why third man is up. But this one has enough width on it, so batsman can manufacture the pace with his hands as he cuts

no run, batsman given out on the field, but he's reviewed it. He got into a terrible position against a cracking bouncer from bowler, just left his hands up there, and according to umpire Gould it brushed his glove on the way. But there's nothing on Ultra-Edge. However, the third umpire still goes through to check if there's any visible deflection. That's interesting. Still, he can't find much to uphold the onfield call. So the decision will have to be overturned

FOUR, wowww! What an off-drive, the strike-rate is up and running again. Very brave from Ro to have mid-off in at this stage, but Watto made full use of this juicy full ball and powered it to the fence

2 runs, top edgeeeee, it's Malinga and he isn't stable, doesn't even get a hand on it! team cannot be sloppy in the field. They defended miraculously against team a couple of years ago at this very venue. They need to be sharp now. This was a slower short ball, batsman went for the pull shot and got an edge that went way up in the air, Slinga moved sluggishly to his left from short fine leg and he never judged it properly

out Lbw!! batsman's hot and cold season comes to an end with him eating up a review in an all important final when he was absolutely dead in front. Lovely bowling from bowler. Leggie from the leggie, batsman was hanging back to defend, missed the ball, the impact was on the front pad first before it smashed into the back pad. Impact in line with middle and it's hitting the top of middle stump. Mumbai have an opening now. Can they put team under serious pressure? batsman lbw b bowler 8(14)
SIX, smashed! A sharp bouncer @139.8km/h, batsman isn't back and across, but natural talent comes to the fore - the frontfoot across and that pulled high in front of deep square leg for six!

FOUR, terrific catch from RJ - well, nearly, only he could have got to the ball, ran in a long way from deep mid-wicket, dived across to his left, went one-handed and got to the ball, but it kept going away and bounced past his outstretched hands. Nicely played by Suryakumar, knew that mid-wicket was wide and clipped it high and wide of that fielder - any other fielder and it was an easy boundary
FOUR, that has been muscled - Kishan making his intentions clear - fetched a well flighted delivery from outside off and heaved it wide of mid-wicket - the fielder at long-on can't get across in time

out Bowled!! bowler is off and running here in Hyderabad - big wicket in the context of the innings, Suryakumar was one who could have anchored this innings for team - the slider from bowler, pitched around off and kept going straight, Suryakumar was perhaps playing for the wrong 'un, made room and pushed limply - with a horizontal bat, the ball grazes the inside edge and bounces through to the middle-stump. batsman b bowler 15(17) [4s-1]

out Caught&Bowled!! That's a top-catch from Shardul - he called for the ball, sprinted a long way towards square leg, got to the ball and then juggled it, but doesn't panic - holds onto the second attempt and team have lost their fourth wicket. He's on a roll, the Mumbai speedster. This was a well directed bouncer, short and climbing onto the left-hander, cramped for room, Krunal still went for the pull, gets a big top-edge, high and towards square leg. MS went for the catch, but the bowler called it out and then held on. batsman c and b bowler 7(7)
SIX, low full toss, didn't dip on the batter and has been spanked down the ground over the bowler's head for a sixer. batsman didn't hold back there. Mistimed hits from him will carry as well

out Caught by Raina!! What have you done mr. Kishan? Was that needed? Tries to go for a big slog sweep against a googly, gets a huge top-edge and Raina takes a dolly at cover. And bowler becomes the leading wicket-taker of the tourney. Is it a game changing moment? Might well be. team fans erupt. batsman c Raina b bowler 23(26) [4s-3]

FOUR, Chahar goes for the catch at deep cover and the ball bounces just in front of him to go away to the fence. That was sliced away powerfully and Chahar came charging in only to find the ball dropping right in front of him
SIX, you can't drop it that short! Mince meat for batsman. Picks the short ball and slams it over deep square leg for a sixer. Much needed one for team
1 run, have you dropped the game Mr. Raina? That was a short ball, batsman mistimes the slap and Raina at cover drops a dolly. Big final and batsman gets a chance!!! team have a huge reprieve
SIX, and batsman slams the pull away! Adds a lot of red chilly into the wounds of team. Powered over deep mid for a sixer. That was hugeeeeee
SIX, fuller ball and has been whipped away over deep mid. This is what a redemption does to a batter. Frees his arms and helicopters it over deep mid for a sixer. Oh Raina!!
FOUR, short ball, batsman stays back and pulls it down to deep mid for a four. Was in the gap between deep mid and long-on. team on a roll post the drop!

out Lbw!! That dropped chance might not hav cost a lot of runs as Pandya is out LBW. bowler nailed the yorker against a rampaging batsman. batsman looked to whip it staying deep in his crease and missed it. He was given out LBW and challenged it immediately. But it was three reds. And Pandya had to walk off. Excellent thinking on the part of the young man. batsman lbw b bowler 16(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

bowler to Rahul bowler, out Caught by du Plessis!! bowler gets his younger brother. Length delivery curling away, Rahul bowler looks to go down town and slices the ball away to mid-off. Simple catch for the fielder who accepts it with ease. Pollard couldn't crossover either. team being dented here. Rahul bowler c du Plessis b bowler 0(2)

out McClenaghan Run Out!! 1 run completed. McClenaghan sacrifices his wicket trying to get batsman back on strike. Was struck down the ground over the bowler's head as another wide yorker was executed. The man at long-off zoomed the throw to the bowler's end for the bowler to whip the bails off. Bravo shows emotions as well and bangs the ball on to the turf after whipping the bails off. McClenaghan run out (du Plessis/bowler) 0(2)
FOUR, power, brute power! Full, outside off and slammed between deep cover and deep long-off for a four. Whatta shot!!! batsman absolutely drilled that. bowler missed the wide yorker not by much

SIX, another lost ball? A length ball, the white marshmallow deceives bowler, as it doesn't move off the wicket, a tad wide outside off, but batsman shuffles across and clubs that high and mighty over cow corner for six! Into the stands!

SIX, an away-swinger, nothing wrong with this one, on a good length and not a lot of width, batsman just backs away and has a flash at it - and he's sliced it away over deep backward point for six. Just over Bhajji at the fence
SIX, VVS was spot-on with his pitch report, he's definitely trusting the bounce off a length, it's angling away, batsman lines himself and just casually lofts it over deep extra cover for six

FOUR, and batsman signs off with a four! An angry batsman walks off. That 'could have been wide ball' playing on his mind. Was fuller, missed the mark though, and batsman butchered it between deep cover and long-off. Sped into the fence in a jiffy
FOUR, errs off the final ball - a flat one on the pads, batsman is quick to pounce on it, shapes up to sweep, and nails it to the backward square leg fence for four
SIX, short one angling away outside off, batsman plays a southpaw's forehand and absolutely slaughters that over deep mid-wicket for six. That's an absolutely stunning shot...

out Caught by Dhoni! Short ball, and that does the trick! Right at the body, really brave bowling, he's hurried on the pull and top-edges it - hardly any bat on that and Dhoni comes around, moves to his right, to take the citter of the century. A huge wicket in the context of the game, and Shardul has taken a key wicket here. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 29(17) [6s-4]

out Caught by Dhoni! The slower one has done it! 119.8km/h, the knuckle ball, that wobbles unpredictably in the air, swerves away, courtesy a falling seam towards the on-side, and batsman has been done in by the lack of pace - can't decide when to get his weight forward and has a waft at a transfer-of-weight drive into the off-side - his bottom-hand has come off the bat, no control, and he gets a healthy edge. Dhoni dives forward to pick up the catch that's dipping on him. Both the openers have departed, and team right back in it! batsman c Dhoni b bowler 15(14) [4s-1 6s-1]
no run, just short of Raina at cover, dropped short and wide of off, Kishan made room for the punch and didn't bother to keep it down, almost carried to cover as raina tumbled forward
FOUR, clubbed, nice way to start after the break, length delivery outside off, Kishan leant forward and lifted it high and over mid-on, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes

FOUR, nicely played, the loopy slower ball from Bravo, kept dipping onto the left-hander - Kishan was setting himself up for the pull, bends down low with the ball and then sweeps it behind square on the on-side - beat the man in the ring and raced away to the ropes
FOUR, fetch that! On a full length outside off, shaping away to an extent and batsman throws the kitchen sink at it. Smacks it over extra cover as he's off the mark with a boundary

out Lbw!! Sweet vengeance for bowler as he comes back on the very next ball having conceded a boundary. Full, quick and swinging into the batsman. batsman goes for a drive with lack of footwork and gets rapped on the pads. Impact on middle and this would have crashed into middle and leg. Good call by the openers to not opt for the review, else they would have regretted it after watching the replays. batsman lbw b bowler 4(5) [4s-1]
SIX, horrible drag down this. batsman's charged down, made it into one in his slot and smoking a cross-batted heave over cow corner

FOUR, absolute smash back, tennis forehand. A walk, clearing the front leg and a swat downtown, with bowler getting a fingertip as he tries pulling his hand out of the way. Oh and also, a fifty -- and revenge for the 2019 WC is well and truly complete
SIX, oooo, wow. Just wow. batsman continues dancing, going inside-out, and then holding his pose. Yep, extra cover
1 run, back of a length, on off. Swatted off the front foot, to a sliding long-on who's Pandya, Hardik Pandya
1 run, 142.8kph, yorker, off-lined. Jammed down the ground, coincidentally bringing up the 100-run stand as well
FOUR, 144.5kph. Slight width, wth Faf backing away to snatch a lot more to slap this with lots of bottom-hand, past Rohit's dive at short cover
1 run, dropped -- a massively tough one, but nevertheless, it's put down. batsman reverse-sweeps, and Krunal Pandya - backward point - dives to his right, gets both palms, and can't hold on

out Caught&Bowled!! Nobody's taking his catches, and so what if he needs to sprint backwards for this. Yeah, he does. batsman, third time unlucky, has a dance, a hoick, only getting the toe-end and skewing up a skier. It's somewhere around mid-on, and the run-dive's more than good enough. But forget that, it's been a top knock from India's best number four who wasn't in the World Cup. batsman c and b bowler 71(48) [4s-6 6s-3]
FOUR, filthy loose a line. Full, leg-lined and batsman just waits for it to get close before whipping it really fine
FOUR, nothing dicey here. bowler feeds him a high full toss outside off and batsman neatly opens his bat face to carve it backward of point
