Nicely set up by the bowler. He bent his back on this delivery and got his reward. batsman c Ravi Bishnoi b bowler 1(5)
FOUR, slow full toss and lofted over mid-on for the first four of the innings. That was a terrible delivery and batsman took advantage of it

no run, Is batsman gone? The umpire has given him out caught behind. But batsman was quick to review it. That nipped in, batsman pushed at it and seems to have missed it. Mostly it went off the pads and into the keeper's gloves. Not out is the verdict and batsman is safe. Even he was safe on the LBW call as it was missing the wickets
SIX, length delivery, off-pace as well, batsman has his weight on the back leg but still manages to slam it over long-off for a sixer. Was sweetly hit. batsman has to fire tonight for team
FOUR, some room and batsman capitalises on it. Smashes it through the covers for a four. Got the room and pounced on it
FOUR, too short, batsman pulls it down the ground over the mid-off fielder for a four. Shouts of catch were there but it was well away from the fielder. Even long-on tried to cut it off but couldn't
FOUR, stays back, batsman pulls it behind square. That was once again short and punished by batsman

FOUR, is it a four? Or has Cottrell managed to push it back into the playing area? Seems to be a four. Went really fine and the man at short fine leg gave it a good chase. ABD shows his deft side as well. He is off to a flier
FOUR, sweeps it fine and sweeps it well to get it away for a four. That was well down leg and batsman helped himself to a boundary by placing it to the fine leg fence
1 run, goes a little wide of the crease to deliver that googly. batsman nudged that out to deep mid-wicket for a single

out Bowled!! The quickish flattish leggie does it for bowler. That beat batsman on the outer edge as he looked to punch it and missed it for the off pole to be disturbed. The young man has a huge scalp. The partnership was building and has been broken now. Punjab get an important wicket to stop the momentum. batsman b bowler 20(21) [4s-3]
FOUR, floated up outside off and has been spanked past cover for a four. That was hit really hard and the man at deep cover despite trying his best just couldn't stop it

out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! The bat face turned on impact and has been taken at deep cover. The googly has done it for bowler. ABD has problems against leggies and has been exposed once more. The run rate also had a role to play in the dismissal. team have lost their top half and don't have much on the board. batsman c Sarfaraz Khan b bowler 28(18) [4s-4 6s-1]
1 run, use of the feet to drive this firmly down the ground to long-on
FOUR, neat hit that to this short of length delivery. Wristed that behind square at the last minute to pick up the backward square leg gap. No chance for the man at fine leg

1 run, he's not hit this well. He grunts "Aaaargh" as soon as he hit that in the air and Hetymer has put down a sitter. What has he done? This was the short delivery outside off stump, batsman just chipped it high over cover-point, Hetty ran in and probably overran, came around chest height and he couldn't control. This is a massive let off!

FOUR, in the airrr, and in the gap! Is this Faf's day? He hasn't timed everything as well as Sharjah or Abu Dhabi! This time he ran down the pitch and had a wild swing at the lofted drive, good from Mishy to push it outside off stump and force Faf to fetch that, leading edge actually and it flew between cover and point. Dhawan didn't cut the angle and was slow to take off, he assmued the man at cover would grab that

FOUR, oh that is quite a flick shot off the back foot. Wasn't all that short to be honest, he flicked that off the kneeroll! My word! Somehow generated enough power to beat the deep mid-wicket fielder

FOUR, in the airrrr and just over the leaping Nortje at mid-off. Jadhav jumped down the pitch and flat-batted that short of length delivery, hit it flat, Nortje is tall, tried his best there but it escaped.
FOUR, that's an audacious pull shot from batsman to his countrymen. KG tried the slower delivery but dropped it short, Faf played the, aah let it come pull shot over the infield over mid-wicket

FOUR, now deft touch from Kedar, oh that's beaten third man near the fence. Faf was shouting run, run, run.. to Kedar, who was so confident and just jogging. He was right. Third man was wide and he couldn't cut it off. That's one problem of having pace up your sleeve, batsman sometimes use it to their advantage
1 run, tucks this short of length delivery to backward square leg. Fifty stand between these two

out Lbw!! That is plumb in front! Impact right in front of off stump. You can't be slogging with a pull shot when it's not really short. Hit around the kneeroll. Jadhav seemed to be rushed by that length delivery and team have a breakthrough! Okay, was a slower delivery, so he was trying to adjust and that's why he missed. So far, a top over from bowler. batsman lbw b bowler 26(21) [4s-3]
3 runs, uppish guide to this short delivery past backward point, they race back for three
FOUR, low full toss and he's lofted that with such calmness. No real rush to power that ball, just placed it perfectly back over the ump's head and no chance for the men in the deep
FOUR, oh no! Not there! bowler tried to nail the leg stump toe-crusher but bowled a low full toss down leg, batsman happily helps it away to fine leg for four

2 runs, he hasn't timed it, it's highhhh and it's Hetmyer again who drops it. Full and on the stumps, batsman looks to loft over the infied, but he's skied this. Hetymer ran back from cover, a tough catch, but it looks like he never got a finger on it. No, on second viewing it is clear that he got both hands but it bursts through to fall on the ground

out Caught by Pant!! Edged and into the hands of Pant. Is that the game for team? Death bowling is all about watching what the batsman does. Faf was backing away, so KG fired this short of length delivery wide of off and forced him to fetch, Faf tried to reach but only managed to kiss it to Pant as he overbalanced playing the shot. batsman c Pant b bowler 43(35) [4s-4]
FOUR, guided, in the air but in the gap between short third man and backward point. batsman used pace on that short of length delivery really well

out Caught by Pant!! batsman walks! Slower short delivery, batsman early into the pull shot, gets a thick edge that lobs in front of Pant who dives forward to complete the catch. This is so good from team. Oh a bit of glove love between KG and Jadeja too. Nice to see. batsman c Pant b bowler 15(12) [4s-2]

FOUR, this by no means looked convincing. batsman backed away to open up the off-side field, Patel fired it within the stumps and batsman was committed to go for it. Dragged it off the cue-end and hits it uppishly, just manages to clear mid-on and earns a boundary

no run, dropped. Pops out of Shaw's hands at square leg like a bar of soap. He got a lifeline when he was batting and now this. Karma eh? A strong wristy whip from batsman, hitting it on the up and straight to Shaw, who couldn't lock his hands in time and grasses it. batsman will breathe easy.. you can't drop these catches at this level

out Caught by Mishra!! Cut straight to hand and bowler has three. Nice end to a comprehensive win from team. Short of a length, batsman guides and that's catching practice for Mishy. batsman c Mishra b bowler 12(9) [4s-1]

FOUR, he's welcomed into the attack with a boundary. Went fuller just outside off, batsman goes hard and sort of squirted it off the inner half, miscued it airly and it flies past Rabada's dive at mid-on. No point chasing it as it scurries away to the fence
SIX, Avesh is the weak link among DD's pacers and batsman knows it. A free-flowing swing of the bat, nailing it off the middle and launches it into the long-on stands. Can't bowl this length Avesh..

out Caught by Hetmyer!! batsman walks straight into the trap set by Iyer and Co. For a second, I thought Hetmyer misjudged it by running in too far, but he keeps his calm and holds onto it. Another game, another instance of team losing an early wicket. batsman will be kicking himself there, couldn't have placed it any better. A short delivery begging to be hit, batsman jumped back and pulled it uppishly, didn't have the power to clear the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Very poor.. Patel is pumped. batsman c Hetmyer b bowler 14(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

FOUR, not too smart bowling from bowler. Drifting onto batsman's pads, too easy for Faf as he just gets inside the line and tucks it past square leg. The timing is good enough to fetch him a four there

out Caught by Rabada!! This was inevitable. With the way, he was timing it, you'd sensed it, a wicket was round the corner. batsman's painful stay at the crease comes to an end and has he played his last game for team? You never know. team are a happy bunch. A simple back of a length delivery just outside off, some extra zip and pace did the trick for bowler. batsman just swung his bat, got it high on the bat and spooned a dolly to Rabada at mid-on. team two down and in a spot of bother. batsman c Rabada b bowler 10(15) [4s-1]

out Ruturaj Gaikwad Run Out!! This is the last thing team would've wanted at this stage. Needless. Patel lasers in the armer, batsman is cramped for room as he inside-edges it towards square leg. Ruturaj was keen to get to the other end as he races across the pitch only for Faf to send him back. Pant quickly sprints across and flings in a sharp throw to the bowler. He put in a full-length dive but wasn't enough. bowler cleanly breaks the stumps and he's a goner! Ruturaj Gaikwad run out (Pant/bowler) 5(10)

FOUR, yup, cover, punch, high-elbows, covers. Typically Shaw. Spots the back of a length early and rocks behind in his crease to not over-hit this crunch, perfectly through the point and extra cover gap
FOUR, pitched up this time with a bit of away swing. Shaw leans forward, and stays just as elegant -- drilling this cover drive with a louder crunch
SIX, thumped over long-off. Not quite to the pitch of it, and he's against the spin, but there's enough in those arms to tonk over

FOUR, pressure on the spinners as the openers are in complete control. Boundaries coming from both ends. batsman gets to the pitch of this delivery and whacks it over the bowler's head for four runs. bowler is running out of ideas

out Lbw!! Gone! Just the wicket they were looking for. He was playing so well, there was no need to play the reverse sweep. Actually the reverse heave. bowler goes very full and the batsman gets beaten and rapped on the pads. The impact was around middle and this might have gone on to crash into the off-stump. Nevertheless, this was also the highest opening wicket stand for Delhi since 2016. batsman lbw b bowler 35(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

FOUR, Delhi have just lost a wicket, but that's not going to affect Shaw. He'll keep playing his shots. This was short and wide outside off, Prithvi goes deep in his crease and cuts it past the man at short third man, four more..

out Stumped!! bowler gets rid of both the openers in successive overs. batsman walks down the wicket to play the flatter delivery and gets outfoxed. Comes off an inside edge, rolls back off the pad towards Dhoni who had to lunge forward to get the ball and stretch to break the bails. No chance of getting back in and that's the end of an impressive innings by the Capitals' opener. Can team get a few more wickets and stem the flow of runs? batsman st Dhoni b bowler 64(43) [4s-9 6s-1]

FOUR, typical batsman. Down on his knee in a flash as he picks the floated delivery to perfection. Enough elevation behind this scoop-like shot, with a lot more power behind. Almost went the distance at fine leg
FOUR, impeccable timing behind this cover drive, and even Faf du Plessis can do nothing about it. Touch fuller outside off and it has been absolutely creamed through the huge gap on the off side

FOUR, that was not needed. Dhoni wouldn't be happy with that. batsman had eased this one back to the bowler and Curran has a needless overthrow to give them four bonus runs. Would have been a dot ball, but he threw it down leg and Dhoni had no chance

FOUR, not an impressive delivery by bowler. He has sprayed a full toss on the pads in his quest to attempt the yorker. Easy pickings for batsman was flicks it away to the deep square leg fence. That went flat and for a moment it seemed as if this will go the distance. Alas, it didn't
FOUR, misfield by Kedar Jadhav at sweeper cover. This was absolutely smashed through the off side by batsman, but the fielder couldn't stop it in the deep. Dhoni applauds him for the effort though
1 run, 50-run stand up between this pair as batsman squeezes the yorker to square third man. They need to hit a few big ones here..
FOUR, and batsman is exactly doing that. On a length around off, batsman picks the length early and chips it over extra cover for a cracking four

out Caught by Dhoni!! MS files to his right and takes a superb catch. What a spectacular over by Curran as he concedes only four runs. Slightly short ball outside off, batsman swings across the line and gets an outside edge which has been taken. A rather rusty knock comes to an end. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 26(22) [4s-1]
FOUR, smashed! In the slot outside off and batsman has thumped it right over the bowler's head, can't keep a fielder there, can you?
FOUR, first-ball four for batsman. Shuffles in the crease, moves miles across the crease and drags the short ball from outside off and manages to get it past the man at short fine leg

leg byes, FOUR, runs for Delhi! Fired outside off on a yorker length and batsman once again attempts a similar shot. This one comes off his pads and beats Dhoni as it races away to the boundary. Doesn't matter how these runs come, as long as they do..
FOUR, 130.1kph, ah, too easy. Leg-lined, leg-cutter and Shaw glances it into the totally empty backward square leg
FOUR, 120.7kph, goes airy. Curran feeds length, and Shaw goes full-hearted, committing to slicing this easily over mid-off
FOUR, slashed through the covers .. and Chahar, chasing it from sweeper just doesn't put in the dive, merely sticking his foot out. Oh dear ..
FOUR, picks the gap behind square, and nails. Opening his bat face and using the sheer pace that bowler's dishing out all over to get it perfectly out there
SIX, here's the shackle-breaker. batsman finally middles, finally shows intent, sitting under this length and using the in-spin to slog it over deep square leg
FOUR .. and again. bowler feeds it in the slog, and batsman slog-sweeps, more into cow corner though
FOUR, top stuff. bowler gets just that little fuller-than-good, and Shaw goes inside-out, without a lot of feet movement either, lofting it wide of long-off comfortably
FOUR, googly. But as if Shaw could care less, he's dancing down this time, making room for his arm and inside-outing it once again into that extra cover zone
1 run, 96kph, straighter one on middle, with Shaw shuffling and tucking into mid-wicket. Also, a fifty
FOUR, it's his turn to inside-out. Steps away, makes room and lofts one-bounced into extra cover's ropes
FOUR, lovely, not a great ball from bowler, floaty half-volley on the pads, Gill gets inside the line and whips it over square leg, the man in the deep has no chance

out Caught by Warner!! The start team would have wanted after being restricted to a modest score. Look at Warner go, he's pumped up, this could lift his team as well. Back of a length and at the stumps, batsman was slightly cramped up on the pull, gets a steepling top-edge towards mid-off and Warner made sure that everyone else stayed away. Watched it all along and held on, a fist pump from bowler as he exults. batsman c Warner b bowler 0(2)

SIX, clubbed, Gill charges down the track to a good length delivery, didn't look like he got to the pitch of it, still went through with the bludgeon and gets enough to send it over the ropes at long-on
FOUR, breaks the shackles in style! Swung across the line for a four. That was in the arc for batsman to thwack it through the square leg region

FOUR, short delivery outside off and has been cut away past point for a four. That was delightfully done. Fifty for the young man. Has been an excellent knock! He has played shots all around the ground and more importantly very judiciously
1 run, full toss and almost a return catch! That was played with a twisted face of the bat and just away from the clutches of the bowler, who made an attempt to grab it to his right
wide, again down leg, batsman misses the tuck and this time it has been wided
1 run, fifty of the partnership comes up! That angled in and has been pushed down to long-on for a single. team in control
SIX, fuller delivery angled across, batsman lofts it huge over deep cover for a sixer! Lovely hit. The freedom was there for the southpaw and he just opened his arms
FOUR, tossed up delivery and has been slog swept! That was floated up and batsman knelt down to thwack it hard
SIX, chips down the track and lofts it huge down the ground! Superb hit from batsman as he wants to have an early finish
SIX, short ball outside off and has been pulled away handsomely over deep mid for a sixer! Got under it and slammed it. Only 2 needed now. batsman unleashed that big shot as he saw it too short

FOUR, redemption for team! And that too without much hullabaloo. That was a full toss and batsman powered it past the bowler for a four. Struck really hard by the southpaw to bring about their first win of the season!

FOUR, cracking shot, hint of width and those fast hands of Rana does the rest - stands tall and punches it in front of square on the off-side, past the dive at backward point and runs away to the ropes

FOUR, lovely, he's looking in excellent touch, Rana - back of a length and just outside off, not much width on offer, Rana still stands tall and punches it on the up, past the fielder at cover and runs away to the ropes
FOUR, top-edge and four, no control over this pull from Rana, but he got enough bat to clear Saha and his gloves, banged in short and well wide of off, Rana was clearly late on the shot
FOUR, sheer timing from Rana, back of a length and on the hips, he gets inside the line and clips it past square leg, the timing is sweet and the ball runs away to the boundary ropes
FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, short and wide of off, Rana gets on top of the bounce and cuts it up and over backward point - third man is fine and has no chance

FOUR, Rana can't do much wrong today, friendly full-toss from Natarajan, he leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the umpire - two fielders gave chase, but the ball beats them to the ropes

out Caught by W Saha!! A loose moment and Rana finds himself back on the way to the dressing room. He would be livid with himself, looked a million dollars, only to throw it all away. On a good length and a hint of shape away from the left-hander, Rana's feet went nowhere as he drove, gets a thick audible edge and Saha snaps it up. A wicket against the run of play, a wicket that would raise the hopes of team once again. batsman c W Saha b bowler 26(13) [4s-6]
FOUR, short, wide and four, the attempted slower ball from Khaleel, but it all went wrong - sat up to be smacked, Gill backed away and then thrashed it over cover for a boundary

FOUR, back-to-back boundaries - Gill is batting beautifully, men inside the ring in the off-side and he's opening up that gap with subtle feet movements - backs away to a length ball and then cuts it behind square on the off-side for a boundary

out Lbw!! Celeb appeal and the umpire's finger goes up for LBW. Think DK was happy to go, but he then chatted with his partner and decided to review. Pretty sure the 15-second time gap had elapsed, but here we go. It's a fair delivery and there's no inside edge on that. Was the wrong 'un and DK didn't read it one bit. UltraEdge confirms that there's no bat on that, Hawk-Eye in and it's three REDS. batsman is OUT and team have wasted their review. Lovely delivery from Khan, slipped in the wrong 'un and batsman didn't spot it - ended up playing outside the line as he lunged forward. Past the inside edge and struck adjacent to middle, was going on and crashing into the middle-stump. team keep themselves in the hunt with timely wickets. batsman lbw b bowler 0(3)
FOUR, nicely played, batsman brings out the reverse sweep - bends down low and gets enough bat to clear short third man - was the leg-break and he played with the turn

FOUR, 101kph, bowler fires one in the blockhole outside off, Pandey reaches out to squeeze it away with a horizontal blade and gets a faint under edge. The ball goes through the legs of the keeper and runs away to the fence. bowler has his hands on his head

FOUR, Nagarkoti slightly errs with his length and Pandey takes toll of it. Overpitched outside off at 139.5kph, the right-hander stays leg-side of the ball and batters it wide of mid-off. No need to run for those
1 run, 92kph, very full and around off, Pandey clears his front leg for a hoick-across-the-line and inside-edges it to mid-wicket

SIX, Saha had to up the ante! Shimmies down the track, crouches low and swings his bat hard to flog it over mid-wicket. There was a man in the deep, but the keeper-batsman got enough wood on it to clear the fielder. Nevertheless, an excellent spell from bowler comes to an end -- 4-0-25-1

FOUR, just wide of mid-off! 135.4kph, shortish ball, Pandey wanted to flat bat it over mid-off. Got it off the top part of the bat and wasn't in control of his shot. Fortunately for him, it beat Narine to his right and the ball raced away to the long-off fence
1 run, fifty for batsman! An off-pace ball, Pandey reaches the landmark with a cut to deep point. Just a raise of the bat from team's No. 3

out Caught&Bowled!! A high full toss at 139.4kph, and is batsman is out caught-and-bowled? The umpires send it upstairs. It's below the waist and Pandey has to walk back. This is a big wicket. A full toss just below the waist from round the wicket, Pandey was initially looking to run it down to third man and later decided to work it into the on-side. In the end, the ball lobbed up off the splice of the bat. He was taken aback by the full toss. A simple return catch for Dre Russ. batsman c and b bowler 51(38) [4s-3 6s-2]

FOUR, in the air and Nagarkoti has misjudged it! He charged in from third man and over-ran, put in a desperate leap in the end, but the ball was out of his reach. Goes to the fence on the bounce. A leg-stump full toss and Saha got a big leading edge trying to flick it away. Streaky, but team won't mind
FOUR, slapped! A short of length delivery outside off at 138.1kph, batsman clears his front leg and muscles the cross-batted shot through the covers. Not a muscle moved. Stand and deliver
FOUR, 134.9kph, full toss on leg from round the wicket, batsman flicks it away handsomely over square leg for a one-bounce four. Good start to the over for team

out W Saha Run Out!! 1 run completed. Better length from bowler, full and outside off, batsman batters it to long-off. Saha decides to come back for the second, but batsman is unmoved. The former spots it only after coming halfway down the pitch. Cummins fires a good throw to the keeper's end and Karthik completes the proceedings. Easy call for the TV umpire. W Saha run out (Cummins/Karthik) 30(31) [4s-1 6s-1]

byes, 1 run, 140.6kph, shortish ball outside off, Sharma wafts and is beaten by the pace and bounce. The batsmen decide to sneak a run via byes. Karthik lobs it to the bowler, but bowler misses the target at his end

SIX, up, up and over long-on. batsman has seen enough and it's time to get into business. Slightly bends forward, reaches out with his long levers as he pummels it high and sends it over the ropes. There was a fielder waiting but it cleared him. First shot of real intent and it's a six
FOUR, muscled past mid-on. bowler dropping it a tad shorter, batsman takes full toll of it. Sits deep, twirls his wrists and places it perfectly in the gap..

no run, fullish just outside off, batsman sits low outside off looking to scoop it over short fine leg. Loses his balance and it flies off the pad to short third man. DK calls for it and grabs. Appeals and the finger went up. batsman knew he didn't hit it, so got it overturned

out Bowled!! Knocked him over. So, he doesn't last long then. bowler cleans him up. He's been excellent today, rarely has bowled a bad ball. Just sticks to the traditional length and targets the stumps. batsman follows a similar approach of making room and exposes all the three stumps. Misses it altogether on this occasion and the off-pole takes a beating. team have struck early here. bowler is delighted with the breakthrough.. batsman b bowler 5(10)
SIX, that's batsman for you. Banged in short and Pandey smokes it over cow corner. A 81-metre hit. The ideal length for him and he tees off. He's away with a maximum and Warner liked it too

FOUR, there was a man at deep square leg but batsman still went for it and timed it properly. Got a hunch that a short ball was coming, quickly hung back and got on top of the bounce. Then employed some power and pulled it exactly where he wanted. To the right of deep square leg and it travels rapidly to the fence
SIX, clean hitting from Pandey. Uses his feet, gets to the pitch and extends his bat swing in tonking it over long-on. Stunning timing on that

out Caught&Bowled!! First IPL scalp for Varun bowler in this edition of IPL. And it's the big fish - batsman. A blip in concentration for team's captain after the break. A nothing shot really. This gave an impression of stopping upon reaching the batsman. Teased batsman into pushing at it, he went a bit too hard and chips it back to the bowler. bowler doesn't drop those. It was catching practice indeed. team camp are elated. batsman c and b bowler 36(30) [4s-2 6s-1]
no run, it was the slider, Saha stayed back and didn't pick it. Played it outside the line, gets trapped on the back leg. Oh, it was the googly in fact.. close shave for Saha

SIX, that's one length you don't bowl to batsman. He thrives with anything short, the round the wicket angle was also taking it down leg, batsman swivels and helps along the way over fine leg. With the fielder inside the ring it was more comfortable to put it away

FOUR, in the air and just over. Expensive start for bowler, 14 off the first over. Full and curling away outside off, batsman is in no control of the drive as he hits it uppishly and manages to get it over the leaping cover-point fielder

out Caught by (sub)Negi!! First time Sundar has opened the bowling this season and he has got the big wicket of batsman. Just the start team wanted especially after an expensive over from Udana. batsman had enough of defending and was looking to go for the biggie, the length was fraction short and he was quick to pounce, pulls it high and that would have gone the distance in any other ground but not in Dubai, Negi settles under it at deep mid-wicket and hangs on comfortably. batsman c (sub)Negi b bowler 8(8) [6s-1]
SIX, welcome back to the attack, Saini. Kishan lays into him, showing no respect to this full ball. Right in his arc and that's been slammed straight down the ground for a maximum

SIX, okay, Kishan has decided to change gears and he's targeting Saini. Again gets the length up, Kishan was waiting for this. Just gets under it and muscles it a mile over deep mid-wicket. Second six of the over, pressure on the bowler

out Caught by (sub)Negi!! The celebration from Virat Kohli and Co. just tells you this wicket meant a lot to them. bowler strikes gold for his team as batsman departs. Got a lot of height on this mow, it's a big boundary at deep mid-wicket, it required more power to clear the fence, but sadly he couldn't generate it. Ubiquitous Negi circles around and pouches it safely. Massive blow to team. batsman c (sub)Negi b bowler 15(13) [6s-1]

SIX, fifty for batsman. It's his comeback game, replaced Tiwary and he's making this opportunity count. bowler gets it too full, Kishan gets underneath it and smokes it a long way over cow corner. Brings up the milestone in some style

2 runs, They are checking for a boundary. Udana seems to have done a good job in saving a couple for his team. A thick top edge on the sweep, the fielder at short fine leg thought he was in business but it soared over his head. Udana runs across from the deep and keeps the ball in play
SIX, Mumbai need more of this. A dragged-down delivery from bowler, Kishan has all the time in the world to hang back and swipe it over deep backward square leg. Brute force from Kishan..

FOUR, chance? Nope, seems to have dropped just in front of Devdutt at long-off. A toe-ended swat from batsman, dumps it to the left of Devdutt, who bolted to his left and went for the catch. But the ball dipped and unfortunately, he couldn't get his body behind the line as well. Four more to batsman
FOUR, gotta feel for Saini. This was a yorker just outside off, Kishan waited and waited for it, opened his bat face and just guided it very fine at third man. Talk about placement and timing... wow

FOUR, that's bullied down the ground at long-off. My god! What power from batsman. bowler errs and bowls it in the slot for him. No chance for the fielder there, it just rocketed away to the fence in a jiffy

SIX, oh boyyyyy! Has Negi dropped the match here? What a big miss from him at deep extra cover. After taking so many catches, he lets one burst through his hands. Flighted just outside off, batsman mistimes it as it comes off the toe-end. Skies in the air near the fence, Negi was in good position but it slips through and sails over the rope. You can't give a lifeline to someone like batsman, he will make you pay..
SIX, and he does. Rightaway! A rank long hop, batsman sits back and clobbers it a countrymile over cow corner
SIX, told ya! batsman is making that drop count. Yet another maximum.. Tosses up by bowler, batsman didn't get it off the middle but still has imparts enough power on it to smash it over long-on

3 runs, in the air.. another chance and Chahal this time makes a meal of it. What are team doing? Very poor.. batsman looks to go for another biggie, gets a thick edge which goes up towards backward point. Chahal circles around, never looked comfortable and worse is.. doesn't even get a hand on it. Phew!
SIX, naahhh! batsman ain't showing any mercy. Tonks it over long-off. Served it up slower and wider of off, batsman's long levers coming to the fore.. sends it into the empty stands
SIX, Kishan gets into the act now. Not so great bowling from bowler. Where's the googly mate? Just tosses another leg-break, Kishan pivots back, reads it and slogs it over deep mid-wicket

SIX, 20-ball fifty for batsman. What a player. What a knock this has been. team back in the game. Another big over. Flatter leg-break from bowler, batsman skips back, makes room and murders it over long-off

SIX, my word! How did this fly over the ropes? A proper mis-hit from Kishan, directs it into the night sky and Virat at long-off was setting himself near the boundary, but it gains some distance and loops over his head. Crazy

SIX, butter fingers everywhere for team. Gurkeerat at long-on messes it up. Kishan muscled it flat and straight to him, he got both hands but couldn't lock it in time. Terrible.. and morever, he tips it over the bar for SIX

SIX, batsman, you beauty.. connects and connects this one properly. Moves across his stumps and pummels it over long-on. Too predictable from bowler and Virat throws his head in anger. Rohit jumps from his chair. Oh! What's happening!

out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! More twist. More drama. Kishan's fallen a solitary run short of his century. Uff! A slower ball from bowler, trimmed his length a bit and Kishan slogged it hard, doesn't have power to clear deep mid-wicket and Devdutt clasps onto it. Take a bow, Kishan though. He's played a gem and has taken team closer.. batsman c Devdutt Padikkal b bowler 99(58) [4s-2 6s-9]

out Caught by de Villiers!! team have two now. They had a solitary wicket in the powerplay before today and that too a lucky dismissal of Warner and now they have two in the space of four balls. Short of length delivery angled across the right hander, the ball bounces more than Suryakumar anticipated, he goes for the steer and edges it behind to the keeper. AB has a juggle before completing the catch. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, that's a freebie first up. Short and plenty of width on offer, Kishan tries his best to get on top of the bounce to play the cut, but flays it uppishly past the diving backward point fielder

FOUR, IT's a TIE. The scores are level as batsman pulls this to the fence at deep mid-wicket. Dug in short, batsman stayed back and placed it perfectly. SUPER OVER to decide the winner. Elation in both camps. Kohli is relieved for the moment and smiles that they haven't come second. He walks off briskly to push for a Super Over win

SIX, shot! That's a fine hit from Kishan. Short and at the body, Kishan swivels and pulls, he got it right off the meat as the ball sailed over the long leg fence. The ball is lost in the stands and the fourth umpire brings out a box of replacement balls..

out Caught by (sub)Negi!! This was on the cards. batsman never looked comfortable at the crease and with the required rate shooting up he had no other choice but to go after the spinner. bowler is not afraid of getting hit, he tosses it up generously but gets it to dip on the southpaw, batsman goes for the slog sweep and miscues it horribly, a much simpler catch for Negi at deep mid-wicket this time. batsman c (sub)Negi b bowler 14(15) [4s-1]

SIX, that's a horrible delivery. bowler overcooks the delivery and it ends up as a full toss, Pandya does not need a second invitation, deposits it to the biggest part of the ground - to deep mid-wicket. Even some of his team mates were impressed on the distance he got

FOUR, that's a freebie for any batsman. bowler gets a bit greedy tries to swing it away from middle and leg, but the ball keeps going with the angle, Padikkal flicks it stylishly backward of square and the new cherry races away to the fence
FOUR, edged and four, clear intention from batsman, runs down the track, was done in the by slower ball, but he had a free swing at that, gets a fat edge that flies over the lone slip

out Caught by Rohit!! No. no. no! You don't want to see that if you are a batsman fan! That was a painful stay, but credit to bowler. He troubled batsman and deserved this wicket. Was the leggie, probably that diagonal over the wicket angle is troubling him - he was bowling most deliveries to batsman from that angle. However, this was bowled with a conventional run-up, pitching on a length and turning away, batsman loses one hand on the handle and chips it to cover. batsman c Rohit b bowler 3(11)

SIX, now that is some shot! Kohli hit a six over long-off in an international game and this is a little similar to that. Not easy to loft handsomely off the back foot and he did so without balance too. Great shot!

SIX, now the full flowing bat down the ground to loft bowler into the sightscreen. batsman, what a talent. Length delivery, in the slot, but Padikkal made it look so easy. Rohit not happy with the length or the idea from the bowler
FOUR, oh that seemed effortless. Short and angling in, batsman was cramped on the pull, but lofted that over infield, the timing was good enough to clear long-on
FOUR, they have been trying to bowl wide of off to Padikkal and he smartly targets the cover region with a nice lofted hit, just bounced inside the line

FOUR, no pace on this length delivery, but enough width to free the arms. Past backward point and the cut shot heads to the boundary. Second fifty in three games for young Padikkal. The team dugout is so happy for him. AB pats him on the helmet
FOUR, taking pace off is fine, but you can't bowl down leg with no fine leg. Easily helped away behind square for a boundary
FOUR, if you are bowling full and outside off stump it's got to be really wide. This is right in the slot as bowler misses the yorker, batsman gets into a great position to loft over cover
SIX, okay! Never bowl within the bodyline to AB when he's looking for quick runs. The slower ball sat into the surfaces, batsman hangs back and pulls over mid-wicket. Didn't bother running

SIX, no Jas B! Unless you get that yorker right, it's difficult to control AB when you bowl into his body! This is another yorker missed, right in the slot and batsman, clearing the front leg out of the way, powers it handsomely over the bowler's head for a maximum

out Caught by Pollard!! Pollard takes a really good catch. bowler dropping the slower ball short and wide of off, forcing Padikkal to fetch, Padikkal went for the pull, hit it decently, but big Pollard ran to his left, used all his height to great effect to take a gentle leaping catch. Well played young Dev! bowler's actually on a hat-trick, got Finch off the last ball of his previous over. batsman c Pollard b bowler 54(40) [4s-5 6s-2]

SIX, just 4 runs off the over till this ball, so it should have been a smart delivery, but bowler, having got away with a short slower ball first delivery, tries again, but AB will feed on those anything within his bodyline at the end overs. Pulls, really high and into the stands over long leg
FOUR, Jas B isn't nailing those yorkers. Low full toss outside off stump, batsman lofts straight down the ground and any batsman need not hit such deliveries hard, just placed over the bowler

FOUR, smart, really smart from Dube. Seriously can't understand bowler bowling short and angling outside off stump with third man in, Dube just uses the pace offered and guides past the fielder inside

SIX, how high was that hit? What a way to raise a fifty. Such a lovely player to watch at the death. Really interesting ploy from bowler to continue to bowl into AB's body than bowl outside off stump and make him to force pace. This is just a length delivery that's been absolutely muscled over deep square leg
SIX, wow! Really nice cameo this from Dube. Knew bowler is going to bowl full and wide of off stump, read the slower delivery, got down on one knee and powered this over cover

SIX, this is so stylish flicked! Stunning hit! Rohit folds hands and looks. Fullish and angled in, Dube just uses his hands on that to wrist it with a strong bottom hand grip, so easily clearing mid-wicket

no run, chance and Rohit has dropped it - fair to say, he has saved four runs - short and just outside off, batsman rocked back and drilled the pull, to the left of mid-wicket. Rohit moved across quickly, got both hands on the ball, but can't hold on
SIX, lovely, superbly played by batsman, length delivery outside off, he reached forward, got close to the ball, a clean extension of his arms and he drop kicks it over the long-off fence

SIX, why? Just why? Coaches, experts plead not to bowl length at the death but bowler has bowled a slower ball halfway down the pitch. Dube stands tall and flat-bats it really straight. What a finish for team - 201
FOUR, cracking shot, batsman is on a mission - back of a length and well wide of off, he swivels across and pulls it in front of square on the on-side - one bounce and over the ropes
FOUR, lovely, Chahar was trying to follow batsman as he backed away, but the length is far too short, pulled away with immense power over square leg for a boundary
FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for batsman, this is excellent batting, fired short and down leg, he bends down low, uses the pace on the ball and laps it over short fine for a boundary
FOUR, make it a hat-trick of boundaries - this is poor bowling from Chahar - dropped short and on off-stump, batsman made room and cracked it square on the off-side for yet another boundary
leg byes, FOUR, poor line from bowler, short and on Padikkal's hips, he was looking to flick and missed, clipped the thigh-pad and beat the diving keeper - brings up the 50 for team
FOUR, cracking shot, he isn't afraid of playing his shots - banged in short and at the stumps, Padikkal swivels across and pulls it over square leg, no one in the deep and it's another boundary
FOUR, nicely played, loopy delivery wide of off, batsman gets a good stride forward and goes inside out over cover, almost went all the way, bounced just in front of the ropes
FOUR, nicely played, fifty for batsman, his first for team - tossed up quicker and sliding down leg, he bends half-way down and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
FOUR, this is smart batting. Looked like the short slower delivery on the leg stump, Padikkal gets inside the line, swivels and helps it away fine knowing fine leg is very square

out Caught by Pollard!! Catching practice for Pollard at long-off - the threatening partnership has been broken. Change of pace and batsman was done in completely - the slower ball and batsman had to manufacture all the pace on this attempted lofted drive - was looking to go over cover, but it skewed off the inner half and lobbed down towards Pollard at long-off. He didn't have to move, a fine knock from batsman comes to an end. batsman c Pollard b bowler 52(35) [4s-7 6s-1]

out Caught by Bairstow!! There is the edge.. Bairstow takes it neatly in front of his face and Bhuvi strikes in his first over. Got extra lift on this outswinger, beautiful seam presentation as it nibbles away outside off. Shaw with zero feet movement chases and nicks it behind. Early jitters in the team camp. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 2(5)

out Caught by Bairstow!! SHR review an edge: A googly, spinning sharply across batsman's heave. And there's a little tickle off the toe-end. Bairstow's heard it, but he whips the bails off before appealing, confusing the umpire. So again, the excuse of blaming it on the loud noisy crowds for umpires missing nicks stands exposed. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 34(31) [4s-4]
SIX, and there's the insult rubbed in .. batsman's not messing around, staying his ground and for a change not over-hitting as he manages a lovely bat flow in slogging it over cow corner
SIX, more insult -- off a slice this time, over long-off. Neat bat swing, and a flat tonk

leg byes, FOUR, 135kph, high full toss, and as if that weren't enough, he's dished out a filthy line heading down leg as well. batsman whips, or rather gets a thick chunk of his thigh pad, and it comfortably goes past the keeper
SIX, 137kph, feeds a full toss in the arc at full pace. Well, well, it can't get easier. batsman finds his arc, swinging and heaving over cow corner. This should break shackles
SIX, picks the off-cutter for treatment here -- with Ahmed insisting on feeding it short, wide, and getting sliced uppishly over backward point

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! One bobble, second pouch. Kumar - bringing all his experience into this - keeps it slow, outside off and forces batsman to reach out and slice it to the longest part of the boundary at long-off. Doesn't matter, he'd miscued it alright as Pandey runs in from the boundary, and holds on with some help from his chest. So team finally are into their home territory of small defences, choking out teams at the death. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 21(12) [6s-2]
FOUR, 122.6kph, back of a length, slow, but there's width, generous width. batsman stays on his back foot, and cuts away through point, beating third man comfortably

FOUR, 120.2kph, whacks it alright. Kumar once again loses his line on the change of pace, keeping it short and wide outside off. batsman - for a change - doesn't commit early, waiting on it to slap it through sweeper

out Caught by Priyam Garg!! bowler, rare loop, rarer flight and a Rishabh batsman freaky sweep -- mix it, and a disaster's a certainty. So it starts with batsman premeditatingly shuffling across his stumps, Khan tossing it up on leg-stump, extracting bounce, getting the top-edge and going down deep square leg's throat. batsman c Priyam Garg b bowler 28(27) [4s-1 6s-2]

out Lbw!! LBW reviewed compulsively with the knowledge that he's the last remaining batsman with the skill to stand up to this bully of a bowling attack. Natarajan keeps it the same, very full, on middle, and batsman in a hope to manufacture something funky out of this, shuffles across, misses his flick and finds himself plumb in front of middle. Yea, that's exactly what HawkEys also says - hitting the base of off in three reds, dark reds. batsman lbw b bowler 11(9) [4s-1]
FOUR, 139.5kph, full toss. batsman slices, has his bat turning in his palms, but still has enough in it to chip it over extra cover, and beat Rashid's sliding dive from sweeper
2 runs, dropped -- and it's Manish Pandey of all people .. batsman holds his pose on the one-kneed high-elbowed punch through the covers, which only finds long-off perfectly. Alas, too casual

out Bowled!! Through him. A big hoick across the line, and not that he had much of a choice here did Patel, but clearly wasn't even close to the line, that manages to drift in through the air and come in with the angle to drag off the inside edge to leave an LED-lit mess behind. batsman b bowler 5(6)

FOUR, shot of the evening so far! A fuller length delivery that jagged back in a little, batsman charged out of his crease, gave himself some room and presented a straight bat in lifting it over the bowler's head. Balance and timing in sync and then he poses for the cameras too

SIX .. and he'll finally get his cover-chip-drive right, getting under this length and tonking it over long-off rather comfortably. Clearly team couldn't care less, in fact Warner's even celebrating while the ball's in trajectory

FOUR, chipped over mid-on. Dances out of his crease without any trace of worry, converts it into a fullish delivery and holds his shape nicely. Hits it through the line and enough wood on it to get it sail over the fielder's head

FOUR, batsman knows Iyer is biding his time, so he has to attack. Spots an overpitched delivery outside off, transfers his weight quickly forward and bashes it past cover. It was on the rise but just wide of the fielder and off it trickles away to the boundary
FOUR, a junk from Ahmed and Iyer says thanks. Strays on the pads, Iyer gets inside the line and tucks it very fine
FOUR, quality shot from Iyer. Made that look so easy. Natarajan pitches it up just outside off, Iyer stomps forward and lofts it magnificently over mid-off. He's getting a move on now

out Caught by Abdul Samad!! Goneeee! Just needed two balls to get a breakthrough. Iyer wasn't in his zone tonight. Wanted to slice it over extra cover, the bat face turned in his hands at the point of contact and as a result of which, he skies it to deep cover. Samad runs in, doesn't panic and grabs it. His first catch in IPL and team have lost their second wicket. Rashid is thrilled. batsman c Abdul Samad b bowler 17(21) [4s-2]
FOUR, excellent execution of the sweep. Preempted, went down and predicted the bowler to pitch it on leg-stump. Swept it wide of short fine leg and batsman earns a boundary
FOUR, nicely played, tad too full and at the stumps, batsman stays deep in the crease and then gets enough power on the lofted on-drive, clears mid-on with ease and bounces away to the ropes
FOUR, cracking shot, dropped short and wide of off, batsman makes room and clatters the cut behind square on the off-side, no one moved

FOUR, brilliant placement! There is a long-on in place but batsman had got this well wide of that fielder who had no chance to cut it off. Bad ball from bowler though, too short and allowed batsman to sit back on the pull. He cleverly picked his spot

out Caught by Rabada!! Weird shot from Pandey!! He had just come in and this isn't the easiest of surfaces to start on. Looks to take bowler on with the slog sweep but is done in flight and gets a top-edge that's pouched comfortably at deep mid-wicket. It's that longer part of the ground which undid team yesterday in Dubai, and just like that here in Abu Dhabi, has taken out Pandey today. He was clutching his hamstring last over, so did that play a role in this shot? Either ways, team aren't complaining. This is a fab phase for them. batsman c Rabada b bowler 3(5)

1 run, slight hesitation but they get the single as extra cover can't get across. batsman drove this gently and wanted one from the outset but Bairstow was a bit unsure. It eventually goes down to long-off

FOUR, chipped over a leaping extra cover! batsman was a bit in two minds as he played this, almost as an afterthought but did well to clear the infield eventually. Was looped wider outside off, and batsman didn't really get to the pitch but went through with the stroke. Picked his gap well

FOUR, terrific placement! Fine leg and deep mid-wicket are the fielders on the leg-side boundary, so KW decides to ping that gap. Shuffles across early and gets inside the line to pull this short delivery that didn't rise as much to trouble batsman

FOUR, what a shot! Mid-off up, the length had to be a tad short but batsman is ready for it. Stands tall and flat-bats this wide of mid-off. Lovely connection and it's raced away. Much-needed momentum for team

FOUR, batsman is unleashing himself! Full and outside off, not the slower ball and batsman is across the stumps in a flash to play his typical pickup stroke. Dhawan at deep backward square leg tried to get across but couldn't

FOUR, he is toying around with the field! Makes room this time and although it's a hard length from bowler, batsman biffs it over mid-on. Not a meaty connection but enough to clear the infield. What a gem of a knock this is turning out to be from the Kiwi in his first outing of the season

2 runs, fifty for batsman and also the 50-run stand! Terrific yorker from bowler and batsman somehow digs this out between his legs, towards deep square leg. They run hard and though the second run was risky, JB is comfortably home. It's been an unconventional batsman innings so far, not that free-flowing but the crucial part is that he has adapted. Also a very handy partnership, this

out Caught by Nortje!! You can't deny bowler for long at the death. He thrives in these situations and has struck a vital blow here. Cross-seamer from bowler, very full and batsman made room for the loft. Didn't get any timing whatsoever and absolutely sent this straight up into the night skies. We've seen many such ones dropped, but Nortje holds his composure and takes it near the deep mid-off region. batsman falls after an workman-like innings. batsman c Nortje b bowler 53(48) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, top-edge but goes to the fence! Another attempted swipe across the line, this is short and pacy, and it's no surprise that young Samad is very late. Slices this way over the keeper and very fine down to third man fence. They all count

SIX, he's got hold of this one! Wow! First signs of Samad's abilities. In the slot alright and he's pumped this high over wide long-on. Brute force and to do it against a bowler of bowler's pace shows that the bloke has the talent for sure

out Caught by Axar!! Holes out to deep mid-wicket. Slower ball, wide outside off and batsman has to really fetch this one. Looks to wrist this away but these are big dimensions on that part of the ground. Doesn't get the distance on the stroke and picks out the fielder to perfection. A priceless cameo from the NZ skipper though. batsman c Axar b bowler 41(26) [4s-5]

1 run, a direct hit and even batsman's dive wouldn't have saved him - drilled the drive straight to extra-cover and set-off for a quick single - Shreyas Iyer was helped by some good bounce and has a shy at the bowler's end

leg byes, 1 run, appeal for LBW - bowler liked it and Shreyas points towards the review. Only the height is a matter of concern, looked pretty adjacent to the stumps. It's a fair delivery and there's no bat on that, UltraEdge confirms it. It's umpire's call on hitting the stumps, batsman survives. Short of a length and the ball skidded through after pitching, batsman was early into the pull and is beaten, struck high on the thigh-pad and the ball is only clipping the bails of middle

1 run, chance and Shreyas can't hold on - would have been a good catch had he held, the ball was always dying onto him, just got his fingertips, but the ball popped out. batsman is done in by the slowness of the pitch and is early into the shovel, lobbed off the inner half and towards mid-on

SIX, cracking shot, batsman breaks the shackles at last - change of pace on this cutter from bowler, but the length was wide of off - batsman bends down on his knees and pumps the drive over cover - went a long way over the ropes for a maximum

FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for batsman - this was a streaky one though, short of a length and on off, he was hopping across on the pull, gets an inside edge onto the thigh-pad and it rolls away to the third man ropes
SIX, clubbed, nicely tossed up outside off, batsman gets down on his knees, picks the length early and plays the slog sweep over mid-wicket - hard, flat and over the ropes
2 runs, good running from batsman, nudged a well flighted delivery in front of mid-wicket and the call was always for the second run - Bairstow responded and they complete it with ease

SIX, lovely, the slower ball from bowler, but it's too full and right under batsman's arc - he clears his left leg and drills it back over the umpire's head, has enough power to sail over the ropes for a maximum
FOUR, batsman sets himself up for the reverse sweep, gets a bottom edge and the ball runs fine, past Shaw at short third man and beats his chase to the ropes

out Caught by Pant!! Another attempted reverse sweep and Pant reckons there was some glove on that. The Capitals have reviewed the caught behind call. This looks close, think batsman might be in trouble, looked like a feather on the glove. UltraEdge in and there's a minor spike when the ball is past batsman's gloves. That's enough for the third umpire to overturn the original call. batsman is OUT. Think it's a fair decision from the third umpire, Chris Gaffaney. The spike wasn't huge, but there seemed to be a deviation when the ball went past the gloves - batsman was attempting the reverse sweep to one that drifted across him - caught the glove and Pant stood low to hold on. A wicket against the run of play, the dangerous batsman departs. batsman c Pant b bowler 45(33) [4s-3 6s-2]

SIX, has that gone the distance? Yeah, of course, it has! Right into the slot around off, slightly up, batsman shuffles a touch in the crease, gets underneath the length and clubs it over long-on for the first big one of this evening in Dubai

out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Tewatia gets Rana. A floated delivery around off, batsman looks to take on bowler and fails in his quest to clear long-off. Lofts it high up in the air, but fails to get the distance. It's Riyan Parag who completes a safe catch in the deep. This has been the problem with Rana this season. He's getting those starts, but he's not really able to convert them. batsman c Riyan Parag b bowler 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, Archer is disappointed with himself. Overpitched flighted delivery and Gill drills the drive straight down the ground, Archer gets across from long-on and tries to stop it with one hand, the ball does not stick

out Caught&Bowled!! And Archer strikes. He was brought back to take out Russell but Rajasthan won't mind this. The set batsman departs and it is two new batsmen out in the middle. 140.5kph back of a length delivery angled in to the right hander, Gill is a tad early into his flick and the leading edge balloons up, Archer calls for it and tumbles backwards as he completes the catch. batsman c and b bowler 47(34) [4s-5 6s-1]
SIX, there he goes! First of the night for Dre Russ. Googly and batsman was waiting for it, it landed right in his arc and he went down on his knee to bludgeon it over cow corner

SIX, number 2! Gopal is erring in line and batsman is not one to miss out. This one drifts in on leg-stump, batsman clears his front leg and muscles it flat over deep mid-wicket. The fielder was left as a spectator

out Caught by Buttler!! Archer is on fire. This is a jaffa to remove the team captain. A typical Archer wicket. Pounds it hard at 147.3kph on back of a length and gets it to straighten a tad, just a tad and batsman ended up playing the wrong line, the outside edge settled nicely into Buttler's mitts. batsman c Buttler b bowler 1(3)
SIX, this is a buffet delivery for batsman. He is just waiting for that length - back of a length, he waits for the ball to arrive and pumps it flat over deep mid-wicket. Six #3!

out Caught by Unadkat!! And gone! Rajasthan have their man. batsman cannot believe it as he walks back with both his hand along with the bat over his head. team in trouble now with half the side back in the dugout. There was a plan and bowler has bowled to it. Third man was up, deep backward point was in place and a deep extra cover. bowler went for the wide yorker and even nailed it, batsman bends down and slices it straight to Unadkat at deep backward point. That was right off the meat but the long boundaries did not help him there. batsman c Unadkat b bowler 24(14) [6s-3]

FOUR, first boundary conceded by Archer. 121.4kph back of a length delivery, batsman had the width to work with and he times the pants off this backfoot punch, sweeper was not on the boundary line and he is not able to cut the angle as the ball races away to the fence

SIX, oh no! Curran has palmed it over the rope. Short and angled across the left hander, batsman uses the space on offer to play the upper cut to deep backward point, Curran runs across and he is thinking of parrying the ball in even before catching it, in the end he allows it to slip past his grasp
FOUR, batsman is switching gears now. But he is aided by Curran here. Juicy full toss outside off, batsman moves across and slaps it over extra cover, no chance for the sweeper cover

out Caught by Samson!! Wow! Has Samson hurt his head? Landed badly on it. Slower short ball and batsman takes it on, he miscues the pull to deep backward square, Samson misjudges it slightly as he overruns it but adjusts well to leap up and take it over his head, he tumbles backwards and that's when he hits his head onto the ground. Seems to be fine.. batsman c Samson b bowler 12(10) [4s-1]
1 run, full and close to yorker length, Nagarkoti jams it out to long-on

FOUR, that's poor planning by bowler. With mid-off inside the ring he dishes out a half volley outside off, Nagarkoti just needs to clear the infield and he does that quite comfortably, well over Smith and the ball races away to the fence

SIX, and he's got the distance. It was in the air for a long time but he had made enough connection to beat deep mid-wicket. Slower short of length delivery and it sat up nicely, batsman shuffles across and heaves it with a clean bat swing

1 run, dropped! The ex team player has done them a favour. batsman could have been dismissed for a duck, but he has been given a life by Uthappa. Got deceived due to the slower one and ended up chipping it towards mid-on where the fielder puts down a dolly as he tries to reverse cup it

FOUR, four runs! Will he make them pay for that dropped catch? A back of length delivery by bowler and batsman heaves it through mid-wicket as the fielder in the deep fails to stop it even after his dive, parrying it away to the boundary

FOUR, short and punished! I mean it wasn't all that short, but batsman is quick to pick the length. Treks back in the crease does the opener and slams it through mid-wicket, that's four more! bowler proving to be slightly expensive
SIX, that shall give him some confidence. Or rather, a lot of it. He's a confidence player. Picks the bones out of this slower delivery and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen
FOUR, each and every run will hurt Uthappa. A short of a length delivery around off, batsman reaches out for it and punches it through covers as he beats the fielder's dive inside the ring

out Bowled!! Oh yeah, Robbie will be a relieved man! His prayers have worked, and the dropped catch hasn't cost much. bowler sticks to his slower ones and he has managed to knock down batsman. Rolled his fingers, pitched this one on a good length. batsman like always, swings and misses. Failed to get him in his previous over, but has managed to get his man eventually. First wicket for bowler this season. batsman b bowler 15(14) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, finally batsman gets off the mark. Was waiting for a loose delivery and he has latched onto it with both hands. Throws the kitchen sink at this short and wide ball and cuts it over backward point as the fielder in the deep couldn't do nothing about it

FOUR, a half-tracker by bowler and it has spoiled the over for him. Was proving to be quite economical till then. Gill rocks back in his crease and hammers the pull as it beats the sprinter at deep mid-wicket. Bowled well against Rana, but not so well against Gill
SIX, Rana welcomes bowler with a maximum. A loopy delivery around off and the shouthpaw has lofted it over wide long-off with impeccable timing, looked a six the moment he connnected that
FOUR, such an artist! This was darted around middle and leg, batsman waits for it to arrive and heaves it into the huge gap at deep mid-wicket
FOUR, smashed down the ground! batsman into his 40s as he makes sure to make the bowler pay for pitching this one up. Played it straight as an arrow as the fielder at long-on couldn't get there
FOUR, Samson dives at deep point, but this kept curving away from him. Was a short ball again and batsman's square-cut fetched him four runs

SIX, has that gone the distance? Yeah, of course, it has! Right into the slot around off, slightly up, batsman shuffles a touch in the crease, gets underneath the length and clubs it over long-on for the first big one of this evening in Dubai

Lofts it high up in the air, but fails to get the distance. It's Riyan Parag who completes a safe catch in the deep. This has been the problem with Rana this season. He's getting those starts, but he's not really able to convert them. batsman c Riyan Parag b bowler 22(17) [4s-2 6s-1]

FOUR, a half-tracker by bowler and it has spoiled the over for him. Was proving to be quite economical till then. Gill rocks back in his crease and hammers the pull as it beats the sprinter at deep mid-wicket. Bowled well against Rana, but not so well against Gill
