FOUR, smashed down the ground! batsman into his 40s as he makes sure to make the bowler pay for pitching this one up. Played it straight as an arrow as the fielder at long-on couldn't get there
FOUR, Samson dives at deep point, but this kept curving away from him. Was a short ball again and batsman's square-cut fetched him four runs

FOUR, if the idea was to surprise batsman first ball with a short one, it hasn't worked. He's in position quickly, leaning back, hitting the pull over square leg. Did take the eyes off it eventually, but still got it crack off the middle
FOUR, the short ball didn't work against Agarwal.. it almost did against batsman. Hits him high on the bat as he pulls. No control as it flies to the left of Krunal but he can't get to it at long leg
FOUR, backs away, receives one that is pounded in on short of length and slaps it over cover. Some form these blokes are carrying, and the confidence is on show

leg byes, 1 run, batsman tried to slog-sweep the googly and missed, luckily the ball pitched outside leg stump. Mumbai needlessly reviewed, only to lose. QdK was blinded by the batsman, so he couldn't tell the full story
SIX, Nic batsman in the house folks! Back in his crease as he tonks the short ball over long-on for a huge six
FOUR, harmless short of length delivery, sits up nicely, batsman powers off the back foot over mid-wicket. He's keeping them in the game big time. Mumbai will want to hunt him down quickly

2 runs, in the airrr, Hardik Pandya can't get there. batsman sliced this lofted drive as bowler floated a full one, looked like pace off that, Hardik had a lot of ground to cover, he had to skate to get there

out Caught by de Kock!! A game of angles, nothing else folks. You would think how on earth did a set batsman of batsman's ability not muscle that juicy full ball over the ropes. but there's a lot on the technical side in this game. batsman took the invitation without knowing there was trap, he swung too hard and lost a bit of shape which is why he couldn't find the middle. Edge to QdK who takes a simple catch. A lot of times people wonder why Cottrell and not Jordan in a team. It's all about the angles. Left-arm angle to right-handeed batsman isn't all that easy. batsman c de Kock b bowler 44(27) [4s-3 6s-2]

out Caught by Boult!! Okay it's so simple. If you have a leggie in your team, make him bowl into the wicket/not too full and get it to turn outside off stump, batsman can't resist slogging across the line, unfortuanly the bat keeps turning in his hands and he slices them. This had a lot of height as he tried to fetch a pull shot, Boult moved a few paces forward and catches it. batsman c Boult b bowler 11(18)

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Caught off a high full toss, they are checking but it's just below the waist and a legal delivery. When it's not your day even the full toss go to fielders. batsman wanted to smash over mid-wicket, miscued it high and actually a good grab running back from backward point over his right shoulder.batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 7(7)
FOUR, now that makes a lot of sense, third man is in, third man Sarfaraz plays the reverse slog and connects really well. Clears the infield and it's a boundary

out Lbw!! That's a toe-crusher at the base of leg stump. Sarfaraz couldn't get that away with the attempted flick shot, ump raised the finger. Batsman reviewed, but he knew he was a goner. batsman lbw b bowler 7(8) [4s-1]

out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! SKY has been really busy in the last few minutes. Full and into the sticks, Bishnoi actually squeezed that well, but hit it straight to backward point. The fielding show should lift SKY after the run-out today. batsman c Suryakumar Yadav b bowler 1(5)
FOUR, sliced with one hand, full and outside off stump, pace off, so batsman was deceived but he went through with the loft, clears short third man
SIX, in the airrr and just over Pollard at long-off. bowler went full and outside off stump, batsman toe-ended the loft, Pollard jumped on the boundary but it evaded him
FOUR, short delivery, batsman backs away and guides, gets it fine and over the keeper
FOUR, proper batting from a proper batsman. Short of length outside off, batsman waits long enough on it as he steers the ball fine to beat Hardik at deep backward point

out Bowled!! Castled! Massive breakthrough as bowler goes right through a dangerous batsman. Pitched right up, finds movement off the seam as it comes in off the deck. batsman hadn't bargained for it. He threw his hands on the drive without any footwork. It's a shot you play on a flat pitch. This, however, has something in it. Bowls him through the gate. batsman b bowler 25(18) [4s-3]

out Bowled!! batsman chops on! He attempts to cut this ball away from close to off stump but never has enough room to do so, despite his effort of stepping into the leg-side. The length isn't all that short either. Been up and down the order in this tournament, and this duck will only add to the pressure. batsman b bowler 0(3)
SIX, this is why Krunal was afraid to get anything close to him. The slog-sweep has gone miles. batsman shuffles across, fetches it from a length outside off and finishes it
FOUR, wide yorker outside off, runs away for four off the outside edge. One of the pitfalls with Krunal firing them in. No chance for short third man

out Bowled!! batsman steps across to paddle sweep and is bowled behind his legs. Oh what a massive wicket. Just went too far and then missed it, getting done by the pace at which this skidded through. Probably only clips the leg bail, but that's all it had to do. Mumbai in control now. batsman b bowler 17(19) [4s-1]
FOUR, what a response. Flays this through backward point. And it's not all that short either. But the width is there from bowler and batsman jumps all over it

out Bowled!! Cleans him up, right through everything. It's that pre-covid-Starc dismissal -- which Quinton's looking to whip against the outswing. Clearly he's in no position to connect, but bowler's perfectly in position and pose in his salute. batsman b bowler 0(5)
FOUR, absolute overcook outside off. Sharma leans, drives, and creams it through the covers to help himself past 5000 IPL runs
FOUR, now the back-footed punch, typically batsman, standing on the bounce, arching behind and nailing this between point and cover
SIX, that's into the stands! A loopy delivery around middle, batsman shuffles across, goes down on his knee and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for a massive six. 84 metre maximum that!
1 run, 50-run stand up as batsman nudges the shortish delivery through mid-wicket for one. Need to up the ante now that both the batsmen have got their eye in

1 run, dropped by Bishnoi at deep mid-wicket. batsman had completely mistimed the pull shot, but the fielder running in couldn't latch onto the catch. Was a good effort to get there with a sprint, just that the end result wasn't in the fielder's favour. Was a short ball that induced a top-edge

out Caught by Nair!! batsman's struggle comes to an end. Probably, a blessing in disguise for Mumbai Indians. Time for Pollard and the Pandya brothers to take charge from here on. Was down on his knee to play the slogsweep as Kishan finds the man at deep mid-wicket. Two contrasting knocks for Kishan then. 99 the other night, and only 28 tonight. More importantly, he has used up too many deliveries in this innings. batsman c Nair b bowler 28(32) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, how easy was that for him? Stands tall and nonchalantly lofts the tossed up googly over long-on for half-a-dozen. Pressure on the young wrist spinner

SIX, got out to a half-tracker in the previous game, but not this time. Rocks back and manages to beat the fielder at deep mid-wicket by quite some distance. Wasn't in complete control of this pull, but the timing was good enough to go the distance, and it was also the shorter boundary that he targeted

FOUR, fifty for the Mumbai skipper and he gets there with a boundary. 5000 runs earlier in the day, and now a good fifty-plus innings. Premeditates this one and scoops the full toss towards the fine leg fence. Almost cleared the boundary there
FOUR, time to roll! Full toss around off and it has been creamed past the diving man at extra cover, no stopping that

SIX, yeah, that's what I was talking about! So pleasing to the eyes. Short ball around middle and leg, "batsman has more than a second to spot the length," as Kohli says. Doesn't even need to transfer his weight as he pulls it over deep square leg. 86 metres!
SIX, such a talent! Goes inside out, plays with the field and lofts the pitched up delivery over deep extra cover. Raining sixes in Abu Dhabi!

out Caught by Neesham!! Tag-team effort by Maxwell and Neesham has helped Punjab get rid of the Hitman. Maxwell did all the hard work there, but Neesham makes sure that his effort isn't in vain. Was lofted towards long-off by batsman as Maxy grabbed it and just when he was about to overhaul the boundary, he parried it to Neesham who was charging across from long-on. bowler has been the strike bowler for Punjab this season, and here's why. batsman c Neesham b bowler 70(45) [4s-8 6s-3]

no run, batsman reviews! He was adjudged lbw here by the umpire, but he has straight away signaled for a review. Think there was some bat on it, as I look at the replays. Was a low full toss on leg that batsman failed to middle. Luckily for him there was some bat on it. So the onfield decision has to be overturned. The original decision was out, hence although he got some bat on it, it will be called as a dead ball

SIX, stand and deliver! Short of a length delivery around off, batsman reads the length early and lofts it over the leaping Maxwell at long-on. He can attack right from the word 'go', hence he's so crucial towards these later stages
FOUR, no stopping that! Backs away, manufactures room and whacks the shortish delivery at he manages to beat the fielder at deep extra cover this time around

FOUR, Punjab leaking runs towards the closing stages. Their bowlers are running out of ideas. This was slightly wide outside off and batsman slams it through deep extra cover for another scintillating boundary. bowler stands there in disbelief
FOUR, a short and wide ball with third man inside the ring? batsman is not going to miss out on those as he plays an upper cut and finds the fence at square third man

FOUR, that's an edge, but it won't matter. Was a really full ball around off, seaming away from batsman who goes at it with hard hands. As the ball shapes away from him, it takes an outside edge and runs past the man at short third man
FOUR, slammed! Goes deep in his crease and pulls the short ball to the deep mid-wicket fence with that meaty swing of his
FOUR, 19 runs off the 19th over. A full toss to end the over as batsman flicks it over square leg. The fielder was inside the ring, hence Polly will get four more
SIX, the last ball he smacked back to the bowler, but this one he has smacked out of the park. Right into the slot around middle as batsman smokes it over deep mid-wicket. High and handsome!
SIX, the carnage continues! Pitched up by bowler, and although it was wide - batsman manages to reach for it as he tonks it right over the bowler's head, and into the sightscreen
SIX, 97 metre six! A floated delivery around middle and leg, batsman gets under it and clubs it over deep mid-wicket for six more

no run, Mumbai review this given LBW: Full, straightening back in off the pitch, and batsman's trapped on the front pad in his crease. But, but, the impact's in front of leg-stump, and ball-tracking shows it to be going down leg. False alarm, and batsman will stay there
FOUR, perfect cover drill -- big plonk in front, leaning through the line, still head, high elbows and the fullest of bat-faces in bisecting the two men out there
FOUR, and the covers again. It wasn't all that full, and Yadav's going through with what's more a punch this time, and the rest is the same (2.4)
SIX, vintage batsman finishes off the innings in style. A hat-trick of sixes for the big man as he bludgeons this one over the bowler's head. Mumbai end with 191/4

out Suryakumar Yadav Run Out!! Direct hit, and Punjab are already celebrating. Yadav clearly underestimates Shami - the short fine leg - as batsman's sweep goes to his right and decides to take his aim and his arm on with the quick single. Yea, nothing helps when it's a direct hit, not even a full stretch, and just like that, Surya finds himself run-out for the second time in these four games. Suryakumar Yadav run out (Shami) 10(7) [4s-2]
FOUR, carved over cover, which Pooran chases and appears to have pulled back at the boundary. But no, he isn't all that good, for when his fingers are on the ball, his elbow's on the rope
FOUR, jumps away, gives himself room and punches against the spin. That's not the fun part. The fun starts when this seeming push ends up splitting mid-off and extra cover. Wow
FOUR, there's no point, literally. But bowler dishes out width off a shortened length and allows Sharma to go behind and cut it square
FOUR, leg-cutter. Seams away. batsman gets squared, and edges it straight to first slip. Well, well. There's no first slip, and third man can't come around either
1 run, bodyline, swatted round the corner
FOUR, delicately cut late. Cute. Bishnoi gives it some flight, but then gets it to dip short and wide allowing Sharma a rock behind and a carve between point and short third man

FOUR, stand and deliver! A tossed up delivery by bowler, goes a touch full and batsman slams it past the bowler. bowler hardly had any time to react, but believe me, had he got his hands to it, he could've been seriously injured. It was hit so hard!

FOUR, and that shall release some pressure! bowler in his quest for the yorker, bowls a low full toss and batsman makes full use of it. Times his flick to perfection and manages to find the fence at deep square leg
SIX, here we go! batsman is down the wicket as he tonks the tossed up delivery over long-on for a 84 metre six. There was a fielder sprinting across in the deep, but this cleared him comfortably..

leg byes, 1 run, team review. It's a referral against batsman for an lbw. But I think this was sliding down the leg side, and Hyderabad will lose their review in that case.. As I look at the replays, it's pitching outside leg as well. batsman tried to whip it through the on side, but couldn't connect it..
FOUR, and this time he has managed to beat that fielder, has MSD. Was a half-tracker by bowler and the team skipper has timed his pull and placed it into the gap at deep square leg
FOUR, edged, but safe! Short of a length on leg, batsman swings across the line and gets a under-edge that dips in front of Bairstow, beats his dive and finds the fence

FOUR, 50-run stand up for the fifth wicket! bowler immediately has a change in the field. Goes short and batsman makes sure to send it away to the fence. Hooks it over the fielder at short fine leg for four more..
FOUR, that's a hat-trick of boundaries. Spears a full ball down the leg side and batsman has glanced it away to the fine leg fence. Just had to get a faint tickle, which Jaddu managed to pull off..

FOUR, dropped by Pandey! That was a tough chance, but you can expect Manish to take those. That's the standard he sets in the field. Was a full ball by Natarajan and batsman miscued his loft towards deep mid-off where he was put down. The ball was eventually parried away to the fence
SIX, fifty for batsman! Please move him up the order. A full toss on leg and the southpaw heaves it over deep square leg as he brings out a rather tired sword celebration

out Caught by Abdul Samad!! batsman departs after an enterprising knock. Gets a short ball to have a go after and he has swung it straight to Samad at deep square leg. Looked a slightly tired shot, but he has made up for that strike rate. Was struggling initially, but this innings will give him some confidence going forward. batsman c Abdul Samad b bowler 50(35) [4s-5 6s-2]
SIX, that's the first ball batsman's facing and he has struck the biggest six of the night. A short ball by Natarajan and batsman pulls it over deep square leg as it goes deep into the stands. WoW!

FOUR, "that's a terrible misfield," reckons Slater on air. batsman slogs the length ball towards deep mid-wicket where Samad charges in, takes his eyes off the ball as he tries to grab the ball, and makes complete mess of it..
SIX, so the break has helped. It has helped him regain his focus. Picks the bones out of this slower short ball and thumps it over deep mid-wicket for a flat six
FOUR, and the equation is down to 17 off 4 balls! A tossed up delivery by bowler and batsman has smashed it right past the bowler, it's four more..

out Bowled!! Chopped on - Have to say this was coming, batsman was never at home against bowler - short of a length and just outside off, a flat-footed batsman aimed at the cut, cramped for room - all he managed was a big inside edge, the ball bounced back onto the off-stump and the lightened up bails signals batsman's sorry exit. team have once again lost an early wicket in this season's tournament. batsman b bowler 1(6)

SIX, the last ball of the match has gone the distance! But, Chennai Super Kings face their third straight loss after winning the tournament opener. Gets to the pitch of the delivery does batsman and thumps it right over the bowler's head for half-a-dozen!
FOUR, batsman is up and away, low full-toss and he has whipped it past mid-wicket - the man at deep square leg has no chance - a boundary to break the shackles for team

FOUR, smashed, team need to get going and batsman will start playing his shots - came down the track and drilled this short ball wide of cover - Warner gives chase, but he was always coming second best
FOUR, cheeky and four, a pre-meditated paddle from batsman, got down low, waited on the ball and then scooped it over fine leg's head, the fielder was inside the ring and has no chance

out Bowled!! A peach and the in-form batsman has been sent packing. Lapse in concentration? Could be the case, but this was a cracker of a delivery from the Tamil Nadu pacer - hit the deck hard around leg and then seamed away sharply - batsman was completely opened up as he looked to tuck, past the closed the bat-face and the ball went on to hit the top of off-stump. A dream dismissal for any left-arm pacer. batsman b bowler 8(9) [4s-1]
FOUR, clubbed, excellent use of the feet from batsman, waited until the ball left Natarajan's hand, shimmied down the track and then lifted it back over the umpire's head for a boundary

FOUR, change of tactics from batsman - he's going to be the aggressor - came down the track, Natarajan responded by bowling short and wide - batsman uses his reach and thwacks it back over the umpire's head for another boundary

out du Plessis Run Out!! A direct hit would have definitely run du Plessis OUT, but is he still short? Great work from Bairstow as he pushed the ball at the stumps. du Plessis is definitely short, but was it the ball hitting the stumps or did Bairstow break the stumps without the ball in his hand? Actually, the ball slipped out of his hands, but think it inadvertently went on to hit the stumps. OUT is the call. That's a massive blow for the Super Kings - the in-form du Plessis has been sent packing. Never a run there and Kedar must cop the blame for it - tucked it to the right of mid-wicket and set-off for a single. Garg was quick on the ball and has a shy at the striker's end - he missed, but Bairstow was covering for the throw. The ball did slip out of his hands, but luckily for him, it fell onto the stumps. Either way, du Plessis was well short. Replays suggest that du Plessis didn't really sense the danger first-up, was a bit slow to start and by the time he realised his mistake, it was all too late. du Plessis run out (Priyam Garg/Bairstow) 22(19) [4s-4]

out Caught by Warner!! Chennai in trouble as they've lost almost half of their side. bowler strikes in his first over. Played a handy cameo a few days ago and strikes right away today. Tempts the batsman with a loopy legbreak around off and Kedar chips it straight to the team skipper at covers. Good reflexes shown by Warner as he completes the catch and isn't he delighted? batsman c Warner b bowler 3(10)

out Bowled!! Gets him with a peach of an inswinger. Full and swinging in towards middle and off, batsman looks to flick over mid-wicket and plays all around it. Gets completely beaten by the inward movement and the woodwork is all over the place.batsman b bowler 0(3)
FOUR, edged and four! Full away swinger and draws batsman into a drive away from the body, Pandey goes hard and the edge goes flying down to the third man fence
FOUR, anything pitched up and batsman is not gonna let it go scot-free. Maintains solid base and crunches the loft over mid-off, bowler's pace takes care of the rest
FOUR, lovely placement from batsman! Gives himself a bit of room and sits on one knee to pull this short ball in the gap between deep mid-wicket and deep square

out Caught by du Plessis!! Faf is making a habit of pulling off these boundary-flirting catches and he makes it look so easy. batsman is disappointed and he knew he was in trouble from the moment it left the bat. Huge wicket for team. batsman danced down the track and perhaps got a little too close to the pitch of the delivery, miscues the loft off the toe-end, it did seem like going for a maximum but there's always a risk involved when you take on a fielder like Faf. He Leaps up full length, grabs the ball on the jump and quickly realizes, he's gonna go over the ropes. What does he do then? Just maintains his composure, lobs the ball in the air before going over the ropes and collects the ball with ease on the second attempt. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 28(29) [4s-3]

out batsman Run Out!! This is disaster of the highest class. batsman flicks it to mid-wicket and calls for a quick single, Priyam Garg barely responded and batsman was left stranded mid-pitch. There was never a single there and Rayudu at mid-wicket had all the time in the world to lob the ball to Dhoni who does the rest. He looks upset, not sure if it was his call, but having played it to the right of mid-wicket, there was no single on there. batsman run out (Rayudu/Dhoni) 9(13) [4s-1]
FOUR, full and sliding down the leg-side, Abhishek uses the line to broom it fine past the keeper for an easy boundary
FOUR, nicely played - a little counter-punch from young Abhishek - bends down half-way, uses the pace on the ball and plays the reverse pull, behind square on the off-side for a boundary
SIX, lovely, RJ doesn't learn, tosses one just outside off, Abhishek gets across, plays with the angle and swings it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum
FOUR, cracking shot, too full and too wide of off from Bravo, almost a half-volley length and Abhishek can get under it on the drive - has enough power to clear mid-off and rolls away to the ropes

FOUR, lovely - Garg is making most of this opportunity to bat time - had a part in the run-out of KW, but that hasn't figured in his plan since - tad too short and he's very quick on the pull, swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it over square leg for a boundary

FOUR, beautifully played, a touch of class from Garg - overpitched and well wide of off, he leant into the drive, opened the bat-face at the last moment and sliced the drive behind square on the off-side for a boundary

SIX, this is batting of the highest quality from young Garg - full and coming back into the right-hander, from that round the wicket angle - he bends low, picks the length early and slaps it over square leg for a maximum
no ball, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Garg - this is a no-ball for height as well - high full-toss outside off, Garg makes room and lifts it over backward point for a boundary

FOUR, cute, Garg is taking Curran to the cleaners - another proper cricketing shot, back of a length and well wide of off, he waited on it, opened the bat face and ran it behind square on the off-side, third man was inside the ring and has no chance

FOUR, chance and dropped - and it's by RJ of all people - length ball outside off and Sharma swiped it over square leg. RJ ran across to his left, got there with plenty of time, got both hands and then let the ball burst through - to add insult to injury, it dribbled over the ropes

1 run, another chance and Shardul has put down a sitter - butter fingers all of a sudden from team, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Abhishek was looking to go inside out over cover - the bat-face turned on impact and he carved it over point - Shardul had plenty of time on the ball and somehow makes a mess of it
FOUR, top-edge and four, banged in short and just outside off, Garg was a tad late on the pull, the ball caught the fat top-edge and lobbed over MS for another boundary

out Caught by Dhoni!! Abhishek's fun-filled innings is over, but he has done his job. Banged in short and angling across the left-hander, the attempted slower bouncer from bowler - Abhishek was looking to nail the pull wide of mid-wicket, gets an audible edge and MS does the rest. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 31(24) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, Garg continues to ooze class - knew that Bravo would be bowling a slower ball, went right across on the paddle sweep and clears backward square leg. MS isn't looking all that impressed
1 run, Maiden IPL fifty for Garg, first of many to come? Low full-toss on the pads and it's clipped past square leg for a single
FOUR, class from batsman! Sees the outswinger pitch in the fullish zone and shows the full face of the bat to silk a gorgeous straight drive past mid-off. Too good!!
FOUR, batsman unleashing! Gets a full delivery in his zone and he clubs it straight back over the bowler's head for a delightful-looking boundary
FOUR, 136ks length ball outside off, Pandey picks it up from wide of off and swats it over Bravo at mid-on, easy pickings for the batsman
FOUR, half-volley on off-stump and batsman will not miss out. Unleashes those powerful bottom hand as he chips the loifted drive straight down the ground, straight as an arrow!!

out Caught by Sam Curran!! batsman perishes and instantly shadow-practices the execution. It was a cross-seam delivery from Shardul Thakur and the length - full - lured Pandey to go for big shot. He looks to slap-drive it over mid-off but doesn't get the timing right, skews it off the thick toe-end and offers catching practice to Curran at mid-off. batsman c Sam Curran b bowler 29(21) [4s-5]

FOUR, just needed one delivery to get his timing right and it's pure class flowing from the bat of Kane batsman! Gets into superb position as he jumps on this full ball and creams the drive sweetly past the diving left hand of cover
FOUR, a quicker one from bowler and batsman makes use of the pace to reverse slap it past the diving left hand of Watson at backward point. Got great power behind the shot did the team skipper

FOUR, lifts this over the in-field on the off-side. batsman is off the mark with a four. This should ease his nerves a bit. Too short, too wide and batsman will not let this go scot-free. Rides the bounce and makes hay

SIX, where has this gone? Monster hit from Padikkal. Remember him playing a similar kind of shot in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, he's so good with the flicks and glances. bowler bowls the inswinger onto his pads, Padikkal says thanks and decimates it a long way into the grass banks at deep square leg
FOUR, bashed over mid-wicket. The shot of a man in prime form. Not all that short from bowler, but Padikkal quickly read the length, camped back and took heavy toll of it

FOUR, deft! 108.7kph, slower ball around off, Padikkal spots it, waits for the ball and opens his bat-face at the last moment to guide it cheekily fine of the man at short third man. Third half-ton in four matches for batsman! Brilliant
FOUR, slapped over extra cover! That went like a bullet. batsman shimmies down the pitch and Parag shortens his length. There's ample width and batsman flayed it powerfully!

SIX, even better! Parag bowls a full one, right in the slot. batsman makes room by moving leg-side and lofts it handsomely over deep extra cover. Superb inside-out from the skipper. This is the batsman we know....

2 runs, 88.1kph, batsman jogs down the pitch and hammers it over the bowler's head. Tewatia got fingertips to it and the long-off fielder put in a dive to his right to save a couple of runs. tough to call it a drop! That came towards the bowler very quickly
SIX, shot! batsman is definitely finding his touch! Dances down the track to this flighted delivery, gets to the pitch of the ball and tonks it powerfully over long-on. Moves to 49!
1 run, you can't keep him silent for long! Beware, other IPL teams! Fifty for Virat batsman and he reaches there by dinking a full ball down to long-on

FOUR, 142.6kph, short ball from Archer, it was on the stumps. But, Padikkal walks away towards the leg-side which allows his free arms and plays an aerial cut shot over backward point. A one-bounce four and Padikkal made it look so easy

out Bowled!! Timber! 145.7kph, very full and attacking the sticks from round the wicket, Padikkal backs away a long way and is too late to bring his horizontal bat down. Crashes into the base of off and middle. First wicket for Archer, is it too late though? batsman b bowler 63(45) [4s-6 6s-1]

FOUR, wow! A fullish ball at 133.8kph, batsman shimmies down the pitch, converts it into a half-volley and drives it exquisitely straight of the mid-off fielder. With mid-off inside the circle, it wasn't a great idea to bowl full. batsman took full toll of it
FOUR, 124.4kph, slow, short and wide. batsman stands tall and throws his bat at it. Gets a fat top-edge that flies over the short third man fielder. Uthappa did run back and dived but to no avail

FOUR, 16 runs off the over! batsman is in a hurry to finish this match. Another slower ball, shortish in length, batsman gets behind the line by shuffling across and pulls it nicely over backward square leg

3 runs, 129kph, bowler probably saw the batter step down and shortened his length. batsman checks his lofted drive and the ball falls short of in-running-and-diving Gopal at long-off. Meanwhile, batsman runs three by the time Gopal recovers and releases the ball. Just incredible stuff...
FOUR, low full toss, batsman crouches a bit and batters it to the right of Jofra at mid-on. Runs away to the fence and team win by 8 wickets
FOUR, yes, he was right. It's indeed the googly but Gopal errs in length, getting it too short and following the batsman. batsman backed away too far but manages to hack it past square leg

out Lbw!! It's that man again - bowler, who strikes for Rajasthan. He usually does well against team and has got a wicket in his first over. Flighted just outside off - the googly which spun back in - batsman was alerted by his partner about this threat, still he went low to sweep and failed to connect. The impact was in-line and the only question was whether it was hitting the stumps. Gopal was proved right and team have lost their first wicket. batsman lbw b bowler 8(7) [4s-2]
FOUR, that's a poor delivery from Archer. Easy pickings for Padikkal. Drifts it on the pads, Padikkal moves across and just helps it fine past the man at 45

FOUR, batsman's first boundary of IPL 2020! Whodathunk.. He's been having a lean patch and Gopal offered him a freebie. A rank long hop, batsman had all the time in the world to shift his weight back and pummel it to the deep backward square leg boundary

FOUR, superb from Padikkal. Doesn't overhit this short ball, just waited for it and lifted his one leg to unleash a short-arm pull past the fielder at short fine leg. Bread and butter for him.. too leg-sidish from Curran, needs to shift his line to outside off
FOUR, brute force. Nipping away outside off, plenty of room to free his arms and Padikkal seizes.. slapping it over extra cover with enviable timing!

1 run, a proper miscue.. who wants it? Actually nobody as it falls safely at long-on. Was through the shot early, skews it up after losing his balance.. Padikkal gets away. Lady luck shining brightly on him so far

FOUR, that's clumsy from the fielder at extra cover. This should've been stopped. I guess Lomror is the culprit, Smith ain't happy. A fuller length delivery just outside off, batsman just sublimely drives it crisply and sends it to extra cover where Lomror couldn't get his body in-line and fumbles. It scurries away to the boundary
FOUR, wow! Those magical wrists of batsman coming into play. Went back upon seeing this darter on leg, just swatted it across the line through square leg and pierces the gap to perfection

2 runs, great work from Tewatia at long-off. Padikkal drilled it powerfully along the ground, it was racing away quickly and Tewatia bolted to his right and keeps the ball in play. Two to Padikkal and it's 50-partnership between these two
FOUR, loose ball and batsman has put it away. On the pads, shortish and batsman walks down to tuck it away easily wide of short fine leg who was a bit off the mark too. VK isn't amused with that

FOUR, this is poor from bowler. He's getting the slow nature of the deck to assist him but instead of bowling tigher, feeds a boundary ball. Fed on the pads with fine leg up, batsman isn't missing out. Shuffles across and glances it wide of that fielder in the ring

FOUR, third boundary of the innings and all have been to the same area - fine leg. Quicker one from Sundar, probably put off a bit by batsman's initial walk down the pitch and it's fed on the pads. Swept away past short fine leg

out Caught by Udana!! batsman looks to go big against bowler and he has found the man at long-off. Was a loopy legbreak around off and Robbie miscues it completely in his quest to clear the fence. Udana takes a comfortable catch in the deep and bowler has just bagged his second wicket of the match. Sunrisers were in a similar situation yesterday. 70/4 when two youngsters braved them out of trouble. batsman c Udana b bowler 17(22) [4s-1]

FOUR, finally connects one! A tossed up delivery on middle and leg, batsman waits for it to arrive and powers is past bowler. Straight as an arrow as this one races away to the fence in double quick time..
SIX, this one's got the height.. and the distance! Enormous! batsman gets to the pitch of the ball and smokes it over long-on for a massive six. Was in the air for an eternity
1 run, full toss outside off and it has been driven through covers by batsman for one

out Caught by Finch!! The experience of bowler overcomes Parag. He looks to slap the short ball, but fails to get the distance. Mistimed to long-on where Finch moves forward and reverse cups it. Right then, time for the miracle man - Tewatia to come in and take charge. Do we have another Tewatia special on the cards? batsman c Finch b bowler 16(18) [4s-1]
SIX, this is proving to be an enterprising knock by batsman! bowler at its receiving end once again, as the southpaw goes down on his knee and swings it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! bowler brings an end to batsman's stay! Keeps this one slightly wide outside off and the batsman has to reach out for it. Throws his hands at it, as the ball is miscued towards long-off where Padikkal isn't going to miss out. He'll be disappointed that he couldn't get a fifty. Right then, it's Jofra time.. batsman c Devdutt Padikkal b bowler 47(39) [4s-1 6s-3]
SIX, that's the confidence he's carrying! On the pads and batsman helps it over the deep square leg fence. How nonchalant did he make that swipe look like?
FOUR, french-cut by batsman as he swings hard and gets an inside edge on the full toss. The fielder at fine leg was inside the ring, hence this was an easy boundary
SIX, that's Archer-ed! A slower delivery by bowler, on the shorter side and Jofra bludgeons his pull over deep mid-wicket for a flat six. All about power!

no run, chance of a run-out, but bowler has made a mess of it. Tewatia was almost at the striker's end when Archer asked him to go back. But, bowler couldn't get rid of the ball quickly. Had he gone for a direct-hit at the bowler's end, Tewatia could have been in trouble. The throw wasn't an impressive one, as he parried it away towards the fielder who was charging in from mid-off. Was delivered on the pads as batsman failed to connect his flick

SIX, and the free-hit is out of the park! The reply couldn't have been a better one. Length delivery by bowler and batsman swings it over deep square leg for a monster hit. Once again, team are proving to be expensive in their death overs

SIX, dealing in sixes is Tewatia. Rahul - it's in the name! A full toss around off, batsman shuffles across and swipes it towards deep square leg as he manages to beat the fielder's leap near the boundary

SIX, that's a batsman special! Wow! Slower ball, on a shorter length and not many can generate such power by standing in the crease. Waited that bit longer and unleashed his short-arm jab. Minimum fuss, maximum result

FOUR, can't bowl short to batsman at this pace, bowler! Gonna get punished for sure. This is a harmless half-tracker on leg stump, batsman sits back and pulls this away through mid-wicket. Didn't middle it all that well, still got it to the fence

out Bowled!! Chopped on! batsman is livid with himself. It was there to be hit, short and wide but the slowness of the deck, and the lack of bounce does him in. bowler had offered no pace and so, batsman's attempted cut stroke results in a big inside edge that disturbs the furniture. bowler is elated, his slower ball menu has finally found success. batsman b bowler 5(5) [4s-1]
FOUR, how is that for a start? Gentle half-volley from bowler alright but look at that execution from batsman. Just leans into the drive and caresses the drive wide of mid-off. Class!

out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! What a way to start your spell! This is a massive strike first-ball by Saini. The dangerous batsman is out of here. The umpires wanted to refer it upstairs for a bump ball but Jos was already walking. He knew it was a fair dismissal. Raw pace probably did him in here, very full and outside off, batsman tried to squeeze the drive but could only get a thick edge. Padikkal was placed at a wide slip, perhaps strategically and it's straight at him. Sharp low catch and team are absolutely pumped. Dream start for them. batsman c Devdutt Padikkal b bowler 22(12) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Caught&Bowled!! And he strikes first-ball! What a catch from bowler! They're checking for a clean catch. Soft signal is OUT. Seemed alright in real time. Okay, the replays are quite confusing. It does seem like a bit of his fingers are under the ball, but also a portion of it seems to be touching the ground. The third umpire isn't sure but he feels there isn't enough evidence to overturn the onfield call. So, batsman has to walk. Huge, huge wicket this. Was doled out full by bowler and batsman moved leg-side to drive through the covers. Got it off the inside part of the bat and the ball was travelling to the right of the bowler. bowler stuck his right hand to pouch it. A very fine reflex attempt. team in disarray here. batsman c and b bowler 4(3) [4s-1]

FOUR, brilliant effort by Gurkeerat at long-on! Raced across to his left and dived full-length but couldn't do much. Seemed like a mishit from batsman initially, went hard on the halfvolley from bowler but did well to go dead straight down the ground. One bounce into the ad hoardings
1 run, fuller and on the pads, batsman flicks it away towards deep square leg

SIX, huge blow! This boy is known to hit the ball long and hard, and this is a sample of that. Slot ball from bowler, leg break and batsman gets down on his knee to slog sweep this over deep mid-wicket. Clean strike and a much-needed blow for team

FOUR, this is great awareness from batsman. Saw mid-off was up and wanted to get this past the fielder. Backed away for the flat-batted stroke and although he didn't get a big chunk of this, still had enough to beat the diving fielder in the circle

FOUR, full pitched at the stumps, Shaw - with his high backlift - punches it sweetly over mid-on. With his flourish as it is, if the timing is good, he doesn't need to worry about clearing the infield
FOUR, short ball angling across, batsman cuts from underneath it and gets it over short third man

SIX, fifty for Shaw. Second of the season for him. He shakes hands with his skipper at the other end and then raises his bat to the dugout. Slower that is dragged back, Shaw backed away and though he had to reach for the flat-batted hit, he manages to clear the long-on boundary
SIX, second six of the over. He bowled a similar delivery to Iyer early in the over and got away with it but not this time, the flick is uppish and the ball sails over the backward square leg fence
1 run, patted in front of backward point and the pair cross over. The 50-partnership comes up between these two
FOUR, edged and four. Flighted outside off, Shaw drives and the ball flies off the outside edge, runs away fine and Rana had no chance catching up with it

FOUR, and a boundary to finish.. bowler does not want to pitch it on a length, so he errs on the shorter side, Iyer is waiting for it and flays the cut behind square - bisecting backward point and short third man

SIX, small margins for error. Nagarkoti fails to nail the yorker, it is a juicy knee high full toss and though Shaw does not middle his pick up shot, half a decent connection on this ground is enough to take it all the way. Mavi could only watch it go over him near deep mid-wicket

out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Nagarkoti has his man. He has gone for quite a few but this should give him some relief.
