wide, another wide, tries to keep it out of the southpaw's range and sprays it too far outside off, batsman has no chance of reaching that
FOUR, Cummins was straighter at mid-off but batsman still manage to beat him. Full delivery outside off, batsman swings through the line past Iyer and Cummins had no chance of getting across

FOUR, oh no! Cummins has made a mess of it. Meanwhile, Iyer reaches his fastest IPL fifty. He has to bat through and ensure his side get the total they need. Full delivery on middle and leg, Iyer flicks it uppishly to wide long-on, the ball lands just in front of Cummins and he ends up overrunning the ball.
FOUR, smashed! 141.2kph short of length delivery outside off, batsman sets himself up nicely and slaps it hard over extra cover, goes flat and almost all the way

FOUR, not sure he intended that to go there but he won't mind it. Full delivery around off, batsman aims to drive it through extra cover, but the bat face turns and the ball ends up in front of square on the leg-side - splitting deep mid-wicket and long-on

SIX, these small boundaries, I tell you. This was a miscue, right off the cue-end but the ball just clears the rope. A low full toss and Iyer didn't get it off the meat, but enough to clear cow corner

FOUR, oh no! Even good deliveries are going for runs. Sloppy bit of work from Narine. bowler nails it in the blockhole, Iyer shuffles across and gets his bat down in the nick of time, squeezes it to short fine and Narine ends up diving over the ball. bowler is not impressed with the effort

FOUR, hammered! He is putting on a show here. Keeps moving around in the crease, makes room as the ball is delivered and drives it with his weight on the back leg, pierces the gap between extra cover and mid-off
SIX, that's outta here. Length delivery at this venue goes only one way - onto the roads. This was right in the swinging arc for batsman and he doesn't miss out, deposits it over deep mid-wicket
FOUR, that's poor planning. He goes short with square leg and fine leg inside the ring, even the mistimed pull from batsman races away to the fence

FOUR, batsman looks at the base of his bat. He knows that it didn't come off the middle. Full toss outside off and batsman swings it away in front of square on the leg-side, wide of the long-on fielder

out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Better from bowler. More the area he needs to bowl. This is right up there, near to yorker length, batsman goes deep in the crease and plays the helicopter, but doesn't get enough to clear long-on, Mavi does not have to move much as he takes a simple chance. A perfect cameo from batsman but he would have wanted to bat a bit longer. batsman c Shivam Mavi b bowler 38(17) [4s-5 6s-1]

FOUR, first ball has disappeared to the fence. He dragged the length back and Iyer waited for it on the backfoot, muscles the pull in front of square on the leg-side - right between deep mid-wicket and long-on
SIX, 12 off 3 balls. This delivery had width on it and Iyer picks his spot - deep extra cover, extends his arms and launches it with a clean bat swing over the rope

SIX, 20 off the over. So the move didn't work. This flighted delivery lands right in the arc, Iyer clears his front leg to get a golf-like swing and he smashes it over deep mid-wicket. Can he get a hundred?

out Caught by Chakravarthy!! batsman cannot believe it. He moved across his stumps and reaches out for a slow delivery way down leg, the cue-end balloons towards short fine and Chakravarthy takes a dolly. It would have been a wide had he let go but at this stage batsmen want to put bat on ball all the time. batsman c Chakravarthy b bowler 1(3)
SIX, high and long. Right into the team dugout. bowler misses the yorker and it is a full delivery, batsman doesn't get hold of the loft but you don't need much to clear the fences here

no run, this is excellent stuff from bowler. Another short ball that is banged into the surface, he slants it across the left hander and batsman cannot connect with the pull, the ball flies under his bat
FOUR, bowler hits 151kph as he pounds it in on short of length, and is pulled over midwicket. Shaw didn't quite get hold of it though. Definitely a little rushed for pace. But enough meat on it
SIX, now this has been crunched. Short of length into the body, 147kph, Shaw treats it with contempt as he pulls over midwicket. Skimmer!
FOUR, batsman barely has a followthrough on this cover-drive, but the timing is sublime. Smears it over cover. bowler went too full there
SIX, collects a six as he gently sweeps over square leg. Nicely on a length from bowler, batsman meets it with good timing
SIX, six more with the sweep. Went a touch harder there, but once again the length is perfect for the shot. It goes further. Goes over the roof
1 run, fires this short outside off, it spins back in slightly and batsman mistimes the cut wide of cover
FOUR, Shaw seems like he's picking him. Or maybe it's just premeditated. Backs away to a length ball, it turns away from him and he cuts through cover

out Caught by Morgan!! Has struck a couple of sixes with his sweep shot. This one though goes straight up off the top-edge. It was the one that turned away from batsman and got him closer to the toe-end, hence the error. Morgan is underneath the skier at square leg. Swirls under it. Eventually has to put in a bit of a dive, but grabs it with both hands. batsman c Morgan b bowler 26(16) [4s-2 6s-2]

1 run, Shaw may have been struggling here. Have to confirm with the replay. But Morgan's under-arm flick running in from cover misses the mark. Would've been touch and go. It was Shaw's call anyway, so he had no one else to blame. Iyer was less sure after tapping this back of a length delivery into the off-side
SIX, makes room to a length ball and slaps this over extra cover. Oh the wonders of batting in Sharjah, hitting through the line like this
FOUR, driven hard enough to burst through Mavi's hands. Races away to the boundary. It wasn't an obvious drive-ball so to say, but it might as well be over here.
1 run, Shaw had given up at the non-striker's end. Cummins, from mid-off, misses the stumps but he has hit Shaw right on the boot. He looks in some pain, but is back up quickly
SIX, Iyer's been made to fetch this from outside off. He does so and swipes over midwicket. Just clears the boundary with this 75-metre hit
byes, FOUR, 138.7kph, sharp bumper first up, batsman is beaten - courtesy pacy and bounce. He is in no control to pull and misses it comfortably. Fies over the keeper's leap too

out Bowled!! Knocked him over! bowler is pumped up. Another failure for batsman. 147.6kph, batsman is expecting a short ball, the bowler smartly bowls a length ball. The left-handed batter backs away in an attempt to hoick across the line. Too quick for him though. Gets beaten on the inside edge and the ball hits the top of leg. batsman b bowler 3(5)
1 run, 149.6kph! Very full ball, Gill jams it out towards mid-off and sets off for a tight single. Iyer misses the target at the bowler's end. A direct hit would have been curtains for Gill
2 runs, 120.3kph, off-lined yorker. Whipped round the corner, pinches the second, and team pinch a 100 ..
FOUR, slow, short, sitting up outside off. Rana finally finds a gap, rocking behind and slaps it backward of point
1 run, slow, just outside off, and angling away. A quiet, neat run down to third man -- and fifty
SIX, more in the slot, more of the obvious slower ones. Rana can line it up, swing, and hoick downtown

out Caught by (sub)Axar!! It's not that Rana had much of a choice apart from hopeful bat-swings. But Patel had this shorter, slower, hence ruining the timing on Rana's attempted heave over mid-wicket. The miscue is a top-edge, and the Patel-unity will do it by the boundary. batsman c (sub)Axar b bowler 58(35) [4s-4 6s-4]

out Caught by Dhawan!! And the game's killed. Go on, shake your sanitized hands and move on with life. Patel digs in a short-quick one, hurrying batsman into his pull for a top-edge that balloons and dips in front of mid-on. Fhawan's there, diving into it, and thigh-slapping. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 6(8)
FOUR, genuinely squared up outside edge -- but batsman manages to keep some control and drop his wrists to guide it past the keeper

out Caught by Harshal Patel!! Top-edged splice. 151ks, back of a length, outside off and batsman attempted carve over point ends up at third man, where Harshal does rather well to get low and under. batsman c Harshal Patel b bowler 5(4) [4s-1]
SIX, brutal, murderous. And it's the first ball that he's faced -- swivelling, pulling, tonking flat over deep square leg
FOUR, there's no long-off, and bowler dishes out a full toss, aka, juicy freebie, deservedly sliced over mid-off
SIX, slogged, and bursting straight through a jumping Rahane at deep mid-wicket -- for batsman's 301st T20 six. Anyway, it's helped the equation come under three runs per ball
1 run, 140kph, sharper bouncer, following the backing away for another adjusted hook to fine leg
SIX, 116.1kph, bang in the slot, bang-er in the arc, and BANG. Tripathi's already one-kneed, smoking this over cow corner's roof
SIX, slow full toss .. Tripathi's once again gone one-kneed and is slogging this flatter, cow corner
FOUR, one-handed, outside-edge, and third man's inside the ring to be causing problems. bowler goes full and wide outside off, but Tripathi throws his bat out, ah, well ..
SIX, certified opener to certified finisher -- Rahul Tripathi's making the Cummins promotion look really silly. Another wide full toss and his one'kneed adventures get it sliced over extra cover
SIX, 139kph, bouncer, nah, never mind. batsman stands with an opened up stance, whacks a pull, and gets it high, almighty outside the stadium, via fine leg
SIX, more fun. MORE FUN. A 121kph slower cutter on a length. It's a sin, it's a cardinal sin. batsman stands like he does, crouched, under it, and slogs over deep square leg

SIX, batsman's half a Yuvraj, 3/5th a Tewatia. Another full toss, and batsman - as if for fun - just swipes and smashes a hoarding on the square leg boundarys roof. Right, just to make sense: with an asking rate of 18-an-over, batsman's done it n half the time

no run, Tripathi reviews a caught behind: It's a nasty bouncer, head-high, over the pull and with a clear sound as it goes through to the keeper. It's the sound of the ball brushing the helmet. Okay, Tripathi will survive ..
FOUR, another yorker goes wrong -- this one the other way in the form of a half volley that Tripathi hammers downtown, with mid-off in the circle. This is a joke, an unfunny joke
1 run, back of a length, sensibly. Tripathi slaps, and finds sweeper

out Caught by Hetmyer!! Brave delivery this -- back of a length, into the body and batsman in fact swipes it rather well. But no, it's flat and straight to a waiting backward square leg. The trick was that this one skidded along more than normal, getting batsman crouched more than normal. Okay, now, surely game over? No? Okay. batsman c Hetmyer b bowler 44(18) [4s-1 6s-5]
FOUR, over point. Tripathi's one-kneed, staying under the low full toss and nailing it over. Now, now
out Bowled!! Yorker. Timber. bowler finally gets it right, dipping under Tripathi's yet-another one-kneed-hoick and sneaking further to clean him up. batsman b bowler 36(16) [4s-3 6s-3]
SIX, batsman greets bowler with a maximum! That's gone outta here. Flat, non-turner on a length, Rana gets down on one knee and nails the slog sweep to send it over deep square leg. New ball please!
SIX, 15 runs off the over! In-drifter, but the length is tad too full. Ends up bowling it in the slot, Rana gets under it and swings his willow hard to dispatch it over long-on
FOUR, 145kph, full and outside off, Gill lifts it over mid-off. Used the bowler's pace to his advantage. A couple of bounces and into the fence. Good start to the over for team
SIX, that's a nice shot! Banged in short, head-high bumper at 140.4kph, Gill picks the length early, stands tall and pulls it away with aplomb over deep square leg for a 68m six!
FOUR, authoritative shot! Short ball, not much venom, Gill stands tall and pulls it through backward square leg. The man in the deep didn't have much distance to cover, but the ball bulleted away
FOUR, fuller ball outside off, Rana clears his front leg for a big hoick, gets a fat outside edge that goes fine of short third man and runs away to the third man fence
FOUR, four more! 118.8kph, slow and full, Rana slightly looks to squeeze it out and gets another outside edge that beats a diving Pant to his left
1 run, full on leg, flicked away to long leg

no run, dropped! It was a return catch and bowler has spilt it. Flighted around off, Rana leans forward and closes the bat face to work it into the leg-side, the leading edge pops to the right of the bowler, bowler dives across and gets both hands, but the ball does not stick. He has also hurt his finger in the process..
FOUR, 93.7kph, quick, short and wide. batsman takes heavy toll of it. Treks back in his crease and uses the bowler's pace and width to his advantage, Cut fiercely square of the wicket on the off-side

out Caught by Pant!! Amit bowler breaks the 64-run stand. He conceded just 2 runs in his opening over, should have scalped Nitish Rana too. Nevertheless, he has nipped out Gill. A floaty leg-break, spins away a bit, Gill gets down to slog-sweep and only manages a top edge. Went a long way up in the air and Pant moves towards the square leg region to pouch it. batsman c Pant b bowler 28(22) [4s-2 6s-1]

SIX, and, batsman takes full toll of the free-hit. bowler overpitches one, it's right in Rana's arc. The left-hander clears his front leg, bends his back leg and bludgeons it straight down the ground for a 81m six!

FOUR, 125.1kph, bowler resorts to a slower ball from a shortened length. batsman clears his front leg and swings his bat hard to hammer it over vacant straight mid-on. One bounce and into the fence. The long-on fielder didn't even bother to move

SIX, smacked! bowler misses his yorker by a couple of inches - ends up bowling a half-volley. batsman moves leg-side, clears his left leg and hoists it over the bowler's head. Bent his back leg and muscled it!

out Caught by Nortje!! bowler has the last laugh! 144.6kph, dug in short, batsman wants to hit another six. Despite not being in a great position, hurriedly plays a pull shot and gets a big top edge. Nortje runs in from third man and holds onto it safely. bowler is cock-a-hoop! Big wicket for Delhi Capitals... batsman c Nortje b bowler 13(8) [4s-1 6s-1]
SIX, there's the first six of the game. Didn't take long. You cannot bowl short to batsman not on this ground, not on any ground, easy pickings as he nonchalantly pulls it over deep mid-wicket

out Caught by Bairstow!! Massive wicket for Hyderabad. Superb review from them. There was a sound but umpire Illingworth was not convinced. It was short and way outside off, close to being called a wide but batsman goes chasing after it and gets a toe-end, Bairstow does the rest behind the stumps. Replays also show a clear deviation in the path of the ball. batsman c Bairstow b bowler 6(5) [6s-1]
SIX, lovely, excellent use of the feet from batsman, comes down the pitch, gets close to the ball and then launches it back over the bowler's head, brings up his first fifty of the season

SIX, one over too many for KW - Warner had to complete the fourth over from his fifth bowler- but this is going the distance. Tad too full and well outside off, Kishan reaches out and slugs it high and wide of long-on for a maximum
FOUR, cheeky and four, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, batsman moves right across, uses the pace on the ball and paddles it fine, past the keeper and runs away to the ropes

SIX, nicely played, batsman is looking in top form now, length ball on off, he gets under this one and clubs the on-drive over mid-wicket - went flat and wide of Manish at long-on, over the ropes for a maximum

out Caught&Bowled!! A miscue from batsman, Rashid called for the catch and Rashid takes the catch - running all the way to mid-wicket. The quicker delivery from the Afghan maestro - was the wrong 'un and batsman didn't spot it, was setting himself for the pull and ended up playing against the turn. A massive top-edge and the ball was in the air for a long time. Rashid was always under the delivery, watches it keenly and takes it over his shoulder. End of a fine knowck from the team opener. batsman c and b bowler 67(39) [4s-4 6s-4]
SIX, Kishan is in some form - he will have to take over the role of the aggressor now, full and just outside off, he bends down low and pumps the slog-sweep over mid-wicket for a maximum

SIX, fingertips and Warner has parried one over the ropes. Will it prove costly for team? Was a brilliant effort, he was on the move, leapt as high as he could, but managed to only parry it over the ropes - length ball outside off and Hardik pumped it high and over long-on

FOUR, Manish hasn't had a great day in the field - fuller length delivery and well wide of off, Hardik sliced the drive wide of cover. Manish got across to his left at long-on and then went one-handed on the stop - can't stop it cleanly and the ball hit the ropes

out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Now, now - this is simply sensational from Manish. He's had a shocker by his own high standards today, but he has pulled off an absolute ripper now. Kishan will consider himself desperately unlucky here, length ball and he flat-batted the lofted drive to the right of long-on. Had enough power, but not the elevation. Manish rushed across from long-on, threw himself at the ball - was parallel to the ground when he completed the two-handed catch and then had the sense to make sure that it didn't pop out when his elbow hit the ground. batsman c Manish Pandey b bowler 31(23) [4s-1 6s-2]
SIX, clubbed, fraction too short from Natarajan, angling across the right-hander, Pandya stays back and pummels the pull over mid-wicket for a maximum

SIX, even mishits can fly on this ground - Sandeep misses his yorker, offers a full-toss on the pads, batsman didn't get hold of the shovel, but the short boundaries takes care as the ball sails over the ropes. 100th six in Sharjah this IPL

SIX, just over Rashid at backward square leg, low full-toss on the pads and batsman whipped it over backward square leg - Rashid got across and was trying to drag the ball back into play with his right hand, can't do so though

no run, a loud shout for LBW and team will review. The angle means this ball must have pitched outside leg. Think so, can see all the three stumps, no bat for sure and UltraEdge confirms it. But it has pitched marginally outside leg and team lose their review. Good delivery to complete the spell, the slower dipping yorker from round the wicket, Hardik was looking to shovel it over the leg-side and is done by the late dip, struck low and in front of the leg-stump

SIX, thumped, low full-toss wide of off, batsman reached out and got it pretty low off the bat - but the short boundaries meant that the fielder in the deep at long-off could only watch it sail over his head
FOUR, nicely played, Natarajan missed his yorker by an inch, but that's enough for Hardik - opens the face of the bat and slices the drive over backward point for a boundary

out Bowled!! The perfect yorker, this time by Siddarth and he has Hardik's stumps in a mess. Came from round the wicket - fired it very full and at the stumps, Hardik was opening himself on the helicopter shot, missed and the ball pinged the leg-stump, off his back-pad. If it hadn't hit the stumps, he would have been OUT plumb LBW. batsman b bowler 28(19) [4s-2 6s-2]
SIX, smashed, change of pace and Krunal spotted it early, threw everything he had on the slog, gets enough to clear the fielder at long-on by a distance
FOUR, Krunal is finishing in some style - low full-toss at the stumps, he gets under it and drilled it back past the bowler, the fielder at long-on has no chance
FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries, low full-toss outside off, Krunal stayed deep inside the crease and scythed the drive wide of extra-cover. no wonder, he looks absolutely chuffed
FOUR, poor start from Kaul. First ball and he sprays it down leg, batsman does not miss out, he clips it backward of square leg and the ball races across the turf
FOUR, there is still a bit of movement. Outswinger outside off and Yadav plays it with the swing, lifts it over the infield on the off-side and almost collects half a dozen, just bounced inside
FOUR, fabulous shot! Kaul is going for plenty here. Should Warner have persisted with Sandeep? This was a back of a length delivery, Yadav stands tall and punches it elegantly through extra cover
FOUR, fourth boundary of the over. Kaul is all over the place. He overcorrects the length and offers a half volley, Yadav drives it straight of mid-on and the timing takes care of the rest

SIX, a four-ball unbeaten 20 for Krunal and he has lifted team to 208, length ball at the stumps - Krunal gets under it and sends it high and over long-on. Warner can only watch it sail into the stands. Krunal is absolutely thrilled as he walks back
FOUR, Yadav is dealing in boundaries at the moment. All his runs have come in fours. Swinging down leg, Yadav flicks it backward of square and beats the fielder in the deep comfortably
FOUR, no timing on that but it still beats the fielder to the fence. Full delivery and batsman tries to force it straight down the ground, gets it off the inner half and the ball races past mid-on
FOUR, Kaul is having a horror time. This is the fifth boundary he has conceded in seven balls. A full toss just below the waist, Yadav helps it along the way past short fine

FOUR, make that six fours in ten balls. He is just feeding it right in the slot. Overpitched delivery outside off, Yadav decides to go up and over, lofts it over extra cover with the full face of the bat

out Caught by T Natarajan!! Horrible cricket from both Kaul and Yadav. This was another rubbish delivery from Kaul. Full and spraying down leg, like Rohit, Yadav goes chasing it and flicks it straight to Natarajan at short fine leg. He could have let it through and collected a wide, he could have hit it along the ground but instead Yadav picked out the fielder. batsman c T Natarajan b bowler 27(18) [4s-6]
2 runs, flighted on the stumps, batsman works it square on the leg-side and scampers back for the second

SIX, oh no! Pandey has parried it over the rope. Is this the luck batsman needed to get going? This was not all that short and hence batsman could not get the elevation on the pull, hit it flat towards long-on where Pandey moves to his left and allows the ball to burst through his fingers. Tough chance but you expect it to be taken

FOUR, "catch it" shouted Bairstow but it was nowhere close to the fielder. The wrong 'un is leg-lined, Kishan goes down on his knee and nails the sweep over the square leg umpire, no chance for the long leg

SIX, this was right in the slot and batsman ensures it is dispatched. Flighted outside off, batsman had the width to free his arms and he smacks it straight down the ground, clearing the sightscreen comfortably
FOUR, batsman is finally getting into his groove. This was fraction short and he was quick to pick the length, rocks back and pulls it in front of square - bisecting long-on and deep mid-wicket
SIX, what a way to get off the mark! Wide half-volley and at Sharjah of all places, that's gotta go. batsman reaches out and lofts it cleanly over long-off. It's gone for a mammoth six
FOUR, absolutely smashed! batsman premeditates the length and charges down the track, holds his shape and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Total nonchalance

FOUR, bowler is losing his radar a bit here and probably, confused with his lengths too. Goes very full but it's on the pads, batsman gets a tickle on it. More of the inside half and it beats de Kock down the leg-side

SIX, round-arm ball from round the wicket, a length ball outside off at 93.5kph, batsman swings his bat hard and deposits it over long-on. Got it off the bottom of bat, but all those won't matter at this ground
FOUR, Pandya goes for the yorker, misses his length by an inch or two and batsman takes heavy toll of it. The skipper gets under it and lofts it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four

1 run, 146.2kph, bowler tries to bowl a yorker and ends up bowling a low full toss. batsman push-drives down the pitch and the mid-off fielder dives to his left to stop it. The single also brings up batsman's fifty! Can he take his team over the winning line. Just 6 runs came off the over - team were happy to take the singles against bowler

out Caught by de Kock!! bowler has deceived the NZ captain with a slower delivery. Off-speed, on a shortish length and just outside off. batsman arched his back to play a late-upper-cut. He was through with his shot and only managed a faint outside nick. Simple catch for the 'keeper. batsman tried to pull his bat in, but it was too late. batsman c de Kock b bowler 3(5)
FOUR, 110.8kph, slow, short and wide. batsman backs away and slaps it fiercely over extra cover. Couple of bounces and into the fence. Still a good over for Mumbai as they managed to nip out KW

1 run, just 7 runs off the over. Overpitched delivery at 121.5kph, Garg gets under it and absolutely smashes it. bowler is brave to stick his right hand out - over his head - and parry it towards the mid-wicket region. Too harsh to call it a drop...

out Caught by Rahul Chahar!! Full toss and out! Garg shapes up to slog-sweep, gets the timing wrong - courtesy top edge - and Chahar has pulled off a brilliant catch at deep square leg. The leggie moved to his left, and reverse-cupped it. He was very close to the boundary rope and tumbled to complete the catch. Did he touch the boundary rope while tumbling and getting up? The TV umpire has been summoned and he rules it rightly in the favour of the fielding team. batsman c Rahul Chahar b bowler 8(7)

out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! bowler has his man! It's the slower ball off the back of the hand, wide outside off at 110.8kph, batsman chases it for a cut and gets a thick top edge. Kishan dives to his right at short third man and completes the formalities. The fielder is pumped up, I'm sure the entire team set-up is. batsman c Ishan Kishan b bowler 60(44) [4s-5 6s-2]

SIX, this lad is known to hit massive sixes. 143.2kph, bowler misses the yorker, Samad stays deep in his crease, gets under it and bludgeons it over the bowler's head. The sightscreen has to bear the brunt..

FOUR, four to end the over! 142.7kph, very full and wide of off, Samad shuffles across and superbly slices it over backward point. Pattinson runs to his right in the deep, but puts in a lousy effort to stop that. bowler wears a cheeky smile on his face, sure he didn't like it
SIX, 128.8kph, slower ball on a shortish length, sits up nicely. Samad walks across, waits for the ball and pummels it over deep backward square leg with a pull shot

out Caught by Rohit!! 146.8kph, bowler goes full, the line is around off, Samad wants to slog across the line. The ball pops up off the leading edge and Rohit completes the formalities in the extra cover region. batsman c Rohit b bowler 20(9) [4s-1 6s-2]

out Bowled!! The middle-stump has been uprooted! Goes for the yorker, bowls a low full toss at 141.4kph, batsman moves across to scoop and doesn't connect. Hears the death rattle! batsman b bowler 10(13)
SIX, the first bad ball of the over and batsman says 'Thank you very much!'! Dropped short by Krunal and it's launched over deep mid-wicket. Easy peasy for JB

out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Superb bowling! Slower bouncer from bowler, kept it wide outside off and that meant batsman had to really fetch it on the pull. He is clearly foxed by the variation, and one hand coming off during the shot execution doesn't help either. Straight down the throat of deep square leg. Brilliant cricket from team. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 25(15) [4s-2 6s-2]
FOUR, he's getting into the act straightaway. Perhaps a slower ball again from bowler, this is fuller though and Pandey waits for it, before dispatching it straight down the ground
FOUR, probably another slower ball but this is a fraction short and sits up for Pandey who pulls this over mid-wicket. Picks his spot and gets a boundary

FOUR, first time that batsman has tried to time the ball and he gets rewarded instantly. Short and angling across him, he just uses bowler's pace to steer it between short third man and backward point

FOUR, and again! Much better from batsman, not so from bowler. Short again and allows the left-hander to free his arms. Punches this on the up and splits the gap at cover. This should get the team skipper going

FOUR, how about that for timing? Geez! A fairly good delivery from bowler, angles this on a good length and Pandey just pushes it with a straight bat past the bowler. Just a gentle-looking push but it speeds across the turf to the fence in no time. Wow!! Shot of the day?

FOUR, Hardik puts down a dolly! The catching in this IPL hasn't been good at all. This is another instance of a superb fielder spilling an easy chance. Was short and wide, bowled cleverly by bowler and Pandey tried to upper-cut it. Doesn't get the distance and Hardik at sweeper overruns the ball. What's worse, it's gone to the fence. He has his sunglasses on so no excuse of the sun in the eyes either
SIX, didn't I tell ya? Pandey loves to murder spin, especially when it's tossed up fuller and at this ground, hitting that for six is just a formality. Clobbered over cow corner. Easy as you like
SIX, that's on the roof! Chahar isn't learning, errs on the fuller side again and it's slower too. batsman mows it over long-on for a huge hit. team sensing that this is the time to go big
2 runs, superb batting! Slower on leg stump, it's the googly and batsman called for two as soon as he wristed this through mid-wicket. Gets the right response from Manish Pandey

FOUR, this is excellent batting! Not that bad a ball from bowler, on a good length around off stump but batsman backs away early to make room. And then uses the pace to steer it between short third man and backward point

out Caught by Pollard!! There's the wicket team were looking for! Precisely why Rohit brought bowler on, and the plan has worked. Fuller and wider outside off, might have been a tad slower than bowler's usual deliveries and Pandey doesn't get the timing on the loft. Picks out Polly at long-off and he ain't dropping these, not even with this 'catching flu' that's caught the IPL. An enterprising little knock from Pandey ends but he'll be gutted to go at this point. batsman c Pollard b bowler 30(19) [4s-4 6s-1]
FOUR, 134.2kph, strays on the hips. Okay, this should help batsman, it better help batsman, with free runs off a fine leg-glance
FOUR, that's more Watto-like. A big forward plonk, leaning under the length and lofting this punch over mid-on
FOUR, strays on the hip and batsman picks it away wide of short fine leg. bowler isn't very pleased by the effort. Basically there was no effort
FOUR, oh that's vintage batsman. Reaches fifty by planting his foot down to a length ball and crashing it through extra cover. Comforting sight for the dugout
1 run, Faf follows Watson in raising his fifty. Opens the face as he pushes a full ball to third man. Continues his good form in this tournament
FOUR, overpitches outside off, batsman muscles the drive wide of long-off. Doing it in a canter
SIX, batsman's found his range tonight. Clears the front leg to a length ball and clubs it down the ground. Clean hitting
FOUR, Punjab aren't going to turn this around with these deliveries. Short at the stumps, Faf crunches the pull between long-on and midwicket
SIX, Harpreet is almost forced to bowl it closer after the call, gets into batsman's arc and gets nailed over long-on
1 run, hammered to long-on. 150 stand up. It's as if their earlier troubles didn't even exist
FOUR, spoils a good over by pitching it too full. It's a blistering drive through extra cover from batsman
FOUR, full toss outside off, Faf flays it over point. Now the highest partnership for team in IPL
FOUR, yorker outside off, runs away fine past short third man. Faf reached out to it and got it right off the toe-end. What a miserable return for bowler this is turning to be
SIX, what a ridiculous shot. Slices it one-handed over cover for six. Was a near yorker from bowler and gets creamed by batsman
FOUR, low full toss outside off, driven through extra cover. The sweeper gives up. It's a 10-wicket hammering
FOUR, it's in the slot, it's in batsman's arc, and he makes sure he plonks in front and smokes this downtown, and makes sure he makes it look seriously brutal
FOUR, overpitches. There's no one straight down in the deep, and batsman easily gets under this one to go over, typically
FOUR, there's an entirely empty deep mid-wicket, so Faf walks across his stumps and tucks this uppishly with a lot of bottom hand into that area. Just timing, checked timing
FOUR, neatly ramped. A cutter from bowler, which Faf's spotted early, shuffling big time and sitting under to scoop it over the keeper
FOUR, again, not off the middle, but he's managed enough chunk on this inside-halved-pull between mid-wicket and mid-on
FOUR, overcompensates with width this time. Now, now. Faf slices, over and wide of short third man with nobody behind

FOUR .. and team have officially arrived. 19 off this over, with a forehand smash down the ground. He made room, made sure he was on top of the the in-angling short one and muscled it wide of mid-on. It's bowler's birthday, and this is the equivalent of birthday bumps ..
FOUR, punishes the short ball and pulls hard through square leg. Motoring along is batsman
FOUR, batsman steps across and paddle-scoops this off the stumps. Long chase for Cottrell running across from long leg. Puts in a big dive but to no avail
FOUR, this won't help. This won't help Punjab at all. Swept straight to Shami at short fine leg, but he doesn't even get a hand on it. Right through the legs.
FOUR, advances down, gets beside the ball, lofts it over extra cover. Lovely batting

FOUR, almost got himself in trouble looking to pull a ball that wasn't very short. It skids through off a length, headed towards middle and leg. But batsman manages to get it off a thick under-edge, which then beats Shami at short fine
SIX, batsman has destroyed this googly. He has absolutely destroyed it. Slog-swept into the top tier. That's soul-crushing
1 run, right in the blockhole, Faf squeezes it wide of square leg. A 100-run opening stand for team. What bliss for their teammates who stand up to applaud
FOUR, there's a sweeper cover in place, but he can't do nothing about it. Full and wide outside off and batsman creams it past the fielder with impeccable timing and incredible placement

SIX, shot! batsman goes down on his knee and smokes the tossed up delivery over deep mid-wicket with a meaty slog. Such. Sweet. Timing! Maxwell does some bhangra in the dug-out to acknowledge the batsman
SIX, batsman is dealing in sixes! A short ball by bowler, batsman rocks back in the crease and pulls it over deep mid-wicket for six more. Just the momentum they were looking for!

out Caught by Rayudu!! A fine low catch by Rayudu brings an end to batsman's cameo. Slightly up outside off and batsman plays an uppish drive straight to the man stationed at cover. Looks skyward does the batsman as he's disappointed at his dismissal. Was looking for a boundary and has perished in the process. batsman c Rayudu b bowler 27(16) [6s-2]

FOUR, an edge and that has fetched him a boundary. Was a slower delivery outside off and batsman got an outside edge on his drive. The fielder at third man tried his best to stop it with a dive, but he couldn't really do it
1 run, opens the bat face and glides it down to third man for one
FOUR, slams over extra cover. Shuffles across early, which bowler sees and goes wider .. and gets carved over
SIX, another shuffle, and bowler fires it in quicker and into the body. batsman pulls, no, wait, tonks, over an empty backward square leg
SIX, finally. FINALLY. batsman goes uppish, shows intent, getting under Thakur's juicy length delivery to smoke it over long-off. Also, a fifty, and no one's keeping count anymore, there's no point
FOUR, the tap's opened. Thakur tries going wider and fuller, but batsman still finds a way to get under it and slice over extra cover
FOUR, delicate now -- lining up, opening his bat face and bisecting backward point and short third man. yep, he's officially found his gear box
SIX, 134.3kph, absolutely holds onto this heave. He's already standing with an open stance, swinging across the line, and then boom. Onto cow corner's second tier
SIX, high full toss, and whacked with disdain. batsman doesn't even bother looking up after flat-batting this into cow corner
2 runs, chopped away, under-half, and an easy second before the man in the deep can clean up

out Caught by Jadeja!! Cross-seamed one in the slot, which batsman's shaping up to smoke somewhere into the desert outside deep mid-wicket. But, but, there's something called not finding the middle, and as shocking as it might sound in this innings for batsman, this delivery was that. He gets a lot of height, but Jadeja's swirling under at the boundary, reverse-cupping a seriously good catch. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 33(17) [4s-1 6s-3]

out Caught by Dhoni!! W.W. And just like that, both set batsmen who'd laid this platform for the final assault, won't be the ones doing it, if it ever goes on to happen. A full wide delivery that batsman throws his bat out to, but doesn't get close to the line, ending up outside-edging the squeeze to a diving MSD -- who has his 100th IPL catch. Wow, quite the equivalent of 400 Test wickets. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 63(52) [4s-7 6s-1]
FOUR, okay, it's tennis now. batsman's already standing in a very-open stance, swatting this short-wide delivery like a forehand smash over mid-off
FOUR, remember 2015? Yea, it's that Sarfaraz -- sitting down, staying under the low full-paced full toss to discoop it over the keeper
FOUR, wide yorker, and really nothing wrong with this. There was a deep third man and a backward point as well. But still, Sarfaraz's found a way to angle his bat out and squeeze it extremely fine
FOUR, lovely cut! Back of a length outside off, width on offer and batsman plays a fine square cut as the ball races away through the backward point region for four runs

FOUR, batsman is riding his luck. Slightly up outside off, this one seams away from the batsman who flays at it and gets an outside edge that flies over short third man. Fleming's reaction in the balcony depicts how desperate team are for a win..

FOUR, just the kind of over Punjab needed to get going. 12 runs off it as batsman square drives the slightly full ball through point and manages to beat the sprinter in the deep. batsman knocked over Curran at the other end as his eyes were on the ball. The little guy is on the floor..
FOUR, smashed! Full length delivery outside off and Mayank absoutely belts it over covers as he finds the boundary once again. Went flat and almost cleared the boundary on the full
FOUR, batsman welcomes Thakur with a boundary. A front foot pull shot by batsman as the bowler goes slightly short. That's the kind of form these openers are in
1 run, 50-run stand up between the openers as batsman glides the short of a length delivery down to third man
FOUR, short and punished! Width on offer outside off, batsman opens the bat face and cuts it past the diving fielder at point. Can see a few Punjab flags in the stands

out Caught by Sam Curran!! bowler get batsman! The leg spinner strikes on his first ball. Was a short ball by Piyush as batsman pulled it straight to Sam Curran at deep mid-wicket. Looked a tired shot and the batsman will have to make his walk back to the pavilion. That's also a time-out.. batsman c Sam Curran b bowler 26(19) [4s-3]

FOUR, 123.7kph, harmless short of length ball. Shaw doesn't need second invitations to put it away. The right-hander stands tall, fetches it from outside off and pulls it fiercely in front of square on the leg-side. Off the mark with a boundary
FOUR, slower ball, full on leg and middle, Shaw picks it and brings his wrists into play. Flicked away through the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on. Second boundary of the over
FOUR, make that three! Poor stuff from bowler. He shortens his length and strays it on leg, wristily tucked away through backward square leg. 14 runs off the over

out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! Fantastic catch by Padikkal. Huge wicket for team as it is the in-form Delhi skipper walking back. He does fancy clearing the rope against the spinners and would have as well if he was playing in Sharjah or Abu Dhabi, but not here. Flighted around off, Iyer goes with the spin and heaves it to deep mid-wicket, Padikkal settles under it and clutches with both hands, then throws the ball up, goes outside the boundary rope and comes back in to complete the catch. Excellent awareness shown by the youngster. batsman c Devdutt Padikkal b bowler 11(13) [4s-1]

FOUR, batsman will take on bowler even with the long boundaries. Flighted outside off, batsman is down on his knee and launches the slog sweep over mid-wicket, since it is a big side of the ground, the ball bounces inside the rope
1 run, once more keeps it on middle and leg, batsman nudges it square on the leg-side
SIX, batsman does clear the boundary rope at deep mid-wicket. This a half tracker and those bulging forearms come into play, he muscles it way over the fence

FOUR, the extra deliveries cost him a boundary. 15 off the over and a much needed one for Delhi. This was also quicker but right in the slot, batsman smacks it straight down the ground for a one bounce four
SIX, woah! That's some shot from batsman. Back of a length delivery and he was so quick to pick that, transferred his weight back and bullied it for a flat six over cow corner

FOUR, batsman is on fire here. Remember he is playing against his old franchise. Length delivery and batsman swings through the line, not off the middle but goes straight and collects a one bounce four

FOUR, just over the fielder. Saini proving to be expensive today, already gone for 29 in 11 balls. He goes for the wide yorker, batsman lines up by going down on his knee, slices it over backward point and just over the fielder

1 run, dropped! How costly a miss is this going to be? They dropped Rahul around the same time and we know what happened after. This was a full toss and batsman does not get it off the middle, heaves it towards deep mid-wicket where Chahal moves to his left and lets it slip through his hands. Moeen too was running across from long-on. Did that put him off?
FOUR, dipping full delivery around off, batsman moves across, waits for the ball to arrive and then drills it hard past extra cover. No chance for the sweeper to get across and stop it
1 run, back of a length around off, batsman miscues the heave and the ball bounces just in front of long-on. The 50-run stand comes up between the duo and it has come in quick time
FOUR, batsman is picking his gaps for fun here. The full delivery isn't working for him, stays deep in the crease and manages to whip it away to deep mid-wicket, Padikkal has no chance this time

1 run, run out chance missed. team making the same mistakes they made in their loss against team. Low full toss outside off, batsman moves across and flicks it to the right of deep mid-wicket, he wanted the second and was halfway down, even given up since Pant didn't want it. But Kohli does not gather Padikkal's throw and that allows batsman to make his ground back

SIX, batsman gets into the act now. Saini is being taken to the cleaners. Slower delivery and batsman spotted it early, lined himself for the big hit and smacked it straight back over the bowler, just clearing the rope

FOUR, superb, sensible batting. Saini is all over the shop. Slower delivery down leg, batsman moves inside the line and helps it along the way past short fine, no chance for Finch or the fielder getting across from deep square leg

FOUR, miscued but it was in the gap. Slower delivery outside off, batsman is through the shot a bit early and ends up slicing it over extra cover, the ball has enough to beat a chasing Finch from long-off

no ball, SIX, oh my! Now bowler does a Saini. High full toss that almost took out batsman's head, the keeper-batsman does well to duck and swing across the line, the top-edge sails over the fine leg fence

out Bowled!! Cleaned up! bowler has his man. The partnership has been broken but the damage has been done. The slower delivery from bowler, rolled his fingers across the ball at the last second, batsman goes on his knee to play the slog sweep but is through the shot early, the ball clips the inside edge brushes his thigh and ends up on the stumps. batsman b bowler 37(25) [4s-3 6s-2]

FOUR, fifty for batsman. That's his second of the season and it has been a brutal innings. Apart from the first ball, it was a decent over from bowler. He went full and wide outside off, batsman moves across and whips it in front of square. The shot was on as fine leg and square leg were inside the ring. He raises his bat and soaks in the applause of his team mates
SIX, bowler misses the yorker but batsman doesn't miss. It was a full toss and batsman uses his power to muscle it over deep mid-wicket, cleared the fence quite comfortably there
FOUR, a gift first up from Saini and batsman gleefully accepts it. A wide, half-volley outside off at 139.9kph, batsman throws his arms and flays the drive through the covers. Sped away to the fence

SIX, that's an incredible shot from batsman! Fullish ball outside off at 143.6kph, Shaw bends his back leg and lofts it handsomely over extra cover. Came off the meat of the bat and went all the way. Mind you, it was the longer side too
FOUR, that's a freebie from bowler. A flat leggie at 89.4kph, on the shorter side too. Shaw clears his front leg and slaps it through the covers. Authoritative shot
SIX, now a biggie! bowler is brave to toss this one up, bowls it full and outside off. Shaw gets down on one leg and bludgeons it over wide long-on for a mighty six. New ball, please!
FOUR, Delhi have decided to go after team's best bowler. Leg-stump line, batsman crouches and slog-sweeps it over backward square leg for a one-bounce four

FOUR, bowler concedes his first boundary of the match. Shaw shuffles and gets low to slog-sweep. Gets a top edge against this leg-stump line ball. Flies over the keeper and runs away very fine to the fence

FOUR, that's a hit-me delivery. bowler shortens his length and there's not much pace or bounce to threaten the batter. batsman gets into a strong position and pummels the pull in front of square on the leg-side

out Caught by de Villiers!! team have the breakthrough and Kohli is pumped up. Shaw has been bounced out. A head-high bumper on leg from bowler, gets a bit big on Shaw who got inside the line to hook it away. The ball trims the glove on its way to the keeper. AB moves to his left to pouch it. End of an entertaining knock from Shaw. batsman c de Villiers b bowler 42(23) [4s-5 6s-2]

FOUR, bowler welcomes Iyer with a gift by doling out a leg-stump half-volley at 140kph. The skipper, who is in great form, gets off the mark with an easy flick off his pads through backward square leg

out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Holed out! 134.4kph, full on the stumps, batsman stands outside leg-stump and backs himself to clear the ropes. The bat turns at the point of impact and robs all the timing. It comes off the bottom part of the bat too. Moeen takes a couple of steps forward from long-on to complete the catch. batsman c Moeen Ali b bowler 32(28) [4s-3]

no run, bowler drops it! Such an easy caught and bowled chance, but KG has put it down. batsman had chipped it right back to the bowler who got his palms to it, but nothing more. Maybe, he got deceived due to the trajectory as the ball was dipping on him
FOUR, cracking shot by batsman to greet bowler. Short of a length outside off, batsman reaches out for it and slams it through the gap at cover-point for a boundary

2 runs, dropped again! What's going on? batsman gets an another life as Dhawan fails to latch onto this one at slip as he tries to reverse cup it. Went at the full ball with hard hands and got an outside edge that absolutely flew to the man in the cordon. Looks like it's his day

out Caught by Hetmyer !! It's the longest part of the boundary at cow corner, but Moeen thinks his forward-charging-hoick would do it. Nope, much like his innings, and much like team, this goes nowhere .. and that nowhere is straight down deep mid-wicket's throat. batsman c Hetmyer b bowler 11(13) [4s-1]
SIX, steps down, makes room for himself, gets it perfectly in the slot, and tonks this into long-on's first floor
FOUR, 123.8kph, just a punch. First ball, eh. High elbows, standing up on the length delivery and stroking away through the line, through the covers

out Caught by Pant!! So bowler's now got batsman thrice in seven innings -- Bunny worthy? Anyway, batsman didn't have much of a choice here. He'd realized he's got to everything left by himself, and so what if it's the Delhi's best bowler, He charges down, swipes across the line and ends up getting a thin inside-tickle through to the keeper. batsman c Pant b bowler 43(39) [4s-2 6s-1]
SIX, gets hold of this .. under the length to a fuller-than-usual delivery to smoke it over long-on against the spin
FOUR, 142kph, short, wide and Sundar uses all of it in a jumpy upper-cut, behind point, in front of third man
FOUR, 141.8kph, pitches it up in the slot .. and Sundar drills it straight down, lofting it over bowler's head

out Caught by Ashwin!! 141kph. Short. Head-lined. Sundar looks to make room. Pulls. Zero timing. Negative control. Mid-wicket inside the circle. And just like these broken sentences, team crumble further. batsman c Ashwin b bowler 17(11) [4s-3]

out Bowled!! 143kph bolt -- full, into middle-stump, and Dube's aimless swing isn't even close to connecting. Yea, sheer pace, and sheer-er accuracy, going under the bat and making a real mess of the stumps. batsman b bowler 11(12) [6s-1]

out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! WW.W. bowler's putting up a spectacle here, courtesy batsman's top-edged slice, barely clearing the infield as Iyer - the extra cover - runs backwards and takes it without fuss. batsman c Shreyas Iyer b bowler 1(3)
FOUR, very low full toss, marginally outside off. But batsman after backing away manages to stick his bat out and somehow connect to get it really fine past backward point

out Bowled!! Typically tail-ender like. batsman clearly (and smartly) keeps backing away to save getting hit and this time bowler's not taking chances. He's kept it really full, on middle, and is uprooting middle. batsman b bowler 5(4) [4s-1]
FOUR, boom. With 24 runs needed per ball, Saini's managed one-sixth, but it's a night time one-sixth. Backing away, getting under Patel's full one and swinging downtown

out Caught by Stoinis!! Ravichandran bowler gets the man in form. An off-break by bowler, that was bowled a lot slower through the air. batsman swings his bat and gets it off the cue end as Stoinis takes a comfortable catch at deep mid-wicket. The pressure of big scores, he's yet to deal with that, is batsman. Even against Punjab when team were set a big target, Padikkal failed to get going. Same is the case today. batsman c Stoinis b bowler 4(6)

FOUR, he announced his return to form in the previous game, and here's another superb shot. Gets off the mark on the first ball of the innings as he creams the floated delivery through covers with sublime timing

out Caught by Pant!! batsman has been dismissed, finally. So, the couple of dropped chances haven't cost much. This pitched outside off and spun away sharply from the batsman who tried to flirt with it and got an outside edge. Sharp reflexes by Pant as he takes it. Both team openers are back to the pavilion as the Delhi spinners are choking their opposition at the moment. batsman c Pant b bowler 13(14) [4s-1]

FOUR, easy pickings for batsman! This was speared down the leg side by bowler and the skipper flicks it past the man at short fine leg with nonchalance. 9000 runs in T20 cricket for batsman, informs Sunny G on air..

FOUR, that was in the air for a while, but just eluded the man at mid-off. This delivery was pitched up by bowler and AB played a gentle chip. Almost got deceived due to the slower one, but luckily he played it with a straight bat to get it past the fielder stationed at mid-off

no run, a direct-hit at the bowler's end and Kohli was gone! This was driven to Ashwin at mid-on by batsman and Kohli was almost halfway down the track. Ash had plenty of time to aim and go for the direct-hit at the bowler's end, but he couldn't pull it off
FOUR, short in length around off, batsman treks back in his crease and slams it over extra cover for a boundary

out Caught by Dhawan!! Royal Challengers Bangalore in trouble as AB batsman walks back. Was a length ball by bowler and the batsman completely miscued it. Tried to hoick across the line and mistimed it towards mid-wicket where Dhawan takes a comfortable catch. In the battle of two South Africans, it's the younger bloke who comes out on top. batsman c Dhawan b bowler 9(6) [4s-2]
FOUR, swept away! Down on his knee as he sweeps the loopy delivery past the man at deep square leg for four runs
1 run, darts this one outside off and batsman punches it through covers for a single
FOUR, lovely, a friendly half-volley outside off and batsman is off and running with a boundary, leans into the drive and places it straight of mid-off, the fielder didn't have a chance

FOUR, lovely, poor line and length from bowler, can't offer width with third man inside the ring - batsman waits on the ball, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and guides it behind square on the off-side for a boundary
FOUR, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Suryakumar picked it, he went down on his knee and swept it with the spin backward of square, giving no chance for the fielder in the deep
FOUR, that's another excellent shot. A inside out loft off the backfoot. This was fraction short and Suryakumar forced it over the cover fielder, he had enough power to beat the sweeper
SIX, pressure releaser for Krunal. He was not getting anything off the middle till now. Tewatia floats one up and Krunal takes it on, slog sweeps straight down the ground and collects half a dozen

out Caught by Shreyas Gopal!! Of course he can. That's Archer at his best. Exploits the weakness of Krunal and sends him packing. Short of length delivery at the ribs, Krunal is not comfortable anything around there, he gets all cramped up as he attempts the pull, it is a tame one and Gopal gobbles up the dolly at mid-wicket. batsman c Shreyas Gopal b bowler 12(17) [6s-1]

FOUR, neatly done! Fifty for Suryakumar. First of the season for him. He has looked good in the last few games but has been run-out in a couple of them. Today he has not thrown it away. Coming to the ball: Slower delivery and Suryakumar waited for it, steered it so well that he bisected Buttler and short third man
FOUR, stand and deliver! Mid-off was inside the ring. Archer offers width on the back of a length and Hardik flat-bats it straight past the fielder at mid-off
FOUR, good improvisation there from Suryakumar. Mumbai needed a boundary to make it a good over. He moves inside the line, gets under the back of a length delivery and helps it over short fine

FOUR, full toss outside off and though Hardik didn't get it off the middle, he gets it into the gap - sliced over extra cover and Gopal cannot chase it down. He immediately asks for a drier pair of gloves..
2 runs, 137.5kph right in the blockhole, Hardik jams it with a closed bat face into the mid-wicket region, the fielders are on the boundary edge allowing the second to be taken

1 run, dropped! How costly will that be? Curran has no one else to blame than himself. The slower short ball outside off, Hardik tries to flat-bat it down town but the top-edge flies straight up to the right of the bowler, Curran sets himself up and lets it slip through his hands. He took his eyes off just at the right time

SIX, superb batting. Suryakumar shuffles across, goes down on his knee and waits for the low full toss, then nonchalantly helps it over backward square. The connection was so good that the ball sailed over
FOUR, 19 off the over.. That's the big one Mumbai wanted. Curran goes for the slower back of a length stuff, Suryakumar walks across, gets inside the line and laps it over short fine leg
2 runs, free-hit and Hardik cannot take toll of it. Low full toss on middle and leg, Hardik drills it down to long-on and Suryakumar races back for the second. He was helped by a slight fumble

no ball, byes, FOUR, oh my! That must have slipped out of Archer's hand. High full toss right at Hardik's head, he does well to duck under it. The ball bounces just in front of Buttler and escapes past him. Archer immediately had his hands up apologetically

SIX, wow! That's special. We have seen this before but to do it to Archer after being hit on the head. Hats off! Full delivery just short of yorker length, Suryakumar crouches down and reverse laps it straight over Buttler, the pace of Archer ensures it goes the distance. Even Smith was impressed with that shot
FOUR, that's brilliant cricket. Suryakumar moved across early and bowler followed him with a full toss, but the batsman adjusted and scooped it over short fine, one bounce and over the ropes

SIX, once more not off the meat but the power of Hardik ensures it goes sailing over the rope. It was a freebie from bowler, juicy full toss and Hardik goes straight, clearing the boundary quite comfortably
SIX, beautifully played, tad too full and wide from bowler, batsman leans forward, gets close to the ball, extends his arms and launches it over mid-off went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

FOUR, cracking shot, bowler is proving to be expensive - back of a length and wide of off, batsman waits on it and then cuts it late, beats the sliding effort of the fielder running across to his left from deep point

FOUR, cheeky and four, change of pace from bowler, the slower ball angling across the left-hander, batsman shuffles across, gets inside the line and helps it on its way over short fine for another boundary

FOUR, a big effort from Rajpoot at fine leg, but that would have been the catch of the season had he held it - length ball down leg and batsman whipped it violently towards fine leg - The ball was travelling and Ankit ran across to his left - put in the dive, but the ball was always going away from him
SIX, massive, fraction short and batsman is quick on the pull - rocks back and pulls it high and over backward square leg, went sailing over the ropes

SIX, a high full-toss and batsman has sent is sailing into the stands - prods across and then brings his wrists into play, came at an uncomfortable height, but he was equal to the task, pulled over backward square leg for a maximum

out Caught by Buttler!! Maiden IPL wicket for Kartik - beaten for sheer pace was batsman - banged in short and at the stumps, batsman was rocking back on the pull, the ball kept getting big on him, he was in no control over the shot, gets a top-edge that spills straight up - Buttler called for the catch and holds on with ease. batsman c Buttler b bowler 23(15) [4s-3 6s-1]
1 run, back of a length and just outside off, dabbed down towards third man and Suryakumar is off the mark with a single
FOUR, nicely played, too straight from Curran, Suryakumar shuffles across, gets inside the line and picks the gap wide of mid-on with the on-drive, no need to run for those
FOUR, beautifully played, the leg-spinner from Shreyas, drifted wide of off, Suryakumar leans forward, opens the face of the bat and lifts it inside out over cover for a boundary
SIX, cracking shot, too short from Shreyas, batsman stays on the front-foot and then pummels the pull over mid-wicket, went a long way over the ropes for a maximum
FOUR, short, wide and four, a bad ball from Tyagi at 133 kmph, Suryakumar had to reach out as he steered the cut over backward point, one bounce and over the ropes

FOUR, cheeky and four, this was the shot that had him against trouble against team, but he's played it well here - short of a length at 137 kmph, some extra bounce and Suryakumar made sure he got on top of it, chops it past the keeper and into the third an ropes

FOUR, edged and four, three boundaries and three dots in the over - the length was wide once again, Suryakumar threw the kitchen sink on the drive, gets a thick edge that flies through the vacant slip cordon

out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! A soft soft dismissal for batsman - he falls to leg-spin once again. The wrong 'un and batsman read it well, came down the track, got close to the pitch and was then looking to launch it back over the bowler's end. Unfortunately for him, the bat turned slightly on impact and he ended up heaving it down the throat of Tewatia at long-on - didn't have to move an inch and the Royals have their man. batsman c Rahul Tewatia b bowler 35(23) [4s-2 6s-3]

out Caught by Samson!! Back to back wickets for Shreyas, but what was batsman trying to do? First ball and he looks to slog Shreyas out of the park - was the wrong 'un and he didn't get anywhere near the ball, sliced it high and over cover. Samson circled around it, kept his eyes on the ball and pouches it with glee. All of a sudden, Shreyas finds himself on a hat-trick. batsman c Samson b bowler 0(1)

out Caught by de Kock!! batsman gets back into the team and gets a duck on return. Back of a length outside off, just a hint of shape for bowler, nothing great. But this is a bad shot. Plays away from the body looking to run it to third man, only succeeds in nicking it behind. batsman c de Kock b bowler 0(2)
FOUR, what wrists from batsman as he whips this through square leg. Back of a length around off, shovels it with the bottom hand, hurries to the fence

out Caught by de Kock!! A replica of his dismissal against Cummins in that game against team, where he looked so frenentic. Was more composed at the crease in the time he spent here, before this happened. Tries slogging bowler off a length and inside-edges it behind. De Kock flies to his left for an excellent grab. Royals in a hole. batsman c de Kock b bowler 6(7) [4s-1]
SIX, slips out of his hand into the half-tracker mark, batsman rocks back and launches that over long-on for a gigantic 82-meter six!
SIX, he's backed away to a flat one that's intended to cramp him, and mowed it over deep mid-wicket for six!
SIX, for the faintest moment, all was gone for team. He backed away to the on-side, waited for the pace-off delivery to reach, and bottom-handed the swat late over long-on for six!
FOUR, another slower one, and batsman waits again to let it reach, carting it over the on-side for four! batsman on fire!

out Caught by Pollard! That is an incredible catch! I mean, he did make things difficult for himself to be honest. Not sure he knew where the boundary was. batsman just got under a really full one and tried to launch this over long-on, but hand to take on the tallest fielder in the opposition - Pollard ran towards the left and leapt up, got a hand, but the ball bounced out in the first attempt - and yet, he was quick enough to grab it in the second attempt! batsman c Pollard b bowler 70(44) [4s-4 6s-5]
FOUR, full and wide, no feet to go towards it, just gets under it and lifts it away towards long-off for four

FOUR, full and wide, batsman gets under it and slices high towards the cover region, Krunal comes in from wide long-off to dive and cut it off, but he's touching the boundary as he does that - boundary it is...

out Caught by Hardik Pandya! Curran's gotta go! Doesn't quite have Buttler's bottom-hand, and with the pace off, he's tried to club this with a dominant bottom-hand over long-on - doesn't get much distance, and Hardik runs in from wide long-on to comfortably hold on to a catch. batsman c Hardik Pandya b bowler 15(16) [4s-1]
FOUR, all kinds of zig-zag, that run-up, a slower, wide length ball, batsman delays the shot and then just cross-bats a slap to long-off for four

out Bowled! Knocked him over! The form-temporary-class-permanent thing is the cliche of all cliches, but he's nailed another yorker at 142.1km/h. Tewatia has to move around and improvise to get under that and score some much-needed runs, but it's not going to happen. Not tonight. The bails light up and batsman has to go. batsman b bowler 5(6) [4s-1]

out Caught by de Kock! Oh this is Vintage bowler. Maybe bowler isn't old enough for the word VIintage to be associated with him, so lets say "typical" bowler! Angling in sharply, brute-forcing even this unresponsive Kookaburra to straighten off the seam, and take the hopping batsman's outside edge to the 'keeper for a catch. QdK just about keeps that off his face. Might consider a helmet. batsman c de Kock b bowler 1(2)
SIX, short ball at the off-stump, batsman has a free swing across the line between mid-wicket and long-on and gets it over the fielder for six! Terrific shot, and they'll need a lot more of those!
FOUR, slams a length ball between mid-wicket and long-on for four! Just mows this away without a care in the world!

FOUR, another one that doesn't really have width, a short one, but even though he's cramped for room, he's picked up the length quick enough to hit the middle with the pull and club it away towards long-on for four

out Caught by Pollard! Tries getting under it, but doesn't do so well enough to a really full ball, and the result is that he can't quite get the desired height - and that would mean Pollard at long-on has to hold on to a ridiculously easy catch. batsman c Pollard b bowler 24(11) [4s-3 6s-1]

out Caught by Rohit! That's the end of a comprehensive performance from the Mumbai Indians. batsman backs away and tries slicing that over cover, but Rohit inside the circle takes a catch above his head to end a memorable night for Mumbai. batsman c Rohit b bowler 2(5)
FOUR, strays it wide outside off with the angle going across, batsman slaps it through point

out Caught by Rohit!! Mumbai pacers on fire again. And not for the first time in this tournament has batsman been dismissed after being rushed on the pull. So after a great start, he's had three successive failures. The ball just comes onto him quicker than expected as he camps on the front foot. Spoons it up off the splice to mid-on. Royals losing this match in a hurry. batsman c Rohit b bowler 0(3)
FOUR, full on middle, strong wrists from batsman as he drives past mid-on

FOUR, back of a length delivery across off, batsman opens the face on it to guide it past Pollard at short third man. If nothing else, it's a good chance for batsman to play himself into some form. Or is it too early to write them off?
FOUR, more conviction in this from batsman. Short and wide, puts the cut away through cover-point

out Caught by (sub)Anukul Roy!! Different ways to get your name out there. He probably won't get a chance to showcase his left-arm spin this season, but Anukul Roy has pulled off a blinder as a substitute fielder. Sliced off a thick outside edge as batsman tries to go leg-side. It goes up and behind Roy at short cover. He runs back, eyes on the ball which is going further and further away, but he races after it and dives with both hands, parallel to the ground while taking it. Stunning. batsman c (sub)Anukul Roy b bowler 11(13) [4s-1]
SIX, half-tracker at the stumps, swatted into the grass banks behind midwicket
1 run, sliding in on middle and leg, works it through midwicket

SIX, drops it so short that it was on its way down when reaching batsman. And he does so well to generate power, which isn't always the easiest thing with such deliveries. Slaps it over the extra cover boundary
FOUR, 134.3kph, into the feet again. It's less worse, meaning Tripathi can tickle, and gets it really fine

out Caught by du Plessis!! Just Jadeja things! Takes an absolute specky, at deep mid-wicket, diving parallel to the ground to his right and just when he was about to skid onto the boundary triangles, tosses the ball to Faf (running from long-on) to complete the catch. Was loopier and the line teased batsman to go for the big one, attempts a heave, only to be bettered by the fielding brilliance of team. The team management won't be too disappointed and we could see batsman play more of such roles for the rest of the IPL. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 17(9) [4s-1 6s-1]
FOUR, crunched off the middle! Full pitcher in the zone outside off and batsman just leans into the drive while slotting it in the gap through extra cover, raced away!

1 run, a direct hit from bowler would have sent batsman back to the pavilion, wasn't to be. batsman gave up mid-way after knocking this into the leg-side and Curran did well to gather the ball quickly, missed the target by some distance though

out Caught by Dhoni!! Huge wicket in the context for team and it's Curran who's got his England skipper. Surprises batsman with a short ball and gets good fizz off the pitch to get it climbing and restrain the timing on the shot, batsman was probably aiming for the deep square region, but the shot lacked intent and MSD does the rest behind the sticks. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 7(10) [4s-1]
FOUR, too easy! Drifting down leg on a length and all batsman had to do help it on its way, he sits on one knee and scoops it fine of the keeper to his left

SIX, this is poor execution from Deepak bowler! He serves another leg-stump dross and it's been picked up neatly from the in-form batsman who smokes it on one knee and sees the ball sailing over the fine leg fence

out Caught by Dhoni!! Shardul Thakur has been terrific with his lengths and variations today. Bowls the cross-seam delivery and pitches it much shorter than it did against Gill. A similar dismissal though. batsman looks to go over mid-wicket with a cross-bat swipe and sends a crisp edge through to the keeper. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 2(4)
FOUR, a real smash-me outside off. Short and wide of off, batsman gets on his tippy toes and flays it with brute power over backward point

out Caught by Watson!! First wicket for DJ Bravo in IPL 2020. Pushes this fuller and in the outside off zone, batsman looks to play a cheeky dab with an open bat face but the ball takes the bottom half and lands in the bucket hands of Watto at short third man. Bravo went up straightaway and so did Watson, the umpires just wanted to be sure as they deemed the soft signal in favor of the bowler. batsman c Watson b bowler 81(51) [4s-8 6s-3]

FOUR, Pat batsman would have grown up playing such shots and the length was ideal. Short at 138ks and right in the slot for him, powers the pull and gets it in the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket
SIX, another one to feast on for batsman and he doesn't miss out. Short and angled into the batsman, batsman loads up on the back foot and smites it many-a-mile flat over the cow corner fence

FOUR, dropped! A relatively easy chance by Jadeja's standards. DK muscles the pull and it was hit flat to the right of the fielder at deep mid-wicket, Jaddu got there quickly but the momentum was always taking him to his right and he seemed to have lost the trajectory momentarily as he tried to take it in front of his face. Sneaks through his fingers and travels to the fence

out Caught by SN Thakur!! Gone this time. Thakur juggles once and takes it on the second attempt. Short and got big on DK outside off, he still tries to force the upper cut and hits it flat and straight to the fielder at square third man. batsman c SN Thakur b bowler 12(11) [4s-1]

out Caught by du Plessis!! Catching practice for Faf at mid-off. Bravo is back to doing what he does best, take wickets in the death overs and unleash his dance moves. Deceives Nagarkoti with a slower ball outside off and a tame chip to mid-off meant curtains for the batsman. batsman c du Plessis b bowler 0(2)

out Caught by Dhoni!! Goodness me! That is a spectacular catch from MSD. Sheer commitment and his athleticism was on full display while grabbing the catch. Dhoni seemed to have signalled something to Bravo just before this delivery and I'm guessing it's something to do with lack of pace. Keeps it in the shortish length area does Bravo and induces a thick outside edge on the slog. Dhoni dives full length to his right, juggles it on the first attempt and then takes the rebound with a sharp spring to his right. 150th IPL wicket for Bravo! batsman c Dhoni b bowler 0(1)
1 run, hops, dabs in front of backward point (Jadeja again), and this time Tripathi would've comfortably been out had it been a direct hit at the non-striker's. Alas ..
FOUR, ah, stunning. bowler looks to bang it in short, but Gill's standing taller, with a lofted pull, over mid-wicket

FOUR, hoicked agriculturally, against the line, and despite the miscue, he's gotten it over the leg-side infield. Thakur chases, slides, flicks it back, and his knee has just brushed the boundary while a finger's still on the ball

out batsman Run Out!! 1 run completed. Jadeja and Dhoni, goodluck taking risk against this duo. batsman powers this low full toss to deep mid-wicket and there was never a two there, team still run in hope and hope is all that'll remain for them. Jaddu fires it quickly and MSD was in perfect position to deflect it onto the stumps. batsman run out (Jadeja/Dhoni) 1(1)

FOUR, 130kph, another bouncer gets punished. bowler clearly doesn't have the pace to trouble, but this delivery's a little higher, but still, the shortness of it allows Tripathi the time to get inside the line, swivel and hook it really fine. It also helps that fine leg's inside the ring
FOUR, 127.2kph, on the pads, but instead of just flicking it away, Tripathi makes sure he crouches and makes it more of a sweep off his legs
FOUR, overpitched. Tripathi connects with his swing this time, getting under this and lofting this over mid-off. This is how you celebrate promotions ..

out Caught by Dhoni!! Big loud nick. Thakur has Gill for the third time in as many IPL innings -- this time with Gill throwing it away after losing patience, losing shape and losing his timing. He tries a cross-batted heave but the length's a little too full to be doing this, and ends up getting a tickle on the under-edge through to the keeper. batsman c Dhoni b bowler 11(12) [4s-1]
FOUR, 140kph .. and Rana flashes hard. Full, wide and a thick outside edge on Rana's slap, but there's no slip, and third man's rather square
SIX, the knuckle ball in the slot .. and Tripathi has a full-blow at this, slicing his loft, with more height than distance, but is still over deep extra cover
wide, 115.2kph, slower shorter one, but gets too leg-sided, angling past Tripathi's attempted pull
SIX, slogged. One-kneed, murderous bat-swing, and despite Curran's full-leap at long-on, it just goes over. Alas, not everyone has a Polllard ..

out Caught by Jadeja !! Miscued slog-sweep. It's a normal leg-break, but Rana's adventures of wanting to smoke this over the longest part of the ground - cow corner - ends up in the hands of the fielder out there. Clearly not full enough to be slogging these .. batsman c Jadeja b bowler 9(10) [4s-1]

FOUR, 132.5kph, juicy this. Short, wide, and it's Bravo's birthday, but for some reason, he's the one giving out gifts here. Tripathi thrashes a square cut, over point, and has a fifty. Yea, that's how you seal spots and kill debates
SIX, 99.9kph. Wide floaty, loopy off-break. batsman lays in, this is bang in his zone, and slices this typically over deep extra cover
FOUR, overcooks it now at full pace. batsman opens his bat face and squeezes this between point and short third
FOUR, 134.3kph, into the feet again. It's less worse, meaning Tripathi can tickle, and gets it really fine

Takes an absolute specky, at deep mid-wicket, diving parallel to the ground to his right and just when he was about to skid onto the boundary triangles, tosses the ball to Faf (running from long-on) to complete the catch.
